column2: RLA Penapatch Structural Repair Mortar HB80
column3:
Use RLA Penapatch HB80 for: Structural concrete repairs needing high compressive strength, dimensional stability, and strong adhesion.

RLA Penapatch HB80 is a high build, high strength polymer-modified repair mortar engineered for structural restoration of vertical, overhead, and horizontal concrete surfaces. It is shrinkage-compensated and highly abrasion-resistant, offering excellent bond strength to concrete and masonry. Ideal for addressing spalled concrete, reinforcement corrosion, and structural degradation, Penapatch HB80 enables single-application builds up to 180mm on horizontal surfaces. This Australian-made solution eliminates the need for formwork and suits both dry and wet spray applications.

Key Features of RLA Penapatch HB80

  • High compressive strength up to 68 MPa for structural durability
  • Single-application high build up to 180mm horizontally, 100mm vertically
  • Tenacious adhesion to concrete and masonry surfaces
  • Low permeability protects against chlorides and carbonation
  • Excellent abrasion resistance and dimensional stability
  • Pre-bagged and easy to mix – just add water

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polymer-modified cementitious blend
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Compressive Strength: Up to 68 MPa (28 days)
  • Flexural Strength: 10 MPa (28 days)
  • Young’s Modulus: Approx. 26 GPa
  • Abrasion Resistance: Wear Index 120 (ASTM C501)
  • Water Requirement: 3.6 L per 20kg bag
  • Yield: 10.5 L per 20kg bag

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Spiral mixing paddle, forced action mixer, trowel, spray pump (wet spray)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use RLA RenderGrip A or Epilox Binder depending on substrate moisture. Avoid feather edging under 5mm.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Slumping occurs with excessive water or overly wet primer—always mix with precision and monitor substrate condition.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Dry area, off cold floors, away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F–77°F)

Certifications

  • Tested to AS1478.2-2005 for compressive strength
  • Complies with AS1012.11-2000 for flexural strength
  • Meets Australian concrete repair guidelines

column32: RLA Penapatch HB80 Structural Repair Mortar | Adheseal
column33: RLA Penapatch HB80 is a High strength polymer mortar for vertical and overhead structural repairs.
column52:
How to apply RLA Penapatch HB80:

  1. Prepare the substrate by removing oil, dust, laitance, and loose material.
  2. Prime surface using RLA RenderGrip A or RLA Epilox Binder depending on moisture level.
  3. Mix 20kg of HB80 with exactly 3.6L of clean water using a spiral mixing paddle.
  4. Apply mortar by trowel or gloved hand, thoroughly compacting into surface and around steel reinforcement.
  5. Screed and finish with a steel trowel; avoid overworking the surface.
  6. For spray application, use a wet process pump system. Contact RLA for setup advice.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA Penapatch HB80

Q: How do I apply RLA Penapatch HB80 to vertical or overhead surfaces?

A: Apply using a trowel or gloved hand after priming the surface with RLA RenderGrip A. For thicker vertical repairs, use multiple layers or formwork for builds over 100mm.

Q: What is the compressive strength of this product?

A: RLA Penapatch HB80 achieves 24 MPa in 1 day, 52 MPa in 7 days, and 68 MPa in 28 days, ensuring high structural integrity for demanding repair jobs.

Q: Is it compatible with reinforcement bars and concrete surfaces?

A: Yes, it bonds strongly to concrete and masonry and can be used around cleaned and primed steel reinforcement using RLA Zinc Rich Primer.

Q: What can I do if the product starts to slump during application?

A: Slumping is usually caused by excessive water or wet primer. Ensure no more than 3.6 L of water per 20kg bag and that primer is tacky—not wet—before applying.

Q: What safety precautions should I take during application?

A: Wear gloves, eye protection, and a dust mask. Use adequate ventilation during mixing and avoid skin or eye contact. Refer to the SDS for complete guidance.
column54:
RLA Penapatch HB80 limitations:

  • Do not apply at thicknesses below 5mm except in very localised areas.
  • Product should not be applied when ambient temperature is below 5°C or above 35°C.
  • Excess water will weaken strength and cause slumping—use only 3.6L per 20kg bag.
  • Substrate movement may cause reflective cracking in applied repair mortar.
  • Must not be exposed to water or rain for at least 24 hours post-application.

Safety precautions when using RLA Penapatch HB80:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Safety gloves, eye protection, dust mask (P2), and protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow during mixing and application, especially indoors
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact; do not breathe dust during mixing
  • Dispose of hardened product as construction waste in accordance with local regulations
column55: Shrinkage-compensated, high build repair mortar with exceptional strength, bonding, and abrasion resistance.
column56:
RLA Penapatch HB80 can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete – requires clean, roughened surface and priming
  • Masonry – ensure substrate is structurally sound and dust-free
  • Steel reinforcement – must be cleaned and primed with Zinc Rich Primer
column57:
Use RLA Penapatch HB80 for:

  • High build repairs to concrete columns, beams, and soffits
  • Repairing spalled or corroded concrete with exposed rebar
  • Structural repairs requiring dimensional stability and high strength
  • Overhead repairs in infrastructure, tunnels, and industrial settings

Why Use RLA Penapatch HB80:

  • Ensures long-lasting structural repairs with compressive strength up to 68 MPa
  • Minimises labour costs with high build capacity in a single application
  • Reduces moisture ingress with low permeability and abrasion resistance
  • Eliminates mixing errors with pre-bagged, easy-to-use formulation

column2: RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar
column3:
Use RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar for: Restoring damaged concrete on vertical and overhead surfaces, minimising shrinkage, and achieving high durability in patch repairs

RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar is a polymer-modified, fibre-reinforced cementitious mortar engineered for vertical and overhead repairs in concrete structures. Designed for high build applications up to 50mm in a single pass, this high-performance repair mortar delivers exceptional adhesion and minimal sag. Ideal for patching spalled or deteriorated concrete in commercial, civil, and industrial environments, it complies with AS/NZS standards and exhibits high early and ultimate strengths. Penapatch HB50 is shrinkage-compensated and requires only water to mix, making it user-friendly for Australian trade professionals seeking reliable, durable results.

Key Features of RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar

  • High build application up to 50mm in one layer without sagging
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete substrates, ensuring long-term durability
  • Polymer modification and fibre reinforcement improve flexural strength
  • Shrinkage-compensated for stable, crack-free repairs
  • Just add water – no primer or bonding agents required

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polymer-modified, fibre-reinforced cementitious mortar
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F)
  • Compressive Strength: >50 MPa at 28 days
  • Pot Life: Approximately 45 minutes at 23°C
  • Maximum Build Thickness: 50mm per layer
  • Water Addition: 3.3 – 3.75 litres per 15kg bag

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Trowel, mixing paddle and drill, hawk, sponge float
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For vertical or overhead applications, apply with firm pressure to maximise bonding; use a sponge float for finishing if required
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For dry surfaces, pre-wet substrate to prevent premature water absorption; avoid applying below 5°C or in direct hot sun

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, cool area away from moisture
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep between 5°C and 30°C during storage

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 4020 compliant – suitable for use in contact with drinking water
  • Meets performance standards for structural concrete patch repairs

column32: RLA Penapatch HB50 Repair Mortar for Concrete Restoration | Adheseal
column33: RLA Penapatch HB50 is a high build mortar ideal for vertical and overhead concrete repairs with superior strength and workability.
column52:
How to apply RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar:

  1. Prepare the surface by removing loose concrete, dust, and contaminants
  2. Pre-wet the substrate, ensuring surface is damp but free of standing water
  3. Mix 15kg of powder with 3.3 – 3.75 litres of clean water using a mechanical paddle
  4. Apply the mortar using a trowel, working firmly into the surface
  5. Finish with a sponge float as needed once initial set has begun
  6. Protect the repair area from rain or rapid drying for at least 24 hours
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar

Q: How should I apply RLA Penapatch HB50 for vertical surfaces?

A: For vertical surfaces, use a clean trowel to firmly press the mixed mortar into the prepared substrate. Apply in layers no thicker than 50mm and finish with a sponge float if required.

Q: How strong is the final cured product?

A: RLA Penapatch HB50 achieves compressive strength greater than 50 MPa after 28 days, providing high structural integrity suitable for heavy-duty repair work.

Q: Can I use it on surfaces other than concrete?

A: RLA Penapatch HB50 is formulated for concrete substrates. It is not recommended for use on timber, steel, or plastic without a compatible bonding system.

Q: What if the mortar starts setting too quickly?

A: If the mortar sets prematurely, it may be due to high ambient temperature or insufficient water. Always mix in cool, shaded areas and never add more water once setting has begun.

Q: What are the safety precautions during use?

A: Wear gloves, dust mask, and safety goggles. Ensure good ventilation when mixing. Avoid contact with skin and eyes, and wash with clean water if exposed.
column54:
RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar limitations:

  • Not suitable for use below 5°C or above 35°C during application
  • Should not be applied over painted or sealed surfaces without removal
  • Not designed for trafficable surfaces without a protective coating

Safety precautions when using RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety goggles, dust mask
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas or outdoors
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; wash thoroughly after handling
  • Keep out of reach of children and dispose of packaging according to local regulations
column55: High build, fibre-reinforced mortar for concrete repairs. Ideal for vertical and overhead surfaces. Excellent adhesion and low sag.
column56:
RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete – must be clean, sound, and free of laitance
  • Reinforced Concrete – remove rust and scale before application
  • Cementitious Renders – provided surface is stable and dust-free
column57:
Use RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar for:

  • Repairing vertical and overhead spalled concrete
  • Concrete restoration in columns, beams, and soffits
  • Patch repairs in civil and commercial infrastructure projects

Why Use RLA Penapatch HB50 High Build Repair Mortar:

  • Easy single-pass high build application saves time on-site
  • Fibre reinforcement enhances strength and reduces cracking risk
  • Excellent bond to concrete ensures durable repairs
  • Simple water-only mix design improves application efficiency

column3:
Use RLA Fairing Coat Mortar for: Surface repairs, defect smoothing, and thin-layer concrete finishing on vertical or overhead areas

Fairing Coat Mortar is a fine-textured, fast-setting cementitious compound designed for professional concrete repairs where only a thin coat is required. Formulated with a specialised blend of cement and polymers, it offers outstanding adhesion, durability, and smooth finish without shrinkage. Ideal for vertical applications, patching, or preparing surfaces for coatings, this Australian-made product simplifies surface refinishing on-site. It’s suitable for both internal and external use, whether as a top coat or standalone repair layer.

Key Features of RLA Fairing Coat Mortar

  • Fast-setting formulation ensures rapid project turnaround
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete and masonry surfaces
  • Smooth, fine-textured finish ready for coating or exposure
  • Can be feathered and applied up to 5mm in one pass
  • Negligible shrinkage reduces risk of cracking or surface flaws
  • Internal and external suitability with durable, long-lasting performance

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Cementitious with polymer additives
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Wet Density: 1800 kg/m³
  • Yield: 14 litres per 20kg bag
  • Compressive Strength: 20 MPa at 28 days
  • Flexural Strength: 7.1 MPa at 28 days
  • Drying Shrinkage: <450 microstrain at 56 days
  • Initial Set Time: 25 minutes at 20°C
  • Final Set Time: 50 minutes at 20°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Forced-action mixer, suitable mixing paddle, trowel
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use chilled water in hot conditions to extend workability and pre-soak substrates for maximum bond
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For highly porous surfaces, use RLA RenderGrip A to prevent flash drying

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry areas, off cold floors, away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep in room-temperature environments between 5°C and 25°C

Certifications

  • Complies with AS1012, AS2073 and ASTM C348-86 standards
  • Meets Australian conditions for concrete surface repair compounds
  • Manufactured to Australian regulatory safety and quality standards

column52:
How to apply RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar:

  1. Clean surface of contaminants like oil, paint, and dust
  2. Pre-soak substrate with water (avoid pooling) or use RLA RENDERGRIP A for porous surfaces
  3. Mix 3.1–3.6L of water per 10kg bag using a high-shear spiral mixer
  4. Add powder to water while mixing to avoid lumps
  5. Apply with trowel or gloved hand, compacting thoroughly
  6. Finish with a steel trowel for smooth texture
  7. Apply RLA RENDERGRIP A over finished areas in hot or windy conditions for curing
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar

Q: How do I apply the product to vertical surfaces?

A: Use a steel trowel or gloved hand to apply Penapatch Panel LW to the substrate. Thoroughly compact the mortar and finish with a steel trowel. Ensure minimum 5mm thickness is maintained and avoid overworking the surface.

Q: How strong is the mortar once cured?

A: At 28 days, Penapatch Panel LW achieves a compressive strength of 20 MPa and a flexural strength of 7.1 MPa, making it suitable for non-structural repairs in commercial and industrial applications.

Q: Is this mortar compatible with existing coatings?

A: Yes, it's compatible with RLA protective and decorative coatings. Ensure the surface is clean and properly cured before applying coatings or renders for best adhesion.

Q: What should I do if the mortar sets too quickly?

A: In hot or windy conditions, premature drying can occur. Use chilled water for mixing and apply RLA RENDERGRIP A as a curing aid. Avoid reworking the mix once it has begun to set.

Q: Are there any special disposal or safety requirements?

A: Dispose of any uncured product according to local regulations. Always wear gloves, eye protection, and ensure proper ventilation during application. Refer to the SDS for full safety details.
column54:
RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar limitations:

  • Not suitable for load-bearing or structural repairs
  • Not designed for pedestrian or vehicle traffic surfaces
  • Must not be applied thinner than 5mm except for minor feather edges
  • Excessive water during mixing reduces strength and increases drying time
  • Reflective cracking may occur if underlying substrate cracks or moves

Safety precautions when using RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and a dust mask when mixing or sanding
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow in enclosed spaces
  • Handling: Mix only what can be applied within the working time; do not re-temper
  • Refer to the product SDS for detailed safety and first aid information
column55: Fast-setting, smooth-finish fairing mortar ideal for thin concrete surface repairs. Strong adhesion, internal/external use, easy application.
column56:
RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete – Ensure surface is clean and mechanically keyed
  • Precast Panels – Ideal for tilt-up construction and joint plate coverage
  • Masonry – Requires pre-soaking and priming if porous
  • Steel Reinforcement – Must be cleaned and primed with RLA Zinc Primer
column57:
Use RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar for:

  • Patching and covering metal joiner plates in precast tilt-up construction
  • Vertical surface repairs up to 50mm and overhead builds up to 100mm
  • High-build fairing coats for cosmetic concrete restoration
  • Prepping concrete surfaces before painting or rendering

Why Use RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar:

  • Eliminates formwork for vertical and overhead applications
  • Fast drying with a smooth finish ready for coating
  • Reduces risk of shrinkage cracking with shrinkage-compensated formula
  • Fire-rated performance suitable for compliant builds

column2: 30mm HexCell Wall Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550
column3:
Use 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550 for: Efficient sub-surface drainage, water flow management, and structural void creation in green roofs, retaining walls, balconies, and civil works.

The 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550 is designed to provide exceptional sub-surface drainage performance while maintaining high structural integrity. Made from recycled polypropylene (Reprolene™) or HDPE, it delivers a permanent and non-clogging void between structures and soil profiles. With a compressive strength of 70t/m² and flow rate of 14,400 L/h/m² at 1% fall, it ensures optimal water management in roof gardens, retaining walls, balconies, and civil engineering applications. Lightweight and supplied in large 1.1m x 1.1m panels, this system speeds up installation while maintaining environmental sustainability and long service life.

Key Features of 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550

  • High compressive strength of 70t/m² to support heavy loads
  • Open cell structure allows rapid water flow and prevents clogging
  • Lightweight and large panel format for easy handling and fast installation
  • Manufactured from recycled polypropylene for eco-friendly performance
  • Chemically resistant and unaffected by moulds, algae, or soil bacteria

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Unaffected by moulds, algae, soil-borne chemicals, and bacteria
  • Application Temperature Range: -30°C to +120°C (-22°F to +248°F)
  • Compressive Strength: 70t/m² (99.56 PSI)
  • Flow Rate: 14,400 L/h/m² at 1% fall (508.5 gal/h/ft²)
  • Material: Recycled Polypropylene (Reprolene™) or HDPE

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Utility knife, PPE, drainage pipe connectors
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Pre-plan panel layout to minimise cutting and wastage on site
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For uneven surfaces, use compacted sand bedding to achieve level installation

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store flat in dry area away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: Indefinite under proper storage conditions
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid prolonged exposure above 120°C

Certifications

  • Manufactured to comply with Australian drainage standards
  • Made from 100% recycled material—meets environmental sustainability benchmarks

column32: 30mm HexCell Wall Drainage Cell for Efficient Stormwater | Adheseal
column33: High-strength 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell for superior stormwater flow and structural voiding. Recycled plastic, lightweight, and easy to install.
column52:
How to apply 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550:

  1. Prepare substrate ensuring level surface and proper fall
  2. Lay waterproofing membrane and protective geotextile
  3. Install drainage cell panels by interlocking edges
  4. Trim to fit using utility knife where needed
  5. Cover with filter fabric, then backfill with soil or overlay
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550

Q: How is the drainage cell installed beneath a green roof?

A: The drainage cell should be placed directly on top of the waterproofing membrane, followed by filter fabric, then soil or growing media. Ensure proper outlet connections are in place.

Q: How does this product perform under load?

A: With a compressive strength of 70t/m², it easily supports foot traffic, planter boxes, and structural loads on podiums or landscaped decks.

Q: Is it compatible with waterproofing membranes?

A: Yes, it is fully compatible with most waterproofing systems. A separation layer (e.g., geotextile) is recommended to prevent membrane damage.

Q: What should I do if the panels don't align properly?

A: Panels can be trimmed with a utility knife for a precise fit. Ensure they’re interlocked securely and avoid forcing mismatched sections.

Q: How do I safely dispose of off-cuts or unused product?

A: Off-cuts are recyclable. Dispose of in accordance with local plastic recycling regulations. Avoid burning or landfill disposal.
column54:
30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550 limitations:

  • Not suitable for high vehicular traffic without additional structural support
  • Requires stable, level substrate for effective installation
  • Cannot be used as a primary waterproofing layer

Safety precautions when using 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Safety gloves and steel-capped boots recommended
  • Ventilation: Not applicable for outdoor or open-air use
  • Handling: Use caution with sharp tools while trimming panels
  • Store away from open flames or extreme heat sources
column55: 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell offers high compressive strength, rapid flow rate, and long-lasting durability for efficient stormwater management.
column56:
30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550 can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete slabs (ensure surface is level)
  • Bituminous waterproofing membranes (use protective geotextile)
  • Compacted sand beds (in landscaping or softscape applications)
column57:
Use 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550 for:

  • Green roof and podium landscape drainage
  • Retaining wall backfill drainage solutions
  • Balcony and planter box voiding and runoff control
  • Sports field and civil engineering sub-surface drainage

Why Use 30mm HexCell Drainage Cell - Standard Duty 550:

  • Improves drainage efficiency, reducing water buildup
  • Supports sustainable construction practices
  • Easy to transport, cut, and install on-site
  • Ensures long-term performance with chemical resistance

column3:
Use Megadure Ceramic for: Protecting equipment in mines, ball mills, and other abrasive environments.

Megadure Ceramic is a two-component, high alumina bead epoxy paste designed for extreme abrasion resistance. It is ideal for protecting equipment in demanding industrial environments such as mines, coal-fired plants, and dredging operations. Available in both standard and quick-setting formulations, it offers flexibility for various project timelines. The green-cured paste can be applied by trowel or spatula, providing a durable lining and grouting solution for wear-resistant ceramic tiles and steel surfaces.

Cure Time: Standard set cures in 24-48 hours, while quick set cures in 12-24 hours, depending on temperature. For example, in a 25°C environment, quick set will fully cure in 12 hours, allowing for faster equipment turnaround.

Yield: A 2kg kit provides 0.5 m2 coverage at 2mm thickness, making it easy to calculate material requirements for large projects.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature is 10°C. Ensure surfaces are within this range for proper curing and adhesion.

Surface Preparation: Metals require grit blasting or mechanical abrasion and degreasing, while concrete needs to be free of grease and laitence, achieved by mechanical abrasion.

Key Features of Megadure Ceramic Alumina Bead Wear Resistant Lining

  • High Alumina Bead Formulation: Provides exceptional abrasion resistance.
  • Standard and Quick Set Options: Offers flexibility for different project timelines.
  • Durable Epoxy Paste: Ensures long-lasting protection in harsh environments.
  • Easy Application: Can be applied by trowel or spatula.
  • Australian Made: Ensures quality and local support.

Why Choose Megadure Ceramic:

  • Extended Equipment Lifespan: Protects against wear and abrasion, reducing maintenance costs.
  • Versatility: Suitable for various industrial applications.
  • Reliable Performance: Designed for extreme conditions.
  • Efficient Application: Pre-metered kits simplify mixing and application.

When to Choose Megadure Ceramic versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megadure Ceramic over standard epoxy coatings when: You require superior abrasion resistance for heavy industrial applications.
  • Consider other options when: You need a coating for purely chemical resistance without extreme abrasion.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megadure Ceramic:

For Mining Engineers:

  • Lining ball mills and slurry pumps for extended wear.
  • Grouting between ceramic tiles in high-wear areas.
  • Protecting bulk handling equipment from abrasive materials.

For Industrial Maintenance Professionals:

  • Repairing and protecting equipment in coal-fired plants.
  • Lining pipes and fittings in dredging operations.
  • Applying wear-resistant linings to processing equipment.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Trowel, spatula, mixing equipment, grit blasting equipment (for metals).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for optimal properties. Follow surface preparation guidelines closely.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete mixing leads to poor curing; ensure proper mixing. Surfaces must be clean to achieve proper adhesion.

Health and Safety

  • Safety Precautions: Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet and Bulletin No. 100 for proper handling and safety information.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • PPE: Use appropriate personal protective equipment.

column32: Megadure Ceramic Epoxy Lining Paste | Adheseal
column33: Wear-resistant high alumina epoxy lining paste for mining and industrial use. Fast and standard set options.
column52:
How to apply Megadure Ceramic Epoxy Lining Paste:

  1. Thoroughly clean and prepare the surface according to substrate type
  2. Mix Part B (hardener) into Part A (resin) gradually, stirring continuously
  3. Apply with trowel or spatula at desired thickness (typically 2 mm)
  4. Allow to cure under ambient conditions as per product set type
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megadure Ceramic

Q: What is the difference between the standard and quick set formulations?

A: The quick set formulation cures faster, allowing for quicker project turnarounds, while the standard set provides a longer working time.

Q: How do I prepare metal surfaces for Megadure Ceramic?

A: Metal surfaces should be grit blasted to AS CK 9.4 Class 3 finish or mechanically abraded and degreased to ensure proper adhesion.

Q: Can Megadure Ceramic be used in high-temperature environments?

A: The technical data sheet focuses on ambient curing conditions. For high-temperature applications, consult Megapoxy's technical service.

Q: What is the coverage area for a 2kg kit?

A: A 2kg kit of Megadure Ceramic will yield 0.5 m2 at a 2mm thickness.

Q: How do I ensure proper mixing of the two components?

A: Add Part B (hardener) to Part A (resin) slowly with continual mixing. Thorough mixing is essential for optimal properties.
column54:
Megadure Ceramic Epoxy Lining Paste limitations:

  • Do not apply below 10°C – curing is inhibited in cold conditions
  • Not suitable for flexible joints or movement areas
  • Must not be used on damp or contaminated surfaces

Safety precautions when using Megadure Ceramic Epoxy Lining Paste:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety glasses, long sleeves
  • Ventilation: Apply in well-ventilated area or use forced ventilation
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact; wash with soap if contact occurs
  • Refer to MSDS and follow all industrial hygiene practices
column55: High-performance, wear-resistant alumina bead epoxy paste for lining, grouting, and heavy-duty industrial protection.
column56:
Megadure Ceramic can be used on the following substrates:

  • Metals: Grit blasted or mechanically abraded surfaces.
  • Concrete: Clean and mechanically abraded surfaces.
  • Painted Surfaces: Paint must be fully removed before application.
column57:
Use Megadure Ceramic Epoxy Lining Paste for:

column2: 80mm Square Megaflex Stick Down Floor Waste
column3:
Use 80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste for: Efficient drainage in low-profile installations requiring secure waterproofing and durable components.

The 80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste is a high-quality drainage solution ideal for waterproofing applications in bathrooms, laundries, and wet areas. Designed for low-profile installations, it features a solid brass grate and an ABS Megaflex™ flange, ensuring both durability and ease of application. Available with either a 50mm or 80mm outlet, this floor waste adapts to varying plumbing needs while maintaining compliance with Australian standards. A chrome finish enhances both functionality and aesthetics, making it a preferred choice among trade professionals.

Key Features of 80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste

  • Solid brass grate offers long-term corrosion resistance
  • ABS Megaflex™ flange ensures secure waterproofing in stick-down applications
  • Low-profile design facilitates seamless installation in tight spaces
  • Available in 50mm or 80mm outlet for flexible plumbing compatibility

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Brass (grate), ABS (flange)
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 60°C (41°F to 140°F)
  • Finish: Chrome plated
  • Outlet Sizes: 50mm or 80mm
  • Installation Type: Stick down, low-profile

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Standard plumbing tools, sealant gun, waterproofing membrane tools
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use compatible waterproofing membrane around flange for maximum seal
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure flange is properly bonded to prevent leaks; use correct outlet adapter for pipe connection

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry environment, away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: Indefinite shelf life under proper storage conditions
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid exposure to temperatures exceeding 60°C (140°F)

Certifications

  • WaterMark Certified – Complies with AS/NZS 3500
  • ISO 9001 Certified Manufacturing
  • Meets Australian Standards for Plumbing and Drainage

column52:
How to apply 80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste:

  1. Clean and dry the substrate thoroughly.
  2. Apply compatible waterproofing membrane around the outlet area.
  3. Press Megaflex™ flange into position, ensuring full contact with membrane.
  4. Secure connection to pipe using appropriate fittings.
  5. Install solid brass grate and seal edges if required.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste

Q: How is this floor waste installed?

A: It is designed for stick-down installation. The ABS Megaflex™ flange allows for direct bonding to waterproofing membranes, ensuring a watertight seal and low-profile fit.

Q: How durable is the solid brass grate?

A: The solid brass grate provides exceptional corrosion resistance, even in high-moisture environments, making it ideal for long-term use in Australian conditions.

Q: Is this product compatible with vinyl flooring?

A: Yes, the low-profile flange is suitable for use with vinyl, tile, and other common wet area flooring materials, provided proper bonding and sealing are achieved.

Q: What if the flange does not adhere properly?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Use a compatible primer or adhesive to improve bond strength. If failure persists, reapply with proper surface preparation.

Q: Is this product recyclable after use?

A: Brass components are recyclable. ABS plastic is also recyclable where facilities exist. Dispose of according to local waste regulations.
column54:
80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste limitations:

  • Not suitable for use in areas without waterproofing membrane
  • Must not be exposed to temperatures above 60°C (140°F)

Safety precautions when using 80mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves and eye protection
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation when applying adhesives
  • Handling: Avoid rough handling to prevent flange damage

column2: Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex One Plus P590
column3:
Use Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590 for: Sealing expansion and construction joints in concrete, precast panels, cladding, and specialty surfaces to manage movement and ensure long-lasting flexibility.

Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590 is a low modulus polyurethane sealant designed for demanding construction applications requiring high flexibility and durability. Formulated for Australian conditions, it provides excellent UV resistance, superior elongation (>1000%), and accommodates joint movement of +100%/-50%. Ideal for both vertical and horizontal joints, it delivers bubble-free, sag-free curing and can be used on a wide range of substrates including concrete, fibre cement, metal, and stone. This Made-in-Australia solution ensures a smooth finish and long-lasting seal in all environments.

Key Features of Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590

  • Low modulus for superior flexibility and movement accommodation
  • Extremely elastic with over 1000% elongation at break
  • Bubble-free, sag-resistant curing for smooth application
  • UV resistant for long-term outdoor durability
  • Paintable after full cure for seamless integration
  • Excellent adhesion to porous and non-porous substrates
  • Made in Australia to meet local standards and conditions

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Low modulus polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -30°C to 80°C (-22°F to 176°F)
  • Cure Rate: 3mm per 24 hours at 23°C and 50% RH
  • Elongation at Break: >1000%
  • Tensile Strength: 1.20 N/mm²

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge or sausage caulking gun, spatula or trowel, Bostik Handy Wipes for cleanup
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always use backing rod for correct joint geometry; prime critical surfaces for optimal adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For poor adhesion, ensure surfaces are clean and primed; avoid applying in wet conditions

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry, ventilated area between 5°C and 25°C
  • Shelf Life Information: 15 months from date of production in original unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storage in direct sunlight or temperatures outside recommended range

Certifications

  • ASTM C920
  • EN 15651-1 (F-EXT-INT-CC 25LM)
  • EMICODE EC1
  • SNJF F25E
  • ASTM C1248
column7: Marine Sealants,aluminium,block work,brick,caulking-i,civil construction-i,concrete-s,durable,expansion joints,fibre cement sheet,flexible,glass,glass and aluminium-i,glazed surfaces,glazing-i,large format tiles,long work time,low modulus,marine plywood,masonry,mdf,non-porous,one part,paintable,particle board,plasterboard,polyurethane-s,porcelain,porous,precast panels,render,sealant,sheet metal-i,slump resistant,steel,stone,tile-s,tiling-i,uv stable,weatherseal,window perimeters
column32: Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex One Plus P590 Polyurethane Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex One Plus P590 is a high-movement, UV-resistant, low modulus polyurethane sealant ideal for Australian construction joints.
column52:
How to apply Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590:

  1. Clean and dry surfaces thoroughly, removing all contaminants.
  2. Install backing rod to control joint depth and shape.
  3. Prime substrates if necessary using Bostik N49 or N40 primers.
  4. Apply sealant with a cartridge or sausage caulking gun in a continuous bead.
  5. Tool the sealant with a spatula to form a smooth, concave finish.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590

Q: How should Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex P590 be applied for best results?

A: Apply with a caulking gun, ensuring the joint is clean and dry. Use a backing rod to achieve correct joint depth, and tool the surface for a smooth, concave finish.

Q: How long does it take to fully cure?

A: The product cures at a rate of 3mm per 24 hours at 23°C and 50% RH, achieving full cure in 7 days for joints under 20mm wide. Wider joints require up to 14 days.

Q: What substrates is Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex P590 compatible with?

A: It adheres well to concrete, fibre cement, aluminium, stone, and metal cladding. Primers may be needed for plastics and high-stress joints.

Q: What should I do if the sealant doesn’t adhere properly?

A: Ensure surfaces are free of contaminants and use Bostik N49 or N40 primers as required. Test adhesion prior to application for critical joints.

Q: Are there any safety concerns when using this sealant?

A: Use appropriate PPE including gloves and eye protection. Ensure adequate ventilation, and avoid contact with uncured sealant on skin or eyes.
column54:
Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590 limitations:

  • Not suitable for joints in chlorinated or salt water environments
  • Do not apply on PE, PP, PTFE, or soft plastics
  • Not for glazing applications or trafficable joints
  • Not to be applied below 5°C or above 40°C

Safety precautions when using Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety goggles, and protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhalation of fumes
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact; wash thoroughly after use
  • Store away from food and drink; keep out of reach of children
column55: Low modulus, highly elastic polyurethane sealant with excellent UV resistance and +100%/-50% movement capability. Ideal for expansion joints.
column56:
Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590 can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete and render – ensure surfaces are clean and dry
  • Precast and tilt-up panels – use backing rod for joint geometry
  • Metal cladding and aluminium – prime with Bostik N40 if necessary
  • Granite, sandstone, and marble – test adhesion before full application
  • Fibre cement sheeting – suitable for vertical expansion joints
column57:
Use Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590 for:

  • Sealing expansion joints in precast concrete panels
  • Facade sealing for EIFS, ETICS, and cladding systems
  • Interior joint sealing in plasterboard and fibre cement

Why Use Bostik Seal ‘N’ Flex® One Plus P590:

  • Exceptional joint movement capability reduces cracking
  • Fast, bubble-free application saves time on site
  • Durable and UV resistant for long-lasting seals

Use Square Bermuda Megaflex 100x100mm for: Efficient drainage in modern residential and commercial settings.

The Square Bermuda Megaflex 100x100mm Floor Waste is designed for optimal drainage performance with a sleek, contemporary look. Constructed from solid brass with an ABS Megaflex base, it delivers superior strength and durability. Featuring a protective cover during installation and integrated sound dampeners, this high-quality waste solution is available in various premium finishes to complement different bathroom and kitchen aesthetics.

Key Features of Square Bermuda Megaflex 100x100mm

  • Solid brass construction for longevity and durability.
  • ABS Megaflex™ base for enhanced flexibility and performance.
  • Protective cover to prevent damage during installation.
  • Sound dampeners included as standard for quieter operation.
  • Available in a range of premium finishes, including Chrome, Satin Chrome, Brushed Nickel, and Matte Black.
  • Maximum flow rate of 50 litres per minute under optimal conditions.

  • Material: Solid brass with ABS Megaflex™ base
  • Outlet Sizes: 50mm, 80mm, 100mm
  • Flow Rate: Up to 50 L/min

  • Recommended for professional installation to ensure optimal drainage.

column33: Durable Square Bermuda Megaflex 100x100mm Floor Waste with solid brass construction and ABS Megaflex™ base for superior performance. Available in multiple finishes.
column52:
How to apply Square Bermuda Megaflex™ 100x100mm:

  1. Ensure the drainage pipe is correctly positioned and installed.
  2. Place the Square Bermuda Megaflex™ floor waste securely over the outlet.
  3. Remove the protective cover after tile installation is complete.
  4. Test drainage efficiency to confirm proper function.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Square Bermuda Megaflex™ 100x100mm Floor Waste

Q: How do I install the Square Bermuda Megaflex™ floor waste?

A: Installation is straightforward—ensure the ABS Megaflex™ base is securely connected to your drainage pipe. Remove the protective cover after tiling is complete, and set the waste into place. Always follow Australian plumbing codes for compliant installation.

Q: What is the maximum flow rate this floor waste can handle?

A: The Square Bermuda Megaflex™ 100x100mm Floor Waste is tested to a maximum flow rate of 50 litres per minute with a 5mm head of water and a minimum fall to waste of 1:80, though real-world flow may vary based on installation and water delivery systems.

Q: Is the floor waste compatible with all tile types?

A: Yes, it’s compatible with most floor tiles, including ceramic, porcelain, and natural stone. Ensure the tile thickness accommodates the flange depth and allows for proper drainage slope to the waste.

Q: What should I do if water flow is slower than expected?

A: Check for debris or blockages in the outlet and ensure the drainage slope meets the 1:80 fall requirement. Also, consider whether your shower head delivers aerated water, which can affect flow rate perception.

Q: How should I clean and maintain the Square Bermuda floor waste?

A: Regularly clean the visible surfaces with non-abrasive cleaners. Periodically remove the top grate to access and clean the interior. Avoid harsh chemicals that may damage the brass or ABS components.
column54:
Square Bermuda Megaflex™ 100x100mm limitations:

  • Requires proper fall to drain for maximum efficiency.
  • Installation must comply with plumbing regulations.

Safety precautions when using Square Bermuda Megaflex™ 100x100mm Floor Waste:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear cut-resistant gloves during installation to avoid injury from sharp tile edges and metal components.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation when using adhesives, waterproofing compounds, or sealants in enclosed areas during installation.
  • Handling: Handle the brass grate and ABS base with care to avoid damage. Do not use excessive force during fitting to prevent cracking or deformation.
  • Post-Installation Inspection: Verify the protective cover is removed and drainage is clear before first use to prevent water pooling and slip hazards.
  • Tool Safety: Use appropriate tools such as a rubber mallet and level; avoid power tools directly on brass surfaces to prevent damage or injury.

column3:
Use the Premium Pointed Rubber Grouter for: Achieving professional and precise grout application with high-quality Japanese rubber.

The Premium Pointed Rubber Grouter by BAT Trims is designed for precision and durability. Constructed with premium Japanese rubber, it provides excellent flexibility and control for smooth grout application. The timber handle offers a firm and comfortable grip, reducing hand strain for extended use. Ideal for both professionals and DIY enthusiasts, this grouter ensures even grout distribution for a flawless finish.

Key Features of Premium Pointed Rubber Grouter

  • Made with high-quality Japanese rubber for superior flexibility and durability
  • Pointed rubber edge for precise grout application, even in tight spaces
  • Ergonomic timber handle provides a secure and comfortable grip
  • Designed for trade professionals and DIY tilers
  • Ensures smooth and even grout application with minimal residue
  • Durable construction for long-lasting performance

Technical Overview

  • Material: Premium Japanese rubber
  • Handle: High-quality timber
  • Edge Design: Pointed for precision grout application
  • Ideal For: Professional tilers, waterproofers, and DIY users

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Works with all grout types, including epoxy
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Clean the rubber after each use to maintain performance
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Rinse frequently to prevent grout buildup

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a dry location away from direct sunlight
  • Clean after each use to preserve rubber flexibility
  • Avoid prolonged exposure to moisture to extend lifespan

Certifications

  • Manufactured to meet industry standards for professional tiling tools

Frequently Asked Questions About The Rubber Grouter

  • Why is Japanese rubber superior? Japanese rubber is known for its high durability, flexibility, and wear resistance, ensuring a smoother grout application
  • Is this grouter suitable for epoxy grout? Yes, it works with all types of grout, including epoxy
  • How do I maintain the rubber edge? Rinse with warm water and mild detergent after use to preserve its quality
  • Can this be used on mosaic tiles? Yes, the pointed edge makes it ideal for intricate tile layouts

column3:
Use Panther Thin Turbo Diamond Blade for: Achieving clean, precise tile cuts with reinforced strength for professional applications.

The Panther Ultra Thin Turbo Blade is designed for precise cutting of various tiles and stone materials. Featuring a reinforced core for extra strength and a thin turbo rim for fast, smooth cuts, this diamond blade delivers exceptional performance. Ideal for both wet and dry applications, it ensures minimal chipping and maximum durability. A must-have tool for tilers, builders, and trade professionals.

Key Features of Panther Thin Turbo Diamond Blade

  • Ultra-thin turbo rim for clean, precise cutting
  • Reinforced core for superior strength and durability
  • Compatible with 105mm (4”) and 125mm (5”) angle grinders
  • Wet and dry cutting capability
  • Designed for ceramic, porcelain, slate, marble, and granite

Technical Overview

  • Blade Type: Diamond Turbo
  • Diameter: 105mm (4”) / 125mm (5”)
  • Application: Wet & Dry Cutting
  • Core: Reinforced for added strength
  • Cutting Materials: Ceramic, Porcelain, Slate, Marble, Granite

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Angle grinder (compatible with 4” or 5” blades)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use water for extended blade life when cutting dense materials.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If chipping occurs, reduce speed and use wet cutting.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a dry, cool place to prevent corrosion
  • Ensure blade is kept in its original packaging when not in use
  • Check for wear before each use

Certifications

  • Meets industry standards for professional tile cutting tools

Frequently Asked Questions About BAT Panther Thin Turbo Blade

  • Can this blade be used for dry cutting? Yes, it is suitable for both wet and dry applications.
  • Does it fit all angle grinders? It is compatible with 105mm (4”) and 125mm (5”) grinders.
  • What materials can it cut? Ceramic, porcelain, slate, marble, and granite.
  • How do I extend the blade’s life? Use water when cutting hard materials and avoid excessive pressure.

column3:
Use PB Spacer Tabs for: Ensuring uniform paver spacing, alignment, and water drainage in raised flooring systems.

PB-TABS Spacer Tabs are designed to regulate the spacing between pavers on raised flooring systems, ensuring precise alignment and free water drainage. These clip-on tabs integrate seamlessly with BUZON pedestals, requiring no tools for installation. Made from high-quality recycled copolymer polypropylene, they are resistant to weathering, sea salts, and various chemicals, making them ideal for outdoor applications.

Key Features of PB Spacer Tabs

  • Ensures uniform spacing between pavers for a flawless finish.
  • Available in six thicknesses: 2mm, 3mm, 4.5mm, 6mm, 8mm, and 10mm.
  • Clips onto BUZON pedestals without tools.
  • Made from high-quality recycled polypropylene.
  • Resistant to weather conditions, sea salts, algae, and chemicals.
  • Designed for external raised floors, including granite, ceramic, and composite tiles.
  • Supports efficient water drainage.

Technical Overview

  • Material: Copolymer polypropylene (CPP), 80% first-grade recycled PPC, 20% Talc + Masterbatch black.
  • Height: 17mm.
  • Weight: 0.018 - 0.022 kg depending on thickness.
  • Temperature Resistance: -30°C to +80°C.
  • Packaging: 120 pieces per carton, 12,000 per pallet.
  • Applications: Outdoor raised flooring, including granite, composite, and ceramic tiles.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: No tools required for installation.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Detachable tabs allow for customized layouts.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure pedestals are level for optimal spacing alignment.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a dry environment at room temperature.
  • Maintain away from direct sunlight to preserve material integrity.

Certifications

  • Made in Europe using recycled EU-origin materials.
  • Compliant with environmental sustainability standards.

Frequently Asked Questions About PB-TABS Spacer Tabs

  • Are these spacer tabs visible once installed? No, they remain hidden under the pavers.
  • Do I need tools for installation? No, they clip directly onto the pedestal heads.
  • Can they be used for various tile materials? Yes, they work with granite, ceramic, composite, and metal grating.

Common problems this product solves: Enables stable and adjustable raised flooring for terraces, rooftops, and landscape areas while ensuring proper drainage and ventilation.

The PB-11 Adjustable Pedestal is a premium solution for elevated outdoor flooring, providing **stability, durability, and precise height adjustment from 755 to 955 mm**. Manufactured using high-quality recycled materials, this pedestal is resistant to weather, chemicals, and UV exposure. Ideal for terraces, pool decks, rooftops, and more, it supports various finishes, including stone, ceramic, and decking.

Pedestal Components

  • 1 PB-4-BASE
  • 3 PB-C2 coupler
  • 1 PB-4-TOP

Key Features

  • Adjustable height range: **755 to 955 mm**
  • Compatible with **U-PH5 slope corrector** for additional height (769 to 969 mm) and slope correction (0-5%)
  • Made from **80% recycled polypropylene (PPC) + 20% talc**
  • Resistant to extreme temperatures (-30°C to +80°C)
  • Supports various flooring materials: stone pavers, timber decking, ceramic tiles
  • High load-bearing capacity with compression-tested strength

Technical Overview

  • Material: **Copolymer Polypropylene (CPP)**
  • Base Diameter: **197 mm (305 cm² surface area)**
  • Top Diameter: **170 mm (227 cm² surface area)**
  • Weight: **2.97 kg**
  • Compression strength: Up to **1095 kg** (full load)
  • Weather-resistant, UV-stable, and chemical-resistant

Trade Professional Information

  • Tools required: Level, tape measure, deck spacers
  • Tips: Use **U-PH5 slope corrector** for inclined surfaces
  • Common Issues: Ensure pedestals are evenly spaced for load distribution

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a dry location, away from direct sunlight
  • No expiry, long-term durability

Certifications

  • Manufactured in Europe under stringent quality controls
  • Contains minimum **50% recycled content**
  • Compliant with international load-bearing and material safety standards

Frequently Asked Questions About PB-11 Adjustable Pedestal

  • What surfaces can the PB-11 be installed on? It is compatible with concrete slabs, cement screeds, waterproof membranes, and insulation panels.
  • Can the pedestal be used for vehicular traffic? No, the PB-11 is designed only for pedestrian applications.
  • What is the maximum weight capacity? The pedestal can support up to 1095kg (2461 lbF) under standard conditions.

column33: The Buzon PB-9 is an adjustable pedestal (560-715mm) made from 95% recycled polypropylene, ideal for outdoor raised flooring applications.
column52:
Application Guide

  1. Prepare the Surface: Ensure the substrate is stable and level. Suitable bases include concrete slabs, cement screeds, waterproof membranes, and insulation panels.
  2. Assemble the Pedestal:
    • Attach the PB-4-BASE at the bottom.
    • Connect the PB-C2 couplers to adjust the height as needed.
    • Secure the PB-4-TOP on top of the assembly.
  3. Adjust the Height: Rotate the PB-C2 couplers to achieve the desired height (560 mm to 715 mm).
  4. Ensure Stability: Use the Security STOP feature to lock the height adjustment in place.
  5. Install the Decking or Paving: Position the tiles, decking, or other finishing materials on top of the PB-9 pedestal.
  6. Check for Leveling: Use a spirit level to confirm the evenness of the surface.
  7. Optional Slope Adjustment: If required, use the U-PH5 slope corrector to compensate for slopes up to 5%.

For detailed manual instructions, please download the Installation Manual PB-9.

Limitations

  • Not suitable for extremely heavy structural loads beyond rated capacity
  • Must be installed on a stable and compacted surface

The Leister Unidrive 500 is a semi-automatic hot-air welder designed for efficient and reliable welding of thermoplastic roofing membranes. It features ergonomic handles for balanced pressure, a reversible drive for directional flexibility, and a compact design for maneuverability in tight spaces. The Unidrive 500 offers consistent welding quality, even with voltage fluctuations, and is significantly faster than manual welding.

Key Features

  • Semi-automatic operation for consistent welds
  • Ergonomic handles for balanced pressure and comfortable use
  • Reversible drive for welding in both directions
  • Compact and lightweight design (4.5 kg) for easy handling
  • Maintenance-free, brushless motors for long service life
  • Stainless steel nozzle for all welding applications
  • Constant parameters and reliable quality, even with undervoltage
  • Up to three times faster than manual welding

Technical Overview

  • Voltage: 100V, 120V, or 230V depending on the model
  • Power: 1500W, 1800W, or 2200W depending on the model
  • Temperature range: 100 - 580°C
  • Air volume: Adjustable from 45% to 100%
  • Welding speed: 0.7 - 4.5 m/min
  • Sound pressure level: 70 dB(A)
  • Dimensions (L x H x W): 297 x 173 x 275 mm

Trade Professional Information

  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper alignment and pressure for optimal welding results. Use the correct nozzle size and type for the specific roofing material.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store the welder in a dry and safe place when not in use.
  • Keep the welder out of reach of children.

Fatrafol 810v is a robust, reinforced PVC roofing membrane engineered for single-ply flat roofing applications. This UV-resistant membrane is mechanically anchored and designed for exceptional durability and weather resistance. Fatrafol 810v is ideal for a variety of roofing projects and must be installed by specialized, trained professionals.

Key Features

  • Reinforced PVC membrane with polyester grid
  • UV resistant
  • Mechanically anchored installation
  • Suitable for cold temperature installation (down to -5°C)
  • Meets EN 13956 standard
  • Produced by multi-extrusion processing

Technical Overview

  • Key Performance Data: Meets EN 13956. Consult Fatra for specific performance data. Membranes meet test pressure of 60 kPa. Achieved AA rating according to BS 476-3:1958.
  • Chemical Properties: PVC-P based. Consult Fatra for detailed chemical properties and compatibility. Not compatible with bitumen; requires protection layer if exposed.
  • Application Temperature Range: Up to -5°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Hot air welding equipment, specialized tools for single-ply membrane installation, mechanical anchoring equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Installation must be carried out by specialized, trained installers according to Fatra's Construction and Technologic Instruction. Ensure proper substrate preparation, anchoring selection, and welding techniques. Consider wind suction and dimensional changes during installation.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Adhere to Fatra's guidelines for jointing and detailing. Ensure proper storage and handling of materials. Protect from bitumen contact.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original closed packing on wooden pallets, protected by packing film.
  • Shelf Life Information: Consult Fatra.
  • Temperature Considerations: Recommended storage temperature: -5°C to +30°C. Protect from weathering influences until processing.

Certifications

  • Meets EN 13956 standard. Manufacturing control system certificates No. 1390-CPD-0028/07/Z and 1390-CPD-0033/06/Z.

Related Products

  • Fatrafol 804 membrane (for details)
  • Mechanical anchoring elements

The Fatrafix Bar offers a unique solution for installing timber decking, solar panels, air conditioning units, and other mechanical services onto Fatra PVC single-ply roofing membranes *without* penetrating the membrane. This innovative system preserves the waterproofing integrity of the roof, eliminating the need for complex detailing around penetrations. Ideal for balconies, terraces, and common areas, Fatrafix Bar provides a secure and efficient fixing method for Australian trade professionals.

Key Features

  • Non-penetrating fixing system
  • Compatible with Fatra PVC membranes (807, 807v, 810v)
  • Suitable for timber decking, solar panels, and other services
  • Easy installation by qualified installers
  • Durable and long-lasting
  • Australian engineered solution

Technical Overview

  • Key Performance Data: Achieves an average 3.0 kN loading. EJOT ecoFAST JF3-2-5.5 x 25 S16 Stainless steel Bi-Met fasteners achieve over 3.6 kN pullout performance.
  • Chemical Properties: PVC encapsulated aluminium bar. Consult Fatra for membrane chemical resistance data.
  • Application Temperature Range: Consult Fatra for specific membrane compatibility.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Hot air welding equipment, seam roller, solvent cleaner suitable for PVC, measuring tools.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure membrane is clean and dry before installation. Use appropriate welding techniques for Fatra membranes. Consult Fatra for specific application requirements. Ensure correct fastener selection for the application.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper alignment of Fatrafix Bar. Avoid installing over seams without additional membrane strip. Conduct wind load calculations for restrained applications.

Limitations and Precautions

  • Consult Fatra for compatibility with specific membrane types and applications.
  • Ensure adequate wind load calculations are performed for restrained applications.
  • Do not install over seams without using an additional membrane strip.
  • Ensure the roof structure can support the additional load.
  • Use appropriate safety equipment during installation.

Suitable Substrates

  • Fatra PVC single-ply membranes (807, 807v, 810v)

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, well-ventilated area.
  • Shelf Life Information: Consult Fatra for specific information.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures.

Use Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive for: Bonding Fatrafol felt-backed roof membranes to concrete, fibre strand boards, plywood, insulation boards, and steel panels.

Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive is the go-to solution for Australian tradespeople needing a reliable and efficient adhesive for felt-backed roofing membranes. Its single-sided application and rapid hardening properties streamline the installation process, saving time and reducing project costs. With its high strength adhesion and resistance to blistering, Fatrabond 1214 ensures a long-lasting, high-quality roofing system.

Key Features of Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive

  • High Strength Adhesion: Bonds strongly to a wide range of substrates.
  • Single-Sided Application: Simplifies the application process.
  • Rapid Hardening: Speeds up project completion.
  • Resistance to Blistering: Ensures a smooth, durable finish.
  • Solvent-Free Formulation: Environmentally friendly and safe to use.

Technical Overview

Fatrabond 1214 is a moisture-curing polyurethane-based adhesive with a liquid consistency and blue appearance. Its formulation is designed to provide excellent bond strength and rapid hardening, making it suitable for demanding roofing applications.

Chemical Properties: Polyurethane-based, moisture-curing adhesive.

Application Temperature Range: 5 °C to 30 °C (41 °F to 86 °F).

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Roller, heavy-duty (40-50 kg) roller.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Apply adhesive evenly and roll out any air pockets with a heavy-duty roller. For porous surfaces, a second coat may be necessary.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If adhesive dries for over 15 minutes, recoat the area. Ensure proper rolling to prevent air entrapment.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original, unopened packaging in a dry place, not exceeding 30 °C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in temperatures above 30 °C.

column33: High-strength Fatrabond 1214 MCPU adhesive for Fatrafol felt-backed roof membranes. Solvent-free and rapid-curing. Shop now at Adheseal!
column52:
How to apply Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive:

  1. Prepare the substrate: Clean and dry the surface.
  2. Apply adhesive: Use a roller to apply an even coat.
  3. Allow tack time: Wait 2-6 minutes until tacky.
  4. Apply membrane: Roll Fatra felt-backed roof membrane.
  5. Roll out air pockets: Use a heavy-duty roller.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive

Q: What surfaces can Fatrabond 1214 be used on?

A: It is designed for bonding Fatrafol felt-backed roof membranes to concrete, fibre strand boards, plywood, insulation boards, and steel panels.

Q: How long does Fatrabond 1214 take to cure?

A: It offers rapid hardening depending on moisture and temperature. The open time is 15 minutes at 20 °C.

Q: Is Fatrabond 1214 environmentally friendly?

A: Yes, it is a solvent-free formulation, making it an effective green solution.

Q: How should Fatrabond 1214 be applied?

A: Apply evenly with a roller onto the substrate and allow 2-6 minutes until tacky. Then, apply the membrane and roll out any air pockets with a heavy-duty roller.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Fatrabond 1214?

A: Wear appropriate PPE, such as gloves and eye protection. Ensure adequate ventilation. Avoid skin contact. Clean tools with appropriate solvent immediately after use.
column54:
Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive limitations:

  • Open time of 15 minutes at 20 °C.
  • Storage temperature not to exceed 30 °C.
  • Porous surfaces will drastically increase consumption.

Safety precautions when using Fatrabond 1214 MCPU Adhesive:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and appropriate respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact. Clean tools with appropriate solvent immediately after use.
  • Storage: Store in a dry place, not exceeding 30 °C.

Use SILCOR 575 LB for: Waterproofing of balconies, podiums, roof decks, and internal wet areas with seamless, high-performance protection.

SILCOR 575 LB is a high-solids, one-part polyurethane waterproofing membrane formulated for robust, long-lasting protection of horizontal surfaces. Its moisture-curing technology allows for easy roller or brush application, creating a seamless, monolithic membrane that eliminates weak points. The membrane accommodates structural movement, bridges non-structural cracks, and offers superior adhesion to concrete, screeds, masonry, and various substrates.

Key Features of SILCOR 575 LB

  • One-part, high-solids, moisture-curing polyurethane
  • Seamless, liquid-applied monolithic membrane
  • High extensibility (>800%) and tensile strength (>5 MPa)
  • Certified Class III waterproofing (AS 4654.1 & AS/NZS 4858)
  • Fully bonded – prevents water tracking
  • Accommodates typical structural movements
  • Resistant to water immersion, chemicals, and aging
  • Cold-applied – no flame or heat required
  • Low VOC (<110g/L) – environmentally friendly

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: High-solids, moisture-curing polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Roller, brush, mixing drill
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply to dry, primed surfaces; ensure uniform coverage to avoid thin spots
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application to wet substrates to prevent adhesion failure

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in original packaging between +15°C and +25°C
  • Shelf life: 9 months from manufacture date
  • Protect from heat, moisture, frost, and direct sunlight

Certifications

  • AS 4654.1-2012 – External Waterproofing
  • AS/NZS 4858-2004 – Internal Wet Areas
  • Low VOC – <110 g/L

Frequently Asked Questions About SILCOR 575 LB

  • Can this be used for exposed areas? Yes, but must be overcoated with SILCOR Top Coat 75.
  • Is this suitable for heavy foot traffic? No, it is not designed for heavy-duty foot or vehicle traffic.
  • Can it be applied in wet conditions? No, it must be applied to dry, properly prepared surfaces.

Use Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane for: Heavy-duty waterproofing in high-traffic and demanding environments, including stadiums, car parks, and wet areas.

Silcor 580 is a premium-grade, two-part polyurethane membrane designed for long-life waterproof protection. With its very low VOC content and exceptional physical properties, including high elongation and tensile strength, it provides a seamless and durable barrier. This membrane is ideal for applications requiring robust waterproofing, such as stadiums, car park decks, and balconies. Its ability to accommodate structural movements and bridge non-structural cracks ensures long-term performance. When paired with the correct silcor top coat, the product is suitable for heavy traffic areas. The polyurethane chemistry ensures it is free from bitumen or tar, preventing bleeding or staining.

Primer Information: Use Silcor Primer BS for dry concrete and metals, or Epocote F100W for damp concrete. Proper priming is essential for optimal adhesion and performance.

Cure Time: Tack-free in 4 hours, minimum recoat time of 15 hours, and ready for flood testing in 15 hours. Cure times vary with temperature and humidity.

Application: Apply using a notched trowel, squeegee, roller, or brush. Ensure proper mixing and application to achieve the specified dry film thickness (DFT). It is important to remember that this product is semi self leveling, and should only be applied to horizontal surfaces set to falls.

Chemical Properties: High solids, 2-part polyurethane with excellent resistance to water, detergents, and chemicals. This makes it suitable for demanding environments like laboratories and plant rooms.

Key Features of Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane

  • High Elongation (>700%): Accommodates structural movements, preventing cracks in high-traffic areas.
  • Very Low VOC (<35g/L): Enhances on-site safety and environmental compliance.
  • Seamless Application: Eliminates weak points and provides a continuous waterproof barrier.
  • Wide Service Temperature (-40°C to +100°C): Ensures performance in extreme Australian climates.
  • AS 4654.1 and AS/NZS 4858 Compliant: Meets Australian standards for external and internal waterproofing.

Why Choose Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane:

  • Durability: Provides long-term protection in demanding environments.
  • Versatility: Suitable for a wide range of applications, from stadiums to wet areas.
  • Safety: Low VOC content reduces health and environmental risks.
  • Reliability: Chemically cured polyurethane ensures consistent performance.

When to Choose Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Silcor 580 over bitumen-based membranes when: High flexibility, low VOC, and long-term durability are required.
  • Consider other options when: Vertical applications or very fast cure times are needed.

Trade-Specific Applications for Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane:

For Stadium Builders:

  • Waterproofing stadium decks and concourses, ensuring durability under heavy foot traffic.
  • Provides a seamless, long-lasting barrier against water ingress.
  • Accommodates structural movements, preventing cracks.

For Car Park Builders:

  • Waterproofing car park decks and ramps, protecting against water and chemical damage.
  • High tensile strength and elongation ensure durability under vehicle traffic.
  • Low VOC content enhances safety in enclosed car park environments.

For Waterproofers:

  • Reliable waterproofing for balconies, roof decks, and internal wet areas.
  • Seamless application eliminates weak points and ensures long-term protection.
  • Compliant with Australian standards, ensuring quality and performance.

For Civil Engineers:

  • Providing long term waterproofing solutions for civil projects.
  • High chemical resistance for use in industrial applications.
  • Long term durability.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing drill, paddle mixer, notched trowel, squeegee, roller, WFT gauge.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper substrate preparation and priming. Use a WFT gauge to verify applied thickness.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application in high humidity or when rain is imminent. Ensure proper mixing to prevent curing issues.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original packaging between 15°C and 25°C, protected from heat, moisture, and sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Apply between +5°C and +35°C.

Certifications and Compliance

  • AS 4654.1-2012: Compliant for external, non-exposed waterproofing.
  • AS/NZS 4858-2004: Compliant for internal wet area waterproofing.

column33: SILCOR® 580 is a heavy-duty, low-odour, polyurethane waterproofing membrane designed for superior protection. Ideal for balconies, decks & car parks.
column52:
How to apply Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane:

  1. Prepare the substrate: Ensure it is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Prime the substrate: Apply the appropriate primer (Silcor Primer BS or Epocote F100W).
  3. Mix the membrane: Thoroughly mix the two components of Silcor 580.
  4. Apply the membrane: Use a notched trowel, squeegee, roller, or brush to apply the membrane to the required thickness.
  5. Allow to cure: Allow the membrane to cure for the specified time before applying a top coat or further finishes.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane

Q: Can Silcor 580 be used in external applications?

A: Yes, Silcor 580 is compliant with AS 4654.1-2012 for external, non-exposed waterproofing. Ensure it is overcoated with Silcor Top Coat for UV protection.

Q: What type of primer should I use with Silcor 580?

A: Use Silcor Primer BS for dry concrete and metals, or Epocote F100W for damp concrete. Proper priming is essential for optimal adhesion.

Q: Can Silcor 580 be used in high-traffic areas?

A: Yes, when overcoated with Silcor Top Coat 80, it is suitable for heavy foot traffic and light vehicle traffic areas.

Q: What is the VOC content of Silcor 580?

A: Silcor 580 has a very low VOC content of less than 35 g/L, making it safer for applicators and occupants.

Q: What is the service temperature range for Silcor 580?

A: The service temperature range is -40°C to +100°C, ensuring performance in extreme Australian climates.

Q: How do I apply Silcor 580?

A: Apply using a notched trowel, squeegee, roller, or brush. Ensure proper mixing and application to achieve the specified dry film thickness (DFT). Always use on horizontal surfaces set to falls.
column54:
Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane limitations:

  • Not to be installed as a negative pressure membrane.
  • Not to be installed to damp, wet, contaminated, or unprepared substrates.
  • Not recommended for internal lining of water tanks due to self-levelling properties.
  • Must not be applied if it is raining or rain is imminent.
  • Not to be installed when ambient humidity is above 85%.

Safety precautions when using Silcor 580 Polyurethane Waterproofing Membrane:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Clean spills immediately.
  • First Aid: In case of skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water. If inhaled, move to fresh air.
  • Storage: Store in original packaging between 15°C and 25°C.

Use Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone for: Glass and metal connection joints, ceramic/mosaic tile repairs, kitchen and bathroom sealing, and mirror adhesion.

Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone is a one-component, moisture-curing, high-performance hybrid sealant that brings together the mechanical properties of polyurethane and silicone sealants. This new generation, isocyanate-solvent free sealant offers easy application, excellent UV resistance, weathering, and ageing properties, making it ideal for both indoor and outdoor applications. With very good adhesion to most construction materials and low VOC content, Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone ensures reliable and environmentally conscious performance.

Key Features of Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone

  • Solvent and Isocyanate Free: Safer to use and environmentally friendly.
  • Excellent UV Resistance, Weathering, and Ageing: Ensures long-term durability in outdoor applications.
  • Good Chemical Resistance: Enhances durability in environments with chemical exposure.
  • Very Good Adhesion: Bonds strongly to most construction materials, simplifying application.
  • Low VOC: Meets environmental standards and enhances user safety.
  • Transparent Colour: Ideal for aesthetic applications like glass and mirror bonding.

Technical Overview

Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone is a silane-terminated polymer-based sealant with a specific gravity of 1.02 ±0.03 g/cm³. It has a tack-free time of approximately 35 minutes at 25°C and 50% RH. With a Shore hardness of 35±5, an elongation at break of 300%, and a tensile strength of 1.9 MPa, it provides robust performance.

Chemical Properties: Silane-terminated polymer-based sealant with excellent UV and chemical resistance.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C.

Temperature Resistance: -40°C to +90°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, putty knife.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Use backing rods for large joints. Tool sealant immediately after application.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application on bituminous substrates, natural rubber, EPDM rubber, PE, HDPE, Teflon, Delrin, or materials that bleed oils. Clean uncured sealant with solvents.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between +5°C and +25°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

  4. Curing: Avoid contact with alcohol and solvents during curing.
  5. Cleanup: Clean uncured sealant with solvents. Cured material can only be removed mechanically.
column53:

Q: Is Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone suitable for outdoor use?

Q: What types of surfaces does Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone adhere to?

A: Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone has very good adhesion to most construction materials, including metal, aluminium, glass, plastic, and wood.

Q: How long does Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone take to become tack-free?

A: Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone has a tack-free time of approximately 35 minutes at 25°C and 50% RH.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Selsil Ultra Clear Silicone?

A: Keep out of reach of children. Avoid contact with skin. Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.
