column3:
Use RLA 2PART for: Waterproofing internal and external wet areas, showers, balconies, planter boxes, retaining walls, ponds, swimming pools, and potable water storage.

RLA 2PART is a two-component, cementitious waterproofing membrane designed for the demanding needs of Australian trades. This Class II membrane combines the robust durability of cement-based systems with the flexibility of pre-mixed alternatives. Its fast-drying formula allows for rapid project completion, while its high tensile strength (1.2 MPa) and elongation (214%) ensure long-lasting, crack-resistant protection. Suitable for both internal and external use, including fully immersed applications like swimming pools and water tanks, RLA 2PART provides a versatile and reliable waterproofing solution. It's certified to AS4858, AS 4654.1, and AS 4020 (potable water), giving you confidence in its performance and compliance.

Key Features of RLA 2PART

  • Class II Flexibility: Provides excellent crack-bridging capabilities, accommodating movement in the substrate and preventing water ingress.
  • Fast Drying: Recoat in just 2-4 hours and tile or screed within 24 hours, significantly reducing project downtime.
  • High Adhesion Strength: Bonds securely to a variety of substrates, including concrete, render, screed, and fibre cement sheeting.
  • Durable and UV Stable: Offers long-term protection against water, weathering, and UV exposure, ensuring the integrity of your waterproofing system.
  • Immersed Applications: Suitable for use in constantly wet environments like swimming pools, ponds, and water features (must be tiled over).
  • Potable Water Approved: Certified to AS 4020, making it safe for use in drinking water storage tanks.

Technical Overview

RLA 2PART is a technically advanced, two-component waterproofing membrane comprising a liquid polymer (Part A) and a cement-based powder (Part B). This combination delivers a superior balance of flexibility and strength. The 1:1 mixing ratio simplifies preparation, and the resulting viscous paste is easy to apply by brush or roller. Achieving the specified dry film thickness (DFT) of 1.2mm is critical for optimal performance, requiring a minimum two-coat application with a total coverage of 1.5 litres/m².

Chemical Properties: Cementitious, providing excellent adhesion and compatibility with cement-based substrates and tile adhesives.

Application Temperature Range: Apply only when the substrate and ambient temperatures are between 5°C and 35°C (41°F and 95°F). Applying outside this range can affect curing time and overall performance. For example, in hot weather, consider working during cooler parts of the day to extend pot life and prevent premature drying.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing drill with paddle attachment, brush or medium nap roller, wet film thickness gauge, scissors or knife (for cutting tape), spatula or roller (for pressing tape).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always add the powder (Part B) to the liquid (Part A) while mixing. Allow the mixed product to stand for 5 minutes before use to ensure proper hydration. Regularly check the wet film thickness to guarantee adequate coverage.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the membrane dries too quickly, reduce the application area or work during cooler periods. If pinholes appear, apply an additional thin coat. For substrate irregularities, use RLA repair compounds before applying the membrane.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry area, off the ground, and out of direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production when stored in unopened original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Ensure storage temperature remains above 5°C (41°F).

Certifications

  • AS4858: Wet Area Membranes - Ensures compliance with Australian standards for internal wet area waterproofing.
  • AS 4654.1: Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground use - Guarantees suitability for external applications.
  • AS 4020: Products for use in contact with drinking water - Confirms the membrane is safe for use in potable water storage.
column7: AS42 28,balcony,bathroom,cementitous,concrete,durable,external,facades,fibre cement sheet,flexible,flooring-i,high strength,internal,masonry,membrane,pail,plasterboard,render,screed,shower,stone-i,swimming pool,tiling,tiling-i,undertile,uv stable,water tank,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i,wet areas
column32: RLA 2 Part Cementitious Waterproofing Membrane | Adheseal
column33: RLA 2 Part is a flexible, quick-drying, two-component cementitious waterproofing membrane ideal for internal & external wet areas, pools, and more. Shop online!
column52:
How to apply RLA 2 PART Two Component Cementitious Membrane:

     
  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure all surfaces are clean, sound, smooth, dry, and free from contaminants. Mechanically remove any unsound layers or contaminants. Fill any defects, voids, or cracks.
    2.  
  2. Priming: Apply the appropriate RLA primer based on the substrate's porosity: RLA Porous Primer for porous surfaces (1-2 coats), RLA Non Porous Primer for non-porous surfaces (1 coat), or RLA Moisture Seal for damp surfaces (1-2 coats). Allow primer to dry completely.
    3.  
  3. Mixing: Pour half (10 litres) of Part A liquid into a clean 20L bucket. While mechanically stirring, slowly add one 10 kg bag of Part B powder and mix until smooth and lump-free. Allow to stand for 5 minutes and remix before use.
    4.  
  4. First Coat Application: Using a brush or medium nap roller, apply an even first coat to the surface, achieving a minimum wet film thickness of 0.75mm (750 micron).
    5.  
  5. Drying Time: Allow the first coat to dry completely, typically for 2-4 hours at 23°C and 50% RH. Drying times will vary with temperature and humidity.
    6.  
  6. Second Coat Application: Apply a second coat at a right angle to the first coat, again achieving a minimum wet film thickness of 0.75mm (750 micron). This will result in a total minimum dry film thickness of 1.2mm.
    7.  
  7. Detailing: Incorporate bond breaker tapes (e.g., Elastoproof Joint Band, BRW PF Tape) at all joints, junctions, and corners as per relevant Australian Standards (AS 3740 & AS 4654.1). Use Elastoproof Collars or BRW PF Tape for pipes and penetrations.
    8.  
  8. Curing: Allow the membrane to cure fully before tiling or applying toppings. Polymer-modified adhesives can typically be used after 24 hours. Immersion in water should be delayed for 7 days.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA 2PART

Q: How do I ensure the correct mixing ratio for RLA 2PART?

A: RLA 2PART has a simple 1:1 mixing ratio. Always add the powder (Part B) to the liquid (Part A). For a full kit, pour half the liquid (10 litres) into the 20L bucket, then slowly add one 10kg bag of powder while mixing with an electric drill and paddle. Smaller quantities can be mixed using the same 1:1 ratio.

Q: What is the coverage rate of RLA 2PART?

A: A 40kg kit of RLA 2PART covers approximately 23m² (247.57 sq ft). However, this is dependent on the surface profile. Uneven or porous surfaces may require more product to achieve the required 1.2mm dry film thickness. Always apply a minimum of two coats.

Q: Can RLA 2PART be used on damp substrates?

A: Yes, but you must first prime the surface with RLA MOISTURE SEAL if the substrate has residual moisture greater than 80% RH (ASTM F2170) or 5% moisture content (ASTM F2659). For standard porous surfaces, use RLA POROUS PRIMER. For non-porous surfaces, use RLA NON POROUS PRIMER.

Q: How do I use RLA 2PART in a swimming pool?

A: RLA 2PART is suitable for immersed applications like swimming pools. However, it *must* be tiled over. It cannot be used as an exposed finish in these environments. Ensure you follow the correct application procedures, including priming and achieving the required dry film thickness. Use polymer-modified tile adhesives and grouts from the RLA range for tiling.

Q: What are the safety precautions when using RLA 2PART?

A: Always refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for comprehensive safety information. As a cementitious product, it's essential to wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves and eye protection. Ensure adequate ventilation during application. Clean tools and spills with water while the product is still wet.
column54:
RLA 2 PART Two Component Cementitious Membrane limitations:

     
  • Do not apply when surface or ambient temperatures are below 5°C or above 35°C.
    •  
  • Must not be applied when raining or if rain is imminent.
    •  
  • Not to be used as a trafficable membrane finish.
    •  
  • Not to be used as an exposed coating in swimming pools or spas - must be tiled over.
    •  
  • Not to be used in areas subject to negative hydrostatic pressure.

Safety precautions when using RLA 2 PART Two Component Cementitious Membrane:

     
  •     Personal Protective Equipment: Wear appropriate gloves (e.g., nitrile or rubber), eye protection (e.g., safety glasses), and respiratory protection (e.g., dust mask) to avoid contact with skin, eyes, and inhalation of dust.  
    •  
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation in the work area, especially in enclosed spaces, to minimise dust inhalation.
    •  
  • Handling: Avoid generating dust during mixing and handling. Wash hands thoroughly after use. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed handling and disposal instructions.
column55: RLA 2PART is a versatile, quick-drying, two-component cementitious membrane. This flexible and durable Class II membrane offers high adhesion and is suitable for a wide range of waterproofing applications, even in immersed environments.
column56:
RLA 2 PART Two Component Cementitious Membrane can be used on the following substrates:

     
  • Concrete: Ensure concrete is cured for at least 28 days and is clean and dry. Prime with RLA Porous Primer.
    •  
  • Render: Cement render should be allowed to cure for at least 7 days. Ensure it is sound and prime with RLA Porous Primer.
    •  
  • Screed: Sand cement screeds require a minimum 7-day cure. Prime with RLA Porous Primer.
    •  
  • Masonry: Ensure surfaces are pointed flush and free of defects. Prime with RLA Porous Primer.
    •  
  • Compressed fibre cement sheeting: Ensure sheets are installed according to manufacturer's recommendations and prime with RLA Porous Primer.
    •  
  • Plasterboard: Use only water-resistant plasterboard in wet areas and prime with RLA Porous Primer.
column57:
Use RLA 2 PART Two Component Cementitious Membrane for:

     
  • Internal wet areas: Waterproofing showers, laundries, and bathrooms before tiling.
    •  
  • External wet areas: Providing a flexible and UV-stable waterproof layer on balconies and decks before tiling or other toppings.
    •  
  • Planter boxes: Creating a waterproof barrier to protect structures from water damage caused by soil and moisture.
    •  
  • Retaining walls: Waterproofing subterranean walls to prevent water ingress from the surrounding soil.
    •  
  • Ponds and water features: Providing a reliable waterproof lining for decorative water features.
    •  
  • Swimming pools: Creating a waterproof membrane beneath the tile finish in swimming pools and spas.
    •  
  • Potable water storage facilities & retention tanks: Ensuring a safe and certified waterproof lining for drinking water containment.
    •  
  • Façade walls under tiles and stone: Protecting building facades from water penetration behind adhered finishes.

Why Use RLA 2 PART Two Component Cementitious Membrane:

     
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for a wide range of waterproofing needs, from internal bathrooms to external balconies and even immersed environments, simplifying product selection for various projects.
    •  
  • Long-Lasting Protection: Forms a tough and durable waterproof barrier with high adhesion, ensuring reliable performance and preventing costly water damage over time.
    •  
  • Easy to Apply: The two-component system mixes readily, and the application process with a brush or roller is straightforward for trade professionals familiar with membrane application.
    •  
  • Meets Australian Standards: Independently tested and certified to AS4858 and AS 4654.1, providing confidence in its performance and compliance with local building codes.
    •  
  • Safe for Potable Water: Approved to AS 4020, making it suitable for use in contact with drinking water, an essential requirement for specific applications.
    •  
  • Saves Time: Fast drying properties allow for quicker project completion, enabling tradespeople to move on to subsequent stages of the job more efficiently.
    •  
  • Flexible Performance: The flexible nature of the membrane accommodates minor substrate movement, reducing the risk of cracking and maintaining the integrity of the waterproof seal.

column3:
Key Features

  • Available in four lengths: 5 m, 8 m, and 10 m.
  • Blade widths of 25 mm (RubTape 5 and 8), and 32 mm (RubTape 10).

column2: Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone
column3:
Use Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone for: Sealing joints in kitchens and bathrooms, tiling applications, and any area requiring a matt finish and anti-fungal properties.

Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone is a neutral curing, anti-fungal silicone sealant with a unique matt finish, specifically formulated for kitchen and bathroom applications. Its high flexibility and water resistance make it ideal for sealing joints around sinks, tiles, and other sanitary fixtures, ensuring a hygienic and aesthetically pleasing finish.

Key Features of Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone

  • Matt Finish: Provides a stylish, non-reflective finish, ideal for modern kitchen and bathroom designs.
  • Anti-Fungal: Inhibits mould and biological growth, ensuring hygienic seals in wet areas.
  • High Flexibility: Accommodates joint movement up to ±25%, preventing cracks and leaks.
  • Water Resistance: Provides a durable, waterproof seal, essential for kitchen and bathroom environments.
  • Low VOC: Meets Green Star environmental criteria, ensuring safe application in indoor spaces.

Why Choose Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone:

  • Aesthetic Appeal: Unique matt finish enhances tiled and sanitary surfaces.
  • Hygienic Seals: Anti-fungal properties prevent mould growth in humid conditions.
  • Specialised Application: Specifically designed for kitchen and bathroom environments.
  • Durable Performance: Withstands moisture and temperature variations.
  • Safe and Compliant: Low VOC content and compliance with environmental standards.

When to Choose Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone over standard silicone sealants when: A matt finish is required for aesthetic purposes and anti-fungal properties are essential for kitchen and bathroom areas.
  • Consider other options when: High structural glazing is required, or when the product will be used on polycarbonate sheeting.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Matt Seal S-250 offers a premium finish and specialized anti-fungal properties, providing long-term value in kitchen and bathroom applications.

Trade-Specific Applications for Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone:

For Tilers:

  • Sealing movement joints between tiles in kitchens and bathrooms with a matt finish.
  • Sealing corners in tiled walls and floors, preventing water ingress and mould growth.
  • Ensuring a smooth, clean finish around splashbacks and bench tops.

For Plumbers:

  • Sealing joints around sinks, baths, and showers, ensuring watertight seals.
  • Providing a hygienic seal around pipe penetrations.
  • Ensuring long-lasting protection against moisture and mould.

Technical Overview

Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone is a neutral curing silicone sealant designed for high-performance applications in kitchen and bathroom environments. Its matt finish and anti-fungal properties make it ideal for these specific applications, providing a durable, long-lasting seal that withstands moisture and temperature variations.

Chemical Properties: Oxime curing system ensures a neutral cure, preventing corrosion and damage to sensitive materials. The anti-fungal additives inhibit mould growth, maintaining hygienic seals.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C. This range allows for application in most Australian climates. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry for optimal adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, IPA cleaner or white spirits.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For tiling, use masking tape to achieve neat edges. For plumbing applications, ensure surfaces are thoroughly cleaned and dry.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper surface preparation to prevent adhesion issues. Clean uncured sealant with white spirit.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Green Star Compliance: Meets environmental criteria for sustainable building practices in Australia.
  • Anti-Fungal Standards: Formulated to inhibit mould and biological growth, ensuring hygienic seals.

column32: Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone | Adheseal
column33: Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone: Anti-fungal, matt finish silicone sealant for kitchens and bathrooms. High flexibility and water resistance.
column52:
How to apply Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust, grease, and loose materials. Use IPA cleaner or white spirits for thorough cleaning.
  2. Priming (if necessary): Apply 50A primer for non-porous surfaces or Supaprime for porous surfaces with a small brush and allow to dry.
  3. Joint Design: Use a 2:1 width-to-depth ratio for the sealant joint. For joints deeper than 10mm, use a backing rod.
  4. Application: Cut the nozzle at a 45° angle, insert the cartridge into a caulking gun, and apply the sealant in a continuous bead.
  5. Tooling: Smooth the sealant with a moistened spatula within 5 minutes of application.
  6. Clean Up: Remove excess uncured sealant with white spirit. Remove masking tape while the sealant is still wet.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone

Q: Can I use Matt Seal S-250 in shower areas?

A: Yes, Matt Seal S-250 is specifically designed for wet areas like showers. Its anti-fungal properties and water resistance make it ideal for preventing mould and leaks. Ensure proper surface preparation for optimal adhesion.

Q: How do I achieve a neat finish with this sealant around tiles?

A: Use masking tape to define the joint edges before applying the sealant. Tool the sealant with a moistened spatula before it skins over, and remove the tape while the sealant is still wet for clean, precise lines.

Q: Is Matt Seal S-250 suitable for sealing around rimless sinks?

A: Yes, Matt Seal S-250 is suitable for rimless sinks. Its excellent adhesion to porcelain and other sanitary acrylics ensures a durable, waterproof seal.

Q: Can I use this sealant on natural stone?

A: It is recommended that stain testing be carried out before use on natural stone. Matt Seal S-250 is recommended for marble and granite after a successful stain test.

Q: What is the best way to clean up uncured sealant?

A: Clean uncured sealant with white spirit or turps. Ensure adequate ventilation and follow safety precautions when using solvents.

Q: How long does Matt Seal S-250 take to cure?

A: Matt Seal S-250 cures at a rate of approximately 2mm per 24 hours at 25°C and 50% humidity. Cure times can vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.
column54:
Matt Seal S-250 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone limitations:

  • Not suitable for totally confined spaces, as it requires atmospheric humidity to cure.
  • Not recommended for aquariums or adhering mirrors (use High Power 609 for mirrors, with testing).
  • Not suitable for structural glazing (use N-80 or N-60 Glazing silicone).
  • Not recommended for polycarbonate sheeting.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Not paintable.
  • Not recommended for below grade applications.
  • Not always suitable for all natural stone products, testing is required.

column2: DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm
column3:
Use DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm for: Eliminating tile lippage, maintaining precise tile spacing, and achieving a level surface on floor and wall tiling jobs

DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm are engineered to deliver smooth, lippage-free tile finishes across a wide range of applications. Designed to be used with Flat Out wedges and levelling pliers, these clips create a consistent 1.5mm grout line while holding tiles firmly in place during curing. Ideal for use on tiles between 2mm and 12mm thick, they are perfect for professional wall and floor installations. Whether you’re working with porcelain, ceramic, or stone tiles, these clips reduce tile movement and speed up the laying process for high-quality, repeatable results.

Key Features of DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm

  • Maintains consistent 1.5mm grout joint spacing
  • Eliminates lippage during adhesive curing
  • Compatible with tiles from 2mm to 12mm thick
  • Easy to install and remove without damaging tile edges
  • Optimised for both wall and floor tile applications

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: High-strength polymer construction
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Tile Thickness Compatibility: 2mm to 12mm
  • Grout Joint Spacing: 1.5mm fixed

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Flat Out wedges and levelling pliers
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always seat the clip base fully under the tile edge before inserting the wedge
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For uneven tiles, double-check adhesive coverage and wedge tightness for proper contact

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry, cool, shaded environments
  • Shelf Life Information: Unlimited shelf life under proper conditions
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 35°C (41°F to 95°F)

Certifications

  • Manufactured under ISO 9001 Quality Systems
  • Complies with Australian tiling trade standards
column7: accessory,levelling clips,tiling-i,trade tools
column32: DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm | Adheseal
column33: DTA Flat Out Tile Clips 1.5mm eliminate lippage and ensure level tile surfaces. Ideal for 2–12mm floor and wall tiles.
column52:
How to apply DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm:

  1. Apply tile adhesive as per the tile manufacturer’s recommendations
  2. Insert the base of the 1.5mm clip beneath the tile at the edge
  3. Place the adjacent tile and ensure alignment
  4. Insert a wedge into the clip and use pliers to apply pressure
  5. Allow adhesive to fully cure (check adhesive cure times)
  6. Remove clips by kicking or tapping parallel to grout lines
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm

Q: How do I install DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm?

A: Slide the base of the 1.5mm clip under the tile edge after adhesive is applied. Place the adjacent tile, insert a wedge into the clip, and tighten using levelling pliers for consistent pressure and alignment.

Q: Can I use these clips with large format tiles?

A: Yes. These clips are ideal for large format tiles, helping to maintain even spacing and eliminate lippage across wider surfaces where tile warping is more likely.

Q: Are DTA Flat Out Tile Clips 1.5mm reusable?

A: The clips are single-use and should be removed after the adhesive has cured. However, the accompanying wedges are reusable, offering cost-efficiency over multiple projects.

Q: What do I do if a clip doesn’t snap off cleanly?

A: Ensure you're removing clips by kicking or tapping parallel to the grout line. If part remains, gently tap with a rubber mallet or use pliers to twist off any excess.

Q: What tiles are compatible with the 1.5mm Flat Out clips?

A: These clips are compatible with ceramic, porcelain, and natural stone tiles ranging from 2mm to 12mm in thickness, offering great versatility across indoor and outdoor applications.
column54:
DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm limitations:

  • Not reusable – clips must be replaced for each install
  • Not suitable for tile thicknesses under 2mm or over 12mm
  • May crack very thin or delicate tiles if overtightened

Safety precautions when using DTA Flat Out Levelling System Tile Clips 1.5mm:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection when using levelling pliers
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation when working with tile adhesives
  • Handling: Avoid excessive force during clip tightening to prevent tile damage
  • Keep out of reach of children and store clips in a sealed container when not in use

column3:
Use Moisture Seal for: Preventing moisture ingress, vapour transmission, and rising damp in various construction applications, protecting surfaces and ensuring the longevity of overlaid flooring systems, waterproofing membranes, and decorative finishes.

RLA Moisture Seal is a high-performance, two-part, water-based epoxy primer and barrier coating system designed to prevent moisture ingress, vapour transmission, and rising damp. This versatile system is ideal for various applications, including priming concrete and masonry surfaces, protecting against hydrostatic pressure, and acting as a moisture barrier for decorative finishes. With its outstanding adhesion properties and compatibility with various RLA membranes and coatings, Moisture Seal ensures long-lasting protection against moisture-related damage.

Key Features of Moisture Seal

  • Water-based, solvent-free, and low VOC
  • Withstands up to 25 metres or up to 250 kPa of hydrostatic pressure
  • Can be applied to damp and "green" concrete
  • Extended pot life
  • Outstanding adhesion properties
  • Fully compatible with RLA membranes, coatings, adhesives, and levelling compounds
  • Complies with AS 4020 for potable water storage

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: 2-part water-based epoxy
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing pail, electric stirrer with paddle attachment, squeegee, stiff nylon broom, medium/long nap roller, wet film thickness gauge, sandpaper (if necessary).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough surface preparation, including cleaning and levelling the substrate. Use a wet film thickness gauge to ensure proper application thickness. Allow adequate drying time between coats and before applying subsequent finishes. For specific application requirements, refer to the product data sheet or contact RLA Technical Department.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application in temperatures below 10°C or above 35°C, or when relative humidity exceeds 80%, as these conditions can affect the cure rate. Do not apply to steel/metal surfaces to prevent corrosion. For substrates with active water leaks, treat with a suitable hydraulic setting cement/water plug before applying Moisture Seal.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original, unopened packaging in a dry area at room temperature. Keep off cold floors and out of direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • AS 4020
  • ASTM E96

Related Products

  • RLA Waterproofing Membranes
  • RLA Epoxy Flooring Systems
  • RLA Floor Levelling Compounds
  • RLA Universal Primer

column32: RLA Moisture Seal Epoxy Vapour Barrier System | Adheseal
column33: RLA Moisture Seal is a 2-part epoxy primer & barrier system that prevents moisture ingress and rising damp. Ideal for waterproofing and flooring.
column52:
Application Guide

  1. Prepare surface by cleaning, leveling, and removing contaminants.
  2. Mix Parts A and B at a 1:1 ratio until homogenous.
  3. Apply using a roller or squeegee for uniform coverage.
  4. For a vapour barrier, apply 1 coat (200 µm wet film thickness).
  5. For moisture barrier applications, apply 2 coats perpendicular to each other.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Moisture Seal

  • Can Moisture Seal be applied to damp surfaces? Yes, it can be applied to damp and "green" concrete.
  • What is the maximum hydrostatic pressure that Moisture Seal can withstand? It can withstand up to 25 metres or 250 kPa of hydrostatic pressure.
  • Can Moisture Seal be used in potable water applications? Yes, it complies with AS 4020 for potable water storage.
  • How long does it take for Moisture Seal to cure? Recoat time is approximately 4 hours, and it is recommended to wait 24 hours before applying subsequent finishes. Full cure for immersion applications takes approximately 10 days.
column54:
Moisture Seal limitations:

  • Do not apply when surface or ambient temperatures are below 10°C or above 35°C
  • Do not apply when relative humidity exceeds 80%
  • Do not apply to steel/metal surfaces
  • Not to be applied over standing water
  • Not designed as a trafficable surface
  • Not to be used as a finished coating subject to permanent UV exposure
  • Wear appropriate PPE, including gloves and eye protection.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during application, especially in enclosed areas.
  • Avoid skin and eye contact.

column2: Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet
column3:
Use Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet for: Rapid and reliable waterproofing of internal wet areas, and providing anti-fracture protection under tiled surfaces.

Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet is a high-strength, reinforced PVC sheet designed for efficient waterproofing and anti-fracture applications. Its self-adhesive backing significantly speeds up installation, making it a preferred choice for tilers and waterproofers. This sheet provides excellent moisture and vapour resistance, safeguarding internal wet areas like bathrooms and laundries. For renovators and builders, its anti-fracture properties offer added protection to tiled surfaces over existing or cracked substrates. The versatility of Gripset XpressLay extends to various substrates, including concrete, timber, and existing tiles, streamlining material selection on site.

Primer Information: Gripset XpressLay requires priming for optimal adhesion. Use RLA Universal Primer (diluted for porous surfaces, neat for non-porous) or Gripset E60 for green/damp surfaces. Priming ensures a strong bond, especially crucial for demanding wet area applications.

Installation: The self-adhesive nature of XpressLay allows for quick and easy installation. Simply measure, cut, peel, and stick. Ensure overlaps are a minimum of 50mm and firmly rolled. For plumbers and tilers, this significantly reduces installation time compared to traditional methods.

Thickness and Strength: At 1mm thick with a tensile strength of >2MPa and elongation of >60%, XpressLay provides a durable and flexible waterproofing layer. This is vital for preventing cracks in tiles due to substrate movement, a common concern for builders and homeowners.

Waterproofing Performance: Gripset XpressLay boasts excellent waterproof and vapour resistant properties with a water vapour transmission rate of 0.1g/24h/m². This effectively protects structures from moisture damage, meeting the stringent requirements of AS4858 for internal wet areas.

Key Features of Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet

  • Self-Adhesive Application: Drastically reduces installation time and labour costs for tilers and waterproofers.
  • Anti-Fracture Properties: Protects tiles from cracking due to substrate movement, enhancing the longevity of tiled surfaces for builders and renovators.
  • Wide Substrate Compatibility: Adheres to concrete, timber, existing tiles, and more, simplifying product selection for various trades.
  • Excellent Waterproofing: Provides reliable protection against moisture and vapour, crucial for internal wet areas.
  • Compliant to AS4858: Meets Australian standards for internal wet area waterproofing, ensuring quality and compliance.

Why Choose Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet:

  • Rapid Installation: Saves time and money on projects, benefiting project managers and builders.
  • Versatility: Reduces the need for multiple products, streamlining the waterproofing process for tilers and plumbers.
  • Reliable Protection: Ensures long-term waterproofing and anti-fracture performance, providing peace of mind for homeowners.
  • Ease of Use: Simplified application process, making it suitable for both professionals and DIY enthusiasts.

When to Choose Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Gripset XpressLay over liquid-applied membranes when: Speed of installation and consistent membrane thickness are critical, such as in large commercial projects.
  • Consider other options when: Complex detailing around penetrations or curved surfaces is required, where liquid membranes may offer more flexibility.

Trade-Specific Applications for Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet:

For Tilers:

  • Provides a stable and waterproof base for tile installations in bathrooms and laundries, using polymer-modified adhesives for direct tiling.
  • Anti-fracture properties prevent tiles from cracking due to minor substrate movement.
  • Saves time on waterproofing, allowing for quicker tile laying.

For Waterproofers:

  • Efficiently waterproofs internal wet areas, meeting the requirements of AS4858.
  • Self-adhesive application simplifies detailing and reduces the risk of application errors.
  • Offers a compatible system with Gripset liquid membranes for complex areas.

For Builders and Renovators:

  • Provides a reliable waterproofing solution for new builds and renovations.
  • Can be applied over existing surfaces, reducing demolition work.
  • Offers long-term protection against water damage.

For Plumbers:

  • Waterproofs areas around pipes and fixtures, ensuring watertight seals.
  • Compatible with various plumbing materials.
  • Quick and easy to apply, reducing time spent on site.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Sharp knife or scissors, measuring tape, roller or float, primer applicator (brush or roller).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and primed properly for optimal adhesion. Overlap sheets by at least 50mm and roll firmly. For tiling, use polymer-modified adhesives.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If bubbles appear, puncture and roll them out. In cold conditions, store rolls in a warm area before use to improve flexibility.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place, upright and vertically, at room temperature.
  • Shelf Life Information: Best used within 12 months of purchase.
  • Temperature Considerations: Product is not affected by frost or cold floors, but avoid application below 5°C or above 30°C.

Certifications and Compliance

  • AS4858 Compliance: Meets the requirements of Australian Standard AS4858 for internal wet area waterproofing.
  • Warranty: Gripset offers warranty options for long-term system performance.

column32: Gripset XpressLay Waterproofing Sheet | Adheseal
column33: Gripset XpressLay is a self-adhesive PVC sheet for internal waterproofing and anti-fracture tile applications. Flexible, durable, and solvent-free.
column52:
How to apply Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet:

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure it is clean, dry, smooth, and free from contaminants. Prime the surface according to the substrate type.
  2. Measure and cut: Measure the area and cut the sheet to the required length, allowing for overlaps.
  3. Position and adhere: Peel back a small section of the release paper, position the sheet, and gradually peel the remaining paper while pressing the sheet down firmly.
  4. Roll the sheet: Use a roller or float to remove any air bubbles and ensure full contact with the substrate, especially at edges and overlaps.
  5. Overlap sheets: Ensure a minimum 50mm overlap between sheets. For waterproofing applications, coat the overlaps with a suitable Gripset liquid membrane.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet

Q: Can Gripset XpressLay be used in showers?

A: Yes, Gripset XpressLay is specifically designed for internal wet area waterproofing, including showers. It provides a reliable barrier against moisture and complies with Australian standards for these applications. Ensure proper detailing around drains and penetrations for optimal performance.

Q: Do I need to use a primer before applying Gripset XpressLay?

A: Yes, priming is essential for most surfaces. Use RLA Universal Primer for porous and non-porous surfaces (diluted or neat, respectively) or Gripset E60 for damp surfaces. Priming ensures a strong bond and long-term performance.

Q: What type of tile adhesive should I use over Gripset XpressLay?

A: Use polymer-modified cement-based tile adhesives. Refer to Gripset's C-LITE, C-MASTIC, or C-RUBBER TDS for suitable options. Contact RLA Technical for compatibility details of other adhesives.

Q: How do I handle overlaps when installing Gripset XpressLay?

A: Ensure a minimum 50mm overlap between sheets. Roll the overlaps firmly to create a good seal. For waterproofing applications, apply a suitable Gripset liquid under tile membrane over the overlaps.

Q: Can Gripset XpressLay be used on walls?

A: No, Gripset XpressLay is designed for floor/horizontal surfaces only. It is not suitable for vertical surfaces to support tiles or other finishes. Use appropriate wall waterproofing membranes for those applications.

Q: What is the service temperature range for Gripset XpressLay?

A: The service temperature range is -30°C to 80°C, making it suitable for a wide range of Australian climates. However, avoid applying the product when the surface or ambient temperature is below 5°C or above 30°C.
column54:
Gripset XpressLay limitations:

  • Not suitable for vertical surface applications
  • Not designed for outdoor use
  • Must be covered—cannot be used as a final finish
  • Not recommended for expansion joints

Safety precautions when using Gripset XpressLay:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety glasses.
  • Ventilation: Ensure good airflow in enclosed areas.
  • Handling: Use caution when cutting the sheet.

Why Use Gripset XpressLay Self Adhesive Waterproofing Sheet for:

  • Rapid installation: Self-adhesive application speeds up the waterproofing process, reducing labour costs.
  • Reliable waterproofing: Meets Australian standards for internal wet area waterproofing.
  • Versatility: Compatible with various substrates, simplifying product selection.
  • Long-term protection: Durable and flexible, preventing water damage and tile cracking.
  • Ease of use: Simplified application makes it suitable for both professionals and DIY enthusiasts.

column3:
Use Gripset C-Bed for: Flooring, screed applications, leveling surfaces, and remedial concrete repairs.

Gripset C-Bed is a professional-grade, fast-drying, shrinkage-compensated engineered screed designed for high-performance internal and external flooring applications. With superior adhesion to concrete and masonry, this pre-blended, dimensionally stable screed delivers excellent workability and long-term durability, ensuring seamless flooring solutions.

Key Features of Gripset C-Bed

  • Fast drying—light foot traffic in 8 hours
  • Excellent water resistance—reduces efflorescence risk
  • High strength at low build
  • Suitable for screed thickness from 5mm to 200mm
  • Pre-blended one-pack formula—no on-site batching required
  • Superior adhesion to prepared substrates
  • Crack-resistant and dimensionally stable
  • Can be tiled over within 24 hours
  • Australian-made quality

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Cement-based engineered screed
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C
  • Coverage: 2m² at 5mm thickness per 20kg bag
  • Setting Time: 4 hours
  • Final Strength: 30 MPa at 28 days

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing drill with paddle, trowel, screed board
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply over a wet slurry primer for optimal adhesion
  • Common Issues & Solutions: Protect from rapid drying in hot weather to prevent cracking

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a dry environment at room temperature
  • Avoid exposure to freezing temperatures
  • Shelf life: 12 months from date of production

Certifications

  • Manufactured to Australian Standards
  • Suitable for commercial and residential applications

column3:
Use Everflex Supaprime for: Priming porous and non-porous substrates, enhancing adhesion for sealants and waterproof membranes.

Everflex Supaprime is a premium, single-part polyurethane primer formulated for both porous and non-porous substrates. Its rapid-drying and moisture-curing properties make it ideal for Australian construction, ensuring strong adhesion for sealants and waterproof membranes. This primer offers exceptional penetration and durability, making it a reliable choice for various applications.

Key Features of Everflex Supaprime

  • Rapid Drying: Allows for faster overcoating and reduced project delays.
  • Low Viscosity: Ensures deep penetration into porous substrates, enhancing adhesion.
  • Moisture Curing: Cures effectively in humid environments, suitable for various Australian climates.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for concrete, masonry, timber, and more.
  • Non-Corrosive: Safe for use on a wide range of building materials.

When to Choose Everflex Supaprime versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Everflex Supaprime over standard primers when: Rapid drying and moisture curing are essential for efficient and reliable application.
  • Consider other options when: UV resistance is critical without overcoating or when working in extreme temperature conditions.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: The fast drying time and enhanced adhesion justify the cost for projects requiring high performance.

Trade-Specific Applications for Everflex Supaprime:

For Waterproofers:

  • Priming concrete and masonry before applying waterproof membranes.
  • Ensuring strong adhesion in wet areas and external applications.
  • Use in humid climates due to the moisture curing properties.

For Tilers:

  • Preparing substrates for tile adhesives, enhancing bond strength.
  • Priming plasterboard and cement sheeting in wet areas.
  • Use on various substrates to ensure proper adhesion of tiling products.

For Builders:

  • Priming timber and masonry surfaces for sealants and adhesives.
  • Preparing concrete and render surfaces for waterproofing.
  • Use for various substrates to ensure proper sealing between materials.

Technical Overview

Everflex Supaprime is a moisture-curing polyurethane primer designed to improve the bond between substrates and subsequent coatings. Its low viscosity and rapid-drying properties make it easy to apply and ensure optimal performance. This primer is essential for achieving a durable and long-lasting seal.

Chemical Properties: Single-part polyurethane primer, moisture curing, low viscosity.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C, ensuring usability in most Australian climates.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, or spray equipment, cleaning cloths, and safety gear.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. For porous substrates, a second coat may be necessary.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application in extreme temperatures or high humidity. Clean tools with xylene.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in direct sunlight or extreme temperatures.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Refer to manufacturer's documentation for relevant Australian standards.

column32: Everflex Supaprime: Moisture-Curing Polyurethane Primer | Adheseal
column33: Everflex Supaprime is a fast-drying polyurethane primer for porous and non-porous substrates. Enhances adhesion for waterproofing membranes and sealants.
column52:
How to apply Everflex Supaprime:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Apply using a brush, roller, or spray.
  3. Allow the primer to dry for approximately 1 hour before applying sealants or waterproofing membranes.
  4. If the substrate is highly porous, a second coat may be required.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex Supaprime

Q: How long does Everflex Supaprime take to dry?

A: It dries to a translucent film in approximately 1 hour at 23°C, but cure times vary with atmospheric conditions.

Q: Can Everflex Supaprime be used on wet surfaces?

A: No, surfaces must be dry and free from continual dampness before application.

Q: What is the coverage rate for Everflex Supaprime?

A: Approximately 5 to 10m² per litre, depending on substrate porosity.

Q: What surfaces is Everflex Supaprime compatible with?

A: It is compatible with concrete, masonry, timber, cement sheeting, and more.

Q: How do I clean up Everflex Supaprime?

A: While wet, use acetone. For cured product, use mechanical means or Xylene.
column54:
Everflex Supaprime limitations:

  • Not designed for long-term UV exposure – must be overcoated
  • Do not apply in temperatures below 10°C or above 35°C
  • Not suitable for damp or wet substrates
  • Not recommended for areas with hydrostatic pressure

Safety precautions when using Everflex Supaprime:

column33: Sanitary S100 is a neutral curing anti-fungal silicone sealant suitable for bathrooms, laundries, kitchens, and food preparation areas. With excellent adhesion and UV stability, it is ideal for both indoor and outdoor applications. Learn more about its physical properties and application instructions.
column52:
Application Guide

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust or grease. Use MEK, alcohol, or ethanol to degrease if necessary.
  2. Priming (Optional): Primer is generally not required, but adhesion testing is recommended. If needed, use an appropriate primer.
  3. Backer Rod (Optional): Use Adhefoam open-cell or closed-cell backer rod where required. For joints without backer rod, use bond breaker tape to prevent three-sided adhesion.
  4. Application: Fill the joint completely, avoiding air entrapment. Dry tool immediately before the sealant skins (within 10 minutes, depending on conditions).
  5. Cleaning: Clean uncured material with white spirit or solvent. Clean tools with white spirit or solvent. Clean surfaces with silicone cleaner. Cured material can only be removed mechanically.
column54:
Limitations

  • Adhesion testing is highly recommended for optimal performance.

Q: Are these refills suitable for outdoor work?

column3:
Use Mapei Keracolor FF for: Grouting ceramic, stone, and mosaic tiles in wet and dry areas, including pools and high-traffic floors, with resistance to mould and water.

Mapei Keracolor FF is a high-performance, polymer-modified grout that combines advanced technologies for superior results. It features DropEffect® for water repellency and BioBlock® for mould resistance, ensuring durability and easy cleaning. Suitable for joints up to 6mm, this grout is perfect for a wide range of tiling projects, providing a smooth, durable, and aesthetically pleasing finish.

Key Features of Mapei Keracolor FF

  • Water-Repellent and Mould Resistant: DropEffect® and BioBlock® technologies provide excellent water repellency and resist mould and mildew growth, making it ideal for wet areas.
  • High Abrasion Resistance: Ensures long-lasting durability, even in high-traffic areas, maintaining the integrity and appearance of the grout.
  • Smooth Finish and Easy Cleaning: Low water absorption and a smooth final surface make it easy to clean and maintain, keeping tiled areas looking pristine.
  • Excellent Workability: Easy to mix and apply, providing a consistent and smooth finish with minimal effort.
  • Wide Range of Colours: Available in 15 colours, allowing for perfect matching with any tile design and aesthetic preference.

Technical Overview

Mapei Keracolor FF is formulated with a blend of cement, very fine-graded aggregates, special polymers, additives, and pigments. The inclusion of hydrophobic additives and BioBlock® technology ensures a high-performance grout that is both durable and easy to maintain. It provides excellent compressive and flexural strength, as well as resistance to freeze/thaw cycles.

Chemical Properties: Cementitious grout with polymer modifiers, hydrophobic additives (DropEffect®), and mould-resistant technology (BioBlock®).

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C (41°F to 95°F). Apply within this range to ensure proper setting and performance, avoiding extreme temperatures that can affect curing.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Low-speed mixer, MAPEI trowel or rubber float, hard cellulose sponge (e.g., MAPEI sponge), Scotch-Brite® pad or disc-type power float.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure joints are clean and raked back to 2/3 of the tile thickness. Use the correct water ratio for mixing and avoid adding water to a setting mix. For smooth surfaces, use a damp Scotch-Brite® pad for finishing.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Efflorescence can occur due to excess water; ensure correct water ratio and allow substrates to dry thoroughly. Colour variations can result from different water ratios; maintain consistent mixing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry place in original packaging.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in 20 kg bags, 24 months in 2 kg and 5 kg Alupaks.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures or damp conditions to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Classified as CG2WA according to EN 13888 and ISO 13007-3.
  • EMICODE: EC1 Plus - very low emission.
column7: bag,cementitous,ceramics,chemical resistant,construction,durable,external,flexible,flooring-i,glass,grout,high strength,industrial,internal,low temperature,manufacturing,polymer modified,porcelain,premium,retaining walls,sanitary,stone,swimming pool,tile-s,tiling,tiling-i,water resistant,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i,wet areas
column32: Mapei Keracolor FF | Polymer-Modified Grout | Adheseal
column33: Mapei Keracolor FF: High-performance, water-repellent grout with mould resistance. Ideal for joints up to 6mm. CG2WA classification, various colours.
column52:
How to apply Mapei Keracolor FF:

  1. Prepare Joints: Ensure joints are clean, free of dust, and raked back to 2/3 of the tile thickness.
  2. Prepare the Mix: Mix Keracolor FF with 26-28% water by weight using a low-speed mixer.
  3. Apply the Grout: Fill joints completely using a MAPEI trowel or rubber float, ensuring full compaction.
  4. Remove Excess Grout: While fresh, remove excess grout with a float diagonally across joints.
  5. Finish: After 10-20 minutes, clean with a damp sponge, working diagonally to the joints.
  6. Final Cleaning: Remove residual haze with a dry cloth; use an acid cleaner (e.g., Keranet) after 10 days if necessary.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Mapei Keracolor FF

Q: Can Mapei Keracolor FF be used in swimming pools?

A: Yes, Keracolor FF is suitable for swimming pools. However, for pools using saline electrolysis, Ultracolor Plus or Kerapoxy is recommended.

Q: How long should I wait before cleaning the grout?

A: Wait 10-20 minutes after application, when the grout loses plasticity and becomes matt, before cleaning with a damp sponge.

Q: What is the recommended water ratio for mixing Keracolor FF?

A: Mix 100 parts of Keracolor FF with 26-28 parts of water by weight, depending on the colour. For floors, you can add slightly more water (27-30%).

Q: Can I use Keracolor FF in expansion joints?

A: No, expansion and movement joints should be filled with appropriate flexible MAPEI sealants, not Keracolor FF.

Q: How do I remove efflorescence from the grout surface?

A: Efflorescence can be caused by excess water or residual moisture. Ensure proper mixing and allow substrates to dry thoroughly. For existing efflorescence, clean with an acid cleaner like Keranet, following the instructions.

Q: What types of tiles are compatible with Keracolor FF?

A: Keracolor FF is compatible with a wide range of tiles, including ceramic, porcelain, natural stone, marble, granite, agglomerates, glass, and marble mosaics.

Q: How long before the grouted area can be used?

A: Floors are set to light foot traffic after 24 hours and ready for full traffic after 7 days. Swimming pools can be filled 7 days after grouting.
column54:
Mapei Keracolor FF limitations:

  • Do not mix with cement or other products.
  • Do not add water to a setting mix.
  • Do not blend different grout colours.
  • Do not use salty or dirty water.
  • Use within +5°C to +35°C temperature range.
  • Do not sprinkle dry grout powder onto filled joints.
  • Do not fill expansion joints with Keracolor FF.
  • Not for use in swimming pools disinfected with saline electrolysis (use Ultracolor Plus or Kerapoxy).

Safety precautions when using Mapei Keracolor FF:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear protective gloves and goggles.
  • Handling: Take usual precautions for handling chemicals.
  • Eye Contact: If contact occurs, wash immediately with plenty of clean water and seek medical attention.
  • Skin Contact: If contact occurs, wash immediately with plenty of clean water.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
column55: Mapei Keracolor FF is a polymer-modified, cementitious grout with DropEffect® and BioBlock® technology, designed for joints up to 6mm. It offers water repellency, mould resistance, and high abrasion resistance, making it ideal for both interior and exterior applications, including swimming pools and smooth surfaces.

Why Use Mapei Keracolor FF:

column3:
Use Silcor Primer BS 117 for: Priming concrete, masonry, and metal surfaces before applying Silcor polyurea and polyurethane waterproofing membranes and protective coatings.

Silcor Primer BS 117 is a one-part, fast-curing, solvent-based primer specifically designed to enhance the adhesion of Silcor polyurea and polyurethane membranes and coatings to various substrates, including concrete, masonry, and metal. Its high penetration and low viscosity ensure a strong bond and effective sealing of surface porosity, reducing the risk of outgassing and pinholes. Silcor Primer BS 117 is ideal for use in exposed, non-exposed, and permanent immersion areas, making it a versatile solution for a wide range of waterproofing applications.

Key Features

  • Fast curing and recoat time
  • Low viscosity and high penetration
  • Promotes high adhesion between substrate and membrane
  • Water resistant
  • Reduces concrete/masonry outgassing
  • Simple application by brush, roller, or spray
  • Suitable for various substrates

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurea-modified penetrating primer
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 40°C (50°F to 104°F)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, or airless sprayer
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of contaminants. Apply evenly at the recommended rate. For porous surfaces, apply multiple coats as needed. Allow the primer to cure tack-free before applying the membrane. Use appropriate safety measures when handling solvent-based products.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying to damp or green concrete. If outgassing occurs, allow the primer to cure and re-prime if necessary. Ensure proper ventilation during application and curing. If unsure about substrate compatibility, contact GCP technical support.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store undercover in dry conditions between 15°C and 25°C (59°F and 77°F), out of direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months unopened from the date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures and direct sunlight

Related Products

  • Silcor polyurea and hybrid polyurea coatings
  • Silcor polyurethane membranes
  • Silcor LM PU Sealant

column2: Megapoxy HICB High Impact Crusher Backing Epoxy (2 Part Kit)
column3:
Use Megapoxy HICB for: Crusher backing, machinery grouting, and high-impact industrial applications.

Megapoxy High Impact Crusher Backing (HICB) is a two-component, 100% solids epoxy grout designed for demanding industrial applications. Its exceptional compressive strength and nil VOC formulation make it ideal for crusher backing, machinery grouting, and other high-stress environments. With both standard and accelerated cure options, Megapoxy HICB provides flexibility and efficiency for various project timelines.

Key Features of Megapoxy HICB

  • High Compressive Strength (115 MPa): Provides exceptional load-bearing capacity, ensuring long-term durability in heavy machinery applications. Example: Backing of cone crushers.
  • Nil VOC Content: Enhances safety and reduces environmental impact, suitable for indoor and confined spaces. Example: Grouting machinery in enclosed industrial settings.
  • Accelerated Cure Option: Minimizes downtime with rapid cure times, allowing for quick return to service. Example: Urgent repairs in mining operations.
  • Excellent Bond Strength: Ensures strong adhesion to steel and concrete, providing reliable performance in demanding environments. Example: Setting anchor bolts in concrete foundations.

Why Choose Megapoxy HICB:

  • Durability: High strength and modulus of elasticity ensure long-lasting performance. Example: Extending the lifespan of grinding mills.
  • Efficiency: Rapid cure options reduce downtime and increase productivity. Example: Quick repairs during critical production cycles.
  • Safety: Nil VOC formulation enhances workplace safety and environmental compliance. Example: Grouting in areas with strict air quality standards.
  • Versatility: Suitable for a wide range of industrial applications, from crusher backing to machinery grouting. Example: Chocking of machinery and rail track grouting.

When to Choose Megapoxy HICB versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megapoxy HICB over standard concrete grouts when: High compressive strength and chemical resistance is required, such as in heavy machinery installations. Concrete is not as strong, and can be effected by chemicals.
  • Consider other options when: Very thin applications are needed, or when a very fast cure time is not required, as standard concrete grouts are cheaper in those applications.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Although initial cost may be higher than standard grouts, the longevity, strength, and quick return to service of Megapoxy HICB offer greater long term value.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy HICB:

For Mining and Quarry Industries:

  • Backing of cone and gyratory crushers, using a pourable application to fill gaps and reinforce liner plates.
  • Compatible with steel and concrete, ensuring strong, durable bonds in heavy machinery.
  • High compressive strength and impact resistance provide reliable performance in harsh environments.

For Industrial Maintenance:

  • Grouting of machinery and setting anchor bolts, ensuring precise and stable installations.
  • Compatible with a variety of substrates, offering versatile application options.
  • Rapid cure options minimize downtime, allowing for quick return to service.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy HICB is a two-component epoxy grout designed for high-impact applications. It offers exceptional compressive strength and bond strength, making it ideal for backing and reinforcing heavy machinery. The product's nil VOC formulation enhances safety and environmental compliance. The accelerated version allows for rapid cure times, minimizing downtime.

Chemical Properties: A two-component epoxy system, providing a 100% solids, high-strength grout. The nil VOC formulation ensures safety and environmental compliance.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature of 10°C (50°F). Ensure that the ambient temperature is within this range for proper curing and application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Low-speed electric mixer, mixing buckets, putty (e.g., Megapoxy PF Rapid set putty), grit blasting equipment (if required), industrial degreaser.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For crusher backing, ensure all crevices are sealed with putty to prevent leakage. For anchor bolt setting, ensure proper alignment and surface preparation.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inconsistent mixing can lead to poor curing; ensure thorough mixing for at least 3 minutes. High ambient temperatures can shorten work time; store kits in a cool place.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information.
  • Temperature Considerations: High temperatures can shorten shelf life and work time; maintain storage temperatures within recommended ranges.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Complies with relevant Australian standards for industrial grouting and safety.
  • Nil VOC formulation meets environmental regulations.
  • ASTM standards for compressive strength, bond strength, and other properties are adhered to.

column33: Megapoxy HICB is a heavy-duty, 100% solids epoxy grout for crusher backing and industrial grouting. High impact & compressive strength. VOC-free. Shop now!
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy HICB:

  1. Prepare the surface: Grit blast or mechanically abrade metal surfaces and degrease. Ensure concrete surfaces are clean and free of contaminants.
  2. Seal crevices: Use Megapoxy PF Rapid set putty to seal any crevices to prevent leakage.
  3. Mix the components: Stir Part A thoroughly to ensure uniformity. Add Part B slowly while mixing with a low-speed electric mixer for at least 3 minutes.
  4. Apply the grout: Pour the mixed Megapoxy HICB into the prepared area, ensuring even distribution.
  5. Allow to cure: Allow the grout to cure for the specified time based on temperature and product version.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy HICB

Q: How do I prepare metal surfaces for Megapoxy HICB application?

A: For optimal adhesion, grit blast metal surfaces to AS CK 9.4 - 1964 Class 3 finish. If grit blasting isn't possible, mechanically abrade the surface to clean, bright metal, and then degrease it using an industrial degreaser.

Q: What is the maximum casting thickness for Megapoxy HICB?

A: The maximum casting thickness is 50 mm. Exceeding this thickness may result in improper curing and reduced performance.

Q: How much working time does the accelerated version of Megapoxy HICB provide?

A: The accelerated version provides a working time of approximately 10 minutes at 25°C. This allows for faster application and reduces downtime.

Q: Can Megapoxy HICB be used in confined spaces?

A: Yes, Megapoxy HICB is ideal for confined spaces due to its nil VOC formulation, which enhances safety and reduces environmental impact.

Q: What is the cure time at 35°C for the standard Megapoxy HICB?

A: At 35°C, the minimum cure time for the standard Megapoxy HICB is 12 hours. The accelerated version will cure in 3 hours at this temperature.

Q: What cleaning products should be used to clean tools after using Megapoxy HICB?

A: Use Megapoxy Thinners to clean mixing implements and working tools. Disposable rubber gloves are recommended for hand protection.
column54:
Megapoxy HICB limitations:

  • Maximum casting thickness: Do not exceed 50 mm in a single pour to ensure proper curing.
  • Temperature sensitivity: Ensure application and curing temperatures are within the recommended range.
  • Specific surface preparation: Proper surface preparation is crucial for optimal adhesion.

Safety precautions when using Megapoxy HICB:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and respiratory protection in enclosed spaces.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact and inhalation of fumes.
  • First Aid: In case of skin contact, wash with soap and water. If inhaled, move to fresh air. Seek medical attention if irritation persists.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste according to local regulations.

Use BAT Trims Tile Crosses for: Ensuring even grout lines, maintaining consistent tile spacing, professional tile installations.

BAT Trims Tile Crosses are essential for achieving a professional and flawless tile installation. Designed for precision and durability, these tile spacers ensure consistent grout lines and even spacing, enhancing the overall aesthetic of your tiling project. Whether you're working on a bathroom, kitchen, or any tiled surface, BAT Trims Tile Crosses provide the reliability and accuracy you need. Built for the Australian trade professional, these tile crosses are a key component in any tiling toolkit.

Key Features of BAT Trims Tile Crosses

  • Precision Spacing: Ensures consistent grout lines for a professional finish.
  • Durable Construction: Made from high-quality materials for long-lasting use.
  • Various Sizes Available: Accommodates different tile sizes and grout line widths.
  • Easy to Use: Simple design allows for quick and efficient installation.

Why Choose BAT Trims Tile Crosses:

  • Improved Accuracy: Minimises errors and ensures a uniform tile layout.
  • Enhanced Efficiency: Speeds up the tiling process with consistent spacing.
  • Professional Finish: Achieves a high-quality result that meets trade standards.
  • Reduced Waste: Prevents tile damage and material waste from uneven spacing.

Trade-Specific Applications for BAT Trims Tile Crosses:

For Tilers and Builders:

  • Ensuring consistent grout lines in bathroom and kitchen tile installations.
  • Maintaining even spacing for large-format tiles in commercial projects.

For Renovators:

  • Achieving a professional finish in DIY tiling projects.
  • Ensuring accurate spacing for intricate tile patterns.

Application Information

  • Application: Place BAT Trims Tile Crosses between tiles at each corner to maintain consistent spacing. Remove after the adhesive has set.
  • Expert Tips: Choose the correct size of tile cross for your tile and grout line requirements. Ensure tiles are level and aligned before the adhesive sets.

Storage

  • Storage Recommendations: Store in a clean, dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures.

Compatibility

  • Compatible with various tile types, including ceramic, porcelain, and natural stone.
  • Available in different sizes to accommodate various tile thicknesses and grout line widths.

Use Polymastic Pre-Mixed Tile Adhesive for: Internal wall tiling with ceramic, mosaic, and large-format tiles.

Polymastic is a premium, pre-mixed tile adhesive designed for professional wall tiling applications. This white, acrylic-based formula offers exceptional workability and a non-slump consistency, making it ideal for large-format tiles. Polymastic provides a strong, flexible bond on various substrates, including concrete, render, and plasterboard. Its ease of application and excellent adhesion make it a reliable choice for achieving a high-quality tile installation.

Key Features

  • Pre-mixed for convenient application
  • White acrylic-based formula
  • Non-slump properties for large-format tiles
  • Flexible and durable bond
  • D1TE classification

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Acrylic-based adhesive
  • Appearance: White paste
  • Application Temperature: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Notched trowel, bucket, sponge, grout float.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and primed before application. Back-butter large format tiles for optimal adhesion. Adjust drying times based on temperature and humidity. Use appropriate notch size for tile dimensions.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Skinning of adhesive can occur if applied in large areas; apply in 1m² sections. For porous surfaces, use RLA Porous Primer.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry area.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original unopened packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep away from cold floors and direct sunlight.

Certifications

  • D1TE classification
  • Complies with AS 3958: 2023 – Installation of Ceramic and Stone Tiles

Related Products

  • RLA Porous Primer
  • RLA Luminous Grout
  • RLA Wet Area Membranes

column2: Gripset BRW PFN Fibre Reinforced Butyl Rubber Waterproofing
column3:
Use Gripset BRW PFN for: Internal and external waterproofing applications, including bathrooms, balconies, and cracked substrates.

Gripset BRW PFN is a high-performance, self-adhesive butyl rubber sheet membrane designed for internal and external waterproofing applications. This premium membrane offers outstanding adhesion, flexibility, and vibration resistance, making it ideal for wet areas, balconies, decks, and over cracked floor substrates. It provides superior waterproofing and anti-fracture properties while supporting direct application of tile adhesives and screeds.

Key Features of Gripset BRW PFN

  • Self-adhesive for easy installation
  • Excellent adhesion to multiple surfaces
  • Performs in extreme temperatures (-30°C to 80°C)
  • High flexibility and vibration resistance
  • Anti-fracture properties prevent substrate cracking
  • Primer-less application on metals, plastics, and glazed surfaces
  • Cold-lay installation—no torching or heat welding
  • Outstanding waterproof and vapour-resistant properties
  • Solvent-free and non-toxic formulation
  • Compatible with cement-based tile adhesives and screeds
  • Compliant with AS 4858 and AS 4654.1 standards

Technical Overview

  • Material: Butyl rubber sheet with fabric lamination
  • Application Temperature: 5°C to 30°C
  • Service Temperature: -30°C to 80°C
  • Thickness: 1mm
  • Tensile Strength: >2MPa (AS 4654.1)
  • Elongation: >60% (AS1145.3)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Scissors, sharp knife, roller
  • Trade Tips: Ensure correct overlap alignment for optimal waterproofing
  • Common Issues: Avoid air pockets during installation using a heavy roller

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a dry environment at room temperature
  • Upright storage recommended
  • Shelf life: 12 months from purchase

Certifications

  • Complies with AS 4858 (Internal Wet Areas Waterproofing)
  • Complies with AS 4654.1 (External Waterproofing)

column2: RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane
column3:
Use RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane for: Waterproofing retaining walls, planter boxes, and under screeds where solvent-free and efficient single-coat solutions are required.

RLA SAFE2O is a single-component, liquid-applied waterproofing membrane that cures via atmospheric moisture and is based on Silyl Modified Polymer (SMP) technology. Designed as a safe alternative to traditional solvent-based membranes, SAFE2O is Green Tag certified and completely free from isocyanates. It provides excellent mechanical durability and adhesion across a wide range of substrates including concrete, render, screed, masonry, and fibre cement. Ideal for internal and external above-ground waterproofing applications, it complies with AS 4858 and AS 4654.1 standards, rated as a Class III membrane. Its ability to be applied in a single coat on horizontal surfaces makes it a cost-effective and time-saving solution for professional trades.

Key Features of RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane

  • Solvent-free and isocyanate-free for safe use in enclosed areas
  • Single-coat application on horizontal surfaces reduces labour time
  • Built-in root inhibitor suitable for subterranean applications
  • High flexibility and toughness for durable performance
  • Green Tag certified and compliant with Australian Standards

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Silyl Modified Polymer (SMP)
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F)
  • Tensile Strength: >1 MPa
  • Elongation: >300%
  • Water Vapour Transmission: 0.38g/24h/m²
  • Dry Time: 4 hours at 23°C / 50% RH
  • Coverage Rate: 1.4 kg/m² for single coat

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush or medium nap roller, wet film thickness gauge
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply in single coat for horizontal surfaces to 1.2mm wet film; use two 0.6mm coats on verticals
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For cracks over 1mm, use RLA MAX SMP 25 to fill prior to membrane application

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry, and weatherproof environment
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in sealed pail
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid application below 10°C or above 35°C

Certifications

  • Global Green Tag Certification – Level A
  • Complies with AS 4858 and AS 4654.1 Class III for wet area membranes
column7: AS4654.1,AS4858,civil construction-i,concrete,durable,external,fibre cement sheet,flexible,internal,masonry,membrane,pail,planter,render,retaining walls,screed,silyl modified polymer,solvent free,special order,structural bonding,tiling,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i,wet areas
column32: RLA Safe2O Waterproofing Membrane | Adheseal
column33: Non-hazardous, single-component waterproofing membrane with strong adhesion and Green Tag certification.
column52:
How to apply RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane:

  1. Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants like oil, laitance, or curing agents.
  2. Prime the surface using appropriate RLA primers based on porosity (Porous, Non-Porous, or Damp conditions).
  3. Apply a bond breaker fillet using RLA MAX SMP 25 at all junctions, penetrations, and transitions.
  4. For horizontal areas, apply 1 coat at 1.2mm wet film thickness using brush or roller.
  5. For vertical surfaces, apply 2 coats at 0.6mm each, allowing the first to dry before recoating.
  6. Allow a minimum 48 hours before screeding or 72 hours before backfilling.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane

Q: How should RLA SAFE2O be applied for best waterproofing results?

A: On horizontal surfaces, apply a single even coat at a wet film thickness of 1.2mm. For vertical applications, apply two coats at 0.6mm each. Always use a wet film gauge to verify correct thickness.

Q: How does RLA SAFE2O perform in terms of durability and water resistance?

A: RLA SAFE2O has outstanding durability with >300% elongation and a tensile strength of >1 MPa. It meets Class III waterproofing requirements under AS 4858 and AS 4654.1 for internal and external applications.

Q: What substrates are compatible with RLA SAFE2O?

A: SAFE2O adheres well to concrete, screed, render, masonry, compressed/fibre cement sheets, and PAA structural/marine plywood. Metal or non-porous surfaces should be tested prior to application.

Q: What should I do if the membrane doesn’t adhere properly?

A: Ensure the surface is properly cleaned, cured, and primed. For cracks over 1mm, use RLA MAX SMP 25 to fill and prepare the substrate. Always test adhesion on smooth or non-porous surfaces.

Q: Is RLA SAFE2O safe to use indoors or in enclosed areas?

A: Yes. RLA SAFE2O is solvent and isocyanate-free, making it safe for indoor and confined applications. However, ensure adequate ventilation during application and curing.
column54:
RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane limitations:

  • Do not apply if rain is imminent or during wet weather
  • Not suitable as a UV-exposed or trafficable membrane
  • Cannot be used under tiles without screed installation
  • Not suitable for immersed applications like pools
  • Do not apply below 10°C or above 35°C
  • Should not be applied directly to particle board floors

Safety precautions when using RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves, protective clothing, and safety glasses
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow, especially in confined or enclosed spaces
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact; clean up spills immediately with suitable cleaner
  • Follow the latest SDS for safe disposal and first aid advice
column55: RLA SAFE2O offers single-coat waterproofing, excellent adhesion, and is Green Tag certified for safe internal and external use.
column56:
RLA SAFE2O Moisture Curing Waterproofing Membrane can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete – fully cured (min. 28 days) with sound surface
  • Render and screeds – cured for a minimum of 7 days

column3:
Use Sika® Primer-3 N for: Enhancing adhesion of sealants and adhesives on concrete, masonry, and metal surfaces.

Sika® Primer-3 N is an essential component for applicators seeking to achieve optimal adhesion with Sika sealants and adhesives. Its solvent-based formulation penetrates porous surfaces and prepares metals, ensuring a strong and durable bond. With its easy application and quick flash-off time, Sika® Primer-3 N streamlines the application process, saving time and enhancing the quality of the finished product.

Key Features of Sika® Primer-3 N

  • Enhances Adhesion: Ensures a strong bond between sealants/adhesives and porous/metal substrates.
  • Water Repellent: Provides added protection against moisture.
  • Short Flash-Off Time: Speeds up the application process.
  • Easy Application: Can be applied with a brush or roller.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for concrete, masonry, and various metals.

Technical Overview

Sika® Primer-3 N is a solvent-based epoxy resin compound with a density of approximately 1.00 kg/l and a viscosity of 10 mPas. Its composition is designed to penetrate and prepare surfaces, ensuring optimal adhesion for subsequent sealant or adhesive applications.

Chemical Properties: Solvent-based epoxy resin compound.

Application Temperature Range: +5 °C to +40 °C (41 °F to 104 °F), with a minimum 3 °C above dew point.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Clean brush or roller.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are thoroughly clean and dry. Apply only a thin, even coat. Reseal the container immediately after use.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Discard any primer that has gelled or separated. Ensure proper ventilation due to solvent content.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, between +5 °C and +25 °C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months from the date of production in original, sealed packaging. Must be used within one month of opening.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • ISO 2811-1: Density measurement.
  • ISO 3219: Viscosity measurement.
