  2. Apply Sika® Primer-3 N with a clean brush or roller.

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Sika® Primer-3 N

Q: How long does Sika® Primer-3 N take to dry?

A: It requires a minimum flash-off time of 30 minutes and a maximum of 8 hours before applying sealant or adhesive.

Q: Can Sika® Primer-3 N be used on all types of metal?

A: It is suitable for various metals, but always ensure the metal is clean and free from contaminants. For specific metal types, consult the Sika pre-treatment chart.

Q: What surfaces is Sika® Primer-3 N compatible with?

A: It is designed for porous substrates like concrete, masonry, and metals.

Q: How should Sika® Primer-3 N be stored?

A: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, between +5 °C and +25 °C. Use within one month of opening.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Sika® Primer-3 N?

A: Ensure adequate ventilation, wear appropriate PPE, and avoid skin and eye contact. Clean tools with appropriate solvent immediately after use.
column54:
Sika® Primer-3 N limitations:

  • Limited shelf life after opening.
  • Must be used within one month of opening.
  • Discard gelled or separated primer.
  • Primers are not a substitute for proper surface cleaning.

Safety precautions when using Sika® Primer-3 N:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and appropriate respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Disposal: Dispose of according to local regulations for solvent-based products.

column52:
Application Guide

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of dust and grease. Degrease with MEK, Alcohol or ethanol if necessary.
  2. Where required, use Adhefoam open cell backer rod. Closed cell backer rod can also be used, but avoid damaging the outer skin to prevent gassing.
  3. For joints too shallow for backer rod, use a bond breaker tape to prevent three-sided adhesion.
  4. Fill the joint completely with sealant, avoiding air entrapment.
  5. Dry tool the sealant immediately before it skins over, typically within 10 minutes depending on temperature and humidity.
column54:
Limitations

  • Do not use in closed rooms without adequate ventilation.
  • Do not expose to thermal, mechanical, or chemical influences before complete curing.
  • Not suitable for use on polyacrylate or polycarbonate without consulting the technical department.
  • Cannot be painted over.

SA Sanitary Silicone Sealant is a high-performance, neutral cure, anti-fungal silicone sealant designed for wet areas such as kitchens, vanities, bathrooms, and shower screens. Its mildew-resistant formula withstands prolonged exposure to heat and humidity, ensuring a long-lasting seal. This non-slump, flexible sealant offers excellent adhesion to glass, ceramics, masonry, metal, and most plastics, making it ideal for trade professionals requiring a reliable solution for sanitary and weatherproofing applications.

Key Features

  • Neutral cure oxime formulation
  • Anti-fungal properties to prevent mould growth
  • Non-slump for easy vertical and horizontal applications
  • Outstanding UV and weather resistance

Technical Overview

  • Neutral cure (Oxime-based)
  • Operating temperature range: -62°C to 180°C

column3:
Use FulasealPRO 840NS for: Sealing joints in cool rooms, refrigeration units, and insulation panels where moisture resistance and a non-skinning sealant are required.

FulasealPRO 840NS is a premium butyl-based sealant designed for professional use in cool room and refrigeration applications. Its non-sagging and non-skinning properties make it ideal for concealed lap joints and areas requiring a durable, permanently plastic seal. Offering excellent adhesion to various substrates, including metals, sandwich panels, and plastics, this sealant provides reliable moisture resistance and long-lasting performance in controlled environments.

Key Features of FulasealPRO 840NS

  • Excellent Low Temperature Properties: Maintains flexibility and performance in cold environments, crucial for refrigeration applications.
  • Non-Skinning: Ensures a permanently plastic seal, ideal for concealed joints where a surface skin is undesirable.
  • Mould and Mildew Resistant: Provides a hygienic seal, essential in environments where mould growth is a concern.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to various substrates, including steel, aluminium, and sandwich panels, ensuring a durable seal.
  • Non-Corrosive: Safe for use on metal surfaces without causing corrosion over time.
  • Gunnable and Non-Sagging: Easy application with a standard caulking gun, ensuring precise placement without sagging.

Technical Overview

FulasealPRO 840NS is formulated to provide a reliable seal in environments where moisture and temperature control are critical. Its butyl-based composition ensures a permanently plastic seal that resists moisture and remains flexible at low temperatures. This product's non-skinning property is particularly beneficial in concealed joints, preventing surface hardening and maintaining a consistent seal.

Chemical Properties: Butyl-based sealant with excellent moisture resistance and non-skinning characteristics, ensuring a permanently plastic seal.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C (41°F to 95°F). Apply within this range for optimal adhesion and sealant performance. Ensure surfaces are within this temperature range for best results.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Standard caulking gun, isopropyl alcohol (IPA), lint-free cloths, wax and grease remover (for heavy contamination).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For metal substrates, lightly abrade the surface before cleaning with IPA to enhance adhesion. Always use the 2-rag wipe method for surface preparation to ensure thorough cleaning.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure surfaces are completely clean and dry to prevent adhesion failures. For heavily contaminated surfaces, use a wax and grease remover before IPA cleaning.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry area between +5°C and +25°C (41°F and 77°F), away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Indefinite shelf life when stored correctly in unopened packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product consistency and performance.

Certifications

  • Complies with industry standards for cool room and refrigeration sealant applications.

column33: FulasealPRO 840NS: Butyl-based, non-sagging sealant for cool room and refrigeration applications. Excellent moisture resistance and durability.
column52:
How to apply FulasealPRO 840NS:

  1. Cut the seal at the top of the cartridge.
  2. Screw on the nozzle and cut it to the desired bead size.
  3. Hold the gun at a 45° angle and apply the sealant to one surface.
  4. Combine the surfaces to seal.
  5. Clean up excess sealant with mineral spirits.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About FulasealPRO 840NS

Q: Can FulasealPRO 840NS be used in external applications?

A: No, FulasealPRO 840NS is not suitable for applications exposed to weathering and dirt pick-up. Use HB Fuller 770 Sanitary Silicone for external applications.

Q: What surfaces can this sealant adhere to?

A: FulasealPRO 840NS adheres to steel, stainless steel, aluminium, sandwich panels, polystyrene, and most plastics. Pre-testing is recommended for specific plastics.

Q: How do I prepare surfaces for application?

A: Surfaces must be clean, dry, and free of contaminants. Use isopropyl alcohol (IPA) for light contamination and a wax and grease remover for heavy contamination, followed by a final IPA wipe.

Q: Is FulasealPRO 840NS suitable for applications with movement?

A: No, this is a non-elastomeric sealant and is not suitable for applications where joint movement is expected or where there is dynamic stress.

Q: What is the shelf life of this sealant?

A: FulasealPRO 840NS has an indefinite shelf life if stored correctly between +5°C and +25°C in unopened packaging, away from direct sunlight.
column54:
FulasealPRO 840NS limitations:

  • Not suitable for applications with joint movement or dynamic stress.
  • Not suitable for external applications exposed to weathering and dirt pick-up.
  • Not suitable for applications involving vibration, such as truck bodies or caravans.
  • Not paintable.

Safety precautions when using FulasealPRO 840NS:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection to avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Store in a dry place below 25°C and keep out of reach of children.

column2: Armadillo D: Concrete Dustproofing & Hardening Densifier
column3:
Use ARMADILLO D (DUSTPROOF) for: dustproofing concrete floors, repairing rain-damaged surfaces, and increasing concrete hardness in warehouses, garages, and commercial spaces.

ARMADILLO D is a proprietary blend of silica polymers designed to penetrate concrete surfaces, enhancing abrasion resistance and reducing liquid absorption. By reacting with calcium hydroxide in the concrete, it forms calcium silicate hydrate (CSH), significantly strengthening the surface. This water-based solution dries tack-free in 2 to 4 hours, providing a harder, denser, and more durable concrete floor. Ideal for both interior and exterior applications, ARMADILLO D offers long-lasting protection and dustproofing for various concrete surfaces.

Key Features of ARMADILLO D (DUSTPROOF)

  • Dustproofs and increases the hardness of concrete surfaces.
  • Reduces porosity and enhances resistance to oils and chemicals.
  • Complies with GREEN STAR-OFFICE DESIGN V3 IEQ-13 standards.
  • Suitable for new and existing concrete, offering versatile application.
  • Minimizes tire marks and simplifies cleaning.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Proprietary blend of silica polymers
  • Drying Time: Light foot traffic: 4-6 hours, Wheel traffic: 24 hours (at 21°C and 50% RH)
  • Coverage: 4-5 m²/litre on steel trowelled surfaces
  • Shelf Life: 2 years in original, unopened package

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Low-pressure sprayer, soft-bristled broom, squeegee, mechanical scrubbers (for large areas).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure complete removal of any curing compounds before applying ARMADILLO D. Keep the surface wet for 30 minutes and thoroughly flush to remove residues. For new concrete, apply as soon as the surface is firm enough to walk on.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Excess residue can be removed with a grinder. Protect surrounding surfaces from overspray. Ensure proper drying time before exposing the surface to traffic.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep containers cool and closed, protect from freezing.
  • Shelf Life Information: 2 years in original, unopened package.
  • Temperature Considerations: Thaw and agitate if frozen.

Certifications

  • Complies with GREEN STAR-OFFICE DESIGN V3 IEQ-13
column7: bottle,civil construction-i,concrete-s,construction,drum,durable,external,flooring-i,industrial,internal,liquid applied,masonry,preparation & remedial,solvent free,tiling-i,water based
column32: Armadillo D Dustproof Concrete Hardener | Adheseal
column33: Armadillo D dustproofs and hardens concrete, enhancing abrasion resistance and reducing liquid absorption. Ideal for warehouses and garages.
column52:
How to apply ARMADILLO D (DUSTPROOF):

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure the concrete is clean and free of contaminants.
  2. Apply ARMADILLO D: Use a low-pressure sprayer or broom to apply evenly.
  3. Keep surface wet: Maintain a wet surface for 30 minutes, working the product into the concrete.
  4. Remove excess: Squeegee or vacuum excess material.
  5. Clean up: Wash tools with water immediately after use.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About ARMADILLO D (DUSTPROOF)

Q: How long does ARMADILLO D take to dry?

A: ARMADILLO D generally dries tack-free in 2 to 4 hours at 21°C and 50% relative humidity. Light foot traffic is acceptable after 4-6 hours, while wheel traffic should wait 24 hours.

Q: Can ARMADILLO D be used on both new and existing concrete?

A: Yes, ARMADILLO D is suitable for both new and existing concrete. For new concrete, it can be used with traditional curing methods or as a curing and densifying compound at the time of pour.

Q: How do I prepare existing concrete for ARMADILLO D application?

A: The concrete surface must be clean, dry, and free of contaminants or coatings. For best results, use mechanical scrubbers to apply and scrub the product into the surface.

Q: What is the coverage rate for ARMADILLO D?

A: One litre of ARMADILLO D will cover 4-5 m² of steel trowelled surface, depending on the porosity of the surface. Coverage may be greater on metallic or mineral aggregate hardened surfaces.

Q: How do I clean up after applying ARMADILLO D?

A: Clean brooms, tools, and sprayers with potable water immediately after use. The residue from application and cleanup is non-toxic.
column54:
ARMADILLO D (DUSTPROOF) limitations:

  • Does not meet AS 3799 curing compound requirements.
  • Not a protection against rising damp.
  • Protect metals, glass, and painted surfaces from contact.
  • Do not leave excess residue on the surface.

Safety precautions when using ARMADILLO D Dustproof Concrete Densifier:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Safety goggles, gloves, and protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Ensure good air circulation during application
  • Handling: Avoid contact with metals, glass, and painted surfaces; clean spills immediately with water
  • Non-toxic residue; clean tools with potable water after use

Use Gripset C-Rubber for: High-performance tiling applications on walls and floors, including wet areas.

Gripset C-Rubber is a high-performance rubber-modified tile adhesive designed for professional tiling applications. With its respirable silica-free formulation, it offers a flexible, non-slump consistency that ensures superior adhesion. This premium adhesive is suitable for internal and external use, providing reliable bonding on a variety of substrates, including concrete, screed, render, blockwork, and waterproofing membranes.

Key Features of Gripset C-Rubber

  • Respirable silica-free formulation for a safer application
  • Non-slump, high-bond strength for vertical and horizontal tiling
  • Flexible and suitable for various substrates
  • Meets C2TES1 classification
  • Can be used over green screeds and render
  • Ideal for fixing porcelain, ceramic, and vitrified tiles
  • Highly economical with excellent coverage

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Rubber-modified adhesive
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Notched trowel (size varies by tile type), mixing paddle
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For tiles larger than 300x300mm, back-butter for optimal adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If adhesive skins before tiles are placed, remove and reapply fresh adhesive

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life: 12 months from the date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing conditions

Certifications

  • Complies with AS 3958 tiling standards
  • Meets C2TES1 classification under ISO 13007

column33: Gripset C-Rubber is a flexible, rubber-modified tile adhesive with superior bonding strength for internal & external tiling. Silica-free & economical.
column52:
How to Apply Gripset C-Rubber:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Mix 8 litres of water per 20kg bag until a smooth consistency is achieved.
  3. Apply using a notched trowel appropriate for the tile size.
  4. Back-butter large tiles for optimal adhesion.
  5. Press tiles firmly into the adhesive and ensure full coverage.
  6. Allow the adhesive to cure for 24 hours before grouting.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset C-Rubber

Q: What substrates can Gripset C-Rubber be applied to?

A: It can be applied over concrete, screed, blockwork, plasterboard, compressed fibre cement, and acoustic underlay.

Q: Can Gripset C-Rubber be used in wet areas?

A: Yes, it is ideal for internal and external wet areas, including bathrooms and balconies.

Q: Does it require priming before application?

A: Porous surfaces should be primed with Gripset GP Primer, while non-porous surfaces require Gripset OP Primer.
column54:

Safety precautions when using Gripset C-Rubber:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves and a dust mask when mixing.
  • Ventilation: Work in a well-ventilated area.
  • Handling: Store in a dry area away from moisture.

Use Mineral Turpentine for: Cleaning and degreasing machinery, tools, and surfaces in industrial settings.

Mineral turpentine is a highly effective solvent for cleaning and degreasing various surfaces. It is commonly used in industrial settings to remove grease, oil, and grime from machinery, tools, and equipment. This versatile solvent is a staple in many industries due to its powerful cleaning properties and ease of use. Please note that mineral turpentine is a hazardous product and must be handled with care, following all safety precautions.

Key Features

  • Powerful cleaning and degreasing action
  • Versatile solvent for various industrial applications
  • Effective removal of grease, oil, and grime
  • Easy to use

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Aliphatic hydrocarbon, low aromatic content

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Appropriate safety equipment (gloves, eye protection, respiratory protection), rags or brushes for application
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure adequate ventilation when using. Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Dispose of waste responsibly according to local regulations.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a tightly closed original container in a dry, cool, and well-ventilated place.
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep away from heat and sources of ignition.

Application Guide

  1. Ensure adequate ventilation.
  2. Wear appropriate safety equipment (gloves, eye protection, respiratory protection).
  3. Apply mineral turpentine to the surface using a rag or brush.
  4. Scrub the surface to remove grease, oil, and grime.
  5. Wipe away the residue with a clean cloth.
  6. Dispose of waste responsibly according to local regulations.
column54:
Limitations

  • Flammable liquid and vapour. Keep away from heat, sparks, and open flames.
  • May cause skin and eye irritation. Avoid contact with skin and eyes.
  • May cause respiratory irritation. Use in a well-ventilated area.
  • May be harmful if swallowed. Do not ingest.
  • May cause cancer. Handle with care.
  • Wear chemical resistant gloves.
  • Wear safety glasses or a face shield.
  • Use a respirator if necessary.
  • Wear long sleeves and long trousers or coveralls.
  • Wear enclosed footwear or safety boots.

  4. Allow sealant to cure per manufacturer’s instructions before use
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 316 Stainless Steel Square Tile Insert with Megaflex™

Q: How do I correctly install this tile insert?

A: Begin by aligning the Megaflex™ base over the floor waste outlet, apply a silicone bead for sealant, then insert the stainless steel tile component and level it with surrounding tiles.

Q: Will it resist corrosion in coastal areas?

A: Yes, the 316 marine-grade stainless steel provides excellent corrosion resistance, making it ideal for coastal and high-humidity environments.

Q: Is this compatible with all tile types?

A: Yes, it’s compatible with ceramic, porcelain, and stone tiles. Ensure the tile thickness aligns with insert depth for a flush finish.

Q: What if the Megaflex™ seal leaks?

A: Check for proper seating of the base. Reapply sealant and ensure the tile insert is properly aligned and pressed firmly into position.

Q: Are there any safety concerns during installation?

A: Use gloves to handle stainless steel edges, and ensure proper ventilation when applying silicone sealant. Always follow Australian safety protocols.

column2: Megapoxy 108 - Rapid Set Epoxy for Pile Splicing
column3:
Use Megapoxy 108 for: Pile splicing, high-strength concrete repairs, and applications requiring rapid setting.

Megapoxy 108 is a specialized rapid set epoxy binder engineered for civil engineering projects where speed and strength are paramount. Its unique formulation allows for quick curing and exceptional compressive strength, making it ideal for pile splicing and other critical applications. This product excels in situations where downtime must be minimized and structural integrity is essential.

Key Features of Megapoxy 108

  • Rapid Set: Achieves 90% cure in 2 hours at 25°C, enabling quick resumption of work.
  • High Compressive Strength (120 MPa): Provides robust structural integrity, crucial for demanding applications like pile splicing.
  • Hydrophilic Resin: Cures in the presence of moisture, ensuring reliable performance in damp environments.
  • High Flexural Strength (55 Mpa): Provides added strength to the application.
  • Rapid Mortar creation: When mixed with silica 50N sand, a high strength mortar is created.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy 108 is a liquid epoxy binder designed for rapid strength development. Its unique chemical composition ensures a fast cure rate and high compressive strength, making it ideal for time-sensitive civil engineering projects. When mixed with silica 50N sand a high strength mortar is created for concrete repairs.

Chemical Properties: Liquid epoxy binder, hydrophilic resin, rapid curing.

Cure Rate: 90% cure in 2 hours at 25°C, full cure in 6 hours at 25°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Slow speed drill with propeller stirrer, plastic buckets, measuring containers.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure accurate mixing ratios (4:1 by volume). Use silica 50N sand for mortar applications.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Short working time requires efficient application. Refer to MSDS for safety precautions.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to manufacturer's specifications.
  • Temperature Considerations: Store within recommended temperature ranges to maintain product integrity.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy 108:

For Civil Engineers:

  • Pile splicing for bridge construction, ensuring rapid strength development.
  • Concrete repairs in high-stress areas, utilizing the high compressive strength.
  • Use in damp conditions due to the product’s hydrophilic properties.

For Construction Workers:

  • Quick repairs to precast concrete elements, minimizing project delays.
  • Bonding steel to concrete in structural applications.
  • Effective in environments with high moisture levels.

How to apply Megapoxy 108:

  1. Measure and mix 4 parts 'A' to 1 part 'B' by volume in a clean plastic bucket.
  2. If creating a mortar, gradually add three volumes of silica 50N sand while mixing.
  3. Use a slow speed drill with a propeller stirrer for thorough mixing.
  4. Apply the mixture to the prepared surfaces within the working time.
  5. Allow the epoxy to cure for the specified time.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy 108

Q: How quickly does Megapoxy 108 cure?

A: Megapoxy 108 achieves 90% cure in 2 hours at 25°C and full cure in 6 hours at 25°C, making it ideal for rapid applications.

Q: Can Megapoxy 108 be used in damp conditions?

A: Yes, Megapoxy 108 is a hydrophilic resin, meaning it will cure in the presence of moisture.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Megapoxy 108?

A: The mixing ratio is 4 parts 'A' to 1 part 'B' by volume. Accurate measurement is crucial for optimal performance.

Q: What is the compressive strength of Megapoxy 108?

A: The ultimate compressive strength is 120 MPa, providing robust structural integrity.

Q: What kind of sand is used to make Megapoxy 108 Mortar?

A: Silica 50N sand should be used when creating Megapoxy 108 Mortar.

  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Refer to MSDS for detailed handling instructions.
  • First Aid: Follow MSDS guidelines in case of accidental exposure.

Use Twin Component Cartridge Gun 400ml 10:1 for: Applying two-component adhesives and sealants accurately and efficiently on site

The Twin Component Cartridge Gun 400ml 10:1 is a premium, trade-grade application tool engineered for applying two-part adhesives and sealants. With its rugged aluminium-alloy construction and ergonomic trigger mechanism, it’s purpose-built to handle high-viscosity materials and demanding site conditions. The 10:1 thrust ratio ensures smooth, consistent extrusion, reducing fatigue during extended use. Compatible with 400ml coaxial cartridges, this applicator is a must-have for professionals seeking reliable and precise dispensing across construction, automotive, and industrial applications.

Key Features of Twin Component Cartridge Gun 400ml 10:1

  • Aluminium-alloy handle for lightweight durability
  • Designed for 400ml two-component coaxial cartridges (10:1 mix ratio)
  • Ergonomic grip and trigger for comfortable, controlled use
  • Heavy-duty frame suited for high-viscosity materials

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Compatible with epoxy, polyurethane, acrylic adhesives
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Material: Aluminium-Alloy Handle, Reinforced Steel Frame
  • Cartridge Compatibility: 400ml CoAxial, 10:1 Ratio
  • Dispensing Ratio: 10:1 for two-component cartridges

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Twin Component Cartridge Gun, compatible nozzles, cleaning tools
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Warm cartridge slightly in cool conditions for easier flow
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inconsistent flow? Check cartridge seating and nozzle alignment

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in clean, dry area away from moisture
  • Shelf Life Information: Indefinite with proper storage and cleaning
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid prolonged exposure to temperatures above 50°C

Certifications

  • ISO 9001 Certified Manufacturing
  • Complies with Australian Construction Equipment Safety Standards

Frequently Asked Questions About Twin Component Cartridge Gun 400ml 10:1

Q: How do I properly load a two-component cartridge?

A: Insert the cartridge into the barrel ensuring it is seated firmly. Attach the static mixing nozzle and prime the material until both components flow evenly.

Q: Can this gun handle thick adhesives?

A: Yes, the 10:1 thrust ratio and solid steel drive mechanism are designed to dispense thick, high-viscosity materials with ease and consistency.

Q: Is it compatible with all 400ml two-part cartridges?

A: The gun is compatible with standard 400ml coaxial cartridges with a 10:1 mix ratio. Always verify cartridge dimensions for a snug fit.

Q: What should I do if the material stops dispensing?

A: Check for blockage in the nozzle or improperly seated cartridge. Clear any cured material and ensure the plunger is aligned correctly.

Q: Are there specific cleaning or disposal guidelines?

A: After use, remove the cartridge and nozzle, and clean any residue with a suitable solvent. Dispose of used cartridges according to local regulations.

column2: Adheseal Everflex Multi Prime Acrylic Primer
column3:
Use Everflex Multi-Prime for: Improving adhesion on porous and non-porous surfaces, priming before waterproofing, tiling, and levelling applications.

Everflex Multi-Prime is a single-pack, rapid-drying, solvent-free acrylic primer designed for use on both porous and non-porous surfaces. It enhances adhesion for tile adhesives, self-levelling compounds, waterproofing membranes, and grouts. This water-based primer is easy to apply, non-corrosive, and meets “green star” environmental criteria. Suitable for both internal and external applications, Everflex Multi-Prime provides excellent long-term durability and inhibits mould growth, making it an essential choice for professional trades.

Key Features of Everflex Multi-Prime

  • Fast-drying formula for quick application turnaround
  • Enhances adhesion on a variety of porous & non-porous substrates
  • Low VOC, non-toxic, and meets "green star" environmental standards
  • Compatible with waterproofing membranes, tile adhesives, and levelling compounds
  • Resists mould and mildew in humid conditions
  • Suitable for both indoor and outdoor applications

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Water-based acrylic primer
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F)
  • Colour: Green (RAL 6034)
  • Coverage: 5-10m² per litre (varies by substrate)
  • Drying Time: Approx. 1 hour at 23°C (tack-free translucent film)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, or sprayer
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the surface is dry and clean for best adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying on damp surfaces to prevent delamination

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 25°C
  • Shelf Life: 12 months from the date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not apply below 10°C or above 35°C

Certifications

  • Meets "Green Star" environmental criteria
  • Low VOC certified

How to apply Everflex Multi-Prime:

  1. Ensure the substrate is structurally sound, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. For porous substrates: Dilute 1 part Multi-Prime with 2 parts water and apply evenly.
  3. For non-porous substrates: Apply undiluted using a roller or brush.
  4. Allow drying for approximately 1 hour until a translucent film forms.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex Multi-Prime

Q: Can Everflex Multi-Prime be used on non-porous surfaces?

A: Yes, Everflex Multi-Prime can be applied undiluted on non-porous surfaces such as burnished concrete and ceramic tiles (except high-gloss coatings). For best results, perform a light sanding before application.

Q: How long does it take to dry?

A: At 23°C, Everflex Multi-Prime dries to a tack-free translucent film in approximately 1 hour. Drying times may vary based on environmental conditions and substrate porosity.
column54:

  • Do not apply below 10°C or above 35°C.
  • Not designed for long-term UV exposure – must be overcoated.
  • Not suitable for surfaces with hydrostatic pressure or rising damp.

Safety precautions when using Everflex Multi-Prime:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety glasses, and workwear.
  • Ventilation: Ensure proper airflow when applying indoors.
  • Handling: Clean tools with water before the product cures.

column2: Pasco Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop
column3:
Use Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop for: sealing construction joints, precast panels, and penetrations in underground structures, tunnels, and potable water tanks.

Aquastop is a high-performance hydrophilic waterstop made from flexible polymer rubber, designed to provide a reliable seal in construction joints and precast panels. Upon contact with water, Aquastop expands up to 300%, forming a durable, self-healing barrier. This unique mechanism ensures a permanent seal, even in irregular surfaces and around penetrations. Ideal for use in underground structures, tunnels, and potable water applications, Aquastop withstands hydrostatic pressure up to 70 meters. Its easy installation and non-toxic nature make it a versatile and safe solution for various construction projects.

Key Features of Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop

  • 300% expansion: Provides a reliable seal in wet conditions.
  • Self-healing: Closes cracks and voids, ensuring long-term protection.
  • Potable water safe: Suitable for use in drinking water applications.
  • Easy installation: Flexible coils and butt-end joining for continuous waterstop.
  • Withstands 70m hydrostatic pressure: Ideal for high-pressure environments.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Hydrophilic polymer rubber with sodium bentonite
  • Expansion: 100-300%
  • Hydrostatic Head Resistance: >70 meters
  • Service Life: 40°C to 80°C (104°F to 176°F)
  • Elongation: >450%
  • Specific Gravity: 1.57 (ASTM D71)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, Aquastop adhesive, mechanical fasteners (optional).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Apply adhesive evenly and press Aquastop firmly. Butt join ends tightly to form a continuous waterstop. For penetrations, install around the outer diameter and fill voids with non-shrink grout.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid pre-hydrating or submerging Aquastop. In areas with severe ground water chemicals or salts, consult Pasco. Ensure a minimum 75mm concrete cover.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry conditions below 25°C (77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months minimum.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Potable water safe

column32: Aquastop Hydrophilic Waterstop | Self-Healing Seal | Adheseal
column33: Aquastop: self-healing, hydrophilic waterstop for concrete joints. 300% expansion, potable water safe, easy install, 70m water head.
column52:
How to apply Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop:

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure surfaces are clean and free of contaminants.
  2. Apply adhesive: Brush Aquastop adhesive along the concrete surface.
  3. Install Aquastop: Remove release paper and press Aquastop firmly to the surface.
  4. Butt join ends: Tightly butt join ends to form a continuous waterstop.
  5. Secure: Use mechanical fasteners if needed, especially on vertical sections.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop

Q: How does Aquastop work to prevent water infiltration?

A: Aquastop contains sodium bentonite, which expands upon contact with water, creating an impermeable barrier. The expansion fills cracks and voids, forming a self-healing seal that prevents water migration.

Q: Can Aquastop be used in potable water applications?

A: Yes, Aquastop is non-toxic and safe for use in potable water tanks and other drinking water applications.

Q: What is the maximum hydrostatic pressure Aquastop can withstand?

A: Aquastop can withstand hydrostatic pressure up to 70 meters, making it suitable for high-pressure environments like underground structures and tunnels.

Q: How do I install Aquastop around pipe penetrations?

A: Install Aquastop around the outer diameter of the pipe or sleeve. For sleeved pipes with large gaps, install additional strips. Fill any remaining void with non-shrink cementitious grout.

Q: What surface preparation is required before applying Aquastop?

A: Surfaces must be structurally sound and free of dirt, dust, grease, paint, oil, form release, curing agents, and other contaminants. Remove standing water before application.
column54:
Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop limitations:

  • Standard Aquastop is not suitable for contaminated groundwater (saltwater or organic).
  • Requires a minimum 75mm concrete cover.
  • Do not pre-hydrate or submerge in water before installation.
  • Not designed for expansion joints.

Safety precautions when using Aquastop Hydrophilic Construction Joint Waterstop:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves are recommended.
  • Ventilation: General ventilation is sufficient.
  • Handling: No known hazards during normal use. Refer to the MSDS for more details.

column3:
Use Duram 195 for: Waterproofing wet areas, decks, balconies, and below-ground structures where a durable, flexible, and seamless membrane is required.

Duram 195 is a premium, single-pack, moisture-curing polyurethane waterproofing membrane designed for professional use in non-UV exposed areas. It cures to form a tough, seamless, and elastomeric (Class III) membrane, providing long-term waterproofing protection. Its self-leveling capability and easy application make it ideal for various applications, including wet areas, decks, and below-ground structures. When top-coated with Multithane ATC, it can also be used in exposed areas.

Key Features of Duram 195

  • Single Pack, Easy Application: No mixing required, simplifying the application process and reducing waste.
  • Rapid Cure: Cures within 24 hours, allowing for faster project completion.
  • Permanently Flexible: Maintains flexibility (Class III), accommodating substrate movement and preventing cracking.
  • Seamless Membrane: Forms a 100% bonded, seamless membrane, eliminating joints and laps for superior waterproofing.
  • Excellent Chemical Resistance: Suitable for demanding waterproofing applications and permanent immersion.
  • High Strength and Puncture Resistance: Provides a durable and robust waterproofing layer.
  • Low VOC and Green Star Compliant: Meets environmental criteria, making it a sustainable choice.

Technical Overview

Duram 195 is formulated with UV stabilizers, absorbers, and antioxidants to enhance its UV protection and stability. It bonds well to most primed building substrates and is suitable for both above and below-ground applications. Its self-leveling properties ensure a smooth, even finish, while its elastomeric nature accommodates substrate movement.

Chemical Properties: Moisture-curing polyurethane membrane with UV stabilizers, absorbers, and antioxidants.

Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F). Ensure the substrate surface temperature is within this range for optimal adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, broom, or squeegee, Duram Resiflex FC sealant, Duram Leak-Seal Tape (for joints and cracks), Duram Solvent (for cleanup).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are thoroughly primed with Duram Primeseal MC or SP. Pay close attention to detailing corners, joints, and cracks using Duram Resiflex FC and Leak-Seal Tape. Apply two coats for optimal thickness and performance.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying to damp surfaces to prevent gassing and bubbling. Ensure proper surface preparation to avoid adhesion failures. Use Duram Solvent for immediate cleanup of spills and equipment.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep in a cool, dry place away from heat, flame, or combustible materials.
  • Shelf Life Information: 6 months in unopened container, best used within that period.
  • Temperature Considerations: Store within recommended temperature ranges to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • AS4654.1 2012: Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground use (when top-coated with Multithane ATC).
  • Green Star environmental criteria compliant.

column32: Duram 195 - High-Performance Polyurethane Waterproofing | Adheseal
column33: Duram 195 is a moisture-curing polyurethane waterproofing membrane offering seamless, durable protection for non-exposed areas. UV-stabilised and versatile.
column52:
How to apply Duram 195:

  1. Ensure surfaces are sound, clean, and dry. Prime with Duram Primeseal MC or SP.
  2. Detail corners, joints, and cracks with Duram Resiflex FC and Duram Leak-Seal Tape.
  3. Apply Duram 195 by brush, roller, broom, or squeegee in two coats, allowing 6-24 hours between coats.
  4. Ensure a minimum dry film thickness of 1.5mm for floors and tanking areas, and 1.0mm for vertical surfaces.
  5. For exposed areas, top-coat with Duram Multithane ATC after Duram 195 has cured.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Duram 195

Q: Can Duram 195 be used in exposed areas?

A: Yes, but only when top-coated with Duram Multithane ATC to provide UV protection. Duram 195 itself is not designed for long-term direct UV exposure.

Q: What surfaces can Duram 195 be applied to?

A: Duram 195 is compatible with a wide range of surfaces, including concrete, cement render, block work, masonry, FC sheeting, metal (when primed), and timber (when primed). Proper priming is essential.

Q: How do I prepare surfaces for Duram 195 application?

A: Surfaces must be sound, stable, dry, and clean. Prime surfaces with Duram Primeseal MC or SP. Fill blowholes and imperfections with Duram Resiflex FC. Detail corners, joints, and cracks with Resiflex FC and Leak-Seal Tape.

Q: What is the correct application thickness for Duram 195?

A: The dry film thickness (DFT) should be 1.5mm for floors and tanking areas, applied in two coats (0.75L/m² per coat). For vertical surfaces, 1.0mm DFT is required. For water-resistant non-tanking walls, 0.5mm DFT is sufficient.

Q: How do I clean up Duram 195?

A: Use Duram Solvent to clean spills and equipment immediately. Avoid spills on porous surfaces and carpets. Allow the product to cure before attempting to remove it from carpets.
column54:
Duram 195 limitations:

  • Not designed for long-term direct UV exposure; requires top-coating with Multithane ATC for exposed areas.
  • Not designed as a trafficable membrane, though infrequent maintenance foot traffic is acceptable.
  • Not suitable for direct and prolonged contact with chlorine concentrations above 10 ppm.
  • Cannot be applied to damp surfaces; surfaces must be dry.
  • Direct tile adhesion is not advised; seek Duram technical advice for specific applications.

Safety precautions when using Duram 195:

  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas as it is solvent-based.
  • Flammability: Keep away from ignition sources as the uncured product is combustible.
  • PPE: Read and understand the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) before use. Wear appropriate personal protective equipment.
  • Cleanup: Use Duram Solvent for cleaning spills and equipment.

Use Permabond 240 for: rapid bonding of plastics, rubber, and metals, especially in large gap applications and on porous surfaces.

Permabond 240 is a high-viscosity cyanoacrylate adhesive designed for fast, strong bonds across a variety of materials. Its high viscosity makes it particularly effective in large gap applications and on porous substrates, ensuring a reliable bond even in challenging conditions. This 100% reactive, solvent-free adhesive cures rapidly upon contact with surface moisture, making it ideal for high-speed production environments where efficiency is paramount.

Key Features of Permabond 240

  • Rapid development of high strength
  • Ease of use – no mixing or heat cure required
  • Bonds most materials, including plastics, rubber, and metals
  • High viscosity for large gap filling
  • Ideal for porous substrates
  • 100% reactive, no solvents

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Ethyl cyanoacrylate
  • Application Temperature Range: Room temperature (optimal)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Dispensing nozzles, surface preparation solvents (acetone, isopropanol), emery cloth for metal abrasion.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. For difficult-to-bond materials like polypropylene or polyethylene, use Permabond Polyolefin Primer (POP). For faster curing on acidic surfaces, use Permabond C Surface Activator (CSA) or Permabond QFS 16.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Blooming (white residue) can occur in high humidity; ensure proper ventilation. Inconsistent bond strength can result from contaminated surfaces; thorough cleaning is essential.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: 2°C to 7°C (35°F to 45°F) in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Typically 12 months from the date of manufacture when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Allow adhesive to reach room temperature before opening to prevent condensation.

Certifications

  • Approved to MIL-A-46050C Type II Class 3 (existing designs)

How to apply Permabond 240:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from grease. Use a suitable solvent for cleaning.
  2. For metals like aluminium or copper, lightly abrade the surface to remove oxide layers.
  3. Apply the adhesive sparingly to one surface.
  4. Bring the components together quickly and correctly aligned.
  5. Apply sufficient pressure to ensure the adhesive spreads into a thin film.
  6. Do not disturb or re-align until sufficient strength is achieved, normally in a few seconds.
  7. Remove any surplus adhesive with Permabond CA solvent, nitromethane, or acetone.

What materials can Permabond 240 bond?

Permabond 240 bonds a wide range of materials including metals, plastics, and rubbers. For difficult plastics like polypropylene or polyethylene, use a primer.

  • Ensure adequate ventilation during use.

column3:
Use Permabond 102 for: Rapid bonding of close-fitting plastic, rubber, and metal parts; high-speed assembly lines; quick repairs on small components.

Permabond 102 is an ethyl cyanoacrylate adhesive renowned for its extremely fast fixture time and low viscosity. This colourless, single-component "super glue" polymerises rapidly through surface moisture, creating strong bonds on a wide variety of materials in mere seconds. Its low viscosity (70-90 cP) allows it to wick effectively into tight gaps (up to 0.15 mm or 0.006 in), making it perfect for precise bonding of close-fitting components. Australian manufacturers, repair technicians, model makers, and prototyping specialists rely on Permabond 102 for applications demanding speed and accuracy, especially when bonding plastics, rubbers (like Buna N), and metals.

Primer Information: For optimal bonding on difficult low-surface-energy plastics such as polypropylene (PP), polyethylene (PE), PTFE, or silicone rubber, pre-treatment of the surface with Permabond POP Polyolefin Primer is essential before applying Permabond 102.

Activator Information: On porous surfaces, or in very low humidity conditions sometimes found in drier Australian regions, cure speed may slow. To ensure rapid fixturing in these situations, consider using Permabond CSA or QFS 16 activators.

Cure Time: Permabond 102 achieves handling strength (fixture time) incredibly quickly: 5-10 seconds on Buna N Rubber, 7-10 seconds on ABS and PVC, and 10-15 seconds on Steel and Phenolic surfaces under typical conditions (23°C, 50% RH). This rapid cure dramatically speeds up assembly processes. Full mechanical strength develops within 24 hours.

Coverage Rate: As a cyanoacrylate, Permabond 102 is applied sparingly – typically one small drop per few square centimetres of bond area is sufficient. Coverage depends heavily on the application method and substrate smoothness, but a little goes a long way.

Application Temperature Range: While the adhesive itself cures at ambient temperatures, the cured bond performs reliably in service temperatures ranging from -55°C to 80°C (-65°F to 176°F). It can withstand brief exposures to higher temperatures (e.g., paint baking cycles) if the joint isn't highly stressed, making it versatile for various manufacturing processes.

Chemical Properties: Permabond 102 is an ethyl cyanoacrylate. It offers good resistance to non-polar solvents but is not recommended for prolonged exposure to strong oxidising materials or polar solvents. It will generally withstand a quick solvent wash without bond degradation, useful for cleaning processes post-assembly.

Key Features of Permabond 102

  • Extremely Fast Fixture Time (5-15 seconds): Minimises assembly time and clamping needs, boosting throughput on production lines or speeding up repairs. Example: Bonding plastic housing components together in seconds.
  • Low Viscosity (70-90 cP): Flows easily into tight gaps (up to 0.15mm) ensuring good surface contact for strong bonds on close-tolerance parts. Example: Securing small rubber O-rings or gaskets.
  • Versatile Material Bonding: Creates strong bonds on most common plastics (ABS, PVC, Phenolic), rubbers (Buna N), and metals (Steel, Aluminium, Zinc). Example: Joining a metal bracket to a plastic casing.
  • Single Component, No Mixing: Ready to use straight from the bottle, eliminating mixing errors and reducing preparation time.
  • 100% Reactive, No Solvents: Environmentally conscious formulation with minimal odour during application.
  • High Shear Strength on Plastics: Often causes substrate failure on ABS, PVC, and Polycarbonate, indicating a very strong adhesive bond.

Why Choose Permabond 102:

  • Boost Productivity: Slash assembly times from minutes to seconds per part with rapid handling strength. Example: Significantly increasing units per hour on an assembly line.
  • Achieve Precise Bonds: Its low viscosity is perfect for intricate components and applications requiring neat, clean bond lines. Example: Model making or detailed electronics assembly.
  • Simplify Your Process: Easy-to-use single-component adhesive requires no complex mixing or heat curing equipment. Example: Streamlining repair procedures in a workshop.
  • Bond Dissimilar Materials: Effectively join combinations like rubber-to-plastic or metal-to-plastic for complex assemblies. Example: Attaching rubber feet to a metal base.

When to Choose Permabond 102 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Permabond 102 over Epoxies/Polyurethanes when: Speed is paramount. You need handling strength in seconds, not minutes or hours, for high-volume assembly or quick fixes on tight-fitting parts.
  • Choose Permabond 102 over Solvent Cements when: You need to bond dissimilar materials (e.g., metal to plastic) or require a solvent-free solution.
  • Consider other options (e.g., higher viscosity CAs, structural acrylics, epoxies) when: You need significant gap filling (>0.15mm), require high impact or peel strength, need flexibility in the bond line, or require resistance to polar solvents or continuous high temperatures (>80°C).

Trade-Specific Applications for Permabond 102:

For Manufacturing/Assembly Operators:

  • Application: Rapidly bonding plastic housings, attaching rubber seals or feet, securing small metal components.
  • Technique: Apply sparingly to one surface, align parts quickly and hold for 5-15 seconds. Use jigs for consistent alignment in production.
  • Material Compatibility: Excellent for ABS, PVC, steel, aluminium, Buna N rubber. Use POP primer for PE/PP/Silicone.
  • Performance Benefits: Dramatically reduced cycle times, increased throughput, simple application process.

For Repair Technicians (Electronics, Appliances, Automotive Trim):

  • Application: Repairing cracked plastic casings, re-attaching small trim pieces, securing loose rubber components.
  • Technique: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Apply a minimal amount, press parts together firmly for recommended fixture time. Remove excess with CA solvent/acetone if needed.
  • Material Compatibility: Bonds common plastics (ABS, PC) and rubber found in consumer goods. Check plastic type; use POP primer if necessary.
  • Performance Benefits: Very fast repairs, strong bonds for non-structural fixes, clear bond line.

For Model Makers & Hobbyists:

  • Application: Assembling plastic model kits (polystyrene, ABS), bonding small metal or rubber details.
  • Technique: Use precision applicators for fine control. Work quickly due to fast cure. Ensure good ventilation.
  • Material Compatibility: Excellent for kit plastics, good for adding small metal/rubber parts. Test compatibility first.
  • Performance Benefits: Rapid assembly, strong bonds on small parts, clear appearance.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Adhesive dispenser bottle (usually integrated), potentially precision applicator tips, safety glasses, nitrile gloves. Surface cleaning supplies (e.g., Isopropanol like Diggers IPA, Acetone). Emery cloth for abrading metals.
  • Trade-Specific Tips:
    • Manufacturing: Use automated dispensing for consistency. Monitor humidity levels as high humidity accelerates cure. Ensure proper refrigerated storage rotation (FIFO).
    • Repair: Cleanliness is crucial. Less is more – excess adhesive doesn't improve strength and can be messy.
    • Model Making: Use a 'kicker' or activator (CSA/QFS 16) sparingly if faster setting is needed, but be aware it can sometimes slightly reduce ultimate bond strength or cause hazing on clear plastics.
  • Common Issues and Solutions (Australian Conditions):
    • Curing Too Fast (High Humidity - e.g., Summer in QLD/NT): Align parts immediately after application. Work in smaller sections. Ensure adhesive isn't too warm.
    • Curing Too Slow (Low Humidity - e.g., Arid zones, winter): Use Permabond CSA or QFS 16 activator on one surface. Ensure parts are clean and adhesive is fresh.
    • White Haze ('Blooming'): Caused by rapid cure, especially with activators or excess adhesive. Ensure good airflow/ventilation during cure. Use minimal adhesive.
    • Poor Bond Strength: Check surface cleanliness/preparation. Verify material type (use POP primer for PP/PE/PTFE/Silicone). Ensure parts are mated within the adhesive's open time and gap is minimal (<0.15mm). Check adhesive age/storage conditions.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store unopened containers in a refrigerator at 2°C to 7°C (35°F to 45°F). This is critical for maintaining shelf life, especially in warmer Australian climates.
  • Shelf Life Information: Shelf life data wasn't provided in the excerpt, but typically cyanoacrylates maintain properties best for 6-12 months under ideal refrigerated conditions. Check packaging for expiry date.
  • Temperature Considerations: Before use, allow the adhesive container to reach room temperature *before opening* the bottle. This prevents moisture condensation inside the bottle, which can compromise adhesive performance and shelf life. Avoid prolonged exposure to high temperatures.

Certifications and Compliance

  • MIL-A-46050C Type II Class 2: Approved under this US Military Specification for cyanoacrylate adhesives (applicable to existing designs using this specification). This indicates a level of quality control and performance testing relevant to defence and aerospace applications.

column33: Permabond 102 is a low viscosity, general purpose cyanoacrylate adhesive. Ideal for bonding a variety of materials. Fast setting and easy to use.
column52:
Permabond 102 limitations:

  • Low Gap Fill: Only suitable for very close-fitting parts (max 0.15 mm / 0.006 in). Will not bridge larger gaps; consider gel CAs or epoxies for gap filling.
  • Brittleness: Cured adhesive is rigid (85 Shore D) and can be brittle, offering limited resistance to high impact or peel forces compared to toughened adhesives.
  • Temperature Limits: Not suitable for continuous service above 80°C (176°F), although brief higher excursions may be tolerated under low stress.
  • Chemical Resistance: Not recommended for long-term immersion or contact with strong oxidising agents or polar solvents (like acetone, although it withstands brief washes).
  • Surface Sensitivity: Requires clean, dry surfaces. Performance can be affected by surface acidity/alkalinity (activators can help). Requires specific primer (POP) for polyolefins (PE, PP) and silicone.
  • Blooming Potential: Can leave a white powdery residue (blooming) on surfaces adjacent to the bond line, especially if excess adhesive or activator is used, or ventilation is poor.

Safety precautions when using Permabond 102:

  • Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Always wear safety glasses/goggles to prevent eye contact. Wear nitrile or polyethylene gloves (avoid cotton/wool which can react exothermically). Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for full details.
  • Ventilation: Use with adequate ventilation to minimise exposure to vapours, which can irritate eyes and respiratory system. Avoid breathing vapours directly.
  • Handling: Bonds skin and eyes in seconds. Avoid contact. Keep away from children. Apply adhesive carefully to avoid spills. Store properly refrigerated and allow to reach room temp before opening.
  • First Aid: EYES: Flush immediately with plenty of water for at least 15 minutes, seek medical attention. SKIN: Do NOT pull bonded skin apart. Soak in warm soapy water and gently peel or roll skin apart (e.g., using a blunt object like a spoon handle). If lips are bonded, apply warm water and encourage wetting/salivation; peel/roll apart gently. Seek medical attention if necessary. Refer to SDS for detailed first aid.
  • Disposal: Dispose of cured adhesive as standard industrial waste. Dispose of uncured adhesive and containers according to local council regulations. Consult the SDS.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Permabond 102

Q: How fast does Permabond 102 actually set? Can I reposition parts?

A: Permabond 102 sets extremely quickly, typically achieving handling strength in 5-15 seconds depending on the material. You have very little time for repositioning once parts make contact. Ensure accurate alignment *before* bringing surfaces together, especially in humid Australian conditions which can accelerate the cure.

Q: Do I always need to use the POP primer for plastics?

A: No, Permabond 102 bonds well directly to many common plastics like ABS, PVC, Polycarbonate, and Phenolic. However, for low-surface-energy plastics like Polypropylene (PP), Polyethylene (PE), PTFE (Teflon®), and Silicone rubber, you absolutely need to use Permabond POP Primer first to achieve a strong bond.

Q: What's the best way to prepare surfaces before using Permabond 102?

A: Surfaces must be clean, dry, and free from grease or oil. Degrease using a suitable solvent like Isopropanol (IPA) or acetone. For metals like aluminium or copper, lightly abrading the surface with emery cloth to remove the oxide layer can improve bond strength. Ensure all solvent is evaporated before applying the adhesive.

Q: Can I use Permabond 102 to fill gaps between parts?

A: No, Permabond 102 is very low viscosity and designed for tight-fitting parts with a maximum gap fill of only 0.15 mm (0.006 in). It will not effectively bridge larger gaps. For gap filling, consider a higher viscosity cyanoacrylate, a gel formulation, or a different adhesive technology like epoxy.

Q: Why does the adhesive sometimes create a white residue (blooming)?

A: This 'blooming' or 'frosting' is common with cyanoacrylates and is caused by adhesive vapours reacting with moisture and settling on the surface during a rapid cure. It's more likely with excess adhesive, poor ventilation, or when using activators. Minimise adhesive use, ensure good airflow, and avoid excessive activator application.

Q: How critical is the refrigerated storage? What happens if I don't?

A: Refrigerated storage (2-7°C) is critical for maximising shelf life, especially in Australia's often warm climate. Storing at room temperature significantly shortens the effective life of the adhesive, causing it to thicken or potentially cure prematurely in the bottle. Always allow it to reach room temp before opening.
column54:
Limitations

  • Not recommended for use in contact with strong oxidizing materials and polar solvents.
  • Maximum gap fill is 0.15 mm.
  • Handle in accordance with good industrial hygiene practices.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for complete safety information.
column55: Permabond 102 is a versatile cyanoacrylate adhesive that provides strong and fast bonds on various materials, including plastics, rubbers, and metals. This low-viscosity adhesive is ideal for close-fitting components and offers excellent performance in a wide range of applications.
column56:
Permabond 102 can be used on the following substrates:

  • Plastics: Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC), Polycarbonate (PC), Phenolic Resins. Bonds are often stronger than the plastic itself. Ensure surfaces are clean.
  • Rubber: Buna N (Nitrile) rubber bonds very quickly and effectively. Other rubbers should be tested. Silicone rubber requires Permabond POP primer.
  • Metals: Steel, Aluminium, Zinc. Cleaning and light abrasion (for oxide removal on Aluminium/Copper) are recommended for best results.
  • Other Materials: Ceramics, Wood (porous, may require activator like CSA/QFS 16 for faster cure).
  • Difficult Plastics (Requires Primer): Polypropylene (PP), Polyethylene (PE), PTFE. Must use Permabond POP primer for adhesion.
column57:
Use Permabond 102 for:

  • High-Speed Assembly: Bonding plastic components, rubber seals, or small metal parts on production lines where speed is critical. Example: Assembling electronic device casings.
  • Quick Repairs: Fixing broken plastic items, re-attaching small trim pieces (automotive, appliance), repairing rubber components where bond line is tight. Example: Repairing a cracked ABS plastic housing.
  • Model Making & Hobby: Assembling plastic kits, attaching small detail parts made of plastic, metal or rubber. Example: Building detailed scale models.
  • Securing Gaskets & O-Rings: Tack-bonding rubber O-rings or small gaskets into place during assembly (where fluid compatibility allows). Example: Holding a Buna N O-ring in its groove before final assembly.
  • Wire Tacking (Temporary): Lightly tacking wires to surfaces for routing during prototyping (ensure compatibility). Example: Securing fine gauge wires inside electronic prototypes.

Why Use Permabond 102 for:

  • Unmatched Speed: Achieve handling strength in seconds, drastically cutting down assembly or repair time compared to slower adhesives. Perfect for time-sensitive tasks in Australian manufacturing or workshops.
  • Ease of Application: Single-part, no-mix formula is incredibly simple to dispense and use, reducing potential for error and simplifying processes.
  • Precision Bonding: The very low viscosity allows the adhesive to wick into the tightest of joints, creating strong, intimate bonds on well-matched parts.
  • Material Versatility: Bonds a wide range of common materials including many plastics, rubbers, and metals frequently used in Australian industries.
  • Clear, Neat Bonds: Cures colourless, providing aesthetically pleasing results on visible joints or components.

Multithane 2P-A80 is a two-part, heavy-duty, elastomeric polyurethane waterproofing membrane. Designed for high-traffic and demanding applications, it offers superior abrasion resistance, chemical durability, and flexibility. This low VOC, environmentally friendly product complies with AS4654.1 standards and is ideal for both exposed and non-exposed waterproofing scenarios.

Key Features

  • Heavy-duty, abrasion-resistant, and trafficable waterproofing membrane.
  • High tensile strength with Class 1 extensibility.
  • Low VOC, environmentally friendly and Green Star compliant.
  • Seamless and fully bonded membrane, preventing water tracking.
  • Puncture, tear, and chemical resistant, suitable for harsh environments.
  • Can be made non-slip for added safety.
  • Resistant to ponded water and root penetration.
  • Withstands temperature extremes from -30°C to 120°C.

Suitable Substrates

  • Concrete and cementitious surfaces.
  • Brickwork and masonry.
  • Timber and metal (with appropriate primers).
  • Planter boxes and retaining walls.

column52:
Application Guide

  1. Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Prime the surface with Duram Primeseal MC or a suitable alternative.
  3. Mix Parts A and B in the correct ratio using a mechanical stirrer.
  4. Apply two coats of Multithane 2P-A80 with a roller, brush, or trowel, achieving a total dry film thickness of 1.5mm.
  5. Top-coat with Multithane ATC for exposed applications to enhance UV stability.
  6. Allow 48 hours for full curing before subjecting to traffic or topping.
column54:
Limitations

  • Requires proper mixing of Parts A and B for correct curing.
  • Not recommended for direct tile adhesion without technical consultation.
  • Should not be applied to damp or wet substrates.
  • Pot life is limited to 20–30 minutes; mix only what can be applied promptly.

column3:
Use Epocote™ F100W Clear for: priming damp concrete, sealing surfaces, and preventing efflorescence and calcium leachate staining.

Epocote™ F100W Clear is a two-pack, water-based epoxy primer and sealer designed for general-purpose applications. Its clear formulation allows for a seamless finish, and its low VOC and odour profile make it ideal for indoor use. This product boasts an exceptionally long pot life, reducing waste and simplifying application. It cures quickly to form a strong, chemically resistant barrier, making it suitable for a variety of substrates, including damp or green concrete. This primer/sealer is essential for preparing surfaces for waterproofing membranes and preventing unsightly staining.

Key Features of Epocote™ F100W Clear

  • Bonds to damp or green concrete (up to 10% moisture content), expanding application flexibility.
  • Long pot life (60 minutes at 25°C), minimising product waste and allowing for extended work time.
  • Fast-curing formula, enabling quicker project completion.
  • Low VOC and low odour, enhancing user comfort and safety.
  • Prevents efflorescence and calcium leachate staining, maintaining aesthetic appeal.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Two-pack, water-based epoxy
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F)
  • Mix Ratio: 100:100 (by weight or volume)
  • Solids Content: 40% (undiluted)
  • Tack Free Time: 2-4 hours at 25°C (77°F) / 60% RH

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, slow-speed mixer
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For porous concrete, dilute 10% with clean water for the first coat to minimise pinholes. Ensure thorough mixing for optimal results.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Cold weather slows curing; adjust application schedule accordingly. Discard gelled material to prevent application issues.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, cool place.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of manufacture in unopened containers.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Complies with relevant Australian building codes for waterproofing and sealing applications.
  • Meets low VOC requirements for indoor air quality.
column7: AS 374,AS4654.2 212,Green Star Compliant,balcony,basements,bathroom,block work,brick,chemical resistant,concrete-s,construction,decks,durable,epoxy-s,external,fast cure,fibre cement sheet,flooring-i,internal,low voc,masonry,pail,primer,screed,sealer,stone,tiling-i,two part,vapour barrier,vapour resistant,water based,water resistant,waterproofing-a,wet areas
column32: Epocote F100W - Water-Based Epoxy Primer | Adheseal
column33: Clear, water-based epoxy primer & sealer. Low VOC, long pot life, bonds to damp concrete. Prevents efflorescence & staining.
column52:
How to apply Epocote™ F100W Clear:

  1. Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Mix Part A and Part B for 3 minutes using a slow-speed mixer. Allow to stand for 5 minutes, then remix.
  3. For porous concrete, apply a first coat diluted with 10% clean water using a brush or roller.
  4. Apply a second, undiluted coat within 24 hours.
  5. Allow the primer/sealer to cure according to the specified tack-free time.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Epocote™ F100W Clear

Q: Can Epocote™ F100W Clear be applied to freshly poured concrete?

A: Yes, it can be applied to damp or green concrete with a maximum moisture content of 10%. Ensure the concrete has reached a minimum strength grade of 25 MPa and is moist-cured as per AS 3600.

Q: How long does Epocote™ F100W Clear take to cure?

A: The tack-free time is typically 2-4 hours at 25°C and 60% relative humidity. Curing time can vary based on temperature and humidity conditions.

Q: Is dilution necessary for all applications?

A: Dilution with 10% clean water is recommended for the first coat on porous concrete substrates to minimise pinholes. The second coat should be applied undiluted.

Q: What is the best way to clean up after using Epocote™ F100W Clear?

A: Use water to clean uncured product from brushes and rollers. Xylene may assist in removing gelled material. Discard used brushes and rollers where possible.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using this product?

A: Always wear appropriate personal protective equipment, including gloves and protective goggles. Ensure adequate ventilation during application. Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for comprehensive safety information.
column54:
Epocote™ F100W Clear limitations:

  • Do not apply when relative humidity exceeds 80%.
  • Do not apply outside the temperature range of 10°C to 35°C.
  • Maximum re-coat time is 24 hours at 20°C.

Safety precautions when using Epocote™ F100W Clear:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, protective goggles, and appropriate clothing.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Follow MSDS guidelines for safe handling practices.
column55: A versatile, clear, water-based epoxy primer and sealer with extended pot life and rapid curing. Ideal for priming damp concrete and preventing efflorescence.

column57:

column2: Silcor 560 HB Low VOC Grey - Polyurethane Membrane
column3:
Common problems this product solves: Prevents water ingress, eliminates leaks in wet areas, and enhances substrate longevity.

SILCOR 560 HB LVOC is a high-performance, single-component polyurethane waterproofing membrane with very low VOC content. It forms a seamless, elastomeric barrier that adapts to structural movement, providing superior waterproofing for internal and external applications. Certified to Australian standards, it ensures reliable, long-term moisture protection for builders and waterproofing professionals.

Key Features

  • Seamless, monolithic waterproofing membrane
  • High elongation for crack-bridging capabilities
  • Very low VOC – environmentally friendly
  • Cold-applied, no heating or torching required
  • Compatible with various substrates including concrete, brick, and metals
  • Class III wet area membrane (AS4858:2004)

Technical Overview

  • Membrane Type: High solids polyurethane
  • Application Temperature: +5°C to +35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Roller, brush, or squeegee
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply in two coats for optimal performance
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Use appropriate primers to enhance adhesion on difficult substrates

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place (15°C to 25°C)
  • Shelf Life: 9 months from the date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from frost and direct sunlight

Certifications

  • AS4858:2004 – Wet Area Membranes
  • AS3740:2010 – Waterproofing for Residential Buildings
  • AS4654.1 – External Waterproofing Compliance

Related Products

  • SILCOR Primer BS – Solvent-based primer for cementitious, masonry, and metal substrates
  • SILCOR LM PU Sealant – For detailing and joint sealing
  • SILCOR Top Coat 75 – UV-stable protective topcoat

column3:
Use Silcor Top Coat 75 for: Protecting Silcor membrane systems, providing a UV-resistant and non-slip finish, and creating durable, foot-trafficable surfaces.

Silcor Top Coat 75 is a high-performance, two-part, aliphatic polyurethane coating designed to protect Silcor membrane systems in exposed environments. This fast-curing, non-slip topcoat provides excellent UV resistance, ensuring long-lasting color and durability. Ideal for plant room and lift motor room roofs, balconies, decks, and perimeter turn-ups, Silcor Top Coat 75 delivers a tough, foot-trafficable finish that withstands harsh Australian conditions. Its ease of application and quick cure time make it a reliable choice for professional waterproofing projects.

Key Features of Silcor Top Coat 75

  • UV Resistant: Provides long-lasting color and protection against UV degradation.
  • Non-Slip Finish: Ensures safety and functionality in foot traffic areas.
  • Fast Curing: Allows for quick access by trades, minimizing downtime.
  • Permanently Flexible: Maintains total adhesion and flexibility, accommodating structural movement.
  • Immediate Rain Resistance: Protects against rain damage immediately after application.

Technical Overview

Silcor Top Coat 75 is formulated to provide a robust protective layer over Silcor membrane systems. Its aliphatic polyurethane composition ensures excellent UV resistance and durability. The fast curing properties allow for efficient project completion, while the non-slip finish enhances safety. This topcoat is designed to maintain its flexibility and adhesion, ensuring long-term performance in various environmental conditions.

Chemical Properties: Two-part, aliphatic polyurethane coating.

Application Temperature Range: Apply at temperatures suitable for polyurethane coatings, typically between 5°C and 35°C (41°F and 95°F). Ensure surfaces are dry and free from moisture.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: High-speed dissolver, clean mixing containers, brush, roller, or spray equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Mix components thoroughly for 5 minutes before application. Apply two coats in cross directions for a uniform finish. Do not add solvent. Discard mixed product if it becomes thick and stringy.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper mixing to avoid curing issues. Clean tools with MULTITEK Xylene or methylated spirits before curing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, protected area, away from weather and sun exposure.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in sealed pails. Once opened, product may solidify within a few days.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperature fluctuations during storage.

Certifications

  • UL Class A Fire Resistance.
  • Tensile Strength (AS1145) of 2 MPa.
column7: balcony, decking, decks, durable, fast cure, flexible, membrane, pail, polyurethane, special order, trafficable, two part, uv stable
column32: Silcor Top Coat 75 | UV Resistant Coating | Adheseal
column33: Silcor Top Coat 75: Durable, UV-resistant, non-slip polyurethane coating for Silcor membranes. Fast cure, foot trafficable. Ideal for roofs & decks.
column52:
How to apply Silcor Top Coat 75:

  1. Mix each component separately with a clean stirrer blade.
  2. Combine Resin and Hardener in a clean, dry container at a 5:1 weight ratio.
  3. Mix thoroughly with a high-speed dissolver for 5 minutes.
  4. Apply in two coats by brush or roller, applying the second coat in a cross direction.
  5. For spraying, use a single wet-on-wet application.
  6. Discard any mixed product that becomes thick and stringy.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Silcor Top Coat 75

Q: How do I prepare the Silcor membrane before applying the topcoat?

A: Ensure the Silcor membrane surface is clean and dry. Remove any dirt, debris, or moisture before applying Silcor Top Coat 75.

Q: Can I tile over Silcor Top Coat 75?

A: Yes, you can tile over Silcor Top Coat 75 after sealing it with Silcor Primer BW Grey/EPOCOTE F100W Grey to ensure proper adhesion.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Silcor Top Coat 75?

A: The mixing ratio is 5:1 by weight, Resin to Hardener. Mix thoroughly with a high-speed dissolver for 5 minutes before application.

Q: How long does Silcor Top Coat 75 take to dry?

A: It dries in approximately 2 hours at 25°C (77°F), allowing for quick access by trades.

Q: What is the coverage rate for Silcor Top Coat 75?

A: The minimum coverage is 0.3 kg/m² to achieve a minimum dry film thickness (DFT) of 0.15 mm.

Safety precautions when using Silcor Top Coat 75:

  • Handling: Exercise care when using solvents for cleanup. Review MSDS before use.

column3:
Use Efflock for: Preventing efflorescence, rising damp, salt attack, and picture framing in tiling, brickwork, stonemasonry, and concrete applications.

Efflock is a high-performance, water-based liquid additive designed for the bulk impregnation of cement-based building materials. By creating a hydrophobic molecular structure within the pores of cured concrete, Efflock dramatically reduces water absorption while allowing the controlled release of moisture. This makes it an excellent solution for preventing efflorescence, dampness, and other water-related problems in various construction applications.

Key Features of Efflock

  • Prevents Efflorescence: Provides complete efflorescence protection for tiling systems, compatible with tile beds, tile adhesive, and grout.
  • Reduces Dampness: Prevents capillary action that can lead to waterproofing failure and rising damp.
  • Protects Against Salt Attack: Repels waterborne contaminants like salt, resulting in excellent resistance to salt attack and concrete cancer.
  • Concentrated Formula: Dilutes 100 times for convenience, minimal plastic waste, and reduced transport impacts.
  • Improves Durability: Prevents absorption of damp, salt attack, and frost attack, enhancing the long-term durability of cement-based materials.
  • Hydrophobic Effect: Repels water, promoting a cleaner appearance and inhibiting moss and mould growth.
  • VOC Free and Environmentally Friendly: Water-based and free of volatile organic compounds, making it safe for use.

Technical Overview

Efflock's unique technology creates a hydrophobic molecular structure within the pores of cured concrete without filling the pores of the material. This dramatically reduces water absorption while maintaining permeability. Efflock provides bulk impregnation, protecting concrete throughout its entire mass, ensuring that performance is not affected by traffic wear or movement cracks.

Hydrophobic Properties: Imparts a water-repellent quality to cement-based materials, preventing water ingress and associated damage.

Dilution Ratio: Typically 1 part Efflock to 100 parts water, but may vary depending on application. For tile screed, add Efflock neat at 0.001% of the mixer capacity.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Measuring jug, mixing buckets, mechanical screed mixer (for screed), soft bristle broom or air pressure sprayer (for surface application).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For tile screed, use a mechanical mixer and add Efflock neat to ensure proper proportioning, as sand from the building yard has unknown moisture content. Ensure thorough mixing for uniform dispersion. When working with natural stone, conduct on-site testing to confirm compatibility and desired outcome.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure accurate batching and thorough mixing to achieve optimal performance. Protect concrete from premature drying and avoid rain exposure for at least 24 hours after application.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in tightly sealed original containers, kept dry and at moderate temperatures out of direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Can be stored in original containers for at least 24 months if stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid temperature extremes below 0°C and above 45°C, as they may cause irreparable damage.
