column32: Efflock Concentrate Additive | Adheseal
column33: Efflock: High-performance liquid additive for cement-based materials, preventing efflorescence, dampness, and salt attack. Concentrated formula, easy to use.
column52:
How to apply Efflock:

  1. For general use, prepare gauging water by mixing 1 part Efflock with 100 parts clean tap water.
  2. Add the pre-mixed gauging water to dry concrete ingredients and proceed as usual.
  3. For tile screed, add Efflock neat to the mechanical mixer at a rate of 0.001% of the mixer capacity.
  4. For surface application, dilute Efflock 1 part to 9 parts water and apply using a soft bristle broom or air pressure sprayer.
  5. Ensure thorough mixing for all applications.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Efflock

Q: What types of materials can Efflock be used with?

A: Efflock is designed for use with cement-based building materials, including tile screed, mortar, grout, render, and concrete. It is suitable for various applications in tiling, brickwork, stonemasonry, and concrete construction.

Q: How does Efflock prevent efflorescence?

A: Efflock creates a hydrophobic molecular structure within the pores of cement-based materials, reducing water absorption. Since efflorescence is caused by water carrying salts to the surface, reducing water ingress prevents efflorescence.

Q: Can Efflock be used with natural stone?

A: Yes, Efflock can be used with natural stone. However, due to the variance in stone porosity and composition, on-site testing is recommended to confirm compatibility and desired outcomes. Pre-sealing of the stone may be necessary.

Q: What is the correct dilution ratio for Efflock?

A: The general dilution ratio is 1 part Efflock to 100 parts water. However, for tile screed, Efflock should be added neat to the mix at a rate of 0.001% of the mixer capacity. Always follow the specific recommendations for each application.

Q: How is Efflock applied?

A: Application methods vary depending on the use case. For mixing in screed, add Efflock during the mixing process. For surface application, use a soft bristle broom or air pressure sprayer. Refer to the product data sheet for detailed instructions.
column54:
Efflock limitations:

  • "Builders Cement" (Type GB) should be avoided when using Efflock. Use General Purpose Cement (Type GP).
  • Efflock does not prevent or contribute to colour consistency and colour retention problems in dark coloured tile grouts.
  • Efflock is not intended to resist head pressure under water.
  • Care should be taken when using sealers in conjunction with Efflock, especially with low porosity stone.
```html

Safety precautions when using Efflock:

  • Handling: Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for safe handling instructions.
  • Storage: Store in tightly sealed original containers, kept dry and at moderate temperatures out of direct sunlight.
  • Disposal: Dispose of any waste chemicals at an authorised chemical disposal facility.

Use MapePUR Universal Foam M/G for: Filling gaps, thermal and sound insulation, and sealing construction features.

MapePUR Universal Foam M/G is a high-quality, one-component expanding polyurethane foam formulated for professional use. Available in both manual (M) and gun (G) application, it's perfect for filling, sealing, and insulating gaps in a wide range of construction applications. This foam provides excellent thermal and sound insulation, adheres strongly to common building materials, and cures rapidly to form a stable, closed-cell structure.

Key Features of MapePUR Universal Foam M/G

  • One-component polyurethane foam.
  • Available in manual (M) and gun (G) application.
  • Excellent thermal and sound insulation.
  • Rapid hardening and stable structure.
  • Adheres to various building materials.
  • Resistant to mould, mildew, and temperature variations (-40°C to +90°C).
  • Can be cut, sanded, drilled, and painted after hardening.
  • CFC-free and ozone-friendly.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane prepolymer, foaming agents, additives.
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +30°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: MapePUR Gun Standard (for G variant), feed tube (for M variant), masking tape, water sprayer.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Shake can thoroughly before use, dampen substrates for better adhesion, fill gaps 50-60% as foam expands. For larger gaps, apply in layers.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Blocked tubes (replace), uneven expansion (shake can more, ensure proper temperature), UV damage (protect cured foam).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store vertically in a dry, covered area between +10°C and +25°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 18 months in original sealed packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not expose to temperatures above +50°C.

Certifications

  • DIN 4102 Flammability Class B3.

Related Products

  • MapePUR Cleaner.
  • MapePUR Gun Standard.

Frequently Asked Questions About MapePUR Universal Foam M/G

  • Can I paint over the cured foam? Yes, once hardened, it can be painted.
  • What is the temperature resistance of the foam? -40°C to +90°C.
  • How do I clean uncured foam? Use MapePUR Cleaner.

  6. For larger gaps, apply in layers.
  7. Spray with water after application.
  8. Cut or sand excess foam after hardening.

column3:
Use DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant for: Structural glazing, panel bonding, facade sealing, and weatherproofing on commercial and residential projects

DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant is a premium, one-part, neutral-cure silicone sealant designed for long-term durability in structural and weatherproofing applications. It offers outstanding unprimed adhesion to a variety of building substrates including glass, aluminium, steel, masonry, stone, and plastics. With its high movement capability (±50%), exceptional UV and weather resistance, and wide service temperature range, DOWSIL™ 795 is ideal for Australian construction environments. Available in multiple standard colours with custom options, it ensures both performance and aesthetic compatibility for facade systems and curtain walls.

Key Features of DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant

  • Excellent unprimed adhesion to most construction materials including anodised and painted aluminium
  • ±50% movement capability for superior joint flexibility
  • Outstanding UV, weather, and temperature resistance from -40°C to 149°C
  • Low VOC content (30 g/L) for safer indoor air quality compliance
  • Non-sagging formula allows easy vertical and overhead applications

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: One-part, neutral-cure, RTV silicone
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 50°C (41°F to 122°F)
  • Movement Capability: ±50% joint movement
  • Service Temperature Range: -40°C to 149°C (-40°F to 300°F)
  • Hardness (Shore A): 35
  • Tack-Free Time: Approx. 3 hours
  • Full Cure Time: 7–14 days at 25°C and 50% RH
  • VOC Content: 30 g/L (SCAQMD compliant)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Standard caulking gun, masking tape, joint backer rod, tooling spatula
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always test adhesion on porous substrates; use masking for clean lines
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If curing is delayed, check ambient humidity; avoid applying to wet surfaces or during rain

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store below 27°C in a dry, well-ventilated area
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from manufacturing date in original unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid prolonged storage above 27°C

Certifications

  • ASTM C920 Type S, Grade NS, Class 50
  • ASTM C1184 Structural Silicone
  • CAN2-19.13-M82 (Canada)
  • TT-S-00230C and TT-S-001543A (Federal Specifications)

column32: DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Sealant – Structural & Weatherproof | Adheseal
column33: High-performance silicone sealant for structural glazing and weather sealing. Bonds to glass, metal, stone & more.
column52:
How to apply DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant:

  1. Clean surfaces to remove dust, oils, old sealants, or coatings
  2. Install backer rod or joint filler as required
  3. Mask off areas to create neat sealant lines
  4. Apply sealant with positive pressure using a caulking gun
  5. Tool sealant within 15 minutes to ensure proper adhesion and finish
  6. Remove masking immediately after tooling
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant

Q: How do I apply DOWSIL™ 795 to vertical panels or overhead joints?

A: Use a caulking gun with a consistent bead and tool within 15 minutes before skin forms. Apply masking tape for neater lines and remove immediately after tooling.

Q: How durable is DOWSIL™ 795 in extreme Australian climates?

A: DOWSIL™ 795 is engineered to withstand UV, rain, salt air, and extreme temperatures from -40°C to 149°C, making it ideal for Australia’s harsh environmental conditions.

Q: Is DOWSIL™ 795 compatible with painted aluminium and coated glass?

A: Yes, it adheres well to anodised, alodined, and many Kynar-painted aluminium surfaces. Always test unfamiliar substrates to ensure adhesion.

Q: Why is my sealant not curing properly?

A: Ensure sufficient humidity is present and avoid sealing in confined joints. Cure time is 7–14 days, but factors like temperature and ventilation may affect performance.

Q: Is this product safe to use indoors?

A: Yes, it has a low VOC rating of 30 g/L and cures with a low-odour byproduct, making it safe for most indoor applications when used with adequate ventilation.
column54:
DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for underwater or below-grade applications
  • Should not be painted – paint will not adhere to cured silicone
  • Do not apply to surfaces that bleed oils or solvents
  • Not recommended for totally confined joints without air exposure

Safety precautions when using DOWSIL™ 795 Silicone Building Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Apply in well-ventilated areas to avoid fume build-up
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; do not ingest
  • Dispose of waste and containers according to local regulations

Use DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant for: Sealing curtain walls, glazing joints, and expansion joints on commercial façades and building exteriors.

DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant is a premium, one-part, neutral-cure RTV silicone sealant designed specifically for weather-sealing applications in commercial construction. Engineered for maximum flexibility, it handles joint movement up to ±50% and delivers long-term adhesion on both porous and non-porous surfaces like glass, aluminium, masonry, and steel. With exceptional weather resistance, including UV, rain, and temperature extremes, this sealant is ideal for use in Australian climates and building codes. Its non-sag, low-string formulation makes application easy and precise.

Key Features of DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant

  • ±50% movement capability for superior flexibility in dynamic joints
  • Excellent unprimed adhesion to most substrates including aluminium, masonry, and coated glass
  • Outstanding weather resistance – unaffected by UV, ozone, rain, or snow
  • Non-sag, easy-to-gun formula for clean application and tooling
  • Available in 8 standard colours with custom colour options

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: One-part, neutral-cure RTV silicone
  • Application Temperature Range: 4°C to 40°C (39°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -50°C to 150°C (-58°F to 302°F)
  • Joint Movement Capability: ±50%
  • VOC Content: 45 g/L
  • Colours: Black, Grey, Dark Grey, Metal Grey, Bronze, Limestone, Precast White, White

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Standard or air-operated caulking guns, joint backing material, masking tape
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Tool within 15 minutes for optimal bead shape and surface contact
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying on wet or frost-laden surfaces; ensure surfaces are clean and dry for best adhesion

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store below 30°C in original sealed container
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not store in freezing or excessively hot conditions

Certifications

  • ASTM C920 Type S, Grade NS, Class 50
  • ISO 11600 F&G-25LM
  • EN15651-1/2:2012 – European Standard

How to apply DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant:

  1. Clean all surfaces thoroughly to remove dust, oil, old sealant, or coatings.
  2. Install backer rod or joint filler to maintain optimal joint depth.
  3. Mask adjacent surfaces to ensure clean sealant lines.
  4. Apply sealant in a continuous bead using a caulking gun or pneumatic dispenser.
  5. Tool the bead within 15 minutes to ensure complete surface contact and aesthetic finish.
  6. Remove masking tape before skin forms on the sealant.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant

Q: How should DOWSIL 791 be applied for best results?

A: Clean and dry all joint surfaces thoroughly. Install suitable backing material and apply the sealant in a continuous motion using a caulking gun. Tool within 15 minutes before skin formation to ensure proper bonding and finish.

Q: How does this product perform in extreme weather conditions?

A: DOWSIL 791 performs exceptionally in both hot and cold Australian climates. It offers excellent UV resistance, withstands heavy rain, and maintains elasticity from -50°C to 150°C, making it ideal for external building joints.

Q: Is DOWSIL 791 compatible with porous and non-porous materials?

A: Yes, it adheres well to a wide variety of substrates including aluminium, coated glass, masonry, and galvanised steel without the need for primer in most cases. For porous surfaces, a test placement is recommended.

Q: What are common issues and how can they be avoided?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Do not apply in confined joints or on wet/frosty surfaces. Use backing rods to control joint depth and avoid three-sided adhesion for optimal movement.

Q: Is it safe to use and dispose of DOWSIL 791?

A: Use personal protective equipment and ensure good ventilation during application. Dispose of containers and unused material according to local regulations. Refer to the SDS for full safety guidance.
column54:
DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for structural glazing applications
  • Do not use below-grade or in submerged applications
  • Incompatible with surfaces that bleed oils, plasticisers, or solvents
  • Not intended for paint-over finishes – paint typically does not adhere
  • Do not use in totally confined joints; requires moisture to cure
  • Avoid application on frost-laden or excessively hot surfaces (>50°C)

Safety precautions when using DOWSIL 791 Silicone Weatherproofing Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves, safety glasses, and long sleeves
  • Ventilation: Apply in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhaling fumes
  • Handling: Do not eat, drink, or smoke when handling the product; wash hands thoroughly
  • Refer to SDS for detailed hazard and first aid information

Use Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture for: Enhancing adhesion, water resistance, durability, and flexibility of cement-based compounds used in demanding environments.

Gripset 11Y is a concentrated SBR latex polymer admixture developed to significantly improve the performance of cement-based screeds, mortars, renders, and patching systems. Designed for areas exposed to weather, immersion, and subterranean conditions, Gripset 11Y delivers enhanced adhesion, waterproofing, durability, and crack resistance. It reduces permeability and shrinkage while increasing early strength gain. Ideal for professional use in commercial and residential construction, it serves as both a primer and an additive in high-performance cement mixes.

Key Features of Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture

  • Improves adhesion to a wide range of substrates for long-lasting results
  • Increases waterproofing capabilities for use in immersed and underground areas
  • Enhances resistance to cracking, frost, salts, and aggressive environments
  • Reduces shrinkage and permeability in screeds and renders
  • Improves durability under freeze/thaw cycles and harsh climates

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Concentrated SBR Latex Polymer
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Form: Thin liquid
  • Colour: White
  • Coverage: 1 litre covers approximately 3m² as a primer slurry

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Electric mixer with paddle, brush, roller, broom, or squeegee
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply render or screed onto wet or damp primer for best adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For surfaces with active moisture, pre-treat with Gripset E60 to avoid adhesion failures

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry area off concrete floors and away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original unopened container
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing and extreme heat

Certifications

  • Manufactured in accordance with relevant Australian Standards
  • Suitable for use in compliance with AS 3958 for tiling systems

column32: Gripset 11Y | High-Performance SBR Latex Admixture | Adheseal
column33: Boost adhesion, strength, and waterproofing in cement mixes with Gripset 11Y – ideal for wet, immersed, and underground areas.
column52:
How to apply Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture:

  1. Clean the substrate thoroughly—remove dust, oil, coatings, and contaminants
  2. Mix 1 part Gripset 11Y with 1 part cement and 1 part washed sand to create slurry
  3. Apply slurry to substrate using a brush, broom, roller, or squeegee
  4. For screeds/renders, mix 1 part cement and 4 parts sand, then combine with a liquid blend of 1 part 11Y and 3 parts water
  5. Apply while primer is still wet or tacky to ensure strong adhesion (“wet on wet” method)
  6. Allow to cure per system requirements, and protect from early exposure to water or frost
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture

Q: How do I apply Gripset 11Y as a primer?

A: Mix Gripset 11Y with equal parts of washed sand and cement to form a slurry. Apply with a brush, roller, broom, or squeegee to achieve a 1mm film. For best results, apply subsequent layers while the primer is still damp.

Q: How does Gripset 11Y improve performance in wet areas?

A: Gripset 11Y enhances waterproofing and reduces permeability in cement-based systems, making it ideal for submerged and continuously wet environments like bathrooms, pools, and basements.

Q: Is Gripset 11Y compatible with existing membranes or coatings?

A: Yes, it can be applied over Gripset membranes and acrylic coatings. However, surface preparation is critical, and suitability should be confirmed with RLA Technical for other coatings or paints.

Q: What should I do if adhesion is poor or uneven?

A: Ensure proper surface cleaning and priming. Surfaces must be sound, clean, and free from contaminants. If moisture issues exist, pre-treat with Gripset E60 for effective moisture control.

Q: Are there any special safety considerations when using Gripset 11Y?

A: Wear gloves, eye protection, and use in a well-ventilated area. Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for full safety information and disposal guidelines.
column54:
Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture limitations:

  • Not suitable for use on glass, glazed surfaces, or raw steel without specific preparation
  • Do not use in areas subject to rising damp unless pre-treated with Gripset E60
  • Not intended as a stand-alone waterproof membrane
  • Do not apply over poorly prepared or contaminated substrates

Safety precautions when using Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas or with mechanical ventilation if indoors
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; wash thoroughly after handling
  • Do not eat, drink, or smoke during application; refer to SDS for disposal and first aid measures
column55: Gripset 11Y is a high-performance SBR latex additive that enhances adhesion, water resistance, and durability in cement-based applications.
column56:
Gripset 11Y can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete and masonry surfaces

Use Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture for:

  • Improving adhesion and water resistance in cement-based tile adhesives and grouts

Why Use Gripset 11Y Latex Polymer Admixture:

  • Boosts durability and strength in cementitious mixes for longer-lasting installations
  • Reduces water penetration, preventing efflorescence and structural damage
  • Increases flexibility and resistance to cracking and movement
  • Delivers outstanding adhesion even in harsh or immersed conditions

column3:
Use RLA Universal Primer for: Priming porous and non-porous substrates like concrete and tiles to ensure strong adhesion of levelling compounds and adhesives

RLA Universal Primer is a rapid-drying, solvent-free, water-based acrylic primer specifically designed for professional application on both porous and non-porous substrates. Its low VOC formulation makes it ideal for indoor environments and compliant with Australian safety standards. Whether you're working on ceramic tiles, burnished concrete, or painted surfaces, this primer ensures enhanced adhesion for levelling compounds and cement-based tile adhesives. Easy to apply and quick to cure, it's perfect for busy Australian trade professionals needing reliable performance with minimal downtime.

Key Features of RLA Universal Primer

  • Water-based, low VOC formula for safer indoor use
  • Compatible with porous and non-porous substrates including tiles and painted surfaces
  • Rapid-drying – ready to use in as little as 30 minutes
  • Enhances adhesion of levelling compounds and adhesives
  • Easy to apply with roller or brush

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Water-based acrylic
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Coverage Rate: 5 to 10 m² per litre depending on substrate porosity
  • Drying Time: 30 to 60 minutes at 23°C (73°F)
  • Shelf Life: 12 months in unopened container

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Roller or brush (e.g., Monarch or Uni-Pro)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For very porous substrates, use a second diluted coat for optimal absorption
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For glossy tiles, avoid application or use light sanding for improved adhesion

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry area off the ground
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from production in original unopened container
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not store or apply in conditions below 5°C or above 35°C

Certifications

  • VOC Compliant – Meets Australian environmental standards
  • ASTM F2170 – Moisture testing compatibility
column7: acrylic, ASTM F2170, ceramics, concrete, construction, container, fast cure, flooring-i, industrial, internal, low voc, manufacturing, painted surfaces, primer, solvent free, tiling, tiling-i, water cleanup, waterproof membranes-s
column32: RLA Universal Primer - Water-Based Acrylic | Adheseal
column33: Low-VOC water-based acrylic primer for porous and non-porous surfaces. Quick-drying and compatible with tile adhesives and levelling compounds.
column52:
How to apply RLA Universal Primer:

  1. Identify substrate as porous or non-porous using the water-drop method
  2. For porous surfaces, dilute 1:2 (primer to water) and apply with roller
  3. For non-porous surfaces, apply neat (undiluted) directly
  4. Allow drying to a transparent film (30–60 minutes)
  5. Proceed with application of levelling compounds or adhesives
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA Universal Primer

Q: How should I apply RLA Universal Primer on porous concrete?

A: Dilute 1 part primer with 2 parts clean water and apply with a roller or brush. For very porous surfaces, a second coat diluted 1:3 may be needed. Allow to cure for 30 minutes.

Q: How fast does RLA Universal Primer dry?

A: It dries in approximately 30 to 60 minutes at 23°C depending on substrate porosity and ambient conditions. The film should be transparent and tack-free before proceeding.

Q: Is this primer compatible with ceramic tiles?

A: Yes, but only on water-based painted or matte ceramic tiles. Avoid glossy or wax-coated tiles unless lightly sanded to enhance adhesion.

Q: What if the primer isn’t adhering well?

A: Ensure the surface is properly cleaned and abraded if necessary. For non-porous substrates, use the primer undiluted and allow full drying before overlaying.

Q: What safety precautions should I follow?

A: Wear gloves, eye protection, and ensure good ventilation. Avoid inhaling vapours and contact with skin or eyes. Always follow Australian safety regulations and use PPE.
column54:
RLA Universal Primer limitations:

  • Do not apply on glossy or wax-coated ceramic tiles
  • Not suitable for external applications or substrates with rising damp
  • Drying time may be extended in cold or high humidity conditions

Safety precautions when using RLA Universal Primer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, goggles, respiratory protection
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas only
  • Handling: Avoid contact with eyes and skin; do not inhale vapours
  • Store out of reach of children and keep sealed when not in use
column55: RLA Universal Primer is a rapid-drying water-based acrylic primer for porous/non-porous surfaces. Excellent adhesion, easy application, and low VOC content for professional use.

column3:
Use RLA TruLevel BulkFill UT for: High-build levelling of concrete floors, correcting uneven surfaces, and preparing for various floor coverings.

RLA TruLevel BulkFill UT is a premium, high-build self-levelling compound designed for internal concrete substrates. It efficiently corrects surface irregularities from 3mm to 70mm, providing a smooth, durable base for diverse flooring installations. This cementitious underlayment is formulated for rapid setting and high mechanical strength, making it ideal for trade professionals seeking a reliable and efficient levelling solution. Suitable for carpet, tiles, and floating floors, TruLevel BulkFill UT ensures quick installation and excellent surface preparation.

Key Features

  • High-build capability: 3mm to 70mm thickness in a single application.
  • Rapid setting and hardening: Walkable in 3-4 hours, ready for flooring in 24-36 hours.
  • Excellent flow properties for smooth, even surfaces.
  • High mechanical resistance and compressive strength.
  • Pumpable for efficient large-area applications.
  • Compatible with underfloor heating systems.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Rapid setting and hydrating cement, graded silica sand, resins, and additives.
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Drill with mixing paddle, gauge rake, stand-up spreader, or trowel.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for 3 minutes to avoid lumps. Prime porous and non-porous surfaces correctly. Do not overwater the mix.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Pinholes on porous surfaces (apply a second primer coat), bleeding and separation (avoid overwatering).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry area off the ground, in original unopened packaging.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage and application.

Certifications

  • EN 13813: CT-C30-F6.

Related Products

  • RLA Universal Primer
  • RLA Moisture Seal
  • RLA TruLevel EconoPro
  • RLA TruLevel TuffTop

Application Guide

  1. Prepare the substrate: Clean, dry, and sound.
  2. Prime the substrate with RLA Universal Primer (diluted for porous, neat for non-porous).
  3. Mix RLA TruLevel BulkFill UT with 3.6-3.8 litres of clean water for 3 minutes.
  4. Apply the mixture using a gauge rake, spreader, or trowel at the desired thickness (3-70mm).
  5. Allow 3-4 hours for setting and 24-36 hours before installing floor coverings.
  6. For vinyl or rubber flooring, apply a 2-3mm coat of TruLevel EconoPro or TuffTop.
column54:

Use RLA TruLevel Fine Finish for: Smoothing uneven internal floors, preparing surfaces for carpet and vinyl, and rapid floor repairs.

RLA TruLevel Fine Finish is a high-quality, rapid-drying cement-based underlayment designed for Australian trade professionals. It provides a smooth, even surface for various internal substrates, allowing for quick and efficient floor covering installations. With excellent coverage and easy application, this product is ideal for residential and commercial projects, ensuring a flawless finish every time.

Key Features of RLA TruLevel Fine Finish

  • Rapid Drying: Allows floor coverings to be installed after just 20 minutes, reducing project downtime.
  • Excellent Coverage: A 5kg bag covers approximately 10m² at 1mm thickness, minimizing material usage.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for feather edge to 3mm thickness, accommodating various floor leveling needs.
  • Low VOC: GEV Emicode EC1 Plus certified, ensuring a healthier working environment.

Why Choose RLA TruLevel Fine Finish:

  • Time-Saving: Fast drying time speeds up project completion.
  • Cost-Effective: Excellent coverage reduces material costs.
  • Easy Application: Mixes easily with water and applies smoothly.
  • Reliable Finish: Provides a smooth, even surface for perfect floor coverings.

When to Choose RLA TruLevel Fine Finish versus Alternatives:

  • Choose RLA TruLevel Fine Finish over standard underlayments when: Rapid drying is critical for project timelines.
  • Consider other options when: External applications are required or expansion joints are present.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: RLA TruLevel Fine Finish offers faster drying and better coverage, reducing overall project time and material costs.

Trade-Specific Applications for RLA TruLevel Fine Finish:

For Floor Layers:

  • Smoothing uneven concrete floors before laying vinyl or carpet, using a trowel for even application.
  • Compatible with concrete and Masonite substrates commonly found in Australian homes.
  • Ensures a smooth, level surface for perfect flooring installations.

For Builders:

  • Patching minor defects and leveling concrete slabs in new construction and refurbishment projects.
  • Suitable for internal concrete and masonry substrates.
  • Provides a stable and even base for subsequent flooring applications.

Technical Overview

RLA TruLevel Fine Finish is a cement-based skim smoothing compound designed for rapid drying and easy application. Its unique formulation provides excellent coverage and a smooth finish, ideal for preparing internal substrates for various floor coverings. The low VOC content ensures a safe and healthy working environment.

Chemical Properties: Cement-based compound with rapid-drying additives.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C, suitable for most Australian internal environments.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing pail, trowel, measuring jug, and mixing drill.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Mix thoroughly for 3-4 minutes to avoid lumps. Do not overwater.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying over expansion joints to prevent reflective cracking. Ensure substrates are free of rising damp.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, cool place.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.

Certifications and Compliance

  • GEV Emicode EC1 Plus: Ensures very low VOC emissions.
  • Australian Standard 1884-2021: Guidelines for resilient floor covering installations.

How to apply RLA TruLevel Fine Finish:

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Prime the surface (if needed): Apply RLA Universal Primer for porous substrates.
  3. Mix the compound: Combine 1 part water with 3 parts powder and mix for 3-4 minutes.
  4. Apply the compound: Use a trowel to apply a single coat from feather edge to 3mm.
  5. Allow to set: Wait approximately 20 minutes before installing floor coverings.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA TruLevel Fine Finish

Q: How long does RLA TruLevel Fine Finish take to dry?

A: It dries rapidly, allowing floor coverings to be installed approximately 20 minutes after application at 20°C.

Q: Can I use this product for external applications?

A: No, RLA TruLevel Fine Finish is designed for internal use only. External applications are not recommended.

Q: What is the maximum thickness I can apply?

A: The maximum application thickness is 3mm. It can also be applied at a feather edge for minor leveling.

Q: How much coverage does a 5kg bag provide?

A: A 5kg bag covers approximately 10m² at a 1mm thickness.

Q: Does this product have a strong odor?

A: No, RLA TruLevel Fine Finish is GEV Emicode EC1 Plus certified, meaning it has very low VOC emissions and minimal odor.

Q: Do I need to prime the substrate before applying?

A: Generally, priming is not required. However, for porous substrates, RLA Universal Primer is recommended, mixed 1 part primer to 2 parts water.

RLA TruLevel Fine Finish limitations:

  • Do not apply on substrates with rising dampness.
  • Do not apply over expansion joints.
  • Drying times can be extended in cold ambient temperatures.
  • Do not allow contact with water during or after curing.

Safety precautions when using RLA TruLevel Fine Finish:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear respiratory protection, eye protection, and gloves.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Do not eat, drink, or smoke while using.

Use Maxisafe P2 Moulded Respirator with Valve for: Reducing exposure to hazardous particles in dusty, welding, grinding, and medical environments

The Maxisafe P2 Moulded Respirator with Valve (RES504) delivers reliable protection and comfort for trade professionals working in demanding environments. Engineered with a pre-moulded design, this respirator fits a wide variety of face shapes and includes an exhalation valve for improved airflow and reduced heat build-up. Certified to AS/NZS 1716, it safeguards against both mechanically and thermally generated particles, making it ideal for welding, sanding, grinding, and medical applications. Its pre-formed nose bridge minimises leaks, while twin straps ensure a secure, comfortable fit.

Key Features of Maxisafe P2 Moulded Respirator with Valve

  • P2 rating for effective filtration of hazardous airborne particles
  • Exhalation valve increases airflow, reducing heat and moisture build-up
  • Pre-moulded design fits most face profiles comfortably
  • Pre-formed nose bridge minimises risk of leaks for enhanced safety
  • Twin strap system ensures a firm, secure fit during active use
  • Certified to AS/NZS 1716 for trusted respiratory protection

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Suitable for use in environments with mechanically and thermally generated particles
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Certification: AS/NZS 1716 Lic SMKH 20566

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: No tools required; ready-to-use disposable respirator
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use in combination with safety goggles in high-dust areas for full protection
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper strap tension to avoid leaks; replace if respirator becomes damaged or breathing becomes difficult

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a clean, dry environment away from direct sunlight and chemicals
  • Shelf Life Information: 3 years from the date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

How to apply Maxisafe P2 Moulded Respirator with Valve:

  1. Remove respirator from packaging without touching the filter area.
  2. Place over nose and mouth with nose bridge at the top.
  3. Pull the top strap over your head and position above your ears.
  4. Pull the bottom strap over your head and position below your ears.
  5. Adjust nose bridge to ensure a tight seal and check for any leaks.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Maxisafe P2 Moulded Respirator with Valve

Q: How should I properly wear the Maxisafe P2 Respirator?

A: Ensure the respirator covers both nose and mouth completely. Adjust the twin straps for a firm fit and mould the nose bridge to minimise leaks.

Q: How effective is the valve in improving comfort?

A: The exhalation valve facilitates easier breathing and reduces heat and moisture build-up, making it more comfortable during extended wear.

Q: Is this respirator compatible with safety glasses or goggles?

A: Yes, its slim profile and secure fit allow compatibility with most safety glasses and goggles used in trade environments.

Q: What should I do if I notice the respirator leaking?

A: Refit the respirator by adjusting the straps and re-moulding the nose bridge. Replace it if leaks persist or it becomes damaged.

Q: How should I dispose of the used respirator safely?

A: Dispose of used respirators in accordance with local regulations. Do not reuse disposable masks, and avoid touching the filter area when discarding.

Designed for Australian trade professionals, these earmuffs feature lightweight yet durable construction, ensuring comfort over long shifts. Soft foam ear cushions provide a secure fit, while the slide and swivel cup system enhances adjustability for superior wearability. Ideal for use in conjunction with hard hats, the HBE635 earmuffs are suited to a wide range of applications including construction, landscaping, transport, and light manufacturing. Maximise protection and comfort with Maxisafe’s trusted performance.

Key Features of Maxisafe Class 5 Earmuff HBE635

  • Class 5 hearing protection with SLC80 29dB noise reduction rating
  • Lightweight design ensures all-day comfort during extended use
  • Shock-resistant build for long-term durability in tough conditions
  • Slide and swivel ear cups for optimal fit and enhanced comfort
  • Compatible with hard hats for versatile usage across trades

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Non-reactive polymer shell with soft foam ear cushions
  • Application Temperature Range: -10°C to 50°C (14°F to 122°F)
  • Noise Reduction Rating: Class 5, SLC80 29dB
  • Compliance: Meets AS/NZS 1270:2002 standards

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: None required for use
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For optimal comfort, adjust slide and swivel cups before wearing under hard hats
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure ear cushions are sealed over ears to maintain noise reduction; replace worn cushions to retain effectiveness

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and contaminants
  • Shelf Life Information: 5 years from manufacture when stored correctly
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid exposure to temperatures exceeding 50°C (122°F)

Certifications

A: Yes, they are designed for behind-the-head wear, allowing compatibility with hard hats and other head protection gear commonly used on job sites.

column3:
Use MaxiPlug Corded Earplugs HEC644 for: Protecting hearing in high-noise environments such as construction, manufacturing, and mining

MaxiPlug Corded Earplugs HEC644 are premium hearing protection devices designed for use in loud environments across various trades. With Class 5 protection and a high SLC80 rating of 26dB, these earplugs are ideal for construction sites, manufacturing plants, and mining operations. Made from soft polyurethane foam, they ensure comfort even during extended wear, while the tapered design offers an easy and secure fit. Each pair is individually bagged for hygiene and convenience, with 100 pairs provided per dispenser. Compliant with AS/NZS 1270:2002 standards, MaxiPlug offers reliable protection for Australian trade professionals.

Key Features of MaxiPlug Corded Earplugs HEC644

  • Class 5 protection with 26dB SLC80 rating for extreme noise reduction
  • Soft polyurethane foam ensures long-lasting comfort during extended use
  • Sealed surface prevents contamination from foreign bodies
  • Tapered ergonomic design allows easy insertion and secure fit

column52:
How to apply MaxiPlug Corded Earplugs HEC644:

  1. Ensure hands are clean before handling earplugs.
  2. Roll the earplug between your fingers to compress the foam fully.
  3. With your opposite hand, pull the top of your ear upward and outward to straighten the ear canal.
  4. Insert the plug deeply into the ear canal and hold for approximately 60 seconds for the foam to expand.
  5. Test the seal by cupping hands over ears—noticeable noise reduction indicates proper fit.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About MaxiPlug Corded Earplugs HEC644

Q: How should MaxiPlug Corded Earplugs be properly inserted?

A: Roll the foam tightly between your fingers, then pull the top of your ear upward and insert the plug. Hold in place for 60 seconds to allow full expansion for an optimal seal.

Q: How effective are these earplugs in high-noise environments?

A: With a Class 5 rating and SLC80 of 26dB, these earplugs offer top-tier protection in industrial settings, reducing harmful noise exposure significantly.

Q: Are these earplugs compatible with other PPE like helmets or earmuffs?

A: Yes, the low-profile, corded design ensures compatibility with hard hats, earmuffs, and other PPE without interference or discomfort.

Q: What should I do if the earplugs don’t seem to block noise effectively?

A: Re-check insertion technique. Ensure foam is rolled tightly, inserted fully, and allowed to expand. Inadequate fit can compromise effectiveness.

Q: How should used earplugs be disposed of safely?

A: Dispose of used earplugs in general waste. Do not reuse. Wash hands after handling used plugs and avoid sharing between users for hygiene.
column54:

  • Ventilation: Not applicable; no vapours or emissions
  • Handling: Do not share earplugs between users; dispose of after use

column2: Everflex Aquaban Under Tile Class 3 Waterproof Membrane
column3:
Use Everflex Aqua-Ban for: Waterproofing bathrooms, balconies, patios, and wet areas under tiles.

Everflex Aqua-Ban is a high-performance, single-component elastomeric waterproof membrane specifically designed for under-tile applications. It is a ready-to-use, water-based, SBR-reinforced formula that provides a durable, seamless, and flexible barrier against moisture. Tested to comply with AS-4858:2004 and AS-4654.1 standards, this Class 3 waterproofing membrane ensures long-term reliability for both internal and external wet areas.

Key Features of Everflex Aqua-Ban

  • Class 3 waterproofing – High flexibility and crack resistance.
  • Self-reinforced elastomeric formula for superior adhesion.
  • Rapid drying, allowing for faster tiling application.
  • Water-based, low VOC, and environmentally friendly.
  • Excellent adhesion to common building materials.
  • Compatible with most tile adhesives and waterproofing systems.
  • Resistant to re-emulsification when immersed in water.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Styrene-Butadiene Rubber (SBR) elastomeric membrane.
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F).
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 80°C (-40°F to 176°F).
  • Dry Film Thickness: Minimum 1mm DFT.
  • Coverage: 1.5L/m² per coat (minimum two coats required).
  • Recoat Time: 2-4 hours after touch dry.
  • Final Curing Time: 48 hours before tiling.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Roller, brush, film thickness gauge.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always apply coats at right angles for even coverage.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application on damp substrates to prevent adhesion failure.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life: Minimum 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from freezing and extreme heat.

Certifications

  • Tested to AS-4858:2004 and AS-4654.1.
  • Complies with National Construction Code (NCC).
  • Green Star compliant with low VOC emissions.

column33: Everflex Aqua-Ban is a high-performance Class 3 waterproofing membrane for under-tile applications, ensuring durability and compliance with AS-4858.
column52:
How to apply Everflex Aqua-Ban:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Prime porous surfaces with Everflex WBP or VBS.
  3. Apply the first coat with a brush or roller at 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  4. Once touch-dry, apply a second coat at a right angle to the first.
  5. Allow 48 hours curing time before tiling.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex Aqua-Ban

Q: Can Everflex Aqua-Ban be used in shower recesses?

A: Yes, it is specifically designed for wet areas, including bathrooms, shower recesses, and laundries.

Q: How long should I wait before tiling over Everflex Aqua-Ban?

A: The membrane requires approximately 48 hours of curing time before tiling.
column54:
Everflex Aqua-Ban limitations:

  • Not designed for prolonged UV exposure—must be tiled over.
  • Not suitable for areas with rising damp or negative hydrostatic pressure.
  • Do not apply on wet or contaminated surfaces.

column2: Megapoxy 254 - Non-Sag Epoxy Filling and Adhesive Paste
column3:
Use Megapoxy 254 for: bonding precast concrete, metal, stone, and repairs to concrete, fiberglass, and more.

Megapoxy 254 is a specially formulated, non-sag epoxy filling and adhesive paste designed for a wide range of applications. This two-part epoxy system, with a simple 1:1 mixing ratio, sets after mixing to provide excellent properties. It is VOC-free, ensuring a safer application. Megapoxy 254 will not stain or discolor white or light-colored marble and ceramics when properly mixed.

Key Features of Megapoxy 254

  • Simple 1:1 mixing ratio by volume.
  • Non-sag formulation for vertical and overhead applications.
  • VOC-free.
  • Adheres and cures under adverse conditions (cold and damp).
  • High strength permanent bonds.
  • Excellent tensile and compressive strengths.
  • Excellent chemical resistance.
  • Flash point above 200°C.

Recommended Applications

  • Bonding: Precast concrete, metal to metal or concrete, grouting bolts, natural stones, bricks and ceramics, compressed cement sheet.
  • Filling and Repair: Concrete pipes and tanks, fiberglass articles, concrete floors and stairs, concrete columns, in-situ formed concrete, flush-filling countersunk screws in fiber cement sheet.

Technical Overview

  • Mixing Ratio: 1 Part A to 1 Part B by volume.
  • Work Time at 25°C: 45 minutes.
  • Minimum Cure Time at 15°C: 48 hours.
  • Minimum Cure Time at 25°C: 24 hours.
  • Minimum Cure Time at 35°C: 12 hours.
  • Minimum Application Temperature: 10°C.
  • Maximum Operating Temperature: 70°C.
  • Colour: White (Part A & Part B, mixed).

Cured Properties

  • Compressive Strength (ASTM D695-23): 70 MPa.
  • Bond Strength Concrete (ASTM 4541): >3 MPa.
  • Tensile Bond Strength Steel (ASTM D897-08): 20 MPa.
  • Modulus of Elasticity (ASTM D695): 2 GPa.
  • Flexural Strength (ASTM D790-17): 38 MPa.
  • Tensile Strength (ASTM D638-22): 22 MPa.
  • Tensile Shear Strength (ASTM D1002-10): 13 MPa.
  • Hardness (Shore D, ASTM D2240-00): 70.
  • Coefficient of Linear Thermal Expansion: 70.4 x 10^-6 (mm/mm/°C).
  • Dielectric Strength (50Hz @25°C): 190 Kv/cm.

Surface Preparation

  • Concrete: Clean, remove laitance (mechanical abrasion or acid etching), dry for 24 hours.
  • Metal Surfaces: Grit blast to AS CK 9.4 - 1964 Class 3, or mechanically abrade and degrease.
  • Coated Surfaces: Remove coatings (flame cleaning, mechanical treatment, paint stripper, grit blasting).

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, trowel, gloves, safety glasses.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure accurate 1:1 mixing ratio and thorough mixing. Prepare surfaces properly. Clean tools with Megapoxy Thinners.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete curing (proper mixing), poor adhesion (surface preparation), discoloration (thorough mixing).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to packaging.

column3:
Use Hi-Flex 50 for: General construction sealing, waterproofing, and bonding diverse materials with excellent flexibility and durability.

Hi-Flex 50 is a premium, single-component elastomeric joint sealant based on advanced MS Polymer technology. Its neutral cure, high modulus, and exceptional movement capabilities make it perfect for demanding construction and industrial applications. This sealant provides excellent adhesion to most common substrates without the need for priming, ensuring efficient and reliable results.

Key Features of Hi-Flex 50

  • Outstanding Adhesion: Primer-less adhesion to non-porous substrates, simplifying application.
  • High Flexibility: Movement capability of +/- 25%, accommodating building movement.
  • Excellent UV Resistance: Ensures long-term durability under harsh Australian conditions.
  • Low VOC: Meets "green star" environmental criteria, ensuring safety and sustainability.

Why Choose Hi-Flex 50:

  • Versatility: Suitable for a wide range of applications, from construction to automotive and marine.
  • Durability: Resists mould, mildew, and weathering, ensuring long-term performance.
  • Ease of Application: User-friendly, non-slump formula for easy gunning and tooling.
  • Reliability: Non-corrosive and compatible with various building materials.

When to Choose Hi-Flex 50 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Hi-Flex 50 over silicone sealants when: Superior adhesion to a wider range of substrates is required, especially on non-porous materials, due to its advanced MS Polymer formulation.
  • Consider other options when: Long-term water immersion is a primary requirement, as Hi-Flex 50 is not suitable for such applications.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Hi-Flex 50 offers excellent durability and reduced application time due to primer-less adhesion, providing better long-term value compared to standard sealants.

Trade-Specific Applications for Hi-Flex 50:

For Builders and Carpenters:

  • Sealing joints in prefabricated buildings and concrete panels, ensuring weatherproofing.
  • Bonding lightweight components and acoustic ceiling tiles, providing a strong and flexible seal.
  • Sealing materials with different thermal expansion coefficients, preventing cracks and leaks.

For Automotive and Marine Trades:

  • Bonding and sealing automotive and marine components, ensuring durability and water resistance.
  • Seam sealing and bolted lap joints, providing a reliable and flexible seal.
  • Adhering display signs and fibreglass components, maintaining structural integrity.

Technical Overview

Hi-Flex 50 is a high-performance, single-component MS Polymer sealant designed for various construction and industrial applications. Its neutral cure, high flexibility, and excellent adhesion properties make it a reliable choice for sealing and bonding diverse materials. The low VOC content and UV resistance ensure long-term performance and environmental safety.

Type of Product: MS Polymer, providing high flexibility and durability.

Movement Capability: +/- 25%, accommodating building movement and thermal expansion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, masking tape, spatula, cleaning cloths, and Xylene.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Use a backing rod for deep joints. Apply sealant in a continuous bead for optimal adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Bubbling can occur in high humidity; ensure proper surface preparation and avoid air entrapment. Discoloration can occur on copper and brass; perform compatibility tests.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Apply at temperatures between 5°C and 40°C.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Low VOC meets "green star" environmental criteria.
  • Non-staining as per ASTM C510 & ASTM C1248.
  • Refer to the product’s Material Safety Data Sheet and any relevant Australian Standards for specific compliance information.

column32: Hi-Flex 50 | MS Polymer Hybrid Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Hi-Flex 50: High-performance MS Polymer sealant. Excellent adhesion, flexibility, and UV resistance for diverse construction applications.
column52:
How to apply Hi-Flex 50:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Use the two-wipe process for impervious substrates and allow concrete to cure for at least 28 days.
  2. Priming (If Required): For optimal adhesion on porous substrates, use Everflex Supaprime. For non-porous substrates, use Adheseal 50A surface prep. Allow 30 minutes to 2 hours before applying the sealant.
  3. Joint Design: Aim for a 2:1 width-to-depth ratio. Use a backing rod for joints deeper than 10mm and bond breaker tape for flat joints to prevent three-sided adhesion.
  4. Application: Cut the nozzle at a 45° angle for sealing or 90° for adhesive applications. Apply sealant in a continuous bead, ensuring good contact with both sides of the joint.
  5. Tooling: Tool off with a moistened spatula within 5 minutes of application. Remove masking tape while the sealant is still wet.
  6. Clean Up: Clean tools and spills with Xylene while the product is wet. Use Adheseal citrus wipes for skin cleaning.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Hi-Flex 50

Q: What types of surfaces can Hi-Flex 50 be used on?

A: Hi-Flex 50 is compatible with a wide range of surfaces, including masonry, brick, metal, timber, plastics, stone, painted surfaces, rubber, fibreglass, porcelain, aluminium, and powder coat. Always perform a preliminary adhesion test.

Q: Can Hi-Flex 50 be used for underwater applications?

A: No, Hi-Flex 50 is not suitable for long-term water immersion or internal swimming pool applications. Avoid exposure to high levels of chlorine.

Q: What is the cure time for Hi-Flex 50?

A: The cure rate is 3.0mm per 24 hours from surfaces exposed to the atmosphere at 25°C and 50% humidity. Cure times can vary depending on atmospheric conditions and the porosity of the substrate.

Q: Does Hi-Flex 50 require a primer?

A: Hi-Flex 50 offers primer-less adhesion on most non-porous substrates. However, for optimal adhesion in critical applications, priming may be necessary. Refer to the Adheseal primer selection chart.

Q: How do I clean up Hi-Flex 50?

A: While the product is still wet, tools and spills can be cleaned with Xylene. Cured product can be removed by mechanical means. For cleaning skin, use Adheseal citrus wipes.

Q: Is Hi-Flex 50 environmentally friendly?

A: Yes, Hi-Flex 50 has a low VOC content (1.5% USEPA) and meets "green star" environmental criteria, making it a sustainable choice for various applications.
column54:
Hi-Flex 50 limitations:

  • Water Immersion: Not suitable for long-term water immersion or aquariums.
  • Confined Spaces: Requires atmospheric humidity to cure; avoid totally confined spaces.
  • Certain Materials: May discolour copper and brass; not suitable for bituminous, natural rubber, or EPDM rubber surfaces.
  • Stone: Stain testing is recommended before use on stone; S100 is recommended for marble and granite.

Safety precautions when using Hi-Flex 50:

  • Inhalation: Remove to fresh air. Seek medical attention if symptoms persist.
  • Skin Contact: Wash with water and soap thoroughly.
  • Eye Contact: Flood eyes with water for at least 15 minutes. Seek medical advice.
  • Ingestion: Do not induce vomiting. Seek medical advice immediately.
  • PPE: Wear gloves and safety glasses. Wash hands before eating or smoking.
column55: Hi-Flex 50 offers high flexibility, UV resistance, and strong adhesion. Ideal for waterproofing, construction, and marine use with low VOC and mould resistance.

  • Plastics and Rubber: Providing flexible and durable bonds.
  • Aluminium and Powder Coat: Ensuring long-term adhesion and weather resistance.

Use Hi-Flex 50 for:

  • Waterproofing: Sealing joints and seams to prevent water ingress.
  • Adhesive Applications: Bonding lightweight components and materials.
  • Automotive and Marine: Sealing and bonding components in vehicle and boat manufacturing.
  • Display Signs: Adhering and sealing signage materials.

Why Use Hi-Flex 50 for:

  • High Flexibility: Accommodates building movement and thermal expansion.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Primer-less adhesion to many substrates, simplifying application.
  • Durability: Resists UV, weathering, mould, and mildew, ensuring long-term performance.
  • Environmental Safety: Low VOC content, meeting "green star" criteria.
  • Versatility: Suitable for a wide range of applications and materials.

Use Sikasil® Pool for: Sealing joints in and around swimming pools, tiles, concrete, glass, and metals in permanently wet areas.

Sikasil® Pool is the ideal solution for Australian tradespeople needing a reliable sealant for swimming pools and wet areas. Its neutral-cure formulation provides excellent adhesion to a variety of substrates and its high resistance to chlorine and fungal attack ensures durability in harsh conditions. With its high elasticity and flexibility, Sikasil® Pool accommodates joint movement, preventing leaks and maintaining a watertight seal.

Key Features of Sikasil® Pool

  • High Water Resistance: Designed for permanent water immersion, providing a reliable seal.
  • Chlorine Resistance: Withstands the harsh chemical environment of swimming pools.
  • Fungal Resistance: Prevents mould and mildew growth in wet areas.
  • Non-Corrosive: Safe for use on metal surfaces.
  • High Elasticity and Flexibility: Accommodates joint movement, preventing cracks and leaks.

Technical Overview

Sikasil® Pool is formulated with a neutral-cure silicone that provides a Shore A hardness of approximately 20, ensuring flexibility and durability. Its tensile strength of ~1.5 N/mm² and movement capability of ±25% make it suitable for dynamic joints in wet environments.

Chemical Properties: Neutral-cure silicone, providing excellent resistance to water and chemicals.

Application Temperature Range: +5 °C to +40 °C (41 °F to 104 °F), ensuring reliable application in various climate conditions. Service temperature is -40 °C to +80 °C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Standard sealant gun, masking tape, backing rods, Sika® Tooling Agent N.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are thoroughly clean and primed as needed. Use backing rods to control sealant depth and prevent three-sided adhesion. Allow a minimum of 7 days curing time before filling the pool.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Fungal attack can occur if pH and chlorine levels are not maintained; ensure proper water chemistry.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, between +5 °C and +25 °C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production in original, sealed packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • ISO 9047: Movement capability.
  • ISO 868: Shore A hardness.

  3. Apply sealant: Extrude into the joint, ensuring full contact.
  4. Finish: Tool the sealant with Sika® Tooling Agent N.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Sikasil® Pool

Q: Can Sikasil® Pool be used in saltwater pools?

A: Yes, Sikasil® Pool is suitable for use in saltwater pools, provided the pH and chlorine levels are maintained within the recommended ranges.

Q: How long does Sikasil® Pool take to cure before water immersion?

A: Allow a minimum of 7 days for complete curing before filling the pool, depending on temperature, humidity, and sealant thickness.

Q: What materials does Sikasil® Pool adhere to?

A: It adheres to tiles, concrete, glass, and metals. Primers may be needed for some substrates.

Q: Can Sikasil® Pool be painted?

A: No, Sikasil® Pool cannot be overpainted.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Sikasil® Pool?

A: Wear appropriate PPE, such as gloves and eye protection. Ensure adequate ventilation. Clean tools with Sika® Remover-208 immediately after use.
column54:
Sikasil® Pool limitations:

  • Cannot be overpainted.
  • Do not use on bituminous substrates, natural rubber, or EPDM rubber.
  • Joint widths should be between 10 mm and 15 mm.
  • Not for structural glazing or food contact applications.
  • Colour variations can occur.

Safety precautions when using Sikasil® Pool:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and appropriate respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application and curing.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Clean tools and skin with Sika® Remover-208.
  • Disposal: Dispose of cured material according to local regulations.

Why Use Sikasil® Pool:

Use Bostik Ultraset® SF for: Adhering parquet, solid strip, engineered, and bamboo flooring to concrete subfloors, and for acoustic underlayment.

Bostik Ultraset® SF is a premium, solvent-free polyurethane adhesive designed for the professional installation of timber flooring. Its strong bond strength, excellent acoustic properties, and suitability for radiant heating systems make it an ideal choice for a wide range of applications. This easy-to-use, ready-to-apply adhesive provides a durable and flexible bond, ensuring long-lasting performance.

Key Features of Bostik Ultraset® SF

  • Solvent-Free and Zero VOC: Environmentally friendly and safe for indoor use.
  • Strong Bond Strength: Provides excellent adhesion to various timber flooring types and concrete subfloors.
  • Excellent Acoustic Properties: Reduces sound transmission, enhancing comfort in the space.
  • Suitable for Radiant Heating: Compatible with underfloor heating systems, ensuring reliable performance.
  • Easy to Apply: Ready-to-use formulation with no mixing required, simplifying the installation process.
  • Remains Flexible After Cure: Accommodates timber movement, preventing cracking and bond failure.
  • Australian Made: Manufactured to high standards for reliable performance in Australian conditions.

Technical Overview

Bostik Ultraset® SF is formulated to provide a strong, flexible bond for timber flooring applications. Its polyurethane composition ensures excellent adhesion and durability. The absence of solvents and VOCs makes it a safer choice for both installers and end-users.

Chemical Properties: Solvent-free polyurethane adhesive with excellent bond strength and flexibility.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C (41°F to 86°F). Ensure the substrate and ambient temperatures are within this range for optimal performance.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Trowel (3-4mm V-notch or square notch), moisture meter, Bostik Ultraseal Vapour Barrier (if required), cleaning solvents (mineral spirits, etc.).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure subfloors are flat and properly prepared. Use the full trowel method for optimal bond strength. Conduct moisture tests and apply Bostik Ultraseal Vapour Barrier as needed. Allow adequate curing time before sanding.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying to dense burnished concrete without abrading. Ensure no Bostik PrimeGrip is left exposed when used with Bostik UL-200. In low humidity, curing may be extended; consult a Bostik Technical Representative.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original sealed containers, under cover, and in dry conditions between 5°C and 30°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original unopened containers when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Meets requirements for EN 14293:2006 “Adhesives for bonding parquet to subfloor”.
  • Tested to ASTM C794 for peel adhesion to various species of Australian hardwood.

column32: Bostik Ultraset SF - Solvent-Free Timber Flooring Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Bostik Ultraset® SF: Solvent-free polyurethane timber flooring adhesive. Strong bond, excellent acoustic properties, suitable for radiant heating.
column52:
How to apply Bostik Ultraset® SF:

  1. Prepare the subfloor: clean, dry, and level. Apply Bostik Ultraseal Vapour Barrier if needed.
  2. Apply Bostik Ultraset® SF using a 3-4mm V-notch or square notch trowel.
  3. Ensure full contact between the adhesive and the timber flooring.
  4. Allow to cure for at least 24 hours before sanding or heavy traffic.
  5. Clean up excess adhesive with mineral spirits or Bostik Handy Wipes.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Bostik Ultraset® SF

Q: What types of flooring can I use with Bostik Ultraset® SF?

A: Bostik Ultraset® SF is suitable for adhering parquet, solid strip softwood and hardwood flooring, engineered flooring, and bamboo flooring to concrete subfloors. It can also be used with recommended acoustic underlays.

Q: How do I prepare the subfloor for application?

A: Ensure the subfloor is clean, dry, and free of voids and contaminants. Use Bostik Ultraseal Vapour Barrier for ground floor and new concrete slabs. Level uneven surfaces with Bostik UL-200. Conduct moisture tests to ensure suitability.

Q: What is the recommended application method?

A: The full trowel method is preferred. Apply a single application using a 3-4mm V-notch or square notch trowel. Ensure full contact between the adhesive and the timber flooring.

Q: How long does Bostik Ultraset® SF take to cure?

A: The product cures at a rate of 1.5-2.5mm per 24 hours, depending on temperature and humidity. Full cure typically takes around 24 hours, but low humidity can extend this time.

Q: Can I use Bostik Ultraset® SF with radiant heating systems?

A: Yes, Bostik Ultraset® SF is suitable for use over radiant heating systems, providing a reliable and durable bond in these applications.
column54:
Bostik Ultraset® SF limitations:

  • Should not be applied over acrylic primers or sealers.
  • Not suitable for dense burnished concrete without prior abrading.
  • Not a waterproofing membrane; do not use for waterproofing.
  • Should not be installed on wet, contaminated, or friable surfaces.
  • Not suitable for totally confined or air-free spaces.
  • Should not be exposed to water or alcohol-based cleaners before curing.

Safety precautions when using Bostik Ultraset® SF:

  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Skin Contact: Avoid prolonged skin contact. Wear gloves and protective clothing.
  • Eye Protection: Wear safety glasses or goggles.
  • Cleanup: Use mineral spirits or Bostik Handy Wipes for cleanup.
  • SDS: Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information.
column55: Bostik Ultraset® SF is a solvent-free polyurethane adhesive for parquet, solid strip, engineered, and bamboo flooring. Strong, flexible, and easy to use.

  • Recommended by major timber flooring manufacturers.

Use Autoshield NP60 for: Windscreen bonding, side glass bonding, and applications requiring a high green strength and rapid curing adhesive.

Autoshield NP60 is a high-performance, one-component polyurethane adhesive designed for professional windscreen replacement. Its primer-less formulation and rapid cure time significantly reduce installation time, allowing for a 1-hour drive-away. This adhesive provides a strong, flexible bond, ensuring vehicle safety and structural integrity.

Key Features of Autoshield NP60

  • 1-Hour Drive Away: Allows for faster vehicle turnaround, increasing workshop efficiency and customer satisfaction.
  • Primer-less Application: Simplifies the bonding process, saving time and reducing the risk of errors.
  • High Modulus: Provides a strong, rigid bond that meets safety standards (FMVSS 212).
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds effectively to glass and automotive body materials, including aluminium.

Why Choose Autoshield NP60:

  • Increased Productivity: Faster cure time enables more jobs to be completed per day.
  • Reduced Labour Costs: Primer-less application minimises preparation time and material usage.
  • Enhanced Safety: Meets FMVSS 212 standards, ensuring structural integrity and passenger safety.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for both windscreen and side glass bonding.

When to Choose Autoshield NP60 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Autoshield NP60 over standard windscreen adhesives when: A fast drive-away time is critical for efficient service, and a primer-less application is desired for ease of use.
  • Consider other options when: A longer cure time is acceptable, and cost is the primary concern, as Autoshield NP60 prioritises speed and efficiency.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: The faster turnaround and reduced labour costs associated with Autoshield NP60 offer significant long-term value for automotive repair businesses.

Trade-Specific Applications for Autoshield NP60:

For Automotive Glaziers:

  • Windscreen Replacement: Use for bonding windscreens in passenger vehicles, ensuring a fast and reliable installation.
  • Side Glass Bonding: Suitable for bonding side windows, providing a strong and durable seal.
  • Performance Benefits: Rapid cure time and primer-less application increase efficiency and reduce customer wait times.

Technical Overview

Autoshield NP60 is a moisture-curing polyurethane adhesive that forms a high modulus and flexible bond. Its primer-less formulation simplifies application, while its fast cure time allows for a 1-hour drive-away. This adhesive is designed to provide strong and durable bonding for automotive glass applications.

Physical Properties: The product exhibits high shear resistance and elongation at break, ensuring a strong and flexible bond. It passes crash tests according to FMVSS 212 standards, demonstrating its safety and reliability.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C. This range allows for use in various Australian climates, ensuring the product can be applied effectively in most conditions. For example, in colder areas, ensure the windscreen and vehicle body are within this temperature range before application. In hotter climates, avoid application in direct sunlight.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, cutting tools for removing old adhesive, cleaning cloths, applicator pads (if using primer/activator).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the glass and vehicle frame are thoroughly cleaned and free of debris before applying the adhesive. Follow the recommended bead profile for optimal bonding.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the adhesive skins over too quickly, work faster or apply in cooler conditions. If adhesion is poor, ensure surfaces are properly cleaned and prepared.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing at temperatures outside the recommended range to prevent product degradation.

Certifications and Compliance

  • FMVSS 212: Complies with the Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 212 for crash testing.

Download NP60 Crash Test Report (One Page)

column32: Autoshield NP60 Windscreen Adhesive | 1 Hour Drive Away | Adheseal
column33: Autoshield NP60: Fast-curing, primer-less polyurethane windscreen adhesive. High modulus, flexible bond for aluminium bodies and side glass.
column52:
How to apply Autoshield NP60 Windscreen Adhesive:

  1. Prepare the surface: Clean the glass with Autoshield Activator and apply GB Primer if necessary. Abrade and clean ceramic band glass.
  2. Apply the adhesive: Apply Autoshield NP60 in a triangle shape to the prepared area.
  3. Install the glass: Push the glass into the vehicle before the adhesive skins.
  4. Clean up: Clean uncured adhesive with Cleaner T or acetone.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Autoshield NP60 Windscreen Adhesive

Q: How long do I have to wait before driving the vehicle after using Autoshield NP60?

A: Autoshield NP60 allows for a 1-hour drive-away time with dual airbags, significantly reducing wait times compared to traditional adhesives.

Q: Do I need to use a primer with Autoshield NP60?

A: No, Autoshield NP60 is designed for primer-less application, simplifying the installation process and saving time.

Q: Is Autoshield NP60 suitable for all types of vehicles?

A: Yes, Autoshield NP60 is suitable for windscreen bonding in various vehicles, including those with aluminium bodies.

Q: What is the temperature range for applying Autoshield NP60?

A: The recommended application temperature range is 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F), making it suitable for most Australian climates.

Q: How should I clean up any uncured Autoshield NP60?

A: Uncured sealant can be cleaned up with Cleaner T or acetone. Cured sealant must be removed mechanically.

Q: Does Autoshield NP60 comply with safety standards?

A: Yes, Autoshield NP60 passes crash tests with dual security airbags after 1 hour at 23°C and 50% RH according to the FMVSS 212 standard.
column54:
Autoshield NP60 Windscreen Adhesive limitations:

  • Silicone Contamination: Do not apply in the presence of cured or uncured silicones or hybrid sealants, as these can interfere with adhesion.
  • Low Temperature Application: Do not apply at temperatures lower than 5°C, as this can affect the curing process.

Safety precautions when using Autoshield NP60 Windscreen Adhesive:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection to prevent skin and eye irritation.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application to avoid inhalation of vapours.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • First Aid: If skin contact occurs, wash with soap and water. If eye contact occurs, flush with plenty of water for 15 minutes and seek medical attention.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste material in accordance with local regulations.

Use Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 for: Speeding up cyanoacrylate adhesive curing, improving bond strength on porous materials, and enhancing overall adhesive performance.

Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 is a highly effective activator designed to significantly reduce the curing time of cyanoacrylate adhesives. This product is essential for trade professionals working with porous materials like MDF, wood, and particleboard, where rapid bonding is crucial. By pre-treating surfaces with this activator, you can achieve faster and stronger bonds, improving productivity and ensuring reliable results. Ideal for intricate joinery, cabinet making, and on-site repairs, this spray ensures that adhesive projects are completed efficiently and effectively, even in challenging conditions.

Key Features of Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2

  • Rapid Curing: Significantly accelerates the curing process of cyanoacrylate adhesives, reducing waiting time and speeding up project completion. For example, joints that typically take minutes to set can be ready in seconds.
  • Enhanced Bond Strength: Improves the adhesion of cyanoacrylate adhesives on porous surfaces, ensuring a stronger and more durable bond. This is particularly beneficial on materials like MDF, where adhesive absorption can be an issue.
  • Easy Application: The aerosol spray provides an even and consistent application, ensuring uniform coverage and optimal activation. This makes it easy to apply even in hard-to-reach areas.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for a wide range of applications, including cabinet making, furniture repair, and general assembly work. It's an indispensable tool for any professional needing fast and reliable bonding.

Technical Overview

Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 is formulated to interact with cyanoacrylate adhesives, initiating a rapid polymerisation process. This ensures a quick set and strong bond, particularly on porous surfaces where adhesives can be absorbed, slowing down the curing process. The aerosol delivery system allows for precise application, minimising waste and ensuring consistent results.

Chemical Properties: Contains Naphtha (petroleum), hydrotreated light and N,N-dimethyl-p-toluidine. These components facilitate rapid curing and enhance bond strength.

Application Temperature Range: While specific temperature ranges aren't listed in the SDS, it's generally recommended to apply at ambient temperatures, typically between 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F). Extreme temperatures can affect the evaporation rate and effectiveness of the activator. For best results, ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Aerosol spray can, clean cloth for wiping excess.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Spray a light, even coat on one surface before applying the cyanoacrylate adhesive to the other. For intricate work, use a small nozzle extension for precise application. Ensure proper ventilation during use.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the adhesive cures too quickly, reduce the amount of activator used. If bonds are weak, ensure surfaces are clean and dry and apply a more generous coat of activator.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated area away from direct sunlight and heat sources. Do not expose to temperatures exceeding 50°C (122°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information. Generally, aerosol products have a shelf life of approximately 12 months when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures, as this can affect the aerosol pressure and product effectiveness.

Certifications

  • Complies with REACH Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006.
  • Adheres to CLP Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008 for hazard classification.
