column32: Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 | Adheseal
column33: Fast-acting activator spray for cyanoacrylate adhesives. Enhances bond strength and speeds curing. Ideal for MDF and porous surfaces.
column52:
How to apply Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust or contaminants.
  2. Shake the aerosol can well before use.
  3. Spray a light, even coat of the activator onto one of the surfaces to be bonded.
  4. Allow a few seconds for the solvent to evaporate.
  5. Apply the cyanoacrylate adhesive to the other surface.
  6. Join the surfaces and apply pressure for a few seconds to ensure a strong bond.
  7. Wipe away any excess activator or adhesive with a clean cloth.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2

Q: How do I apply Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2?

A: Spray a light, even coat on one of the surfaces to be bonded. Allow a few seconds for the solvent to evaporate before applying the cyanoacrylate adhesive to the other surface and joining the parts. This ensures rapid curing and a strong bond.

Q: Will this activator work with all cyanoacrylate adhesives?

A: Yes, Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 is designed to work with most standard cyanoacrylate adhesives. However, it's always recommended to test on a small, inconspicuous area first to ensure compatibility and desired results.

Q: Can I use this activator on metal surfaces?

A: While it's primarily designed for porous surfaces like MDF, it can be used on metals to accelerate curing. However, ensure surfaces are clean and free from oils or contaminants for optimal adhesion.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using this product?

A: Use in a well-ventilated area, wear protective gloves and eye protection, and avoid inhaling the spray. Keep away from heat sources and open flames. Refer to the SDS for detailed safety information.

Q: How should I store the Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2?

A: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and heat. Do not expose to temperatures exceeding 50°C (122°F). Ensure the container is tightly closed when not in use.

Q: Can this product be used in cold weather conditions?

A: While it can be used, colder temperatures may slow down the evaporation of the solvent and thus slightly delay the activation process. Ensure the surfaces are at a reasonable temperature for best results.

Q: Is this product suitable for large scale industrial applications?

A: Yes, the Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 is suitable for both small and large-scale industrial applications where rapid bonding is required. Its aerosol format allows for efficient application across various project sizes.
column54:
Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 limitations:

  • Not suitable for use on non-porous surfaces where cyanoacrylate adhesives are already effective without an activator, as it may cause overly rapid curing and weaker bonds.
  • Avoid excessive application, as it can lead to a white residue or weakened bonds.
  • Not recommended for applications requiring long-term flexibility, as cyanoacrylate bonds are generally rigid.

Safety precautions when using Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Use in a well-ventilated area to avoid inhalation of vapours.
  • Handling: Keep away from heat sources, sparks, and open flames. Do not pierce or burn the can.
  • Avoid contact with skin and eyes. In case of contact, rinse thoroughly with water and seek medical advice if irritation persists.
column55: Selsil MDF Kit Activator Spray-T2 accelerates the curing of cyanoacrylate adhesives, ensuring strong bonds on porous surfaces like MDF. This spray enhances adhesive performance, reduces curing time, and improves efficiency for trade professionals.

column2: Injection Syringe Crack Repair Low Pressure System
column3:
Use Injection Syringes for: Low-pressure injection repair of small concrete cracks in car parks, balconies, concrete walls, pools, and other structural concrete elements.

The Injection Syringe Crack Repair Low Pressure System is a practical and efficient method for addressing small cracks in concrete structures. This system leverages low-pressure injection to ensure thorough penetration of repair materials, effectively restoring the structural integrity of concrete elements. Designed for ease of use and versatility, these syringes can be employed in a variety of settings, from parking garages to residential balconies. The system's compatibility with diverse epoxy products allows for tailored solutions to specific repair needs, providing a reliable and cost-effective approach to concrete crack repair.

Key Features of Injection Syringe Crack Repair Low Pressure System

  • Low Pressure Injection: Ensures effective penetration of repair materials into small cracks without causing further damage.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for a wide range of structural repair jobs, including car parks, balconies, concrete walls, and pools.
  • Epoxy Compatibility: Syringe is suitable for use with various epoxy products, providing flexibility in material selection.
  • Precise Application: Allows for targeted and controlled injection of repair materials, minimising waste and ensuring effective crack filling.
  • Durable Repair: Provides a reliable and long-lasting solution for small concrete crack repair.
  • Cost-Effective: Offers an efficient and economical method for addressing concrete cracks, reducing the need for more extensive repairs.

Technical Overview

The Injection Syringe Crack Repair Low Pressure System utilises a simple yet effective mechanism to deliver repair materials into concrete cracks. The syringes are designed to hold and dispense epoxy at a controlled low pressure, ensuring thorough crack filling and effective bonding. This low-pressure approach minimises the risk of over-injection and damage to the surrounding concrete, making it an ideal method for small, delicate repairs.

Filling Capacity: 50 ml/cc

Maximum Pressure: 3.0 kgf/cm2

Maximum Length: 225 mm

Minimum Length: 147 mm

Application Information

  • Materials Required: Injection syringes, epoxy products (e.g., Sikadur 52), anchoring epoxy (e.g., Sika Anchorfix 1), syringe pedestals, rubber bands (optional), hand grinder.
  • Installation Guidelines:
    1. Clean the surface and remove dust or contamination from the crack.
    2. Install syringe pedestals (5-6 syringes per meter, 10-20 cm apart depending on crack thickness).
    3. Secure pedestals with anchoring epoxy, covering the top of the crack. Ensure the product has cured before injection.
    4. Draw mixed epoxy into the syringe (30cc) and mount the syringe into the pedestal.
    5. Inject epoxy via the pedestal until flow from the adjacent pedestal or until epoxy stops flowing.
    6. Attach rubber bands to apply constant pressure if required.
    7. After epoxy hardens, remove syringes and pedestals and restore surface finish with a hand grinder.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper surface cleaning and pedestal installation for effective crack sealing. Monitor epoxy flow during injection to prevent overfilling.

Limitations

  • Primarily designed for small concrete cracks.
  • Effectiveness depends on the chosen epoxy product and proper application technique.

Safety precautions when using Injection Syringe Crack Repair Low Pressure System:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear appropriate gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection if necessary, in accordance with the safety data sheets of the epoxy products being used.
  • Epoxy Handling: Follow safety instructions provided by the epoxy product manufacturer. Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Surface Preparation: Ensure proper cleaning and preparation of the crack area.

How to apply Injection Syringe Crack Repair Low Pressure System:

  1. Surface Preparation: Clean the surface and remove any dust or contamination from the crack.
  2. Pedestal Installation: Install the syringe pedestals, generally 5 to 6 syringes per meter. Crack thickness will determine the distance apart, usually (10 – 20 cm).
  3. Pedestal Securing: Using an anchoring epoxy (e.g., Sika Anchorfix 1), secure the pedestals in place and cover the top of the crack. Ensure the product has cured before injection.
  4. Epoxy Preparation: Draw the mixed epoxy (e.g., Sikadur 52) inside the syringe (30cc).
  5. Epoxy Injection: Mount the syringe into the pedestal. Inject epoxy via the pedestal until there is flow from the adjacent pedestal or until the epoxy stops flowing.
  6. Pressure Application: Attach the rubber bands to apply a constant pressure if required.
  7. Finishing: When the epoxy has hardened, remove the syringes and pedestals and restore surface finish with hand grinder.

Q: What types of cracks is this system suitable for?

Q: What materials are needed for this repair method?

A: You will need injection syringes, epoxy products (e.g., Sikadur 52), anchoring epoxy (e.g., Sika Anchorfix 1), syringe pedestals, rubber bands (optional), and a hand grinder.

Q: How do you install the syringe pedestals?

A: Install pedestals generally 5 to 6 syringes per meter, spaced 10-20 cm apart depending on crack thickness. Secure them in place with an anchoring epoxy, covering the top of the crack.

Q: How do you inject the epoxy?

A: Draw mixed epoxy inside the syringe (30cc), mount the syringe into the pedestal, and inject epoxy until there is flow from the adjacent pedestal or until the epoxy stops flowing.

Q: What do you do after the epoxy hardens?

A: Remove the syringes and pedestals and restore the surface finish with a hand grinder.

Q: What is the maximum pressure the syringe can handle?

A: The syringe has a maximum pressure of 3.0 kgf/cm2.

Q: What is the filling capacity of the syringe?

A: The filling capacity of the syringe is 50 ml/cc.

column2: Gripset E-60 Water Based Epoxy Primer
column3:
Use Gripset E-60 for: Moisture barrier, primer, rising damp prevention, and potable water storage.

Gripset E-60 is a two-component, water-based epoxy compound designed for Australian trade professionals requiring a reliable moisture barrier and primer. Its unique formulation allows application on damp concrete and provides exceptional hydrostatic pressure resistance. With low VOC and potable water compliance, it's ideal for various internal and external applications.

Key Features of Gripset E-60

  • High Hydrostatic Pressure Resistance: Withstands up to 2.5 bar (250 kPa) of pressure, ensuring robust moisture protection.
  • Low Water Vapor Transmission: Minimizes moisture migration, keeping substrates dry.
  • Damp Concrete Application: Can be applied to damp and “green” concrete, reducing project delays.
  • Potable Water Compliance: Complies with AS 4020, making it safe for drinking water storage.

Why Choose Gripset E-60:

  • Reliability: Provides long-lasting moisture protection.
  • Versatility: Suitable for diverse applications and substrates.
  • Safety: Low VOC and potable water compliant.
  • Efficiency: Reduces project downtime with damp concrete application.

When to Choose Gripset E-60 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Gripset E-60 over standard epoxy primers when: High hydrostatic pressure resistance and potable water compliance are required.
  • Consider other options when: A trafficable or UV-resistant coating is needed.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Gripset E-60 offers superior moisture protection and versatility, reducing long-term maintenance costs.

Trade-Specific Applications for Gripset E-60:

For Waterproofers:

  • Creating a robust moisture barrier on concrete slabs and walls, using rollers for even application.
  • Compatible with concrete and masonry substrates commonly found in Australian construction.
  • Provides reliable protection against hydrostatic pressure and rising damp.

For Builders:

  • Priming damp concrete and screeds before applying flooring and coatings, ensuring proper adhesion.
  • Suitable for internal and external applications on various mineral surfaces.
  • Enhances the durability and longevity of flooring and coating systems.

Technical Overview

Gripset E-60 is a two-component, water-based epoxy compound designed for high-performance moisture protection. Its formulation allows application on damp substrates and provides excellent resistance to hydrostatic pressure. This product is ideal for priming and sealing mineral surfaces in diverse applications.

Chemical Properties: Two-component epoxy compound with low VOC.

Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C, suitable for most Australian conditions.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Electric stirrer, mixing pail, roller, squeegee, and measuring jugs.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Mix thoroughly for 3 minutes. Dampen porous surfaces before application.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying in rain or when rain is imminent. Treat running water with Gripset C-Plug.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry area at room temperature, avoid freezing and direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage and application.

Certifications and Compliance

  • AS 4020: Complies with Australian standards for potable water storage.
  • ASTM E96: Water vapor transmission testing.

How to apply Gripset E-60:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Mix equal parts of Part A and Part B thoroughly.
  3. Apply with a squeegee, roller, or brush, ensuring even coverage.
  4. Allow the first coat to dry before applying a second coat if needed.
  5. For moisture barrier applications, apply two coats at 300 microns DFT each.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset E-60

Q: Can Gripset E-60 be used for external applications?

A: Yes, Gripset E-60 is suitable for both internal and external applications, providing robust moisture protection in various environments.

Q: How long does it take for Gripset E-60 to cure?

A: Full cure takes 7 days. Overcoating with finishes can occur after 24 hours, and immersion after 7 days.

Q: Can I apply Gripset E-60 to damp concrete?

A: Yes, Gripset E-60 can be applied to damp and “green” concrete, reducing project delays.

Q: Is Gripset E-60 safe for potable water storage?

A: Yes, Gripset E-60 complies with AS 4020, making it safe for potable water storage applications.

Q: What is the hydrostatic pressure resistance of Gripset E-60?

A: Gripset E-60 can withstand up to 2.5 bar (250 kPa) of hydrostatic pressure, providing excellent moisture protection.

Q: How do I prepare the surface before applying Gripset E-60?

A: Ensure the surface is clean, sound, and free from contaminants. Remove loose materials and repair any defects. For porous surfaces, dampen with a fine water mist.
column54:
Gripset E-60 limitations:

  • Do not apply below 10°C or above 35°C
  • Not suitable as a UV-exposed final coating
  • Ensure overcoating occurs within 72 hours for optimal adhesion

Safety precautions when using Gripset E-60:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety goggles, and protective clothing.
  • Ventilation: Ensure proper airflow when applying in enclosed areas.
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact and prolonged exposure.
  • Storage: Store in a dry area at room temperature, away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Cleaning: Wash tools with water before the product dries. Dried product must be removed mechanically.
  • Disposal: Dispose of product according to local environmental regulations.

GRIPSET C-LITE is a high-performance, commercial-grade tile adhesive offering superior flexibility and non-slump characteristics. Designed for internal and external applications, it is ideal for wall and floor tiling, wet areas, pools, spas, and underfloor heating. Its advanced formula meets C2TES2 classifications, ensuring outstanding adhesion and durability.

Key Features of GRIPSET C-LITE

  • Highly flexible and non-slump formulation
  • Commercial-grade performance
  • Meets C2TES2 classification standards
  • Compatible with early-age concrete, screeds, and renders
  • Suitable for pools, spas, and other immersed applications
  • Ideal for large-format tile installations

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Cementitious adhesive
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Notched trowel, mixing bucket, electric stirrer
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Back-butter tiles larger than 300x300mm for maximum adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid adhesive skinning by applying in 1m² sections at a time

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life: 12 months in original unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing conditions and store off cold floors

Certifications

column32: Gripset C-Lite | Premium Flexible Tile Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Gripset C-Lite is a premium, highly flexible, non-slump tile adhesive for walls and floors. Suitable for wet areas, pools, large tiles, and underfloor heating.
column52:
How to apply GRIPSET C-LITE:

  1. Ensure substrate is clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Mix 4.5 litres of water per 15kg bag until smooth.
  3. Allow to stand for 3 minutes, then re-mix before application.
  4. Apply using an appropriate notched trowel, ensuring full tile coverage.
  5. Press tiles firmly into adhesive and adjust within 40 minutes.
  6. Allow 24 hours before grouting.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset C-Lite

Q: What is Gripset C-Lite used for?

A: Gripset C-Lite is a premium-grade tile adhesive designed for superior flexibility, non-slump performance, and durability. It is ideal for floor and wall tiling in both internal and external areas, including wet areas and immersed applications such as pools and spas.

Q: Can Gripset C-Lite be used for large-format tile installations?

A: Yes, Gripset C-Lite is formulated to support large-format tiles, ensuring strong adhesion and stability, including for tiles used in high-moisture areas.

Q: What surfaces need priming before applying Gripset C-Lite?

A:

  • Porous surfaces should be primed with Gripset GP Primer.
  • Non-porous surfaces should be primed with Gripset OP Primer.

Q: What is the recommended mixing ratio for Gripset C-Lite?

A: Mix 4.5 litres of clean water per 15kg bag of Gripset C-Lite using an electric stirrer until a smooth, lump-free consistency is achieved.

Q: How long should I wait before grouting after applying Gripset C-Lite?

A: Grouting should be done at least 24 hours after installation or when the adhesive has fully hardened and secured the tiles in place.
column54:
GRIPSET C-LITE Limitations:

  • Not suitable for fixing tiles directly onto timber floors.
  • Do not use with moisture-sensitive stone.
  • Do not apply when temperatures are below 5°C or above 35°C.

Safety precautions when using Gripset C-Lite:

column7: C2S1TE,QLD only,adhesive,bag,civil construction-i,concrete,construction,durable,external,fast cure,fibre cement sheet,flexible,flooring-i,high strength,industrial,internal,large format tiles,masonry,plasterboard,polymer modified,render,screed,slump resistant,stone,tile-s,tiling,tiling-i,waterproof membranes-s,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i
column32: Gripset C-Mastic | Premium Silica-Free Tile Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Gripset C-Mastic is a premium, silica-free, white polymer tile adhesive designed for large format tiles, internal & external tiling, and immersed applications.
column52:
How to apply GRIPSET C-MASTIC:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and structurally sound.
  2. Mix 5.5-6L of clean water per 20kg bag of adhesive.
  3. Apply adhesive with a notched trowel suitable for tile size.
  4. Press tiles into the wet adhesive using a sliding action.
  5. Allow to set for at least 24 hours before grouting.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset C-Mastic

Q: What is Gripset C-Mastic used for?

A: Gripset C-Mastic is a premium, polymer-modified tile adhesive designed for high-performance applications. It offers excellent workability, non-slump characteristics, and superior adhesion for large-format tiles, internal/external tiling, and immersed areas.

Q: Can Gripset C-Mastic be used in swimming pools?

A: Yes, Gripset C-Mastic is formulated for immersed applications, making it suitable for pools, spas, and wet areas where strong water resistance is required.

Q: What is the recommended mixing ratio for Gripset C-Mastic?

A: Mix 5.5 to 6 litres of clean water per 20kg bag, gradually adding the powder to the water while stirring with an electric mixer to achieve a smooth, lump-free consistency.

Q: Do I need to prime surfaces before applying Gripset C-Mastic?

A:

  • For porous surfaces, use Gripset GP Primer.
  • For non-porous surfaces, use Gripset OP Primer.

Q: How long should I wait before grouting after applying Gripset C-Mastic?

A: Grouting can commence after 24 hours, or when the adhesive has fully hardened and secured the tiles in place.
column54:
GRIPSET C-MASTIC Limitations:

  • Not suitable for timber floors
  • Not recommended for moisture-sensitive stone tiles
  • Do not apply below 5°C or above 35°C

Safety precautions when using Gripset C-Mastic:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety goggles, and a dust mask when mixing and applying.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation when applying in enclosed areas.
  • Handling: Avoid inhaling dust and prevent prolonged skin contact.
  • Storage: Store in a dry area at room temperature, away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Cleaning: Clean tools with water immediately after use. Dried adhesive must be removed mechanically.
  • Disposal: Dispose of product residues according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset C-Mastic is a premium-grade, polymer-modified, silica-free tile adhesive with superior non-slump properties. Ideal for large format tiles, wet areas, and external tiling, it provides strong adhesion to concrete, screeds, and waterproofing membranes. Meeting C2S1TE classification, it ensures durability and reliability for professional tiling projects.
column56:
Gripset C-Mastic can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete
  • Screed & Render

  • Gripset Waterproofing Membranes
column57:
Use GRIPSET C-MASTIC for:

  • Fixing porcelain, vitrified, and natural stone tiles (excluding moisture-sensitive types)
  • Large format tile installations

Why Use GRIPSET C-MASTIC:

  • Enhanced workability and ease of application
  • Excellent adhesion to a variety of substrates

column2: Supaflex Glove with Micro Foam Coating
column3:
Use Supaflex Gloves GFN267 for: High-precision tasks requiring dexterity, grip, and long-lasting abrasion resistance

Supaflex Gloves GFN267 are engineered for superior flexibility, comfort, and durability, making them ideal for a wide range of technical and trade applications. Featuring a seamless Nylon/Lycra liner with a polyurethane/nitrile micro foam coating on the palm, these gloves provide excellent grip, abrasion resistance, and tactile sensitivity. The ultra-thin coating enhances dexterity, while the breathable construction keeps hands cool and dry. Trusted by professionals in engineering, automotive, construction, logistics, and mining, Supaflex Gloves offer a close fit with minimal hand fatigue, allowing precise work in tough environments.

Key Features of Supaflex Gloves GFN267

  • Polyurethane/nitrile micro foam palm coating for superior grip
  • Seamless Nylon/Lycra liner provides flexibility and close fit
  • Ultra-thin coating enhances dexterity for precise tasks
  • Highest level abrasion resistance for extended wear life
  • Breathable material reduces heat and moisture buildup
  • No coating strike-through—prevents skin irritation

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane/Nitrile Micro Foam
  • Coating Thickness: Ultra-Thin for Maximum Dexterity
  • Abrasion Resistance: EN388:2016 Level 4 (4131X)
  • Liner Material: Seamless Nylon/Lycra Blend
  • Sizes Available: XSmall to 2XLarge

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: No tools required for use
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ideal for tasks requiring precise handling—select size for snug, ergonomic fit
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Gloves may wear faster in heavy cut environments—select suitable cut protection level if needed

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, ventilated area away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 5 years from date of manufacture under proper storage
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 35°C (41°F to 95°F)

Certifications

  • EN388:2016 – 4131X (Abrasion Level 4, Cut Level 1)
  • Compliant with Australian PPE Standards for hand protection
  • Certified for use in food-adjacent technical environments

column32: Supaflex Glove with Micro Foam Coating GFN267 | Adheseal
column33: Supaflex Gloves GFN267 with micro foam coating, abrasion resistance, and superior grip—ideal for Australian trade professionals.
column52:
How to apply Supaflex Gloves GFN267:

  1. Select appropriate size based on hand measurements
  2. Insert fingers into glove, pulling over wrist securely
  3. Check for a snug fit without constriction to ensure comfort and safety
  4. Remove by peeling from wrist, turning glove inside out
  5. Store in a dry area; wash if reusing for non-hazardous tasks
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Supaflex Gloves GFN267

Q: How do I determine the correct size for Supaflex Gloves?

A: Measure the circumference of your palm at its widest point and compare with the size chart. Gloves should fit snugly without restricting movement for optimal dexterity and comfort.

Q: Are these gloves suitable for use with oils or lubricants?

A: Yes, the polyurethane/nitrile micro foam coating provides excellent grip and resistance in oily environments, making them ideal for automotive and mechanical work.

Q: Can Supaflex Gloves be washed and reused?

A: Yes, these gloves can be hand-washed with mild detergent and air-dried. However, repeated washing may reduce the effectiveness of the coating over time.

Q: What should I do if the glove lining irritates my skin?

A: Supaflex Gloves are designed to prevent irritation. If irritation occurs, ensure your hands are clean and dry before use, and consider using glove liners. Discontinue use if irritation persists.

Q: Are these gloves suitable for handling sharp materials?

A: While offering high abrasion resistance, these gloves are not cut-resistant. For handling sharp objects, choose gloves with appropriate cut-level certification.
column54:
Supaflex Gloves GFN267 limitations:

  • Not suitable for cut-intensive tasks—no cut protection rating
  • Should not be used with high-temperature materials or flames
  • Limited chemical resistance—avoid immersion in harsh chemicals

Safety precautions when using Supaflex Gloves GFN267:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves should be used with additional PPE where necessary
  • Ventilation: Ensure a well-ventilated area when used with chemicals or adhesives
  • Handling: Avoid over-stretching or using gloves beyond abrasion limits
  • Inspect gloves before each use and replace if damaged or worn
column55: Ultra-thin Supaflex Gloves GFN267 with high abrasion resistance, breathable comfort, and superior grip for technical, assembly, and trade work.

Supaflex Gloves GFN267 can be used on the following substrates:

  • Plastic and composite materials – precise grip and dexterity
  • Wood – safe for carpentry and construction work
  • Rubber and foams – compatible for automotive and insulation handling
column57:
Use Supaflex Gloves GFN267 for:

  • Engineering and mechanical maintenance
  • Construction and carpentry tasks
  • Logistics, warehousing, and handling equipment

Why Use Supaflex Gloves GFN267:

  • Excellent grip and abrasion resistance for longevity
  • Breathable material keeps hands cool during extended wear
  • Designed for Australian trade conditions and applications

column3:
Use Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant for: Concrete and asphalt pavement joints, new construction, and remedial applications.

Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant is a one-part, self-levelling silicone material designed for sealing concrete and concrete-to-asphalt pavement joints. Its ultra-low modulus and high movement capability make it ideal for accommodating significant pavement movement, ensuring long-term seal integrity. This sealant is weather and UV resistant, fuel resistant for short-term exposure, and offers unprimed adhesion to Portland cement concrete and asphalt, reducing labour and material costs. With a fast skin-over time, roadways can be quickly reopened to traffic, minimising disruption.

Key Features of Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant

  • Self-Levelling: No tooling required, simplifying application and saving labour.
  • High Movement Capability: 100% extension and 50% compression, accommodating significant pavement movement.
  • Ultra-Low Modulus: Minimises stress on asphaltic joints, preventing premature failure.
  • Unprimed Adhesion: Reduces preparation time and costs, enhancing efficiency.
  • Fast Skin-Over Time: Allows for quick reopening of roads to traffic, minimising disruption.
  • Fuel Resistance: Suitable for areas with potential fuel spills, enhancing durability.
  • Weather and UV Resistant: Ensures long-term performance in outdoor environments.

Technical Overview

Dowsil™ 890-SL is a one-part, cold-applied, self-levelling silicone that cures to an ultra-low-modulus silicone rubber upon exposure to atmospheric moisture. It has a Shore 00 durometer hardness of 41 and an ultimate elongation of 1400%. Its specific gravity ranges from 1.26 to 1.34.

Chemical Properties: One-part, cold-applied, self-levelling silicone sealant with excellent weather and UV resistance.

Application Temperature Range: Can be extruded from -20 to 120°F.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun (for cartridges), bulk dispensing equipment (for pails/drums), backer rod.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure joints are clean and dry. Use proper backer rod installation to prevent three-sided adhesion. Recess sealant as recommended for pavement grinding.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application on wet or damp surfaces or during inclement weather. Follow joint design recommendations forStorage Requirements: Store in original, unopened containers at or below 32°C (90°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for “Use By” date.
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep containers tightly closed and avoid storing in high temperatures.

Certifications

  • ASTM D 5893 Type SL
  • FAA P-605 for silicone joint sealants
  • Meets SS-S-200E (section 4.4.12) Flame Test Requirements
  • EN 14187-5 Hydrolysis Test
  • EN 14188-2 Class B, C and D
column7: Marine Sealants,asphalt,caulking-i,civil construction-i,concrete-s,construction,flooring-i,low modulus,low voc,masonry,neutral-cure,one part,primerless,sausage,sealant,self levelling,silicone,uv stable
column32: Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Dowsil™ 890-SL: Self-levelling silicone sealant for concrete and asphalt pavement joints.
column52:
How to apply Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant:

  1. Preparation: Clean joints and remove any debris.
  2. Backer Rod Installation: Install backer rod to proper depth.
  3. Application: Apply Dowsil™ 890-SL using a caulking gun or bulk dispensing equipment.
  4. Finishing: Allow sealant to self-level; no tooling is required.
  5. Curing: Allow sealant to cure for 21 days at 73°F (25°C) and 50% RH.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant

Q: Can Dowsil™ 890-SL be used for both concrete and asphalt joints?

A: Yes, Dowsil™ 890-SL is designed for both concrete-to-concrete and concrete-to-asphalt pavement joints.

Q: Does Dowsil™ 890-SL require primer for application?

A: No, Dowsil™ 890-SL offers unprimed adhesion to Portland cement concrete and asphalt, reducing the need for primer.

Q: How long does Dowsil™ 890-SL take to cure?

A: Dowsil™ 890-SL typically cures in 21 days at 73°F (25°C) and 50% RH.

Q: Can Dowsil™ 890-SL be used in cold weather?

A: Yes, Dowsil™ 890-SL can be extruded from -20 to 120°F, making it suitable for a wide range of temperatures.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Dowsil™ 890-SL?

A: Read the product and safety data sheets before handling. Ensure proper ventilation. Dispose of waste according to local regulations.
column54:
Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant limitations:

  • Not recommended for continuous water immersion.
  • Should not be applied in totally confined spaces.
  • Avoid application on wet or damp surfaces or during inclement weather.
  • Consult Dow for airfield runway applications.
  • Not for spill containment areas.
  • Not for medical or pharmaceutical uses.

Safety precautions when using Dowsil™ 890-SL Silicone Joint Sealant:

  • Safety Data Sheets: Read product and safety data sheets before use.
  • Handling: Use proper protective equipment.
  • Disposal: Dispose of in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations.

column2: Everflex HVUV Premium Grade UV Class 3 Waterproof Membrane
column3:
Use Everflex HVUV for: Waterproofing roofs, balconies, wet areas, and surfaces exposed to UV, ensuring a durable, flexible, and long-lasting barrier.

Everflex HVUV is a premium-grade, single-component, self-reinforced elastomeric waterproof membrane engineered for applications exposed to UV radiation. This Class 3 membrane, compliant with AS 4858:2004 and AS 4654.1, forms a seamless, fully bonded, and highly flexible barrier that withstands maintenance foot traffic and prevents water re-emulsification. Ideal for a variety of substrates, Everflex WPUV/HVUV offers superior protection for roofs, balconies, wet areas, and more, ensuring long-term performance and durability.

Key Features of Everflex HVUV

  • High UV Resistance: Specifically formulated for UV exposed applications, ensuring long-term durability and protection against weathering. For instance, on exposed roofs, it maintains its integrity and flexibility, preventing cracking and degradation.
  • Class 3 Waterproofing: Provides a high-performance waterproof barrier, meeting stringent Australian standards for both internal and external use. In wet areas, it ensures complete protection, preventing water damage to underlying structures.
  • Excellent Flexibility: Maintains flexibility even under varying temperatures, accommodating substrate movement without cracking. This is crucial for balconies and terraces where thermal expansion and contraction occur.
  • Micro Fibre Reinforced: Enhances the membrane's strength and durability, making it suitable for areas with maintenance foot traffic. This reinforcement ensures longevity and reduces the risk of punctures or tears.
  • Easy Application and Clean-up: Single-component and water-based, allowing for straightforward application and clean-up with water. This simplifies the application process for tradespeople, saving time and effort.

Technical Overview

Everflex HVUV is designed to create a seamless, elastomeric barrier that effectively prevents water ingress. Its formulation includes microfibres that enhance its tensile strength and flexibility. The membrane’s ability to cure into a tough, durable film makes it suitable for various substrates and applications. The product is also formulated to have a low VOC content, meeting Green Star environmental criteria, which is beneficial for both indoor and outdoor applications.

Chemical Properties: Alkyl Acrylate-Styrene Copolymer, Polyurethane emulsion, Talc. These components provide the membrane with its elastomeric properties, UV resistance, and durability.

Application Temperature Range: Apply between 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F). Applying within this range ensures proper curing and adhesion. Avoid application in extreme temperatures or when rain is imminent to prevent compromised performance.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, film thickness gauge, Hi-Flex MS sealant, polyester reinforcing fabric (if needed).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper surface preparation, including priming, to achieve optimal adhesion. Apply two coats at right angles to each other, verifying wet film thickness with a gauge. For corners and joints, use Hi-Flex MS sealant or Adheseal Elastoband for a robust seal.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If delamination occurs, ensure proper surface preparation and priming. For uneven curing, verify application thickness and environmental conditions.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months from the date of manufacture (DOM).
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity and shelf life.

Certifications

  • Tested in accordance with AS 4858:2004 (Wet Area Membranes) and AS 4654.1:2012 (Waterproofing of roofs and associated flashings).
  • Meets National Construction Code (NCC) requirements.
  • Green Star compliant with low VOC content.
column7: AS4654.1:212,AS4858,Green Star Compliant,aluminium,balcony,basements,bathroom,block work,brick,concrete-s,construction,decks,durable,epoxy-s,external,fast cure,fibre cement sheet,fibre reinforced,flexible,flooring-i,green tag certified,internal,kitchens,liquid applied,low voc,marine plywood,masonry,mdf,membrane,metal,non toxic,pail,particle board,polyurethane-s,quick drying,render,roof & gutter,rooftops,screed,shower,single pack,solvent free,structural plywood,tiling-i,timber sheeting-s,trafficable,undertile,uv stable,water based,waterproofing-a,wet areas,wood-i
column32: Everflex HVUV Premium UV Waterproof Membrane | Adheseal
column33: Everflex HVUV is a high-performance waterproof membrane with superior UV resistance. Ideal for external applications, flexible, and fast-drying.
column52:
How to apply Everflex HVUV:

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure it is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Prime the surface: Apply Everflex WBP (internal) or VBS (external) primer as needed.
  3. Mix the membrane: Thoroughly mix Everflex WPUV/HVUV before use.
  4. Apply the first coat: Use a brush or roller to apply a 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  5. Apply the second coat: After 2-4 hours, apply a second coat at right angles, also at 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  6. Verify thickness: Use a film thickness gauge to ensure a minimum 1mm dry film thickness (1.3mm for external).
  7. Allow curing: Let the membrane cure for 48 hours before tiling or further work.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex HVUV

Q: How do I prepare surfaces before applying Everflex HVUV?

A: Ensure surfaces are structurally sound, clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Prime porous surfaces with Everflex WBP (internal) or VBS (external) primer. Rectify any cracks or holes before application.

Q: Can Everflex HVUV be used on timber flooring?

A: Yes, it can be used on timber flooring, including structural plywood Type A (PAA JAS-ANZ). Ensure the timber is clean, dry, and structurally sound before applying the membrane.

Q: What is the recommended application thickness for external areas?

A: For external areas, apply a minimum of two coats to achieve a dry film thickness (DFT) of 1.3mm. Verify the wet film thickness with a gauge during application to ensure proper coverage.

Q: How long should I wait before tiling over Everflex HVUV?

A: Allow approximately 48 hours cure time at 25°C and 50% humidity before tiling. Cure times may vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using this product?

A: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas. Ensure adequate ventilation during application. Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Consult the SDS for detailed safety information.

Q: Can Everflex WPUV/HVUV be tinted?

A: Yes, up to 75ml of black Glycol tint can be added to change the colour, however this will affect the Solar Reflectance Index (SRI) of the applied finish.

Q: Is a primer always necessary?

A: The use of a primer is always recommended, particularly on porous and warm surfaces. For internal applications, Everflex WBP is typically sufficient, while for external applications like roof decks and balconies, Everflex VBS is recommended.
column54:
Everflex HVUV limitations:

  • Do not apply below 10°C (50°F) or above 35°C (95°F).
  • Do not apply on damp, wet, or contaminated substrates.
  • Not suitable for areas with negative hydrostatic pressure or rising damp.
  • Not suitable for areas subject to foot traffic greater than maintenance.

Safety precautions when using Everflex HVUV:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Rinse thoroughly with water if contact occurs.
  • Disposal: Dispose of according to local regulations.
column55: <!-- Short Product Summary --> Everflex HVUV is a premium UV-resistant waterproofing membrane designed for high-exposure areas like balconies, patios, and rooftops. Flexible, durable, and rapid drying.
column56:
Everflex HVUV can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete (after 28 days curing).
  • 3:1 sand cement screed or C-Bed.
  • Masonry/render (after 4 days curing).
  • Cement sheeting/underlay/external weatherboard/blue board.
  • Pre-cast concrete (after release agent removal).
  • Wet area plasterboard/Villaboard.
  • Timber flooring (structural plywood Type A).
  • Brickwork, Hebel (aggregate block).
column57:
Use Everflex HVUV for:

  • Waterproofing exposed roofs and under pedestal systems.
  • Protecting wet areas, shower recesses, laundries, toilets, and kitchens.
  • Sealing patios, terraces, decks, and balconies.
  • Providing a waterproof barrier under tiles.
  • Creating a durable, UV-resistant membrane on external surfaces.

Why Use Everflex HVUV:

  • Ensures long-term protection against water damage with a Class 3 waterproof barrier. For example, on a balcony, it prevents water ingress that could damage the building structure.
  • Maintains flexibility and durability under UV exposure, reducing maintenance and extending the lifespan of the waterproof layer. For instance, on a roof, it withstands harsh sunlight and temperature variations.
  • Simplifies application with a single-component, water-based formulation, saving time and effort for tradespeople. This allows for quicker project turnaround and reduced labour costs.
  • Provides a safe and environmentally friendly solution with low VOC content, contributing to Green Star ratings. For example, in residential projects, it ensures a healthier indoor environment.
  • Offers versatile application on various substrates, making it suitable for diverse construction projects. This eliminates the need for multiple products and simplifies inventory management.

column2: Duram Azcothane Polyurethane Fortified Water Based Waterproofing Membrane
column3:
Duram Azcothane is a high-performance water-based polyurethane dispersion fortified acrylic hybrid waterproofing membrane. It is designed for demanding applications such as exposed, under tile, underground, and immersed waterproofing. Azcothane meets various industry standards and criteria, including wet area membranes, external above-ground use, resistance to ultraviolet, and environmental criteria.

Uses

  • Balconies
  • Terraces
  • Decks
  • Podiums
  • Tiled or covered areas
  • Metal roofs
  • Roofs (UV-exposed)
  • Shower recess & wet areas
  • Retaining walls
  • Planters and landscaped areas
  • Structural slabs
  • Pits and bunded areas
  • Door flashings

Suitable Surfaces

Azcothane is suitable for a wide range of surfaces, including concrete, cement and cement render, FC and CFC sheeting, block & brickwork, masonry/stone, FC, CFC, asbestos and Blue board sheeting, particle board, Scyon & composite sheeting, acrylic coatings, vitreous, ceramic & terra cotta tiles, bitumen (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC), metal (when primed with Duram ME Primer), timber, particle board, plywood (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC), masonite, plasterboard, extruded foam, and fibreglass/gelcoat/PVC. Duram provides recommended priming methods for these surfaces.

Benefits and Advantages

  • Azcothane is a feature-packed polyurethane dispersion fortified acrylic hybrid waterproofing membrane.
  • Single pack (no mixing) easy to apply anti-sag technology.
  • Rapid cure.
  • Not hazardous and not flammable. Water-based.
  • UV resistant.
  • Low VOC levels. Meets environmental criteria.
  • Permanently flexible with excellent flexibility.
  • Bitumen and tar-free, does not stain grout or tiles.
  • Self-leveling 100% bonded seamless membrane with no joints or laps.
  • Suitable for immersion in water.
  • Excellent chemical and positive hydrostatic resistance.
  • Tough, durable, and puncture resistant.
  • Easily repaired and maintained.
  • Easy to apply and odourless when cured.
  • Suitable for use in confined spaces.
  • Provides long-term protection and inhibits mould and biological growth.
  • Australian made with a long history of Australian use.
  • Overcoat with Virotuff for trafficable areas and extended UV protection.
  • Meets Class III High Extensibility classification.
  • Can be installed in accordance with wet area and exterior membrane applications.
  • Safe to use and does not re-emulsify once fully cured.
  • Will not stain grout or tiles.
  • Formulated for wet area and under tile use, compatible with most tile adhesives.
  • Can be rendered with polymer render and standard render (with bonding additive).

Limitations

  • Azcothane is not designed as a trafficable membrane, although infrequent maintenance foot-traffic is acceptable during the construction phase.
  • Azcothane is not suitable for direct contact with high concentrations of chlorine.
  • Azcothane cannot be applied directly to wet surfaces, as it may cause gassing and bubbling of the membrane.
  • Azcothane can be applied to slightly damp surfaces, provided the surface is free from surface water and prolonged dampness.
  • Azcothane is not designed as a trafficable membrane, although infrequent maintenance foot-traffic is acceptable. A protective coat of Duram Virotuff is recommended in trafficable areas.

Coverage

Coverage rates may vary depending on the type, condition, porosity, texture of the surface, and application technique. The minimum coverage rate is 1.7L/m² or 0.85L/m² per coat. A 15 Lt pail will cover 18 m² for 1 coat at 0.5mm DFT. For water-resistant non-tanking walls, the minimum coverage is 0.85L/m² at 0.5mm DFT. The dry film thickness of the membrane on floors and tanking areas should be 1.0mm DFT with each coat being 500 microns dry film (0.5mm DFT).

Drying and Curing

Drying and curing times are affected by the type, dryness, and porosity of the surface, temperature, humidity, ventilation, climate conditions, and application technique. As a guide, at 25ºC and 50% RH, the touch dry time is 2 to 4 hours per coat, set time is 12 hours, and full cure time is 24 hours per coat. Ensure the membrane is fully cured before tiling or topping. Azcothane is generally touch dry within 2 to 4 hours and fully cured after 24 hours. Recoat between 4-24 hours.

Clean-up

Avoid spills. Wet spills can be cleaned with water, but they may be difficult to clean on porous surfaces. On concrete and non-porous surfaces, use a cloth and water for wet spills. Do not clean off carpets as it is better to allow the product to cure and then shave the carpet. Equipment should be immediately cleaned with water.

Storage and Packaging

Store Azcothane in a cool, dry place away from heat and freezing. The product is not flammable. It is available in 4 Lt and 15 Lt pails, with 15 liters equating to 16 kg. Shelf life is 12 months in an unopened container.
column7: AS4654.1:212,AS4654.2 212,AS4858,Green Star Compliant,acrylic,balcony,basements,bathroom,bitumen-s,block work,brick,ceramics,concrete-s,construction,decks,durable,epoxy-s,external,fibre reinforced,fibreglass,flexible,green tag certified,internal,liquid applied,masonry,membrane,metal,pail,particle board,planter,polyurethane-s,pvc,quick drying,render,rooftops,screed,shower,single pack,tiling-i,undertile,uv stable,water based,waterproofing-a,wet areas,wood-i
column32: Duram Azcothane Non-Reo - UV Stable Waterproofing Membrane
column33: Duram Azcothane is a high-performance water-based polyurethane fortified acrylic hybrid waterproofing membrane. It is designed for demanding applications such as balconies, terraces, decks, shower recesses, and more. Discover its benefits including rapid cure, UV resistance, flexibility, durability, and low VOC levels.
column54:
Limitations

  • Azcothane is not designed as a trafficable membrane, although infrequent maintenance foot-traffic is acceptable during the construction phase.
  • Azcothane is not suitable for direct contact with high concentrations of chlorine.
  • Azcothane cannot be applied directly to wet surfaces, as it may cause gassing and bubbling of the membrane.
  • Azcothane can be applied to slightly damp surfaces, provided the surface is free from surface water and prolonged dampness.
  • Azcothane is not designed as a trafficable membrane, although infrequent maintenance foot-traffic is acceptable. A protective coat of Duram Virotuff is recommended in trafficable areas.
column55: Duram Azcothane is a high-performance water-based polyurethane dispersion fortified acrylic hybrid waterproofing membrane.
column57:
Uses

  • Balconies
  • Terraces
  • Decks
  • Podiums
  • Tiled or covered areas
  • Metal roofs
  • Roofs (UV-exposed)
  • Shower recess & wet areas
  • Retaining walls
  • Planters and landscaped areas
  • Structural slabs
  • Pits and bunded areas
  • Door flashings

Suitable Surfaces

Azcothane is suitable for a wide range of surfaces, including concrete, cement and cement render, FC and CFC sheeting, block & brickwork, masonry/stone, FC, CFC, asbestos and Blue board sheeting, particle board, Scyon & composite sheeting, acrylic coatings, vitreous, ceramic & terra cotta tiles, bitumen (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC), metal (when primed with Duram ME Primer), timber, particle board, plywood (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC), masonite, plasterboard, extruded foam, and fibreglass/gelcoat/PVC. Duram provides recommended priming methods for these surfaces.

Benefits and Advantages

  • Azcothane is a feature-packed polyurethane dispersion fortified acrylic hybrid waterproofing membrane.
  • Single pack (no mixing) easy to apply anti-sag technology.
  • Rapid cure.
  • Not hazardous and not flammable. Water-based.
  • UV resistant.
  • Low VOC levels. Meets environmental criteria.
  • Permanently flexible with excellent flexibility.
  • Bitumen and tar-free, does not stain grout or tiles.
  • Self-leveling 100% bonded seamless membrane with no joints or laps.
  • Suitable for immersion in water.
  • Excellent chemical and positive hydrostatic resistance.
  • Tough, durable, and puncture resistant.
  • Easily repaired and maintained.
  • Easy to apply and odourless when cured.
  • Suitable for use in confined spaces.
  • Provides long-term protection and inhibits mould and biological growth.
  • Australian made with a long history of Australian use.
  • Overcoat with Virotuff for trafficable areas and extended UV protection.
  • Meets Class III High Extensibility classification.
  • Can be installed in accordance with wet area and exterior membrane applications.
  • Safe to use and does not re-emulsify once fully cured.
  • Will not stain grout or tiles.
  • Formulated for wet area and under tile use, compatible with most tile adhesives.
  • Can be rendered with polymer render and standard render (with bonding additive).

column3:
Use Gripset OP for: Enhancing adhesion on non-porous surfaces for Gripset membranes and tile adhesives.

Gripset OP is a solvent-free, multipurpose primer specifically developed to enhance the adhesion of Gripset membranes and tile adhesives to non-porous, smooth, and difficult-to-bond substrates. Its unique formulation provides superior adhesion properties, a textured finish for improved mechanical key, and a fast-drying, low VOC solution for both internal and external applications.

Key Features of Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer

  • Solvent-Free Formula: Safer for users and the environment, eliminating hazardous solvent fumes.
  • Super Adhesion Properties: Ensures a strong bond to various non-porous surfaces.
  • Textured Finish: Improves mechanical key for enhanced adhesion of subsequent coatings.
  • Fast Drying Time: Reduces project downtime, allowing for quicker application of membranes and adhesives.
  • Low VOC Content: Complies with health and safety standards, suitable for indoor use.

Why Choose Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer:

  • Enhanced Adhesion: Optimises the performance of Gripset membranes and tile adhesives.
  • User-Friendly Application: Easy to apply by brush or roller.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for a wide range of substrates and applications.
  • Environmentally Safe: Low VOC and solvent-free formulation.

When to Choose Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Gripset OP over solvent-based primers when: You require a safer, low VOC solution with superior adhesion to non-porous surfaces.
  • Consider other options when: Working with damp substrates or substrates with rising moisture, where Gripset E60 is recommended.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Gripset OP improves long-term adhesion and reduces health risks, providing excellent value.

Trade-Specific Applications for Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer:

For Tilers:

  • Priming ceramic tiles and natural stone to ensure strong tile adhesive bonds.
  • Enhancing adhesion over existing tiles in wet areas, when used with an approved membrane system.
  • Preparing surfaces for tile application in both internal and external settings.

For Waterproofers:

  • Priming metal flashings and rigid PVC for waterproofing applications.
  • Preparing concrete and fibre cement sheeting for Gripset membrane application.
  • Ensuring a reliable bond for leak control flanges and pipe penetrations.

Technical Overview

Gripset OP is a viscous, blue liquid primer designed to provide a textured surface that enhances the mechanical adhesion of Gripset membranes and tile adhesives. Its solvent-free formulation and low VOC content make it a safer and more environmentally friendly option.

Form: Viscous liquid, providing easy application and even coverage.

Dry Time: 30 minutes at 23°C and 50% RH, allowing for quick project continuation.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush or medium nap roller.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Apply a neat, even coat for optimal adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application below 5°C or above 35°C. For dried product, use mechanical or solvent removal.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store at room temperature, away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in unopened container.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Precautions and Limitations

  • Limitations: Not suitable for solvent-based materials, immersed applications, or rising moisture. Must be covered with a wet area membrane when tiling.
  • Safety: Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed health and safety information.
column7: Green Star Compliant,adhesion promoter,aluminium,bonding,ceramics,civil construction-i,concrete,construction,external,fibre cement sheet,flooring-i,general purpose,glass,industrial,internal,low voc,manufacturing,marine plywood,masonry-i,metal,non toxic,pail,plasterboard,primer,solvent free,stainless steel-s,steel,stone-i,tiling-i,water based,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i,wood,wood-i
column32: Gripset OP | High-Performance Multipurpose Primer | Adheseal
column33: Solvent-free multipurpose primer with superior adhesion for non-porous surfaces. Fast-drying, low VOC, and easy to apply. Ideal for Gripset membranes.
column52:
How to apply Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Apply Gripset OP neat, do not dilute.
  3. Use a brush or medium nap roller to apply one even coat.
  4. Allow the primer to dry until it is tack-free, approximately 30 minutes.
  5. Apply Gripset membranes, tile adhesive, or other approved coatings shortly after the primer dries to ensure optimal adhesion.
column53:
Q: Can Gripset OP be used on damp surfaces?

A: No, Gripset OP is not suitable for damp surfaces. For damp substrates or surfaces with rising moisture, Gripset E60 is recommended.

Q: How long does Gripset OP take to dry?

A: Gripset OP dries in approximately 30 minutes at 23°C and 50% relative humidity. Drying times may vary based on environmental conditions.

Q: What is the coverage rate for Gripset OP?

A: On smooth, non-porous surfaces, Gripset OP covers approximately 10 square meters per litre. Coverage may vary depending on the substrate's condition and porosity.

Q: Can Gripset OP be used for both internal and external applications?

A: Yes, Gripset OP is suitable for both internal and external applications, providing versatile use in various construction projects.

Q: Is Gripset OP compatible with solvent-based products?

A: No, Gripset OP is not suitable for applications where solvent-based materials will be applied directly over the primed surface.

Q: What is the best way to clean up Gripset OP?

A: While wet, clean up with water. Once dried, mechanical removal or solvent cleaning is required.
column54:
Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer limitations:

  • Not suitable for applications where solvent-based materials will be applied over the primer.
  • Not for use in immersed applications.
  • Do not apply when ambient or surface temperatures are below 5°C or above 35°C.
  • Not to be used for priming areas subject to rising moisture or negative hydrostatic pressure.

Safety precautions when using Gripset OP Multipurpose Primer:

  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed health and safety information.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Avoid contact with skin and eyes.
  • Store in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
column55: Gripset OP is a solvent-free, multipurpose primer designed to enhance adhesion on non-porous surfaces. Its fast-drying, low VOC formula and textured finish make it ideal for use with Gripset membranes and tile adhesives.

column3:
Use XPRESS PRIMER H2O PLUS for: Preventing blistering and delamination of coatings due to residual moisture, enhancing adhesion, and reducing efflorescence.

XPRESS PRIMER H2O PLUS is a high-performance, single-component vapour barrier primer designed for use on concrete and mineral surfaces. Unlike traditional primers, it does not alter the surface profile but enhances adhesion for overlaid membranes and coatings. Fast-drying and water-resistant, it allows finishes to be applied within just 1 hour. Its unique colour-changing formulation provides a clear visual indication of when it's ready for overcoating, reducing guesswork and ensuring optimal application.

Key Features of XPRESS PRIMER H2O PLUS

  • Forms a strong vapour barrier against residual moisture
  • Can be applied over damp and green concrete
  • Fast drying – allows application of finishes after only 1 hour
  • Water-resistant for enhanced durability
  • Unique colour-changing formula for easy application
  • Reduces efflorescence when used on screeds and renders
  • Compatible with Xpress Multi Pro Membrane for porous surfaces

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Water-based polymer dispersion
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C - 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush or medium nap roller
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants before application
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If applied in humid conditions, allow additional drying time before overcoating

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a cool, dry area away from direct sunlight
  • Keep off cold floors to avoid temperature fluctuations
  • Shelf life: 12 months in original unopened packaging

Certifications

  • Compliant with Australian building standards

Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset Xpress Primer H2O Plus

Q: Can Gripset Xpress Primer H2O Plus be applied over damp concrete?

A: Yes, it is designed for application over damp and green concrete to prevent moisture-related issues.

Q: How long does it take to dry?

A: It dries in approximately 1 hour at 23°C and 50% RH.

Q: What substrates can this primer be applied to?

A: Suitable for concrete, masonry, screed, render, aerated concrete, plasterboard, and compressed fibre cement sheeting.

Q: Does it change colour when drying?

A: Yes, it transitions from milky white to a slight green tinge before drying clear.
column54:
XPRESS PRIMER H2O PLUS Limitations:

  • Not suitable for surfaces with continuous rising moisture or negative hydrostatic pressure
  • Do not apply in temperatures below 5°C or above 35°C
  • Do not use as a primer over existing coatings

Safety precautions when using Gripset Xpress Primer H2O Plus:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves and safety glasses recommended.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow when applying.
  • Handling: Clean up spills with water before drying.

column2: Gripset Xpress SP Rapid Set Primer
column3:
Use Gripset Xpress SP for: Enhancing adhesion on non-porous and porous substrates without etching or solvents.

Gripset Xpress SP is a professional-grade, solvent-free primer engineered for superior adhesion on dense, smooth, and non-porous surfaces. Designed for both wall and floor applications, it eliminates the need for etching or solvent treatments, ensuring a fast and efficient priming process. Ideal for use with Gripset self-adhesive sheets and liquid membranes, this environmentally friendly primer enhances bonding strength on challenging substrates, including metal, concrete, tiles, and timber.

Key Features of Gripset Xpress SP

  • Solvent-free and eco-friendly
  • High adhesion to non-porous surfaces
  • Compatible with metal, concrete, tiles, and timber
  • Fast-drying—ready in 30 minutes
  • Non-tacky with low dirt retention
  • Suitable for internal and external applications
  • Easy application by brush, roller, or spray

Technical Overview

  • Form: Viscous liquid
  • Colour: Wet/Dry – off white, not opaque
  • Drying Time: 30 minutes @ 23°C & 50% RH
  • Specific Gravity: 1.24g/cm³
  • pH Level: 7.0 - 8.5
  • Viscosity: 4000 mPas

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Low nap roller, long bristle brush, or spray applicator
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are structurally sound and free from contaminants before application
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If adhesion is compromised, increase surface preparation through mechanical abrasion

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life: 24 months in an unopened container
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storage in freezing conditions

Certifications

  • Low VOC – Compliant with Green Star Rating tools

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Stir the product well before application.
  3. Apply with a low nap roller, long bristle brush, or spray.
  4. Allow a minimum of 30 minutes drying time before applying membranes or coatings.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset Xpress SP

Q: Can Gripset Xpress SP be used on both walls and floors?

A: Yes, it is designed for use on both vertical and horizontal surfaces, providing strong adhesion without the need for etching or solvents.

Q: What surfaces is Gripset Xpress SP suitable for?

A: It bonds to various non-porous surfaces such as metal, glazed tiles, plastics, precast concrete, compressed fibre cement sheeting, polymer mortars, and smooth self-levelling compounds.

Q: How should Gripset Xpress SP be applied?

A: It should be stirred well before use and applied using a low nap roller or long bristle brush. Ensure even coverage across the treated surface.

Q: What is the drying time for Gripset Xpress SP?

A: The primer dries in approximately 30 minutes at 23°C and 50% RH. Drying time may vary depending on temperature and humidity.

Q: Can this primer be used in areas with rising moisture?

A: No, Gripset Xpress SP is not designed for substrates affected by rising damp or negative hydrostatic pressure. Use Gripset E60 for these conditions.
column54:
Gripset Xpress SP limitations:

  • Not suitable for areas with rising moisture or hydrostatic pressure
  • Not for use in immersed applications
  • Avoid application in extreme cold or wet conditions

Safety precautions when using Gripset Xpress SP:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses when handling the product.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow when applying, especially in enclosed areas.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. If contact occurs, wash with soap and water.
  • Clean-up: Clean spills and tools with water while the product is still wet. Once dried, mechanical removal or solvent cleaning is required.
  • Storage: Store at room temperature, away from freezing conditions and direct sunlight.
  • Disposal: Dispose of unused material according to local environmental regulations.

Ideal for metal, concrete, tiles, timber, and other challenging surfaces, this primer is perfect for use with Gripset self-adhesive sheets and liquid membranes. With excellent adhesion, easy application, and low dirt retention, Gripset Xpress SP is the perfect choice for professionals seeking a reliable, non-toxic primer.

column2: Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Powder Free Gloves
column3:
Use Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves for: Protecting hands from chemicals, punctures, and contamination in trade and industrial applications

Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves offer exceptional durability and comfort for Australian tradespeople needing heavy-duty hand protection. Designed for superior puncture resistance and chemical splash protection, these powder-free gloves are crafted from 100% nitrile for enhanced safety and sensitivity. The textured surface ensures a secure grip, even in oily or wet conditions, while low sweat technology supports extended wear. Ideal for automotive work, hydraulic repairs, food handling, and industrial cleaning, Black Ace gloves meet the demands of tough work environments with ease.

Key Features of Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves

  • Powder-free and latex-free for reduced allergic reactions
  • High puncture resistance for reliable hand protection
  • Low sweat technology enhances comfort during long wear
  • Certified for protection against Fentanyl exposure
  • Textured fingers and palm for improved grip control
  • Food contact approved and odour-free for hygienic use
  • 5 mils thickness for extra strength without compromising dexterity

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: 100% Nitrile
  • Thickness: 5 mils (0.13 mm)
  • Puncture Resistance: High
  • Chemical Resistance: Incidental splash exposure
  • Sizes Available: Small to 2XL
  • Certifications: Fentanyl Protection Certified, Food Contact Approved

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: No tools required for use
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ideal for handling oils, lubricants, and food-grade materials
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Gloves may loosen with extended wear—choose correct size for snug fit

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 3 years from date of manufacture if stored properly
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 30°C (41°F to 86°F)

Certifications

  • Certified for Fentanyl Protection (meets relevant safety standards)
  • Approved for Food Contact under Australian standards
  • Complies with PPE regulations for disposable gloves

column52:
How to apply Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves:

  1. Ensure hands are dry and free of oils or contaminants
  2. Select the appropriate glove size for a snug fit
  3. Insert fingers into glove and pull over wrist securely
  4. After use, remove gloves by peeling from wrist, turning inside out
  5. Dispose safely and wash hands thoroughly if needed
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves

Q: How do I properly wear and remove these gloves?

A: Ensure hands are clean and dry. Insert fingers and pull gently over the wrist. To remove, peel from the wrist down, turning the glove inside out to avoid contamination. Dispose of responsibly.

Q: How durable are these gloves for heavy-duty tasks?

A: These gloves offer high puncture resistance with a 5 mils thickness, making them ideal for automotive, hydraulic, and industrial applications where strength and durability are essential.

Q: Are these gloves compatible with all skin types?

A: Yes, made from 100% nitrile and free from latex and powder, they reduce allergy risks and are odour-free, making them suitable for sensitive skin.

Q: What should I do if the gloves tear during use?

A: Immediately remove the damaged glove, clean your hands, and replace it with a new one. Always inspect gloves before use to ensure integrity.

Q: How should I dispose of used gloves safely?

A: Dispose of gloves in accordance with local regulations. If used in chemical or biological exposure, treat as hazardous waste. Avoid reusing disposable gloves.
column54:
Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves limitations:

  • Not suitable for prolonged chemical immersion
  • Single-use only – not designed for reuse
  • Should not be used if punctured or visibly damaged

Safety precautions when using Black Ace Disposable Nitrile Gloves:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves in conjunction with other PPE as required
  • Ventilation: Ensure good ventilation when used with strong chemicals
  • Handling: Avoid sharp objects that could puncture the glove
  • Dispose responsibly after use; do not reuse

  3. Push the unit firmly into the outlet until flush
  4. Check for secure fit and proper drainage flow

Q: How do I install the floor waste?

A: The push-in design allows for easy installation without tools. Simply align with the outlet and push into place, ensuring a snug and secure fit.

Q: Is the chrome finish durable?

A: Yes, the chrome plating offers excellent corrosion resistance and maintains its finish under wet conditions, ideal for bathrooms and laundries.

Q: Is it compatible with all 100mm outlets?

A: It is designed for standard 100mm outlets. Always verify outlet dimensions to ensure compatibility for a proper fit.

Q: What if the waste doesn’t sit flush?

A: Check for debris or uneven outlet edges. Ensure the pipe is aligned and level to allow the floor waste to sit correctly and securely.

Q: Are there any safety concerns during installation?

A: No specific hazards, but ensure the surrounding area is dry during installation to prevent slipping or accidental movement.

column2: Xtraseal MS-609 MS Advanced Polymer Sealant
column3:
Use Xtraseal MS-609 for: Secure bonding of mirrors, panels, decorative walls, metals, plastics, and various building materials without additional support.

Xtraseal MS-609 is a high-performance hybrid polymer sealant designed for superior bonding in construction and industrial applications. It features extreme initial grip, making it ideal for direct bonding without additional mechanical support. With excellent UV resistance, paintability, and the ability to adhere to moist surfaces, MS-609 provides long-lasting, reliable adhesion across multiple substrates, including mirrors, coated metals, UPVC, HPL panels, and more.

Key Features of Xtraseal MS-609

  • High initial grip – eliminates the need for additional support.
  • Excellent UV resistance for long-term outdoor use.
  • Can be applied to damp surfaces without performance loss.
  • Paintable with most water-based paints.
  • Does not contain solvents, isocyanates, or silicone oils.
  • Non-bleeding, crack-resistant, and environment-friendly.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Silyl-modified polyether (MS Polymer)
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 100°C (-40°F to 212°F)
  • Hardness (Shore A): 50
  • Elongation at Break: 200%
  • Tensile Strength: 1.02 MPa
  • Skin Formation Time: 5 minutes
  • Cure Depth: 10mm in 7 days

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, surface cleaner, utility knife
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure substrates are clean and dry for maximum adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If curing time is slow, increase ambient humidity.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place (5°C to 30°C).
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months in unopened packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storage in temperatures above 30°C.

Certifications

  • ISO 11600 F 25 LM
  • ASTM C920 Compliance
  • Meets AS 1526 standards

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About MS-609 MS Advanced Polymer Sealant

Q: Can MS-609 be used for bonding mirrors?

A: Yes, MS-609 is specially developed for mirror bonding, providing a strong and reliable adhesion without staining.

Q: Is MS-609 suitable for external applications?

A: Yes, MS-609 is suitable for both internal and external applications. It has excellent color stability and UV resistance.

Q: Can MS-609 be painted?

A: Yes, MS-609 is paintable with water-based paints. However, compatibility tests are recommended.

Q: How long does MS-609 take to cure?

A: MS-609 skins in approximately 5 minutes, is tack-free in 20 minutes, and cures to 10 mm in 7 days. Curing time may vary with humidity.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using MS-609?

A: Read the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) before use. Ensure proper ventilation. Clean uncured adhesive with mineral spirits.
column54:
MS-609 MS Advanced Polymer Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for PE, PP, PTFE, plastics containing softeners, and bituminous substrates.
  • Not recommended for structural glazing.
  • Avoid use in totally confined spaces where there is no atmospheric humidity.
  • Not suitable for underwater applications.
  • Not recommended for heavy trafficable surfaces or joints.
  • Avoid exposure to aggressive solvents or chemicals.
  • Not suitable for food contact applications.

Safety precautions when using MS-609 MS Advanced Polymer Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Wash hands after use. Avoid contact with skin and eyes.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 30°C.

column2: X'traseal MC-228 Multi-Color Flexi Gap Sealant Grout
column3:
Use Xtraseal MC-228 for: Sealing and beautifying tile gaps with a glossy, water-resistant, and mildew-proof finish.

Xtraseal MC-228 Multi-Color Flexi Gap Sealant is a high-quality, nanotech-polymer-based gap sealant designed to provide a sturdy, glossy, and colorful finish between tile gaps. It is water and mildew-proof, non-shrinking, and VOC-free, making it a safe and durable choice for residential and commercial applications. With a short setting and curing time, MC-228 is ideal for use in kitchens, bathrooms, balconies, and other tiled surfaces.

Key Features of Xtraseal MC-228

  • No VOC – Safe for indoor applications
  • Non-shrink – Maintains its form over time
  • Glossy finish – Matches the appearance of porcelain
  • Water & mildew-proof – Ideal for moisture-prone areas
  • Fast curing – Fully sets in just 24 hours
  • Available in multiple colors – Enhances aesthetic appeal

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Nanotech-polymer with cosmetic-grade pigments
  • Application Temperature Range: 15°C to 120°C (59°F to 248°F)
  • Shore D Hardness: Minimum 50
  • Viscosity: 300±50K cps (Resin), 300±30K cps (Hardener)
  • Mixing Ratio: 1:1 (Resin:Hardener)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Professional caulking gun, masking tape, stainless steel tooling stick
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Dispose of the first 30-40 cm of extruded sealant for even mixing
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If over-applied, remove excess with alcohol before hardening

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C to 30°C
  • Shelf Life Information: 24 months under optimal storage conditions

Certifications

  • Complies with industry standards for low VOC content
  • Meets durability and adhesion requirements for tile sealing

How to apply Xtraseal MC-228:

  2. Insert the cartridge into a caulking gun and attach the nozzle.

  6. Smooth the sealant with a stainless steel tooling stick.
  7. Remove masking tape after 30 minutes and allow curing for 24 hours.

Q: How do I apply MC-228 properly?

A: Clean the gap, apply masking tape along the edges, and use a professional caulking gun to extrude the sealant. Smooth with a stainless steel tool and remove the tape after 30 minutes.

Q: How long does it take to cure?

A: MC-228 sets within 3-5 hours and fully cures in 24 hours at 25°C.

Q: Is MC-228 suitable for all tile types?

A: Yes, it works with travertine, ceramic, porcelain, marble, granite, and more. However, it is not recommended for PE, PP, and PTFE surfaces.

  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow during application.
  • Handling: Clean spills with alcohol before curing.
