column3:
Use Adheseal PU-15 Low Modulus Elastomeric Polyurethane Joint Sealant for: Sealing movement and connection joints, window perimeter sealing, and general construction applications across various substrates.

Adheseal PU-15 is a premium low modulus polyurethane joint sealant designed for high movement applications. It provides exceptional flexibility and durability, making it ideal for Australian construction and industrial needs. Its ability to accommodate up to 30% movement and its resistance to mould and mildew ensure long-lasting performance in diverse environments.

Key Features of Adheseal PU-15 Low Modulus Elastomeric Polyurethane Joint Sealant

  • Low Modulus (Shore A 15): Provides excellent flexibility, reducing stress on joints and preventing cracking.
  • High Movement Capability (+/- 30%): Accommodates significant joint movement, ideal for expansion and contraction.
  • Mould and Mildew Resistant: Suitable for humid environments, preventing fungal growth and maintaining aesthetics.
  • Excellent Chemical Resistance: Resists water, detergents, and dilute chemicals, ensuring long-term durability.
  • Paintable: Compatible with acrylic, oil, and rubber-based paints (test for flexibility).

Why Choose Adheseal PU-15 Low Modulus Elastomeric Polyurethane Joint Sealant:

  • Long-Term Durability: Proven resilience and long-term performance reduce maintenance costs.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various substrates and applications, simplifying inventory and project management.
  • Australian Climate Ready: Wide service temperature range and UV resistance ensure reliable performance in diverse climates.
  • Green Star Compliant: Low VOC content meets environmental criteria, promoting sustainable construction.

When to Choose Adheseal PU-15 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Adheseal PU-15 over standard polyurethane sealants when: High movement capability and low modulus are required, such as in expansion joints and curtain walls.
  • Consider other options when: Structural glazing applications are required, as specialized glazing silicones are more appropriate.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Adheseal PU-15 provides superior movement and durability, offering long-term value compared to cheaper, less flexible alternatives.

Trade-Specific Applications for Adheseal PU-15 Low Modulus Elastomeric Polyurethane Joint Sealant:

For Builders and Carpenters:

  • Sealing expansion joints in precast and tilt-up panels, ensuring structural integrity.
  • Perimeter sealing of windows and doors, preventing water and air ingress.
  • Adhering lightweight components, providing a flexible and durable bond.

For Glaziers:

  • Sealing curtain walls, providing weatherproofing and structural support.
  • Perimeter sealing of windows, ensuring airtight and watertight seals.
  • Sealing joints between glass and framing materials, accommodating thermal movement.

For Metal Cladding Professionals:

  • Sealing metal cladding joints, preventing water and air leaks.
  • Sealing aluminium fabrication and bolted lap joints, ensuring structural integrity.
  • Sealing materials with different thermal expansion coefficients, accommodating movement.

For Marine and Automotive Trades:

  • Sealing joints in vehicular and marine manufacturing, providing durable and flexible seals.
  • Adhering components in vehicle and boat construction, ensuring secure bonding.
  • Sealing seams and joints exposed to harsh environmental conditions.

Technical Overview

Adheseal PU-15 is a low modulus, moisture-curing polyurethane sealant designed for movement and connection joints. Its formulation ensures high elasticity and durability, making it suitable for a wide range of applications. The sealant cures to form a permanently elastic and dustproof seal, accommodating movement up to 30%.

Chemical Properties: Polyurethane-based sealant with excellent resistance to water, detergents, and dilute chemicals. Its low modulus formulation ensures flexibility and durability.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +40°C (41°F to 104°F). This range allows for application in various Australian climates, ensuring the sealant remains workable in both warm and cool conditions.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, smoothing spatula, masking tape, and cleaning solvents (Xylene).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For builders, ensure proper joint design and use backing rod for optimal performance. Glaziers should ensure clean surfaces and use appropriate primers for non-porous substrates.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application in totally confined spaces due to moisture curing requirements. Ensure proper surface preparation and priming for optimal adhesion.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to prevent premature curing or damage to the sealant.

Certifications and Compliance

  • ISO 11600 F 25 LM: Sealant Classification for building joints.
  • ASTM C793-05 & ISO11431: Accelerated testing for UV and weathering.
  • European 2004/42/CE: Low VOC content compliant with environmental standards.
column7: AS/NZ 3837,Marine Sealants,aluminium,anodised aluminium,auto body-i,brick,caravan and truck-i,caulking-i,civil construction-i,cladding,concrete-s,construction,curtain walls,durable,expansion joints,external,facades,fenestration sealing,fibreglass,flexible,flooring-i,general purpose,general sealing,glass and aluminium-i,glazing-i,industrial,internal,joinery & cabinets-i,long work time,low modulus,manufacturing,marine-i,masonry,metal,moisture resistant,one part,paintable,polyurethane-s,precast panels,preparation & remedial,primerless,retaining walls,rooftops,sausage,sealant,sheet metal-i,signage-i,slump resistant,stone,tear resistant,temperature resistant,tiling-i,trafficable,uv stable,water resistant,waterproof membranes-s,weatherseal,window perimeters,wood-i
column32: Adheseal PU-15 Low Modulus Polyurethane Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Adheseal PU-15: Low modulus, elastomeric polyurethane joint sealant. Flexible, durable, and mould-resistant for porous substrates and various construction applications.
column52:
How to apply Adheseal PU-15 Polyurethane Sealant:

  1. Prepare the surfaces: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Prime if necessary: Use appropriate primer for porous or non-porous substrates.
  3. Install backing rod: Use an open-cell foam backing rod for joints deeper than 10mm.
  4. Apply the sealant: Fill the joint completely, avoiding air entrapment.
  5. Tool the sealant: Smooth the surface with a moistened spatula before skin formation.
  6. Clean up: Remove excess sealant and masking tape while wet.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal PU-15

Q: What is the best way to apply Adheseal PU-15 for a clean finish?

A: For a clean finish, use masking tape along the joint edges and remove it while the sealant is still wet. Apply the sealant with a caulking gun at a 45-degree angle, ensuring it fills the joint completely. Tool the sealant with a moistened spatula before it skins over.

Q: How does Adheseal PU-15 perform in extreme weather conditions?

A: Adheseal PU-15 is designed to withstand a range of weather conditions, including UV exposure and temperature variations. Its high elasticity and weather resistance ensure a durable seal, preventing cracks and maintaining integrity over time.

Q: Can Adheseal PU-15 be used on different types of building materials?

A: Yes, Adheseal PU-15 has excellent adhesion to various substrates, including concrete, metal, timber, and plastics. However, for optimal adhesion, especially on non-porous surfaces, use Adheseal 50A surface prep. For porous surfaces, use Everflex Supaprime.

Q: What are the technical properties that make Adheseal PU-15 suitable for movement joints?

A: Adheseal PU-15 has a low modulus and high elasticity, allowing it to accommodate joint movement up to ±25%. This flexibility prevents stress transfer to the substrates, ensuring long-term durability and preventing cracks in dynamic structures.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Adheseal PU-15?

A: Use in a well-ventilated area. Wear gloves, safety glasses, and, if necessary, a respirator. Clean any spills immediately with Xylene. If the product comes into contact with skin or eyes, wash thoroughly with water. Consult the SDS for detailed safety information.

Q: Can Adheseal PU-15 be used below the waterline?

A: Yes, once fully cured, Adheseal PU-15 is suitable for below waterline applications. This makes it versatile for marine environments and other applications where water immersion is a factor.

Q: How long does Adheseal PU-15 take to cure?

A: Adheseal PU-15 has a skin time of approximately 10 minutes and cures at a rate of 2mm per 24 hours at 25°C and 50% humidity. Cure times can vary based on temperature and humidity.
column54:
Adheseal PU-15 limitations:

  • Not suitable for internal swimming pool applications or prolonged exposure to high chlorine levels (max 5ppm).
  • Not for use in totally confined spaces as it requires atmospheric moisture to cure.
  • Avoid use on aquariums, mirrors (use Hi-Power/MS609), and structural glazing (use N-80 or N-60 silicone).
  • Not recommended for composite panels (use Hi-Flex Construction), natural rubber, EPDM rubber, or materials that leach oils, plasticisers, or solvents.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Not for use on bituminous surfaces.
  • Avoid application when moisture-vapor-transmission is emanating from the substrate or if air-entrapment can occur, as this may cause bubbling.

Safety precautions when using Adheseal PU-15:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and a respirator if ventilation is inadequate.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application to avoid inhalation of vapors.
  • Handling: Wash hands thoroughly after handling and before eating or smoking. Clean spills immediately with Xylene.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste materials according to local regulations.

column3:
Use Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive for: Bonding various construction and marine materials, including wood, metals, plastics, and concrete, with a fast-setting, water-resistant formula.

Unobond FC is a structural-grade, solvent-free polyurethane adhesive designed for high-strength bonding across a wide range of materials. Its fast-setting formula and exceptional water resistance make it ideal for demanding applications, including marine environments and general construction. This adhesive provides a durable and reliable bond, enhancing project efficiency and longevity.

Key Features of Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive:

  • Fast Setting: Reduces project time and increases efficiency.
  • Solvent-Free: Environmentally friendly and safe for various materials.
  • Marine Environment Suitable: High water resistance ensures durability in marine applications.
  • Superior Bond Strength: Provides a strong, structural bond for diverse substrates.
  • Long Open Time: Allows for flexible application and adjustments.

Why Choose Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive:

  • Increased Efficiency: Fast setting and easy application reduce project timelines.
  • Versatile Application: Bonds a wide range of materials, simplifying project needs.
  • Enhanced Durability: High water and temperature resistance ensure long-lasting performance.
  • Environmentally Friendly: Solvent-free formulation promotes safer application.

When to Choose Unobond FC versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Unobond FC over traditional construction adhesives when: Fast setting, high water resistance, and marine suitability are required.
  • Consider other options when: Gap-filling applications requiring high strength are needed, as this product loses strength when used as a gap filler.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Unobond FC offers superior performance and durability, justifying its premium value compared to general-purpose adhesives.

Trade-Specific Applications for Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive:

For Marine Trades:

  • Bonding structural components in boat construction and repair.
  • Adhering decking and interior panels, ensuring water resistance.
  • Sealing and bonding components exposed to saltwater environments.

For Carpenters and Builders:

  • Adhering wood, plasterboard, and particleboard in construction projects.
  • Bonding flooring and wall panels, providing a strong and durable bond.
  • Adhering insulation foam and concrete elements.

For Metal Fabricators:

  • Bonding aluminium, iron, and steel components.
  • Adhering sheet metal in fabrication projects.
  • Bonding dissimilar metals, providing a strong and reliable bond.

For Signage and Display Installers:

  • Bonding display signs to various substrates, including metals and plastics.
  • Adhering veneer and melamine in display construction.
  • Providing strong reliable bonds for long lasting signage.

Technical Overview

Unobond FC is a moisture-curing polyurethane adhesive that provides a strong, structural bond across various materials. Its solvent-free formulation and fast-setting properties make it a versatile choice for demanding applications. The adhesive expands slightly during curing, filling minor irregularities in substrates.

Chemical Properties: Polyurethane-based adhesive with excellent water and temperature resistance. Its solvent-free formulation ensures safe application on various substrates.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F). This range allows for application in various Australian climates, ensuring the adhesive remains workable in both warm and cool conditions.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Glue spreader, roller, or spray applicator; clamps, nails, or screws for pressing.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For marine applications, ensure surfaces are thoroughly cleaned and prepared. For carpentry, apply even pressure during curing for maximum strength.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid using as a gap filler for high-strength applications. Ensure proper surface preparation and pressing for optimal bonding.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 35°C (41°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to prevent premature curing or damage to the adhesive.

Certifications and Compliance

  • This product is not classified as hazardous according to Work Safe Australia.

column32: Unobond FC Fast Setting Polyurethane Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Unobond FC: Solvent-free, fast-setting polyurethane adhesive for marine and construction. High water resistance and superior bond strength.
column52:
How to apply Unobond FC:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Apply adhesive using a glue spreader, roller, or spray applicator.
  3. Press both substrates together and apply even pressure using clamps, screws, or nails.
  4. Allow at least 1.5 hours of pressing time before handling.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive

Q: Is Unobond FC suitable for marine applications?

A: Yes, Unobond FC has excellent water resistance and is suitable for use in marine environments.

Q: How fast does Unobond FC set?

A: Unobond FC requires approximately 1.5 hours of pressing time at 20°C for initial setting.

Q: Can Unobond FC be used on non-porous surfaces?

A: Yes, but some non-porous surfaces may require the use of Primer 50A for optimal adhesion.

Q: What materials are compatible with Unobond FC?

A: Unobond FC bonds various materials, including wood, metals, plastics, concrete, and masonry.

Q: How should I clean up Unobond FC?

A: While wet, use Acetone or MEK. Once cured, use mechanical means by trimming or sanding.

Q: Can I use Unobond FC as a gap filler?

A: Using Unobond FC as a gap filler reduces its strength. For maximum strength, apply pressure during the curing period.
column54:
Unobond FC limitations:

  • Not suitable as a gap filler without applied pressure.
  • Some non-porous surfaces may require Primer 50A.
  • Not recommended for flexible joints.

Safety precautions when using Unobond FC:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Use in a well-ventilated area.
  • Handling: Avoid direct skin contact.
column55: Unobond FC delivers a strong, water-resistant bond for diverse applications. Its fast-setting, solvent-free formula is ideal for marine and general construction.
column56:
Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive can be used on the following substrates:

  • Wood: Provides a strong, durable bond for various timber applications.
  • Metals (Aluminium, Iron, Steel): Ideal for bonding metal components in construction and fabrication.
  • Plastics: Adheres to many plastics, but testing is recommended.
  • Concrete and Masonry: Suitable for bonding concrete elements and masonry materials.
  • Plasterboard and Particleboard: Provides a reliable bond for interior construction.
  • Polystyrene and Insulation Foam: Bonds foam materials effectively.
column57:
Use Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive for:

  • Bonding structural components in marine environments.
  • Adhering various construction materials, including wood, metals, and plastics.
  • Bonding interior and exterior panels in construction.
  • Adhering insulation foam and concrete elements.
  • Bonding dissimilar materials in fabrication projects.

Why Use Unobond FC Solvent-Free Polyurethane Adhesive for:

  • Fast setting for efficient project completion.
  • High water resistance for marine and outdoor applications.
  • Strong structural bond for demanding applications.
  • Solvent-free formulation for safer application.
  • Versatile application on a wide range of substrates.

column2: Sikaflex® Pro: Sealant for Concrete and Masonry Facades
column3:
Use Sikaflex® PRO for: Sealing movement and connection joints on porous substrates, such as concrete and masonry facades.

Please note, this product is BOX BUY only.

Sikaflex® PRO is a reliable and versatile sealant designed for a variety of applications, including movement and connection joints on concrete and masonry facades. This one-component, moisture-curing sealant offers excellent adhesion to various substrates, good workability, and a movement capability of ±25%, ensuring a durable and weather-resistant seal.

Key Features

  • One-component, moisture-curing sealant
  • Elastic joint sealant
  • Excellent adhesion to various substrates
  • Good workability
  • Movement capability of ±25%
  • Suitable for indoor and outdoor applications

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: +5 °C to +40 °C
  • Service Temperature: -40 °C to +70 °C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sealant gun, closed cell polyethylene foam backing rods, Sika® Aktivator-205 (for non-porous substrates), Sika® Primer-3 N (for porous substrates), Sika® Tooling Agent N, Sika® Remover-208, Sika® TopClean T
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and properly prepared before application. Use appropriate primers and activators for optimal adhesion. Tool the sealant firmly against joint sides to ensure proper adhesion and avoid air entrapment. Use masking tape for neat lines. Can be overpainted with most conventional facade coating paint systems after fully cured.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Discoloration may occur due to chemical exposure, high temperatures, or UV radiation. This is purely aesthetic and does not affect performance. Avoid using tooling agents containing solvents. Do not use on natural stone, bituminous substrates, natural rubber, EPDM rubber, or building materials that might bleed oils, plasticizers, or solvents.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, between +5 °C and +25 °C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between +5 °C and +25 °C.

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 4020:2018 - Water Potable Approved
  • ISO 11600 F 25 LM
  • ASTM C 920 class 25

column32: Sikaflex® PRO Sealant for Concrete & Masonry | Adheseal
column33: Sikaflex® PRO is a high-quality, moisture-curing sealant for concrete and masonry facades. It offers excellent movement capability and adhesion.
column52:
Application Guide

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and properly prepared.
  2. Insert a suitable backing rod to the required depth.
  3. Apply any necessary primer or activator.
  4. Extrude Sikaflex® PRO into the joint, ensuring full contact with joint sides and avoiding air entrapment.
  5. Tool the sealant firmly against the joint sides.
  6. Use masking tape for neat lines and remove it within the skin time.
  7. Smooth the joint surfaces with a compatible tooling agent.
column54:
Limitations

  • Do not use on natural stone.
  • Do not use on bituminous substrates, natural rubber, EPDM rubber, or building materials that might bleed oils, plasticizers, or solvents.
  • Do not use to seal joints in and around swimming pools.
  • Do not use for joints under water pressure or for permanent water immersion.
  • Do not expose uncured Sikaflex® PRO to alcohol-containing products.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for complete safety information.

column2: 100mm Round Megaflex Stick Down Floor Waste
column3:
Use 100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste for: Effective drainage in large wet areas with high water flow, requiring secure waterproofing and a low-profile design.

The 100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste is a robust solution for high-volume drainage in commercial and residential wet areas. Featuring a 100mm outlet, solid brass grate, and durable ABS Megaflex™ flange, this floor waste ensures effective water management and secure waterproofing. Designed for low-profile installations, it is ideal for bathrooms, commercial kitchens, and laundry rooms. The chrome finish offers both aesthetic appeal and corrosion resistance, making it a preferred choice for Australian trade professionals.

Key Features of 100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste

  • 100mm outlet enables high-capacity drainage in large wet areas
  • Solid brass grate provides superior durability and corrosion resistance
  • ABS Megaflex™ flange ensures secure bonding with waterproofing membranes
  • Low-profile design simplifies installation in tight or flush-mounted areas

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Brass (grate), ABS Plastic (flange)
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 60°C (41°F to 140°F)
  • Finish: Chrome plated
  • Outlet Size: 100mm
  • Installation Type: Stick down, low-profile

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Plumbing tools, sealant gun, waterproofing tools
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a primer with ABS flange for maximum membrane adhesion and seal integrity
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure alignment with pipe fittings for optimal flow; recheck seal around flange to avoid leaks

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep in a dry area away from UV exposure
  • Shelf Life Information: Unlimited under proper storage conditions
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • WaterMark Certified – Complies with AS/NZS 3500
  • ISO 9001 Certified Manufacturing
  • Conforms to Australian Plumbing and Drainage Standards

column32: 100mm Round Megaflex Stick Down Floor Waste | Adheseal
column33: High-capacity floor waste with 100mm outlet, brass grate, and Megaflex™ flange. Ideal for large wet areas. Low-profile, easy install.
column52:
How to apply 100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste:

  1. Prepare and clean the substrate surface thoroughly
  2. Apply waterproofing membrane and bonding agent as needed
  3. Press ABS Megaflex™ flange firmly into position
  4. Connect 100mm outlet to drainage pipe using correct fitting
  5. Install brass grate and ensure proper sealing at edges
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste

Q: How do I install the 100mm outlet floor waste?

A: Apply waterproofing membrane, bond the ABS Megaflex™ flange to the substrate, and connect the 100mm outlet to plumbing fittings. Ensure proper alignment and sealing.

Q: Is the brass grate rust-proof?

A: Yes, the solid brass grate is corrosion resistant and suited for high-moisture environments, offering long-term durability.

Q: Can I use this floor waste with tiled surfaces?

A: Absolutely. It is compatible with tiled, vinyl, and screeded surfaces. Proper sealing ensures optimal waterproofing on all compatible surfaces.

Q: What if water pools around the flange?

A: This may indicate an improper seal. Ensure membrane adhesion and inspect the flange for full contact with the surface. Reseal if needed.

Q: How should I dispose of this product at end of life?

A: Recycle brass grate through metal recycling programs. Dispose of ABS flange according to local recycling regulations for plastics.
column54:
100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste limitations:

  • Not intended for high-temperature waste water systems
  • Requires proper waterproofing membrane for effective performance

Safety precautions when using 100mm Round Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves and safety glasses
  • Ventilation: Ensure workspace is ventilated during adhesive use
  • Handling: Handle flange carefully to avoid warping or damage

column3:
Use Mountain Grout Flexible for: Crack and joint repair in concrete structures, waterproofing, void filling, and creating a flexible, durable seal.

Mountain Grout Flexible is a single-component, hydrophobic polyurethane grout designed for professional concrete repair. Its low viscosity allows for deep penetration into cracks and joints, expanding up to 30 times its initial volume upon contact with minimal water. This expansion creates a closed-cell foam that forms a flexible, durable, and watertight seal, ideal for various applications, including water-related facilities, tunnels, and underground vaults. The addition of the "B" accelerator allows for job site control of the reaction time.

Key Features

  • Hydrophobic: Forms a watertight seal.
  • Flexible: Accommodates movement in concrete structures.
  • High Expansion: Fills voids and cracks effectively.
  • Low Viscosity: Penetrates deeply into cracks.
  • VOC-Free: Environmentally friendly.
  • Controllable Reaction Time: Accelerator allows for job site adjustments.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Hydrophobic Polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: (Consult manufacturer's documentation)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Grout pump, mixing equipment (if using accelerator), personal protective equipment (PPE) including gloves and eye protection.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Proper surface preparation is crucial. Clean cracks thoroughly and ensure they are free of debris. The amount of "B" accelerator added will control the reaction time. Start with small amounts and test the reaction before proceeding with large batches. Consider using a pressure injection method for deeper cracks.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Uncontrolled expansion can occur if too much accelerator is used. Always test the mix ratio first. Ensure proper safety measures are taken when working with polyurethane grouts.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place. Protect from moisture.
  • Shelf Life Information: (Consult manufacturer's documentation)
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures.

Suitable Substrates

  • Concrete
  • Masonry

column2: Gripset C-Plug Rapid Set Waterproof Plug
column3:
Use Gripset C-Plug for: Instant waterproof sealing of active water leaks in concrete and masonry structures.

Gripset C-Plug is a high-performance, rapid-setting, non-shrink cement-based compound that provides an immediate waterproof seal for active leaks. Designed for use in commercial, industrial, and residential applications, it effectively prevents water ingress through cracks, holes, and structural joints in concrete and masonry. With its quick curing time of 1-3 minutes, it ensures efficient leak prevention while maintaining structural integrity.

Key Features of Gripset C-Plug

  • Stops active water leaks instantly
  • Rapid set time: 1-3 minutes
  • Non-shrink formula for a durable seal
  • High compressive strength (35 MPa at 28 days)
  • Non-toxic, non-staining, and free from hazardous odors
  • Does not corrode steel reinforcement
  • Can be sanded or ground to match structural contours

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Cement-based
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Trowel, spatula, gloves
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are damp before application for optimal adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For high-volume leaks, increase application depth to at least 40mm

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry environment, off concrete floors
  • Shelf Life: 12 months from date of production
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing conditions

Certifications

  • Compliant with Australian standards for waterproofing

column32: Gripset C-Plug | Rapid-Set Waterproof Leak Sealer | Adheseal
column33: Gripset C-Plug is a fast-setting, non-shrink cement-based compound that instantly seals active water leaks in concrete and masonry. Ideal for basements, tunnels, and water tanks.
column52:
How to apply Gripset C-Plug:

  1. Clean and prepare the surface by removing loose debris.
  2. Dampen the area with clean water.
  3. Mix Gripset C-Plug powder with water to form a thick paste.
  4. Apply the mix to the affected area using a gloved hand or trowel.
  5. Hold in place until the product begins to warm or set.
  6. Keep the applied area damp for 15 minutes to aid curing.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset C-Plug

Q: What is Gripset C-Plug used for?

A: Gripset C-Plug is a rapid-setting, non-shrink cement-based compound designed to instantly stop active water leaks under pressure. It is ideal for sealing cracks, holes, and openings in concrete and masonry surfaces.

Q: How quickly does Gripset C-Plug set?

A: The initial set time is 30 seconds to 1 minute, while the final setting time is 2-4 minutes.

Q: Can Gripset C-Plug be used for sealing wall/floor junctions?

A: Yes, it can be used to create a pressure-resistant fillet at wall/floor junctions in water-retaining structures when combined with Gripset C-1P.

Q: How do I apply Gripset C-Plug?

A: Mix the product by hand using a spatula, form a paste, and press it firmly into the leaking area. Hold in place until the product begins to set, then slowly remove your hand.

Q: Is Gripset C-Plug suitable for use in water tanks?

A: Yes, it can be used in water tanks and other water retention structures to stop leaks and provide a waterproof seal.
column54:
Gripset C-Plug limitations:

  • Not for use on non-cementitious surfaces
  • Not suitable for expansion/movement joints
  • Do not use on frozen surfaces or in extreme cold conditions

Safety precautions when using Gripset C-Plug:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses when handling the product.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid dust inhalation.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. If contact occurs, rinse thoroughly with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Clean tools and surfaces with water before the product sets. Once dried, removal must be done mechanically.
  • Storage: Store in a dry area at room temperature. Keep away from moisture and freezing conditions.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste material according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset C-Plug is a rapid-setting, non-shrink cement-based compound that provides an instant waterproof seal against active leaks. It is specially formulated to stop flowing water in cracks, holes, and similar openings in concrete and masonry. With a set time of 1-3 minutes, it offers high mechanical strength and does not promote corrosion. Suitable for basements, tunnels, lift shafts, and water retention structures, Gripset C-Plug ensures lasting protection against leaks and seepage. Non-toxic, non-staining, and free from dangerous odors, it is a reliable solution for various applications, including joint filling and rapid anchoring.
column56:
Gripset C-Plug can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete
  • Masonry

column2: RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar
column3:
Use RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar for: Fast, non-structural repairs on vertical and overhead concrete surfaces, especially precast and tilt-up panels.

RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar is a lightweight, polymer-modified cementitious mortar specifically designed for high-build applications up to 100mm. Fire-rated to AS1530.4 when applied at 35mm, it provides outstanding adhesion to concrete and masonry surfaces with minimal shrinkage. This fine-filled Australian-made mortar is ideal for covering metal joiner plates in precast and tilt-up panels, as well as repairing damaged concrete in vertical or overhead orientations. Its easy-to-mix formula requires only water and finishes to a smooth surface ready for coating.

Key Features of RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar

  • High-build repairs up to 100mm without formwork
  • Fire-rated (4 hours to AS1530.4) at 35mm thickness
  • Excellent adhesion and minimal shrinkage
  • Easy to apply and finish to a smooth surface
  • Compatible with RLA coatings and render systems
  • Australian-made and formulated for local conditions

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polymer-modified cementitious mortar with lightweight fillers
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Density: 900 kg/m³ (fresh wet)
  • Compressive Strength: 20 MPa at 28 days
  • Flexural Strength: 7.1 MPa at 28 days
  • Yield: 15 litres per 10kg bag
  • Coverage Rate: 1.85 kg/m²/mm

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: High-shear spiral mixing paddle, trowel, gloves, steel float
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use RLA RENDERGRIP A to reduce premature drying in warm or windy conditions
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid adding excess water to prevent reduced strength and extended curing time

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, cool area away from direct sunlight and off cold floors
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from freezing or overheating

Certifications

  • Fire-rated to AS1530.4 (4 hours at 35mm thickness)
  • Compressive strength tested to AS1012 & AS2073
  • Flexural strength tested to ASTM C348-86
column7: AS153.4:214,QLD only,bag,cementitous,civil construction-i,concrete,concrete repair,construction,external,fire rated,grout,high strength,industrial,manufacturing,masonry,mortar,precast panels,preparation & remedial,steel,uv stable
column32: RLA Penapatch Panel LW Repair Mortar | Adheseal
column33: Discover RLA Penapatch Panel LW, a fire-rated, lightweight repair mortar ideal for concrete repairs. High adhesion, fast drying, and easy to use.
column52:
How to apply RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar:

  1. Clean surface of contaminants like oil, paint, and dust
  2. Pre-soak substrate with water (avoid pooling) or use RLA RENDERGRIP A for porous surfaces
  3. Mix 3.1–3.6L of water per 10kg bag using a high-shear spiral mixer
  4. Add powder to water while mixing to avoid lumps
  5. Apply with trowel or gloved hand, compacting thoroughly
  6. Finish with a steel trowel for smooth texture
  7. Apply RLA RENDERGRIP A over finished areas in hot or windy conditions for curing
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar

Q: How do I apply the product to vertical surfaces?

A: Use a steel trowel or gloved hand to apply Penapatch Panel LW to the substrate. Thoroughly compact the mortar and finish with a steel trowel. Ensure minimum 5mm thickness is maintained and avoid overworking the surface.

Q: How strong is the mortar once cured?

A: At 28 days, Penapatch Panel LW achieves a compressive strength of 20 MPa and a flexural strength of 7.1 MPa, making it suitable for non-structural repairs in commercial and industrial applications.

Q: Is this mortar compatible with existing coatings?

A: Yes, it's compatible with RLA protective and decorative coatings. Ensure the surface is clean and properly cured before applying coatings or renders for best adhesion.

Q: What should I do if the mortar sets too quickly?

A: In hot or windy conditions, premature drying can occur. Use chilled water for mixing and apply RLA RENDERGRIP A as a curing aid. Avoid reworking the mix once it has begun to set.

Q: Are there any special disposal or safety requirements?

A: Dispose of any uncured product according to local regulations. Always wear gloves, eye protection, and ensure proper ventilation during application. Refer to the SDS for full safety details.
column54:
RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar limitations:

  • Not suitable for load-bearing or structural repairs
  • Not designed for pedestrian or vehicle traffic surfaces
  • Must not be applied thinner than 5mm except for minor feather edges
  • Excessive water during mixing reduces strength and increases drying time
  • Reflective cracking may occur if underlying substrate cracks or moves

Safety precautions when using RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and a dust mask when mixing or sanding
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow in enclosed spaces
  • Handling: Mix only what can be applied within the working time; do not re-temper
  • Refer to the product SDS for detailed safety and first aid information
column55: Lightweight, fire-rated repair mortar for vertical and overhead concrete repairs. Ideal for precast panel patching. Made in Australia.
column56:
RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar can be used on the following substrates:

  • Steel Reinforcement – Must be cleaned and primed with RLA Zinc Primer

Why Use RLA Penapatch Panel LW – Repair Mortar:

column3:
Use Penatech GP Grout for: High-performance grouting under machine base plates, crane rails, anchor bolts, and bridge bearings.

Penatech GP Grout is a high-performance, precision Class C cementitious grout formulated for demanding structural applications. Designed with dual-phase expansion, it ensures zero shrinkage in both plastic and hardened states. This non-metallic, chloride-free grout provides superior flow and retention, making it ideal for use under base plates, crane rails, anchor bolts, and precast panels. With excellent impact and thermal resistance, Penatech GP Grout is trusted for both dry pack and flowable installations across commercial and industrial sites.

Key Features of Penatech GP Grout

  • High early and ultimate compressive strength exceeding 80 MPa
  • Exceptional flow characteristics with zero bleeding or segregation
  • Dual expansion system compensates for shrinkage in plastic and hardened states
  • Non-metallic formulation eliminates staining risks on substrates
  • Tested to ASTM C1107-91 and CRDC-621-82 specifications
  • Can be dry packed, trowelled, or poured for flexible application

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Cement-based, chloride-free, non-metallic
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C (41°F to 86°F)
  • Compressive Strength: >80 MPa at 28 days
  • Setting Time: 2–4 hours depending on consistency and temperature
  • Flow Distance: >4.0 m with 250 mm grout head at 20°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: High-shear mixer, spiral mixing paddle, header box, displacement pump (for large volume)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Maintain a consistent grout head during pour to avoid air pockets
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid adding excess water to prevent segregation and reduced strength

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Dry, low humidity environments in original sealed packaging
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months from production date
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F and 77°F)

Certifications

  • ASTM C1107-91 Compliant
  • CRDC 621-82A Compliant
  • Tested to AS 1012.18 and AS2350-11 for strength and setting
column7: ASTM C1107-91,Bridge Strengthening Supplies,CRDC 621-82A,QLD only,bag,cementitous,civil construction-i,concrete,concrete repair,construction,external,grout,high strength,industrial,manufacturing,preparation & remedial,special order
column32: Penatech GP Grout - High Strength Non-Shrink Cement Grout | Adheseal
column33: Penatech GP Grout is a high-strength, non-shrink Class C cement grout ideal for heavy-duty structural applications and dynamic loads.
column52:
How to apply Penatech GP Grout:

  1. Clean substrate of dust, oil, or contaminants. Pre-soak concrete for 4 hours, removing excess water before grouting.
  2. Set up watertight formwork with venting holes. Coat with release oil if needed.
  3. Mix Penatech GP Grout with clean water using a high-shear mixer or paddle drill. Mix for 3–5 minutes to a smooth consistency.
  4. Pour or pump from one side using a grout head or header box to avoid air entrapment.
  5. Cure the exposed grout with plastic sheeting or curing compound immediately after placement.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Penatech GP Grout

Q: How should Penatech GP Grout be applied under base plates?

A: For base plates, use a gravity-fed header box system. Ensure the formwork is watertight, maintain a consistent grout head, and pour from one side only to avoid air entrapment.

Q: How does Penatech GP Grout perform under high loads and vibration?

A: It offers high early and ultimate compressive strength with excellent durability, making it suitable for dynamic loads and vibration-prone applications like crane rails and machinery bases.

Q: Is Penatech GP Grout compatible with pre-cast concrete and steel substrates?

A: Yes, it bonds effectively with clean, saturated-surface-dry concrete and properly prepared steel. It’s commonly used in precast concrete and anchor bolt applications.

Q: What should I do if the grout begins to stiffen during application?

A: Do not add water to re-temper. Discard any grout that has stiffened. Always mix fresh batches and maintain continuous application to avoid cold joints.

Q: What safety measures are necessary during use?

A: Wear gloves, safety goggles, and protective clothing. Ensure adequate ventilation and avoid direct skin contact. Refer to the MSDS for full safety information.
column54:
Penatech GP Grout limitations:

  • Do not mix by hand—mechanical mixing is required
  • Do not add extra water beyond specified limits
  • Unrestrained areas must be minimised to avoid cracking
  • Not suitable for dry porous substrates—pre-soak thoroughly

Safety precautions when using Penatech GP Grout:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, goggles, long sleeves
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhalation
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact, wash hands after use
  • Refer to MSDS for full safety procedures and emergency advice
column55: High-strength, non-shrink cement grout with excellent flow, early strength, and dual expansion for critical structural grouting.

Penatech GP Grout can be used on the following substrates:

  • Steel – must be free of oil, rust, and contaminants

column3:
Use RLA Penaflow Panel Grout for: Precast panel grouting, anchor bolt filling, and general construction grouting in Australian projects.

RLA Penaflow Panel Grout is a high-performance, non-shrink cementitious grout designed to meet the demanding requirements of Australian trade professionals. This Class A grout is formulated with Portland cement, graded aggregates, and specialized additives to ensure shrinkage compensation and exceptional strength. It is ideal for a wide range of applications, including grouting precast panels, filling anchor bolts, and general construction grouting. Its versatility allows for dry packing, trowelling, pouring, and pumping, making it suitable for projects of any scale.

Key Features of RLA Penaflow Panel Grout

  • Shrinkage Compensated: Gaseous expansion during the plastic state eliminates shrinkage and settlement, ensuring long-term stability and structural integrity.
  • High Strength: Achieves compressive strengths exceeding 55 MPa at 28 days, providing reliable load-bearing capacity for critical applications.
  • Versatile Application: Can be dry packed, rammed, trowelled, poured, or pumped, offering flexibility for various project requirements and scales.
  • Non-Metallic Iron Content: Eliminates staining, ensuring a clean and professional finish on visible surfaces.
  • Australian-Made: Manufactured to meet the specific needs of Australian construction projects and conditions.

Technical Overview

RLA Penaflow Panel Grout is formulated to provide a consistent and reliable performance in demanding construction environments. Its controlled expansion characteristics ensure a tight fill, while its high compressive strength supports heavy loads. The grout's flow properties are designed to facilitate easy placement and minimize air entrapment, ensuring complete void filling.

Chemical Properties: A blend of Portland cement, high-quality graded aggregates, and additives that control expansion. The non-metallic composition prevents staining.

Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 30°C (50°F to 86°F). This range ensures proper setting and curing in typical Australian construction conditions.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mechanical mixer, trowel, tamping rod, pump (for large applications), formwork.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Pre-soak the substrate for 4 hours before grouting to reduce porosity and ensure optimal adhesion. Use a grout head box for continuous flow and to prevent air entrapment. Always add grout powder to pre-measured water.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the grout is too dry, it may not hydrate properly, leading to low strength gain. Ensure accurate water measurement and thorough mixing. Avoid hand mixing to ensure consistent results.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from moisture.
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months from the date of manufacture when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product quality.

Certifications

  • AS1012.9: Tests for mortars - Methods of testing mortar (compressive strength)
  • AS2073 ASC348-86: Australian Standards for grouts and related products.
  • ASTM C882-1987: Standard Test Method for Bond Strength of Epoxy-Resin Systems Used With Concrete By Slant Shear.

column32: RLA Penaflow Panel Grout | Non-Shrink Cement Grout | Adheseal
column33: RLA Penaflow Panel Grout: High-strength, non-shrink cementitious grout for precast panels, anchor bolts, and general construction.
column52:
How to apply RLA Penaflow Panel Grout:

  1. Substrate Preparation: Ensure the substrate is clean, sound, and pre-soaked for 4 hours. Remove excess water before grouting.
  2. Formwork: Construct leak-proof formwork using foam rubber strips or a suitable sealant. Apply form oil for easy removal.
  3. Mixing: Use a mechanical mixer and add grout powder to pre-measured water. Mix for 3-5 minutes until a homogeneous consistency is achieved.
  4. Placement: Choose the appropriate placement method (dry pack, gravity flow, or pumping) based on the application requirements. Ensure continuous flow and avoid air entrapment.
  5. Curing: Cure the exposed grout using plastic sheeting, wet hessian, or liquid curing compounds.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About RLA Penaflow Panel Grout

Q: What is the ideal water-to-grout ratio for a flowable consistency?

A: For a flowable consistency, mix 3.6 to 4.0 litres of water per 20kg bag of RLA Penaflow Panel Grout. Accurate measurement is crucial to achieve the desired flow and prevent segregation.

Q: How long does it take for RLA Penaflow Panel Grout to reach its final set?

A: The final set time varies depending on the consistency. For a flowable mix at 20°C, it takes approximately 6.5 hours. For dry pack, it's about 2.5 hours.

Q: Can RLA Penaflow Panel Grout be used for underwater applications?

A: While it offers excellent performance in various conditions, RLA Penaflow Panel Grout is not specifically designed for underwater applications. Consult with RLA technical support for specialized underwater grouting solutions.

Q: What is the compressive strength of this grout after 28 days?

A: RLA Penaflow Panel Grout achieves a compressive strength exceeding 55 MPa at 28 days when tested at 20°C, ensuring high load-bearing capacity.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using this grout?

A: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment, including respiratory protection, eye protection, and gloves. Avoid skin contact and inhalation of dust. Work in well-ventilated areas and follow the safety guidelines in the SDS.
column54:
RLA Penaflow Panel Grout limitations:

  • Do not add more water than specified, as this can cause segregation and bleeding.
  • Avoid applying grout to dry, porous surfaces without pre-soaking.
  • Do not use mechanical vibration to assist flow.
  • Application temperature must be between 10°C and 30°C.
  • Unrestrained areas must be kept to a minimum.

Safety precautions when using RLA Penaflow Panel Grout:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear respiratory protection, eye protection, and gloves to prevent skin and eye irritation.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhalation of dust.
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact and wash thoroughly with soap and water after use.
  • First Aid: If ingested, do not induce vomiting and seek medical attention immediately. If in eyes, rinse thoroughly with water.

  • Ease of Use: Pre-packaged and easy to mix, reducing labor and time on-site.
  • Australian-Made Quality: Manufactured to meet the specific needs of Australian construction.

column3:
Use EverKrete 102 for: Concrete repair, surface overlays, and as a primer, providing a durable, flexible, and weather-resistant finish.

EverKrete 102 is a high-performance, thermoset vinyl polymer resin designed for concrete repair and surface overlays. Its unique formulation provides a fast cure, excellent weathering ability, and compatibility with various substrates. This resin can be used as a binder for EverKrete mortar or saturated with sand to create a tough, slip-resistant surface overlay. It also functions as an effective concrete primer, especially in temperatures between -18°C and +15°C.

Key Features of EverKrete 102

  • Fast Cure: Allows for rapid return to service, minimising downtime.
  • Low Viscosity: Ensures easy mixing and application, even in cold temperatures.
  • Excellent Weathering Ability: Provides long-term durability and resistance to environmental factors.
  • Wide Temperature Application: Utilises EverKrete Accelerator for applications between -18°C and +35°C.
  • Micro Fibre Reinforced: Enhances strength and durability of the cured material.
  • Non Re-Emulsifying: Ensures long-term performance and stability once fully cured.
  • Versatile Compatibility: Adheres to concrete, masonry, brickwork, and other common building materials.

Technical Overview

EverKrete 102 is a thermoset vinyl polymer that cures through a chemical reaction initiated by the EverKrete Catalyst. This process results in a tough, durable, and flexible material suitable for various concrete repair applications. The resin's low viscosity allows for easy penetration and bonding to substrates, ensuring a strong and lasting repair.

Chemical Properties: Thermoset vinyl polymer resin, providing excellent resistance to weathering and chemical exposure.

Application Temperature Range: -18°C to +35°C (-0.4°F to 95°F) with EverKrete Accelerator, or 10°C to +35°C (50°F to 95°F) without. Ensure substrates are dry and clean for optimal adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Power mixer, measuring containers, trowels, brushes/rollers for primer, and acetone for clean-up.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always catalyse EverKrete 102 before adding dry components. Use kiln-dried sand and aggregates. For easy trowelling, use a clean, shiny stainless-steel trowel and wipe with acetone.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure accurate catalyst ratios for proper curing. Avoid application on damp or contaminated surfaces. Use EverKrete Accelerator for low-temperature applications.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between +10°C and +25°C (50°F and 77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 6 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • N/A (Refer to local building codes and standards for specific project requirements)

column32: EverKrete 102 Advanced Vinyl Polymer Resin | Adheseal
column33: EverKrete 102 is a thermoset vinyl polymer for concrete repair, overlays, and priming. Fast cure, low viscosity, excellent durability. Shop now!
column52:
How to apply EverKrete 102:

  1. Pre-mix EverKrete 102 thoroughly with a power mixer.
  2. Measure the required amount of EverKrete 102.
  3. Add the EverKrete Catalyst and mix for 30-60 seconds.
  4. Add EverKrete Accelerator if needed for low temperatures.
  5. Incorporate kiln-dried sand and aggregates for mortar or overlay applications.
  6. Apply the mixture to the prepared surface using trowels or rollers.
  7. Allow to cure for 45-90 minutes before traffic use.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About EverKrete 102

Q: How do I prepare EverKrete 102 for application?

A: Pre-mix EverKrete 102 with a power mixer to disperse any settled material. Measure the required amount, add the catalyst, and mix thoroughly for 30-60 seconds before adding aggregates or sand.

Q: What is the curing time for EverKrete 102?

A: Full traffic use is achieved in 45-90 minutes. Pot life varies with temperature; approximately 20 minutes at 25°C (77°F) with 80% aggregate and 13 minutes without aggregate.

Q: Can EverKrete 102 be used in cold weather?

A: Yes, with the addition of EverKrete Accelerator, it can be used in temperatures as low as -18°C (-0.4°F). Refer to the EverKrete Accelerator TDS for detailed instructions.

Q: What substrates are compatible with EverKrete 102?

A: EverKrete 102 is compatible with cured concrete, 3:1 sand cement screed, masonry, pre-cast concrete, brickwork, and Hebel blocks. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry.

Q: How do I clean up after using EverKrete 102?

A: Clean tools immediately with acetone. Cured material can only be removed by mechanical means.
column54:
EverKrete 102 limitations:

  • Do not use below -18°C or above +35°C.
  • Avoid application on damp, wet, or contaminated surfaces.
  • Do not apply during rain or if rain is imminent.
  • Ensure proper catalyst ratios for curing.

Safety precautions when using EverKrete 102:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and suitable clothing.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Do not inhale fumes. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.
column55: EverKrete 102 is an advanced, thermoset vinyl polymer resin designed for concrete repair and surface overlays. It offers fast curing, excellent weathering ability, and compatibility with various substrates, making it ideal for both internal and external applications.

column3:
Use Bostik Fireban® One for: Sealing fire rated joints in concrete, masonry, and wall systems where durable, flexible sealing is essential

Bostik Fireban® One is a premium, one-part, fire rated intumescent polyurethane sealant designed for sealing joints in a variety of construction substrates. Engineered for Australian conditions, it withstands up to 4 hours of fire exposure, resists weathering, and supports joint movement of ±25%. Ideal for use on concrete, brickwork, plasterboard, and fibre cement, it cures to form a durable, flexible seal. With easy application and excellent adhesion, Fireban® One is perfect for both fire and acoustic-rated joints in commercial, industrial, and residential projects.

Key Features of Bostik Fireban® One

  • Fire rated up to 4 hours for critical safety compliance
  • Acoustic rated for sound insulation in wall and floor systems
  • One component formula – no mixing, easy application
  • Excellent durability and UV/weather resistance for outdoor use
  • Paintable and non-staining for seamless finishes
  • Low modulus and supports joint movement of ±25%

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Intumescent Polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 70°C (-40°F to 158°F)
  • Cure Rate: 2mm per 24 hours on porous substrates
  • Tensile Strength: >1.3 N/mm²
  • Elongation at Break: >900%

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sausage barrel gun, spatula or trowel, Bostik primers (N49, N40)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use backing rods for correct sealant geometry; tool sealant to achieve concave profile
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid premature water exposure during curing to prevent failure; always prime for maximum performance

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store between 5°C to 30°C in a cool, dry, ventilated space
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from date of manufacture in original unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from direct sunlight and extremes of temperature

Certifications

  • AS 1530.4-2014 – Fire resistance certification
  • ASTM C920 – International standard for sealant performance
  • AS1157-1972 – Resistance to fungal growth

column33: Bostik Fireban® One is a fire rated, intumescent polyurethane sealant for durable joint sealing in Australian construction.
column52:
How to apply Bostik Fireban® One:

  1. Clean and dry all surfaces thoroughly
  2. Apply primer (N49 for porous, N40 for non-porous) as needed
  3. Insert backing rod to correct joint depth
  4. Dispense sealant with a sausage gun and tool off for smooth finish
  5. Allow to cure for 7 days before painting or exposure to moisture
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Bostik Fireban® One

Q: How should Bostik Fireban® One be applied for best results?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry, apply recommended primer, then dispense using a sausage barrel gun. Tool off to a concave finish for optimal sealing.

Q: How does it perform under extreme conditions?

A: Fireban® One remains durable under UV exposure, weathering, and supports joint movement of ±25%, making it suitable for Australian outdoor environments.

Q: Is it compatible with painted surfaces and coatings?

A: It can be painted after 7 days; however, solvent-based coatings may react. Conduct a field test for coating compatibility before full application.

Q: What if the sealant is exposed to water before curing?

A: Exposure to water or alcohol during curing can compromise performance. Always allow full cure—7 days—for optimal sealing strength and durability.

Q: What safety precautions should I follow?

A: Wear gloves, eye protection, and ensure good ventilation. Avoid skin contact and inhalation. Refer to SDS for full safety guidelines and emergency actions.
column54:
Bostik Fireban® One limitations:

  • Not suitable for swimming pools or constant saltwater immersion
  • Do not apply to bitumen-based substrates
  • Not for glazing applications or joints under 6mm width/depth
  • Avoid use in trafficable joints over 10mm width

Safety precautions when using Bostik Fireban® One:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, eye protection, and respirator if ventilation is inadequate
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhalation
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact and inhalation; clean up uncured material immediately
  • Keep out of reach of children; refer to SDS for full safety info

column2: BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt
column3:
Use BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt for: Efficiently mixing adhesives, mortars, screeds, and levelling compounds to save time and ensure consistent results on-site

The BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt is built for serious trades requiring exceptional power and precision. Designed for mixing heavy adhesives, mortars, and compounds, this mixer features a high-performance 1600W motor and dual-speed control (0-380 rpm, 0-660 rpm). Its triple reduction gearbox delivers superior torque, while the M14 thread secures paddles firmly. This Professional Series tool includes two mixing paddles (140 x 600mm & 100 x 600mm) and a 1-year warranty, offering reliable and efficient performance for professional tilers and builders.

Key Features of BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt

  • 1600W motor for mixing dense materials like adhesives and screeds
  • Two-speed settings (0-380 rpm, 0-660 rpm) for flexible control
  • Triple reduction gearbox ensures high torque for tough mixes
  • Includes two mixing paddles: 140 x 600mm and 100 x 600mm
  • Secure M14 thread connection for compatibility with standard paddles
  • 1-year warranty for professional reliability and peace of mind

Technical Overview

  • Motor Power: 1600 Watts
  • Speed Range: 0-380 rpm (low), 0-660 rpm (high)
  • Gearbox: Triple reduction for optimal torque
  • Thread Type: M14
  • Paddles Included: 140 x 600mm and 100 x 600mm

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Standard M14-compatible mixing paddles, PPE gear
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Begin mixing at low speed to reduce splash and dust; increase speed for smoother blends
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If motor overheats, rest the unit and mix in shorter bursts to maintain performance

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store dry, clean, and protected from impact
  • Shelf Life Information: Mechanical tool – long-lasting with proper care
  • Temperature Considerations: Operate safely between 5°C and 40°C (41°F - 104°F)

Certifications

  • Complies with Australian Electrical Safety Standards
  • CE Certified for international compliance
  • IP Rating: IPX4 splash resistance

column52:
How to apply BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt:

  1. Attach the appropriate paddle to the mixer using the M14 thread
  2. Place the paddle into a clean mixing container with required materials
  3. Set to low speed to start blending, avoiding splashing and dust
  4. Gradually increase to high speed for a smooth, uniform mix
  5. After use, turn off and unplug; clean paddles thoroughly
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt

Q: How should I operate the mixer for best results?

A: Start mixing on the lowest speed to blend dry materials without splashing. Once combined, increase to high speed for a smooth, lump-free mix. Avoid overloading to maintain motor efficiency.

Q: How does the mixer perform with thick compounds?

A: The 1600W motor and triple reduction gearbox offer exceptional torque, allowing it to mix thick adhesives, screeds, and mortars with ease, ensuring a uniform and smooth result.

Q: Is this mixer compatible with other paddles?

A: Yes, the mixer features a standard M14 thread, making it compatible with most commercial-grade paddles used across the tiling and building trades.

Q: What should I do if the motor overheats?

A: Allow the unit to cool down before restarting. Use in cycles and avoid running at maximum speed continuously for extended periods, especially with heavy mixes.

Q: How do I safely clean and store the mixer?

A: Always unplug before cleaning. Use a damp cloth to wipe down, ensuring no residue remains on paddles. Store in a dry area, away from dust and moisture for longevity.
column54:
BAT Pro Tiling Professional Series Electric Mixer - 1600Watt limitations:

  • Requires electrical outlet – unsuitable for remote areas without power

  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated environments to avoid dust inhalation
  • Handling: Use both hands to operate; keep clear of moving paddles
  • Always unplug before maintenance or cleaning to prevent accidental start

column3:
Use X'traseal MS-608 for: Securely bonding parquet flooring to various subfloors with a durable, moisture-resistant, and flexible adhesive.

X'traseal MS-608 is a professional-grade, one-component MS polymer flooring adhesive designed for high-strength bonding of various types of parquet flooring. Its advanced formula ensures excellent adhesion to different subfloors, including concrete and plywood, while maintaining permanent flexibility. This product is solvent-free, odorless, and environmentally friendly, making it ideal for both indoor and outdoor use. With exceptional moisture resistance and superior mechanical bonding strength, MS-608 guarantees a long-lasting flooring solution.

Key Features of X'traseal MS-608

  • High mechanical bonding strength for secure flooring installation
  • Excellent sound dampening properties for quieter environments
  • Long open time, allowing easy adjustments during installation
  • Waterproof and moisture-resistant for superior durability
  • Odorless, solvent-free, and eco-friendly formulation
  • Can be applied to damp surfaces, ensuring convenience
  • UV and weather-resistant for both indoor and outdoor applications

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Silyl-modified polyether (MS Polymer)
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 100°C (-40°F to 212°F)
  • Specific Gravity: 1.70 ± 0.02
  • Shore A Hardness: 40
  • Tensile Strength: 0.75 MPa
  • Elongation at Break: Approx. 800%
  • Curing Time: 10mm depth in 7 days

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Trowel, caulking gun
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a coarse trowel for large wood sizes and rough substrates, and a fine trowel for smaller wood sizes and smooth surfaces.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If flooring adhesion is weak, ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from dust or grease.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 30°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in unopened packaging.

Certifications

  • ISO 9001 Certified
  • ISO 14001 Certified

column2: Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer
column3:
Use Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer for: Flexible sealing of joints in construction, windows, doors, panels, and blockwork exposed to movement and weather.

Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer is a hybrid acrylic elastomeric sealant designed for both interior and exterior applications in Australian construction. Its low modulus and high elasticity allow it to withstand ±50% joint movement, making it ideal for sealing in dynamic environments. Everflex JS adheres exceptionally to a wide range of materials including concrete, timber, metals, and plastics, without the need for priming. Its smooth tooling, superior slump resistance, and excellent weatherability make it a top choice for trade professionals seeking reliable performance across diverse projects.

Key Features of Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer

  • Exceptional elasticity with ±50% movement capability for dynamic joints
  • Superior adhesion without primer on most substrates for efficient application
  • Excellent slump resistance ensures clean, smooth finishes even on vertical surfaces
  • Weather-resistant and UV stable, ideal for Australian climate extremes
  • Paintable, non-toxic, and non-hazardous for safe indoor and outdoor use

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Hybrid Acrylic
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Service Temperature: -18°C to 80°C (0°F to 176°F)
  • Specific Gravity: 1.06
  • Elongation at Break: 1000%
  • Movement Capability: ±50%
  • VOC Content: 32 g/L
  • Colours: Grey

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, Adhefoam backer rod or bond breaker tape
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Tool immediately after application for a smooth, non-concave finish; avoid rain within 90 minutes of application
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Use Fire-Foam backer rod for fire-rated joints; ensure joints are capped to prevent water infiltration before curing

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in unopened containers between 5°C and 32°C
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months from date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from freezing; avoid high heat exposure

Certifications

  • Meets TT-S-00230C, Class A
  • Complies with ASTM 834
  • VOC compliant to Californian SCAQMD Rule 1168

column32: Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer for Interior/Exterior | Adheseal
column33: Everflex JS is a low modulus, elastomeric joint sealer ideal for flexible sealing on most substrates. Paintable and non-toxic.
column52:
How to apply Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer:

  1. Clean the joint thoroughly, removing all dirt, grease, and loose particles.
  2. Insert Adhefoam backer rod or bond breaker tape to set desired joint depth.
  3. Apply Everflex JS evenly using a quality caulking gun for a consistent bead.
  4. Tool off immediately using a spatula, achieving a flat finish. Do not allow a concave surface.
  5. Protect the joint from rain for at least 90 minutes post-application to ensure proper curing.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer

Q: How should Everflex JS be applied for best results?

A: Apply Everflex JS to clean, dry surfaces using a caulking gun. Fill joints with Adhefoam backer rod or bond breaker tape before sealing. Tool off immediately with a spatula for a flat finish.

Q: How does Everflex JS perform under Australian weather conditions?

A: Everflex JS excels in Australian climates, offering excellent UV stability, water resistance, and flexibility in both hot and cold conditions with no cracking or adhesion loss.

Q: What materials is Everflex JS compatible with?

A: Compatible with concrete, brickwork, timber, metals, and many plastics including acrylic and polycarbonate. Always test on suspect surfaces to confirm adhesion.

Q: What should I do if Everflex JS begins to sag on wide joints?

A: For wide joints, conduct pre-application testing to ensure stability. Maintain a maximum depth of 10mm and use backer rods to support the sealant and prevent sagging.

Q: Is Everflex JS safe to use indoors and how should I dispose of it?

A: Yes, it’s non-toxic and non-hazardous, making it suitable for indoor use. Dispose of cured sealant as general waste; refer to local guidelines for disposal of uncured material.
column54:
Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer limitations:

  • Do not use if rain is likely within 90 minutes, as premature exposure may cause washouts.
  • Not recommended for joints deeper than 10mm or with a depth-to-width ratio exceeding 2:1.
  • Backer rod must not absorb water before sealant cures to prevent gassing issues.

Safety precautions when using Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses during application.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation in enclosed spaces.
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact. Wash hands after use.
  • Non-toxic and non-hazardous; consult MSDS for sensitive individuals.

column2: Everflex Fire-fill AC Fire Rated & Acoustic Sealant
column3:
Use Everflex Fire-fill for: Sealing joints and penetrations in walls, floors, and ceilings to prevent fire transmission, while also providing weather and UV resistance.

Everflex Fire-fill is a high-quality, fire-rated acrylic sealant that provides up to 4 hours of fire protection for various construction applications. This intumescent sealant expands when exposed to fire, forming a plug that prevents fire transmission through joints and penetrations. It is suitable for both internal and external use, offering excellent UV and water resistance, flexibility, and adhesion to common building materials.

Key Features

  • Up to 4-hour fire rating
  • Waterborne co-polymer-based intumescent acrylic sealant
  • Suitable for internal and external use
  • Excellent UV and water resistance
  • High flexibility
  • Non-slump properties
  • Paintable
  • Easy to apply
  • Non-toxic, low VOC

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Waterborne co-polymer-based intumescent acrylic
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C
  • Service Temperature: -10°C to +80°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sealant gun, masking tape, utility knife, cleaning supplies (water), Everflex Supaprime primer (optional)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Priming is not typically required, but for optimal adhesion on certain substrates, use Everflex Supaprime primer. Mask joint edges for a neater finish. Avoid overfilling the joint and tool the sealant before it skins. Clean up with water while the sealant is still wet.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying to wet surfaces or when rain exposure is likely within 24 hours. Not suitable for long-term water immersion or internal swimming pool applications. Avoid exposure to high levels of chlorine. Incompatibility with some substrates may cause discoloration or poor adhesion, so preliminary tests are recommended.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between +5°C and +25°C.

Certifications

  • Tested in accordance with AS1530.4 and assessed to AS4072.1

Use Autoshield Activator AP1001 for: Enhancing the adhesion of polyurethane adhesives to glass and lacquer surfaces in automotive and industrial applications.

Autoshield Activator AP1001 is a high-performance adhesion promoter designed to significantly improve the bonding strength of polyurethane adhesives on glass and lacquer substrates. This specialized formula ensures a secure and durable bond, crucial for demanding applications in the automotive and industrial sectors. Its easy-to-use wipe format allows for quick and efficient application, making it an essential tool for professionals seeking optimal adhesion performance.

Key Features

  • Enhances adhesion of polyurethane adhesives to glass and lacquer.
  • Easy-to-use wipe format.
  • Improves bond strength and durability.
  • Suitable for automotive and industrial applications.
  • Clear and non-staining.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Proprietary blend (Consult SDS)
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +40°C (41°F to 104°F)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Clean cloth or tissue
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Use sparingly and allow to dry completely before applying adhesive. Always perform adhesion tests before full application, especially on new or unknown substrates.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid using on porous surfaces as it may not be effective. If the activator becomes milky, it has absorbed moisture and should be discarded.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original packaging in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: 18 months unopened. While clear, it is fit for purpose.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures.

column52:
h3>How to apply Gripset BRW HD:
  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. For porous surfaces, apply an appropriate primer.
  3. Unroll the sheet and cut to required lengths.
  4. Remove a section of the release liner and position the membrane.
  5. Gradually remove the liner while pressing the membrane firmly onto the substrate.
  6. Use a hand roller to ensure full adhesion and remove air bubbles.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset BRW HD

Q: What is Gripset BRW HD used for?

A: Gripset BRW HD is a self-adhesive butyl rubber sheet membrane designed for subterranean waterproofing and multi-layered sheet membrane applications.

Q: Can Gripset BRW HD be used in underground applications?

A: Yes, it is ideal for underground retaining walls, basement walls, lift pits, tunnels, and planter boxes.

Q: Does Gripset BRW HD require a primer before application?

A: Yes, porous surfaces require Gripset GP Primer, non-porous surfaces require Gripset OP Primer, and damp surfaces require Gripset E60.

Q: How does Gripset BRW HD handle temperature variations?

A: It performs well in temperatures ranging from -30°C to 80°C, maintaining flexibility and adhesion in extreme conditions.

Q: Can Gripset BRW HD be exposed to UV light?

A: No, it must be covered or protected from UV exposure to maintain its integrity.
column54:
Gripset BRW HD limitations:

  • Not designed for UV exposure
  • Not suitable for trafficable surfaces
  • Not intended for use over expansion joints

Safety precautions when using Gripset BRW HD:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses when handling the membrane.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid fume build-up when applying primers.
  • Handling: Ensure hands are clean and dry before working with the membrane for proper adhesion.
  • Clean-up: Use appropriate cleaning methods to remove adhesives or primers from tools and surfaces.
  • Storage: Store in a dry, temperature-controlled environment and keep rolls upright.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste material according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset BRW HD is a self-adhesive butyl rubber sheet membrane with a high-strength HDPE film, designed for subterranean waterproofing and multi-layer applications. Featuring instant sealing, excellent adhesion, and superior flexibility, it withstands vibration, movement, and extreme temperatures (-30ºC to 80ºC). The membrane is solvent-free, non-toxic, and offers outstanding chemical resistance. It requires no heat welding or primers on metallic, plastic, or glazed surfaces. Ideal for underground retaining walls, planters, roof gardens, basements, podiums, and more, Gripset BRW HD ensures rapid application with no drying time.
