column2: Gripset C-1P 1 Part Flexible Cementitious Membrane
column3:
Use Gripset C-1P for: Waterproofing basements, retaining walls, lift pits, water tanks, pools, and under-tile areas.

Gripset C-1P is a one-component, fibre-reinforced flexible cementitious waterproof membrane designed for durability and versatility. Suitable for both positive and negative waterproofing applications, it provides excellent adhesion, high crack-bridging capabilities, and resistance to hydrostatic pressure. This non-toxic, solvent-free membrane is ideal for underground structures, immersed environments, and wet areas such as bathrooms and tiled surfaces.

Key Features of Gripset C-1P

  • Withstands 5 bar positive and 1.5 bar negative hydrostatic pressure
  • Flexible and crack-bridging capabilities
  • Waterproof and suitable for continuously wet environments
  • UV-resistant for exposed applications
  • Easy application by brush, roller, trowel, or spray
  • Compatible with concrete, masonry, and tile finishes
  • Potable water approved (AS 4020)
  • Non-toxic, water-based, and solvent-free
  • Compliant with AS 4858 for internal wet areas

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Fibre-reinforced cementitious waterproof membrane
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, trowel, or spray equipment
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Pre-dampen porous surfaces before application for optimal adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure even coverage to achieve the required film thickness for waterproofing effectiveness

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a cool, dry place
  • 12-month shelf life in unopened packaging
  • Avoid freezing and direct sunlight

Certifications

  • AS 4020: Potable water approved
  • AS 4858: Compliant for internal wet areas

column33: Gripset C-1P is a one-component, flexible cementitious waterproofing membrane with high crack-bridging capabilities. Ideal for underground, immersed, and under-tile applications.
column52:
How to Apply Gripset C-1P:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Pre-dampen porous surfaces or prime as required.
  3. Mix Gripset C-1P with clean water according to application method.
  4. Apply using a brush, roller, trowel, or spray.
  5. Ensure a minimum of 2 coats are applied for effective waterproofing.
  6. Allow each coat to dry before applying the next.
  7. For tiling, use a polymer-modified cement-based adhesive.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset C-1P

Q: What is Gripset C-1P used for?

A: Gripset C-1P is a one-component, fibre-reinforced flexible cementitious waterproof membrane designed for both positive and negative waterproofing applications, including basements, retaining walls, water tanks, and wet areas.

Q: Can Gripset C-1P be used for submerged applications?

A: Yes, it is waterproof and suitable for continuously wet and immersed environments such as swimming pools and water features.

Q: What surfaces can Gripset C-1P be applied to?

A: It can be applied to concrete, masonry, compressed fibre cement sheeting, aerated concrete panels, and plasterboard.

Q: How is Gripset C-1P applied?

A: It can be applied using a trowel, roller, brush, or spray unit. A minimum of two coats is required for optimal performance.

Q: Does Gripset C-1P require a primer?

A: Yes, for porous surfaces, pre-dampening with water is required. Non-porous surfaces should be primed with Gripset OP Primer.
column54:
Gripset C-1P Limitations:

  • Not suitable for exposed swimming pool surfaces (must be tiled over)
  • Do not apply in temperatures below 5°C or above 35°C
  • Must not be applied over standing water
  • Ensure adequate drying time before immersion or exposure to water

Safety precautions when using Gripset C-1P:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing when handling.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow in enclosed spaces to prevent dust inhalation.
  • Handling: Avoid direct contact with skin and eyes. If contact occurs, rinse thoroughly with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Wash tools with water before the product dries. Once dried, removal must be done mechanically.
  • Storage: Store in a dry, cool place at room temperature, away from direct sunlight and moisture.
  • Disposal: Dispose of unused material and packaging according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset C-1P is a high-performance, fibre-reinforced cementitious waterproof membrane. column3:
Use Gripset P39 for: Waterproofing wet areas, balconies, roofs, and exposed surfaces with excellent durability.

Gripset P39 is a premium fibre-reinforced waterproofing membrane developed with advanced hybrid polyurethane technology. Engineered for superior durability, flexibility, and water resistance, it is suitable for both under-tile and exposed membrane applications. With outstanding UV resistance and the ability to handle early water ponding, Gripset P39 is an ideal solution for commercial and residential waterproofing projects.

Key Features of Gripset P39

  • Solvent-free and environmentally friendly
  • Highly flexible and elastomeric
  • Low vapour transmission and water absorption
  • Superior adhesion to multiple substrates
  • Excellent resistance to weather, UV exposure, and fungi
  • Light foot-trafficable when cured
  • Handles permanently wet conditions without re-emulsifying
  • Compliant with AS 4858 and AS 4654.1 waterproofing standards

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Hybrid Polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, or spray unit
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a wet film gauge to ensure correct coverage
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure substrate is clean and primed for best adhesion

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in original, unopened packaging
  • 12-month shelf life
  • Protect from freezing and direct sunlight

Certifications

  • Compliant with AS 4858 waterproofing standards
  • Compliant with AS 4654.1 for external wet areas

column32: Gripset P39 Waterproofing Membrane | Adheseal
column33: Gripset P39 is a high-performance waterproofing membrane with UV resistance, early ponding protection, and strong adhesion. Perfect for wet areas and external surfaces.
column52:
How to apply Gripset P39:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and primed with the appropriate primer.
  2. Apply the first coat using a brush, roller, or spray unit.
  3. Wait 2-4 hours before applying the second coat in a perpendicular direction.
  4. For exposed applications, apply a third coat to achieve a durable finish.
  5. Allow 24-48 hours of curing time before tiling or exposing to water.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset P39

Q: What is Gripset P39 used for?

A: Gripset P39 is a fibre-enhanced, hybrid polyurethane waterproofing membrane designed for internal and external wet areas, balconies, decks, and roofing applications.

Q: Can Gripset P39 be used in permanently wet conditions?

A: Yes, once cured, Gripset P39 does not re-emulsify and can handle permanently wet conditions, making it ideal for waterproofing exposed areas.

Q: Does Gripset P39 require a primer before application?

A: Yes, porous surfaces require Gripset GP Primer, non-porous surfaces require Gripset OP Primer, and damp surfaces require Xpress Primer H2O Plus or Gripset E60.

Q: How many coats of Gripset P39 are required?

A: For under-tile applications, a minimum of 2 coats is required, while exposed trafficable membranes require 3 coats for optimal performance.

Q: Can Gripset P39 be used as an exposed membrane?

A: Yes, Gripset P39 is UV-resistant and can be used as an exposed waterproofing membrane on rooftops, terraces, and other outdoor areas.
column54:
Gripset P39 Limitations:

  • Not suitable for areas with negative hydrostatic pressure
  • Do not apply in temperatures below 5°C or above 30°C
  • Not designed for heavy-traffic surfaces without additional protection

Safety precautions when using Gripset P39:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing during application.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow in enclosed areas to prevent inhalation of vapours.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Clean tools with water before the product dries. Once cured, mechanical removal is required.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste material according to local environmental regulations.

column3:
Use Gripset LS for: Enhancing durability and slip resistance on rooftops, balconies, podiums, and walkways.

Gripset LS is a premium non-slip topcoat designed for exposed external surfaces such as rooftops, balconies, and podiums. Formulated for use over compatible Gripset base membranes, it offers superior UV resistance, excellent adhesion, and long-lasting durability. This solvent-free, non-hazardous coating enhances system performance, preventing algae growth and maintaining slip resistance without additional aggregate.

Key Features of Gripset LS

  • Non-slip, hard-wearing surface – no aggregate or sand casting needed
  • Solvent-free, environmentally friendly, and non-hazardous
  • Flexible yet durable – withstands light foot traffic
  • Excellent weather and ponding water resistance
  • Resists fungi and algae growth
  • High adhesion to concrete, screeds, plywood, tiles, and fibre cement sheeting

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Advanced water-based acrylic
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush or medium nap roller
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply a minimum of two coats in alternating directions for best results
  • Common Issues & Solutions: Ensure substrates are clean, dry, and sound for optimal adhesion

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Store in a cool, dry area away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf life: 12 months in unopened packaging
  • Do not store in freezing conditions

Certifications

  • Complies with Australian building standards
  • Tested for UV and weather resistance

column32: Gripset LS - Durable Non-Slip Roof & Balcony Coating | Adheseal
column33: Gripset LS is a hard-wearing, non-slip topcoat for roofs, balconies, and podiums. UV-resistant, flexible, and foot-trafficable. Buy now at Adheseal!
column52:
How to apply Gripset LS:

  1. Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and sound.
  2. Apply a compatible Gripset base membrane if required.
  3. Apply the first coat of Gripset LS with a brush or roller at 750 microns wet film thickness.
  4. Allow to dry for at least 4 hours before applying the second coat.
  5. Apply a second coat in an alternate direction to achieve full coverage.
  6. Allow 24 hours before exposing to foot traffic and 10 days for full cure.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset LS

Q: What is Gripset LS used for?

A: Gripset LS is a non-slip, hard-wearing topcoat designed for external floor surfaces, including roofs, balconies, podiums, and walkways.

Q: Can Gripset LS be used as a standalone waterproofing membrane?

A: No, Gripset LS must be applied over a compatible Gripset waterproofing membrane such as Gripset 38FC, P39, or Xpress Multi Pro.

Q: Is Gripset LS resistant to UV exposure?

A: Yes, it is designed to withstand permanent UV exposure and harsh weather conditions.

Q: How many coats of Gripset LS should be applied?

A: A minimum of 2 coats is required for a total dried film thickness of 1mm. A third coat may be applied for enhanced durability.

Q: How long does Gripset LS take to dry?

A: Recoating can be done after 4 hours. Light foot traffic is possible after 24 hours, and full curing takes 10 days.
column54:
Gripset LS Limitations:

  • Not suitable for vehicular traffic areas
  • Must be used with a Gripset base membrane for suspended applications
  • Not for areas subject to rising damp or negative hydrostatic pressure

Safety precautions when using Gripset LS:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing during application.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow when applying in enclosed areas.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Clean tools with water while the product is still wet. Once dried, removal must be done mechanically.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Disposal: Dispose of waste material according to local environmental regulations.

Use Maxisafe Vented Hardhat with Ratchet Harness for: Reliable head protection in construction, mining, and industrial settings requiring airflow and comfort

The Maxisafe Vented Hardhat with Ratchet Harness (HVR580) offers superior head protection with a focus on comfort and usability for Australian trades. Certified to AS/NZS 1801:1997, it features a lightweight, UV and impact resistant ABS shell, complemented by a 6-point webbed harness for optimal fit. The single-hand ratchet adjustment ensures quick, secure fitting, while 10 strategically placed ventilation points provide excellent airflow. Designed with practicality in mind, it accommodates most earmuff attachments and includes a replaceable sweatband for ongoing comfort on site.

Key Features of Maxisafe Vented Hardhat with Ratchet Harness

  • Single-hand lockable ratchet harness for easy, secure adjustment

  • Attachment slot fits most earmuff brands for versatility
  • Replaceable sweatband enhances long-term wearability

  • Harness System: 6-point webbed harness and cradle

  • Ventilation: 10 ventilation points
  • Standards Compliance: AS/NZS 1801:1997

Trade Professional Information

Storage and Shelf Life

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Maxisafe Vented Hardhat with Ratchet Harness

Q: How do I adjust the fit of the Maxisafe Hardhat?

A: Use the lockable ratchet adjustment at the back for single-hand tightening or loosening. Ensure the harness sits snugly without pressure points.

Q: Is this hardhat compatible with earmuffs?

A: Yes, it includes an attachment slot that fits most brands of earmuffs, allowing seamless integration for hearing protection on-site.

Q: How long does the hardhat last?

A: It is recommended to replace hardhats every 5 years or immediately after any significant impact, even if no visible damage is present.

Q: Can I replace the sweatband?

A: Yes, the sweatband is replaceable for hygiene and comfort. Maxisafe provides compatible sweatbands (HRS557) for easy replacement.

Q: Can I print my company logo on the hardhat?

A: Yes, Maxisafe offers logo printing services on helmets, ideal for branding and easy team identification on site.

Use MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645 for: Protecting hearing in high-noise environments across various industries, ensuring comfort and safety

MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645 provide top-tier hearing protection with an SLC80 rating of 26dB, making them ideal for extreme noise environments such as construction, manufacturing, and mining. These ergonomically shaped, disposable earplugs are crafted from soft polyurethane foam with a sealed surface to prevent contamination. Their tapered design ensures easy insertion and a snug, comfortable fit even during long shifts. Supplied in a convenient dispenser of 200 individually bagged pairs, MaxiPlug earplugs meet Australian safety standards AS/NZS 1270:2002, offering trades reliable and comfortable protection.

Key Features of MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645

  • Class 5 hearing protection with 26dB SLC80 rating for loud environments
  • Ergonomic, tapered design for a secure and comfortable fit
  • Sealed surface prevents contamination and enhances hygiene
  • Soft polyurethane foam ensures extended wear comfort
  • Individually bagged pairs for convenient use and storage
  • Complies with AS/NZS 1270:2002 Australian standards

Technical Overview

  • Material: Soft Polyurethane Foam
  • Noise Reduction: SLC80 rating of 26dB (Class 5)
  • Design: Tapered ergonomic shape
  • Compliance: AS/NZS 1270:2002
  • Packaging: 200 pairs per dispenser, individually bagged

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: No tools required; manual insertion only
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Roll foam tightly before insertion and allow expansion for full seal
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Improper insertion can reduce effectiveness; ensure foam fully expands in ear canal

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 5 years from date of manufacture if unopened
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 30°C (41°F and 86°F)

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 1270:2002 compliant

column32: MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645 | Adheseal
column33: MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs provide Class 5 hearing protection with 26dB SLC80 rating. Comfortable, durable, and ideal for noisy work environments.
column52:
How to apply MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645:

  1. Ensure hands are clean before handling earplugs
  2. Roll earplug between fingers to compress foam
  3. Pull ear up and out to straighten ear canal, insert earplug
  4. Hold in place for 60 seconds to allow expansion and sealing
  5. Test fit by cupping hands over ears and checking for noise reduction
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645

Q: How do I properly insert MaxiPlug earplugs?

A: Roll the earplug between clean fingers to compress the foam. Gently pull the top of your ear upwards and insert the plug. Hold it in place for 60 seconds to allow full expansion and sealing.

Q: How effective are these earplugs in noisy environments?

A: With a Class 5 SLC80 rating of 26dB, MaxiPlug earplugs provide excellent noise reduction in extremely loud environments such as mining, construction, and manufacturing.

Q: Are these earplugs compatible with all ear sizes?

A: Yes, the tapered ergonomic design fits most ear canal sizes, offering a secure and comfortable seal for effective hearing protection.

Q: What if the earplugs don't stay in properly?

A: Ensure you roll the foam tightly before insertion and hold the plug in place until it fully expands. Reinsert if necessary for proper fit and seal.

Q: Are these earplugs safe to dispose of in general waste?

A: Yes, as non-hazardous waste, MaxiPlug earplugs can be safely disposed of in general waste. Always follow workplace disposal protocols.
column54:
MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645 limitations:

  • Not reusable; designed for single use only
  • Ineffective if not properly inserted or if foam is damaged

Safety precautions when using MaxiPlug Uncorded Earplugs Class 5 HEU645:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Clean hands required; no additional PPE needed
  • Ventilation: Not applicable
  • Handling: Avoid contamination by keeping earplugs in original packaging until use

Use 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle for: Consistent and precise application of sealants and adhesives. Ideal for: Professional Builders, Tilers, Waterproofers, General Contractors. Key benefit: Consistent bead size for professional finishes.

The 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle is designed for professionals who demand precision and reliability in sealant application. This nozzle ensures a uniform 19mm bead, crucial for achieving consistent and aesthetically pleasing results. Its robust construction withstands the rigors of daily use on construction sites, and its smooth interior surface minimizes sealant buildup, facilitating easy cleaning. This nozzle is essential for applications requiring precise extrusion rates, viscosity control, and consistent contact pressure, ensuring a high-quality seal every time.

Key Features of 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle

  • Consistent Bead Size: Ensures a uniform 19mm bead for professional finishes.
  • Durable Material: Constructed from high-quality materials for long-lasting performance.
  • Easy to Clean: Smooth interior surface minimizes sealant buildup and simplifies cleaning.
  • Secure Fit: Designed for a tight, leak-free connection to sausage guns.

How 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle Compares

Feature 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle Standard Alternatives
Bead Consistency Uniform 19mm bead Variable, inconsistent bead
Durability High-grade material Lower-grade, prone to wear
Cleaning Smooth interior, easy clean Rough interior, difficult to clean

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sausage gun, sealant or adhesive cartridges, cleaning solvents.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the nozzle is securely attached to prevent leaks. Clean the nozzle immediately after use to prevent sealant hardening.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inconsistent bead size can be caused by blocked nozzles; clean thoroughly.
  • Australian Standards Compliance: While specific standards may vary by sealant, this nozzle is designed for use with sealants meeting relevant AS standards.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a clean, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Indefinite if properly cleaned and stored. Inspect for damage before each use.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to prevent material degradation.
  • Transport Requirements: No special requirements, but protect from physical damage.

column52:
How to apply 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle:

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from debris.
  2. Load the sausage gun: Insert the sealant cartridge and attach the 19mm nozzle securely.
  3. Apply the sealant: Hold the sausage gun at a consistent angle and apply even pressure to extrude a uniform bead.
  4. Smooth the sealant: Use a suitable tool to smooth and shape the sealant bead for a professional finish.

Pro Tip: Cut the nozzle tip at a 45-degree angle for precise application and a clean bead.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle

Q: How do I clean the 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle?

A: Remove the nozzle from the sausage gun and wipe away excess sealant with a clean cloth. Use a suitable solvent to remove any remaining residue. Ensure the nozzle is completely dry before reuse.

Q: Is the 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle compatible with all sausage guns?

A: It is designed to be compatible with most standard sausage guns. However, always check the compatibility of the nozzle with your specific sausage gun model to ensure a secure fit.

Q: What type of sealants can I use with this nozzle?

A: This nozzle is compatible with a wide range of sealants and adhesives dispensed from sausage cartridges, including silicone, polyurethane, and acrylic-based products.

Q: How do I prevent sealant from hardening inside the nozzle?

A: Clean the nozzle immediately after use. If you must stop for a short period of time while using the product, extrude a small amount of sealant past the tip of the nozzle, and allow to harden. Then before restarting, pull the hardened plug of sealant from the tip. For long term storage, cleaning is the best method.
column54:
19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle limitations:

  • Not suitable for highly viscous materials that require a larger nozzle opening.
  • May require more frequent cleaning when used with fast-curing sealants.
  • Can be damaged by excessive force during cleaning.

Safety precautions when using 19mm Sausage Gun Nozzle:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear safety glasses and gloves to protect against sealant contact.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation when using sealants that emit fumes.
  • Handling: Handle the nozzle with care to avoid damage.
  • Storage: Store in a safe place away from children.
  • Disposal: Dispose of sealant residue and cleaning solvents according to local regulations.

A: Thanks to its high thrust ratio, the M8504 handles high-viscosity sealants like polyurethane with ease, maintaining a consistent and smooth application.

Q: What if the gun stops during use?

A: Check battery charge, nozzle blockage, and make sure the plunger is not jammed. Restart the unit and clean any sealant build-up from the mechanism.

column52:
How to apply Heavy Duty Cartridge Caulking Gun Type 35:

  1. Cut nozzle of cartridge to desired bead width and puncture inner seal.
  2. Pull back plunger and insert cartridge firmly into cradle.
  3. Push plunger forward and squeeze trigger evenly for controlled flow.
  4. Adjust nozzle angle using the 360° rotation for seamless directional changes.
  5. Release pressure mechanism after each use to avoid sealant drip.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Heavy Duty Cartridge Caulking Gun Type 35

Q: How do I insert a 310ml cartridge properly?

A: Pull back the plunger fully, insert the 310ml cartridge nozzle-first into the cradle, and push the plunger forward until it makes contact. Cut the nozzle to desired bead size before application.

Q: Does the 360° rotation help with vertical joints?

A: Yes, the 360-degree rotating frame allows seamless directional changes during application, particularly useful for overhead or vertical joints without wrist strain.

Q: What materials is the gun compatible with?

A: Compatible with all 310ml cartridges containing silicone, polyurethane, acrylic, or butyl rubber-based sealants used in building, plumbing, or automotive trades.

Q: The gun is stiff during cold weather – what should I do?

A: In cooler conditions, cartridges may stiffen. Warm the cartridge slightly (not over 40°C) in a bucket of warm water for a few minutes before loading.

Q: How do I clean and maintain the gun safely?

A: After use, wipe down the frame with a cloth and mild solvent if needed. Avoid water ingress into the trigger mechanism and store in dry conditions to prevent corrosion.

column3:
Use Megapoxy Thinners for: Thinning Megapoxy epoxy products to achieve desired viscosity for application.

Megapoxy Thinners is a specially formulated solvent blend designed to reduce the viscosity of Megapoxy epoxy products. This ensures optimal application and curing, improving the overall performance of the epoxy. However, due to its highly flammable nature and hazardous components, strict safety precautions must be followed during handling and storage.

Key Features of Megapoxy Thinners:

  • Specialized Formulation: Tailored for Megapoxy epoxy products.
  • Effective Thinning: Reduces viscosity for easier application.
  • High Flammability: Requires careful handling and storage.
  • Hazardous Components: Contains Ethanol and Xylene, necessitating safety measures.

Why Choose Megapoxy Thinners:

  • Optimized Application: Ensures proper viscosity for Megapoxy epoxies.
  • Improved Curing: Facilitates even and effective curing of epoxy products.
  • Compatibility: Designed for use with Megapoxy products.

When to Choose Megapoxy Thinners versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megapoxy Thinners when: Thinning Megapoxy epoxy products is required.
  • Consider other options when: Alternative thinners may be used, but compatibility should be tested.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Megapoxy Thinners is formulated for specific product compatibility, ensuring optimal results.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy Thinners:

For Construction and Engineering:

  • Thinning epoxy coatings for structural applications.
  • Adjusting viscosity for specific application methods (spraying, brushing).
  • Ensuring proper curing of epoxy repairs and coatings.

For Manufacturing and Fabrication:

  • Thinning epoxy adhesives for bonding applications.
  • Preparing epoxy coatings for industrial equipment.
  • Adjusting epoxy viscosity for specific manufacturing processes.

For Marine Applications:

  • Thinning epoxy coatings for boat repairs and maintenance.
  • Adjusting viscosity for optimal application in marine environments.
  • Ensuring proper curing of epoxy coatings in saltwater conditions.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy Thinners is a solvent blend primarily composed of Ethanol and Xylene, designed to reduce the viscosity of Megapoxy epoxy products. It is classified as a hazardous chemical and dangerous good due to its flammability and toxicity.

Chemical Properties: Highly flammable liquid, slightly soluble in water, completely soluble in most organic solvents. Contains Ethanol and Xylene.

Application Considerations: Requires proper ventilation and safety precautions due to its hazardous nature.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Appropriate mixing containers, stirring equipment, and personal protective equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use in well-ventilated areas, avoid open flames, and wear appropriate PPE.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper ventilation to avoid inhalation hazards, store in cool, dry places to prevent fire risks.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place, away from heat sources and ignition.
  • Shelf Life Information: No specific shelf life provided, but proper storage is crucial.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid high temperatures to prevent fire risks.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Classified as Dangerous Goods by Australian and New Zealand transport regulations.
  • Scheduled Poison S6.
column7: cleaner,dangerous goods,drum,solvent,solvent based

column33: Megapoxy Thinners is a hazardous solvent designed for thinning epoxy products. It is highly flammable and requires careful handling due to its potential health risks.
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy Thinners:

  1. Ensure adequate ventilation in the work area.
  2. Wear appropriate PPE (gloves, respirator, safety glasses).
  3. Add Megapoxy Thinners to the epoxy product in small increments until the desired consistency is achieved.
  4. Use non-sparking tools for mixing.
  5. For cleaning, soak tools in the thinner or wipe with a cloth dampened with the thinner.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy Thinners

Q: What is Megapoxy Thinners used for?

A: Megapoxy Thinners is used to reduce the viscosity of Megapoxy epoxy products for easier application.

Q: Is Megapoxy Thinners flammable?

A: Yes, Megapoxy Thinners is highly flammable and should be stored away from heat sources and open flames.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Megapoxy Thinners?

A: Use in well-ventilated areas, wear appropriate PPE, and avoid inhalation and skin contact.

Q: How should Megapoxy Thinners be stored?

A: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place, away from heat sources and ignition.

Q: What are the main components of Megapoxy Thinners?

A: Megapoxy Thinners primarily contains Ethanol and Xylene.

Q: What should I do in case of a spill?

A: Remove ignition sources, contain the spill, and use absorbent materials. Dispose of properly.
column54:
Megapoxy Thinners limitations:

  • Highly flammable; keep away from ignition sources.
  • Harmful if inhaled or absorbed through the skin.
  • Can cause skin and eye irritation.
  • Use only in well-ventilated areas.
  • Wear appropriate PPE, including nitrile gloves, safety glasses, and a respirator.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during use.
  • Eliminate all ignition sources.

The Buzon PH5 Slope Corrector is an essential accessory for achieving perfectly level surfaces with Buzon pedestal systems, even on sloped or uneven ground. This ingenious device easily attaches to the base of compatible Buzon pedestals, allowing for precise adjustment and slope correction up to 5%. By using the PH5 Slope Corrector, you can effortlessly create a safe, accessible, and visually appealing elevated deck or terrace, regardless of the underlying terrain.

  • Compensates for slopes up to 5% in 0.5% increments
  • Easy to install and adjust with a simple locking key
  • Compatible with Buzon PB, DPH, and BC pedestal ranges
  • Durable construction for long-lasting performance
  • Allows for stacking multiple correctors for up to 10% slope compensation

  • Correcting slopes for rooftop terraces and balconies
  • Creating accessible and compliant outdoor spaces
  • Ensuring proper drainage in sloped areas

Benefits

  • Ensures a perfectly level and stable deck or terrace
  • Increases safety and accessibility for all users
  • Minimizes the need for extensive ground preparation
  • Provides a professional finish to your elevated structure

Property Value
Material High-quality plastic
Compatibility Buzon PB, DPH, BC pedestal ranges
Slope Correction Range Up to 5% per corrector (10% with two correctors)

Application Guide (Simplified)

  1. Place the PH5 Slope Corrector under the base of the pedestal.
  2. Use the U-KIT-SL80 spirit level to measure the slope.
  3. Adjust the corrector until the desired slope is achieved.
  4. Secure the adjustment using the locking key.

column2: Roofers Flash n Patch Liquid Flashing Roof Sealant
column3:
Use Roofers Flash 'N' Patch for: Sealing roof penetrations, seams, gutters, damaged tiles, and punctured roof membranes.

Roofers Flash 'N' Patch is a premium, highly elastic hybrid acrylic sealant designed for a wide range of roofing and sealing applications. Its exceptional resistance to weathering and UV stability ensures a durable and long-lasting seal, even in harsh Australian conditions. This sealant maintains its superb elasticity through both hot and cold climates, making it ideal for dynamic structures that experience thermal expansion and contraction. Its excellent adhesion to most building materials, including Colorbond, Zincalume, aluminium, and tiles, simplifies application and ensures a reliable bond.

Key Features of Roofers Flash 'N' Patch

  • Superior Elasticity: Maintains flexibility across a wide temperature range, preventing cracks and ensuring a long-lasting seal in dynamic roofing structures.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to a variety of roofing materials, including metal, tiles, and plastics, reducing the need for extensive surface preparation.
  • UV Stable: Resists degradation from sunlight, ensuring long-term durability and preventing discolouration or cracking.
  • Weather Resistant: Provides a durable, weatherproof seal that protects against rain, wind, and temperature fluctuations.
  • Paintable: Can be painted after 24 hours, allowing for seamless integration with existing roof finishes.
  • Non-Toxic and Non-Hazardous: Safe for use in various environments, minimising health risks for applicators.

Technical Overview

Roofers Flash 'N' Patch is formulated to provide a highly elastic and durable seal, capable of withstanding significant environmental stress. Its hybrid acrylic composition offers a balance of flexibility and strength, making it ideal for sealing roof penetrations, seams, and damaged tiles. The sealant's ability to maintain its elasticity ensures that it can accommodate movement without cracking, providing long-term protection against water ingress.

Chemical Properties: Hybrid acrylic polymer-based, water-curing sealant that provides excellent resistance to weathering and UV radiation.

Application Temperature Range: +10°C to +35°C (50°F to 95°F). Ensure surfaces are dry and clean before application. Avoid applying if rain is imminent within 24 hours to ensure proper curing and adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Short bristled brush, cleaning cloths, water (for cleaning uncured sealant).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply a 1.5mm to 2mm thick film in one direction for optimal coverage and finish. Allow 24 hours before painting over the sealant. Test adhesion on a small area first if unsure about compatibility.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor adhesion can be prevented by ensuring surfaces are clean and dry. Cracking can be avoided by applying the sealant at the recommended thickness and temperature.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place away from direct sunlight and incompatible materials.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 90°C (41°F and 194°F) for optimal shelf life.

Certifications

  • Complies with WorkSafe Australia standards (non-hazardous classification).
  • AICIS Listed.
column7: acrylic,block work,brick,construction,external,flexible,general sealing,metal,non toxic,pail,paintable,polycarbonate,pvc,roof & gutter,roofing-i,roofs,sealant,stainless steel,steel,tiling,tiling-i,timber sheeting-s,uv stable,waterproofing-i
column32: Roofers Flash 'N' Patch | Elastic Roof Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Roofers Flash 'N' Patch: Highly elastic, UV-stable acrylic sealant for roof repairs. Excellent adhesion to metal, tiles, and more. Weatherproof and paintable.
column52:
How to apply Roofers Flash 'N' Patch:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dirt, grease, and oil.
  2. Application: Using a short bristled brush, apply a film 1.5mm to 2mm thick over the area.
  3. Direction: Be sure to brush only in one direction for a uniform finish.
  4. Painting (Optional): If painting over Roofers Flash 'N' Patch, allow a minimum of 24 hours before painting.
  5. Weather Conditions: Do not use Roofers Flash 'N' Patch if rain is imminent in the next 24 hours.
  6. Adhesion Test: If unsure of adhesion, test a small area of the substrate first.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Roofers Flash 'N' Patch

Q: How should I prepare the surface before applying Roofers Flash 'N' Patch?

A: Ensure surfaces are dry and free from dirt, grease, and oil. Clean the area thoroughly with a suitable cleaner and allow it to dry completely before applying the sealant.

Q: Can I paint over Roofers Flash 'N' Patch?

A: Yes, Roofers Flash 'N' Patch is paintable. Allow a minimum of 24 hours for the sealant to cure before applying any paint.

Q: What types of surfaces can Roofers Flash 'N' Patch be used on?

A: Roofers Flash 'N' Patch has excellent adhesion to a variety of materials, including Colorbond, Zincalume, aluminium, polycarbonate, brick, blockwork, timber, steel, and PVC.

Q: What is the recommended application thickness for Roofers Flash 'N' Patch?

A: Apply a film of 1.5mm to 2mm thick using a short bristled brush. Ensure you brush in only one direction for a uniform finish.

Q: Is Roofers Flash 'N' Patch safe to use?

A: Yes, Roofers Flash 'N' Patch is not classified as hazardous according to WorkSafe Australia. However, skin irritation and sensitization may occur in sensitive individuals. Always consult the SDS for detailed safety information and use appropriate PPE.

Q: Can Roofers Flash 'N' Patch be used in all weather conditions?

A: It is best to avoid applying Roofers Flash 'N' Patch if rain is imminent within 24 hours to ensure proper curing and adhesion. Dry conditions are best for application.

Q: How do I clean up excess or uncured Roofers Flash 'N' Patch?

A: Uncured Roofers Flash 'N' Patch can be cleaned up with water. Once cured, it may require mechanical removal.
column54:
Roofers Flash 'N' Patch limitations:

  • Do not apply if rain is expected within 24 hours.
  • Ensure proper surface preparation for optimal adhesion.
  • Allow 24 hours before painting over the sealant.
  • Skin irritation may occur in sensitive individuals; always consult the SDS.

Safety precautions when using Roofers Flash 'N' Patch:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses. A respirator may be needed in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Wash hands thoroughly after use. Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
column55: Roofers Flash 'N' Patch is a highly elastic hybrid acrylic sealant, perfect for roof repairs and general sealing applications. Its superior elasticity and UV stability ensure long-lasting performance in diverse climates. With excellent adhesion to common roofing materials like Colorbond, Zincalume, and tiles, it provides a durable, weatherproof seal. Easy to apply and paintable.
column56:
Roofers Flash 'N' Patch can be used on the following substrates:

  • Colorbond: Provides a durable, weatherproof seal on metal roofing.
  • Zincalume: Bonds effectively to zinc-aluminium alloy surfaces.
  • Aluminium: Seals joints and penetrations in aluminium structures.
  • Polycarbonate: Adheres well to polycarbonate sheets and panels.
  • Brick and Blockwork: Seals gaps and cracks in masonry surfaces.
  • Timber: Protects wood from moisture and weather damage.
  • Steel: Provides a protective coating on steel structures.
  • PVC: Seals joints and penetrations in PVC pipes and fittings.
column57:
Use Roofers Flash 'N' Patch for:

  • Sealing around roof penetrations, preventing water leaks.
  • Sealing seams in roofing materials, ensuring a weatherproof barrier.
  • Sealing inside guttering, preventing leaks and corrosion.
  • Sealing damaged tiles, extending their lifespan.
  • Sealing punctured roof membranes, restoring their integrity.
  • Sealing around dektites, ensuring a watertight seal.

Why Use Roofers Flash 'N' Patch:

  • Superior Elasticity: Maintains flexibility, preventing cracks in dynamic roofing structures, ensuring long term protection.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to various substrates, reducing the need for extensive prep, saving time and money.
  • UV Stability: Resists sunlight damage, ensuring long-term durability and appearance, reducing the need for frequent repairs.
  • Weather Resistance: Protects against rain and wind, maintaining a durable seal, preventing costly water damage.
  • Paintable: Allows seamless integration with roof finishes, enhancing the aesthetic appeal, providing a professional finish.
  • Ease of Use: Simple application with a brush, making it accessible for both professionals and DIY users, simplifying repairs.

column2: Mapei UC Leveller - Fast Hardening Levelling Compound
column3:
**Important Note:** This product is only available for delivery within QLD or for pickup in-store. Please contact us directly if you wish to have this product delivered outside of Brisbane. Standard shipping charges will apply.

Use Mapei UC Leveller for: Levelling and smoothing interior floors prior to installing carpet, tiles, stone, or timber flooring.

Mapei UC Leveller is a grey powder levelling compound designed for smoothing and levelling interior substrates. Its fast-hardening and self-levelling properties make it ideal for preparing floors before installing various coverings. UC Leveller is classified as CT-C25-F7 according to EN 13813, ensuring high compressive and flexural strength.

Key Features of Mapei UC Leveller:

  • Fast Hardening: Reduces waiting time before flooring installation.
  • Self-Levelling: Provides a smooth, even surface.
  • High Strength: Classified as CT-C25-F7, ensuring durability.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various substrates and flooring types.
  • Pumpable: Easy application with automatic pressure pumps.

Why Choose Mapei UC Leveller:

  • Increased Efficiency: Rapid setting and easy application.
  • Enhanced Durability: High compressive and flexural strength.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for a wide range of flooring installations.
  • Smooth Finish: Ensures a perfect base for floor coverings.

When to Choose Mapei UC Leveller versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Mapei UC Leveller when: Fast hardening and high strength are required for interior levelling.
  • Consider other options when: Levelling exterior substrates or timber substrates.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Mapei UC Leveller offers superior performance and efficiency, justifying its value.

Trade-Specific Applications for Mapei UC Leveller:

For Flooring Contractors:

  • Levelling concrete and cement-based screeds before tile or carpet installation.
  • Preparing anhydrite screeds for various floor coverings.
  • Smoothing floors for underfloor heating installations.

For Tile Installers:

  • Creating a smooth base for ceramic and natural stone tiles.
  • Levelling existing tile and stone floors for new installations.
  • Ensuring a flat surface for large format tiles.

For Carpet Installers:

  • Preparing smooth surfaces for carpet and carpet tiles.
  • Levelling floors in high-traffic commercial areas.
  • Ensuring a flat base for seamless carpet installation.

For Timber Flooring Installers:

  • Preparing concrete substrates for floating timber or laminate flooring.
  • Creating a level surface that will help prevent issues with the timber flooring.
  • Ensuring a flat and smooth base for the timber flooring.

Technical Overview

Mapei UC Leveller is a grey powder composed of special fast-setting and hydrating cements, graded silica sand, resins, and additives. When mixed with water, it becomes a fluid, self-levelling mix that cures rapidly.

Chemical Properties: Cement-based powder with additives for enhanced flow and strength.

Application Considerations: Interior use only, thickness range of 3-70mm, and temperature range of +5°C to +35°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Electric mixer, trowel, float, and pump (for large areas).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper substrate preparation, use correct water ratio, and apply within working time.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid over-watering, ensure proper priming, and follow movement joint guidelines.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, elevated area, protected from moisture.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original sealed packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.

Certifications and Compliance

  • EN 13813 CT-C25-F7 classification.
  • Green Star compliant (very low VOC content).

column7: EN 13813,bag,cementitous,ceramics,civil construction-i,compound,concrete,construction,external,flooring-i,high strength,industrial,internal,levelling compounds,manufacturing,masonry,polymer modified,self levelling,sheet metal-i,silica,special order,stone,stone-i,tiling-i,timber sheeting-s,underfloor heating
column32: Mapei UC Leveller - Fast Hardening Levelling Compound | Adheseal
column33: Mapei UC Leveller: Fast-hardening, self-levelling compound for interior floors. High strength, 3-70mm thickness. Buy now for smooth surfaces.
column52:
How to apply UC Leveller:

  1. Prepare the substrate by cleaning and priming as required.
  2. Mix UC Leveller with water to a homogenous consistency.
  3. Spread the mix with a metal trowel or float, or apply with a pump.
  4. For a second coat, apply after 3 hours or prime with Eco Prim T Plus if more than 24 hours have passed.
  5. Allow to dry for 12-24 hours before installing flooring.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About UC Leveller

Q: Can UC Leveller be used on exterior surfaces?

A: No, UC Leveller is designed for interior use only. It should not be used in external or wet areas, or over substrates subject to rising damp.

Q: How long do I need to wait before installing flooring over UC Leveller?

A: Allow 12 hours for light foot traffic and 24 hours before installing flooring at 23°C and 50% RH. Drying times can vary depending on thickness, temperature, and humidity.

Q: What is the maximum thickness UC Leveller can be applied at?

A: UC Leveller can be applied in a single coat from 3mm to 70mm. For thicknesses above 40mm, it is recommended to add 30% aggregate.

Q: Do I need to prime the substrate before applying UC Leveller?

A: Yes, porous substrates should be primed with Eco Prim T Plus diluted 1:2 with water. Non-porous substrates require undiluted Eco Prim T Plus or Eco Prim Grip Plus. Follow specific priming instructions for different substrates.

Q: How do I prepare the mix for UC Leveller?

A: Pour 3.4-3.8 liters of clean water into a container and gradually add a 20kg bag of UC Leveller. Mix with an electric mixer at 300 RPM until a homogenous, lump-free mix is obtained. Let it sit for a few minutes and remix briefly.
column54:
UC Leveller limitations:

  • Do not use externally or in damp areas.
  • Do not apply at temperatures below +5°C or above +35°C.
  • Do not apply in thicknesses less than 3mm.
  • Do not use over timber substrates.

Safety precautions when using UC Leveller:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, eye protection, and dust mask.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety instructions.

column56:

  • Magnesite floors (primed with Eco Prim T Plus).
  • Substrates with under-floor heating installations.

column2: Mapei Mapegrout T40 - Medium Strength Repair Mortar for Concrete
column3:
Use Mapegrout T40 for: repairing concrete surfaces, corners of pillars, beams, balconies, and reconstructing concrete coverings of reinforcing bars.

Mapegrout T40 is a grey, powdered mortar composed of cement, graded aggregates, and special additives, formulated for repairing degraded concrete. When mixed with water, it forms a thixotropic mortar that can be applied without slumping, even on vertical surfaces. It offers moderate flexural and compressive strength, with properties similar to medium-quality concrete. This mortar is waterproof and provides excellent adhesion to existing concrete, especially when used with Mapefer or Mapefer 1K for reinforcing bars. The addition of Mapecure SRA enhances curing and reduces shrinkage, ensuring a durable and crack-resistant repair.

Key Features of Mapegrout T40

  • Shrinkage-compensated formula minimizes cracking and enhances durability.
  • Thixotropic consistency allows for easy application on vertical and overhead surfaces.
  • Moderate flexural and compressive strength suitable for various repair applications.
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete and reinforcing bars (when used with Mapefer).
  • Waterproof and resistant to environmental factors.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Premixed powdered mortar (cement, aggregates, additives)
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Compressive Strength (28 days): > 40 MPa
  • Flexural Strength (28 days): > 7.0 MPa
  • Bond Strength to Concrete: > 2 MPa

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cement mixer or drill with mixing attachment, trowel, gauging trowel, spray equipment (Turbosol or Putzmeister).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough substrate preparation by removing degraded concrete and sandblasting surfaces. Saturate the substrate with water before application. Use Mapecure SRA for enhanced curing.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid adding excess water post-mixing. Cure the mortar properly, especially in hot or windy weather, to prevent cracking.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original packaging, protected from moisture.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Store in a cool place in warm weather and protect from frost in cold weather.

Certifications

  • EN 1504-3 (R3 class) compliant.
  • AS/NZS 4020:2005 compliant.
  • EN 13501-1 (Euroclass A1) for reaction to fire.
column7: concrete, concrete repair, concrete-s, special order
column32: Mapegrout T40 - Medium Strength Repair Mortar for Concrete
column33: Mapegrout T40: 40MPa, shrinkage-compensated repair mortar. Thixotropic, fibre-reinforced, for vertical/horizontal concrete repairs.
column52:
How to apply Mapegrout T40:

  1. Prepare the substrate by removing degraded concrete and cleaning the surface.
  2. Mix Mapegrout T40 with water to the required consistency.
  3. Apply the mortar with a trowel or spray equipment.
  4. Treat reinforcing bars with Mapefer or Mapefer 1K.
  5. Cure the applied mortar to prevent cracking.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Mapegrout T40

Q: Can Mapegrout T40 be used for structural repairs?

A: Yes, Mapegrout T40 is suitable for both structural and non-structural repairs of concrete surfaces, providing medium mechanical performance.

Q: How do I prepare the substrate before applying Mapegrout T40?

A: Remove degraded concrete, sandblast the surface, and saturate the substrate with water. Reinforcing bars should be treated with Mapefer or Mapefer 1K.

Q: What is the maximum thickness Mapegrout T40 can be applied in a single layer?

A: Mapegrout T40 can be applied in layers up to 30-35 mm thick on vertical surfaces and ceilings without formwork.

Q: Can Mapegrout T40 be sprayed?

A: Yes, Mapegrout T40 can be spray-applied using Turbosol or Putzmeister type equipment, excluding continuous mixing machines.

Q: How do I ensure proper curing of Mapegrout T40?

A: Cure the mortar by spraying water 8-12 hours after application and repeating every 3-4 hours for 48 hours. Alternatively, use Mapecure E, Mapecure S, or Elastocolor Primer.
column54:
Mapegrout T40 limitations:

  • Do not use for structures subject to high compressive loads, impact, or abrasion.
  • Do not use for pumping over long distances or high pumping heads.
  • Do not use on smooth concrete surfaces without roughening and reinforcing.
  • Do not use for anchoring or pouring into formwork for pumping.
  • Do not use at temperatures below +5°C.

Safety precautions when using Mapegrout T40:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, goggles, and respiratory protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash thoroughly after use.

column3:
Gripset BRW Swell Seal is a high-performance, reinforced, multipurpose self-adhesive, hydrophilic butyl rubber waterstop that swells to form a water-tight seal. It is designed for static or low movement construction joints, cold joints, and penetrations on various concrete surfaces. BRW Swell Seal offers a long-lasting, durable, watertight compression seal, protecting against moisture ingress. Its exceptional performance is a result of the combination of butyl rubber, stainless steel reinforcement, and hydrophilic components.

Features & Benefits:

  • Self-adhering application for easy installation
  • Creates a long-lasting compression seal
  • Provides watertight sealing properties
  • High strength core reinforcement for added durability
  • Expansion delay to avoid premature swelling
  • Resistant to wet/dry cycles
  • Primer-less application (on dust-free and stable surfaces)
  • Suitable for submerged environments
  • Easy workability and deformability over substrates
  • Excellent thermal stability
  • Flexible to accommodate movement
  • Outstanding adhesion retention at low temperatures
  • Withstands common ground contaminants
  • No drying required for time-saving application
  • Solvent-free and non-toxic
  • Can be used in conjunction with Gripset underground/immersed systems

Application:

Gripset BRW Swell Seal is suitable for various applications, including:

  • Concrete foundations and walls
  • Concrete slabs, including elevated ramps
  • Lift pits
  • Precast construction
  • Pools, tanks, water containing structures
  • Tunnels, pipes, and underground vaults
  • Marine environments
  • General shotcrete and pile applications

Surface Preparation:

  • Surfaces must be clean, smooth, and dust-free
  • Surfaces must be dry and free of any residual moisture to avoid pre-swell
  • Rough surfaces must be leveled or smoothed with Gripset SB

Installing BRW Swell Seal Waterstop:

  • Can be installed directly onto the concrete surface or to a formed channel in the concrete
  • Optimum results achieved by applying Swell Seal onto even smooth surfaces. Undulating surfaces may slow the application.
  • Ensure a 50mm cover from the edge of the concrete to the face of the Swell Seal to prevent any concrete blow-outs.
  • Swell Seal should be positioned between two rows of reinforcing steel to support optimum product placement.
  • Joint surfaces must be free of loose dirt, dust, and debris.
  • Place Swell Seal in position, and remove release backing from the adhesive side in small sections.
  • Apply moderate hand pressure to press a continuous roll of Swell Seal firmly onto the surface.
  • Ends are to be butt-joined or kneaded together to form a continuous watertight seal.
  • Check adhesion of the Swell Seal strip is correctly and fully adhered to surfaces.
  • Gripset 11Y can be applied as a surface adhesion enhancer on surfaces where bonding may be compromised. Apply Gripset 11Y to the surface, allow it to tack off, then place Swell Seal onto the primed areas.
  • For extremely rough surfaces, fill voids first and then use Gripset SB to adhere the Swell Seal.
  • Placement of concrete can commence once Swell Seal is correctly bonded to surfaces. Care must be taken to ensure the Swell Seal is not dislodged during the concrete application.

Storage Conditions:

BRW Swell Seal is best used within 12 months of purchase; however, its properties will be unchanged if stored correctly. It is best stored at room temperature in dry internal conditions and is not affected by frost or cold floors.

Packaging:

BRW Swell Seal is available in 5m roll lengths, with a width of 25mm and a thickness of 10mm.

Use EverKrete Accelerator for: Accelerating the cure time of EverKrete 102 resin in cold temperatures or when a rapid return to service is required.

EverKrete Accelerator is a single-component additive designed to significantly reduce the curing time of EverKrete 102 resin. It enables applications in temperatures as low as -18°C and achieves full cure in as little as 15 minutes, making it ideal for projects requiring a fast turnaround. Its variable mix ratio allows for tailored cure times based on specific project needs and environmental conditions.

Key Features of EverKrete Accelerator:

  • Extremely Fast Curing: Achieves full cure in as little as 15 minutes.
  • Cold Temperature Application: Suitable for use down to -18°C.
  • Variable Mix Ratio: Allows for customized cure times.
  • Enhanced Workability: Improves application in challenging conditions.
  • Durable and Resilient: Maintains long-term performance.

Why Choose EverKrete Accelerator:

  • Increased Efficiency: Reduces project downtime with rapid curing.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for a wide range of temperature conditions.
  • Tailored Performance: Variable mix ratios for specific project needs.
  • Reliable Results: Proven durability and resilience.

When to Choose EverKrete Accelerator versus Alternatives:

  • Choose EverKrete Accelerator when: Rapid curing and cold temperature application are required.
  • Consider other options when: Standard curing times are acceptable, and temperatures are within normal ranges.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: EverKrete Accelerator offers significant time savings and application flexibility, justifying its value.

Trade-Specific Applications for EverKrete Accelerator:

For Concrete Repair Specialists:

  • Rapid repairs in cold storage facilities or outdoor winter conditions.
  • Quick turnaround repairs in high-traffic areas.
  • Priming applications in cold temperatures.

For Civil Engineers:

  • Accelerating cure times for critical infrastructure repairs.
  • Ensuring timely project completion in varying weather conditions.
  • Enhancing the performance of EverKrete 102 in challenging environments.

For Industrial Maintenance:

  • Minimizing downtime for repairs in production facilities.
  • Ensuring rapid repairs in cold industrial environments.
  • Maintaining operational efficiency with fast-curing solutions.

Technical Overview

EverKrete Accelerator is a single-component additive designed to accelerate the cure speed of EverKrete 102 resin. It is particularly useful in cold temperature applications and when a fast return to service is required.

Chemical Properties: Additive designed to react with EverKrete 102 resin, accelerating its curing process.

Application Considerations: Variable mix ratios, temperature range of -18°C to +35°C, and specific mixing instructions.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, power mixer, and measuring tools.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Test mix ratios before application, follow mixing instructions carefully, and consider ambient and material temperatures.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid simultaneous addition of catalyst and accelerator, and ensure proper mixing for even dispersion.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific details.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.
column7: additive
column32: EverKrete Accelerator – Fast Cure for Concrete Repair | Adheseal
column33: EverKrete Accelerator: Rapid concrete cure for cold temps & fast return to service. Variable mix ratios. Buy now for efficient repairs.
column52:
How to apply EverKrete Accelerator:

  1. Catalyse EverKrete 102 with the standard catalyst as per the product instructions.
  2. Measure the desired quantity of EverKrete Accelerator.
  3. Add the EverKrete Accelerator to the catalysed EverKrete 102 resin.
  4. Power mix well for 30-60 seconds to evenly disperse the accelerator.
  5. Apply the mixture as per the EverKrete 102 application instructions.
  6. Adjust the mix ratio based on temperature and desired cure time, testing beforehand.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About EverKrete Accelerator

Q: What is EverKrete Accelerator used for?

A: EverKrete Accelerator is used to accelerate the cure time of EverKrete 102 resin.

Q: Can EverKrete Accelerator be used in cold temperatures?

A: Yes, it is suitable for applications down to -18°C.

Q: What is the recommended mix ratio?

A: The mix ratio is variable, ranging from 100:1 to 1000:1. Testing is recommended to determine the desired ratio.

Q: How quickly does EverKrete Accelerator cure EverKrete 102 resin?

A: It can achieve full cure in as little as 15 minutes.

Q: Can EverKrete Accelerator be used as a primer?

A: Yes, it can be used as a primer when mixed with EverKrete 102 resin at a ratio of 100-200:1 for temperatures +5°C to -18°C.

Q: How should I clean up EverKrete accelerator?

A: While the product is still wet, tools and spills can be efficiently cleaned with Acetone.
column54:
EverKrete Accelerator limitations:

  • Do not apply when temperatures are below -18°C or above 35°C.
  • Do not apply on damp, wet, or contaminated substrates.
  • Do not apply if it is raining or if rain is imminent.

Safety precautions when using EverKrete Accelerator:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and respiratory protection as needed, according to Australian safety standards.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • First Aid: If poisoning occurs, contact a doctor or Poisons Information Centre (131 126 in Australia). Follow first aid measures as per SDS.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information.

The EverKrete Concrete Repair System is a versatile, advanced solution utilising EverKrete 102 Thermoset Vinyl Polymer resin. When combined with kiln-dried aggregates, it forms a durable mortar ideal for horizontal, vertical, and overhead applications. This repair system is compatible with a range of substrates and offers controlled curing, making it suitable for both internal and external repairs in various environments, including cold temperatures.

This product is designed for industry professionals, as it requires careful attention to instructions for proper use to ensure the best results and prevent any potential issues.

We strongly encourage users to download the EverKrete Trade Kit TDS as it contains important information on how to use and apply this product.

Key Features

  • Thermoset Vinyl Polymer resin with high durability
  • Flexible, fast-curing, and weather-resistant
  • Supports applications from feather-edge to high-build repairs
  • Can be customised for slip-resistant surfaces
  • Available in multiple colours for aesthetic flexibility

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset GP Primer

Q: What is Gripset GP Primer used for?

A: Gripset GP Primer is a water-based primer designed to enhance the adhesion of Gripset waterproofing membranes and tile adhesives over porous surfaces.

Q: Can Gripset GP Primer be used on damp surfaces?

A: No, it should not be applied on damp surfaces. For substrates with high moisture content or rising damp, use Gripset E60 or Xpress H2O Primer Plus.

Q: How many coats of Gripset GP Primer should be applied?

A: Typically, one coat is sufficient. However, for highly porous surfaces or surfaces prone to dusting, two coats may be necessary.

Q: How long does Gripset GP Primer take to dry?

A: It dries in approximately 30 minutes at 23°C and 50% RH. Drying time may vary depending on temperature, humidity, and substrate conditions.

Q: What surfaces is Gripset GP Primer suitable for?

A: It can be applied to concrete, screeds, masonry, aerated concrete, plasterboard, and compressed fibre cement sheeting.
column54:

  • Not suitable for surfaces with active moisture or rising damp—use GRIPSET E60 in such cases.

Q: What surfaces is Gripset GP Primer suitable for?

A: It can be applied to concrete, screeds, masonry, aerated concrete, plasterboard, and compressed fibre cement sheeting.

  • Speeds up project timelines with its fast-drying properties
  • Improves longevity of overlaid membranes and coatings

column3:
Use GRIPSET 2P for: Waterproofing wet areas, balconies, pools, tanks, and subterranean structures.

GRIPSET 2P is a versatile, two-component cementitious waterproofing membrane engineered for high-performance moisture protection in demanding environments. Designed for under-tile, immersed, and subterranean applications, it offers superior adhesion, flexibility, and toughness. With rapid curing times, GRIPSET 2P is ideal for cooler and humid conditions, ensuring quick project turnaround.

Key Features of GRIPSET 2P

  • Highly durable, flexible, and tough cementitious membrane
  • Fast drying—ideal for humid and cool conditions
  • Waterproof and resistant to continuous wet and immersed environments
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete, masonry, and cementitious substrates
  • Non-toxic, solvent-free, and safe for potable water applications
  • Certified to AS4858 and AS4654.1 waterproofing standards
  • Non-sagging on vertical surfaces

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Cementitious polymer blend
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Roller, brush, spray unit
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure substrate is properly primed before application
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Prevent premature drying by avoiding direct sun exposure during application

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry, cool place, off cold floors
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original, unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not store in freezing conditions

Certifications

  • AS4858 and AS4654.1 compliance
  • AS/NZ 4020 – 2018 potable water certification

column32: Gripset 2P Cementitious Waterproofing Membrane | Adheseal
column33: GRIPSET 2P is a two-component cementitious waterproofing membrane, ideal for wet areas, pools, and balconies. Fast-drying and highly durable.
column52:
How to apply GRIPSET 2P:

  1. Ensure surface is clean and primed.
  2. Mix Part A (liquid) and Part B (powder) at a 1:1 ratio.
  3. Apply using a roller, brush, or spray unit.
  4. Apply two coats, allowing 2-4 hours drying time between layers.
  5. Wait 24 hours before tiling or applying screeds.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset 2P

Q: What is Gripset 2P used for?

A: Gripset 2P is a two-component cementitious waterproof membrane designed for internal and external wet areas, submerged applications, and subterranean waterproofing.

Q: Can Gripset 2P be used for potable water storage?

A: Yes, Gripset 2P is certified to AS/NZ 4020 – 2018 for use in potable water storage facilities and water tanks.

Q: How is Gripset 2P applied?

A: It can be applied by brush, roller, or spray unit in a minimum of two coats for a total dried film thickness of 1.2mm.

Q: Does Gripset 2P require priming before application?

A: Yes, porous surfaces require Gripset GP Primer, non-porous surfaces require Gripset OP Primer, and damp surfaces require Xpress Primer H2O Plus or Gripset E60.

Q: What are the drying times for Gripset 2P?

A: Recoat in 2-4 hours, tiling or toppings can be applied after 24 hours, and immersion requires 7 days of curing.
column54:
h3>GRIPSET 2P limitations:
  • Not suitable for negative hydrostatic pressure applications
  • Do not apply in direct rain or extreme temperature conditions

Safety precautions when using Gripset 2P:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing during application.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow in enclosed areas to prevent inhalation of vapors.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Wash tools with water while the product is still wet. Once dried, removal requires mechanical methods.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Disposal: Dispose of unused material according to local environmental regulations.

With fast drying properties, it performs well even in cooler and humid conditions. Compliant with AS4858 and AS4654.1 waterproofing standards.

column2: Gripset 51 Solvent Free Bitumen Rubber Membrane
column3:
Use Gripset 51 for: Waterproofing underground areas, retaining walls, basements, planter boxes, and protecting timber & metal surfaces.

Gripset 51 is a high-performance, solvent-free bitumen rubber liquid membrane designed for superior waterproofing. Its non-toxic, flexible, and durable composition ensures long-lasting protection against water, damp environments, and corrosion. Ideal for commercial, industrial, and residential applications, this versatile membrane is perfect for underground structures, basements, planter boxes, metal and timber coatings.

Key Features of Gripset 51

  • Solvent-free, non-toxic, and environmentally friendly
  • Excellent waterproofing and crack-bridging properties
  • Superior adhesion to porous and non-porous surfaces
  • Protective coating against corrosion, rot, and salt damp
  • Bonds to bituminous and asphalt surfaces for repairs
  • UV-resistant (may experience surface crazing under long-term exposure)
  • Compatible with cement for waterproofing slurries and mortars
  • Provides excellent sound-deadening properties

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Bitumen rubber liquid membrane
  • Application Temperature: 5°C to 35°C
  • Dry Film Thickness: 1mm minimum
  • Recoat Time: 2-4 hours
  • Full Cure: 10 days

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, spatula, trowel
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a wet film gauge to ensure proper coverage
  • Common Issues & Solutions: Avoid applying in wet conditions or temperatures below 5°C

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 25°C
  • Shelf Life: 12 months from the date of manufacture
  • Handling: Avoid freezing and direct sunlight exposure

Certifications

  • Manufactured to Australian waterproofing standards

column32: Gripset 51 | Solvent-Free Bitumen Rubber Liquid Membrane
column33: Gripset 51 is a solvent-free bitumen rubber liquid membrane with high adhesion and waterproofing properties. Ideal for underground, metal, and timber surfaces.
column52:
How to apply Gripset 51:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Prime porous surfaces with Gripset 51 diluted 1:3 with water.
  3. Apply a minimum of 2 coats using a brush or roller.
  4. Allow at least 2-4 hours between coats.
  5. Backfill after 5 days, full cure in 10 days.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset 51

Q: What is Gripset 51 used for?

A: Gripset 51 is a solvent-free bitumen rubber liquid membrane used for waterproofing underground areas, external surfaces, planter boxes, and as a protective coating for timber and metal surfaces.

Q: Can Gripset 51 be used on metal and timber surfaces?

A: Yes, it provides a protective coating against corrosion, rot, and salt damp for timber and metal surfaces, including galvanized iron and zincalume.

Q: Does Gripset 51 require a primer before application?

A: Yes, porous surfaces require Gripset 51 diluted 1:3 with water, non-porous surfaces require Gripset 51 diluted 1:1 with water or Gripset OP Primer, and damp surfaces require Gripset E60.

Q: Can Gripset 51 be exposed to UV light?

A: No, long-term UV exposure may cause surface crazing. It should be covered with a protective layer if exposed to sunlight.

Q: How long does Gripset 51 take to dry?

A: It takes 2-4 hours for re-coating, 5 days before backfilling, and 10 days for full curing.
column54:
Gripset 51 limitations:

  • Not suitable for continuous UV exposure
  • Not a trafficable coating
  • Not designed for negative hydrostatic pressure applications
  • Do not apply in temperatures below 5°C or above 35°C

Safety precautions when using Gripset 51:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and protective clothing during application.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow in enclosed areas to prevent inhalation of vapors.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Wash tools with water while the product is still wet. Once dried, removal requires mechanical methods.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and freezing conditions.
  • Disposal: Dispose of unused material according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset 51 is a non-toxic, solvent-free, bitumen rubber liquid membrane offering high adhesion, flexibility, and waterproofing protection. Suitable for underground and external areas, it bonds to porous and non-porous surfaces, preventing corrosion and rot. Ideal for retaining walls, basements, planter boxes, and timber or metal coatings.

  • Compressed fibre cement sheeting
  • Marine ply, timber sheeting, and timber posts
  • Galvanised iron and Zincalume (not raw steel)
  • Bituminous and asphalt surfaces
  • Polystyrene
column57:
