column3:
Use Gripset 38FC for: Fast-track waterproofing of bathrooms, balconies, and rooftops, enabling quick tiling and overlay finishes.

Gripset 38FC is a next-generation, water-based SBR latex membrane, reinforced with fibres for enhanced strength and workability. Designed for both internal and external waterproofing, it's perfect for areas requiring rapid completion. Its fast-cure technology allows tiling in just 4 hours and flood testing in 24, making it ideal for time-sensitive projects. Gripset 38FC provides a flexible, elastomeric, and durable seamless finish, ensuring excellent vapour barrier properties and low water vapour transmission.

Key Features of Gripset 38FC

  • Fast Curing: Tile over in just 4 hours, significantly reducing project timelines and allowing for quicker completion of wet area installations.
  • Fibre Reinforced: Enhances tensile strength and provides superior workability, ensuring a robust and reliable waterproof barrier on various substrates.
  • Waterproof and Durable: Withstands continuously wet environments and ponding without re-emulsifying, ideal for bathrooms, balconies, and rooftops.
  • Flexible and Elastomeric: Accommodates normal substrate movement, preventing cracks and maintaining a seamless waterproof layer over time.
  • Vapour Barrier: Offers excellent vapour barrier properties and low water vapour transmission, protecting structures from moisture damage.

Technical Overview

Gripset 38FC is formulated to provide a high-performance waterproofing solution with rapid curing capabilities. Its fibre-reinforced composition ensures superior tensile strength and durability, making it suitable for a wide range of applications. The elastomeric properties allow it to flex with substrate movement, preventing cracking and maintaining a continuous waterproof barrier.

Chemical Properties: Water-based SBR latex with fibre reinforcement, providing a flexible and durable membrane.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C (41°F to 86°F). Apply within this range to ensure proper curing and adhesion, avoiding extreme temperatures that may affect performance.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, medium nap roller, spray unit, spatula, wet film gauge.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are properly primed with Gripset GP, OP, Xpress H2O Plus, or E60 primer depending on substrate type. Use a wet film gauge to accurately control the application thickness. Detail all critical areas with Elastoproof B50 Joint Band, BRW PF Tape, or RLA MAX SMP 25 sealant before applying the membrane.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If encountering slow curing, ensure ambient temperature is within the recommended range and humidity is not excessively high. For uneven coverage, use a wet film gauge to monitor thickness and apply additional coats as needed.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original unopened packaging, avoid freezing conditions, and keep off cold floors. Best stored at room temperature, away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in temperatures below 5°C (41°F) or above 30°C (86°F) to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Compliant to AS 4858 (Wet Area Membranes)
  • Compliant to AS 4654.1 (Waterproofing of Roofs and Associated Waterproofing)
column7: AS4654.1:212,AS4858,balcony,bathroom,block work,concrete-s,construction,decks,durable,external,fast cure,fibre cement sheet,fibre reinforced,flexible,internal,liquid applied,low voc,marine plywood,membrane,non toxic,pail,plasterboard,render,rooftops,screed,shower,solvent free,structural plywood,tiling-i,timber sheeting-s,water cleanup,water resistant,waterproofing-a,wet areas
column32: Gripset 38FC Waterproofing Membrane | Adheseal
column33: Gripset 38FC is a fast-curing, fibre-reinforced waterproofing membrane for internal and external wet areas. Tile over in just 4 hours.
column52:
How to apply Gripset 38FC:

  1. Prepare the Surface: Ensure all surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Repair any defects with appropriate repair mortars.
  2. Prime the Surface: Apply the appropriate Gripset primer (GP, OP, Xpress H2O Plus, or E60) according to the substrate.
  3. Detail Critical Areas: Apply Elastoproof B50 Joint Band, BRW PF Tape, or RLA MAX SMP 25 sealant to joints, junctions, penetrations, and cracks.
  4. Apply First Coat: Apply Gripset 38FC by brush or roller at a coverage of 750 microns wet film thickness.
  5. Apply Second Coat: After 1 hour, apply a second coat at 750 microns wet film thickness, ensuring total coverage of 1.5 litres/m².
  6. Allow to Cure: Allow 4 hours before tiling and 24 hours before flood testing.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset 38FC

Q: Can Gripset 38FC be applied to damp surfaces?

A: For damp surfaces with residual moisture, use Xpress Primer H2O Plus or Gripset E60, depending on the moisture level. These primers are designed to adhere to damp substrates, ensuring a strong bond for the Gripset 38FC membrane.

Q: How long does Gripset 38FC take to fully cure?

A: Gripset 38FC fully cures in 24 hours under standard conditions (23°C and 50% RH), allowing for flood testing. Drying times may vary with temperature and humidity.

Q: Is Gripset 38FC compatible with all tile adhesives?

A: Gripset 38FC is compatible with polymer-modified cement-based adhesives. For other adhesives, contact RLA Polymers technical department for compatibility details.

Q: What is the minimum dried film thickness required for Gripset 38FC?

A: The minimum dried film thickness is 1mm. Apply at least two coats to achieve this thickness, ensuring proper waterproofing protection.

Q: What safety precautions should be taken when applying Gripset 38FC?

A: Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information. Ensure adequate ventilation, wear appropriate personal protective equipment, and follow safe handling practices.

Q: Can Gripset 38FC be used on external roofs?

A: Yes, Gripset 38FC is suitable for external roofs and rooftop terraces, provided they are to be covered over with screeds and toppings. It must not be used as a trafficable surface or a finished membrane exposed to UV.

Q: What primers are compatible with Gripset 38FC?

A: Gripset 38FC is compatible with Gripset GP Primer for porous surfaces, Gripset OP Primer for non-porous surfaces, Xpress Primer H2O Plus for damp surfaces, and Gripset E60 for rising damp or high residual moisture.
column54:
Gripset 38FC limitations:

  • Not to be used as a trafficable surface: Gripset 38FC is designed to be covered with toppings or tiles.
  • Not to be used as a finished membrane exposed to UV: Must be covered to prevent degradation.
  • Do not apply when rain is imminent: Ensure dry conditions for proper curing.
  • Do not apply below 5°C or above 30°C: Temperature extremes affect curing and adhesion.
  • Not for areas with rising damp or negative hydrostatic pressure: Use Gripset E60 for rising damp.
  • All finish coatings must be water-based and solvent-free: Prevents damage to the membrane.

Safety precautions when using Gripset 38FC:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and appropriate clothing.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Follow safe handling practices as outlined in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS).
  • Clean Up: Clean tools with water while the membrane is wet; dried product must be removed mechanically.
column55: Gripset 38FC is a next-generation, fast-curing waterproofing membrane designed for commercial and residential applications. Its fibre-reinforced composition enhances tensile strength, ensuring durability in wet areas such as bathrooms, balconies, and rooftops. With a rapid recoat time of 1 hour and the ability to be tiled over in just 4 hours, Gripset 38FC is ideal for projects requiring a quick turnaround. This solvent-free, elastomeric membrane withstands continuous water exposure and is compliant with AS 4858 and AS 4654.1 standards.
column56:
Gripset 38FC can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete, render, and masonry: Ensure surfaces are clean and properly prepared.
  • Compressed fibre cement sheeting and plasterboard: Prime correctly to ensure proper adhesion.
  • Wet area timber sheeting and external grade plywood: Use appropriate primers for timber substrates.
  • Aerated concrete panels and blocks: Prime to reduce porosity and ensure a good bond.
column57:
Use Gripset 38FC for:

  • Internal wet areas: Bathrooms, laundries, and tiled areas.
  • External wet areas: Balconies, decks, podiums, and terrace floors.
  • Roofs and rooftop terraces: To be covered with screeds and toppings.
  • Sandwiching: Between existing and new concrete substrates.
  • Liquid vapour barrier: Between toppings and slabs.
  • General tiled areas: To prevent moisture ingress.

Why Use Gripset 38FC:

  • Fast curing: Allows for tiling in 4 hours, speeding up project timelines.
  • Fibre reinforced: Enhances strength and workability, ensuring a robust barrier.
  • Waterproof and durable: Withstands wet conditions and ponding without re-emulsifying.
  • Flexible and elastomeric: Accommodates substrate movement, preventing cracks.
  • Excellent vapour barrier: Protects structures from moisture damage.

column2: Gripset BRW PF Tape Multipurpose Self-adhesive Tape
column3:
Use Gripset BRW PF Tape for: Waterproofing, flashing, sealing penetrations, detailing plumbing and roofing applications.

Gripset BRW PF Tape is a high-performance, multi-purpose self-adhesive sealing band designed for flashing, waterproofing, and general building applications. Featuring a butyl rubber backing, it offers outstanding adhesion to various surfaces, providing an instant, flexible moisture barrier. Ideal for sealing transitions, joints, penetrations, and structural details, this tape eliminates drying time, making it a fast and efficient solution for professionals.

Key Features of Gripset BRW PF Tape

  • Self-adhesive butyl rubber backing for instant sealing
  • Peel-and-stick application for easy use
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete, metal, timber, plastics, and masonry
  • Flexible and highly durable
  • Compatible with Gripset membranes, coatings, and adhesives
  • Solvent-free and non-toxic
  • Resistant to rupture, tearing, and moisture ingress

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Butyl rubber, solvent-free
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Scissors, utility knife, small vinyl roller
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are dry and dust-free before application for best adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If applying over damp surfaces, use Gripset E60 primer.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life: 12 months from the date of purchase.
  • Temperature Considerations: Not affected by frost or cold floors.

Certifications

  • Complies with Australian building and waterproofing standards

column32: Gripset BRW PF Tape | Multi-Purpose Butyl Rubber Sealing Tape | Adheseal
column33: Gripset BRW PF Tape is a self-adhesive, flexible sealing band for waterproofing, roofing, and detailing applications. Provides instant sealing & outstanding adhesion.
column52:
How to Apply Gripset BRW PF Tape:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free of dust or grease.
  2. Measure and cut the required tape length.
  3. Peel off the release paper and apply firmly to the surface.
  4. Use a small roller or spatula to remove air pockets and secure adhesion.
  5. Apply Gripset membranes or coatings over the tape as required.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset BRW PF Tape

Q: What is Gripset BRW PF Tape used for?

A: Gripset BRW PF Tape is a self-adhesive sealing band designed for waterproofing, roofing, and general building applications, providing an instant seal to protect against moisture ingress, vibration, and flexing.

Q: Does Gripset BRW PF Tape require priming before application?

A: No primer is required for non-porous surfaces such as metals and PVC. However, highly porous or dusty surfaces should be primed with Gripset GP, E60, or Xpress H2O Primer Plus.

Q: Can Gripset BRW PF Tape be exposed to direct UV or used as a flashing?

A: No, it must be covered with a suitable finish, as it is not designed for prolonged UV exposure.

Q: What surfaces can Gripset BRW PF Tape adhere to?

A: It bonds to primed concrete, galvanized iron, zincalume, copper, aluminum, Colorbond, timber, compressed fibre cement sheeting, plasterboard, masonry, ceramics, and plastics.

Q: Can this tape be used in negative hydrostatic applications?

A: No, Gripset BRW PF Tape is not suitable for sealing joints in negative hydrostatic conditions.
column54:
Gripset BRW PF Tape Limitations:

  • Not for use over expansion joints.
  • Not suitable for negative hydrostatic pressure applications.
  • Should not be used in applications requiring solvent-based coatings.

Safety precautions when using Gripset BRW PF Tape:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves when handling to prevent adhesion to skin.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow when working in enclosed spaces.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Any residue should be removed mechanically, as it does not dissolve in water.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and heat sources.
  • Disposal: Dispose of unused tape and packaging according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset BRW PF Tape is a high-performance, self-adhesive sealing band designed for waterproofing, roofing, and general building applications. With a butyl rubber backing, it provides instant adhesion and sealing without the need for drying or curing. Ideal for flashing, detailing over plumbing pipes, sealing puddle flanges, and patching metal surfaces. Its excellent flexibility, thermal stability, and solvent-free composition make it suitable for both internal and external applications. Compatible with Gripset adhesives, membranes, and coatings, this versatile tape is perfect for professionals requiring a reliable moisture barrier solution.
column56:

  • Timber
  • Compressed fibre cement sheeting

  • Sealing around plumbing pipes, PVC, and flashings
  • Guttering and roofing applications

  • Prevents water ingress and enhances structural longevity

column3:
Use Elastoproof Collars for: Sealing around penetrations to prevent water ingress in wet areas, roofs, decks, and more.

Elastoproof Collars are durable, prefabricated flange seals designed to provide a reliable waterproofing solution around penetrations such as pipes, drains, cabling, and fixtures. Made from flexible, high-quality nitrile butadiene rubber (NBR), they ensure a long-lasting seal that withstands movement, vibration, and structural shifts without compromising membrane integrity. Ideal for a range of applications, Elastoproof Collars enhance the durability and performance of waterproofing systems.

Key Features of Elastoproof Collars

  • Creates a permanent, flexible waterproof seal.
  • Designed for use around pipes, drainage outlets, and fixtures.
  • Protects against vibration, movement, and cracking.
  • Compatible with various waterproofing membranes.
  • Ideal for wet areas, balconies, planter boxes, and more.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Nitrile Butadiene Rubber (NBR)
  • Application Temperature Range: Suitable for standard construction environments

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Compatible adhesives, sealants, and application tools.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper substrate preparation before installation.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Use recommended adhesives to enhance bonding strength.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a dry environment away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Long shelf life when stored properly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid exposure to extreme heat.

Certifications

  • Compliant with industry waterproofing standards.

column32: Gripset Elastoproof Collars | Waterproof Flange Seals | Adheseal
column33: Elastoproof Collars provide a permanent, flexible seal around penetrations, ensuring waterproofing integrity in wet areas, roofs, decks, and more.
column52:
How to apply Elastoproof Collars:

  1. Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Apply compatible adhesive or sealant around the penetration.
  3. Firmly position the Elastoproof Collar over the penetration.
  4. Press down to ensure full adhesion.
  5. Allow adequate curing time as per membrane manufacturer’s instructions.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Elastoproof Base Collars

Q: What is Elastoproof Base Collars used for?

A: Elastoproof Base Collars are designed as a waterproof detailing system for sealing penetrations, pipe entries, and other vulnerable areas in waterproofing applications.

Q: What material are Elastoproof Base Collars made from?

A: They are made from cured Nitrile Butadiene Rubber (NBR), which offers high flexibility and durability.

Q: Are Elastoproof Base Collars resistant to chemicals?

A: Yes, they have excellent resistance to strong oxidizing agents and bases but should not be exposed to extreme heat or harsh chemicals.

Q: Can Elastoproof Base Collars be used in submerged applications?

A: Yes, they are suitable for waterproofing applications where continuous water exposure is expected.

Q: How should Elastoproof Base Collars be stored?

A: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme heat to maintain its integrity.
column54:
Elastoproof Collars limitations:

  • Not suitable for use without a compatible waterproofing membrane.
  • Must be applied on a clean, prepared substrate.
  • Exposure to sharp objects may compromise integrity.

Safety precautions when using Elastoproof Base Collars:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Generally not required, but gloves are recommended when handling.
  • Ventilation: No specific ventilation requirements, as the product does not release harmful fumes.
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact if irritation occurs. If contact occurs, wash with soap and water.
  • Clean-up: No special clean-up required. Dispose of waste material according to local environmental regulations.
  • Storage: Store in a dry area at room temperature away from extreme heat and oxidizing agents.
  • Disposal: Dispose of in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. Avoid disposing into waterways.
column55: Elastoproof Collars provide a permanent, flexible seal around penetrations, ensuring waterproofing integrity in wet areas, roofs, decks, and more.
column56:
Elastoproof Collars can be used on the following substrates:

  • Cement sheeting
  • Plasterboard
  • Timber
  • Waterproofing membranes
column57:

  • Wet areas, including bathrooms, laundries, and showers.
  • Balconies, decks, and podiums.

Why Use Elastoproof Collars:

  • Prevents water ingress and structural damage.
  • Enhances waterproofing system durability.
  • Provides long-term elasticity for movement accommodation.
  • Protects against membrane failure due to penetration weaknesses.

column2: Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners Pack of 10
column3:
Use Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners for: Achieving seamless waterproofing at internal (90°) and external (270°) corner intersections in waterproofing applications.

The Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners are designed to provide an effective waterproofing solution for critical 90° and 270° intersections. By maintaining a "flexible zone," these corners ensure a seamless and elastic seal, overcoming the challenges associated with detailing waterproofing membranes at volatile areas. These prefabricated sections offer superior performance compared to traditional multilayered membranes, reinforcement layers, bond breaking tapes, and sealants.

Key Features of Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners

  • Ensures a seamless and elastic seal at joint intersections.
  • Waterproof and acts as a vapour barrier.
  • Allows for 100% elastic recovery when exposed to movement.
  • Provides high tear resistance and long-term durability.
  • Eliminates the need for lapping and bonding at critical corners.
  • Fast and effective application process.
  • Compatible with all Gripset waterproofing membranes.

Technical Overview

  • Corner Types: Internal 90° & External 270°
  • Material: Elastomeric waterproofing fabric
  • Dimensions: 200mm x 200mm with 120mm wall/floor returns
  • Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C application conditions
  • Compatibility: Suitable for Gripset membranes
  • Installation Method: Embedded in wet membrane application

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush or spatula for embedding.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper membrane saturation for adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid air pockets by pressing fabric edges firmly.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Store within manufacturer guidelines for optimal performance.
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not expose to extreme heat or cold.

Certifications

  • Compliant with Australian waterproofing standards.
  • Tested for durability and tear resistance.

column32: Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners | Adheseal
column33: Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners provide seamless, elastic sealing for critical 90° and 270° corner intersections. Waterproof & tear-resistant.
column52:
How to apply Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners:

  1. Apply a liberal coat of Gripset membrane onto the surface.
  2. Embed the prefabricated corner into the wet membrane.
  3. Ensure all fabric edges are fully adhered with no air pockets.
  4. Overlap joint bands by at least 40mm for seamless coverage.
  5. Remove excess membrane from the surface for a clean finish.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset Elastoproof Corners

Q: What are Gripset Elastoproof Corners used for?

A: Gripset Elastoproof Corners are prefabricated corner sections designed to ensure a seamless and flexible waterproof seal at critical 90º and 270º corner intersections.

Q: What are the benefits of using Elastoproof Corners?

A: They provide a waterproof and vapor barrier, offer 100% elastic recovery in movement zones, eliminate the need for multi-layering at corners, and are compatible with all Gripset membranes.

Q: How are Elastoproof Corners installed?

A: They are embedded into a wet coat of Gripset membrane using a spatula or brush to ensure full adhesion, removing any air pockets or creases before additional layers are applied.

Q: Can Elastoproof Corners be used with all waterproofing membranes?

A: Yes, they are compatible with all Gripset waterproofing membranes.

Q: Are Elastoproof Corners resistant to movement and cracking?

A: Yes, they provide high strength, excellent tear resistance, and long-term sealing protection for volatile areas.
column54:
Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners limitations:

  • Not compatible with solvent-based adhesives or coatings.
  • Should not be applied in temperatures below 5°C or above 30°C.

Safety precautions when using Gripset Elastoproof Prefabricated Corners:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses.
  • Ventilation: Ensure a well-ventilated work area.
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact with wet membranes.

Safety precautions when using Gripset Elastoproof Corners:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves are recommended during installation.
  • Ventilation: No special ventilation requirements as it does not emit harmful fumes.
  • Handling: Ensure the product is installed into a wet membrane for proper adhesion.
  • Clean-up: Remove excess membrane from the surface of the corner after embedding.
  • Storage: Store in a dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures.
  • Disposal: Dispose of packaging and unused material according to local environmental regulations.

column2: Elastoproof Prefabricated Internal Corner - CN90 - Pack of 10
column3:
Elastoproof Prefabricated Corner Sections are designed to simplify and enhance the waterproofing capabilities of Elastoproof Jointing Band applications at crucial 90° and 270° corner intersections. These prefabricated corners create a seamless, flexible zone, ensuring a watertight and elastic seal even when exposed to movement and vibration.

Key Features

  • Creates a seamless elastic seal at joint intersections
  • Waterproof and acts as a vapour barrier
  • Fast and efficient installation
  • 100% elastic recovery when exposed to movement
  • High strength and excellent tear resistance
  • Provides long-term sealing protection in vulnerable areas
  • Eliminates the need for lapping and bonding of fabrics at corners
  • Compatible with all Gripset membranes

Uses

  • Detailing 90° and 270° corners in waterproofing applications
  • Creating watertight seals around windows, doors, and other penetrations
  • Protecting joints in balconies, terraces, and other exposed areas
  • Enhancing the durability of waterproofing systems
  • Commercial, industrial and residential applications

Benefits

  • Simplifies the waterproofing process, saving time and labour
  • Provides a superior alternative to traditional corner detailing methods
  • Ensures long-lasting protection against water and vapour ingress
  • Improves the overall integrity and performance of waterproofing systems
  • Reduces the risk of leaks and water damage

Application Guide

  1. Apply a generous coat of Gripset membrane to the surface, covering the entire rear corner profile.
  2. Embed the corner profile into the wet membrane, ensuring all fabric edges are fully saturated.
  3. Smooth out any creases or air pockets behind the fabric edges using a flat spatula or brush.
  4. Remove excess membrane from the top surface of the corner.
  5. Overlap and adhere Elastoproof Jointing Bands onto the prefabricated corner sections with a minimum overlap of 40mm using the selected Gripset membrane.

Limitations

  • Not compatible with solvent-based materials (adhesives, sealants, coatings)
  • Do not apply when the surface temperature is below 5°C or above 30°C

Packaging

  • Internal 90° corners: 200mm x 200mm with 120mm wall/floor returns
  • External 270° corners: 200mm x 200mm with 120mm wall/floor returns
  • 3D Corners: 200mm x 200mm x 120mm high, with 150mm wall/floor return

Precautions

It is recommended to test the adhesion of all products (primers, membranes, coatings, adhesives, etc.) on a typical area of the prepared surface before full application to ensure satisfactory adhesion. For large commercial areas or unusual substrates, Gripset Industries offers a pre-testing service. Consult Gripset Technical Services for further information.

The information provided in this datasheet is general in nature. For any specific situations or queries, consult Gripset Technical Services before application for written confirmation.

Additional Information

Elastoproof products should be installed according to manufacturer guidelines using recommended Elastoproof or Gripset membranes/adhesives. No warranty is offered when these products are not installed to specification.

column3:
Use Gripset BRW PF Squares for: Sealing internal and external joint intersections, penetrations, puddle flanges, and reinforcement applications in waterproofing and construction.

GRIPSET BRW PF SQUARES are high-performance, multi-purpose self-adhesive sealing squares designed for superior moisture protection in waterproofing, roofing, and general construction. The butyl rubber backing ensures excellent adhesion, instant sealing, and no drying time, making it perfect for time-sensitive applications. With compatibility across various surfaces—including metal, timber, masonry, and plastics—it offers a versatile solution for sealing penetrations, joint intersections, and reinforcement bond breakers. Designed to be finished with Gripset adhesives, membranes, coatings, and tile adhesives.

Key Features of GRIPSET BRW PF SQUARES

  • Peel-and-stick application for quick and easy installation
  • Primer-less adhesion on dust-free, stable surfaces
  • Instant sealing properties with no drying or curing required
  • Outstanding adhesion on various substrates, including metals, timber, and masonry
  • Flexible, rupture-resistant, and thermally stable
  • Compatible with Gripset liquid membranes and cement-based finishes
  • Solvent-free, non-toxic, and environmentally safe

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Butyl rubber adhesive with fabric face
  • Application Temperature Range: 0°C to 45°C
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 100°C
  • Elongation at Break: 70% (longitudinal & transverse)
  • Tensile Strength: >100N (longitudinal & transverse)
  • Peel Adhesion: >80N

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Spatula, sponge, or cloth for application
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of contaminants before application
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If adhesion is weak on porous surfaces, use a Gripset primer

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store at room temperature in a dry, internal location
  • Shelf Life: Best used within 12 months of purchase
  • Temperature Considerations: Not affected by frost or cold floors

Certifications

  • Meets Australian waterproofing and building standards

column33: Self-adhesive Elastoproof Butyl Waterproofing Squares for instant, reliable sealing of joints, penetrations, and more. Versatile and compatible with Gripset products.
column52:
How to apply GRIPSET BRW PF SQUARES:

  1. Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Remove the release paper from the butyl rubber backing.
  3. Position the square in place, ensuring full contact with the surface.
  4. Press firmly with a spatula or sponge to eliminate air pockets.
  5. Cut an aperture in the centre when using over plumbing penetrations.
  6. Finish with appropriate adhesives, membranes, or coatings.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gripset BRW PF Squares

Q: What are Gripset BRW PF Squares used for?

A: Gripset BRW PF Squares are self-adhesive sealing squares designed to protect against moisture ingress, vibration, and flexing in waterproofing, roofing, and general building applications.

Q: Do Gripset BRW PF Squares require a primer before application?

A: No primer is required for non-porous surfaces, but highly porous or dusty surfaces should be primed with Gripset GP, E60, or Xpress H2O Primer Plus.

Q: Can Gripset BRW PF Squares be used for sealing plumbing and penetrations?

A: Yes, they are ideal for sealing puddle flanges, pipe penetrations, and joint intersections.

Q: Are Gripset BRW PF Squares resistant to temperature changes?

A: Yes, they offer excellent adhesion retention at low temperatures and can withstand service temperatures from -40°C to 100°C.

Q: Can they be used as an exposed joint seal?

A: No, they must be covered with a surface finish, as they are not designed for direct exposure.
column54:
GRIPSET BRW PF SQUARES Limitations:

  • Not suitable for expansion joints
  • Not to be used as an exposed trafficable surface
  • Should not be applied when surface temperature is below 5°C or above 30°C

Safety precautions when using Gripset BRW PF Squares:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves are recommended for handling to prevent adhesion to skin.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow when applying in enclosed areas.
  • Handling: Avoid contact with eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water.
  • Clean-up: Any residue should be removed mechanically, as it does not dissolve in water.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and heat sources.
  • Disposal: Dispose of unused material and packaging according to local environmental regulations.
column55: Gripset BRW PF Squares are self-adhesive sealing squares for waterproofing, roofing, and general building applications. Instant seal with no drying.

  • Timber

  • Plasterboard, masonry, glazed surfaces

  • Patching pinholes and pitted areas on metal surfaces

Benefits

  • Versatile for various applications

  • Easy to install and handle

column2: Gripset Elastoproof B10 / B50 Joint Band System
column3:
Use Elastoproof B50 for: Waterproofing and sealing movement joints, junctions, and corner intersections, ensuring a seamless, durable seal.

The Elastoproof B50 Joint Band System is a professional-grade waterproofing solution designed for sealing all types of joints, including movement joints, wall-floor junctions, and control joints. Engineered with a unique high-strength rubber compound, it provides exceptional flexibility, rupture resistance, and up to 100% elastic recovery. The system includes prefabricated corners for a seamless finish, eliminating the need for traditional bond-breaking sealants and tapes. Ideal for both internal and external applications, it conforms to AS 3740 & AS4654.2.

Key Features of Elastoproof B50

  • Conforms to Australian standards AS 3740 & AS4654.2
  • 100% elastic recovery for superior movement accommodation
  • Prefabricated corners for quick and seamless installation
  • Compatible with Gripset Class I, II, and III membranes
  • Resistant to water, chemicals, and rupture
  • Simplifies installation by eliminating traditional sealant bond breakers
  • Ideal for submerged applications

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: NBR (Nitrile Butadiene Rubber) with polyester fleece
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C (41°F to 86°F)
  • Temperature Resistance: -20°C to 90°C (-4°F to 194°F)
  • Water Pressure Resistance: 3 bar
  • Shore A Hardness: 65
  • Rupture Strain: 208% (lateral), 48% (longitudinal)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, utility knife, measuring tape
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper embedding in wet membrane to achieve full adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If adhesion fails, reapply membrane and ensure surface is clean and dry

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store at room temperature, away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: Best used within 12 months from purchase
  • Temperature Considerations: Not affected by frost or cold floors

Certifications

  • Complies with AS 3740 (Waterproofing of domestic wet areas)
  • Meets AS4654.2 (Waterproofing membranes for external applications)

Q: What surfaces can Elastoproof B50 be applied to?

A: Suitable for concrete, masonry, tiles, and other structurally sound surfaces.

column3:
Use Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer for: Long-lasting waterproofing of porous substrates like bricks, concrete, and pavers without altering appearance

Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer is a high-performance, siloxane-based waterproofing solution designed for deep penetration into porous surfaces such as concrete, face brick, render, sandstone, and terracotta. It forms an invisible barrier beneath the surface to block water ingress while allowing the substrate to breathe. Ideal for Australian conditions, it resists high pH environments like fresh concrete, protects against efflorescence, mould, and salt attack, and helps extend the service life of masonry surfaces. Easy to apply and fast drying, Duram S900 is a trusted choice for trades needing durable, non-glossy waterproofing performance.

Key Features of Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer

  • Creates an invisible weatherproof barrier for porous materials
  • Does not alter the surface appearance or texture
  • Allows vapour diffusion for breathability
  • Resistant to salt, rain, and UV exposure
  • Suitable for new and existing surfaces with high pH

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Siloxane, high pH compatible, clear solvent solution
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C (41°F to 86°F)
  • Service Temperature: 0°C to 50°C (32°F to 122°F)
  • Drying Time: Touch dry in 2–4 hrs, full cure in 12–24 hrs
  • Coverage Rate: 2–6m²/L depending on surface porosity

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, low-pressure spray, or pour application
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply multiple wet-on-wet coats for best absorption and effectiveness
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Test on highly porous or friable surfaces before full application; cracks must be pre-repaired

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep in a dry, cool, upright position in sealed original container
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from production in unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C to 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • Manufactured to meet Australian building and safety compliance
  • Formulated for high-pH environments like fresh concrete
  • Meets VOC and flammability regulations for Class 3 Dangerous Goods
column7: block work,brick,ceramics,civil construction-i,concrete-s,construction,external,fibre cement sheet,flooring-i,internal,masonry,pail,porous,render,sealer,solvent based,stone,uv stable,waterproofing-a
column32: Duram S900 Clear Sealer for Porous Surfaces | Adheseal
column33: Deep-penetrating clear sealer for weatherproofing porous surfaces, ideal for concrete, bricks, and pavers.
column52:
How to apply Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer:

  1. Ensure surface is dry, clean, stable and free from previous coatings
  2. Apply Duram S900 using a brush, roller, low-pressure spray or pour-on method
  3. Saturate the surface thoroughly and allow absorption
  4. Apply additional coats wet-on-wet for best results
  5. Allow 12–24 hours to fully cure before exposure to water
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer

Q: How do I apply Duram S900 correctly?

A: Duram S900 can be applied using a brush, roller, spray, or poured directly. Ensure the substrate is well saturated and apply multiple wet-on-wet coats for best penetration.

Q: How long does Duram S900 take to cure?

A: It becomes touch dry within 2–4 hours and achieves full cure within 12–24 hours, depending on surface porosity, temperature, and humidity levels.

Q: Is Duram S900 compatible with sealed or painted surfaces?

A: No, Duram S900 must only be applied to uncoated, porous surfaces. Remove any paints or sealers prior to application to ensure proper absorption and effectiveness.

Q: What if the surface is too porous or friable?

A: Extremely porous or sandy substrates may not allow adequate build-up for waterproofing. Test a small area first and consider pre-treatment or consolidation if needed.

Q: What safety measures should I take when using this product?

A: Use solvent-resistant gloves, goggles, and a respirator. Ensure proper ventilation. Product is flammable and should be kept away from ignition sources.
column54:
Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer limitations:

  • Will not bridge or seal cracks – cracks must be repaired beforehand
  • Requires adequate absorption into surface – test areas are recommended
  • Not effective on sealed, painted or non-porous substrates

Safety precautions when using Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Solvent-resistant gloves, eye protection, and respirator
  • Ventilation: Ensure open air or mechanical ventilation during use
  • Handling: Keep away from flames and ignition sources; flammable liquid
  • Disposal: Follow local hazardous waste regulations for disposal
column55: Duram S900 is a clear, high pH siloxane sealer providing weatherproofing without altering surface appearance.
column56:
Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete – ensure it is clean and dry before application
  • Face Brick – test for efflorescence before sealing
  • Cement Render – must be stable and free from dust
  • Block Work – suitable for exterior exposed areas
  • Sandstone – compatible with natural porous stone
  • Terracotta and Porous Pavers – allows breathability and protection
column57:
Use Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer for:

  • Weatherproofing new concrete or render in construction projects
  • Preventing efflorescence and moisture damage in brickwork
  • Sealing sandstone in landscaping applications
  • Protecting terracotta pavers in outdoor patios

Why Use Duram S900 Clear Penetrative Sealer:

  • Maintains the natural look of surfaces while sealing against water
  • Reduces long-term maintenance and deterioration
  • Quick-drying and easy to apply on-site
  • Protects against mould, corrosion, and salt damage

column3:
Use E P Waterproof Supreme for: Preventing water damage, surface degradation, and staining on masonry surfaces

E P Waterproof Supreme is a penetrating waterproofing solution for concrete and masonry surfaces. Utilising advanced urethane and polyester polymer technology, it chemically reacts within substrates to create a dense, waterproof structure. Unlike surface coatings, it prevents internal moisture damage, efflorescence, and structural decay. Ideal for residential, commercial, and industrial applications, it ensures long-term durability with a single application.

Key Features of E P Waterproof Supreme

  • One-coat application for efficient sealing
  • Penetrates substrates — not a surface coating
  • Prevents fretting mortar and surface crumbling
  • Non-toxic, non-flammable, and environmentally safe
  • Enhances paint adhesion and longevity
  • Suitable for use indoors and outdoors

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Urethane and Polyester Polymer blend
  • Application Temperature Range: 8°C to 38°C (46°F to 100°F)
  • Coverage Rate: 4–6 m² per litre
  • Specific Gravity: 1.34 @ 20°C
  • pH: 6.0
  • Boiling Point: 100°C (212°F)
  • Freezing Point: 0°C (32°F)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Low-pressure sprayer (e.g., backpack sprayer)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply when surface is clean and dry for optimal penetration
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid use on previously coated surfaces; ensure material is absorbed for effectiveness

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in closed containers, out of direct sunlight, at 5°C to 38°C
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months from manufacture date
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not apply below 8°C or when rain is imminent

Certifications

  • Complies with Australian environmental safety standards
  • Tested for non-toxicity and indoor air quality

column32: EP Waterproof Supreme | Masonry Sealer Concrete Waterproofing | Adheseal
column33: Advanced penetrating waterproofing for masonry and concrete. Non-toxic, durable, and easy to apply.
column52:
How to apply E P Waterproof Supreme:

  1. Ensure surface is clean, dry, and free from coatings or contaminants
  2. Apply with low-pressure sprayer at no more than 20 psi
  3. Use approximately 1 litre per 4–6 m² of surface area
  4. Allow to dry completely before use or applying paint
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About E P Waterproof Supreme

Q: How should I apply E P Waterproof Supreme?

A: Use a low-pressure sprayer (max 20 psi). Spray uniformly over the surface, allowing 1 litre per 4–6 m². Let dry completely before allowing traffic or applying paint.

Q: How long does the waterproofing last?

A: With proper application, it provides permanent waterproofing. It bonds chemically within the substrate, ensuring long-term protection without reapplication.

Q: Can it be used on previously painted surfaces?

A: No. It must be applied to clean, uncoated masonry or concrete. Surfaces with silicone, siloxene, or solvent coatings should not be treated.

Q: What should I do if the surface does not absorb the product?

A: Discontinue use if the product isn’t absorbing. This indicates prior coatings or unsuitable substrate. Contact the supplier for advice on such surfaces.

Q: Is it safe for indoor use?

A: Yes, it’s non-toxic and non-flammable, making it safe for use indoors on floors, walls, and basements with adequate ventilation.
column54:

  • Not suitable for coated or sealed surfaces
  • Do not apply below 8°C or when rain is expected

Safety precautions when using E P Waterproof Supreme:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, goggles, and protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Ensure airflow in enclosed areas during and after application
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; wash after use
  • Store in sealed containers away from direct sunlight

column3:
Use E P Waterproofing System for: Long-term waterproofing, hardening, and preservation of concrete and masonry surfaces, indoors or outdoors

E P Waterproofing System is an advanced polyester polymer-based solution designed to permanently waterproof, harden, and preserve concrete, brick, plaster, and all masonry structures. Unlike surface coatings, this product penetrates deep into the substrate, initiating a chemical reaction that solidifies internal components, neutralises free lime and alkali, and enhances tensile strength. Ideal for use across industrial, commercial, and residential projects, it is non-toxic, non-flammable, and eco-friendly, providing unmatched durability and protection. Available in 5L and 20L containers, E P Waterproofing System™ ensures long-lasting results even in harsh Australian conditions.

column33: Permanently waterproofs concrete and masonry from within. Non-toxic, eco-safe solution for trade use. Trusted by professionals Australia-wide.
column52:
How to apply E P Waterproofing System™:

  1. Ensure surface is clean and dry. Rinse with water to remove dust and allow to dry.
  2. Apply using low-pressure sprayer at 20 psi, ensuring full saturation (1L per 5–7 m²).
  3. Allow product to cure for 12–24 hours; foot traffic can resume after drying.
  4. For painting, allow full cure (4–5 days). Ensure surface is dry for best adhesion.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About E P Waterproofing System™

Q: How do I apply E P Waterproofing System™?

A: Use a low-pressure sprayer (around 20 psi), applying approximately 1 litre per 5–7 m². Ensure the surface is clean and dry before application and allow sufficient time for curing.

Q: How does E P Waterproofing System™ work?

A: It penetrates masonry and initiates a chemical reaction that solidifies internal structures, waterproofs from within, and neutralises lime and alkali for enhanced durability.

Q: Is it compatible with all masonry materials?

A: Yes, it works on concrete, brick, plaster, mortar, and natural stone. However, it should not be applied over previous silicone or solvent-based coatings.

Q: What should I do if the surface doesn't absorb E P Waterproofing System™?

A: If absorption does not occur, do not apply. This could indicate prior treatment with incompatible coatings. Consider using EP Concrete Block Sealer for large porous areas.

Q: Is special safety equipment required during application?

A: No special PPE is needed. The product is non-toxic, non-flammable, and odourless. Standard safety precautions like eye protection are recommended.
column54:
E P Waterproofing System™ limitations:

  • Do not apply to surfaces previously treated with silicone or solvent-based coatings
  • Not suitable for filling holes or significant cracks – use EP Concrete Block Sealer
  • Requires ambient temperature above 10°C during application and curing

Safety precautions when using E P Waterproofing System™:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Safety glasses, gloves recommended
  • Ventilation: Adequate ventilation for enclosed spaces, although product is odourless
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; rinse thoroughly if contact occurs
  • Store out of direct sunlight and away from freezing conditions

column2: Autoshield GB Primer Auto Glass Primer
column3:
Use Autoshield GP Primer for: Enhancing adhesion of polyurethane adhesives to auto glass, ceramic-coated glass, plastics, and metals.

Autoshield GP Primer is a high-performance, solvent-based black primer designed to improve the adhesion of polyurethane adhesives on a wide range of substrates, particularly in automotive glass applications. This primer reacts with moisture to form a thin, durable layer that acts as a crucial link between the substrate and the adhesive, ensuring a strong and lasting bond. Its formulation is specifically tailored for use with Adheseal’s NP60 primerless polyurethane adhesive, providing excellent adhesion without the need for additional activation steps on many surfaces. The inclusion of UV detectable properties allows for easy in-process quality control, ensuring comprehensive coverage and consistent application.

Key Features of Autoshield GP Primer

  • Enhanced Adhesion: Improves bond strength on a variety of substrates, including float glass, ceramic-coated glass, plastics, pre-coatings, painted surfaces, Ecoats, and metals.
  • UV Detectable: Fluoresces under long-wave UV light, allowing for easy in-process quality control and ensuring complete coverage.
  • Easy to Use: Simple application with a brush, felt, or foam applicator, making it accessible for professional users.
  • Moisture Reactive: Forms a strong bond by reacting with moisture, creating a durable link between substrates and adhesives.
  • Solvent-Based: Provides excellent wetting and penetration on various surfaces, ensuring optimal adhesion.

Technical Overview

Autoshield GP Primer is formulated to provide a reliable and durable bond in automotive glass applications. Its solvent-based polyurethane solution ensures excellent wetting and penetration on various surfaces, creating a strong foundation for adhesive application. The primer's ability to react with moisture forms a thin, robust layer that enhances the adhesive’s performance, particularly in challenging environmental conditions.

Chemical Properties: Solvent-based polyurethane solution that reacts with moisture to form a bonding layer.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F). Ideal application and surface temperature are between 15°C and 25°C (59°F and 77°F). Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants before application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, felt, or foam applicator, UV light source (320-420 nm), cleaning solvents.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Shake the primer can thoroughly before use. Apply a thin, even coat. Reseal the container immediately after use to maintain product quality. Use UV light to verify coverage.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Gelling or increased viscosity indicates the primer should be discarded. Ensure proper resealing to prevent moisture contamination. For transparent substrates, ensure adequate UV protection.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a sealed container in an upright position in a dry place at ≤ 25°C (77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 1000 ml containers: 9 months; smaller packaging: 12 months. Dispose of 100 ml packs after two weeks of opening.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures. Ensure proper resealing to prevent moisture contamination.

Certifications

  • Complies with WorkSafe Australia standards (non-hazardous classification).
column7: adhesion promoter,auto glass-i,bottle,ceramics,glass,metal,painted surfaces,primer,solvent based,surface preparation,uv stable,windscreen installation
column32: Autoshield GP Primer | Auto Glass Primer | Adheseal
column33: Autoshield GP Primer: Solvent-based primer for auto glass bonding. Enhances adhesion, UV detectable. Ideal for use with Autoshield NP60.
column52:
How to apply Autoshield GP Primer:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from grease, oil, dust, and contaminants.
  2. Shaking: Shake the Adheseal GP Primer can thoroughly until the mixing ball rattles freely, then continue shaking for another minute.
  3. Application: Apply a thin, covering coat with a brush, felt, or foam applicator.
  4. Temperature: Ideal application and surface temperature are between 15°C and 25°C (59°F and 77°F).
  5. Single Application: Apply only once, ensuring adequate coverage.
  6. Resealing: Tightly reseal the container immediately after each use.
  7. UV Inspection: Use a light source with a wavelength of 320 to 420 nm to verify coverage.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Autoshield GP Primer

Q: How do I prepare the surface before applying Autoshield GP Primer?

A: Surfaces must be clean, dry, and free from grease, oil, dust, and contaminants. Pre-treatment processes like scuffing, cleaning, and activating may improve adhesion.

Q: How do I know if I've applied enough Autoshield GP Primer?

A: Autoshield GP Primer fluoresces under long-wave UV light (320-420 nm), allowing you to visually inspect the coverage. Ensure a thin, even coat is applied.

Q: Can I use Autoshield GP Primer on plastics?

A: Yes, Autoshield GP Primer is suitable for use on plastics. However, always perform tests on original substrates to ensure compatibility and prevent stress cracking.

Q: What should I do if the primer starts to gel or thicken?

A: If gelling, separation, or a significant increase in viscosity is noted, discard the primer immediately. Do not dilute or mix it with other substances.

Q: How long can I keep an opened container of Autoshield GP Primer?

A: Dispose of the product one month after opening if used frequently, or after two months if used infrequently. 100 ml packs should be disposed of after two weeks.

Q: What temperature range is ideal for applying Autoshield GP Primer?

A: The ideal application and surface temperature are between 15°C and 25°C (59°F and 77°F). However, the primer can be used between 5°C and 40°C (41°F and 104°F).

Q: Is Autoshield GP Primer compatible with all polyurethane adhesives?

A: Autoshield GP Primer is specifically formulated for use with Adheseal’s Autoshield NP60 primerless polyurethane adhesive. Compatibility with other adhesives should be tested.
column54:
Autoshield GP Primer limitations:

  • If used below 5°C (41°F), further testing under expected conditions is mandatory.
  • Dispose of the product one month after opening if used frequently, or after two months if used infrequently. 100 ml packs should be disposed of after two weeks.
  • If gelling, separation, or a significant increase in viscosity is noted, discard the primer immediately.
  • Never dilute or mix this product with any other substances.
  • If used on transparent or translucent substrates, ensure adequate UV protection.

Safety precautions when using Autoshield GP Primer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses. A respirator may be needed in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Wash hands thoroughly after use. Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Storage: Store in a sealed container in an upright position in a dry place at ≤ 25°C (77°F).
  • Flammability: Keep away from heat/sparks/open flames/hot surfaces. No smoking.

column3:
Husky Acribond Acrylic Foam Tape is a high-performance double-sided tape engineered for demanding bonding and mounting applications. This versatile tape boasts a powerful acrylic adhesive that forms a strong, permanent bond on various surfaces, including metals, plastics, and composites. Its unique foam core conforms to irregular surfaces, distributes stress evenly, and absorbs vibrations, making it a reliable alternative to mechanical fasteners.

Key Features

  • Exceptional bond strength for long-lasting adhesion
  • Conformable foam core for bonding uneven surfaces
  • Excellent resistance to UV, solvents, and weathering
  • Available in various thicknesses and colours (including grey)
  • Suitable for indoor and outdoor use
  • Replaces rivets, screws, spot welds, and liquid adhesives
  • Eliminates the need for drilling and surface finishing

Uses

  • Automotive assembly (body side mouldings, emblems, trims)
  • Construction and building facades (panels, trims)
  • Sign and display fabrication (mounting, bonding)
  • General industrial applications (appliance assembly, electronics)
  • DIY projects and repairs
  • Bonding dissimilar materials with different thermal expansion rates

Benefits

  • Replaces mechanical fasteners (rivets, screws, welds) for a cleaner finish
  • Provides a strong, durable bond that withstands harsh conditions
  • Dampens vibrations and noise
  • Distributes stress evenly to prevent bond failure
  • Improves aesthetics with invisible bonding
  • Saves time and labour costs during assembly
  • Versatile and suitable for a wide range of applications

Additional Information

Property Value
Adhesive Type Acrylic
Carrier Material Foam
Available Colours Grey, Clear
Thickness Options Varies (consult product specifications)

Use Hob Polyurethane 1200mm x 75mm x 50mm for: Creating durable, easy-to-install shower hobs that streamline waterproofing, tiling, and finishing in wet area construction.

The Hob Polyurethane 1200mm x 75mm x 50mm is a lightweight, pre-formed solution for shower hob construction. Designed for rapid installation, it significantly reduces transport and handling challenges compared to traditional Hebel hobs. This polyurethane hob cuts easily with standard tools, allowing flexibility in layout and application. Perfect for waterproofing preparation, tiling, and finishing, it provides a clean, solid edge to ensure a professional result every time. Ideal for wet areas, it offers consistent performance and dimensional stability under typical Australian site conditions.

Key Features of Hob Polyurethane 1200mm x 75mm x 50mm

  • Lightweight and easy to transport, reducing on-site fatigue
  • Easily cut with standard handsaws or power tools for custom fits
  • Compatible with waterproof membranes and tiling systems
  • Dimensionally stable and resistant to water damage

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: High-density polyurethane foam
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)

column52:
How to apply Hob Polyurethane 1200mm x 75mm x 50mm:

  1. Clean and level the subfloor surface where the hob will sit
  2. Measure and cut the hob to required length using a saw
  3. Secure in place with polyurethane construction adhesive
  4. Allow adhesive to cure before applying waterproof membrane
  5. Tile and grout as normal once waterproofing is complete
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Hob Polyurethane 1200mm x 75mm x 50mm

Q: How do I cut the polyurethane hob?

A: Use a fine-toothed handsaw or a power saw with a clean blade for precise cuts. Always mark your measurements clearly before cutting to ensure accuracy on site.

Q: Will this hob support tiling and grout properly?

A: Yes, the hob is designed for full tiling systems and provides a stable base once waterproofed, allowing tiles and grout to adhere securely without movement.

Q: Is it compatible with liquid or sheet waterproof membranes?

A: Absolutely. This hob works well with both liquid-applied and sheet membrane systems. Ensure the surface is clean and dry before applying the membrane.

Q: What if the subfloor is uneven?

A: Level the area using tile screed or base leveller prior to installation. Shimming may be used for minor adjustments to ensure even contact along the full length.

Q: How do I dispose of offcuts or damaged sections?

A: Offcuts can be disposed of with general construction waste. Avoid burning the material, and always follow local disposal guidelines.

  • Ventilation: Work in well-ventilated area when cutting with power tools
  • Handling: Avoid rough handling to prevent breakage or warping

Use 100mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste for: Effective drainage in large wet areas with high water flow, requiring secure waterproofing and a low-profile design.

The 100mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste is a robust solution for high-volume drainage in commercial and residential wet areas. Featuring a 100mm outlet, solid brass grate, and durable ABS Megaflex™ flange, this floor waste ensures effective water management and secure waterproofing. Designed for low-profile installations, it is ideal for bathrooms, commercial kitchens, and laundry rooms. The chrome finish offers both aesthetic appeal and corrosion resistance, making it a preferred choice for Australian trade professionals.

Key Features of 100mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste

  • 100mm outlet enables high-capacity drainage in large wet areas
  • Solid brass grate provides superior durability and corrosion resistance
  • ABS Megaflex™ flange ensures secure bonding with waterproofing membranes
  • Low-profile design simplifies installation in tight or flush-mounted areas

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Brass (grate), ABS Plastic (flange)
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 60°C (41°F to 140°F)
  • Finish: Chrome plated
  • Outlet Size: 100mm
  • Installation Type: Stick down, low-profile

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Plumbing tools, sealant gun, waterproofing tools
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a primer with ABS flange for maximum membrane adhesion and seal integrity
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure alignment with pipe fittings for optimal flow; recheck seal around flange to avoid leaks

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Keep in a dry area away from UV exposure
  • Shelf Life Information: Unlimited under proper storage conditions
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • Conforms to Australian Plumbing and Drainage Standards

  1. Prepare and clean the substrate surface thoroughly
  2. Apply waterproofing membrane and bonding agent as needed
  3. Press ABS Megaflex™ flange firmly into position
  4. Connect 100mm outlet to drainage pipe using correct fitting
  5. Install brass grate and ensure proper sealing at edges
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 100mm Square Megaflex™ Stick Down Floor Waste

Q: How do I install the 100mm outlet floor waste?

A: Apply waterproofing membrane, bond the ABS Megaflex™ flange to the substrate, and connect the 100mm outlet to plumbing fittings. Ensure proper alignment and sealing.

Q: Is the brass grate rust-proof?

A: Yes, the solid brass grate is corrosion resistant and suited for high-moisture environments, offering long-term durability.

Q: Can I use this floor waste with tiled surfaces?

A: Absolutely. It is compatible with tiled, vinyl, and screeded surfaces. Proper sealing ensures optimal waterproofing on all compatible surfaces.

Q: What if water pools around the flange?

A: This may indicate an improper seal. Ensure membrane adhesion and inspect the flange for full contact with the surface. Reseal if needed.

Q: How should I dispose of this product at end of life?

A: Recycle brass grate through metal recycling programs. Dispose of ABS flange according to local recycling regulations for plastics.

Made with a solid brass waste and durable ABS base, it resists corrosion and ensures long-term reliability. Perfect for bathrooms, laundries, and outdoor wet areas, this product combines function with a polished chrome finish to suit modern construction and renovation projects.

  • Megaflex™ flange delivers superior waterproofing and prevents leaks

  1. Clean and prepare the outlet pipe and surrounding surface
  2. Apply a bead of silicone around the pipe and flange area
  3. Place the Megaflex™ flange securely over the pipe
  4. Position the floor waste (round or square) and ensure it is level
  5. Secure with fittings and allow sealant to cure before use
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 100mm (Raised) Floor Waste with Megaflex™ Flange

Q: How do I install this floor waste with the Megaflex™ flange?

A: Ensure the outlet pipe is clean and positioned correctly. Apply silicone around the Megaflex™ flange, align the waste unit, and secure it with the proper fittings. Test for leaks after installation.

Q: Is this product suitable for both indoor and outdoor applications?

A: Yes, the solid brass and chrome finish provide excellent resistance to moisture, making it ideal for indoor wet areas and outdoor drainage zones.

Q: Which flooring types are compatible with this floor waste?

A: It’s compatible with ceramic tiles, concrete floors, and waterproof membranes. Proper alignment and sealing ensure a flush fit for tiled surfaces.

Q: What can I do if there’s a leak after installation?

A: Check that the flange and waste are level and properly sealed. Reapply silicone sealant if necessary, and ensure the unit is tightly fitted against the substrate.

Q: Are there safety concerns during installation?

A: Use gloves and eye protection to handle components and sealants safely. Ensure adequate ventilation when applying silicone sealants.

The Megaflex™ Puddle Flange is a premium-grade plumbing fitting designed for waterproofing and drainage applications. Available in 50mm, 80mm, and 100mm outlet sizes, this durable white flange creates a watertight seal where pipes penetrate concrete slabs or waterproof membranes. Built for longevity and compliance with Australian plumbing standards, the Megaflex™ Puddle Flange ensures secure, leak-free installations in both new builds and retrofits.

Key Features of Megaflex™ Puddle Flange

  • Available in 50mm, 80mm, and 100mm sizes for varied site requirements
  • White finish provides durability and professional appearance
  • Watertight seal prevents leaks in slab penetrations and wet areas
  • Meets Australian standards for waterproofing and drainage

Technical Overview

  • Material: High-grade PVC
  • Outlet Sizes: 50mm, 80mm, 100mm
  • Finish: White
  • Temperature Resistance: Up to 60°C (140°F)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Pipe cutter, solvent cement, level
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Secure flange before pouring slab to ensure proper alignment
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure flange is sealed into membrane to prevent seepage

Storage and Shelf Life

column7: Puddle Flanges,balcony,bathroom,external,internal,kitchens,roofing-i,shower,tiling-i,wastes,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i,wet areas
column32: Megaflex™ Puddle Flange | Durable Drainage Seal | Adheseal
column33: Megaflex™ Puddle Flange in 50mm, 80mm, and 100mm sizes. Ideal for secure, leak-proof drainage connections. Durable and easy to install.
column52:
How to apply Megaflex™ Puddle Flange:

  1. Determine pipe location and cut hole in formwork
  2. Place flange around pipe, aligning with slab and membrane
  3. Secure flange and apply solvent cement to pipe and flange
  4. Pour concrete around flange, ensuring no movement
  5. Allow concrete and cement to cure fully before testing
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megaflex™ Puddle Flange

Q: How is the Megaflex™ Puddle Flange installed in a concrete slab?

A: Position the flange where the pipe penetrates the slab, secure it in place, and pour concrete. Ensure flange is sealed into membrane for watertight integrity.

Q: Is the Megaflex™ Puddle Flange suitable for waterproofing?

A: Yes, it is specifically designed to form a seal between pipes and waterproof membranes, preventing water ingress at slab penetrations.

Q: Can this flange be used with all pipe materials?

A: It is compatible with PVC and CPVC pipes. For other materials, ensure correct adaptors or fittings are used.

Q: What if the flange is not level during installation?

A: Re-align before cement sets or concrete is poured. Use a spirit level to maintain alignment and prevent pooling or leakage.

Q: Is the Megaflex™ Puddle Flange approved for potable water?

A: It is designed for drainage and waterproofing, not potable water systems. Use WaterMark-certified products specifically rated for drinking water.
column54:
Megaflex™ Puddle Flange limitations:

  • Not suitable for pressurised systems or potable water use
  • Must be installed before slab pour for proper sealing
  • Limited UV resistance; not for prolonged outdoor exposure

Safety precautions when using Megaflex™ Puddle Flange:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, eye protection, dust mask during cutting
  • Ventilation: Use in ventilated areas when applying cement
  • Handling: Avoid excessive force during installation to prevent cracking
  • Store away from heat sources and direct sunlight

Use Terrafix Geo Fabric for: Stabilizing coastal structures, protecting landfill lining systems, soil filtration, separation, and drainage in civil engineering projects.

Terrafix Geo Fabric is a high-performance, non-woven staple fibre geotextile designed for demanding applications in coastal and landfill environments. Manufactured in Australia, it provides a unique combination of mechanical strength, hydraulic properties, and durability. Made from either polyester or polypropylene fibres, Terrafix Geo Fabric is engineered to protect impermeable liners, ensuring long-term stability and performance. Its high elongation properties minimize installation damage and ensure effective soil contact, interaction, and stability. Terrafix Geo Fabric's resistance to abrasion, UV degradation, and hydrocarbons makes it a reliable solution for a wide range of civil engineering projects.

Key Features of Terrafix Geo Fabric Non-Woven Stable Fibre Geotextile

  • High Strength: Offers exceptional CBR burst strength and wide strip tensile strength, providing robust reinforcement and stability for coastal structures and landfill lining systems.
  • UV Resistance: Exhibits high retention of strength after accelerated UV exposure, ensuring long-term performance in exposed environments.
  • Abrasion Resistance: Maintains strength after abrasion, making it suitable for dynamic environments where mechanical stress is a concern.
  • Excellent Filtration Properties: Provides optimal pore size and permeability, allowing for effective filtration while preventing soil particle migration.
  • Chemical Resistance: Demonstrates high retention of strength after hydrocarbon (diesel) exposure, ensuring durability in contaminated environments.
  • Australian-Made: Developed and tested in accordance with Australian standards, ensuring quality and reliability for local conditions.

Technical Overview

Terrafix Geo Fabric non-woven geotextiles are engineered to provide a balance of mechanical and hydraulic properties essential for the stability and longevity of civil engineering projects. The staple fibre blend and inbuilt flexibility allow for effective soil interaction and stability, while the hydraulic characteristics ensure efficient filtration and drainage. These geotextiles are designed to withstand the harsh conditions of coastal and landfill environments, providing reliable performance over time.

Fibre Type: 100% Virgin Polyester Fibre

Pore Size (O95): ≤ 75 µm (AS 3706.7), 108-182 µm (ASTM D6767 - Capillary Flow Method) - Provides effective filtration while preventing soil particle migration.

Application Information

  • Applications: Coastal protection, landfill lining systems, soil stabilization, filtration, separation, drainage, and erosion control.
  • Installation: High elongation properties minimize installation damage and ensure effective soil contact, interaction, and stability.
  • Industry Standards: Developed and tested in accordance with Australian standards (AS 3706) and ASTM standards.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Recommendations: Store in a dry place, protected from direct sunlight and mechanical damage.
  • Handling Precautions: Handle with care to avoid punctures or tears.

Certifications

  • Tested in accordance with Australian Standards (AS 3706)
  • Tested in accordance with ASTM Standards

How to apply Terrafix Geo Fabric Non-Woven Stable Fibre Geotextile:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure the subgrade is smooth, free of debris, and properly compacted.
  2. Placement: Roll out the Terrafix Geo Fabric geotextile to the required dimensions, ensuring proper overlap between rolls.
  3. Securing: Secure the geotextile with pins or other appropriate methods to prevent movement during installation.
  4. Backfilling: Place fill material over the geotextile, ensuring it is placed carefully to avoid damage.
  5. Compaction: Compact the fill material according to project specifications.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Terrafix Geo Fabric Non-Woven Stable Fibre Geotextile

Q: What is Terrafix Geo Fabric used for?

A: Terrafix Geo Fabric is used for stabilizing coastal structures, protecting landfill lining systems, and various civil engineering applications requiring soil filtration, separation, and drainage.

Q: What type of fibres are used in Terrafix Geo Fabric?

A: Terrafix Geo Fabric is made using either polyester and/or polypropylene fibres, providing a unique staple fibre blend for enhanced performance.

Q: How does Terrafix Geo Fabric protect landfill liners?

A: Terrafix Geo Fabric significantly reduces the force placed on impermeable liners, protecting them in both the short and long term.

Q: Is Terrafix Geo Fabric suitable for coastal environments?

A: Yes, Terrafix Geo Fabric is specifically developed to stabilize coastal structures, offering high abrasion and UV resistance for harsh environmental conditions.

Q: What are the hydraulic properties of Terrafix Geo Fabric?

A: Terrafix Geo Fabric provides optimal pore size and permeability for effective filtration, with permittivity ranging from 0.30 s-1 to 1.41 s-1 and a coefficient of permeability from 20 x 10-4 m/s to 48 x 10-4 m/s.

Q: Is Terrafix Geo Fabric resistant to chemical exposure?

A: Yes, Terrafix Geo Fabric demonstrates high retention of strength after hydrocarbon (diesel) exposure, ensuring durability in contaminated environments.

Q: Where is Terrafix Geo Fabric manufactured?

A: Terrafix Geo Fabric is proudly made in Australia, developed and tested in accordance with Australian standards.

  • Ensure proper installation techniques to avoid damage.

Use Corflute Protection Board (1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm) for: Safeguarding waterproofing membranes from construction-related damage and backfilling pressure

Adheseal’s Corflute Protection Board is a tough, lightweight sheet designed to provide robust protection to waterproofing membranes during construction activities such as backfilling, slab preparation, and heavy-duty trades work. Made from high-strength corrugated polypropylene, this 2mm black board delivers excellent resistance to impact, puncture, and abrasion—ensuring that your membranes remain secure and functional even in demanding environments. Ideal for professional waterproofers, builders, and civil contractors, this protective sheet reduces the risk of costly membrane repairs and reapplications.

Key Features of Corflute Protection Board (1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm)

  • High-impact resistance shields membranes from site damage
  • Puncture-resistant polypropylene for superior membrane defence
  • Lightweight and easy to handle on-site
  • Large surface coverage reduces installation time
  • Reusable and environmentally responsible option

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Corrugated polypropylene (polyolefin-based thermoplastic)
  • Application Temperature Range: -10°C to 80°C (14°F to 176°F)
  • Sheet Dimensions: 1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm (71” x 47.6” x 0.08”)
  • Colour: Black
  • Density: Approx. 0.92 g/cm³

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Utility knife, measuring tape, straight edge, safety gloves
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Pre-cut boards for faster membrane coverage; store flat to avoid warping
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Warping in storage—always store on flat surface away from heat

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store flat in a dry, shaded area
  • Shelf Life Information: Indefinite under proper storage conditions
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid prolonged exposure to heat over 80°C (176°F)
column7: civil construction-i,construction,external,industrial,internal,manufacturing,masonry,pick up,stone,waterproofing protection
column32: Corflute Protection Board for Membrane Protection | Adheseal
column33: Durable black Corflute Board (1805x1210x2mm) for protecting waterproofing membranes. In-store pickup only.
column52:
How to apply Corflute Protection Board (1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm):

  1. Ensure membrane is fully cured before applying protection board
  2. Lay sheets flat over membrane surface, overlapping edges slightly
  3. Use compatible adhesive tape or spot fix with sealant if vertical application is required
  4. Cut to fit corners or penetrations using a utility knife
  5. Proceed with backfilling or further site works as needed
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Corflute Protection Board (1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm)

Q: How is the Corflute Protection Board applied?

A: Simply place the board directly over the waterproofing membrane before backfilling or applying pressure. Use tape or adhesive for vertical applications to keep it in place.

Q: How durable is the board under heavy construction conditions?

A: The 2mm corrugated polypropylene structure provides high resistance to puncture, impact, and abrasion—ideal for heavy-duty trade environments.

Q: Is this product compatible with all waterproofing membranes?

A: Yes, it’s chemically inert and non-reactive, making it suitable for use with most sheet and liquid-applied waterproofing membranes.

Q: What should I do if the board bends or warps during storage?

A: Lay the board flat in a shaded area with weight on top to restore shape. Avoid storing near heat sources to prevent warping in future.

Q: How should I safely dispose of damaged boards?

A: Dispose of in general industrial waste. Corflute is recyclable under many local council guidelines; check for local recycling options.
column54:
Corflute Protection Board (1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm) limitations:

  • Not suitable as a long-term UV-exposed barrier
  • Should not be used as a structural load-bearing surface
  • May warp under excessive heat if not stored flat

Safety precautions when using Corflute Protection Board (1805mm x 1210mm x 2mm):

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Cut-resistant gloves recommended when trimming
  • Ventilation: Not required—material is non-toxic
  • Handling: Carry flat to avoid bending; edges can be sharp when cut
  • Store away from open flame or direct sunlight to prevent degradation

Frequently Asked Questions About Texas Safety Glasses EBR330 Series

A: The anti-fog coating is designed to maintain clear vision in humid or fluctuating temperatures, making them ideal for indoor and outdoor use.

Q: Are these glasses compatible with hard hats or ear muffs?

A: Yes, the low-profile wraparound design fits comfortably with hard hats, ear muffs, and other PPE commonly used on Australian job sites.

Q: What should I do if the lenses become scratched?

A: Minor scratches can be avoided with proper storage. Deep scratches may require replacement for optimal vision and safety compliance.

Q: Are there any safety concerns when disposing of these glasses?

A: Dispose of broken or expired glasses as general waste. Ensure lenses are not sharp when discarding to avoid injury.
