column3:
Use Adheseal IPA Cleaner for: Cleaning surfaces prior to sealant and adhesive application, removing oils, grime, and contaminants to enhance bond strength.

Adheseal IPA Cleaner is a 100% isopropyl alcohol solution, ideal for preparing surfaces before applying Adheseal 50A surface prep, sealants, and adhesives. This versatile cleaner effectively removes fluxes, light oils, grime, and oxides, leaving no residue behind. Its rapid evaporation ensures a clean, dry surface, maximizing the bond strength of applied materials. Suitable for various substrates, including metals, plastics, and masonry, this cleaner is an essential tool for trade professionals.

Key Features of Adheseal IPA Cleaner

  • 100% Isopropyl Alcohol: Ensures high purity and effective cleaning.
  • Residue-Free: Evaporates quickly, leaving surfaces clean and dry.
  • Enhances Adhesion: Removes contaminants that can compromise bond strength.
  • Safe on Most Plastics: Suitable for a wide range of materials.
  • Compatible with Sealants/Adhesives: Does not interfere with the curing process.

Why Choose Adheseal IPA Cleaner:

  • Optimal Surface Preparation: Ensures strong and durable bonds.
  • Efficient Cleaning: Rapid evaporation saves time and effort.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various trades and applications.
  • Reliable Performance: Consistent quality and effectiveness.

When to Choose Adheseal IPA Cleaner versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Adheseal IPA Cleaner over general-purpose cleaners when: A residue-free, high-purity cleaning solution is required for optimal adhesion.
  • Consider other options when: Cleaning surfaces that may be damaged by alcohol, such as certain painted finishes or wood varnishes.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Provides superior surface preparation, reducing the risk of sealant/adhesive failure and costly rework.

Trade-Specific Applications for Adheseal IPA Cleaner:

For Glaziers and Signage Installers:

  • Use for cleaning glass and frame surfaces before applying sealants.
  • Removes oils and grime that can affect adhesion.
  • Ensures a clean surface for optimal sealant performance.

For Tilers and Waterproofers:

  • Use for cleaning tile and membrane surfaces before applying adhesives.
  • Removes contaminants that can compromise bond strength.
  • Ensures a clean, dry surface for optimal adhesion.

Technical Overview

Adheseal IPA Cleaner is a clear, 100% isopropyl alcohol solution designed for effective surface preparation. Its rapid evaporation and residue-free properties make it ideal for cleaning surfaces before applying sealants and adhesives. It is compatible with various materials and does not compromise the curing process.

Application: Apply with a clean rag, ensuring thorough coverage and allowing the cleaner to evaporate completely.

Substrate Compatibility: Suitable for masonry, metal, plastics, and more, with a preliminary test recommended for sensitive surfaces.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Clean rags, safety gloves, and eye protection.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure adequate ventilation, avoid excessive application, and test on sensitive surfaces before use.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Damage to sensitive finishes (test before use), residue from excessive application (use sparingly).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated area away from heat and ignition sources.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Complies with relevant industry standards for cleaning solvents.
  • Refer to SDS for specific compliance and certifications.

column33: Adheseal IPA Cleaner is a high-purity isopropyl alcohol solution designed for thorough surface cleaning, ensuring optimal adhesion for sealants and adhesives.
column52:
How to apply Adheseal IPA Cleaner:

  1. Use a clean rag.
  2. Dampen the rag with Adheseal IPA Cleaner.
  3. Wipe the material down gently and slowly.
  4. Allow the material to dry completely.
  5. Ensure no excess cleaner remains on the surface.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal IPA Cleaner

Q: Can I use Adheseal IPA Cleaner on all plastics?

A: While safe on most plastics, it's recommended to test on a small, inconspicuous area first, as some plastics may be sensitive to alcohol.

Q: How do I ensure I don't leave any residue?

A: Apply sparingly and allow the cleaner to evaporate completely. Use a clean, dry rag to remove any excess liquid.

Q: Will Adheseal IPA Cleaner affect the curing of my sealant?

A: No, Adheseal IPA Cleaner is formulated to be compatible with PU, MS, Acrylic, and Silicone compounds and will not compromise their curing process.

Q: Is Adheseal IPA Cleaner flammable?

A: Yes, isopropyl alcohol is flammable. Keep away from heat, sparks, open flames, and hot surfaces. Use in a well-ventilated area.

Q: Can I use Adheseal IPA Cleaner to clean painted surfaces?

A: Adheseal IPA Cleaner may damage paint. It is crucial to test on an inconspicuous area first before applying to painted surfaces.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Adheseal IPA Cleaner?

A: Use in a well-ventilated area, wear appropriate safety gloves and eye protection, and keep away from heat and ignition sources. Refer to the SDS for detailed safety information.
column54:
Adheseal IPA Cleaner limitations:

  • Not suitable for use in environments where fire is present.
  • May damage paint, wood finishes, and varnish.
  • Do not mix with bleach.

Safety precautions when using Adheseal IPA Cleaner:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear safety shoes, gloves, apron, and chemical goggles. Nitrile rubber gloves are recommended for intermittent contact.
  • Inhalation: Keep victim calm and remove to fresh air. Seek medical treatment if necessary.
  • Skin Contact: Remove contaminated clothing and wash skin thoroughly with water and soap.
  • Eye contact: Hold eyes open and flood with water for at least 15 minutes. Seek medical treatment.
  • Ingestion: Do NOT induce vomiting. Give a glass of water to drink. Seek medical treatment immediately.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information.

column3:
Use Toluene for: Removing spray contact adhesive, polyurethane sealants, and other tough adhesives.

Toluene is a potent solvent-based cleaner formulated for professional use. It effectively removes stubborn adhesives like spray contact adhesive and polyurethane sealants. Its rapid action and strong solvent properties make it a valuable tool for tradespeople. However, due to its hazardous nature, strict safety precautions must be followed. Use only in well-ventilated areas and with appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).

Key Features of Toluene

  • Powerful Solvent: Effectively removes tough adhesives.
  • Fast-Acting: Rapidly dissolves adhesive residues.
  • Professional Grade: Formulated for industrial and trade applications.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for various adhesive types.
  • High Purity: Contains >99.9% toluene for maximum effectiveness.

Technical Overview

Toluene is a clear, colourless liquid with an aromatic odour. It has a low flash point of 4.4°C, indicating high flammability. Its density is 0.870, and it is immiscible with water. The product's high volatility and solvent strength make it effective for adhesive removal. However, its hazardous properties necessitate careful handling and storage.

Chemical Properties: >99.9% Toluene, clear colourless liquid, aromatic odour.

Application Temperature Range: Use at room temperature. Avoid application near ignition sources due to its low flash point.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Chemical-resistant gloves, safety goggles, respirator (if ventilation is inadequate), clean cloths.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always test on an inconspicuous area before full application. Ensure adequate ventilation. Dispose of used materials according to local regulations.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid use in confined spaces; use appropriate PPE to prevent skin and respiratory irritation.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place away from ignition sources. Keep containers tightly closed.
  • Shelf Life Information: Store in original containers to maintain product integrity.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing near heat sources due to its flammability. Store between 10dg—35dg

Certifications

  • Classified as Dangerous Goods (Class 3, Packing Group II).
  • Poison Schedule S5.

column52:
How to apply Toluene:

  1. Ensure adequate ventilation in the work area.
  2. Wear appropriate PPE, including chemical-resistant gloves, safety goggles, and a respirator if needed.
  3. Apply a small amount of Toluene to a clean cloth.
  4. Wipe the surface to remove adhesive residues.
  5. Dispose of used materials according to local regulations.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Toluene

Q: What types of adhesives can Toluene remove?

A: Toluene is effective for removing spray contact adhesive, polyurethane sealants, and many other tough adhesives. Always test on an inconspicuous area first.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Toluene?

A: Use in well-ventilated areas, wear chemical-resistant gloves, safety goggles, and a respirator if necessary. Keep away from ignition sources and avoid skin and eye contact.

Q: How should Toluene be stored?

A: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place away from ignition sources. Keep containers tightly closed and store according to dangerous goods regulations.

Q: Can Toluene be used on all surfaces?

A: No, Toluene is a strong solvent and may damage certain surfaces. Always test on an inconspicuous area before full application.

Q: What should I do if I accidentally inhale Toluene vapors?

A: Immediately move to fresh air. If breathing difficulties persist, seek medical attention. Ensure proper ventilation during use to avoid inhalation.
column54:
Toluene limitations:

  • Highly flammable; keep away from ignition sources.
  • May damage certain surfaces; test compatibility before use.
  • Toxic; requires proper ventilation and PPE.
  • Reproductive toxicity; requires extra caution for certain individuals.

Safety precautions when using Toluene:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear chemical-resistant gloves, safety goggles, and a respirator if necessary.
  • Ventilation: Use only in well-ventilated areas.
  • Handling: Keep away from heat, sparks, and open flames. Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place away from ignition sources.

Use Xylene for: Thinning and cleaning solvent-based products, removing grease, oil, and other contaminants.

Xylene is a powerful and versatile solvent commonly used for thinning and cleaning various solvent-based products. It effectively removes grease, oil, and other contaminants, making it a valuable tool in numerous industries. Due to its hazardous nature, xylene must be handled with caution, following all safety precautions and ensuring adequate ventilation.

Key Features

  • Effective thinner for solvent-based products
  • Powerful cleaning agent
  • Removes grease, oil, and contaminants
  • Versatile applications in various industries

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Xylene (mixed isomers)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Appropriate safety equipment (gloves, eye protection, respiratory protection), rags or brushes for application
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure adequate ventilation when using. Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Dispose of waste responsibly according to local regulations.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated place away from direct sunlight and incompatible materials.
  • Shelf Life Information: Not specified
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep away from heat and sources of ignition.

column3:
Use Methylated Spirits 95% for: Thinning adhesives, cleaning non-porous surfaces, removing adhesive residues, and preparing substrates and tools.

Methylated Spirits 95% is a versatile denatured alcohol designed for professional use. It serves as an effective adhesive thinner for specific adhesives and a reliable cleaning agent for non-porous surfaces. This product is essential for tradespeople needing to prepare surfaces, clean tools, and remove adhesive residues. Its fast evaporation and clear liquid form make it a practical choice for various applications. Always test on an inconspicuous spot before use to ensure compatibility with the surface.

Key Features of Methylated Spirits 95%

  • Versatile Use: Functions as both an adhesive thinner and a general-purpose cleaner.
  • Fast Evaporation: Leaves surfaces clean and dry quickly.
  • Effective Cleaning: Removes adhesive residues and cleans non-porous surfaces effectively.
  • Surface Preparation: Ideal for preparing substrates and tools before adhesive or sealant application.
  • Clear Liquid: Easy to apply and observe during use.

Technical Overview

Methylated Spirits 95% has a density of 0.9 and a water-thin consistency, making it easy to apply and use. Its clear liquid form allows for visual confirmation of cleanliness. The product evaporates quickly, ensuring efficient cleaning and thinning processes. Proper storage between 10°C and 35°C ensures the product maintains its quality and effectiveness over its 2-year minimum shelf life.

Chemical Properties: Denatured alcohol with 95% purity, clear liquid, fast evaporation.

Application Temperature Range: Suitable for use in standard room temperatures. For optimal performance, store between 10°C and 35°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Clean cloths, brushes, and appropriate containers.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Always test on an inconspicuous area before full application to ensure compatibility. Ensure adequate ventilation during use.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid use on porous surfaces; use appropriate PPE to prevent skin and eye irritation.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C. Keep containers closed when not in use.
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 2 years when stored properly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing near heat sources due to its flammability.

Certifications

  • Not classified as hazardous according to Work Safe Australia, but follow safety guidelines.

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Methylated Spirits 95%

Q: What types of adhesives can Methylated Spirits 95% thin?

A: Methylated Spirits 95% is suitable for thinning certain adhesives. Always check the adhesive manufacturer's instructions for compatibility.

Q: Can Methylated Spirits 95% be used on all surfaces?

A: No, it is best used on non-porous surfaces. Always test on an inconspicuous spot before full application to ensure it does not stain or damage the surface.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Methylated Spirits 95%?

A: Avoid skin and eye contact, avoid inhalation, use in well-ventilated areas, and wear appropriate PPE such as gloves and safety glasses. Keep away from ignition sources.

Q: How should Methylated Spirits 95% be stored?

A: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C. Keep containers tightly closed when not in use and away from heat sources.

Q: What should I do if I accidentally get Methylated Spirits 95% in my eyes?

A: Hold eyes open, flood with water for at least 15 minutes, and seek medical advice immediately. Do not rub your eyes.

  • Handling: Keep away from heat, sparks, and open flames. Use spark-proof tools.

column3:
Use Acetone for: Cleaning polyurethane adhesives, thinning resins, epoxies, and lacquers, and dissolving gums, waxes, oils, and dyes.

Acetone is a high-performance cleaning solvent designed for professional use. Its fast-evaporating formula makes it ideal for cleaning adhesives, thinning resins, and dissolving various substances. This versatile solvent is essential for tradespeople working with epoxies, lacquers, and fiberglass. With a 0 g/L VOC content, Acetone provides an environmentally responsible solution for cleaning and thinning applications. Its high purity ensures effective results, making it a reliable choice for demanding tasks.

Key Features of Acetone

  • High Purity: Ensures effective cleaning and thinning.
  • Fast Evaporation: Quickly dissolves and evaporates, reducing downtime.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for cleaning adhesives, thinning resins, and dissolving various substances.
  • Low VOC Content: 0 g/L, making it an environmentally friendly choice.
  • Compatibility: Mixes with water, alcohols, esters, ethers, and other organic solvents.

Technical Overview

Acetone is a powerful solvent with a specific gravity of 0.792 and a freezing point of -95°C. Its water-thin viscosity allows for easy application and effective cleaning. The low acidity and alkalinity levels, combined with a maximum water content of 0.5%, ensure high purity. Its fast evaporation rate, though slower than ether, makes it efficient for various applications.

Chemical Properties: Clear, colourless liquid with high purity and fast evaporation.

Application Temperature Range: Suitable for use in a wide range of temperatures due to its low freezing point (-95°C). Ensure adequate ventilation during application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Clean cloths, brushes, and appropriate containers.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use small amounts at a time to prevent flammable vapor build-up. Ensure proper ventilation.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid using on polystyrene foam; use appropriate PPE to prevent skin irritation.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from ignition sources.
  • Shelf Life Information: Store in tightly closed containers to prevent evaporation and contamination.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing near heat sources due to its flammability.

Certifications

  • Hazard Class III: Flammable liquid classification.

column52:
How to apply Adheseal Acetone:

  1. Ensure adequate ventilation in the work area.
  2. Apply a small amount of Adheseal Acetone to a clean cloth or brush.
  3. Wipe or brush the surface to be cleaned or thinned.
  4. For thinning, gradually add Acetone to the resin or adhesive until the desired consistency is achieved.
  5. Dispose of used cloths and containers properly according to local regulations.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Acetone

Q: What types of adhesives can Acetone clean?

A: Acetone is highly effective for cleaning polyurethane-based adhesives. It also works well with other acetone-based adhesives and resins.

Q: Can Acetone be used to thin epoxy resins?

A: Yes, Acetone can be used to thin epoxies, lacquers, and adhesives. It's also suitable for thinning polyester resins used in fiberglass boat and auto repairs.

Q: Is Acetone safe to use on all surfaces?

A: No, it should not be used on polystyrene foam as it will attack and dissolve it. Always test on a small, inconspicuous area before full application.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Acetone?

A: Acetone is flammable, so keep it away from ignition sources. Ensure proper ventilation and use appropriate PPE, such as gloves and eye protection, to prevent skin and eye irritation.

Q: How should Acetone be stored?

A: Store Acetone in a cool, dry place away from heat sources and direct sunlight. Keep the container tightly closed to prevent evaporation and contamination.
column54:
Acetone limitations:

  • Extremely flammable
  • Not suitable for cleaning equipment used for polystyrene foam
  • May cause skin irritation and sensitisation in sensitive individuals
  • Wear appropriate PPE, including gloves and eye protection.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Avoid skin and eye contact.

column3:
Use Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam for: Weatherproofing, expansion joint sealing, dust and vermin proofing, and sealing various roof and wall decking.

Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam is a versatile, compressible foam designed for effective sealing in construction and industrial applications. Available in bitumen or acrylic impregnated versions, it provides excellent weather resistance and long-term durability. This foam adapts to dynamic joint movements, making it ideal for expansion joints, metal cladding, and timber homes. Its high recovery rate and varying compression resistance ensure reliable performance in diverse conditions, from dust prevention to standing water resistance.

Key Features of Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam

  • High Compressibility and Recovery: Maintains 98% recovery in the first cycle, ensuring long-lasting seal performance in dynamic joints.
  • Weather Resistance: Available in bitumen or acrylic impregnated options for enhanced protection against various weather conditions.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for dust and vermin proofing, expansion joints, and sealing roof and wall decking profiles.
  • Long Working Life: Accelerated aging tests indicate a working life of up to 20 years, depending on the application.
  • Customizable Sizes and Profiles: Available in various sizes and profiles, including options for Corrugated and Trimdek roofing.

Technical Overview

Biyseal is engineered for reliable sealing through its exceptional compressibility and recovery. Its ability to withstand varying degrees of compression allows it to adapt to different environmental challenges, from dust and draughts to standing water. The choice of bitumen or acrylic impregnation enhances its suitability for diverse applications. Its high tensile strength and tear resistance ensure durability, while its low shrinkage maintains consistent performance over time.

Chemical Properties: Polyurethane foam impregnated with bitumen or acrylic, providing flexibility and weather resistance.

Application Temperature Range: While specific temperature ranges are not listed, polyurethane foams generally perform well in standard construction temperatures. Ensure the surfaces are clean and dry for optimal application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Measuring tape, utility knife or scissors for cutting to size.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the foam width matches the application requirements (5x joint opening for weather resistance, 3-4x for expansion joints, 2x for joint proofing).
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper compression for desired sealing level; incorrect compression can lead to insufficient sealing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures.
  • Shelf Life Information: While specific shelf life is not provided, polyurethane foams generally maintain their properties for extended periods when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in excessively hot or cold environments to prevent degradation.

Certifications

  • AS2282-79: Complies with Australian standards for flexible cellular materials.

column52:
How to apply Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam:

  1. Measure the joint opening to determine the required foam width based on the application (weather resistance, expansion joint, or joint proofing).
  2. Cut the Biyseal foam to the required length using a utility knife or scissors.
  3. Insert the foam into the joint, ensuring it is compressed to the appropriate level for the desired sealing effect.
  4. For profiled applications like roofing, use the pre-profiled Biyseal foam to match the roof decking.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam

Q: How do I choose the right size of Biyseal foam for my application?

A: Select the foam width based on the joint opening: 5 times for weather resistance, 3-4 times for expansion joints, and 2 times for joint proofing. This ensures proper compression and effective sealing.

Q: What are the benefits of using bitumen-impregnated versus acrylic-impregnated foam?

A: Bitumen-impregnated foam offers excellent weather resistance and is ideal for general construction applications. Acrylic-impregnated foam is better suited for applications requiring enhanced UV resistance.

Q: Can Biyseal foam be used in standing water applications?

A: Yes, when compressed by 75%, Biyseal can resist standing water. Ensure proper compression to achieve the desired level of water resistance.

Q: How long can Biyseal foam last in outdoor applications?

A: Accelerated aging tests indicate a working life of up to 20 years, depending on the application and environmental conditions. Proper installation and maintenance are crucial for longevity.

Q: Does Biyseal foam require any specific tools for installation?

A: Basic tools like a measuring tape and a utility knife or scissors are sufficient for cutting the foam to the required size. No specialized tools are needed for installation.
column54:
Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam limitations:

  • Performance depends on correct compression; insufficient compression may result in inadequate sealing.
  • Not suitable for applications requiring strong adhesive bonding; relies primarily on compression for sealing.
  • Specific chemical resistance data is not provided, so avoid exposure to harsh chemicals without prior testing.

Safety precautions when using Biyseal Polyurethane Impregnated Foam:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves are recommended to prevent skin irritation.
  • Ventilation: General ventilation is adequate; no specific requirements are listed.
  • Handling: Handle with care to avoid tearing or damaging the foam.

Adheseal's Fire Rated Backing Rod is designed to enhance fire safety in caulking and sealing applications. This specially formulated backing rod is certified for use with Adheseal PU-25 and Everflex JS, providing a reliable barrier against fire and smoke.

Key Features

  • Fire-resistant properties for enhanced safety
  • Certified for use with Adheseal PU-25 and Everflex JS sealants
  • Compressible and easy to install
  • Maintains its shape and integrity under fire conditions
  • Available in various sizes to suit different joint widths

Uses

  • Sealing gaps and joints around fire doors and windows

column3:
Use Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell for: Creating optimal joint profiles, preventing 3-sided adhesion, and supporting sealants in construction joints.

Adheseal Closed Cell Backing Rod is manufactured from closed cell, low-density white polyethylene foam, offering exceptional resistance to weathering and chemicals. Its flexible, round profile ensures sealants form the correct shape for optimal movement and performance. Ideal for various construction applications, this backing rod provides a reliable bond breaker and joint filler, enhancing the longevity of sealants.

Key Features of Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell

  • Closed Cell Structure: Minimizes water absorption, ensuring durability in damp environments.
  • High Flexibility: Conforms to irregular joints, simplifying installation.
  • Excellent Recovery (95%): Maintains joint integrity and sealant performance.
  • Wide Temperature Range: Performs reliably in diverse Australian climates.
  • Chemical Resistance: Resists water, detergents, and moderate chemicals.

Why Choose Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell:

  • Optimal Sealant Performance: Creates the correct joint profile for effective sealant application.
  • Enhanced Joint Longevity: Prevents 3-sided adhesion and supports sealant integrity.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various construction joints and sealants.
  • User-Friendly Installation: Easy to handle and conforms to different joint shapes.

When to Choose Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Adheseal Closed Cell Backing Rod over open-cell rods when: Moisture resistance is crucial, and long-term durability is required.
  • Consider other options when: High-temperature applications beyond +70°C or internal swimming pool applications with high chlorine levels are needed.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Provides superior performance and longevity, reducing maintenance and replacement costs.

Trade-Specific Applications for Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell:

For Glaziers and Window Installers:

  • Use for window glazing to create proper sealant profiles and prevent 3-sided adhesion.
  • Ensures airtight and watertight seals, enhancing window performance.
  • Flexible material conforms to various frame shapes.

For Civil Construction and Bridge Builders:

  • Use in expansion joints and precast panels to accommodate structural movement.
  • Provides reliable support and prevents sealant failure in demanding conditions.
  • Durable material withstands environmental stressors.

For Waterproofers:

  • Use in horizontal joints that are subjected to damp conditions.
  • The closed cell nature of the product prevents water absorption.
  • Creates the proper joint profile for the application of waterproof sealants.

Technical Overview

Adheseal Closed Cell Backing Rod is made from closed cell, low-density polyethylene foam, providing excellent compression and recovery properties. Its round profile ensures sealants form the correct shape, and its resistance to weathering and chemicals makes it ideal for various construction applications.

Physical Properties: Closed cell structure, 95% recovery, wide temperature range (-60°C to 260°C intermittent), and excellent chemical resistance.

Application: Fill prepared joints, avoid air entrapment, use an insertion tool, and protect the outer surface during installation.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Backing rod insertion tool, measuring tape, and safety gloves.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Select the correct rod diameter for the joint width, ensure proper surface preparation for sealant application, and avoid excessive stretching during installation.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Air entrapment (use proper installation techniques), damage to the rod surface (handle with care), and incorrect joint profile (select the right rod size).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C, away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 5 years when stored as recommended.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

column32: Closed Cell Backing Rod | Construction Joint Filler | Adheseal
column33: Adheseal Closed Cell Backing Rod: Flexible, moisture-resistant filler for construction joints. Ensures optimal sealant performance in Australian conditions.
column52:
How to apply Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell:

  1. Prepare the joint surface according to the sealant manufacturer's instructions.
  2. Select the correct diameter backing rod (25% larger than the joint width).
  3. Insert the backing rod into the joint, ensuring it is at the correct depth.
  4. Use a backing rod insertion tool to avoid damaging the rod's surface.
  5. Ensure the rod is compressed to the desired depth to create the proper sealant profile.
  6. Apply the sealant as per the sealant manufacturer's instructions.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell

Q: What is the benefit of using a closed cell backing rod?

A: Closed cell backing rods minimize water absorption, making them ideal for damp environments and ensuring long-term durability and sealant performance.

Q: Can I use this backing rod with any type of sealant?

A: Yes, it is compatible with cold applied sealants, including Acrylic, Silicone, PU, MS, SPUR, and Hybrid types. However, consult our technical department for hot poured sealants.

Q: How do I choose the correct size backing rod?

A: The backing rod should be 25% larger than the joint width to ensure it stays in place during sealant installation and allows for proper sealant thickness (half the joint width).

Q: What precautions should I take during installation?

A: Avoid excessive stretching, use an insertion tool to ensure proper depth, and take care not to damage the rod's outer surface to maintain sealant integrity.

Q: Is this product suitable for swimming pool applications?

A: It is not suitable for internal swimming pool applications with high chlorine levels (above 5ppm). High chlorine can degrade the backing rod.

Q: Can this backing rod be used in outdoor applications?

A: Yes, it is suitable for both internal and external applications. However, it should not be directly exposed to UV light.
column54:
Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell limitations:

  • Avoid excessive longitudinal stretching during installation.
  • Not suitable for hot poured sealants above +70°C.
  • Not suitable for internal swimming pool applications with high chlorine levels (above 5ppm).
  • Not to be UV exposed.

Safety precautions when using Adheseal Backing Rod Closed Cell:

  • Handling: Wear gloves to prevent skin irritation.
  • Installation: Use proper tools to avoid injury during installation.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Disposal: Dispose of according to local regulations for polyethylene foam.

column3:
Use Square Open Cell Backing Rod for: Maintaining consistent sealant shape, preventing three-sided adhesion, and supporting sealant curing in square or rectangular construction joints.

Square Open Cell Backing Rod is a medium-density, firm, open-cell polyurethane foam designed for professional sealant applications in joints with square or rectangular profiles. Its "non-gassing" feature ensures faster sealant curing by allowing air to permeate, which is crucial for achieving durable and effective seals. Ideal for use in expansion joints, precast panel construction, and any application requiring a consistent square backing shape, this rod provides a reliable bond breaker, preventing three-sided adhesion and ensuring the sealant cures correctly. Its firm structure allows it to maintain its shape, providing uniform support.

Key Features of Square Open Cell Backing Rod

  • Consistent Square Shape: Maintains a uniform shape for consistent sealant application in square or rectangular joints.
  • Non-Gassing Properties: Allows sealants to cure from both sides, speeding up the curing process and enhancing performance.
  • Versatile Compatibility: Works with a wide range of sealants, including acrylic, silicone, polyurethane, and hot pour types, providing flexibility for various projects.
  • Firm and Resilient: Provides reliable support and maintains its shape under compression, ensuring a consistent and effective seal.
  • Bond Breaker Function: Prevents three-sided adhesion, ensuring the sealant performs as intended and avoids premature failure.

Technical Overview

Square Open Cell Backing Rod is engineered to provide optimal support for sealants in construction joints with square or rectangular profiles. Its open-cell structure allows for air permeability, essential for proper sealant curing. The material's compressibility ensures it stays in place, maintaining the correct joint depth and shape. Its wide temperature range and chemical resistance make it suitable for diverse environmental conditions and applications.

Chemical Properties: Open-cell polyurethane foam, providing a breathable backing for various sealants.

Application Temperature Range: -40°C to +70°C, suitable for a wide range of Australian climates. Service temperature ranges from -60°C to intermittent 260°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Backing Rod Insertion Tool (TOOLBACKROD), sealant application tools.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the backing rod is compressed by at least 25% of its original dimension for optimal performance. Use the insertion tool to maintain consistent depth. Match the square backing rod size to the joint profile for optimal results.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid excessive stretching during installation. Ensure the joint is clean and prepared according to the sealant manufacturer's instructions.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C, away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 5 years when stored as recommended.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • ASTM D3574 standards for foam properties.

  2. Select a square backing rod that is 25% larger than the joint width and matches the profile.
  3. Insert the backing rod into the joint, ensuring it is compressed by at least 25% of its original dimension.

  5. Apply the sealant according to the manufacturer's instructions.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Square Open Cell Backing Rod

Q: How do I choose the correct size of square backing rod?

A: Select a backing rod that is approximately 25% larger than the joint width and matches the square profile. This ensures it stays in place and provides the correct depth for the sealant.

Q: Is the square backing rod compatible with all sealants?

A: Yes, Square Open Cell Backing Rod is compatible with a wide range of sealants, including acrylic, silicone, polyurethane, and hot pour types.

Q: What is the benefit of using a square backing rod?

A: Square backing rods maintain a consistent shape for uniform sealant application in square or rectangular joints.

Q: Can this backing rod be used in swimming pools?

A: It is not recommended for internal swimming pool applications due to potential exposure to high levels of chlorine.

Q: How should I store this square backing rod?

A: Store it in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C, away from direct sunlight, to maintain its quality and performance.
column54:
Square Open Cell Backing Rod limitations:

  • Not suitable for UV exposed applications.
  • Avoid excessive longitudinal stretching during installation.
  • Not suitable for internal swimming pool applications due to chlorine exposure.
  • Do not use where sealant is heated and applied above +70ºC.

Safety precautions when using Square Open Cell Backing Rod:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear appropriate gloves and eye protection if needed.
  • Ventilation: General ventilation is sufficient.
  • Handling: Handle with care to avoid excessive stretching.

column3:
Use Backing Rod Open Cell for: Preventing three-sided sealant adhesion, ensuring correct joint depth, and supporting sealant curing in construction joints.

Open Cell Backing Rod is a medium-density, firm, open-cell polyurethane foam designed for professional sealant applications. Its "non-gassing" feature ensures faster sealant curing by allowing air to permeate, which is crucial for achieving durable and effective seals. Ideal for use in expansion joints, window glazing, and precast panel construction, this backing rod provides a reliable bond breaker, preventing three-sided adhesion and ensuring the sealant cures correctly. Its flexibility allows it to conform to irregular joint shapes, making it a versatile solution for various construction needs.

Key Features of Backing Rod Open Cell

  • Non-Gassing Properties: Allows sealants to cure from both sides, speeding up the curing process and enhancing performance.
  • Versatile Compatibility: Works with a wide range of sealants, including acrylic, silicone, polyurethane, and hot pour types, providing flexibility for various projects.
  • Flexible and Resilient: Can be stretched, compressed, or bent to fit irregular joints, ensuring a consistent and effective seal.
  • Wide Range of Sizes: Available in diameters up to 50mm, accommodating various joint sizes and reducing the need for multiple product sizes.
  • Bond Breaker Function: Prevents three-sided adhesion, ensuring the sealant performs as intended and avoids premature failure.

Technical Overview

Open Cell Backing Rod is engineered to provide optimal support for sealants in construction joints. Its open-cell structure allows for air permeability, essential for proper sealant curing. The material's compressibility ensures it stays in place, maintaining the correct joint depth. Its wide temperature range and chemical resistance make it suitable for diverse environmental conditions and applications.

Chemical Properties: Open-cell polyurethane foam, providing a breathable backing for various sealants.

Application Temperature Range: -40°C to +70°C, suitable for a wide range of Australian climates. Service temperature ranges from -60°C to intermittent 260°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Backing Rod Insertion Tool (TOOLBACKROD), sealant application tools.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the backing rod is compressed by at least 25% of its original diameter for optimal performance. Use the insertion tool to maintain consistent depth.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid excessive stretching during installation. Ensure the joint is clean and prepared according to the sealant manufacturer's instructions.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C, away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: 5 years when stored as recommended.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • ASTM D3574 standards for foam properties.

column32: Open Cell Backing Rod | Joint Backing Foam | Adheseal
column33: Open Cell Backing Rod: Non-gassing polyurethane foam for expansion joints. Ensures proper sealant depth and adhesion. Available in various sizes.
column52:
Application Guide

  1. Ensure that sealant-specific application requirements are followed before installing the backer rod.
  2. Use the Backing Rod Insertion Tool to place the rod at the correct depth in the joint.
  3. Compress the open-cell foam by at least 24% during installation to ensure it remains in place.
  4. In cases where joint depth is insufficient for the rod, apply bond breaker tape to prevent 3-sided adhesion.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Backing Rod Open Cell

Q: How do I choose the correct size of backing rod?

A: Select a backing rod that is approximately 25% larger than the joint width. This ensures it stays in place and provides the correct depth for the sealant.

Q: Can I use this backing rod with any type of sealant?

A: Yes, Open Cell Backing Rod is compatible with a wide range of sealants, including acrylic, silicone, polyurethane, and hot pour types.

Q: What is the benefit of using an open-cell backing rod?

A: Open-cell backing rods allow sealants to cure from both sides, speeding up the curing process and improving overall sealant performance.

Q: Can this backing rod be used in swimming pools?

A: It is not recommended for internal swimming pool applications due to potential exposure to high levels of chlorine.

Q: How should I store this backing rod?

A: Store it in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C, away from direct sunlight, to maintain its quality and performance.
column54:
Backing Rod Open Cell limitations:

  • Not suitable for UV exposed applications.
  • Avoid excessive longitudinal stretching during installation.
  • Not suitable for internal swimming pool applications due to chlorine exposure.
  • Do not use where sealant is heated and applied above +70ºC.

Safety precautions when using Backing Rod Open Cell:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear appropriate gloves and eye protection if needed.
  • Ventilation: General ventilation is sufficient.
  • Handling: Handle with care to avoid excessive stretching.

Adheseal's Bond Breaker All Weather Tape is a specialized adhesive tape designed to optimize the performance of sealants in expansion joints. By preventing three-sided adhesion, this tape ensures that the sealant bonds only to the two opposing surfaces of the joint, allowing for maximum movement and flexibility. This is crucial in applications where expansion and contraction are expected, such as construction joints, control joints, and structural connections.

Key Features:

  • Prevents three-sided adhesion in joint sealing applications
  • Maximizes movement capabilities of sealants
  • Suitable for both indoor and outdoor use
  • Resistant to weather, UV radiation, and moisture
  • Easy to apply and remove
  • Compatible with a wide range of sealants

Uses:

  • Construction joints
  • Control joints
  • Expansion joints
  • Precast concrete connections
  • Window and door installations
  • Facade systems

Benefits:

  • Optimizes sealant performance and longevity
  • Allows for maximum joint movement and flexibility
  • Prevents sealant failure due to three-sided adhesion
  • Suitable for all weather conditions
  • Easy and efficient application

Application Guide:

  1. Clean and prepare the joint surfaces.
  2. Apply the Bond Breaker All Weather Tape to the bottom of the joint, ensuring it covers the entire width.
  3. Press the tape firmly to ensure good adhesion.
  4. Apply the sealant as per manufacturer's instructions.

column3:
Use E P Efflorescence Remover for: Removing stubborn efflorescence stains from masonry, brick, and concrete surfaces to restore clean appearance

E P Efflorescence Remover is a professional-grade cleaning solution designed to dissolve and eliminate unsightly efflorescence deposits from masonry, concrete, brickwork, and other porous substrates. This non-abrasive, acid-based cleaner penetrates deeply to break down mineral salt build-up, improving surface appearance and longevity. Ideal for both indoor and outdoor applications, E P Efflorescence Remover offers a safe and effective solution for tradespeople dealing with persistent surface staining.

Key Features of E P Efflorescence Remover

  • Rapidly dissolves mineral salt deposits for clean, restored surfaces
  • Safe for use on most masonry and concrete without surface damage
  • Easy-to-use formula requiring minimal scrubbing or mechanical effort
  • Suitable for use in residential, commercial, and industrial settings

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Acid-based cleaning solution with surfactants
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • pH Level: Approx. 2 (Highly acidic)
  • Coverage Rate: 5–10 m² per litre depending on surface porosity

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Plastic bucket, stiff brush, PPE (gloves, eye protection), water source
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Pre-wet the surface to prevent deep acid penetration and ensure even application
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For stubborn stains, reapply and allow longer dwell time before scrubbing

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry, well-ventilated area away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 24 months from manufacture date if unopened
  • Temperature Considerations: Keep between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • Complies with Australian Work Health and Safety (WHS) Regulations
  • Non-flammable classification per Australian Dangerous Goods Code
column7: brick,civil construction-i,cleaner,cleaning,concrete-s,container,flooring-i,masonry,preparation & remedial,stone,surface preparation,tiling-i,waterproofing-a
column32: EP Efflorescence Remover for Masonry & Concrete Surfaces | Adheseal
column33: Effectively remove efflorescence from masonry and concrete with E P Efflorescence Remover. Safe, powerful, and easy to use for trade pros.
column52:
How to apply E P Efflorescence Remover:

  1. Pre-wet surface thoroughly with clean water
  2. Apply diluted remover evenly with brush or sprayer
  3. Allow product to dwell for 5–10 minutes
  4. Scrub surface with stiff brush to loosen deposits
  5. Rinse thoroughly with clean water and allow to dry
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About E P Efflorescence Remover

Q: How do I apply E P Efflorescence Remover?

A: Dilute the solution as required, apply to pre-wet surfaces, allow to dwell for 5–10 minutes, then scrub with a stiff brush and rinse thoroughly with clean water.

Q: Will this damage concrete or brick?

A: No, when used as directed on pre-wet surfaces, E P Efflorescence Remover safely cleans without etching or damaging masonry or concrete substrates.

Q: Is it safe for indoor use?

A: Yes, ensure proper ventilation when used indoors. Always follow safety guidelines including PPE and avoid prolonged inhalation of fumes.

Q: What should I do if staining persists?

A: Repeat application with increased dwell time, ensuring thorough scrubbing. For heavy build-up, multiple treatments may be necessary.

Q: How should I dispose of leftover product?

A: Dispose of in accordance with local regulations. Do not pour into drains. Contact your local waste authority for safe disposal options.
column54:
E P Efflorescence Remover limitations:

  • Not suitable for polished stone or acid-sensitive surfaces
  • May not remove deeply embedded or long-standing deposits in one application

Safety precautions when using E P Efflorescence Remover:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Safety goggles, gloves, and long sleeves
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas; avoid enclosed spaces without airflow
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; do not inhale vapours
  • Keep out of reach of children and store securely in original container

column3:
Use Plastabond PVA for: Enhancing mortar, screed, and render performance with improved adhesion, elasticity, and chemical resistance. Ideal for repairs and new construction.

Plastabond PVA bonding agent and plasticizer is a versatile additive designed to enhance the performance of mortars, renders, and floor screeds. Its polyvinyl acetate resin formulation provides excellent adhesion, increased strength, and greater elasticity, resulting in durable and long-lasting construction. This solvent-free product reduces water permeability and shrinkage, making it ideal for both patching and new construction. Plastabond also improves resistance to abrasion and chemical attack, ensuring superior performance in various environments.

Key Features of Plastabond PVA Bonding Agent

  • Excellent adhesion for improved bonding between layers.
  • Increased elasticity to prevent cracking and improve flexibility.
  • Enhanced mechanical strength for durable mortars and screeds.
  • Reduced water permeability and shrinkage for long-lasting results.
  • Improved resistance to abrasion and chemical attack for added durability.
  • Non-flammable and solvent-free, ensuring safer application.

Technical Overview

Plastabond is a polyvinyl acetate resin that cures through water dispersion, ensuring easy application and clean-up. Its density of 1.03 makes it a workable additive for various construction applications. The product is designed to enhance the physical properties of mortars and screeds, improving their overall performance and longevity.

Chemical Properties: Polyvinyl acetate resin, providing excellent adhesion and flexibility.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F). Ensure proper application and curing within this range for optimal results.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, measuring jugs, and mixing equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Adjust dilution rates based on specific project requirements. Ensure thorough mixing for consistent results. Apply bonding agent while film is tacky for best adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the mix is too thick, add more water; if too thin, add more Plastabond. Ensure proper mixing to prevent segregation.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Complies with relevant Australian building standards for PVA bonding agents.
column7: bonding,bottle,civil construction-i,concrete-s,construction,drum,durable,flooring-i,masonry,non toxic,render,solvent free,water cleanup,water resistant
column32: Plastabond PVA Bonding Agent | Mortar & Screed Additive | Adheseal
column33: Plastabond PVA improves mortar, screed, and render performance with excellent adhesion, elasticity, and strength. Solvent-free and easy to use.
column52:
How to apply Plastabond PVA Bonding Agent:

  1. Determine the appropriate dilution rate based on the application (plasticizer or bonding agent).
  2. Mix Plastabond with water thoroughly to achieve a consistent blend.
  3. For bonding agent application, apply the diluted mixture to the substrate and pour concrete while the film is tacky.
  4. For plasticizer application, mix the diluted solution with the mortar or screed until the desired consistency is achieved.
  5. Ensure proper curing by allowing the water to evaporate.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Plastabond PVA Bonding Agent

Q: How do I use Plastabond as a bonding agent?

A: Dilute Plastabond with water at a 4:1 ratio (Plastabond:water) and apply at approximately 8 square meters per litre. Pour concrete while the film is tacky for best adhesion.

Q: What is the dilution rate for Plastabond as a plasticiser?

A: Dilute between 1 part Plastabond to 10 parts water and 1 part Plastabond to 1 part water, depending on requirements. Mix with concrete until the desired consistency is achieved.

Q: Can Plastabond be used on insulation boards?

A: Yes, Plastabond improves the adhesion of renders to insulation boards. For polystyrene panels, refer to the technical data for acrylic bonding agents.

Q: How do I clean up Plastabond?

A: Uncured Plastabond can be easily cleaned up with water. Once cured, mechanical removal may be required.

Q: What are the storage requirements for Plastabond?

A: Store Plastabond in a cool, dry place between 10°C (50°F) and 35°C (95°F). Avoid freezing temperatures.
column54:
Plastabond PVA Bonding Agent limitations:

  • Not suitable for applications requiring high chemical resistance to strong solvents.
  • Proper dilution is crucial for optimal performance; incorrect ratios can lead to poor results.
  • Avoid application in freezing temperatures as it can affect curing and bonding.

Safety precautions when using Plastabond PVA Bonding Agent:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection to prevent skin and eye irritation.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application to minimize exposure to fumes.
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • Consult the MSDS for detailed safety information.

column3:
Use Acrylic Bonding Agent for: Enhancing mortar, renderings, and floor screeds.

Acrylic Bonding Agent is a versatile additive designed to significantly improve the performance of mortar, renderings, and floor screeds. This product enhances adhesion, elasticity, and strength, while also providing excellent water resistance. It is ideal for a wide range of applications, including patching, repairs, and creating wear-resistant surfaces. The non-flammable and solvent-free formulation makes it a safe and reliable choice for various construction projects.

Key Features of Acrylic Bonding Agent

  • Excellent Adhesion: Significantly improves bonding to concrete and steel.
  • Increased Strength: Enhances the mechanical strength of mortars and screeds.
  • Improved Elasticity: Provides greater flexibility and reduces cracking.
  • Water Resistance: Reduces water permeability and improves damp-proofing.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various construction needs, including repairs and wear-resistant toppings.
  • Non-Flammable and Solvent-Free: Safe and environmentally friendly.

Technical Overview

Acrylic Bonding Agent is designed to produce polymer-modified mortars with high mechanical strengths and good resistance to oil and water. It significantly improves adhesion to sandblasted concrete and steel, as demonstrated by adhesion strength tests. This product is formulated to enhance the durability and performance of construction materials.

Chemical Properties: Acrylic polymer emulsion.

Application Temperature Range: Not specified. Please consult technical data sheets for application temperature ranges of the mortars it is being added to.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, mixing equipment, application tools (trowel, brush, etc.).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and prepared before application. Follow recommended mixing ratios. Conduct tests to determine suitability for specific applications.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Skin irritation may occur in sensitive individuals; wear appropriate protective equipment. Ensure thorough mixing for consistent results.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry conditions.
  • Shelf Life Information: Not specified.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from freezing.

column32: Acrylic Bonding Agent | Mortar Enhancer | Adheseal

column52:
How to apply Acrylic Bonding Agent:

  1. Prepare the substrate by cleaning and removing loose materials.
  2. Mix Acrylic Bonding Agent with the mortar or screed according to the recommended ratio.
  3. Apply the mixture using appropriate tools (trowel, brush, etc.).
  4. Ensure even coverage and follow the curing instructions for the mortar or screed.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Acrylic Bonding Agent

Q: What is Acrylic Bonding Agent used for?

A: It is used to improve the adhesion, strength, and water resistance of mortar, renderings, and floor screeds. It's also used for patching, repairs, and creating wear-resistant surfaces.

Q: Is Acrylic Bonding Agent hazardous?

A: While not classified as hazardous, it may cause skin irritation in sensitive individuals. Consult the MSDS for detailed safety information.

Q: How do I store Acrylic Bonding Agent?

A: Store in cool, dry conditions, protected from freezing.

Q: What surfaces can Acrylic Bonding Agent be used on?

A: It can be used on concrete, steel, and other surfaces where improved adhesion of mortar, renderings, or screeds is required.

Q: How does Acrylic Bonding Agent improve mortar strength?

A: It forms a polymer matrix within the mortar, enhancing its tensile and flexural strength, and improving overall durability.

column2: FlexKrete Fumed Silica Powder – High Purity Synthetic Silicon Dioxide
column3:
Everkrete Fumed Silica is a synthetic, amorphous, colloidal silicon dioxide renowned for its unique particle characteristics. With an extremely small particle size, vast surface area, high purity, and chain-forming tendencies, it stands apart as a remarkable material. This light, fluffy, and white powder finds its applications across various industries, owing to its exceptional properties.

Functions

  • Rheology Control: Adjusts the flow behavior and viscosity of materials.
  • Reinforcement: Enhances the mechanical properties of composites and rubber systems.
  • Free Flow: Reduces caking and improves powder flow.
  • Suspension: Keeps solid particles evenly distributed in liquid formulations.
  • Adsorbent: Absorbs and retains liquids or gases on its surface.

Applications

Flexkrete Fumed Silica finds application versatility in various industries:

  • Adhesives: Improves bonding and cohesion in adhesive formulations.
  • Coatings: Enhances thixotropy, stability, and anti-settling properties of coatings.
  • Composites: Reinforces composites, improving strength and dimensional stability.
  • Powder Coatings: Improves free flow and prevents caking in powder coating formulations.
  • Sealants: Enhances the thixotropic properties and stability of sealants.
  • Silicone Rubber Systems: Reinforces silicone rubber and controls viscosity.

Overhead Applications

EverKrete 102 Resin x 1 part
Fumed Silica x 2 parts
Fine Kiln Dried Sand x 1.5 parts

Vertical Applications

EverKrete 102 Resin x 1 part
Fumed Silica x 1 part
Fine Kiln Dried Sand x 2 parts
column7: special order
column32: Everkrete Fumed Silica - Versatile Synthetic Powder for Various Industries
column33: High-purity fumed silica for rheology, reinforcement, and free flow in adhesives, coatings, and composites.
column52:
How to apply Fumed Silica Powder – High Purity Synthetic Silicon Dioxide:

  1. Pre-weigh the required amount using a digital scale in a well-ventilated area
  2. Slowly add the powder to your base formulation under low-speed stirring
  3. Switch to high-shear mixing to fully incorporate and break down any agglomerates
  4. Continue blending until a uniform, lump-free consistency is achieved
  5. Use immediately or store sealed to prevent moisture contamination
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Fumed Silica Powder – High Purity Synthetic Silicon Dioxide

Q: How should I add fumed silica to my formulations?

A: Fumed silica should be slowly sprinkled into the formulation under continuous mixing to avoid dusting and ensure even dispersion. Use a high-shear mixer for optimal incorporation.

Q: What performance benefits does it provide in adhesives?

A: In adhesives, fumed silica enhances thixotropy, prevents sagging on vertical surfaces, and improves the mechanical strength and durability of the final bond line.

Q: Is this product compatible with water-based or solvent-based systems?

A: Yes, fumed silica is compatible with both water-based and solvent-based systems, but requires different dispersion methods depending on the medium to avoid clumping.

Q: What if I notice clumping during application?

A: Clumping can occur if not dispersed properly. Re-mixing using a high-speed disperser typically restores uniformity. Pre-wetting the silica can also reduce lumping.

Q: Are there any safety concerns when handling this powder?

A: Always wear a dust mask, gloves, and goggles during handling. Ensure good ventilation to prevent inhalation. Avoid creating airborne dust during mixing or pouring.
column54:
Fumed Silica Powder – High Purity Synthetic Silicon Dioxide limitations:

  • Not suitable for formulations requiring a neutral pH – pH is mildly acidic
  • May agglomerate if exposed to moisture during storage or mixing
  • Requires high-shear equipment for full dispersion in viscous systems
  • May contribute to dusting if not handled in controlled conditions

Safety precautions when using Fumed Silica Powder – High Purity Synthetic Silicon Dioxide:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Dust mask (P2/N95), gloves, protective eyewear
  • Ventilation: Use in a well-ventilated space or under extraction hood
  • Handling: Avoid generating dust; do not inhale; wash hands thoroughly after use
  • Keep container tightly sealed when not in use to prevent airborne particles

column3:
Use Sikalastic®-1K for: Waterproofing tanks, bathrooms, balconies, and protecting concrete structures from freeze-thaw and carbon dioxide attack.

Sikalastic®-1K is a high-performance, one-component, fibre-reinforced mortar designed for flexible waterproofing and concrete protection. Its unique formulation, based on cement modified with special alkali-resistant polymers, ensures excellent crack-bridging ability and strong adhesion to various substrates. This product is ideal for both interior and exterior applications, providing reliable protection against water ingress and environmental damage. Suitable for use in contact with drinking water, Sikalastic®-1K offers a durable and versatile solution for diverse construction projects.

Key Features of Sikalastic®-1K

  • One-Component Formulation: Simplifies mixing and application, reducing labour time.
  • Excellent Crack-Bridging Ability: Ensures long-lasting protection in dynamic environments.
  • Strong Adhesion: Bonds effectively to concrete, cement mortars, stone, and masonry.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for brush, trowel, and spray application.
  • Drinking Water Safe: Certified for use in contact with drinking water.

Technical Overview

Sikalastic®-1K is a light grey, cementitious mortar with a maximum grain size of approximately 0.3 mm. It exhibits exceptional crack-bridging ability, tensile adhesion strength, and <\ctrl75>```html capillary absorption. The product provides reliable water penetration resistance under pressure and negative pressure, and it is permeable to water vapor while offering excellent resistance to carbon dioxide. Its Euroclass A2 reaction to fire rating ensures safety in various applications.

Chemical Properties: Cement modified with alkali resistant polymers, selected aggregates, fine fillers admixtures, additives and fibres.

Application Temperature Range: Apply between 5°C and 35°C for optimal performance. Substrate temperature should also be within this range.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Low-speed hand drill mixer, brush, trowel, or spray equipment. Sika® Seal Tape S or Sikadur Combiflex® SG System for joints.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure substrates are structurally sound, clean, and properly dampened. Follow specific mixing ratios for brush or trowel application. Apply in at least two layers for standard applications.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Do not smooth with a float or trowel. Protect from rain for 24-48 hours after application. Avoid direct contact with chlorinated water without protection.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store properly in the original packaging, in cool and dry conditions. Protect from water.
  • Shelf Life Information: 6 months from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Store in conditions that protect the product from water damage and extreme temperatures.

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 4020: 2005 - Products for use in contact with drinking water.
  • AS 4654.1: 2012 - Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground materials.
  • EN 14891:2012 / AC:2012 - CE-marking and Declaration of Performance as liquid-applied water impermeable product.
  • EN 1504-2:2004 - CE-marking and Declaration of Performance as surface protection product for concrete.
  • EN 1062-7, EN 1542, EN 1062-3, EN 12390-8, UNI 8298/8, EN ISO 7783-1, EN 1062-6, EN 13687-1, EN 13501-1 - Compliance with various European and Australian standards.

column33: Sikalastic®-1K is a one-component, fibre-reinforced mortar for flexible waterproofing and concrete protection.
column52:
How to apply Sikalastic®-1K:

  1. Prepare the substrate to be structurally sound, clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Mix Sikalastic®-1K with water according to the application method (brush or trowel).
  3. Apply Sikalastic®-1K by brush, trowel, or spray, ensuring uniform coverage.
  4. Apply in at least 2 layers for standard applications, or 3-4 mm DFT for negative pressure/immersed applications.
  5. Wait until the first layer is dry before applying subsequent layers.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Sikalastic®-1K

Q: What is Sikalastic®-1K used for?

A: Sikalastic®-1K is used for flexible waterproofing and protection of concrete structures, including tanks, basins, pipes, bathrooms, showers, terraces, balconies, swimming pools, external wall surfaces, and for the flexible protection coating of reinforced concrete.

Q: How do you apply Sikalastic®-1K?

A: Sikalastic®-1K can be applied by brush, spray, or trowel. For optimal waterproofing performance, apply by trowel in at least 2 layers to a total thickness of at least 3 mm. When applying by brush, apply in a minimum of 2-3 layers, with each layer being a maximum of 1 mm thick.

Q: Is Sikalastic®-1K suitable for use in contact with drinking water?

A: Yes, Sikalastic®-1K is certified according to AS/NZS 4020: 2005 for use in contact with drinking water. However, ensure it is completely hardened and wash carefully before contact, following local regulations.

Q: What surface preparation is required before applying Sikalastic®-1K?

A: Substrates must be structurally sound, clean, dry, and free of contaminants. Clean surfaces by blast cleaning, high-pressure water-jetting, wire-brushing, grinding, etc. Repair concrete substrates as necessary.

Q: What are the storage requirements for Sikalastic®-1K?

A: Sikalastic®-1K should be stored properly in the original packaging, in cool and dry conditions. Protect it from water. The shelf life is 6 months from the date of production.
column54:
Sikalastic®-1K limitations:

  • Sikalastic®-1K shall not be smoothed using a float or trowel.
  • Protect from rain for at least 24–48 h after application.
  • Avoid direct contact with chlorinated water i.e. in swimming pools, by using suitable protection.
  • Avoid application in direct sun light, when rain is imminent or in strong winds.

Safety precautions when using Sikalastic®-1K:

  • For information and advice on the safe handling, storage and disposal of chemical products, users shall refer to the most recent Safety Data Sheet (SDS) containing physical, ecological, toxicological and other safety-related data.

column2: Azcothane Reo Polyurethane Fortified Waterproofing Membrane
column3:
Use Azcothane Reo for: Waterproofing balconies, terraces, showers, podiums, and wet areas where flexibility and durability are required

Azcothane Reo is a premium polyurethane-fortified, water-based waterproofing membrane designed for superior performance in demanding Australian conditions. Internally reinforced with microfibres, it eliminates the need for external fabric, ensuring easier and faster application. Azcothane Reo is ideal for use on balconies, terraces, wet areas, and podiums, providing a bonded, seamless finish that won’t re-emulsify. With excellent elongation, low VOCs, and compatibility with direct-stick tiles and renders, it’s a go-to solution for trades who demand reliability, efficiency, and compliance with AS 4654.1 and AS 4858 standards.

Key Features of Azcothane Reo

  • Microfibre reinforcement eliminates the need for fabric, saving time
  • Water-based with easy water cleanup, reducing solvent exposure
  • Seamless application with excellent adhesion to multiple surfaces
  • Meets Class III membrane standards (AS 4654.1 and AS 4858)
  • Low VOC, bitumen-free, and compatible with Virotuff range
  • Suitable for direct stick tiling and rendering

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane dispersion, acrylic hybrid, microfibre-reinforced
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Elongation at Break: 311%
  • Tensile Strength: 1.32 MPa
  • Water Vapour Transmission Rate: 6.36 g/m²/24hr
  • % Solids By Volume: 57%

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Medium-nap roller (9–13mm), brush, primer (e.g., Duram Primeseal MC)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use two coats for full waterproofing; embed Durascrim for reinforcement
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid wet substrates; consult Tremco CPG for high-chlorine or below-grade applications

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Cool, dry, upright in original sealed packaging
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from production date
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • AS 4858: Wet Area Membranes (Australian Standard)
  • AS 4654.1: External Above Ground Membranes (Class III)

column33: Duram Azcothane Reo is a fibre-reinforced, water-based waterproofing membrane ideal for balconies, showers, and podiums. Easy application and low VOC.
column52:
How to apply Azcothane Reo:

  1. Prepare the substrate by cleaning, drying, and removing any laitance or contaminants
  2. Prime using Duram Primeseal MC or equivalent based on substrate porosity
  3. Apply the first coat with a medium-nap roller at 1m²/L, achieving 0.5mm dry film thickness
  4. Allow to dry 4–24 hours, then apply the second coat in the same manner
  5. Allow full cure for 96 hours before tiling, rendering, or topping
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Azcothane Reo

Q: How do I apply Azcothane Reo correctly?

A: Apply using a medium-nap (9–13mm) roller in two coats at 1m²/L per coat, ensuring the surface is clean, dry, and primed. Allow 4–24 hours between coats and cure fully before tiling.

Q: How does Azcothane Reo perform under movement?

A: Azcothane Reo has an elongation at break of 311%, allowing excellent flexibility. It passes cyclic movement tests and is suitable for areas with minor substrate movement.

Q: What surfaces can Azcothane Reo be applied to?

A: It is suitable for concrete, masonry, cementitious screeds, lightweight composite sheeting, and many general building substrates. Always test for compatibility in unusual conditions.

Q: What should I do if the substrate is damp?

A: Azcothane Reo must not be applied to wet substrates. Use moisture testing per ASTM F2170 or F2659. For damp areas, consult Tremco CPG for vapor-retardant priming solutions.

Q: Is Azcothane Reo safe to use indoors?

A: Yes. It has low VOC levels, water clean-up, and does not require solvent handling, making it ideal for indoor use in wet areas like bathrooms and laundries.
column54:
Azcothane Reo limitations:

  • Not suitable for use in areas exposed to high concentrations of chlorine
  • Do not apply to wet or damp substrates – proper moisture testing is essential
  • Not designed for trafficable surfaces or below-grade applications
  • Not recommended for use in planter boxes

Safety precautions when using Azcothane Reo:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use gloves, safety goggles, and appropriate workwear
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow when working indoors
  • Handling: Avoid contact with eyes and skin; clean spills immediately with water
  • Read and understand the Safety Data Sheet before use
