  • Seamless, bonded membrane delivers superior long-term waterproofing protection
  • Low VOC and bitumen-free formula ensures environmental compliance

column2: Everflex WPUV Premium Grade UV Class 3 Waterproof Membrane
column3:
Use Everflex WPUV for: Waterproofing roofs, balconies, wet areas, and under tile applications in UV exposed environments.

Everflex WPUV is a premium-grade, single-component, self-reinforced elastomeric waterproof membrane formulated for UV exposed applications. This Class 3 membrane provides a durable, flexible, and seamless waterproof barrier, ensuring long-term protection against water damage. Compliant with Australian standards, it is suitable for both internal and external use, making it ideal for roofs, balconies, and wet areas.

Key Features of Everflex WPUV

  • High UV Resistance: Specifically formulated for prolonged UV exposure.
  • Class 3 Waterproofing: Provides a high level of waterproofing protection.
  • Micro Fibre Reinforced: Enhances strength and durability.
  • High Flexibility: Accommodates building movement without cracking.
  • Low VOC: Environmentally friendly and safe for indoor use.

Why Choose Everflex WPUV:

  • Long-Term Durability: Resists weathering and water damage.
  • Easy Application: Single-component, ready to use.
  • Australian Standards Compliance: Meets NCC, AS4858, and AS4654.1 standards.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for various internal and external applications.

When to Choose Everflex WPUV versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Everflex WPUV over standard membranes when: UV exposure is a primary concern, and long-term durability is required.
  • Consider other options when: Areas are subject to negative hydrostatic pressure or rising damp.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Higher initial cost but reduces long-term maintenance and replacement costs due to superior UV resistance and durability.

Trade-Specific Applications for Everflex WPUV:

For Waterproofers:

  • Use for waterproofing exposed roofs and balconies, ensuring long-term UV protection.
  • Apply in wet areas like showers and laundries for reliable water barrier.
  • Detail joints and penetrations with Hi-Flex MS sealant for complete waterproofing.

For Tilers:

  • Apply as an under tile waterproofing membrane for wet areas and external spaces.
  • Ensure proper surface preparation and priming for optimal adhesion.
  • Use tile adhesives compatible with Everflex WPUV for secure tiling.

Technical Overview

Everflex WPUV is a premium-grade elastomeric waterproof membrane designed for UV exposed applications. It provides a Class 3 waterproof barrier with high flexibility and durability. The product is water-based, low VOC, and easy to apply, making it suitable for various internal and external waterproofing projects.

Application: Apply in two coats witha minimum 1mm dry film thickness. Priming is recommended, and proper surface preparation is essential.

Physical Properties: Elastomeric, high flexibility, micro fibre reinforced, and compliant with Australian standards.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, film thickness gauge, and safety equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper substrate preparation, use the recommended primer, and apply in two coats at right angles.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor adhesion (proper surface prep), insufficient film thickness (apply additional coats), and cracking (use appropriate joint detailing).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from freezing and extreme heat.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Complies with NCC, AS4858:2004, and AS4654.1:2012 standards.
  • Refer to the product's test certificates for specific details.
column7: AS4654.1:212,AS4858,Green Star Compliant,balcony,basements,bathroom,block work,brick,concrete-s,construction,decks,durable,epoxy-s,external,fibre cement sheet,flexible,green tag certified,internal,kitchens,liquid applied,low voc,masonry,membrane,non toxic,non-porous,pail,polyurethane-s,porous,quick drying,roof & gutter,rooftops,screed,shower,single pack,solvent free,tiling-i,trafficable,undertile,uv stable,water based,water cleanup,waterproofing-a,wet areas,wood-i
column32: Everflex WPUV | UV Resistant Waterproofing Membrane | Adheseal
column33: Everflex WPUV: Premium UV resistant, Class 3 waterproof membrane. Ideal for exposed roofs, balconies, and wet areas. Complies with Australian standards.
column52:
How to apply Everflex WPUV:

  1. Ensure surfaces are sound, stable, dry, clean, and free of contaminants.
  2. Prime the surface with the appropriate Adheseal primer (WBP for internal, VBS for external).
  3. Mix Everflex WPUV thoroughly before use.
  4. Apply the first coat with a brush or roller to achieve a 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  5. Allow the first coat to dry.
  6. Apply a second coat at a right angle to the first coat, also at 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  7. Ensure a minimum dry film thickness of 1mm is achieved.
  8. For joints and penetrations, use Hi-Flex MS sealant and consider reinforcing fabric.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex WPUV

Q: Is Everflex WPUV suitable for external use?

A: Yes, Everflex WPUV is specifically formulated for UV exposed applications and is suitable for both internal and external use.

Q: Do I need to prime the surface before applying Everflex WPUV?

A: Priming is always recommended, especially on porous and warm surfaces. Use Everflex WBP for internal applications and Everflex VBS for external applications.

Q: What is the minimum dry film thickness required?

A: A minimum of two coats is required to achieve a minimum dry film thickness (DFT) of 1mm.

Q: How long does Everflex WPUV take to cure?

A: Allow approximately 48 hours of cure time at 25°C and 50% humidity before tiling. Cure times vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.

Q: Can I tile directly over Everflex WPUV?

A: Yes, Everflex WPUV is a tile adhesive friendly membrane. RLA and Gripset have confirmed suitability of specific adhesives. Confirm suitability with the adhesive manufacturer.

Q: What are the limitations of Everflex WPUV?

A: Do not apply below 10°C or above 35°C, on damp or contaminated surfaces, or in areas subject to negative hydrostatic pressure or rising damp. It is designed for maintenance foot traffic only.
column54:
Everflex WPUV limitations:

  • Do not use when temperatures are below 10°C or above 35°C.
  • Do not apply on damp, wet, or contaminated substrates.
  • Not suitable for areas subject to negative hydrostatic pressure or rising damp.
  • Foot traffic greater than maintenance.

Safety precautions when using Everflex WPUV:

  • First Aid: If poisoning occurs, contact a doctor or Poisons Information Centre (131 126 in Australia).
  • Inhalation: Remove victim to fresh air. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist.
  • Skin Contact: Wash with soap and water.
  • Eye Contact: Rinse with water. Consult a doctor.
  • Ingestion: Do not induce vomiting. Seek medical attention.
  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, apron, safety glasses, and a respirator. Use with adequate ventilation.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information.
column55: Everflex WPUV is a premium-grade, single-component, self-reinforced elastomeric waterproof membrane designed for UV exposed applications.
column56:
Everflex WPUV can be used on the following substrates:

  • Concrete (after 28 days curing)
  • 3:1 sand cement screed or C-Bed
  • Masonry/render (after 4 days curing)
  • Cement sheeting/underlay/external weatherboard/blue board
  • Pre-cast concrete (after release agent removal)
  • Wet area plasterboard/Villaboard
  • Timber flooring (structural plywood Type A)
  • Brickwork, Hebel (aggregate block)
column57:
Use Everflex WPUV for:

  • Waterproofing exposed roofs and under pedestal systems.
  • Waterproofing wet areas such as showers, laundries, toilets, and kitchens.
  • Waterproofing patios, terraces, decks, and balconies.
  • Use as an under tile waterproofing membrane.

Why Use Everflex WPUV for:

  • Providing a durable and flexible waterproof barrier.
  • Ensuring long-term protection in UV exposed environments.
  • Meeting Australian standards for waterproofing.
  • Offering ease of application and cleanup.

column2: Duram Durabit Reo Water-Based Synthetic Latex Waterproofing Membrane
column3:
Duram Durabit Reo is a water-based synthetic latex Polymer emulsion (SBR) that incorporates microfibres, reinforcing the liquid applied waterproofing membrane internally. It meets the criteria of AS4858:2004 Wet Area Membranes, AS4654.1 2012 Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground use, and the 'Green Star' environmental criteria.

Uses:

  • Balconies
  • Terraces
  • Decks
  • Podiums
  • Tiled or covered areas
  • Shower recess & wet areas
  • Retaining walls
  • Planters and landscaped areas
  • Structural slabs
  • Concrete
  • Tile adhesives
  • Cement and cement render
  • FC and CFC Sheeting
  • Block & Brick work
  • Masonry/Stone
  • FC, CFC, asbestos, and Blue board sheeting
  • Particle board (see notes below)
  • Scyon & composite sheeting
  • Acrylic coatings
  • Vitreous, ceramic & terra cotta tiles
  • Bitumen (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC)
  • Metal (when primed with Duram ME Primer)
  • Timber, Particle Board, Plywood (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC)*
  • Masonite
  • Plaster board
  • Extruded foam
  • Fibreglass/Gelcoat/PVC

Benefits:

  • Elastomeric and environmentally friendly membrane
  • Durable, odourless, and impervious
  • Seamless membrane that does not re-emulsify when fully cured
  • Does not stain grout or tiles
  • Chemical resistance and inhibits biological growth
  • No need for external reinforcing, making it easier and quicker to use

The Duram Durabit Range of products has been an industry leader for over 20 years in Synthetic latex (SBR) waterproofing technology.

column3:
Use Everflex WPM for: Waterproofing wet areas, balconies, terraces, and under-tile applications in both internal and external environments.

Everflex WPM is a single-component, self-reinforced elastomeric waterproof membrane specifically formulated for under-tile applications. Tested to AS-4858:2004 and AS4654.1 standards, it meets the requirements for both internal and external use. Once cured, it forms a Class 3 waterproof barrier that is durable, flexible, and odourless. Its water-based formulation allows for easy cleanup and meets Green Star environmental criteria. The membrane's low permeability makes it suitable for timber floors, and its micro-fibre reinforcement enhances its strength and durability.

Key Features of Everflex WPM

  • Rapid drying for earlier tiling, reducing project timelines.
  • High permanent flexibility (Class III) to accommodate substrate movement.
  • Low permeability, suitable for use on timber floors.
  • Micro-fibre reinforced for enhanced durability and strength.
  • Low VOC and non-toxic, meeting Green Star environmental criteria.
  • Does not re-emulsify when immersed in water, ensuring long-term performance.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Single-component, elastomeric waterproof membrane
  • Application Temperature Range: +10°C to +35°C (50°F to 95°F)
  • Service Temperature Range: -40°C to +80°C (-40°F to 176°F)
  • Elongation: 391% (AS 4858 Class III)
  • Permeability: 3.92 g/m²/24h (ASTM E96)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, film thickness gauge.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper surface preparation and priming. Apply two coats at right angles to achieve the required dry film thickness. Use Adheseal PU or Hi-Flex MS sealant for waste outlets and penetrations.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application on damp or contaminated substrates. Ensure proper curing to prevent delamination. Use the correct primer for the substrate and application.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between +10°C and +35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • AS 4858:2004 compliant (Class III).
  • AS 4654.1:2012 compliant.
  • Green Star compliant (VOC < 1 g/L).

column52:
How to apply Everflex WPM:

  1. Prepare the surface: ensure it is clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Prime the substrate: use Everflex WBP for internal or Everflex VBS for external.
  3. Apply the first coat: use a brush or roller to achieve a 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  4. Apply the second coat: at right angles to the first, also 0.75mm wet film thickness.
  5. Verify thickness: use a film thickness gauge to ensure proper DFT.
  6. Allow curing: approximately 48 hours at 25°C and 50% humidity.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex WPM

Q: Can Everflex WPM be used for external applications?

A: Yes, Everflex WPM is suitable for both internal and external applications, including balconies and terraces, when applied according to the technical data sheet and relevant standards.

Q: How long does Everflex WPM take to cure before tiling?

A: Allow approximately 48 hours of cure time at 25°C and 50% humidity before tiling. Cure times may vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.

Q: Do I need to prime the substrate before applying Everflex WPM?

A: Priming is recommended, especially on porous and warm surfaces. Use Everflex WBP for internal applications and Everflex VBS for external applications like roof decks and balconies.

Q: What is the required dry film thickness for Everflex WPM?

A: A minimum of two coats is required to achieve a dry film thickness (DFT) of 1mm for internal applications and 1.3mm for external applications.

Q: Can Everflex WPM be used on timber floors?

A: Yes, Everflex WPM's low permeability makes it suitable for use on timber floors, including structural plywood Type A (PAA JAS-ANZ).
column54:
Everflex WPM limitations:

  • Do not use when temperatures are below 10°C or above 35°C.
  • Limited UV resistance; must be tiled or topped.
  • Do not apply on damp, wet, or contaminated substrates.
  • Not suitable as an exposed membrane.
  • Not suitable for areas subject to negative hydrostatic pressure or rising damp.

Safety precautions when using Everflex WPM:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash thoroughly after use.

column3:
Primeseal MC is a high-performance, water-based epoxy waterproof membrane, primer, and sealer designed to protect and waterproof various surfaces. It is suitable for both negative (inside) and positive (outside) surfaces and can be used on damp and newly laid concrete, making it ideal for waterproofing basements, retaining walls, lift wells, and cellars. Moreover, it can be applied to concrete or cementitious structures, serving as an effective moisture barrier.

Suitable Surfaces:

Primeseal MC can be applied to a wide range of surfaces, including concrete, cement render, FC and CFC sheeting, block & brickwork, masonry/stone, acrylic coatings, tiles (vitreous, ceramic & terra cotta), bitumen (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC), metal (when primed with Duram ME Primer), timber, particle board, plywood (when primed with Duram Primeseal MC), plasterboard, extruded foam, and fiberglass/Gelcoat/PVC. It also acts as an excellent primer for waterproofing membranes, paints, and industrial coatings.

Additional Uses:

Primeseal MC serves as a general and universal primer for various substrates and can act as a milled aluminum etch primer for water stop angles. It can be used as a sealer coat over bitumen surfaces, enabling the application of solvent and water-based waterproofing membranes and other coatings. Additionally, it can be used as a sealer over damp surfaces to facilitate the application of urethane-based waterproofing membranes. Furthermore, it acts as an intercoat bridging coating to allow the application of incompatible coatings.

Limitations:

While Primeseal MC is a versatile product, it has low flexibility and is not intended to bridge live cracks or expansion joints. It is crucial to apply the product within the temperature range of 10ºC to 35ºC, and curing requires a temperature exceeding 10ºC and relative humidity below 85%. Adequate ventilation and heating should be utilized when curing conditions are not met.

Benefits and Advantages:

Primeseal MC boasts several benefits, making it a user and environmentally friendly choice. It is solvent-free with negligible odor and meets the 'Green Star' environmental criteria. The membrane can be applied to damp and newly laid concrete surfaces, acting as a barrier against low water vapor pressure. Primeseal MC is suitable for contact with potable (drinking) water and is non-toxic and non-flammable, making it safe for sensitive areas. It offers excellent water barrier properties and adheres well to most existing coatings.

Coverage and Drying:

The coverage of Primeseal MC varies depending on the surface and application technique. As an effective waterproofing membrane, a minimum of 2 coats applied at 3m² per litre per coat is recommended, with a dry film thickness of 0.33mm. Drying and curing times are influenced by various factors, including temperature and humidity. It is essential to allow the membrane to achieve full cure before applying subsequent treatments or coatings.
column32: Duram Primeseal MC - Water-Based Epoxy Barrier Membrane
column33: Duram Primeseal MC is a water-based epoxy barrier membrane, perfect for waterproofing and sealing damp and newly laid concrete surfaces. It forms a strong, hydrostatic pressure resistant barrier and is suitable for potable water applications.

column2: Primer VBS Water Based Epoxy Sealer & Waterproofing
column3:
Use Everflex VBS for: Priming damp substrates, negative pressure vapor barriers, and sealing green concrete.

Everflex VBS is a high-performance, 2-part water-based epoxy designed for professional use. It serves as an effective primer for damp substrates and a robust vapor barrier capable of withstanding up to 25m of hydrostatic pressure. Its low VOC formulation and rapid drying properties make it an ideal choice for both internal and external applications. This product ensures excellent adhesion to various building materials, providing a durable and reliable solution for preventing water seepage and permeation.

Key Features of Everflex VBS

  • Damp Substrate Priming: Effectively primes damp concrete, screeds, and masonry, ensuring strong adhesion for subsequent coatings.
  • Negative Pressure Vapor Barrier: Withstands up to 25m of hydrostatic pressure, ideal for below-ground applications and preventing water ingress.
  • Low VOC Formulation: Environmentally friendly and safe for indoor use, meeting "Green Star" criteria.
  • Rapid Drying: Allows for earlier overcoating, increasing project efficiency.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various substrates, including concrete, timber, and masonry.
  • Durable and Long-Lasting: Once fully cured, it does not re-emulsify, ensuring long-term performance.

Technical Overview

Everflex VBS is a 2-part water-based epoxy system designed for optimal performance in demanding conditions. Its low water vapor permeance and high hydrostatic pressure resistance make it an excellent choice for vapor barrier applications. The product's consistency allows for easy brush or roller application, ensuring even coverage and a continuous film build. The ability to create a repair paste with Portland cement and kiln-dried sand adds to its versatility.

Chemical Properties: Water-based epoxy, providing a durable and chemically resistant barrier.

Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F), ensuring reliable application in various climates.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Electric mixer, brush, roller, mixing containers, and appropriate PPE.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for optimal performance. For highly porous substrates, use a 20% diluted coat as a primer. Repair all cracks and holes before application. Apply subsequent coats within the recoat window for best adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor adhesion can occur if surfaces are not properly prepared. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of contaminants. Inaccurate mixing can lead to poor curing; always mix in a 1:1 ratio.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 35°C (41°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 2 years.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Meets "Green Star" environmental criteria.
column7: basements,bathroom,bitumen-s,block work,brick,civil construction-i,concrete,construction,durable,epoxy,external,fast cure,fibre cement sheet,internal,kitchens,masonry-i,membrane,moisture resistant,pail,plasterboard,primer,render,retaining walls,screed,sealer,sheet metal-i,shower,tiling-i,timber sheeting-s,two part,undertile,vapour barrier,water based,water tank,waterproofing-a,waterproofing-i,wet areas
column32: Everflex VBS Vapour Barrier System & Primer | Adheseal
column33: Everflex VBS is a versatile, water-based epoxy vapour barrier and primer, ideal for damp substrates, waterproofing, and preventing water seepage. Durable and eco-friendly.
column52:
How to apply Everflex VBS:

  1. Prepare the Surface: Ensure the surface is clean, dry, and free of contaminants. Repair any cracks or holes.
  2. Mix the Components: Pre-stir Part A and Part B separately. Combine in a 1:1 volume ratio and mix thoroughly with an electric mixer.
  3. Primer Application: Apply by brush or roller at 4-6 m²/L. For porous substrates, use a 20% diluted coat first.
  4. Vapor Barrier Application: Apply a primer coat (10% diluted), followed by at least two undiluted coats at 5 m²/L per coat. Aim for a 0.33mm dry film thickness.
  5. Overcoating: Apply subsequent coatings within 4-24 hours. If outside this window, apply an additional coat of VBS.
  6. Clean Up: Clean tools with water while the product is wet. Cured product requires mechanical removal.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex VBS

Q: Can Everflex VBS be applied to damp concrete?

A: Yes, Everflex VBS is specifically designed for priming damp substrates, including concrete, screeds, and masonry.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Everflex VBS?

A: The mixing ratio is a simple 1:1 by weight or volume. Mix Part A and Part B thoroughly until a uniform color is achieved.

Q: Can Everflex VBS be used as a negative pressure vapor barrier?

A: Yes, Everflex VBS can withstand up to 25m of hydrostatic pressure, making it ideal for negative pressure vapor barrier applications.

Q: What is the recoat time for Everflex VBS?

A: The recoat time is 4-24 hours. If the subsequent coating cannot be applied within this window, an additional coat of VBS is advised.

Q: How do I clean up Everflex VBS?

A: While the product is still wet, tools and spills can be cleaned with water. Cured product can be removed by mechanical means.

Q: What are the limitations of Everflex VBS?

A: Do not apply to metallic surfaces, use when temperatures are below 10°C or above 35°C, or apply to surfaces with standing or flowing water. Limited UV resistance requires overcoating for external applications.

Q: Can Everflex VBS be tinted?

A: Everflex VBS is supplied in light grey but can be tinted. Contact Adheseal's technical department for more information.
column54:
Everflex VBS limitations:

  • Do not apply to metallic surfaces.
  • Do not use when temperatures are below 10°C or above 35°C.
  • Limited UV resistance; requires overcoating for external applications.
  • Do not apply to surfaces with standing or flowing water.
  • Not suitable as an exposed coating.

Safety precautions when using Everflex VBS:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear rubber boots, gloves, apron, safety glasses, and a respirator if needed.
  • Ventilation: Use with adequate ventilation. If inhalation risk exists, wear an organic vapor/particulate respirator.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • First Aid: Refer to the Safety Data Sheets for detailed first aid information for Part A and Part B.
column55: Everflex VBS is a high-performance, water-based epoxy system for damp substrates, waterproofing, and priming. It offers rapid drying, durability, and eco-friendliness.

Why Use Everflex VBS:

  • Durability: Provides a tough, durable barrier that does not re-emulsify.
  • High Hydrostatic Resistance: Withstands up to 25m of pressure, ideal for demanding applications.
  • Rapid Drying: Allows for faster overcoating and project completion.

column3:
The Bostik N49 Primer is a clear, one-part primer designed to enhance the adhesion of Bostik polyurethane sealants on porous substrates. It ensures a strong bond, particularly in water-immersed applications. Ideal for use with Bostik Seal N Flex® 1, Bostik Seal N Flex® FC, Bostik Construction PU, and Bostik Fireban® One on porous surfaces like concrete, render, brick, blockwork, lightweight blocks, and unglazed ceramic tiles.

Product Features:

  • Promotes high bond strength of polyurethane sealants on porous substrates
  • Clear appearance for neat application
  • One part - no mixing required for ease of use

Product Characteristics:

  • Colour: Clear
  • Appearance: Thin, colourless liquid
  • Coverage: 1 litre covers approximately 50 lineal metres of joint per litre
  • Drying Time: 15 minutes
  • Composition: Moisture sensitive

Surface Preparation:

Before applying Bostik N49 Primer, ensure the substrate is sound, dry, clean, and free from any dust, residue, or contamination. Follow the substrate preparation guidelines detailed in the applicable Polyurethane Sealant Technical Data Sheet.

Application:

Bostik N49 Primer is formulated for use on porous substrates such as concrete, render, and masonry. Apply it with a soft brush and allow a minimum drying time of 15 minutes before applying the sealant. Please note that this primer is not suitable for non-porous substrates like hard plastics and ferrous or non-ferrous metals.

Application Tips:

  1. Decant the required quantity that can be applied by brush within 30 minutes into a clean, dry container.
  2. Primer that changes colour or becomes thicker has commenced to cure and should be discarded.
  3. Avoid dipping the same brush into the original container unless the entire contents are applied in 30 minutes.
  4. Use a clean, dry container on each decant to avoid contamination and shortened pot life.
  5. Discard any unused primer; do not pour any unused primer back into any remaining original primer in the original container.

Primer Yield Guide:

1 litre of primer will coat approximately 50 lineal metres of concrete joint interface, depending on wastage and substrate type.

Storage and Shelf Life:

Store the primer between 5°C and 30°C. Shelf life is twelve months in the original unopened container.

Duram Superprime 7110 is a versatile, polyurethane-based bonding agent and adhesion promoter specially formulated for use over PVC, fibreglass, and various synthetic composite boards. It is designed to enhance the adhesion of various Duram coatings, membranes, and other materials to challenging substrates, ensuring a strong and lasting bond.

Key Features

  • Single-pack, ready-to-use formulation
  • Fast drying time (approximately 30 minutes)
  • Excellent adhesion to PVC, fibreglass, and composite boards
  • Suitable for use as a bonding agent between water-based and polyurethane membranes
  • Contains special etching compounds for improved bonding

Uses

  • Priming and adhesion promotion for Duram coatings (Virotuff, ViroCoat, Rocktuff, etc.) on PVC, fibreglass, and composite boards
  • Bonding water-based membranes to Duram polyurethane membranes
  • Priming PVC sheeting and construction materials
  • Priming fibreglass and gel coats
  • Priming various synthetic composite boards

Benefits

  • Enhances adhesion and durability of coatings and membranes
  • Fast drying time for increased efficiency
  • Simple, single-pack application
  • Versatile for use with various Duram products
  • Provides a strong and lasting bond

Application Guide

  1. Prepare surfaces by ensuring they are sound, stable, dry, clean, and free of contaminants.
  2. Lightly sand or abrade the surface (optional but recommended).
  3. Apply a single, continuous coat of DURAM Superprime 711 by brush, roller, or low-pressure spray.
  4. Allow the primer to gel and set before applying the topcoat.
  5. For best results, apply the topcoat soon after the primer has set but retains some minor residual tack.

Limitations

  • Not suitable for use on particle board in wet areas (shower recesses).
  • Particle board should be sealed with Duram Primeseal MC before priming.
  • Always conduct tests before applying to ensure compatibility with specific substrates.

Additional Information

Type Polyurethane-based primer/bonding agent
Colour Clear
Coverage 5-10m² per litre
Drying Time Approximately 30-60 minutes

Precautions

  • Follow safety instructions on the Product Safety Data Sheet.
  • Wear gloves and safety goggles.
  • Use in well-ventilated areas.
  • Avoid contact with skin and eyes.

column2: Azcoseal Clear Acrylic Sealer and Primer
column3:
Use Azcoseal Clear ‘Wet Look’ Acrylic Sealer and Primer for: Waterproofing, priming, and sealing porous surfaces with a tough, attractive semi-gloss finish

Azcoseal is a premium clear acrylic sealer and primer designed for deep penetration into porous substrates like concrete, masonry, pavers, and FC sheeting. It cures to form a tough, resilient, semi-gloss (wet-look) finish that enhances appearance while providing a long-lasting weatherproof barrier. Ideal for use as a stand-alone sealer or primer under Duram waterproofing membranes and coatings, Azcoseal is UV-resistant, quick-drying, and suitable for encapsulating friable surfaces like asbestos. Its cross-linking technology ensures excellent bonding, and its low-modulus formula ensures thorough substrate penetration. Perfect for Australian trades working with concrete, masonry, or decorative surfaces.

Key Features of Azcoseal Clear ‘Wet Look’ Acrylic Sealer and Primer

  • Dries clear with a semi-gloss ‘wet look’ finish
  • Acts as a high-performance primer and sealer in one
  • Enhances adhesion of membranes and coatings
  • Waterproofs and protects against rain and salt spray
  • UV resistant and suitable for exposed outdoor areas
  • Quick drying – touch dry in 1–2 hours

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Acrylic in solvent solution with cross-linking adhesion technology
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 30°C (41°F to 86°F)
  • Service Temperature: 10°C to 50°C (50°F to 122°F)
  • Drying Time: Touch dry in 1–2 hours, full cure within 24 hours
  • Coverage Rate: 4 m²/L per coat (varies by surface)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, or spray equipment
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply each coat evenly and allow full drying before recoating; best results when recoated within 24 hours
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Use test areas on pavers or terracotta to check for solvent reactions; avoid use on high moisture or non-porous surfaces

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry area, away from ignition sources
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months unopened; 6 months once opened if resealed correctly
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • Class 3 Flammable Liquid compliant
  • Suitable for use with Duram membranes (Multithane, Durabit, Azcothane, etc.)
  • Meets requirements for encapsulation and adhesion enhancement in Australian construction
column32: Azcoseal Clear Acrylic Sealer & Primer for Porous Surfaces | Adheseal
column33: A premium clear acrylic sealer and primer for porous substrates with a satin finish and waterproofing benefits.
column52:
How to apply Azcoseal Clear ‘Wet Look’ Acrylic Sealer and Primer:

  1. Ensure the surface is dry, clean, and free from dust, oils, or coatings
  2. Apply the first coat using brush, roller or spray at 4m²/L
  3. Allow to dry for 2–6 hours before recoating
  4. Apply second (and optional third) coats as required
  5. For best results, topcoat within 24 hours of previous coat drying
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Azcoseal Clear ‘Wet Look’ Acrylic Sealer and Primer

Q: What’s the best way to apply Azcoseal?

A: Azcoseal should be applied using a brush, roller, or spray in 2 or more coats. Ensure each coat is dry before applying the next. For porous surfaces, more coats may be required.

Q: How long does it take to cure?

A: Azcoseal is touch dry in 1–2 hours and fully cured within 24 hours under typical Australian conditions (25°C and 50% RH).

Q: Can I use Azcoseal as a primer for waterproofing membranes?

A: Yes, Azcoseal is an excellent primer for water-based and polyurethane waterproofing membranes, including Duram’s Multithane and Azcothane ranges.

Q: What surfaces are not suitable for Azcoseal?

A: Avoid using Azcoseal on metal, glazed tiles, particle/chip board, or saturated surfaces. Duram Primeseal MC is better suited for those applications.

Q: Is the finish slippery when wet?

A: Yes, the cured coating can become slippery when wet, especially in exposed or trafficable areas. Use caution and apply anti-slip additives if necessary.
column54:
Azcoseal Clear ‘Wet Look’ Acrylic Sealer and Primer limitations:

  • Not suitable for high-moisture or saturated substrates
  • Not a vapour barrier – use Duram Primeseal MC where required
  • Should not be used on metal, glazed, or extremely smooth surfaces
  • Test patches are highly recommended, especially on pavers or terracotta

Safety precautions when using Azcoseal Clear ‘Wet Look’ Acrylic Sealer and Primer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Solvent-resistant gloves, mask, and safety goggles
  • Ventilation: Only apply in well-ventilated areas
  • Handling: Keep away from open flames; flammable during application
  • Disposal: Follow local hazardous waste protocols and read SDS thoroughly

Use 2001 Primer for: Enhancing adhesion on porous surfaces and inhibiting rust on metals in Polyurethane and Hybrid applications.

2001 Primer is a solvent-based reactive primer formulated to improve adhesion on porous surfaces such as timber and masonry. It also acts as a rust inhibitor for metals, making it ideal for applications like automotive glass replacement. This primer ensures strong and durable bonds, enhancing the longevity of sealants and coatings.

Key Features of 2001 Primer

  • Solvent-Based Reactive Primer: Ensures strong adhesion on various surfaces.
  • Dual Functionality: Enhances adhesion and inhibits rust.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for porous surfaces and metals.
  • Improves Longevity: Extends the life of sealants and coatings.

Why Choose 2001 Primer:

  • Enhanced Adhesion: Ensures a strong bond on porous surfaces.
  • Rust Inhibition: Protects metal surfaces from corrosion.
  • Reliable Performance: Suitable for demanding applications.

When to Choose 2001 Primer versus Alternatives:

  • Choose 2001 Primer over non-primers when: Working with porous surfaces or metals requiring rust protection.
  • Consider other options when: Water-based primers are preferred, or VOC regulations are strict.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Improves the longevity of sealants and coatings, reducing maintenance and replacement costs.

Trade-Specific Applications for 2001 Primer:

For Glaziers and Automotive Technicians:

  • Use for automotive glass replacement to prevent rust and ensure strong adhesion.
  • Apply to metal frames and porous surfaces before applying sealants.
  • Ensures long-lasting and reliable windshield installations.

For Construction and Building Professionals:

  • Use on timber and masonry surfaces to enhance the adhesion of Polyurethane and Hybrid sealants.
  • Apply to metal components to prevent rust and corrosion.
  • Ensures durable and long-lasting seals in construction projects.

Technical Overview

2001 Primer is a solvent-based reactive primer designed to improve adhesion on porous surfaces and inhibit rust on metals. It is applied using a brush or clean cloth, with a consumption rate of 50-150ml per square meter. The primer dries via air curing and requires acetone or xylene for cleaning before it dries.

Application: Apply by brush or clean cloth, 50-150ml/m².

Physical Properties: Polyurethane-based, air-drying, clear/yellowish liquid.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, clean cloth, and safety gloves.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Use appropriate safety precautions due to the solvent-based nature of the product.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor adhesion (ensure proper surface preparation), uneven application (apply evenly with a brush or cloth).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from extreme temperatures.

Frequently Asked Questions About 2001 Primer

Q: What surfaces is 2001 Primer suitable for?

A: 2001 Primer is suitable for porous surfaces like timber and masonry, as well as metal surfaces requiring rust inhibition.

Q: How do I apply 2001 Primer?

A: Apply using a brush or clean cloth at a rate of 50-150ml per square meter, depending on surface porosity.

A: Before the primer dries, use acetone or xylene. After it cures, mechanical means are necessary.

Q: What types of sealants are compatible with 2001 Primer?

Use 50A Primer for: Enhancing the adhesion of sealants and adhesives on non-porous surfaces, improving bonding to difficult substrates, and ensuring maximum performance and longevity of sealant applications.

50A Primer is an adhesive wipe specifically designed to improve the adhesion of polyurethane, MS, silicone, and acrylic sealants and adhesives to non-porous surfaces. It's ideal for use on metals, powder coats, plastics, paints, lacquers, and other challenging substrates. This primer is particularly useful in sign manufacturing, caravan, marine, and automotive manufacturing and repair. When maximum performance and longevity are required, 50A Primer, combined with light abrasion and cleaning with Adheseal IPA cleaner, ensures a strong and durable bond.

Key Features of 50A Primer

  • Enhances Adhesion: Improves the bond strength of sealants and adhesives on non-porous surfaces.
  • Fast Drying: Ready for sealant/adhesive application shortly after application.
  • Ready to Use: Single-pack, user-friendly formulation.
  • Non-Corrosive: Safe for use on various substrates without causing corrosion.
  • Increases Durability: Proven to extend the long-term durability and life of sealants and adhesives.

Technical Overview

50A Primer is formulated to promote adhesion on non-porous substrates. Its application prepares the surface to create a stronger bond with sealants and adhesives. Proper surface preparation and application of 50A Primer are crucial for achieving optimal results, especially on challenging surfaces like powder coat.

Chemical Properties: Clear alcohol solution.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +40°C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Adheseal IPA cleaner, clean cloth. For extremely non-porous substrates, light abrasion tools may be needed.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For maximum performance on extremely non-porous substrates, lightly abrade the surface and clean it thoroughly with IPA Cleaner before applying 50A Primer. Apply sparingly with a clean cloth.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Do not use if the primer appears milky, as this indicates water absorption. Ensure the primer dries completely before applying sealant/adhesive.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures.

Certifications

  • (Certifications are not specified in the provided data. If there are any specific certifications, they should be listed here.)

column33: 50A Primer: Adhesive wipe to enhance adhesion of sealants/adhesives on non-porous surfaces like metal, powder coat, and plastic. Fast drying.
column52:
How to apply 50A Primer:

  1. Ensure the surface is sound, stable, dry, clean, and free of contaminants.
  2. Clean non-porous surfaces with Adheseal IPA cleaner.
  3. Wipe the area with 50A Primer, using a clean cloth and applying sparingly.
  4. Allow the primer to dry completely before applying the sealant or adhesive.
  5. For extremely non-porous surfaces, light abrasion and thorough cleaning with IPA Cleaner are recommended before applying the primer.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About 50A Primer

Q: How do I know if a surface is porous or non-porous?

A: Dispense a small puddle of water on the surface. If the water absorbs in less than two minutes, it's porous. If it remains, it's non-porous.

Q: Can I use 50A Primer on porous surfaces?

A: No, 50A Primer is designed for non-porous surfaces. Use Adheseal 2001 primer for porous surfaces.

Q: How do I apply 50A Primer?

A: Clean the surface with Adheseal IPA cleaner, then wipe the area with 50A Primer using a clean cloth. Apply sparingly and allow it to dry completely.

Q: What should I do if the primer appears milky?

A: If the primer is milky, it has absorbed water and should be disposed of. Do not use it.

Q: How long does 50A Primer take to dry?

A: When applied correctly, it dries very quickly (approximately 15 seconds). If it takes longer, it has been applied too heavily.
column54:
50A Primer limitations:

  • Do not use if the contents of the container have become milky.
  • Use only in well-ventilated spaces.
  • Do not expose the primed surface to thermal, mechanical, or chemical influences before the product has dried.
  • Do not use on porous surfaces.

Safety precautions when using 50A Primer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear safety shoes, gloves, apron, and chemical goggles. Gloves made from nitrile rubber are suggested for intermittent contact.
  • Inhalation: Keep the victim calm and remove them to fresh air. Obtain medical treatment immediately.
  • Skin Contact: Remove contaminated clothing and wash skin thoroughly with water, followed by soap and water. Seek medical attention if irritation develops or persists.
  • Eye Contact: Immediately flush eyes with plenty of water for at least 20 minutes, removing contact lenses. Seek medical advice after flushing.
  • Ingestion: Do NOT induce vomiting. Clean mouth with water and drink plenty of water afterwards. Obtain medical treatment immediately.

column3:
Mapei Primer G

Mapei Primer G is a high-quality synthetic resin-based water-dispersion primer with very low volatile organic compound (VOC). It serves multiple purposes, including treating gypsum surfaces before installing ceramic tiles, acting as an anchoring coat for gypsum-based sprayable plasters, and improving the adhesion of smoothing compounds on cementitious, anhydrite, and gypsum-based surfaces.

The primer provides uniform absorption on cementitious or gypsum surfaces, making it an ideal choice for various applications. It creates a flexible, compact, and shiny coating on any surface, consolidating it where needed. Primer G enhances the adhesion of smoothing compounds, paint, adhesive for wallpaper, adhesive for tiles, and mortar for renders.

One of the key benefits of Primer G is its ability to prevent chemical reactions between sulphates and the cement alluminates of gypsum, which can lead to the formation of the salt "ettringite" and cause separation. By reducing substrate absorption, it makes wallpaper removal easier when used for papering. Additionally, when applied before sprayable plasters or self-levelling compounds, Primer G helps prevent over-rapid absorption of water, prolonging workability time and minimizing shrinkage cracks.

This non-flammable primer can be used in closed, unventilated environments without any special precautions. However, it's important not to apply Primer G in such quantity that it forms a surface film; dilute with water as appropriate for the substrate's absorption.

Recommendations

  • Primer G does not waterproof gypsum substrates but considerably reduces their porosity and absorption.
  • Avoid applying onto magnesium substrates.
  • Not recommended for external applications or where rising damp is present.
  • Do not use in excess to form a surface film; dilute appropriately for the substrate's absorption.

Cleaning

Tools and containers should be washed with clean water immediately after use. Any remaining residues, once dry, must be removed mechanically or with Pulicol 2000.

Consumption

The consumption of Primer G depends on the porosity and absorption of the surface, with normal consumption ranging between 0.08 and 0.15 kg/m².

Packaging

Primer G is available in 25 kg, 10 kg, and 5 kg plastic drums, as well as 1 kg bottles.

Storage

Primer G, in its original unopened packaging, can be stored for 12 months. Protect from frost.
column32: Mapei Primer G - Synthetic Resin-Based Water-Dispersion Primer
column33: Discover Mapei Primer G, a top-quality synthetic resin-based water-dispersion primer with very low VOC. Perfect for treating gypsum surfaces, anchoring sprayable plasters, and improving adhesion on cementitious or gypsum-based surfaces.

column3:
Duram WB Primer is a water-based, polymer emulsion that enhances the adhesion of various acrylic membranes, including Durabit EF, Durabit Reo, Duram Azcothane, and Crystoflex. This penetrative primer exhibits excellent adhesion properties, especially on porous surfaces. Notably, it meets the 'Green Star' environmental criteria and has very low VOCs, ensuring a safe and eco-friendly application.

This primer is ideal for priming porous substrates before the application of water-based membranes or coatings. However, it is not suitable for use on non-porous surfaces, metal, shiny or smooth concrete, glazed tiles, marble, terrazzo, particle board, or chipboard.

Product Characteristics:

  • Colour: Clear
  • Sizes: 4 Litres, 15 Litres

Uses:

  • Balconies
  • Terraces
  • Decks
  • Tiled or covered areas
  • Shower recess & wet areas (floors and upturns)
  • Retaining walls
  • Planters and landscaped areas
  • Structural slabs
  • Window hobs

Substrates:

  • Concrete
  • Cement and cement render
  • FC and CFC Sheeting
  • Block & Brick work
  • Masonry/Stone
  • FC, CFC, Asbestos, and Blue Board Sheeting

Benefits and Advantages:

  • Simple to apply
  • Water-based
  • Very low VOCs
  • Meets the 'Green Star' environmental criteria
  • Concrete compatible
  • Beds down dust
  • Aids the adhesion of water-based membranes to the surface
  • Very economical
  • Safe and environmentally friendly to use
  • Single pack

Limitations:

  • Not recommended for particle board or chipboard. Duram Primeseal MC is recommended for these surfaces.
  • Not a vapour barrier. For exposed areas or where entrapped moisture may cause bubbling of the membrane, use Duram Primeseal MC.

Coverage:

Coverage rate varies depending on the type, condition, porosity, texture of the surface, and application technique. General coverage is approximately 4 sqm per litre, but this may vary based on the porosity of the surface. Available in 1, 4, and 15 Lt containers.

Drying and Curing:

Drying and curing times depend on various factors, including surface type, dryness, porosity, temperature, humidity, ventilation, and climate conditions. As a guide, curing usually takes around 30 minutes to 1 hour.

Clean Up:

Wet spills can be cleaned with water, but it's important to avoid spills, especially on porous surfaces. On concrete and non-porous surfaces, use a cloth and water for wet spills. For carpets, allow the product to cure before shaving the affected area. Equipment should be cleaned with water immediately after use.

Storage and Packaging:

Store Duram WB Primer in a cool, dry place away from heat and freezing. The product is not flammable and is available in 4 Lt and 15 Lt pails, with 15 liters equating to 16 kg. Shelf life is 12 months in an unopened container, and any skinned portions of the product should be cut out and removed before use.

column3:
Use Everbond WBP Water Based Primer for: Enhancing adhesion of water-based membranes to porous surfaces like concrete, bedding down dust, and creating a stable base for coatings.

Everbond WBP Water Based Primer is designed to improve the bond between water-based membranes and porous surfaces. Its water-based acrylic formulation ensures low VOCs, making it environmentally friendly and safe for indoor use. This penetrative primer effectively beds down dust and strengthens the substrate, providing a stable surface for subsequent coatings. Ideal for concrete and other porous materials, Everbond WBP simplifies application and enhances the longevity of your waterproofing systems.

Key Features of Everbond WBP Water Based Primer

  • Enhances adhesion of water-based membranes to porous surfaces, ensuring a durable and long-lasting bond.
  • Low VOC formulation meets 'Green Star' environmental criteria, making it safe and environmentally friendly.
  • Penetrates and strengthens porous substrates, providing a stable base for coatings.
  • Simple application with brush, roller, or spray, reducing labor time and costs.
  • Concrete compatible, making it ideal for various construction and renovation projects.

Technical Overview

Everbond WBP is a water-based acrylic primer that cures through evaporation. Its liquid consistency allows for easy application and penetration into porous surfaces. The density ranges from 1.1 to 1.2, ensuring a consistent and effective coating.

Chemical Properties: Water-based acrylic emulsion that provides excellent adhesion and low VOC emissions.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F). This range ensures optimal application and drying, preventing issues like poor adhesion or extended curing times.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, roller, or spray equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure the substrate is clean and dry before application. For highly porous surfaces, apply a second coat.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the primed surface becomes contaminated, clean and re-prime before applying the membrane.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 35°C (41°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Meets 'Green Star' environmental criteria, relevant to Australian sustainable building practices.

column52:
How to apply Everbond WBP Water Based Primer:

  1. Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Apply Everbond WBP using a brush, roller, or spray, ensuring even coverage.
  3. Allow 4 to 24 hours for the primer to dry, depending on environmental conditions.
  4. For highly porous surfaces, apply a second coat after the first coat is dry.
  5. Proceed with the application of the water-based membrane or coating.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everbond WBP Water Based Primer

Q: How do I apply Everbond WBP?

A: Apply Everbond WBP using a brush, roller, or spray to a clean, dry surface. For very porous surfaces, a second coat may be needed.

Q: What surfaces is Everbond WBP compatible with?

A: It is compatible with porous surfaces like concrete, masonry, and render. It is not suitable for non-porous surfaces such as metal or glazed tiles.

Q: How long does Everbond WBP take to dry?

A: Drying time varies from 4 to 24 hours depending on temperature, humidity, and substrate porosity. Ensure the primer is fully dry before applying a membrane.

Q: What is the coverage rate of Everbond WBP?

A: Everbond WBP covers 6m² to 9m² per liter, depending on the porosity of the substrate.

Q: Is Everbond WBP safe for indoor use?

A: Yes, Everbond WBP has very low VOCs and meets 'Green Star' environmental criteria, making it safe for indoor use.
column54:
Everbond WBP Water Based Primer limitations:

  • Not suitable for non-porous surfaces such as metal, glazed tiles, or smooth concrete.
  • Drying time can be significantly affected by temperature and humidity.
  • Direct tiling to this primer is not recommended; use with compatible water-based membranes.

Safety precautions when using Everbond WBP Water Based Primer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection to prevent skin and eye irritation.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application to minimize exposure to fumes.
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • Consult the MSDS for detailed safety information.

Use Megapoxy 36 & RMF for: Securely bonding raised pavement markers to bituminous and concrete roads.

Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives provide a strong and durable bond for ceramic and plastic reflective markers, ensuring long-lasting performance on roads and highways. Available in two formulations, Megapoxy 36 offers a rapid set for quick installations, while Megapoxy RMF provides a longer work time for more complex applications.

Key Features of Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives

  • Two-Component Epoxy: Ensures a strong and reliable bond.
  • Rapid and Extended Work Times: Megapoxy 36 for quick sets, RMF for longer work times.
  • High Bond Strength: Excellent adhesion to both ceramic and reflective markers.
  • Excellent Impact Strength: Withstands traffic and environmental impacts.
  • Thixotropic Properties: Prevents flow during application.
  • Road Authority Approvals: Complies with RTA and Transport S.A. specifications.

Why Choose Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives:

  • Durable Installation: Ensures markers remain securely bonded.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various road marking projects.
  • Efficient Installation: Rapid and extended work time options.
  • Reliable Performance: High bond and impact strength.

When to Choose Megapoxy 36 vs. Megapoxy RMF:

  • Choose Megapoxy 36 when: Rapid setting is required for quick installations.
  • Choose Megapoxy RMF when: A longer work time is needed for complex or larger projects.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Both provide durable and reliable installations, reducing maintenance and replacement costs.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives:

For Road Construction and Maintenance:

  • Use for installing raised pavement markers on highways and roads.
  • Apply to bituminous and concrete surfaces for secure bonding.
  • Choose Megapoxy 36 for rapid installations and Megapoxy RMF for larger projects.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives are two-component epoxy systems designed for bonding ceramic and plastic reflective markers to pavement surfaces. Available in Megapoxy 36 (rapid set) and Megapoxy RMF (longer work time), these adhesives offer high bond strength and impact resistance. They are thixotropic, preventing flow during application, and comply with road authority specifications.

Application: Mix components A and B in a 1:1 ratio and apply to the pavement surface before placing the marker.

Physical Properties: Two-component epoxy, thixotropic, high bond and impact strength.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing equipment, application tools, and safety gloves.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Choose the appropriate formulation based on work time requirements.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Premature setting (use within work time), uneven bonding (ensure proper mixing and application).

Cleaning and Maintenance

  • Cleaning: Use Megapoxy Thinners before the adhesive sets.
  • Maintenance: Ensure proper surface preparation to minimize future maintenance.

Availability and Packaging

  • Available in 4 litre and 20 litre kits.
  • Megapoxy 36 also available in 600 ml twin tube kits.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Megapoxy 36: Complies with RTA specification 3554.
  • Megapoxy RMF: Approved by Transport S.A.

Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives

Q: What is the difference between Megapoxy 36 and Megapoxy RMF?

A: Megapoxy 36 is a rapid setting adhesive with a 3-minute work time, suitable for quick installations. Megapoxy RMF has a longer work time of 10 minutes, ideal for larger or more complex projects.

Q: What surfaces can I use Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives on?

A: These adhesives are designed for bonding ceramic and plastic reflective markers to bituminous and concrete surfaces.

Q: How do I clean up after using Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives?

A: Before the adhesive sets, rinse and flush equipment with Megapoxy Thinners.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives?

A: The mixing ratio is 1:1 by weight or volume for both Megapoxy 36 and Megapoxy RMF.

Q: Are Megapoxy Road Marker Adhesives approved by road authorities?

A: Yes, Megapoxy 36 conforms to RTA specification 3554, and Megapoxy RMF is approved by Transport S.A.

Q: What packaging options are available?

A: Both Megapoxy 36 and Megapoxy RMF are available in 4 litre and 20 litre kits. Megapoxy 36 is also available in 600 ml twin tube kits.

column3:
Use Megapoxy 34 for: Underground cable jointing, encapsulation of electrical transformers, switchgear components, and electrical coils.

Megapoxy 34 is a low-viscosity, 100% solids epoxy resin formulation designed for the demanding requirements of underground cable jointing and the encapsulation of electrical components. Its superior electrical and dielectric properties make it ideal for use in instrument transformers, lighting transformers, small power transformers, and coils. Megapoxy 34 is also suitable for casting electrical switchgear components and for applications requiring high mechanical and chemical resistance. This product ensures excellent static and dynamic mechanical performance, providing a durable and reliable solution for electrical and electronic industries.

Key Features of Megapoxy 34

  • 100% solids, low-viscosity epoxy resin
  • Excellent electrical and dielectric properties
  • Suitable for underground cable jointing
  • Ideal for encapsulating electrical components
  • High mechanical and chemical resistance
  • Conforms to AS3100-1990 standards

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties
    • Two-component, 100% solids epoxy resin
  • Application Temperature Range
    • Pot life of 30 minutes at 25°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools
    • Mixing containers, measuring cups, stirrers (provided), cleaning solvents (acetone, isopropyl alcohol, Megapoxy Thinners).
  • Trade-Specific Tips
    • Ensure surfaces are thoroughly cleaned with acetone or isopropyl alcohol for optimal adhesion.
    • Mix Part A and Part B thoroughly at a 4:3 volume or weight ratio.
    • Avoid wire brushing as a surface preparation method.
  • Common Issues and Solutions
    • Poor adhesion due to surface contamination: Clean surfaces thoroughly with solvents.
    • Incomplete curing due to inaccurate mixing: Ensure precise 4:3 mixing ratio.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements
    • Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information
    • Consult product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations
    • Avoid extreme temperature fluctuations during storage.

Certifications

  • Conforms to AS3100-1990 standards

column3:
Use Megapoxy CT5 for: Encapsulating airport lighting, inductive loops, and weigh-in-motion sensors for rapid and durable installations.

Megapoxy CT5 is an Australian-made, two-part compound specifically designed for the demanding requirements of airport and roadway infrastructure. Its rapid setting and non-brittle properties ensure efficient installation and long-term reliability for critical applications such as encapsulating inductive loops and airport lighting. This product is formulated to minimise disruption and provide lasting performance.

Key Features of Megapoxy CT5

  • Rapid Setting: Quick cure properties minimize road and lane closures, enabling faster project completion.
  • High Hardness: Cures to a Shore D hardness of 60-70, providing exceptional durability and resistance.
  • Australian Made: Specifically formulated for Australian conditions and requirements.
  • Easy to Use: Simple 1:1 mix ratio by volume ensures straightforward application.

Why Choose Megapoxy CT5:

  • Minimised Disruption: Fast cure reduces downtime for critical infrastructure.
  • Long-Term Reliability: Non-brittle formulation ensures durable encapsulation.
  • Consistent Quality: Australian manufacturing guarantees high standards.
  • Efficient Application: Easy mixing and application streamline installation processes.

When to Choose Megapoxy CT5 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megapoxy CT5 over standard concrete when: Rapid return to service is crucial, such as on active airport runways, due to its significantly faster cure time.
  • Consider other options when: High flexibility is required for applications involving significant movement, as Megapoxy CT5 is formulated for hardness and durability.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Megapoxy CT5 reduces long-term maintenance and downtime, offering better overall value for critical installations despite a potentially higher initial cost.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy CT5:

For Civil Contractors:

  • Encapsulating inductive loop sensors in roadways, ensuring accurate traffic data collection.
  • Compatible with both asphalt and concrete surfaces, providing versatility in application.
  • Fast cure times minimise disruption to traffic flow, reducing project timelines.

For Airport Maintenance Teams:

  • Backfilling and encapsulating aircraft landing lights, ensuring secure and reliable operation.
  • Resistant to the stresses of aircraft traffic, providing long term performance.
  • Durable encapsulation protects sensitive equipment from environmental factors.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy CT5 is a two-part compound designed for encapsulating critical infrastructure components. It is formulated for rapid setting and high hardness, ensuring durable protection and minimizing downtime. The 1:1 mix ratio simplifies application, and its properties are optimized for use in demanding environments.

Colour: Black colouration is standard for easy identification and may offer some UV absorption benefits.

Mix Ratio by Volume: 1:1 ratio simplifies mixing and reduces the chance of errors, ensuring consistent performance.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Clean mixing containers (plastic buckets), stirring equipment (manual or mechanical), application tools appropriate for the specific task.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. For high-build applications, use sand or aggregates as directed in the product data sheet.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inaccurate mixing ratios will affect cure. Ensure thorough mixing for at least 3 minutes.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place to maintain product integrity.
  • Shelf Life Information: 2 years in unopened kits, ensuring extended usability.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage. Refer to the data sheet for specific temperature ranges.

Certifications and Compliance

  • Refer to the product’s Material Safety Data Sheet and any relevant Australian Standards for specific compliance information.
column7: adhesive,bitumen-s,civil construction-i,concrete,construction,durable,epoxy,external,flexible,high strength,industrial,internal,special order,two part
column32: Megapoxy CT5: Backfilling Compound for Airport Lighting
column33: Megapoxy CT5: a rapid-setting, Australian-made compound for backfilling and encapsulating airport lighting, sensors, and loops in roadways.
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy CT5:

  1. Measure and Mix: Measure out 1 volume of Part A and 1 volume of Part B of Megapoxy CT5. Place them into a clean mixing vessel and stir thoroughly for at least 3 minutes until a uniform consistency is achieved. Ensure all sides and the bottom of the mixing vessel are scraped to avoid unmixed material.
  2. Mechanical Mixing (Optional): While manual mixing is sufficient, a mechanical mixer can be used. However, it's crucial to minimize splashing and air entrapment during the mixing process to maintain the product's integrity.
  3. Adding Sand (If Required): If sand is needed to make the mixture less flowable, add fine and dry epoxy-quality sand gradually while mixing. Continue mixing until the mixture is uniform and homogenous. Remember that the volume will not double due to air voids in the sand.
  4. Application: Apply the mixed Megapoxy CT5 according to the specific requirements of the application, such as encapsulating inductive loops or airport lighting. Ensure proper placement and coverage to achieve the desired results.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy CT5

Q: How long does Megapoxy CT5 take to cure completely?

A: Megapoxy CT5 has a film cure time of 6 hours at 25°C. However, it's important to note that cure times can be affected by ambient temperature and application thickness. Always refer to the product data sheet for specific guidelines.

Q: Can Megapoxy CT5 be used in cold weather conditions?

A: Megapoxy CT5 is designed for use in various conditions, but cold temperatures can significantly slow down the cure rate. It's essential to follow the manufacturer's recommendations for cold-weather application, which may include pre-warming the product or using heating techniques.

Q: What is the correct mixing ratio for Megapoxy CT5?

A: The correct mixing ratio for Megapoxy CT5 is 1:1 by volume. It is crucial to measure equal volumes of Part A and Part B and mix them thoroughly for at least 3 minutes to ensure proper curing and performance of the product.

Q: Can sand be added to Megapoxy CT5, and if so, how much?

A: Yes, sand can be added to Megapoxy CT5 to make it less flowable for high-build applications. If sand is used, add it gradually while mixing until a uniform and homogenous consistency is achieved. Note that adding 1 litre of resin and 1 litre of sand will not result in 2 litres of volume due to air voids in the sand.

Q: What safety precautions should be taken when using Megapoxy CT5?

A: Before handling Megapoxy CT5, users should familiarize themselves with the health and safety information provided in Bulletin No. 100 and the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for Megapoxy CT5. These documents contain important safety instructions and precautions.

Q: How should Megapoxy CT5 be stored?

A: Megapoxy CT5 should be stored in a cool, dry place. Unopened kits have a shelf life of 2 years when stored correctly. Avoid exposure to extreme temperatures and moisture to maintain product quality and performance.
column54:
Megapoxy CT5 limitations:

  • Specific Application: Megapoxy CT5 is specifically designed for encapsulating inductive detector loops, weigh-in-motion sensors, and aircraft landing lights. It may not be suitable for other applications requiring high flexibility or general adhesive use. Consider other epoxy products for these applications.
  • Mixing Accuracy: Inaccurate mixing ratios and poor mixing will result in lower physical properties of the cured system. If the error is significant, the system may not cure satisfactorily and may discolour over time. Ensure precise measurements and thorough mixing.

Safety precautions when using Megapoxy CT5:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) as recommended in the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), including gloves, eye protection, and respiratory protection if necessary.
  • Ventilation: Use in a well-ventilated area to avoid inhalation of vapors. If working indoors, ensure adequate ventilation or use respiratory protection.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after handling. In case of contact, follow the first aid measures provided in the MSDS.
  • First Aid: Refer to the MSDS for detailed first aid instructions. In case of ingestion, do not induce vomiting and seek medical attention immediately. For eye or skin contact, flush with plenty of water and seek medical advice if irritation persists.

column2: Megapoxy LVS Low Viscosity Sealer (2 Part Kit)
column3:
Use Megapoxy LVS for: Sealing, priming, and waterproofing concrete, timber, bricks, and stone with deep penetration and high strength.

Megapoxy LVS is a premium, low-viscosity epoxy sealer and primer developed to penetrate and protect a wide range of porous materials. Its unique formulation ensures deep penetration, hardening, and waterproofing of substrates like concrete, timber, and stone. This product is ideal for internal sealing of tanks, waterproofing walls and floors, and priming surfaces for subsequent coatings.

Key Features of Megapoxy LVS

  • Low Viscosity: Ensures deep penetration into porous substrates, providing superior sealing and priming.
  • High Strength: Offers excellent compressive and tensile strengths, surpassing the performance of concrete.
  • Chemical Resistance: Provides a durable barrier against various chemicals, ensuring long-term protection.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for concrete, timber, bricks, mortar, and natural stone.

Why Choose Megapoxy LVS:

  • Enhanced Durability: Strengthens and protects substrates, extending their lifespan.
  • Effective Waterproofing: Creates a reliable barrier against moisture, preventing damage.
  • Improved Adhesion: Acts as an excellent primer for subsequent coatings, ensuring strong bonding.
  • Efficient Application: High coverage rates and temperature-dependent cure times streamline project timelines.

When to Choose Megapoxy LVS versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megapoxy LVS over standard sealers when: Deep penetration and high strength are required for porous substrates, such as concrete tanks or natural stone, due to its low viscosity and superior bonding.
  • Consider other options when: A flexible coating is required, as Megapoxy LVS is formulated for hardness and strength, rather than flexibility.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Megapoxy LVS provides long-term protection and reduces maintenance, offering better value for critical applications compared to standard sealers.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy LVS:

For Concrete Contractors:

  • Sealing and priming concrete floors for epoxy floor coatings, ensuring strong adhesion.
  • Waterproofing concrete tanks and structures, providing long-term protection against moisture.
  • Strengthening structural concrete, enhancing its durability and lifespan.

For Stone and Masonry Professionals:

  • Sealing and waterproofing natural stone surfaces, protecting them from environmental damage.
  • Strengthening and hardening brick and mortar structures, improving their longevity.
  • Priming surfaces for further coatings, ensuring optimal adhesion and finish.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy LVS is a two-component, resin-based, low-viscosity liquid designed for deep penetration and robust protection of porous substrates. Its formulation provides high compressive and tensile strengths, excellent chemical resistance, and versatile application across various materials. The temperature-dependent cure times and high coverage rates make it an efficient and reliable solution.

Mixing Ratio by Volume: 2 Parts A to 1 Part B ensures optimal curing and performance.

Mixed Viscosity at 25°C: 90 cps allows for deep penetration into porous materials.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, stirring equipment, brushes or rollers, and appropriate safety gear.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure substrates
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure substrates are thoroughly prepared as per the surface preparation guidelines. Apply thin coats to avoid pooling.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inaccurate mixing affects curing. Ensure precise measurements and thorough mixing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.

column32: Megapoxy LVS Low Viscosity Sealer for Concrete and Brick Surfaces
column33: Megapoxy LVS: a two-component, low-viscosity epoxy sealer and primer for porous substrates like concrete, timber, and stone. Ideal for waterproofing and hardening.
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy LVS:

  1. Prepare Surface: Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Follow specific surface preparation guidelines for each material.
  2. Mix Components: Mix 2 parts of Part A with 1 part of Part B by volume thoroughly. Use a clean mixing container and stir for several minutes until a uniform consistency is achieved.
  3. Apply Coating: Apply Megapoxy LVS using a brush or roller. Apply thin coats and avoid pooling. For priming, a minimum of one coat is required. For sealing or hardening, apply a minimum of two coats.
  4. Cure: Allow the coating to cure for the recommended time, depending on the ambient temperature. Avoid traffic or disturbance during the curing process.
  5. Clean Tools: Clean mixing implements and working tools with Megapoxy Thinners immediately after use.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy LVS

Q: What surfaces can Megapoxy LVS be used on?

A: Megapoxy LVS is designed for use on various porous substrates, including concrete, timber, bricks, mortar, and natural stone. It's ideal for sealing, hardening, and waterproofing these materials.

Q: How do I prepare concrete surfaces for Megapoxy LVS?

A: Concrete should be free from grease and oil. Remove surface laitance by mechanical abrasion or acid etching. Ensure the surface is thoroughly dry before application for maximum adhesion.

Q: What is the correct mixing ratio for Megapoxy LVS?

A: The correct mixing ratio is 2 parts of Part A to 1 part of Part B by volume. Accurate measurement and thorough mixing are crucial for proper curing and performance.

Q: How long does Megapoxy LVS take to cure?

A: Cure times vary based on temperature. At 25°C, the minimum cure time is 24 hours, while at 35°C, it's 12 hours. Thin film cure at 25°C is 4 hours. Ensure adequate ventilation during curing.

Q: Can Megapoxy LVS be used as a primer for floor coatings?

A: Yes, Megapoxy LVS is an excellent primer for Megapoxy floor coating products. Apply a minimum of one coat to a thoroughly dry substrate before overcoating.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Megapoxy LVS?

A: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves and eye protection. Use in a well-ventilated area. Refer to the Megapoxy LVS Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.
column54:
Megapoxy LVS limitations:

  • Must be applied to thoroughly dry substrates.
  • Bonding to coated surfaces may result in reduced adhesion.
  • Use disposable rubber gloves.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation.
  • Refer to the Megapoxy LVS Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.

Megapoxy E is a premium epoxy resin designed for the electrical and electronic industries, offering exceptional static and dynamic mechanical properties. It's ideal for encapsulating instrument transformers, lighting transformers, small power transformers, and coils. This product is formulated for both room and elevated temperature service, with options for hardeners to achieve service temperatures up to 150°C. Megapoxy E provides a reliable, high-strength solution for critical electrical applications.

Key Features of Megapoxy E

  • High impact resistance for durable electrical castings.
  • Superior electrical and dielectric properties.
  • Excellent static and dynamic mechanical strength.
  • Formulated for room and elevated temperature service.
  • Available with different hardeners for up to 150°C service.
  • Chemical resistant properties.

  • Application Temperature Range: Room Temperature (25°C)

Trade Professional Information

  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure accurate mixing ratios for optimal curing. Clean surfaces thoroughly with acetone or isopropyl alcohol. Use proper molds to achieve desired casting shapes.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inconsistent mixing can lead to weak bonds; ensure thorough mixing. Surface impurities reduce adhesion; clean surfaces meticulously.

Storage and Shelf Life

column2: Megapoxy 206 Ultra Heavy Duty Epoxy Grout
column3:
Use Megapoxy 206 Ultra for: pile splicing, rail track grouting, machinery grouting, setting anchor bolts, and bridge bearing pads.

Megapoxy 206 Ultra is a heavy-duty, two-component, 100% solids, solvent-free epoxy grout engineered for demanding civil engineering applications. This hydrophilic, water-displacing grout provides exceptional compressive and impact strength, making it ideal for projects requiring robust and reliable performance. Its flowable consistency allows for easy application, even under adverse conditions like cold and damp environments.

Key Features of Megapoxy 206 Ultra

  • 100% solids, solvent-free formulation.
  • High compressive and tensile strengths.
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete and steel.
  • Flowable for easy application in tight spaces.
  • Cures under adverse conditions (cold and damp).
  • High chemical resistance.
  • Pre-metered kits for accurate mixing.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Two-component, 100% solids epoxy resin.
  • Application Temperature Range: Minimum 10°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mechanical stirrer (low speed), mixing containers, trowel or pouring equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Mix thoroughly for 2 minutes, scraping sides and bottom. Ensure proper surface preparation (grit blasting, grinding). Apply immediately after mixing. Use release agents on formwork if adhesion is not desired.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete mixing (remix thoroughly). Poor adhesion (ensure proper surface preparation). Shortened pot life in high temperatures (store in a cool place).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage and application.

Certifications

  • Complies with ASTM D695, ASTM D4541, ASTM D897, ASTM D790, ASTM D638, ASTM D1002, ASTM D2240-00.
