column2: Megapoxy MC Heavy Duty Maintenance Coating
column3:
Use Megapoxy MC for: Chemical storage tanks, industrial floors, sewage treatment plants, food processing facilities.

Megapoxy MC is a premium, two-component epoxy coating formulated for heavy-duty maintenance and protection. Its 100% solids composition and nil VOC content make it ideal for demanding environments, including food processing facilities and chemical storage areas. Megapoxy MC provides a durable, chemical-resistant finish with excellent adhesion to concrete and steel.

Key Features of Megapoxy MC

  • High Chemical Resistance: Protects against a wide range of chemicals, including hydrogen sulphide.
  • Nil VOC Content: Safe for use in food processing and enclosed spaces.
  • Rapid Cure Option (MC2): Reduces downtime with faster tack-free and re-coat times.
  • High Strength: Excellent compressive and tensile strengths, superior to concrete.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to concrete and steel with proper surface preparation.

Why Choose Megapoxy MC:

  • Durable Protection: Long-lasting protection in harsh industrial environments.
  • Safe Application: Nil VOC content ensures safe use in sensitive areas.
  • Efficient Application: Rapid cure option reduces project timelines.
  • Versatile Use: Suitable for various applications, from floors to chemical tanks.
  • Reliable Performance: Consistent results with pre-metered kits and easy mixing.

When to Choose Megapoxy MC versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megapoxy MC over standard epoxy coatings when: High chemical resistance and nil VOC content are required, such as in food processing or chemical storage.
  • Consider other options when: Very flexible coatings are needed, or when extremely fast cure times are essential beyond MC2.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Megapoxy MC offers superior durability and safety, providing long-term value in demanding applications.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy MC:

For Industrial Maintenance:

  • Protecting chemical storage tanks and bunds with high chemical resistance.
  • Coating factory and warehouse floors for heavy abrasion resistance.
  • Providing durable protection for plant and machine rooms.

For Food and Beverage Facilities:

  • Coating floors and walls with nil VOC, hygienic finishes.
  • Protecting surfaces from chemical spills and cleaning agents.
  • Ensuring long-lasting protection in demanding processing environments.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy MC is a two-component, 100% solids epoxy coating designed for heavy-duty maintenance and protection. Its high chemical resistance and nil VOC content make it ideal for demanding industrial and commercial applications. The rapid cure option (MC2) provides faster cure times, reducing downtime and increasing efficiency.

Chemical Properties: Megapoxy MC is a two-component epoxy system, formulated for high chemical resistance and durability. Its 100% solids composition ensures minimal shrinkage and excellent adhesion.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature is 10°C. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry for optimal adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, mechanical stirrer, brush, roller, squeegee (MC2), airless spray.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use Megapoxy LVS primer on porous surfaces. For non-slip surfaces, broadcast aggregate between coats.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure thorough mixing to avoid curing issues. Abrade between coats if recoating after 24 hours.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications and Compliance

  • VOC Compliance: Nil VOC content, compliant with environmental regulations.
  • ASTM Standards: Tested to ASTM D695, D4541, D897, D638, and D2240 for compressive strength, bond strength, tensile strength, and hardness.

column32: Megapoxy MC Heavy Duty Maintenance Coating | Adheseal
column33: Megapoxy MC: Heavy duty, 100% solids epoxy coating. High chemical resistance, nil VOC, rapid cure option. Ideal for industrial floors and tanks.
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy MC Heavy Duty Maintenance Coating:

  1. Surface Preparation: Clean and prepare surfaces as per guidelines (mechanical abrasion, acid etching, grit blasting).
  2. Priming (if necessary): Apply Megapoxy LVS primer to porous surfaces.
  3. Mixing: Mix Part A and Part B thoroughly for the specified time (3-5 minutes for MC, 2-3 minutes for MC2).
  4. Application: Apply Megapoxy MC using brush, roller, squeegee (MC2), or airless spray.
  5. Non-Slip (optional): Broadcast aggregate over the first coat and recoat.
  6. Curing: Allow to cure for 24 hours at 25°C.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy MC Heavy Duty Maintenance Coating

Q: What is the difference between Megapoxy MC and MC2?

A: Megapoxy MC2 is the rapid setting version, offering faster tack-free and re-coat times compared to the standard Megapoxy MC. This reduces downtime and speeds up project completion.

Q: Can Megapoxy MC be used in food processing facilities?

A: Yes, Megapoxy MC is suitable for food processing facilities due to its nil VOC content and high chemical resistance, ensuring a hygienic and durable finish.

Q: How do I prepare concrete surfaces for Megapoxy MC application?

A: Concrete should be free from grease and oil. Remove surface laitance by mechanical abrasion or acid etching. Ensure the surface is dry for maximum adhesion.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Megapoxy MC?

A: The mixing ratio is 3 parts A to 1 part B by volume or 4 parts A to 1 part B by weight. Mix thoroughly for 3-5 minutes (MC) or 2-3 minutes (MC2).

Q: Can I apply Megapoxy MC with a spray gun?

A: Yes, Megapoxy MC can be applied by brush, roller, squeegee (MC2), or airless spray. Thinning with Megapoxy Thinners up to 10% is possible for easier application.

Q: How do I create a non-slip surface with Megapoxy MC?

A: Broadcast epoxy quality sand, glass beads, carborundum, or silicone oxide over the first freshly applied coat. Recoat to lock the aggregate in place. Alternatively, mix fine aggregate into the Megapoxy MC.
column54:
Megapoxy MC Heavy Duty Maintenance Coating limitations:

  • Minimum application temperature is 10°C.
  • Recoating after 24 hours requires abrasion.
  • Poor mixing can result in curing issues and discolouration.

Safety precautions when using Megapoxy MC Heavy Duty Maintenance Coating:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhaling fumes.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • First Aid: If inhaled, move to fresh air. For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, rinse with water for 15 minutes. If ingested, do not induce vomiting and seek medical advice.

column2: Megapoxy 154 Epoxy Water Based Epoxy Coating
column3:
Use Megapoxy 154 for: priming, coating, and sealing concrete and masonry, dust sealing, moisture barriers, and concrete curing.

Megapoxy 154 is a high-performance, two-component, water-based epoxy coating designed for priming, coating, and sealing concrete and masonry surfaces. This environmentally friendly product offers excellent adhesion, water resistance, and chemical resistance, making it ideal for large areas like car parks and warehouses. It cures to a tough, matte finish, providing long-lasting protection against foot and light vehicular traffic.

Key Features of Megapoxy 154

  • Water-based formulation for easy cleanup and reduced VOCs.
  • Excellent adhesion to damp surfaces and green concrete.
  • High resistance to chemicals, water, and oils.
  • Durable, matte finish suitable for high-traffic areas.
  • Environmentally friendly.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Two-component water-based epoxy.
  • Application Temperature Range: Consult SDS for detailed guidance, generally above 10°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mechanical stirrer, brush, roller, or airless sprayer, wet film gauge.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for at least 3 minutes. For non-slip finishes, mix or broadcast epoxy grade sand aggregate. Apply successive coats at right angles.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Amine blush in cool conditions (clean with water and detergent). Incomplete mixing (remix thoroughly). Slow cure rates in high humidity (ensure humidity below 80%).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store at 20°C for 24 hours prior to use in cold conditions.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid application below 10°C.

Certifications

  • Complies with relevant industry standards for epoxy coatings.

Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy 154

  • Can Megapoxy 154 be used on damp surfaces? Yes, it has excellent adhesion to damp surfaces.
  • Is Megapoxy 154 suitable for outdoor use? It may chalk or yellow in UV light; use a UV-resistant top coat.
  • How long does it take to cure? Full cure takes 72+ hours at 25°C and <50% RH.
  • Can I add water to Megapoxy 154? Yes, up to 25% water can be added after mixing parts A and B.

How to apply Megapoxy 154:

  1. Prepare the surface by removing contaminants and repairing defects.
  2. Mix Part A and Part B in a 1:1 volume ratio for at least 3 minutes.
  3. Add up to 25% water and mix until homogeneous.
  4. Apply using a brush, roller, or airless spray in two or more coats.
  5. Allow 3-5 hours recoat time at 25°C.
  6. Allow 72+ hours for full cure.
  7. Clean tools with clean cold water and/or detergent.

  • Can Megapoxy 154 be used on damp concrete? - Yes, it has excellent adhesion to damp surfaces.

  • Can it be used outdoors? - Yes, but a UV-resistant topcoat is recommended.

column2: Megapoxy 132 - High Strength Floor Coating (2 Part Kit)
column3:
Use Megapoxy 132 for: High-strength, abrasion-resistant floor coating in food processing, pharmaceutical, and industrial environments.

Megapoxy 132 is a premium, solvent-free epoxy floor coating formulated for demanding commercial and industrial applications. Its nil VOC content and food-grade approval make it safe for sensitive environments, while its high strength and abrasion resistance ensure long-term durability. This product provides a decorative, easy-to-clean surface ideal for food processing facilities, hospitals, and warehouses.

  • High Strength: Excellent compressive and flexural strengths for heavy-duty applications.

  • Long-Term Durability: High strength and abrasion resistance extend the lifespan of the floor.

  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various commercial and industrial settings.

When to Choose Megapoxy 132 versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Megapoxy 132 over standard epoxy coatings when: Food processing or potable water contact is required, due to its nil VOC and AS 4020:2018 approval.
  • Consider other options when: High flexibility is required, as Megapoxy 132 is formulated for hardness and strength, rather than flexibility.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Megapoxy 132 provides long-term durability and safety, offering better value for sensitive environments compared to standard coatings.

Trade-Specific Applications for Megapoxy 132:

For Food and Beverage Facilities:

  • Coating floors in production areas for easy cleaning and hygiene compliance.
  • Protecting surfaces from chemical spills and heavy traffic.
  • Ensuring compliance with food safety standards with its nil VOC formulation.

For Hospital and Pharmaceutical Environments:

  • Providing durable and easy-to-clean flooring for hospital kitchens and pharmaceutical production areas.
  • Protecting surfaces from chemical and biological contaminants.
  • Maintaining a hygienic environment with its smooth, high-gloss finish.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy 132 is a two-component, solvent-free epoxy coating designed for high-performance floor applications. Its formulation provides excellent chemical resistance, high strength, and abrasion resistance, making it suitable for demanding industrial and commercial environments. The nil VOC content and food-grade approval ensure safety and compliance in sensitive settings.

Mixing Ratio by Volume: 1 Part A to 1 Part B ensures optimal curing and performance.

Mixed Viscosity at 25°C: 620 cps allows for easy application and smooth finish.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, stirring equipment, brushes, rollers, squeegees
  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, stirring equipment, brushes, rollers, squeegees, or airless sprayers.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are thoroughly prepared as per the surface preparation guidelines. Apply thin coats for optimal curing. Use fine aggregates for non-slip finishes.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inaccurate mixing affects curing. Ensure precise measurements and thorough mixing. Avoid pooling to ensure even curing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.

Certifications and Compliance

  • AS 4020:2018 Potable Water Approved.
  • Complies with Department of Primary Industries requirements for food processing establishments.
  • Refer to the Megapoxy 132 Safety Data Sheet and any relevant Australian Standards for specific compliance information.

column32: Megapoxy 132 - High Strength Floor Coating for Industrial Use
column33: Megapoxy 132: Nil VOC epoxy floor coating for industrial and commercial use. High strength, abrasion resistance, and food-grade approval.
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy 132:

  1. Prepare Surface: Ensure the substrate is clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Follow specific surface preparation guidelines for concrete or steel.
  2. Mix Components: Mix 1 part of Part A with 1 part of Part B by volume thoroughly. Use a clean mixing container and stir for several minutes until a uniform consistency is achieved.
  3. Apply Coating: Apply Megapoxy 132 using a brush, roller, squeegee, or airless sprayer. Apply thin coats for optimal curing.
  4. Cure: Allow the coating to cure for the recommended time, depending on the ambient temperature. Avoid traffic or disturbance during the curing process.
  5. Clean Tools: Clean mixing implements and working tools with Megapoxy Thinners immediately after use.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy 132

Q: Is Megapoxy 132 safe for use in food processing areas?

A: Yes, Megapoxy 132 is free from suspected or potential carcinogens and mutagens. It also conforms to the requirements of the Department of Primary Industries for coatings used in food processing establishments.

Q: Can Megapoxy 132 be used in potable water applications?

A: Yes, Megapoxy 132 is AS 4020:2018 Potable Water Approved, making it suitable for coating and protecting structures in contact with potable water.

Q: What is the correct mixing ratio for Megapoxy 132?

A: The correct mixing ratio is 1 part of Part A to 1 part of Part B by volume. Accurate measurement and thorough mixing are crucial for proper curing and performance.

Q: How long does Megapoxy 132 take to cure?

A: Cure times vary based on temperature. At 25°C, the minimum cure time is 24 hours, while at 35°C, it's 12 hours. Thin film cure at 25°C is 4-6 hours. Ensure adequate ventilation during curing.

Q: Can fine aggregates be used with Megapoxy 132?

A: Yes, Megapoxy 132 can be used with fine aggregates to make screed floors or broadcast between coats for non-slip finishes.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Megapoxy 132?

A: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves and eye protection. Use in a well-ventilated area. Refer to the Megapoxy 132 Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.

  • Proper surface preparation is crucial for adhesion.
  • Wear appropriate PPE, including gloves and eye protection.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during application.

column2: Megapoxy HX Extra Low Viscosity Epoxy Resin
column3:
Use Megapoxy HX for: Concrete crack repair, precise casting, and laminating porous materials.

Megapoxy HX is a specially formulated, extra low viscosity epoxy resin designed for demanding applications. Its 100% solids, solvent-free formula ensures minimal shrinkage and a powerful bond, making it ideal for deep concrete crack repairs via gravity penetration or low-pressure injection. This hydrophilic resin also excels in impregnating porous substrates like masonry and timber, and serves as a reliable laminating resin for fibreglass work.

Key Features of Megapoxy HX

  • Extra Low Viscosity: Penetrates deeply into fine cracks and porous materials, ensuring thorough repairs and impregnations.
  • 100% Solids, Solvent-Free: Provides a strong, durable bond with minimal shrinkage and reduced VOCs, enhancing workplace safety.
  • Hydrophilic Properties: Bonds effectively to slightly damp concrete, expanding application possibilities and ensuring reliable repairs even in challenging conditions.
  • High Strength: Exhibits exceptional compressive, tensile, and flexural strengths, surpassing the capabilities of concrete for long-lasting repairs.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for casting, low-pressure injection, surface hardening, floor repairs, laminating, masonry sealing, capillary action, and vacuum bagging.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy HX is engineered for superior performance in demanding applications. Its low viscosity allows for easy mixing and deep penetration, ensuring complete coverage and strong bonds. The precise 3:1 mixing ratio (Part A to Part B) is essential for optimal curing and performance.

Chemical Properties: 100% solids, solvent-free, hydrophilic epoxy resin. This formulation provides excellent adhesion and minimal shrinkage.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature of 10°C (50°F). Ensure the substrate is within this range for proper curing and bonding. Cure times vary: 60 minutes work time at 25°C, 48 hours minimum cure at 15°C, 24 hours at 25°C, and 12 hours at 35°C. Thin film cure at 25°C is 4-6 hours.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, measuring jugs, low-pressure injection equipment (if applicable), spatulas, and personal protective equipment (PPE).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure accurate measurement of Part A and Part B for proper curing. For deep cracks, use low-pressure injection to ensure complete penetration. When laminating, ensure proper wetting of fibreglass materials.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete curing can result from incorrect mixing ratios or low temperatures. Ensure accurate measurements and maintain a minimum temperature of 10°C.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures, which can affect product viscosity and curing properties.

Certifications

  • ASTM D695 (Compressive Strength and Modulus of Elasticity)
  • ASTM D4541 (Bond Strength Concrete)
  • ASTM D897 (Tensile Bond Strength Steel)
  • ASTM D790 (Flexural Strength)
  • ASTM 638 (Tensile Strength)
  • ASTM D1002 (Tensile Shear Strength)
  • ASTM D2240 (Hardness - Shore D)

How to apply Megapoxy HX:

  1. Prepare the Surface: Clean and prepare the substrate as per the surface preparation guidelines. Remove any loose materials and contaminants.
  2. Measure and Mix: Accurately measure Part A and Part B in a 3:1 volume ratio. Mix thoroughly until a uniform consistency is achieved.
  3. Apply the Resin: Apply Megapoxy HX using gravity penetration, low-pressure injection, or other suitable methods. Ensure complete coverage and penetration.
  4. Allow to Cure: Allow the resin to cure according to the recommended cure times based on the ambient temperature.
  5. Clean Up: Clean tools and equipment with Megapoxy Thinners before the resin cures.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy HX

Q: How do I ensure proper mixing of Megapoxy HX?

A: Measure Part A and Part B accurately using a 3:1 volume ratio. Mix thoroughly until a uniform consistency is achieved. Improper mixing can lead to incomplete curing and reduced strength.

Q: What is the ideal temperature for applying Megapoxy HX?

A: The minimum application temperature is 10°C. Warmer temperatures will accelerate curing. Ensure the substrate is also within this temperature range for optimal bonding and performance.

Q: Can Megapoxy HX be used on damp concrete?

A: Yes, Megapoxy HX is hydrophilic, allowing it to bond effectively to slightly damp concrete. However, standing water should be removed for best results.

Q: What surface preparation is required for concrete crack repair?

A: Clean the concrete surface to remove grease and oil. Remove surface laitance through mechanical abrasion or acid etching. Ensure the surface is dry for maximum adhesion.

Q: How long does Megapoxy HX take to cure?

A: Cure times vary based on temperature. At 25°C, expect a 24-hour minimum cure time. At 15°C, it's 48 hours, and at 35°C, it's 12 hours. Thin film cure at 25°C is 4-6 hours.

  • Proper surface preparation is crucial for adhesion.
  • Wear appropriate PPE, including gloves and eye protection.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during application.

column2: Megapoxy HT Hydrophilic Epoxy Gel Adhesive
column3:
Use Megapoxy HT for: new to old concrete bonding, concrete crack repair, underwater repairs, steel anchoring, and epoxy mortars.

Megapoxy HT is a high-performance, 100% solids, resin-based, solvent-free, hydrophilic epoxy gel adhesive. It is specifically formulated to resist hydrogen sulphide, making it ideal for use in sewage treatment plants and pipes. With excellent static and dynamic mechanical properties, Megapoxy HT can be used to create high-strength epoxy mortars. It's suitable for wet to dry concrete adhesion, underwater and splash zone repairs, and various concrete repair applications. This product is VOC-free, ensuring a safe and environmentally friendly application.

Key Features of Megapoxy HT

  • 100% solids, solvent-free formulation.
  • Hydrophilic properties, ideal for wet conditions.
  • Resistant to hydrogen sulphide.
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete and steel.
  • High compressive and tensile strengths.
  • Suitable for underwater and splash zone repairs.
  • VOC-free.
  • Can be used to create high-strength epoxy mortars.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Two-component, 100% solids, hydrophilic epoxy gel.
  • Application Temperature Range: Minimum 10°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, trowel, brush, or injection equipment.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough surface preparation (grit blasting, grinding, or acid etching). Mix thoroughly for the specified time. For steel anchoring, ensure proper hole preparation and use oil-free compressed air. For new to old concrete bonding, apply Megapoxy HT and place new concrete within 15 minutes.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete mixing (remix thoroughly). Poor adhesion (ensure proper surface preparation). Uneven application (apply with consistent technique).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage and application.

Certifications

  • ASTM D695, ASTM D4541, ASTM D897, ASTM D790, ASTM D638, ASTM D1002, ASTM D2240-00.

column2: Megapoxy H Low Viscosity Epoxy Resin - Hydrophilic (2 Part Kit)
column3:
Use Megapoxy H for: Concrete crack repairs, steel anchoring, underwater repairs, and creating high-strength epoxy mortars.

Megapoxy H is a versatile, low-viscosity, 100% solids epoxy resin designed for demanding applications in both wet and dry environments. Its hydrophilic properties make it ideal for underwater and splash zone repairs, while its high strength ensures durable bonds in concrete and steel anchoring. Compliant with AS/NZS 4020:2018 for potable water contact, Megapoxy H is also resistant to hydrogen sulfide, making it suitable for sewer and water treatment facilities. This VOC-free resin offers exceptional static and dynamic mechanical properties, enabling the creation of high-strength epoxy mortars for various repair and construction needs.

Key Features of Megapoxy H

  • Hydrophilic Formulation: Bonds effectively to wet or dry concrete, ideal for underwater and splash zone repairs.
  • Low Viscosity: Ensures excellent penetration into cracks and voids, improving crack repair and anchoring effectiveness.
  • High Strength: Provides compressive strength of 100 MPa, tensile bond strength to steel of 20 MPa, and new to old concrete bonding of 36MPa, exceeding concrete's inherent strength.
  • AS/NZS 4020:2018 Compliance: Safe for use in contact with drinking water, ensuring potable water safety.
  • Chemical Resistance: Resists hydrogen sulfide, suitable for sewer and water treatment applications.
  • VOC-Free: Environmentally friendly with no volatile organic compounds.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy H is formulated to provide exceptional bonding and mechanical properties. Its low viscosity allows for deep penetration into substrates, while its hydrophilic nature ensures strong adhesion in damp conditions. This combination makes it highly effective for crack repairs and steel anchoring.

Chemical Properties: 100% solids, resin-based, solvent-free, hydrophilic liquid epoxy resin. Provides excellent chemical resistance, including resistance to hydrogen sulphide.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature of 10°C (50°F). Cure times vary with temperature, from 48 hours at 15°C (59°F) to 12 hours at 35°C (95°F). Thin film cure at 25°C (77°F) is 5-6 hours.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, trowels, brushes, injection guns for crack repair, drilling equipment for steel anchoring, and grit blasting equipment for surface preparation.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing of Part A and Part B to avoid curing issues. For crack repair, use low-pressure or pressure injection techniques based on crack depth and accessibility. Properly prepare surfaces by mechanical abrasion or acid etching for optimal bonding.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete curing can result from inaccurate mixing or low temperatures. Ensure precise mixing ratios and maintain application temperatures above 10°C (50°F). Poor bonding often results from inadequate surface preparation; follow recommended surface preparation guidelines.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life details.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to prevent product degradation.

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 4020:2018 “Testing of Products For Use In Contact with Drinking Water”.

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy H

Q: How do I prepare concrete for Megapoxy H application?

A: Concrete should be free from grease and oil. Remove surface laitance by mechanical abrasion (grit blasting, grinding) or acid etching. Ensure the surface is clean and dry for optimal adhesion.

Q: What are the key benefits of using Megapoxy H in wet conditions?

A: Megapoxy H is hydrophilic, meaning it bonds effectively to wet concrete. This makes it ideal for underwater repairs and applications in damp environments, ensuring strong and durable bonds.

Q: Can Megapoxy H be used for steel anchoring?

A: Yes, Megapoxy H is excellent for steel anchoring. Drill holes 1.5 times the steel diameter, clean thoroughly, and pour the mixed resin. Grit blast and degrease the steel for best results.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Megapoxy H?

A: The mixing ratio is 3 parts Part A to 1 part Part B by volume. Accurate mixing is essential for proper curing and performance.

Q: What is the compressive strength of cured Megapoxy H?

A: The compressive strength of cured Megapoxy H is 100 MPa, providing a very strong and durable repair or anchoring solution.

  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.

column2: Megapoxy PF Rapid Set Epoxy Adhesive
column3:
Use Megapoxy PF for: Rapid repairs to tanks, pipes, machinery, concrete, and metals; high-strength bonding and grouting applications.

Megapoxy PF is a fast-setting, two-component epoxy paste adhesive that delivers exceptional strength and reliability in rapid repair and bonding applications. With a working time of just 3 minutes and significant curing within 1 hour, it's perfect for emergency repairs and time-sensitive projects. Its non-sag formulation ensures easy application on vertical and overhead surfaces, making it a versatile solution for various substrates including concrete, metal, stone, and ceramics.

Key Features of Megapoxy PF

  • Rapid setting: sets in 3 minutes
  • High compressive and tensile strength
  • Non-sag formulation for vertical and overhead applications
  • 1:1 volume mix ratio for ease of use
  • Excellent chemical resistance
  • Can be machined after 30 minutes of curing
  • Suitable for emergency repairs and structural bonding

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties
    • Two-component, rapid-setting epoxy paste
  • Application Temperature Range
    • Minimum 10°C, Maximum 80°C (operating)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools
    • Mixing containers, spatulas, Megapoxy Thinners for cleaning, trowel for larger applications.
  • Trade-Specific Tips
    • Mix only the amount that can be applied within 3 minutes due to rapid setting.
    • For concrete, mechanical abrasion is preferred over acid etching for surface preparation.
    • When bonding metals, grit blasting is recommended for maximum adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions
    • Premature hardening: Mix quickly and apply immediately.
    • Weak bond on coated surfaces: Remove all coatings prior to application.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements
    • Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information
    • Consult product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations
    • Avoid extreme temperature fluctuations during storage.

Certifications

column3:
Use Megapoxy PM for: Bonding, filling, and repairing various materials, including concrete, metal, and wood. Ideal for vertical and overhead applications due to its non-sag properties.

Megapoxy PM is a premium, two-component epoxy paste adhesive formulated for bonding, gap-filling, and repair applications. This non-sag formula is ideal for vertical and overhead surfaces, providing excellent adhesion to various materials, including concrete, metal, wood, and more. With its easy-to-use 1:1 mix ratio and high strength, Megapoxy PM is suitable for trade professionals and DIY enthusiasts seeking a reliable and versatile adhesive solution. It is VOC-free and available in white or grey, making it a safe and adaptable choice for various projects.

Key Features

  • Non-sag formula for vertical and overhead applications.
  • High strength and gap-filling capabilities.
  • Versatile for various bonding and repair applications.
  • Easy-to-use 1:1 mix ratio.
  • VOC-free and available in white or grey.
  • Excellent adhesion to concrete, metal, wood, and more.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Non-sag epoxy resin and filler.
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C.
  • Service Temperature Range: Up to 70°C.

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing container, stirrer, application tool (e.g., trowel, putty knife).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for optimal performance. Prepare surfaces properly for maximum adhesion. Choose the appropriate colour (white or grey) based on the application.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete mixing can lead to reduced strength and discolouration (ensure thorough mixing). Adhesion issues may arise from improper surface preparation (follow recommended surface preparation guidelines).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and heat sources.

column2: Megapoxy 84 Two Component Epoxy Paste Adhesive
column3:
Use Megapoxy 84 for: Bonding high-alumina ceramic tiles to steel or concrete in applications with elevated temperatures, such as industrial machinery and furnaces.

Megapoxy 84 is a high-performance, two-component epoxy paste adhesive specifically formulated for fixing high-alumina ceramic tile linings. This robust adhesive excels in demanding environments where elevated temperatures are encountered, offering exceptional bond strength and thermal resistance up to 120°C. Megapoxy 84 is suitable for a variety of industrial applications, including lining furnaces, kilns, and crushers, ensuring long-lasting and reliable performance under extreme conditions.

Key Features

  • Two-component epoxy paste adhesive
  • Designed for high-alumina ceramic tiles
  • Suitable for steel and concrete substrates
  • High-temperature resistance up to 120°C
  • Excellent bond strength and durability
  • Easy to mix and apply

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Epoxy
  • Mixing Ratio: 4 Part A to 1 Part B
  • Work Time at 25°C: 30 minutes
  • Minimum Application Temperature: 10°C
  • Maximum Operating Temperature: 120°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing container, putty knife or spatula, notched trowel, Megapoxy Thinners, warm soapy water, disposable rubber gloves.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are properly prepared by grinding or grit blasting. Mix the entire kit at once for best results. Apply adhesive at a rate of 1.25 litres per m². Press tiles firmly for full contact. Clean up with Megapoxy Thinners and warm soapy water.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid exposure to elevated temperatures during the initial 72-hour curing period. For applications exceeding 120°C, consult Megapoxy for alternative solutions.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Consult product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.

Certifications

  • ASTM D2240-00 (Hardness - Shore D)

column2: Megapoxy 69 High Strength Epoxy Adhesive Gel
column3:
Use Megapoxy 69 for: High-strength bonding of metals, concrete, stone, and timber in structural and demanding applications.

Megapoxy 69 is a world-leading, translucent, non-sag epoxy adhesive gel designed for high-strength bonding across a variety of substrates. Its formulation ensures exceptional adhesion between metals, concrete, masonry, natural stone, and timber, making it ideal for critical structural applications. This VOC-free, easy-to-mix adhesive maintains its integrity even under repeated high-impact forces, proving its reliability in challenging environments. Whether for civil engineering, marine applications, or intricate stone fabrications, Megapoxy 69 delivers a permanent, robust bond.

Key Features

  • Non-sag gel consistency for vertical and overhead applications
  • High tensile and compressive strength, exceeding concrete strength
  • Excellent adhesion to metals, concrete, stone, and timber
  • Simple 1:1 mixing ratio by volume
  • VOC-free and chemically resistant
  • Maintains strength under high-impact forces

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Epoxy Resin
  • Mixing Ratio: 1:1 by volume (Part A to Part B)
  • Work Time at 25°C (77°F): 45 minutes
  • Minimum Application Temperature: 10°C (50°F)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing spatulas, measuring containers, surface preparation tools (grit blaster, grinder, degreaser).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for optimal cure. For concrete, remove laitance through mechanical abrasion. For metals, grit blasting to AS CK 9.4 - 1964 Class 3 is recommended. Remove all coatings for best adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor mixing can lead to inadequate curing; always use a 1:1 ratio. For uneven surfaces, ensure proper gap filling with the non-sag gel.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for specific shelf life.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage.

Certifications

  • ASTM D695 (Compressive Strength, Modulus of Elasticity)
  • ASTM D4541 (Bond Strength Concrete)
  • ASTM D897 (Tensile Bond Strength Steel)
  • ASTM D790 (Flexural Strength)
  • ASTM D638 (Tensile Strength)
  • ASTM D1002 (Tensile Shear Strength)
  • ASTM D2240-00 (Hardness - Shore D)

column3:
Use Megapoxy P1 for: High-strength bonding and repairs of concrete, metal, and in potable water environments.

Megapoxy P1 is a two-component, gap-filling epoxy adhesive designed for professional use. Its Nil VOC formulation and compliance with AS/NZS 4020:2018 make it suitable for potable water applications. This product offers exceptional bonding strength to concrete, metal, and other materials, ensuring durable and reliable repairs. The easy 1:1 mixing ratio and creamy texture simplify application, even on vertical and overhead surfaces.

Key Features of Megapoxy P1

  • High Strength Bonding: Provides superior adhesion to concrete, steel, and other substrates, ensuring long-lasting repairs.
  • Nil VOC Formulation: Safe for use in potable water environments and complies with AS/NZS 4020:2018.
  • Easy 1:1 Mixing Ratio: Simplifies application and reduces errors, saving time and resources.
  • No-Sag Application: Creamy texture allows for easy application on vertical and overhead surfaces without dripping.
  • Chemical Resistance: Resistant to hydrogen sulphide and other chemicals, making it suitable for harsh environments.

Technical Overview

Megapoxy P1 is formulated with DGEBA epoxy resin and carbonate-free filler, providing exceptional strength and durability. Its high compressive strength (80 MPa) and tensile bond strength to steel (19 MPa) demonstrate its robust performance. The 60-minute work time at 25°C allows for precise application, while the varying cure times accommodate different project schedules.

Chemical Properties: DGEBA epoxy resin and carbonate-free filler, providing a strong, durable, and chemically resistant bond.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature of 10°C (50°F), ensuring reliable curing in various conditions. Maximum operating temperature of 80°C (176°F).

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing containers, spatulas, trowels, and appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure thorough mixing for optimal performance. Prepare surfaces by grit blasting or grinding for maximum adhesion. Apply a minimum 3mm layer for steel protection.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inaccurate mixing can lead to poor curing. Always use a 1:1 ratio and mix thoroughly. Surface contamination reduces adhesion; ensure surfaces are clean and prepared.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to the product packaging for specific shelf life information.
  • Temperature Considerations: Flash point above 200°C (392°F) ensures safe handling and storage.

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 4020:2018: Testing of Products For Use In Contact with Drinking Water.

column32: Megapoxy P1 Gap Filling Epoxy Paste Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Megapoxy P1 is a versatile epoxy adhesive for bonding concrete, metals, and fibreglass with a simple 1:1 mix ratio. Buy now at Adheseal.
column52:
How to apply Megapoxy P1:

  1. Prepare the Surface: Clean and prepare the substrate as outlined in the surface preparation guidelines.
  2. Mix the Components: Combine Part A and Part B in a 1:1 volume ratio. Mix thoroughly until a uniform dark grey color is achieved.
  3. Apply the Adhesive: Apply Megapoxy P1 using a trowel or spatula. Ensure even coverage and proper filling of gaps.
  4. Allow to Cure: Allow the adhesive to cure for the specified time based on the ambient temperature.
  5. Clean Up: Clean tools and mixing equipment with Megapoxy Thinners.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megapoxy P1

Q: How do I prepare concrete for Megapoxy P1 application?

A: Ensure concrete is free from grease and oil. Remove laitance by mechanical abrasion (grit blasting, grinding) or acid etching. Allow to dry thoroughly for maximum adhesion.

Q: What is the mixing ratio for Megapoxy P1?

A: The mixing ratio is a simple 1:1 by volume. Mix Part A and Part B thoroughly until a uniform dark grey color is achieved.

Q: Can Megapoxy P1 be used in potable water applications?

A: Yes, Megapoxy P1 is Nil VOC and complies with AS/NZS 4020:2018, making it safe for use in contact with drinking water.

Q: What is the cure time for Megapoxy P1?

A: Cure time varies depending on temperature: 48 hours at 15°C, 24 hours at 25°C, and 12 hours at 35°C. Full cure is achieved in 4 days at 25°C.

Q: How do I protect steel with Megapoxy P1?

A: Apply a minimum 3mm layer of Megapoxy P1 to grit-blasted steel. This provides protection equivalent to approximately 50mm of concrete cover.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Megapoxy P1?

A: Use proper PPE, including rubber gloves. Ensure thorough mixing. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information and proper industrial hygiene.
column54:
Megapoxy P1 limitations:

  • Requires proper surface preparation for optimal adhesion.
  • Inaccurate mixing ratios can lead to poor curing and reduced performance.
  • Bonding to coated surfaces will give inferior bond strengths compared to bonding directly to a prepared substrate.

Safety precautions when using Megapoxy P1:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Use rubber gloves, eye protection, and appropriate respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.

column2: Everbond 2P Contact Adhesive Additive - T3205 Crosslinker
column3:
Use Everbond 2P Crosslinker for: Enhancing heat resistance and adhesion of contact adhesives, especially for bonding rubber materials.

Everbond 2P Crosslinker is an isocyanate-based additive that significantly improves the performance of Everbond Contact Adhesives. It is used to enhance the heat resistance and adhesion of urethane, natural rubber, and synthetic rubber adhesives, making it ideal for applications involving rubber materials. This crosslinker ensures a more durable and reliable bond, especially in high-temperature environments.

Key Features of Everbond 2P Crosslinker

  • Isocyanate-Based: Provides effective cross-linking and adhesion promotion.
  • Enhances Heat Resistance: Improves adhesive performance in high temperatures.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for urethane, natural rubber, and neoprene adhesives.
  • Improves Durability: Increases the longevity and reliability of bonded materials.

Why Choose Everbond 2P Crosslinker:

  • Enhanced Performance: Ensures reliable bonds in demanding conditions.
  • Improved Adhesion: Particularly effective for bonding rubber materials.
  • Increased Durability: Extends the life of bonded assemblies.

When to Choose Everbond 2P Crosslinker versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Everbond 2P Crosslinker when: Working with adhesives in high-temperature environments or bonding rubber materials.
  • Consider other options when: Isocyanate-free additives are required, or pot life is a critical factor.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Improves the durability and reliability of bonded materials, reducing maintenance and replacement costs.

Trade-Specific Applications for Everbond 2P Crosslinker:

For Automotive Technicians:

  • Use to enhance the heat resistance of adhesives in engine compartments.
  • Apply when bonding rubber seals, hoses, and other components.
  • Ensures reliable performance under high operating temperatures.

For Construction and Manufacturing:

  • Use when bonding materials exposed to direct sunlight or high temperatures.
  • Apply to improve the durability of rubber and synthetic material bonds.
  • Ensures long-lasting adhesion in demanding environments.

Technical Overview

Everbond 2P Crosslinker is an isocyanate-based additive that enhances the heat resistance and adhesion of contact adhesives. It is mixed with the adhesive at specific ratios (3-10% by volume) and has a limited pot life. The resulting mixture improves the adhesive's performance, especially in high-temperature applications.

Application: Mix with adhesive at specified ratios, use within pot life.

Physical Properties: Clear amber liquid, water thin, specific gravity approx. 0.96.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Mixing equipment, measuring containers, and safety gloves.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure accurate mixing ratios, use the mixture within the pot life, and work in a well-ventilated area.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Premature gelling (use within pot life), poor adhesion (ensure proper mixing and surface preparation).

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place.
  • Shelf Life Information: One year from the date of manufacturing.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from extreme temperatures.

Safety and Compliance

  • Not classified as hazardous, but may cause skin irritation.
  • Refer to the SDS for detailed safety information.
column7: additive,adhesion promoter,auto body-i,bottle,caravan and truck-i,fast cure,high temperature,joinery & cabinets-i,wood-i
column32: Everbond 2P Crosslinker | Adheseal
column33: Everbond 2P Crosslinker: Isocyanate-based cross-linking agent for Everbond Contact Adhesive. Enhances heat resistance in rubber and urethane bonds.
column52:
How to apply Everbond 2P Crosslinker:

  1. Measure the appropriate amount of Everbond 2P Crosslinker (3-6% or 5-10% by volume).
  2. Add the crosslinker to the Everbond Contact Adhesive.
  3. Mix thoroughly until the solution is uniform.
  4. Apply the mixed adhesive within its pot-life using the recommended application method for contact adhesive.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everbond 2P Crosslinker

Q: What is Everbond 2P Crosslinker used for?

A: It is used to enhance the heat resistance and adhesion of Everbond Contact Adhesives, especially for bonding rubber materials.

Q: What types of adhesives are compatible with Everbond 2P Crosslinker?

A: It is compatible with urethane, natural rubber, and neoprene adhesives.

Q: What are the mixing ratios for Everbond 2P Crosslinker?

A: Use 3-6% by volume for natural rubber and polyurethane adhesives, and 5-10% by volume for neoprene adhesives.

Q: What is the pot life of the mixed adhesive?

A: The pot life ranges from several hours to one working day. The mixture becomes increasingly difficult to use and eventually gels irreversibly.

Q: Is Everbond 2P Crosslinker hazardous?

A: It is not classified as hazardous, but may cause skin irritation in sensitive individuals. Refer to the SDS for more information.

Q: How long is the shelf life of Everbond 2P Crosslinker?

A: The shelf life is one year from the date of manufacturing.
column54:
Everbond 2P Crosslinker limitations:

  • Limited pot-life after mixing; must be used within several hours to one working day.
  • Requires accurate measurements for optimal performance.
  • Not suitable for use with adhesives outside of the specified types (urethane, natural rubber, synthetic rubber).

Safety precautions when using Everbond 2P Crosslinker:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and respiratory protection in well ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during mixing and application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use. Consult the SDS for detailed safety information.
  • First Aid: For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water. If ingested, seek medical advice.
column55: Everbond 2P Crosslinker is an isocyanate-based cross-linking agent designed to enhance the performance of Everbond Contact Adhesive. It increases the heat resistance of adhesive bonds, particularly in natural rubber, synthetic rubber, and polyurethane applications. This product is essential for improving the durability and thermal stability of bonded materials.
column56:
Everbond 2P Crosslinker can be used with the following adhesives:

  • Everbond contact adhesives based on urethane.
  • Everbond contact adhesives based on natural rubber.
  • Everbond contact adhesives based on synthetic rubber, especially neoprene.
column57:
Use Everbond 2P Crosslinker for:

  • Enhancing Heat Resistance: Improving the heat resistance of Everbond contact adhesives in applications where high temperatures are a concern, such as automotive and industrial settings.
  • Improving Adhesion: Strengthening the bond of Everbond contact adhesives, particularly for rubber materials.
  • Industrial Bonding: Enhancing the performance of adhesives in demanding industrial applications.
  • Automotive Applications: Improving the heat resistance and bond strength of adhesives used in automotive assembly and repair.

Why Use Everbond 2P Crosslinker:

  • Increased Heat Resistance: Significantly enhances the temperature resistance of Everbond contact adhesives, ensuring bond integrity in high-heat environments. For example, in automotive applications, it prevents bond failure due to engine heat.
  • Stronger Bonds: Acts as an adhesion promoter, creating stronger and more durable bonds, particularly for rubber materials. This ensures long-lasting performance in demanding applications.
  • Improved Durability: Enhances the overall durability and longevity of adhesive bonds, reducing the need for frequent repairs or replacements.
  • Versatile Compatibility: Compatible with a range of Everbond contact adhesives, making it a flexible solution for various bonding needs.

column2: Styrobond ST - Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive
column3:
Use Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive for: Bonding polystyrene foam to various materials like sheet metals, fibre cement, plywood, and particle board.

Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive is a specialized contact adhesive formulated for bonding polystyrene foam to a variety of substrates. Unlike conventional contact adhesives, Styrobond ST uses special solvents that won't damage polystyrene. Its low viscosity makes it ideal for spray application, ensuring efficient coverage and strong, durable bonds. This adhesive is perfect for applications requiring a reliable bond between polystyrene and materials such as sheet metal, fibre cement sheet, plywood, and particle board.

Key Features of Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive

  • Polystyrene-Safe Formulation: Formulated with special solvents to prevent damage to polystyrene foam, ensuring a strong and lasting bond without degradation. For example, it can be used to bond polystyrene insulation to walls without concern for the adhesive dissolving the foam.
  • Sprayable Application: Low viscosity allows for easy and efficient application with conventional spray equipment, saving time and ensuring even coverage. This is particularly beneficial for large surface areas, such as bonding polystyrene sheets in cool rooms.
  • Strong and Durable Bond: Provides a high-strength bond on both porous and non-porous surfaces, ensuring long-term adhesion and reliability. This makes it ideal for applications where the bond must withstand stress, such as in packaging or construction.
  • Versatile Bonding: Bonds polystyrene foam to a variety of materials including sheet metals, fibre cement sheet, plywood, and particle board, making it suitable for diverse applications. For instance, it can be used to adhere polystyrene to plywood in the manufacture of signs.

Technical Overview

Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive is a rubber solvent adhesive designed for spray application. Its key technical property is its formulation with solvents that are safe for polystyrene foam. The low viscosity ensures it can be applied evenly and efficiently with spray equipment, providing a uniform bond line. This is critical for achieving maximum adhesion and preventing weak spots.

Chemical Properties: Rubber solvent based, this adhesive is designed to create a strong bond through solvent evaporation. The specific solvent blend is crucial for its compatibility with polystyrene, preventing the foam from being dissolved or degraded.

Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F). This temperature range is critical for proper application and bond formation. Applying the adhesive outside this range can lead to poor adhesion or improper curing. For example, applying it on a very cold day may prevent the solvents from evaporating properly, resulting in a weak bond.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Conventional spray equipment (spray gun, compressor), wooden block and mallet, hand roller, or mechanical nip-roller.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of contaminants. For metals, wipe with a solvent for maximum bond strength. Apply a liberal, even coat to both surfaces. Allow the adhesive to dry completely before bringing surfaces together. Use adequate pressure during bonding.
  • Common Issues and Solutions:
    • Weak bond: Ensure proper surface preparation, even adhesive application, sufficient drying time, and adequate pressure.
    • Uneven spray pattern: Adjust spray equipment for a consistent and even spray.
    • Lifting laminates: Use G clamps or sash clamps to maintain pressure during the bonding period.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F). Keep containers tightly closed when not in use.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing the adhesive outside the recommended temperature range, as it can affect its performance and shelf life.

column33: Styrobond ST is a specially formulated contact adhesive designed for bonding porous and non-porous materials to expanded polystyrene foam. It offers a low viscosity for spray application, ensuring strong and reliable bonds. Learn more about its features, application methods, and drying time.
column52:
How to apply Styrobond ST:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry, removing any contaminants.
  2. For metals, wipe clean with solvent.
  3. Apply a liberal, even coat to both surfaces.
  4. For spray application, apply from a distance of 20-30 cm with an even spray pattern.
  5. Allow the adhesive to dry.
  6. Combine surfaces and apply pressure using mechanical nip-rollers, hand rollers, a rubber mallet, or a wooden block.
  7. For difficult laminates, use G clamps or sash clamps during the bonding period.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive

Q: How do I prepare surfaces before applying Styrobond ST?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of any contaminants like grease, oil, or dust. For metal surfaces, wiping them with a solvent is recommended to achieve maximum bond strength. This ensures the adhesive can properly adhere to the surfaces.

Q: What makes Styrobond ST different from other contact adhesives?

A: Styrobond ST is specifically formulated with special solvents that will not harm or dissolve polystyrene foam. This is a critical difference, as conventional contact adhesives can damage or degrade polystyrene, compromising the bond and the integrity of the foam.

Q: Can I use Styrobond ST on materials other than polystyrene?

A: Yes, Styrobond ST can be used to bond polystyrene foam to a variety of other materials, including sheet metals, fibre cement sheet, plywood, and particle board. This versatility makes it suitable for a wide range of applications.

Q: What is the best method for applying Styrobond ST?

A: Styrobond ST is designed for spray application. Use conventional spray equipment to apply an even coat to both surfaces. Ensure the spray pattern is consistent to avoid weak bonds. Allow the adhesive to dry completely before joining the surfaces.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Styrobond ST?

A: While this product is not classified as hazardous according to Worksafe Australia, skin irritation and sensitization may occur in sensitive individuals. It is essential to consult the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for comprehensive safety information and to take appropriate precautions.
column54:
Styrobond ST limitations:

  • Drying time is affected by temperature and humidity.
  • Trapped solvent can affect bond strength and heat resistance.
  • Uneven spray patterns will result in a weak bond.

Safety precautions when using Styrobond ST:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear appropriate protective equipment, including gloves and respiratory protection, in well ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin contact and inhalation of vapors.
  • MSDS: Consult the Material Safety Data Sheet for detailed safety information.

Use Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive for:

  • Insulation Installation: Bonding polystyrene insulation boards to walls, ceilings, and roofs in residential and commercial construction. Its polystyrene-safe formulation ensures the insulation remains intact.
  • Packaging: Securing polystyrene foam packaging materials to various substrates, providing a strong and reliable bond for protecting goods during transit.
  • Signage: Laminating polystyrene sheets to other materials like plywood or metal to create lightweight and durable signs. The spray application ensures even coverage on large surfaces.
  • Cool Room Construction: Bonding polystyrene panels together or to other surfaces in the construction of cool rooms and refrigerated spaces. The strong bond and resistance to degradation are crucial in these environments.

Why Use Styrobond ST Spray Grade Polystyrene Foam Adhesive:

  • Ensured Polystyrene Integrity: The specialized formulation prevents damage to polystyrene, ensuring the long-term performance and integrity of the foam. For example, when bonding polystyrene insulation, you can be confident that the adhesive won't compromise its insulating properties.
  • Efficient Application: The sprayable consistency allows for quick and easy application, saving time and labor. This is particularly beneficial for large-scale projects where efficiency is critical. For instance, in manufacturing, it can speed up the assembly process.
  • Reliable Bond Strength: Provides a strong and durable bond, ensuring long-lasting adhesion and preventing delamination. In construction, this ensures the bonded materials remain securely in place over time, enhancing the durability of the structure.
  • Versatility: Bonds polystyrene to a variety of materials, making it suitable for diverse applications across different industries. This versatility reduces the need for multiple adhesives, simplifying inventory and application processes.

column2: Everbond Ultra Clear Brush Contact Adhesive
column3:
Use Everbond Ultra Clear Brush Contact Adhesive for: Bonding various substrates where a clear, strong, and lasting bond is required, such as in furniture and automotive upholstery.

Everbond Ultra Clear Brush Contact Adhesive is a high-performance, one-component adhesive designed for applications where a clear and strong bond is desired. It offers a very short flash-off time, high initial strength, and excellent resistance to aging and heat. This versatile adhesive is suitable for a wide range of substrates, including timber, rubber, plastic laminates, leather, fabric, and more.

Key Features

  • Ultra clear
  • One-component adhesive
  • Very short flash-off time
  • High initial strength
  • Easy to apply
  • Resistant against aging
  • High heat resistance
  • Broad adhesion range
  • Fast dry time (approximately 3-5 minutes)

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polychloroprene
  • Application Temperature Range: +10°C to +35°C
  • Storage Temperature: +10°C to +25°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Suitable roller coater, tooth comb, brush, or notched trowel, cleaning supplies (acetone)
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Apply evenly to both surfaces and avoid excessive adhesive or pooling. Allow for proper flash-off time before bonding. Apply strong and even pressure when bonding. For open weave or porous materials, Adheseal spray contact is recommended.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Weak bond or bond failure may occur if the adhesive is applied excessively, allowed to pool, or if the substrates are bonded together too early. Ensure proper application and flash-off time for optimal results.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original, undamaged packaging, in dry conditions and out of direct sunlight, at temperatures between +10°C and +25°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not use in temperatures below +10°C. For best results, apply at +20°C.

Use Everbond Brush Contact for: Strong, fast-drying bonds in laminate, foam, and upholstery applications where high heat and water resistance are essential.

Everbond Brush Contact is a premium-grade, brushable contact adhesive designed for professionals requiring fast initial grab, excellent heat resistance, and superior bonding strength. Ideal for the laminate and foam fabrication industries, this one-component adhesive is easy to apply, dries quickly, and offers exceptional performance across a wide range of substrates including timber, laminates, rubber, and metals. Trusted by trades for automotive and furniture upholstery, it ensures a reliable, long-lasting bond even under demanding Australian conditions.

Key Features of Everbond Brush Contact

  • Fast dry time (3-5 minutes) for increased productivity
  • High heat resistance for durability in tough environments
  • Broad adhesion range for various substrates including timber, metal, and plastic laminates
  • Easy application by brush, rollcoater, or notched trowel
  • Resistant to water and ageing for long-term performance

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: One-component polychloroprene
  • Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C (50°F to 95°F)
  • Density: 0.81 kg/L
  • Consistency: Thixotropic liquid
  • Solid Content by Mass: Approximately 17%
  • Coverage Rate: 6–8 m² per litre

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Brush, rollcoater, tooth-comb, or notched trowel
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Avoid excessive adhesive; ensure touch-dry state before bonding to prevent weak bonds or blistering
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Entrapped solvents cause bond failure—ensure proper flash-off time and even pressure during application

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original packaging, dry conditions, out of sunlight, between 10°C and 25°C
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from production date
  • Temperature Considerations: Do not apply below 10°C; ideal application at 20°C

Certifications

  • Complies with WorkSafe Australia safety standards
  • Tested for Australian climate conditions
  • Manufacturer quality control certified

How to apply Everbond Brush Contact:

  1. Prepare clean, dry, and oil-free surfaces
  2. Apply adhesive evenly on both surfaces using brush or trowel
  3. Allow to dry for 3–5 minutes until touch dry
  4. Join surfaces with firm, even pressure
  5. Ensure no adhesive pools or entrapped solvents
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everbond Brush Contact

Q: How should Everbond Brush Contact be applied for best results?

A: Apply evenly to both surfaces using a brush or notched trowel. Wait 3–5 minutes until touch dry, then press firmly together to ensure strong bonding.

Q: How does the adhesive perform in high-temperature environments?

A: Everbond Brush Contact offers high heat resistance, withstanding temperatures above 120°C when used with the 2P additive, ensuring bond integrity.

Q: What substrates is this adhesive compatible with?

A: It bonds to timber, laminates, rubber, leather, fabric, MDF, metal, and more. Always test on your specific materials for optimal compatibility.

Q: What can cause a weak bond or failure?

A: Applying too much adhesive, bonding before it’s touch dry, or working below 10°C may cause failures. Always follow proper flash-off and pressure techniques.

Q: Are there safety precautions I should follow?

A: Wear gloves, ensure good ventilation, and avoid skin contact. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet for detailed handling and disposal guidelines.

  • Handling: Avoid skin contact, clean up with acetone immediately after use

Use Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive for: Laminate bonding, foam fabrication, upholstery, and adhering various materials in transport vehicle production.

Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive is a premium-grade, one-component polychloroprene adhesive formulated for high-performance bonding. Its fast flash-off time and high heat/water resistance make it ideal for demanding applications in various industries. This adhesive provides a strong, lasting bond across a broad range of substrates, ensuring reliable results.

Key Features of Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive

  • Fast Flash-Off Time: Approximately 3-5 minutes, speeding up application and increasing efficiency.
  • High Heat Resistance: Ensures durable bonds in high-temperature environments, preventing bond failure.
  • High Water Resistance: Provides reliable bonds in wet or humid conditions, extending application range.
  • Broad Adhesion Range: Bonds to timber, rubber, plastics, leather, fabric, MDF, particleboard, concrete, glass, and metal.
  • Easy Application: Suitable for spray, rollcoater, brush, or tooth-comb application.

Why Choose Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive:

  • Time Efficiency: Fast flash-off and drying times reduce project timelines.
  • Durable Bonds: High heat and water resistance ensure long-lasting performance.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various industries and materials.
  • Reliable Performance: One-component formulation ensures consistent results.
  • Ease of Use: Simple application methods and broad adhesion range.

When to Choose Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive over standard contact adhesives when: Fast application and high heat/water resistance are crucial, such as in automotive or marine applications.
  • Consider other options when: Bonding materials that require very slow dry times or when extremely high initial grab is not needed.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Everbond 230 offers superior performance and efficiency, providing long-term value in demanding applications.

Trade-Specific Applications for Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive:

For Automotive Trades:

  • Bonding upholstery and trim materials with high heat resistance.
  • Adhering interior panels and coverings with durable, long-lasting bonds.
  • Providing reliable bonds for materials with high spring-back forces.

For Furniture Upholsterers:

  • Adhering fabrics, leather, and foams to frames and supports.
  • Ensuring strong, lasting bonds for high-wear furniture applications.
  • Providing efficient application with fast flash-off times.

Technical Overview

Everbond 230 Spray Contact Adhesive is a premium-grade adhesive designed for high-performance bonding. Its one-component polychloroprene formulation ensures consistent results, while its fast flash-off and drying times enhance application efficiency. This adhesive provides strong, durable bonds across a wide range of materials, making it suitable for various industries.

Chemical Properties: One-component polychloroprene formulation provides a strong, flexible bond. This adhesive is resistant to aging, heat, and water, ensuring long-lasting performance.

Application Temperature Range: 10°C to 35°C. This range allows for application in most Australian climates. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry for optimal adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Spray gun, rollcoater, brush, or tooth-comb.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For porous materials, spray application is recommended to prevent bleed-through. Avoid excessive adhesive application to prevent weak bonds.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper surface preparation to prevent adhesion issues. Avoid applying in temperatures below 10°C to prevent condensation.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original, undamaged packaging in dry conditions, away from direct sunlight, between 10°C and 25°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months when stored according to recommended conditions.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

column3:
Use Everbond PVA Xlink 3 for: Water-resistant bonding in cabinetry, shopfitting, and joinery, including dowelling and laminating, ensuring strong and durable results.

Everbond PVA Xlink 3 is a premium, water-borne synthetic resin adhesive designed for the woodworking industry. Its self-crosslinking formulation provides excellent water resistance, making it ideal for applications where moisture exposure is a concern. This single-component adhesive simplifies application while delivering high strength and quick bonding properties. Conforming to AS 2754.2 1991 and EN 204, Everbond PVA Xlink 3 meets rigorous standards for water-resistant wood adhesives. Suitable for all types of timber, it is perfect for dowelling, laminating, and general woodworking in cabinetry, shopfitting, and joinery. With the option for thermo-curing to further enhance water resistance, this adhesive is a top choice for Australian trades seeking reliable performance.

Key Features of Everbond PVA Xlink 3

  • Water Resistant: Provides excellent resistance to moisture, ideal for applications requiring water protection.
  • Self-Crosslinking Formulation: Simplifies application with a single-component adhesive.
  • Conforms to AS 2754.2 & EN 204: Meets stringent Australian and European standards for water-resistant wood adhesives.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for dowelling, laminating, and general woodworking.
  • Thermo-Curing Option: Enhances water resistance and speeds up curing with Catalyst Number 1.

Technical Overview

Everbond PVA Xlink 3 cures by water dissipation and crosslinking, achieving a firm, water-resistant bond. The adhesive interphase reaches moisture equilibrium in approximately seven days, depending on environmental factors. Thermo-curing with a catalyst can accelerate curing and enhance water resistance. The viscosity of 9300-13500 cP ensures consistent application.

Chemical Properties: Water-borne synthetic resin with self-crosslinking properties. Conforms to AS 2754.2 1991 and EN 204.

Application Temperature Range: Minimum application temperature of 8°C (46.4°F). Ensure ambient and surface temperatures are within the recommended range for optimal bonding. Ideal timber moisture content is 8-12%.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Brushes, rollers, glue baths, clamps, and cleaning cloths.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and properly prepared. Follow specific pressing times for different applications. For enhanced water resistance, use thermo-curing with Catalyst Number 1. Clean tools with water before the adhesive dries.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the bond is weak, ensure proper surface preparation and clamping pressure. For uneven application, use a roller or brush for even coverage.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store indoors under ambient conditions between 10°C and 30°C (50°F and 86°F). Keep containers closed when not in use.
  • Shelf Life Information: 6 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • AS 2754.2 1991: Australian Standard for water-resistant wood adhesives.
  • EN 204: European Standard for water-resistant wood adhesives.

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everbond PVA Xlink 3

Q: How does this adhesive achieve water resistance?

A: Everbond PVA Xlink 3 is formulated with self-crosslinking properties, creating a water-resistant bond as it cures through water dissipation. Thermo-curing with Catalyst Number 1 further enhances this resistance.

Q: What are the benefits of conforming to AS 2754.2 and EN 204?

A: Conforming to these standards ensures the adhesive meets stringent requirements for water resistance and bond strength, providing reliable performance in demanding applications.

Q: How should I clean up excess adhesive?

A: Use water to clean tools and surfaces before the adhesive dries. Dried adhesive must be removed mechanically.

Q: What is the ideal moisture content for timber when using this adhesive?

A: The ideal timber moisture content is 8-12%.

Q: What safety precautions should I take?

A: Refer to the SDS before handling the product. While not classified as hazardous, skin irritation may occur in sensitive individuals. Wear appropriate PPE and ensure adequate ventilation.

Q: What is thermo-curing and how is it done?

A: Thermo-curing involves adding Catalyst Number 1 at a rate of 1% w/w and applying heat. A recommended cycle is 30 seconds at 80°C and 30 seconds at 130°C. This enhances water resistance and speeds up curing.

Use Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive for: Bonding melamine-faced boards and laminates in furniture and cabinet construction, ensuring a clear, strong, and durable bond.

Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive is a premium-grade, clear adhesive designed for professional cabinet and furniture construction. Its PVA/EVA formulation provides excellent adhesion specifically for melamine-faced boards, ensuring a strong and reliable bond. The high solids content contributes to its durability, while the clear drying feature maintains the aesthetic appeal of your finished products. This adhesive is ideal for applications where precision and a clean finish are essential, such as kitchen cabinets and custom furniture. With specific open and clamp times, Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive allows for controlled and effective application, making it a trusted choice for Australian trades.

Key Features of Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive

  • Excellent Adhesion: PVA/EVA formulation ensures a strong bond on melamine-faced boards.
  • Clear Drying: Dries transparent, maintaining the aesthetic quality of finished products.
  • High Solids Content: Provides a durable and robust bond.
  • Controlled Application: Specific open and clamp times for precise and effective bonding.
  • Versatile Use: Ideal for furniture construction and bonding laminates.

Technical Overview

Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive is formulated for optimal performance in bonding melamine-faced boards. Its pH of approximately 4 ensures compatibility with various substrates. The specific open time of around 3 minutes and clamp time of 2-4 hours at 20°C and 65% RH provide a controlled application process. The high solids content ensures a strong and lasting bond, crucial for furniture and cabinet construction.

Chemical Properties: PVA/EVA formulation designed for superior adhesion on melamine-faced boards. Dries clear, maintaining the visual integrity of the bonded materials.

Application Temperature Range: Should not be applied below 10°C (50°F). Ensure ambient and surface temperatures are within the recommended range for optimal bonding. Ideal timber moisture content is 8-10% and relative humidity 60-70%

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Squeeze bottle, brush, clamps, and cleaning cloths.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and fit together precisely. Apply adhesive evenly to one surface. Use sufficient clamping pressure for optimal bond strength. Clean up uncured adhesive with warm, soapy water.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If the bond is weak, ensure surfaces are properly prepared and clamped for the required time. For uneven application, use a brush or roller for even coverage.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry conditions, out of direct sunlight and in a well-ventilated area. Do not store below 5°C or over 40°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months at 25°C when unopened.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

How to apply Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive:

  1. Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from oil, dust, and other foreign materials.
  2. Ensure surfaces fit together exactly to avoid extended drying times and reduced bond strength.
  3. Apply adhesive evenly to one surface using a squeeze bottle or brush.
  4. Join surfaces before the end of the open time (approximately 3 minutes).
  5. Press or clamp surfaces until sufficient initial strength is obtained (2-4 hours at 20°C, 65% RH).
  6. Allow 24-48 hours for full bond strength to develop.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive

Q: How long does it take for the adhesive to fully cure?

A: Full bond strength is achieved in 24-48 hours. Clamp time is typically 2-4 hours at 20°C and 65% RH.

Q: Can this adhesive be used for outdoor applications?

A: No, Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive is designed for interior applications only. It is not suitable for environments with high moisture or direct exposure to weather.

Q: How should I clean up excess adhesive?

A: Use warm soapy water to clean tools and surfaces before the adhesive dries. Dried adhesive must be removed mechanically.

Q: What is the ideal moisture content for timber when using this adhesive?

A: The ideal timber moisture content is 8-10%, with a relative humidity of 60-70%.

Q: What safety precautions should I take?

A: Wear impervious gloves and eye protection. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information. Ensure good industrial hygiene practices.

Q: Can this adhesive be used for structural applications?

A: No, Everbond Melamine PVA Adhesive is a non-structural adhesive. For structural applications, contact Adheseal Adhesives & Coatings.
