column3:
Use Adheseal Multi-Grip for: Strong, instant bonding of timber to studs, installing wall sheeting, and fixing cornices.

Adheseal Multi-Grip is a high-performance, water-based acrylic adhesive specially formulated for Australian construction needs. Its key feature is its very high initial grab, allowing for immediate bonding and reduced need for temporary supports. The adhesive forms a strong yet flexible bond, crucial for sub-floor and wall systems where movement is expected. It adheres to a wide range of materials, including timber, metal, concrete, F.C. sheeting (fibre cement), and plasterboard. Australian builders and carpenters rely on Multi-Grip for its reliability and ease of use in various applications, from fixing timber to studs to installing internal and external mouldings.

Application Temperature Range: Suitable for use between 5°C and 35°C (41°F to 95°F), making it adaptable to most Australian climates year-round. However, ensure surfaces are not saturated with water.

Cure Time: Achieves significant bond strength rapidly due to its high initial grab. Allows for continued construction shortly after application. Refer to flooring manufacturer's instructions for fastener requirements.

Coverage Rate: A 6mm bead will cover approximately 9 linear meters, making it economical for large-scale projects.

Chemical Properties: Water-based acrylic, ensuring easy clean-up with water and lower VOC emissions (47g/L), aligning with environmentally conscious building practices.

Key Features of Adheseal Multi-Grip

  • Very High Initial Grab: Enables immediate bonding, reducing or eliminating the need for temporary supports, saving time on projects. Example: Fixing wall panels vertically without slippage.
  • Flexible and Resilient: Accommodates movement in sub-floor and wall systems, preventing bond failure due to expansion and contraction. Example: Ideal for use on timber flooring where seasonal changes occur.
  • Strong Adhesion to Multiple Surfaces: Bonds effectively to timber, metal, concrete, F.C. sheeting, and plasterboard, reducing the need for multiple adhesives on a job site. Example: Fixing fibre cement sheeting to metal framing.
  • Non-Sag Formula: Prevents dripping when applied overhead, making it cleaner and easier to use for cornice and ceiling applications.
  • Water Clean Up: Simplifies cleaning tools and work areas before the adhesive cures, reducing the need for harsh solvents.
  • Paintable: Allows for seamless integration with painted surfaces once cured.

Why Choose Adheseal Multi-Grip:

  • Increased Efficiency: The high initial grab reduces the time required for bracing and supports, speeding up project completion. Example: Faster installation of wall panels.
  • Durable Construction: Its flexibility ensures long-lasting bonds that can withstand movement. Example: Preventing squeaks in sub-floors as timber dries.
  • Simplified Application: The non-sag formula and water clean-up make it easier and safer to use. Example: Cleaner application when fixing cornices overhead.
  • Versatile Bonding: Reduces the number of products required on site, simplifying inventory management. Example: Use for both framing and sheeting applications.

When to Choose Adheseal Multi-Grip versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Adheseal Multi-Grip over solvent-based adhesives when: You require a more environmentally friendly option with low VOCs and easy water cleanup.
  • Choose Adheseal Multi-Grip over polyurethane adhesives when: high initial grab is essential for quick, support-free bonding, and flexibility is needed for movement in the bonded materials.
  • Consider other options when: Waterproof or submerged conditions are present, or when laying strip flooring/parquetry (as Multi-Grip isn't suitable).

Trade-Specific Applications for Adheseal Multi-Grip:

For Builders and Carpenters:

  • Application: Bonding timber to studs and joists for framing, fixing wall sheeting, and installing cornices and mouldings.
  • Technique: Apply a 6-10mm bead to studs/joists. For butt joints, use two beads 25mm apart.
  • Material Compatibility: Excellent for timber, plasterboard, and FC sheeting.
  • Performance Benefits: High initial grab reduces the need for temporary supports, flexible bond accommodates movement.

For Tilers:

  • Application: Adhering tiles to various substrates.
  • Technique: Apply a bead of adhesive to the substrate.
  • Material Compatibility: Suitable for many tile types and substrates.
  • Performance Benefits: Flexible and shock-resistant for stable installations.

For Joinery & Cabinet Makers:

  • Application: Fixing decorative wood pieces
  • Technique: Apply to the wood to be affixed.
  • Material compatibility notes:
  • Excellent for timber; suitable for bonding decorative elements.
  • Performance benefits: High initial grab holds pieces in place, paintable finish allows seamless integration.

For Sheet Metal Workers:

  • Application: Bonding sheet metal components to other construction materials like timber framing or concrete where high initial grab is beneficial and structural bonding isn't solely reliant on the adhesive.
  • Technique: Ensure metal surface is clean and free of oils. Apply bead and press firmly into place.
  • Material Compatibility: Adheres well to common construction metals.
  • Performance Benefits: High initial grab secures panels quickly, flexible bond accommodates some thermal movement.

For General Construction & Caulking Professionals:

  • Application: General purpose gap filling around frames, panels, and fixtures where a flexible, paintable acrylic sealant/adhesive is suitable. Soundproofing installations by sealing gaps.
  • Technique: Apply appropriate bead size to fill gap, tool off if necessary before skinning occurs.
  • Material Compatibility: Bonds to most common construction substrates.
  • Performance Benefits: Good gap filling capability, paintable, water clean-up, helps reduce sound transmission through gaps.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Standard caulking gun (suitable for 600ml sausages, e.g., Adheseal or other professional brands), utility knife for cutting nozzle, damp cloth or sponge for cleanup.
  • Trade-Specific Tips:
    • Framing/Flooring: Ensure consistent bead size (6-10mm) for optimal contact and performance. Apply double beads at butt joints for maximum adhesion area.
    • Cornice/Mouldings: Apply to the back of the cornice/moulding before pressing firmly into place. The non-sag nature helps prevent slippage.
    • General: Work within the 25-minute skin time, especially in warmer or breezier conditions common in Queensland. Ensure mechanical fasteners are used as per building codes or manufacturer specifications, particularly for structural elements.
  • Common Issues and Solutions (Australian Conditions):
    • Adhesive Skins Too Quickly: Working area might be too hot, humid, or windy. Work in smaller sections. Store adhesive in cooler conditions before use.
    • Poor Adhesion: Surfaces may not be clean or properly prepared. Ensure substrates are free from dust, grease, and loose material. Sanding painted or glossy surfaces can improve grip.
    • Excessive Squeeze-Out: Too much adhesive applied. Use a smaller bead or apply less pressure initially. Clean up immediately with a damp cloth.
    • Bond Failure on Damp Surfaces: While tolerant of damp surfaces, ensure they are not saturated or weeping water, as this will prevent proper curing and bonding.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight. Ideal temperature range is between 5°C and 35°C, typical for many storage areas in Australia but avoid extreme shed heat.
  • Shelf Life Information: 2 years from date of manufacture when stored correctly.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing. If stored in very hot conditions (above 35°C), shelf life may be reduced.

Certifications and Compliance

  • AS 2753: Complies with the Australian Standard for adhesives used for fixing plasterboard wallboards to wood and metal framing, ensuring suitability for standard drywall installations.
  • AS 2329: Complies with the Australian Standard for adhesives used for fixing other types of wallboards (excluding plasterboard, e.g., fibre cement, hardboard) to framing, demonstrating its versatility for various sheeting materials used in Australian construction.

column32: Adheseal Multi-Grip | High Grab Construction Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Adheseal Multi-Grip: High initial grab, water-based adhesive for flooring and construction. Strong, flexible, and easy water clean-up. Buy now.
column52:
How to apply Adheseal Multi-Grip:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure all surfaces are clean, structurally sound, and free from dust, grease, oil, or loose material. Sand any warped timber to ensure flush contact.
  2. Prepare Sausage: Place the 600ml sausage into a suitable caulking gun. Cut the tip of the sausage and fit the nozzle. Cut the nozzle tip to achieve the desired bead size (typically 6-10mm).
  3. Apply Adhesive: Apply a continuous bead of Multi-Grip to one of the surfaces being bonded (e.g., floor joist, wall stud, back of sheet). For wide panels or where panels butt together, apply parallel beads approximately 25mm apart or as recommended by the sheeting manufacturer. For T&G flooring, apply adhesive into the groove.
  4. Position Materials: Bring the components together quickly (within the 25-minute skin time) and position accurately with minimal movement over the wet adhesive. Press firmly to ensure good contact and spread of the adhesive.
  5. Fasten (If Required): Secure the panels or components using appropriate mechanical fasteners (nails, screws) as specified by building codes or the material manufacturer's guidelines. The adhesive complements mechanical fastening.
  6. Clean Up: Immediately remove any excess adhesive squeezed out from the joint using a damp cloth or sponge before it skins over and starts to cure. Clean tools with water.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal Multi-Grip

Q: How quickly does Multi-Grip grab? Do I still need nails or screws?

A: Multi-Grip has very high initial grab, meaning it holds materials in place almost immediately, significantly reducing slippage. However, for structural applications like sub-floors or wall framing, you must still use mechanical fasteners (nails, screws) according to the building code and the flooring/sheeting manufacturer's instructions.

Q: Can I use Adheseal Multi-Grip outdoors?

A: Multi-Grip is suitable for internal and external mouldings. While it's water-based and cleans up with water, the cured adhesive has good resistance. However, it is *not* suitable for permanent water immersion. Ensure the application area is protected from constant saturation.

Q: How long does it take for Multi-Grip to fully cure?

A: Multi-Grip develops a skin in approximately 25 minutes (at 25°C/50% RH). Full cure depends on temperature, humidity, and bead size, but typically achieves significant strength within 24-72 hours. Allow adequate time before subjecting bonds to heavy stress.

Q: Can I paint over Adheseal Multi-Grip?

A: Yes, Adheseal Multi-Grip is paintable once fully cured. Allow sufficient curing time as recommended before painting. Compatibility with all paint types is high, but a small test patch is always a good idea if using specialised coatings.

Q: What's the best way to clean up excess Multi-Grip?

A: Clean up uncured adhesive immediately using a damp cloth or sponge and water. If the adhesive has cured, it will need to be removed mechanically by scraping or sanding, so prompt cleanup is recommended for ease.

Q: Will Multi-Grip bond to damp timber?

A: Yes, Multi-Grip will adhere to damp surfaces, which is useful in typical Australian construction site conditions. However, ensure the surfaces are not saturated or have pooled water, as this will interfere with the bond and curing process.
column54:
Adheseal Multi-Grip limitations:

  • Not Suitable for Water Immersion: Should not be used in applications where the bond line will be permanently submerged or constantly saturated with water.
  • Not for Laying Strip Flooring/Parquetry: Specifically stated as not suitable for the installation (direct bonding) of strip timber flooring or parquetry floors. Use dedicated flooring adhesives for these applications.
  • Requires Mechanical Fasteners for Structural Loads: While providing strong adhesion, it should be used in conjunction with appropriate mechanical fasteners as per Australian building standards for structural elements.
  • Surface Condition Dependent: Performance relies on clean, sound substrates. Will not bond well to greasy, dusty, or unsound surfaces.

Safety precautions when using Adheseal Multi-Grip:

  • Classification: Not classified as hazardous according to Work Safe Australia criteria.
  • Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): While not classified hazardous, wearing gloves is recommended to avoid skin contact, especially for individuals with sensitive skin as irritation or sensitisation may occur. Safety glasses are good practice during construction activities.
  • Ventilation: Use in areas with adequate ventilation, although VOC content is relatively low (47g/L).
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact. Wash hands after use. Keep out of reach of children.
  • First Aid: If skin irritation occurs, wash affected area with soap and water. If symptoms persist, seek medical advice. Consult the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for detailed first aid information.
column55: Adheseal Multi-Grip Water Based Flooring & Construction Adhesive provides a strong, instant bond for various construction materials, offering high initial grab and flexibility.
column56:
Adheseal Multi-Grip can be used on the following substrates:

  • Timber: Softwoods and hardwoods commonly used in Australian framing and flooring (Pine, Meranti, various Australian hardwoods). Ensure timber is clean.
  • Plasterboard: Standard gypsum plasterboard wall and ceiling linings. Adheres strongly as per AS 2753.
  • Metal: Common construction metals like steel framing components or aluminium trims. Ensure surfaces are clean and free from oil or grease.
  • Concrete: Cured concrete floors and walls. Ensure concrete is clean, dust-free, and sound.
  • F.C. Sheeting (Fibre Cement): Common brands used for external cladding, internal linings, and wet area sheeting in Australia. Follow sheeting manufacturer's fixing guidelines.
  • Polystyrene Foam: Can be used to bond polystyrene foam components, useful in insulation or decorative applications.
  • Mouldings: Timber, MDF, or polymer-based mouldings and cornices used internally and externally.
column57:
Use Adheseal Multi-Grip for:

  • Sub-Floor Construction: Bonding timber flooring panels to joists, helping prevent squeaks and movement. Complements mechanical fixing as per Australian standards.
  • Wall Sheeting Installation: Fixing plasterboard, fibre cement (FC) sheeting, or other wallboards to timber or metal studs. Adheres to AS 2753 & AS 2329.
  • Cornice and Moulding Fixing: Installing internal and external cornices and decorative mouldings with high initial grab and non-sag properties.
  • General Construction Bonding: Adhering timber, metal, concrete components where a strong initial hold and flexible bond are needed.
  • Polystyrene Foam Bonding: Attaching foam insulation panels or decorative elements.
  • Gap Filling: Filling gaps in construction where a paintable, flexible acrylic filler is suitable.

Why Use Adheseal Multi-Grip for:

  • Speed and Efficiency: High initial grab allows faster assembly and reduces the need for extensive temporary bracing on Australian building sites.
  • Reliability and Compliance: Meets relevant Australian Standards (AS 2753/2329), providing confidence for builders and certifiers.
  • Reduced Call-Backs: Flexible bond helps prevent floor squeaks and accommodates minor movement, leading to more durable construction.
  • Ease of Use: Simple application with a caulking gun, non-sag formula, and easy water clean-up saves time and effort.
  • Versatility: One product suitable for multiple common construction bonding tasks, simplifying material needs on site.

column3:
Use Parquetry PS1300 for: Parquetry flooring, laminated parquetry, strip flooring, and wood block installations.

Parquetry PS1300 is a premium, single-component, moisture-curing Hybrid PU adhesive specifically formulated for parquetry and strip flooring applications. Its low VOC emissions make it an environmentally friendly choice, suitable for Greenstar rated projects. This adhesive provides exceptional adhesion to various substrates, including wood, concrete, stone, and glass, without the need for priming. It is ideal for laying parquetry, laminated parquetry, wood blocks, and exotic wood species, ensuring a strong and durable bond.

Key Features of Parquetry PS1300

  • Hybrid PU Technology: Provides a strong, flexible bond with low VOC emissions.
  • Moisture Curing: Simplifies application and ensures a reliable cure.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds to various substrates, including wood, concrete, and stone.
  • Low VOC Emissions: Suitable for environmentally sensitive projects.
  • Versatile Application: Ideal for parquetry, strip flooring, and wood block installations.
  • Long Working Time: 60 minutes open time for ease of application.

Technical Overview

Parquetry PS1300 is designed for high-performance wood flooring installations. Its Hybrid PU formulation ensures a strong, flexible bond, while its moisture-curing system simplifies application. Proper substrate preparation is crucial for optimal performance.

Chemical Properties: Hybrid MS Polymer, moisture-curing system. Provides excellent adhesion and low VOC emissions.

Application Temperature: +10°C to +25°C (50°F to 77°F). Ensure substrate humidity is ≤ 3% and parquetry humidity is between 7-11%. Cure rate is 3.5mm per 24 hours at 23°C (73.4°F) and 50% relative humidity.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Notched trowel or spatula, hammer, xylene or toluene for cleaning.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use Primer VBS on slab-on-ground applications to prevent moisture issues. Ensure substrates are level and clean. Allow proper drying time for screeds. Leave a 10-20mm gap along walls for flooring movement.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Inadequate substrate preparation can lead to poor adhesion. Ensure humidity levels are within specifications. Clean tools with xylene or toluene before curing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between +5°C and +25°C (41°F and 77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.
column7: adhesive, concrete, container, flooring-i, Green Star Compliant, high strength, hybrid ms polymer, internal, low voc, masonry, one part, primerless, solvent free, wood
column32: Parquetry PS1300 Hybrid PU Adhesive for Wood Flooring | Adheseal
column33: Parquetry PS1300: Hybrid PU adhesive for parquetry and strip flooring. Low VOC, moisture curing, and strong adhesion to various substrates.
column52:
How to apply Parquetry PS1300:

  1. Substrate Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and level. Apply Primer VBS on slab-on-ground.
  2. Application: Cut the sachet corner and spread adhesive with a notched trowel.
  3. Laying Flooring: Lay wood flooring into the wet adhesive film.
  4. Hammering: Hammer the timber after laying for proper transfer.
  5. Gaps: Leave a 10-20mm gap along walls for movement.
  6. Drying: Allow 48 hours before sanding.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Parquetry PS1300

Q: What is the recommended primer for slab-on-ground applications?

A: Primer VBS is strongly recommended to eliminate the risk of rising damp and ensure proper adhesion.

Q: What is the required substrate humidity level?

A: The substrate humidity level must be ≤ 3%, and ≤ 0.5% for anhydrite screeds.

Q: How long should I wait before sanding the flooring?

A: Allow at least 48 hours for the adhesive to dry before sanding.

Q: What is the open time for Parquetry PS1300?

A: The average open time is 60 minutes, providing ample working time for flooring installation.

Q: Can Parquetry PS1300 be used with exotic wood species?

A: Yes, it is suitable for use with exotic species like teak and bamboo, as well as with cork underlayment.
column54:
Parquetry PS1300 limitations:

  • Do not apply at temperatures below +10°C or when relative humidity exceeds 65%.
  • Substrate humidity must not exceed 3%.
  • Parquetry flooring humidity should be between 7-11%.

Safety precautions when using Parquetry PS1300:

  • Cleaning: Clean tools with xylene or toluene before curing.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Skin Contact: Skin irritation and sensitization may occur in sensitive individuals.
  • MSDS: Consult the Material Safety Data Sheet for further information.
column55: Parquetry PS1300 is a high-performance, single-component, moisture-curing Hybrid PU adhesive designed for parquetry and strip flooring. It features very low VOC emissions and excellent adhesion to wood, concrete, and stone.
column56:
Parquetry PS1300 can be used on the following substrates:

  • Wood
  • Concrete
  • Stone
  • Glass
column57:
Use Parquetry PS1300 for:

  • Parquetry flooring installations.
  • Laminated parquetry flooring.
  • Paving wood blocks.
  • Resin impregnated parquetry flooring.
  • Standing timber and varnished parquetry flooring.
  • Plywood and strip flooring installations.
  • Exotic wood species (teak, bamboo) with cork underlayment.

Why Use Parquetry PS1300:

  • Provides a strong and durable bond for wood flooring.
  • Low VOC emissions, suitable for Greenstar projects.
  • Excellent adhesion to various substrates without priming.
  • Easy application with a 60-minute open time.
  • Suitable for a wide range of parquetry and strip flooring types.

column2: AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound
column3:
Use AllFlex 101 for: Glazing, bedding timber joinery, sealing windows, doors, precast panels, and general interior/exterior sealing.

AllFlex 101 is a high-performance, clear hybrid acrylic sealant designed for Australian construction professionals. Its exceptional weather resistance and elasticity make it suitable for a wide range of applications, including glazing, bedding timber joinery, and sealing various substrates. This sealant offers superior adhesion without the need for priming, is paintable, and maintains flexibility in diverse climates. With its non-staining, non-toxic, and low VOC formulation, AllFlex 101 provides a reliable and environmentally friendly solution for both interior and exterior projects.

Key Features of AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound

  • Exceptional Weather Resistance: Maintains elasticity and adhesion in diverse weather conditions, ensuring long-lasting performance.
  • Superior Adhesion (No Priming): Bonds strongly to most building materials without the need for priming, saving time and effort.
  • High Elasticity (Low Modulus): Accommodates joint movement up to ±50%, preventing cracks and leaks in dynamic structures.
  • Paintable: Allows for seamless integration with surrounding finishes, providing a neat and professional appearance.
  • Clear Finish: Dries clear, making it ideal for applications where aesthetics are important.
  • Mould Resistant: Helps prevent mould growth in high-moisture areas.

Technical Overview

AllFlex 101 is a hybrid acrylic sealant that cures through water evaporation, forming a highly elastic and durable seal. Its low modulus and high elongation capabilities make it suitable for applications subject to significant movement. This sealant is designed for ease of use, with excellent slump resistance and water cleanup.

Chemical Properties: Hybrid acrylic formulation. This sealant is non-toxic, non-hazardous, and free from isocyanates, providing a safe and environmentally friendly solution.

Application Temperature Range: -18°C to +60°C (0°F to 140°F). Apply between 5°C and 40°C for optimal results. Protect sealant from water until cured.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, and xylene for cleanup.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use the two-wipe process for impervious substrates and mask joint edges for a neater finish. Apply sealant at a 45° angle, ensuring it's pushed firmly into place.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For adhesion issues on suspect surfaces, conduct adhesion testing. For extended curing times in non-porous channels, ensure adequate ventilation.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 24 months in the original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • ASTM C-732 (UV Accelerated Weathering)
  • VOC Compliance: Californian South Coast Air Quality Management Rule 1168 (32 g/L)

column32: AllFlex 101 Sealant | Clear Hybrid Acrylic, Weather Resistant | Adheseal
column33: AllFlex 101: Clear, elastic hybrid acrylic sealant for diverse applications. Weather-resistant, paintable, and excellent adhesion without priming.
column52:
How to apply AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound:

  1. Prepare Surfaces: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Cut Nozzle: Cut the cartridge tip and nozzle at a 45-degree angle.
  3. Apply Sealant: Apply AllFlex 101 evenly into the joint, ensuring good contact with the substrate.
  4. Tool Sealant: Smooth the sealant with a moistened spatula before it skins over.
  5. Clean Up: Remove excess sealant with xylene while wet; cured sealant can be mechanically removed.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound

Q: Can AllFlex 101 be used in wet areas?

A: AllFlex 101 is not suitable for permanent water immersion, such as fish tanks or swimming pools. However, it is suitable for areas exposed to intermittent moisture, provided it is protected from water until fully cured.

Q: Does AllFlex 101 require priming?

A: Generally, no. AllFlex 101 offers superior adhesion to most substrates without priming. However, for optimal adhesion on suspect surfaces or high-stress applications, priming may be considered.

Q: How long does AllFlex 101 take to cure?

A: AllFlex 101 has a skin time of approximately 10 minutes and cures at a rate of 2mm per day from exposed surfaces. Full cure can take 4-6 days, depending on bead size, atmospheric conditions, and substrate porosity.

Q: Can AllFlex 101 be painted?

A: Yes, AllFlex 101 is paintable, allowing for seamless integration with surrounding finishes. Ensure the sealant is fully cured before painting.

Q: What are the limitations of using AllFlex 101?

A: AllFlex 101 is not suitable for permanent water immersion, high abrasion areas, structural glazing, or all stone types. Always perform compatibility tests and follow application guidelines.
column54:
AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound limitations:

  • Not for permanent water immersion: Avoid applications where the sealant will be continuously submerged.
  • Not for high abrasion areas: Do not use in areas with heavy foot traffic.
  • Not for structural glazing:
  • Do not use in totally confined spaces: Requires atmospheric humidity to cure.
  • Not for adhering mirrors: Use High Power 609 (test first).
  • Not for composite panels: Use Hi Flex Construction (test first).
  • Not for all stone types: Perform stain testing before use; S100 is recommended for marble and granite.
  • Do not use with lead or copper

Safety precautions when using AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhalation of vapors.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
column55: AllFlex 101 is a versatile, clear hybrid acrylic joint sealant offering exceptional weather resistance and elasticity. Ideal for glazing, bedding, and sealing various interior and exterior substrates.
column56:
AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound can be used on the following substrates:

  • Masonry and Cement Sheet: Provides a durable and flexible seal.
  • Glass: Ideal for glazing and sealing glass panels.
  • Brick: Suitable for sealing joints and cracks in brickwork.
  • Metal (except Lead & Copper): Bonds effectively to various metals, including aluminium and powder-coated surfaces.
  • Timber: Excellent for bedding and sealing timber joinery.
  • Plastics, Acrylic & Polycarbonate: Offers strong adhesion to a range of plastics.
  • Stone: Suitable for some stone types; perform adhesion testing first.
  • Painted Surfaces: Paintable for seamless integration.
  • Rubber: Provides a flexible seal for rubber components.
  • Fibreglass: Bonds effectively to fibreglass surfaces.
  • Porcelain: Suitable for sealing joints in porcelain fixtures.
  • Waterproof Membranes: Ensures a reliable seal on various membranes.
column57:
Use AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound for:

  • Glazing timber joinery: Providing a flexible and durable seal for glass in timber frames.
  • Sealing windows and doors: Preventing drafts and water ingress.
  • Precast panels and tilt-up construction: Sealing joints between concrete panels.
  • Roofing, especially polycarbonate: Ensuring a weather-resistant seal for roofing materials.
  • Sealing weatherboard panels: Preventing moisture penetration in timber cladding.
  • Sealing gaps and cracks: Filling gaps in various building materials.
  • Display signs: Providing a clear and durable seal for signage.

Why Use AllFlex 101 High Performance Joint Sealant & Bedding Compound:

  • Excellent weathering ability: Maintains performance in diverse climates.
  • Superior adhesion: Bonds strongly to most substrates without priming.
  • High elasticity: Accommodates joint movement up to ±50%.
  • Paintable: Allows for seamless integration with surrounding finishes.
  • Clear finish: Dries clear, making it ideal for visible applications.
  • Low VOC: Contributes to healthier indoor environments and meets environmental standards.
  • Mould resistant: Helps prevent mould growth in high-moisture areas.

column2: Everflex JS - Acrylic Tilt Panel Joint Sealant
column3:
Use Everflex JS for: Sealing joints in windows, doors, precast panels, and various construction materials, offering excellent weather resistance and flexibility.

Everflex JS is a premium hybrid acrylic joint sealant engineered for superior performance in diverse environments. Its low modulus and high elasticity accommodate significant joint movement, preventing cracks and ensuring long-lasting seals. With exceptional adhesion to most building materials, including timber, metal, and plastics, Everflex JS eliminates the need for priming in many applications. Its non-sagging formula and smooth tooling properties make it easy to achieve a professional finish.

Key Features of Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer

  • Excellent weathering ability, ensuring long-term durability.
  • Superior adhesion to a wide range of substrates without the need for priming.
  • High elasticity (low modulus) accommodates significant joint movement.
  • Paintable, allowing for seamless integration with surrounding surfaces.
  • Non-toxic and low VOC, contributing to a healthier environment.
  • Excellent slump resistance, maintaining a smooth finish on vertical surfaces.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Hybrid Acrylic
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 32°C (41°F to 89.6°F)
  • Service Temperature: -18°C to 80°C (-0.4°F to 176°F)
  • Movement Capability: ±50%
  • VOC Content: 32 g/L
  • Elongation: 1000%

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, backer rod or bond breaker tape.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure joints are clean and dry before application. Use a backer rod or bond breaker tape to control joint depth and prevent three-sided adhesion. Tool the sealant immediately after application for a smooth finish.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Prevent washouts by avoiding application during rain or within 90 minutes of expected rainfall. Ensure backer rod is dry to avoid gassing.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store between 5°C and 32°C (41°F and 89.6°F) in unopened containers.
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Meets Spec. TT-S-00230C, Class A and ASTM Spec. 834.
  • Conforms to Californian South Coast Air Quality Management Rule 1168.
column7: Foam,Marine Sealants,acrylic,aluminium,anodised aluminium,block work,brick,caulking-i,ceramics,concrete-s,construction,durable,epoxy-s,expansion joints,external,fibre cement sheet,fibreglass,flexible,glass,glazed surfaces,internal,laminates,large format tiles,long work time,low modulus,marine plywood,masonry,mdf,metal,non sag,non toxic,non-porous,pail,paintable,painted surfaces,particle board,plasterboard,porcelain,porous,precast panels,primerless,render,sealant,sheet metal-i,solvent free,stainless steel-s,steel,stone,structural plywood,tile-s,tilt panels,timber sheeting-s,uv stable,water cleanup,weatherseal,wood-i
column32: Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer for Interior & Exterior | Adheseal
column33: Flexible, paintable joint sealant for interior/exterior use with excellent weather resistance and adhesion. Ideal for builders and trades.
column52:
How to apply Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer:

  1. Prepare the joint: Clean surfaces and insert a backer rod or bond breaker tape.
  2. Apply the sealant: Cut the nozzle to the desired bead size and apply a continuous bead.
  3. Tool the sealant: Smooth the sealant with a spatula immediately after application.
  4. Clean up: Remove uncured sealant with water.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer

Q: Can Everflex JS be used in wet conditions?

A: Everflex JS should not be used when rain is evident within 90 minutes of application. Rain may cause washouts if the sealant hasn't formed a skin. Ensure the joint is capped to prevent water soaking into the backing rod.

Q: Do I need to prime surfaces before applying Everflex JS?

A: Priming is generally not required for most substrates. However, for suspect surfaces, adhesion testing is recommended to ensure optimal bonding.

Q: What is the recommended joint design for Everflex JS?

A: Good building practice allows for ±25% movement, though Everflex JS can handle ±50%. The minimum sealant depth is 6mm, and the maximum is 10mm, regardless of joint width. Maintain a 2:1 depth-to-width ratio.

Q: How do I prevent three-sided adhesion with Everflex JS?

A: Use a backer rod or bond breaker tape to control joint depth and prevent the sealant from adhering to the back of the joint, allowing for proper movement.

Q: Is Everflex JS paintable?

A: Yes, Everflex JS is paintable, allowing for seamless integration with the surrounding surfaces and finishes.

Q: What is the shelf life of Everflex JS?

A: Everflex JS has a minimum shelf life of 12 months when stored between 5°C and 32°C (41°F and 89.6°F) in unopened containers.

Q: What are the cleanup instructions for Everflex JS?

A: Uncured sealant can be removed with water. Cured sealant will need to be removed by mechanical means.
column54:
Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer limitations:

  • Should not be applied when rain is expected within 90 minutes.
  • Not recommended for continuous underwater applications.
  • Requires a dry backer rod to prevent gassing.
  • Not suitable for joints consistently exposed to high mechanical stress without testing.

Safety precautions when using Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use.
  • First Aid: For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water. If ingested, seek medical advice.
column55: Everflex JS is a high-performance, low modulus, elastomeric joint sealant designed for both exterior and interior applications. This hybrid acrylic sealant offers exceptional weathering resistance, superior adhesion to various substrates, and excellent flexibility. It's paintable, non-toxic, and low VOC, making it an ideal choice for a wide range of construction projects.

Why Use Everflex JS High Performance Joint Sealer:

column33: Everflex 250JS is a specially formulated acrylic sealant designed for movement joints, providing excellent weather resistance and flexibility. column52:

  1. Fill joints to the required depth with Adherod backer rod or bond breaker tape before applying the sealant.

column2: Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant
column3:
Use Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant for: Sealing gaps around cables, pipes, conduits, and ducts to maintain fire integrity and reduce sound transmission.

Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant is a single-component, waterborne acrylic co-polymer sealant designed specifically for Australian construction conditions. Engineered for both fire resistance and soundproofing, Fire-fill is ideal for sealing penetrations around cables, conduits, metal pipes, and ducts in walls, floors, and ceilings. With intumescent properties, excellent flexibility, and easy tooling, it provides a smooth, paintable finish. Fire-fill is suitable for interior and exterior applications, offering up to 4 hours of fire resistance depending on joint configuration. Its low odour, non-toxic formula ensures safe use in sensitive environments.

Key Features of Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant

  • Up to 4 hours fire resistance for joints up to 50mm wide
  • Acoustic-rated for noise reduction in compliant systems
  • Flexible joint movement capability of ±25%
  • Non-toxic, low odour, and asbestos-free for safe handling
  • No mixing required, water clean-up, and easy application
  • Adheres to damp surfaces without primer

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Acrylic Urethane Paste with Intumescent Expansion
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Service Temperature: -20°C to +90°C (-4°F to 194°F)
  • Elongation at Break: 290% to 340%
  • Shore A Hardness: 30 ± 5
  • VOC Content: 31 g/L (Low VOC per Californian Rule 1168)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, Adhefoam backer rod, bond breaker tape, tooling spatula
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply to clean or slightly damp surfaces, tool to a smooth finish before skin formation, avoid rain exposure for 24 hours
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For shrinkage, ensure groove is completely filled; avoid applying to wet or ponded areas

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry conditions between 5°C and 32°C
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in unopened packaging
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from freezing and excessive heat

Certifications

  • AS 1530 Pt 4 2014 Sections 2, 4, 10 Compliant
  • BS476 Part 20:1987 Fire Resistance Certified
  • Greenstar Rated per Californian Air Quality Rule 1168

column32: Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated Sealant for Joints and Gaps | Adheseal
column33: Everflex Fire-fill is a fire-rated, flexible joint sealant with acoustic properties for Australian trades. Easy to apply and clean.
column52:
How to apply Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant:

  1. Prepare surfaces by cleaning off dirt, grease, and dust. Slightly damp surfaces are acceptable.
  2. Insert Adhefoam backer rod or apply bond breaker tape to control sealant depth.
  3. Apply Fire-fill evenly using a caulking gun. Fill the joint completely to avoid shrinkage gaps.
  4. Tool the sealant to a smooth finish before skin formation (within 15 minutes).
  5. Allow to cure. Avoid water exposure for 24 hours post-application.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant

Q: How should Fire-fill be applied to wall penetrations?

A: Ensure the joint is clean and insert Adhefoam backer rod or bond breaker tape. Apply Fire-fill using a caulking gun, then tool the surface for a smooth finish.

Q: How long does Fire-fill maintain its fire resistance?

A: When correctly applied, Fire-fill offers up to 4 hours of fire resistance in 170mm+ panels depending on joint configuration and depth.

Q: Is Fire-fill compatible with painted surfaces?

A: Yes, once cured, Fire-fill can be painted over for a seamless finish. Ensure paint compatibility by testing a small area first.

Q: What if the sealant shrinks after application?

A: Some shrinkage may occur; ensure the groove is fully filled to avoid gaps. Reapply if needed after initial curing.

Q: Is Fire-fill safe to use indoors without ventilation?

A: Yes, Fire-fill is low odour, non-toxic, and asbestos-free, making it safe for indoor use. However, ensure adequate airflow during application.
column54:
Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant limitations:

  • Do not apply when rain is expected within 24 hours
  • Not suitable for constantly wet or ponded areas
  • Do not use on surfaces that are fully wet or submerged
  • Joint movement should not exceed ±25% to maintain integrity

Safety precautions when using Everflex Fire-fill Fire Rated & Acoustic Joint Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection during use
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas, especially in enclosed spaces
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact; wash with water if contact occurs
  • Dispose of waste sealant in accordance with local regulations

column3:
Use Dowsil™ 888 Silicone Joint Sealant for: Sealing concrete pavement joints, accommodating movement and resisting weather, UV, and fuel exposure.

Dowsil™ 888 Silicone Joint Sealant is a high-performance, one-part silicone sealant designed for concrete pavement joints. Its low-modulus formulation allows for significant movement, accommodating 100% extension and 50% compression. This cold-applied sealant offers excellent weather and UV resistance, as well as short-term fuel resistance, making it ideal for various pavement applications. It provides unprimed adhesion to clean, dry Portland cement concrete, simplifying installation and ensuring durable, long-lasting seals.

Key Features of Dowsil™ 888 Silicone Joint Sealant

  • High movement capability: 100% extension and 50% compression
  • Weather and UV resistant
  • Fuel resistant (short-term exposure)
  • Low modulus for flexibility
  • One-part, cold-applied, ready-to-use
  • Unprimed adhesion to Portland cement concrete
  • Wide application temperature range (-20 to 120°F)

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: One-part, non-sag silicone
  • Application Temperature Range: -20°F to 120°F (-29°C to 49°C)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, air-powered pump (for bulk applications), joint saw, backer rod installation tools
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure joints are clean, dry, and free of frost before application. Use the correct backer rod size to prevent three-sided adhesion. Recess the sealant to the proper depth for optimal performance and to allow for future grinding.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper joint design to accommodate movement. Avoid application during inclement weather or on wet surfaces.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in original, unopened containers below 32°C (90°F)
  • Shelf Life Information: Refer to product packaging for “Use By” date
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing at high temperatures

Certifications

  • ASTM D 5893 Type NS
  • FAA P-605
  • Meets SS-S-200E (section 4.4.12) Flame Test Requirements
  • EN 14187-5 Hydrolysis Test

Use Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant for: Sealing bathrooms, kitchens, splashbacks, and tile joints to prevent mould and ensure flexible, waterproof seals.

Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant is a high-performance, one-part neutral cure silicone designed for use in wet and tiled areas. Engineered to resist mould and mildew, it provides long-lasting, flexible seals in bathrooms, kitchens, and cool rooms. With excellent adhesion to ceramics, glass, and powder-coated metals, it’s ideal for professional trades requiring reliable sealing in moist environments. The non-slump, thixotropic formula ensures easy application and professional finishes, even on vertical joints. Suitable for Australian conditions, this mid-modulus sealant is the go-to choice for trade professionals.

Key Features of Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant

  • Contains fungicide to inhibit mould and mildew growth
  • Neutral cure for low odour and safer indoor use
  • Excellent adhesion to powder-coated metals and ceramics
  • Non-slump formula ensures clean, even application on vertical joints
  • Suitable for use in cool rooms and wet areas

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Neutral cure silicone, mid modulus
  • Application Temperature Range: -10°C to 40°C (14°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -50°C to 150°C (-58°F to 302°F)
  • Skin Time: 8–10 minutes
  • Movement Capability: ±25%

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge gun, tooling spatula, clean cloth, IPA or Z Bond® R-40 cleaner
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use closed cell polyethylene backing rod for joint control and avoid three-sided adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid use on incompatible surfaces (e.g., plasticised sealants, bitumen) to prevent cure issues or discolouration

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Cool, dry place below 25°C (77°F)
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid prolonged storage at high temperatures

Certifications

  • NZFSA C82 – Suitable for food processing environments
  • Complies with ASTM C920 for dynamic movement capability

column32: Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Bostik 6S is a versatile, neutral-cure silicone sealant ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, and wet areas. It's mould-resistant, easy to apply, and available in various colours.
column52:
How to apply Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant:

  1. Ensure all surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust, oil, and grease.
  2. Use a backing rod to control joint depth and avoid three-sided adhesion.
  3. Cut the cartridge tip and nozzle to suit the joint size, then load into a caulking gun.
  4. Apply sealant evenly into the joint, ensuring full contact with the substrate.
  5. Tool off before skin forms (within 8–10 minutes) for a smooth, neat finish.
  6. Allow at least 7 days for full cure before exposing to water or cleaning agents.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant

Q: How do I apply Bostik 6S for a clean, professional finish?

A: Ensure the surface is clean and dry. Use a cartridge gun to apply the sealant, and tool off the joint before skin forms. For best results, use a backing rod and avoid three-sided adhesion.

Q: How long does Bostik 6S take to cure completely?

A: Bostik 6S skins over in 8–10 minutes and cures to a depth of 7mm within 7 days. Full cure depends on temperature and humidity levels in the application environment.

Q: Is Bostik 6S compatible with natural stone surfaces?

A: Bostik 6S is not recommended for granite, marble, or porous stone. For these materials, use Bostik 5CLM to avoid potential staining or adhesion issues.
column54:
Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for aquariums or underwater applications such as swimming pools.
  • Do not use for structural glazing or mirror adhesion.
  • Unsuitable for natural stone without prior stain testing.
  • Cannot be painted over – use colour-matched sealant for aesthetic needs.
  • Not for horizontal walkways or heavy foot traffic areas.

Safety precautions when using Bostik 6S Sanitary & Tile Silicone Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection during application.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation in confined spaces during curing stage.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact; wash thoroughly after use.
  • Do not ingest; seek medical attention if swallowed or if irritation persists after exposure.

column3:
Use Hypersil 912 for: Sealing damp areas, wet areas like showers and kitchens, and applications requiring mould resistance.

Hypersil 912 is a premium, neutral cure sanitary grade silicone sealant that delivers exceptional performance in damp and steamy environments. Its 100% silicone formulation ensures a tough, flexible, and waterproof seal, while its mould and mildew resistance makes it ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, and other wet areas. With ±25% flexibility and excellent adhesion to a variety of substrates, Hypersil 912 provides a long-lasting and reliable seal.

Key Features of Hypersil 912

  • Mould and Mildew Resistance: Inhibits fungal growth, maintaining a clean and hygienic seal in humid environments, such as shower recesses and around sinks.
  • High Flexibility (±25%): Accommodates joint movement, preventing cracks and leaks in dynamic structures, like around bathtubs and splashbacks.
  • Neutral Cure: Suitable for use on a wide range of materials, including metals, without causing corrosion, ideal for stainless steel and aluminium.
  • Excellent Chemical Resistance: Withstands exposure to cleaning agents and chemicals, ensuring long-term durability in kitchens and laundries.
  • Easy Application and Tooling: Provides a smooth, professional finish with minimal effort, suitable for both DIY and professional applications.

Technical Overview

Hypersil 912 is formulated for superior performance in sanitary applications. Its neutral cure mechanism ensures compatibility with various substrates, while its 100% silicone composition provides excellent elasticity and durability. The sealant forms a robust, waterproof seal that resists mould and mildew, ensuring long-term hygiene and performance.

Chemical Properties: 100% Silicone, neutral cure, mould and mildew resistant.

Application Temperature Range: -42°C to +170°C (-43.6°F to 338°F), allowing for use in a wide range of environmental conditions.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, mineral turpentine for cleaning.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use an open-cell polyethylene backing rod to control joint depth. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Tool the sealant immediately after application for a smooth finish.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper ventilation during application due to MEKO emissions. Avoid using on incompatible materials like polycarbonate or bitumen. Clean excess sealant with mineral turpentine before it cures.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place below 28°C (82.4°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months minimum from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product quality.

Certifications

  • Complies with 5-Green Star rating: VOCs less than 50 grams/litre, meeting environmental standards.

column32: Hypersil 912 Sanitary Silicone Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Hypersil 912: 100% silicone, neutral cure, mould-resistant sealant. Flexible (±25%), durable, and easy to apply. Ideal for wet areas and kitchens.
column52:
How to apply Hypersil 912:

  1. Prepare the Surface: Clean and dry all surfaces, removing any contaminants.
  2. Cut the Nozzle: Cut the nozzle to the desired bead size at a 45-degree angle.
  3. Apply the Sealant: Apply a continuous bead into the joint, ensuring both sides are wetted.
  4. Tool the Sealant: Smooth the sealant immediately after application with a spatula.
  5. Clean Up: Remove excess sealant with mineral turpentine before it cures.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Hypersil 912

Q: How do I prepare surfaces for Hypersil 912 application?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust, oil, old sealant, or any other contamination. Clean glass and metal with methylated spirits. Use a clean, dry cloth to remove any solvent residue.

Q: Can Hypersil 912 be used in areas with constant water exposure?

A: Hypersil 912 is designed for wet areas but is not suitable for joints subjected to permanent water immersion, such as aquariums or swimming pools.

Q: What materials does Hypersil 912 adhere to?

A: It provides excellent adhesion to glass, aluminium, steel, concrete, porcelain, grout, and most common building materials. Test surface area for compatibility before application.

Q: What are the safety precautions when using Hypersil 912?

A: Hypersil 912 emits Methyl Ethyl Ketoxime (MEKO) during curing. Use in well-ventilated areas, wear protective clothing, gloves, and eye protection. Rinse eyes immediately with water if contact occurs, and wash skin with hand cleaner and soap.

Q: How long does Hypersil 912 take to cure?

A: Hypersil 912 has a skin time of 8-10 minutes at 20°C and 50% relative humidity. It takes 5-7 days to cure 10mm deep at 25°C. Cure times can vary depending on environmental conditions.
column54:
Hypersil 912 limitations:

  • Structural Glazing: Not suitable for structural glazing applications.
  • Permanent Water Immersion: Not recommended for continuous submersion, such as in aquariums.
  • Certain Materials: Not compatible with polycarbonate plastic sheeting, bitumen, or certain rubber products.
  • Trafficable Areas: Do not use in areas subject to heavy traffic.

Safety precautions when using Hypersil 912:

  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas due to MEKO emissions during curing.
  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Skin and Eye Contact: Avoid contact; rinse eyes with water and wash skin with soap if contact occurs.
  • Handling: Keep out of reach of children and read the MSDS before use.

Use Pasco Hypersil 911 for: General glazing, weatherproofing, and durable sealing solutions across various substrates.

Pasco Hypersil 911 is a premium neutral cure silicone sealant designed for Australian trade professionals. Its 100% silicone formulation ensures a tough, flexible, and waterproof seal, making it ideal for a wide range of applications. This sealant offers exceptional adhesion to various surfaces, including glass, aluminium, and concrete, and boasts excellent weathering and UV resistance for long-term durability. With low VOC content (31 g/L), it's a responsible choice for both indoor and outdoor projects.

Key Features of Pasco Hypersil 911 100% Neutral Cure Silicone Sealant

  • Neutral Cure: Suitable for sensitive metals and substrates, preventing corrosion and ensuring compatibility. For example, it can be used on powder-coated aluminium without causing damage.
  • High Flexibility (±25%): Accommodates joint movement due to thermal expansion and contraction, preventing cracks and leaks. Ideal for curtain wall and construction joint applications.
  • Excellent Weathering and UV Stability: Resists degradation from sunlight, rain, and temperature extremes, ensuring long-lasting performance in Australian climates. Suitable for external cladding applications.
  • Superior Adhesion: Bonds strongly to a wide range of materials, including glass, metals, and masonry. Ensures a durable and reliable seal in diverse applications.
  • Low VOC (31 g/L): Contributes to healthier indoor environments and meets stringent environmental regulations.

Technical Overview

Pasco Hypersil 911 is formulated for ease of application and long-term performance. Its neutral cure mechanism ensures compatibility with various substrates, while its high flexibility and weather resistance make it suitable for demanding applications. This sealant is designed to provide a reliable and durable seal, minimizing the need for frequent maintenance.

Chemical Properties: 100% Silicone, Neutral Cure. This formulation provides excellent resistance to weathering, UV radiation, and temperature extremes, making it suitable for both interior and exterior applications.

Application Temperature Range: Typically applied between 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F). Ensure surfaces are dry and clean before application. Optimal application within this range ensures proper curing and adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, putty knife, mineral turpentine, clean cloths, and backing rod.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper joint design with backing rod to control sealant depth. Clean surfaces thoroughly with methylated spirits for optimal adhesion. Tool the sealant immediately after application for a smooth finish.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For uneven beads, ensure the nozzle is cut at a 45-degree angle. For adhesion issues, thoroughly clean surfaces and test compatibility on a small area first.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place below 28°C (82.4°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in direct sunlight or extreme temperatures to prevent premature curing or degradation.

Certifications

  • ASTM D2240 (Hardness)

Frequently Asked Questions About Pasco Hypersil 911

Q: What is the best way to prepare surfaces before applying Pasco Hypersil 911?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust, oil, and old sealant. For glass and metal, clean with methylated spirits and wipe dry. Proper preparation is crucial for optimal adhesion and long-lasting results.

Q: How does Pasco Hypersil 911 perform in extreme weather conditions?

A: Pasco Hypersil 911 is formulated for excellent weathering and UV resistance, making it suitable for Australian climates. Its flexibility accommodates thermal movement, preventing cracks and leaks in diverse weather conditions.

Q: Can Pasco Hypersil 911 be used on all types of plastics?

A: While Pasco Hypersil 911 adheres to most plastics, it is not suitable for polycarbonate sheeting. For polycarbonate, use Pasco Hyperclear. Always test compatibility on a small area before full application.

Q: What are the technical properties of Pasco Hypersil 911 that make it durable?

A: Pasco Hypersil 911's 100% silicone formulation provides a Shore A hardness of 30 and tensile strength of 2.0 MPa. Its neutral cure and high elongation (400%) ensure flexibility and strength, crucial for long-term durability.

Q: What safety precautions should be taken when using Pasco Hypersil 911?

A: Wear appropriate PPE, including gloves and eye protection. Use in well-ventilated areas as the sealant emits MEKO during curing. In case of contact, rinse eyes immediately and wash skin with soap and water.

column2: SA Contractors Acetic Cure Silicone Adhesive / Sealant
column3:
Use SA Contractors for: Glazing, sealing, weatherproofing, and forming in-place gaskets in various applications.

SA Contractors Silicone Sealant is a reliable, one-part, acetic cure silicone sealant designed for general-purpose glazing and sealing needs. Its 100% acetic curing system ensures a fast cure and strong bond, particularly on non-porous surfaces. This sealant boasts excellent resistance to weathering and UV exposure, making it suitable for both interior and exterior applications. It maintains its superior physical properties even after years of exposure to diverse environmental conditions.

Key Features of SA Contractors Silicone Sealant

  • Acetic Cure: Provides a fast cure and strong adhesion.
  • Excellent Weatherability: Suitable for long-term outdoor use.
  • UV Resistance: Maintains properties even with prolonged UV exposure.
  • Versatile Applications: Ideal for glazing, sealing, and weatherproofing.
  • Non-Slump Formula: Easy to apply on vertical and overhead surfaces.
  • Wide Adhesion: Bonds well to glass, wood, ceramics, aluminum, and many plastics.

Technical Overview

SA Contractors is formulated to provide a durable and reliable seal. Its acetic curing system ensures a strong bond, while its resistance to weathering and UV exposure makes it suitable for various applications.

Chemical Properties: Acetic acid-curing silicone sealant. Provides excellent resistance to weathering and UV radiation.

Operating Temperature: -62°C to 180°C (-79.6°F to 356°F). Ensure surfaces are clean and dry for optimal adhesion. Cure time is 5-7 days for a 10mm bead at 25°C (77°F) and 50% relative humidity.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Sealant gun, tooling spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, and mineral turpentine.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Cut the nozzle at a 45-degree angle. Tool within 5 minutes of application. Use a backing rod for joints over 10mm deep. Mask joint edges for a neat finish and remove tape before the sealant skins over.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Ensure proper ventilation as the sealant releases acetic acid during curing. Clean surfaces thoroughly for optimal adhesion. Avoid using soap or detergent for cleaning.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place below 25°C (77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in high temperatures to prevent reduced shelf life.

column32: SA Contractors Silicone Sealant | Adhesesal

column52:
How to apply SA Contractors Silicone Sealant:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Application: Cut nozzle at 45-degree angle, apply with sealant gun, and tool within 5 minutes.
  3. Backing Material: Use approved backing material for joints over 10mm deep.
  4. Cleaning: Clean uncured sealant with mineral turpentine. Remove masking tape before sealant skins over.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About SA Contractors Silicone Sealant

Q: What is the cure time for SA Contractors Silicone Sealant?

A: The cure time is 5-7 days for a 10mm bead at 25°C (77°F) and 50% relative humidity.

Q: Can SA Contractors Silicone Sealant be used outdoors?

A: Yes, it offers excellent weathering and UV resistance, making it suitable for outdoor applications.

Q: What surfaces can SA Contractors Silicone Sealant be used on?

A: It has excellent adhesion to glass, wood, ceramics, aluminum, and many plastics.

Q: How should I prepare surfaces before applying SA Contractors Silicone Sealant?

A: Surfaces must be clean, dry, and free of dirt, grease, oil, rust, and water. Use white spirits or mechanical cleaning with a lint-free cloth.

Q: Is SA Contractors Silicone Sealant paintable?

A: No, this sealant cannot be painted, as paint will not adhere to it.
column54:
SA Contractors Silicone Sealant limitations:

  • Not recommended for use with concrete, marble, galvanized steel, or lead surfaces.
  • Not for fixing mirrors without manufacturer's approval.
  • Not suitable for submerged joints or aquarium manufacturing.
  • Cannot be painted.
  • Not for use on some laminated glass or certain rubber products where plasticizer bleeding may occur.

Safety precautions when using SA Contractors Silicone Sealant:

  • Ventilation: Use in a well-ventilated area.
  • Avoid Contact: Avoid breathing vapor and contact with skin, eyes, and mouth.
  • Eye Protection: If in eyes, flush with water for 15 minutes and seek medical attention.
  • Hand Protection: Remove sealant from fingertips before handling contact lenses.
  • General: Keep out of reach of children. Refer to MSDS for detailed safety information.

column3:
Use SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant for: Weatherproofing, glazing, and sealing applications requiring high flexibility and movement capability.

SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant is a one-part, low modulus alkoxy silicone sealant engineered for superior weatherproofing and glazing applications. Its exceptional joint movement capability (±50%) and primer-less adhesion to many substrates make it ideal for dynamic building joints and curtain wall systems. This sealant ensures long-term durability and performance in diverse Australian environments.

Key Features of SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant

  • High Joint Movement Capability (±50%): Accommodates significant building movement, reducing stress on substrates.
  • Low Modulus: Minimizes strain on substrate surfaces, preventing damage.
  • Primer-less Adhesion: Simplifies application on various materials, including acrylic and polycarbonate.
  • Excellent UV Resistance: Prevents degradation from sunlight, ensuring long-term durability.
  • Wide Performance Range (-48°C to 149°C): Maintains flexibility and performance in extreme temperatures.

Why Choose SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant:

  • Superior Flexibility: Ideal for dynamic joints in curtain walls and weatherproofing applications.
  • Long-Term Durability: Resists weathering, UV radiation, and temperature extremes.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for various substrates, including glass, metals, and plastics.
  • Efficient Application: Primer-less adhesion and easy tooling simplify the application process.
  • 5 Star VOC Compliant: lower emissions, improving health and safety.

When to Choose SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant versus Alternatives:

  • Choose SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant over standard silicone sealants when: High joint movement capability and low modulus are required, such as in curtain wall glazing or dynamic building joints.
  • Consider other options when: Applications require submersion in water or contact with unpredictably absorptive materials like marble or limestone.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: SA Sealproof offers superior flexibility and primer-less adhesion, providing excellent value for high-performance applications.

Trade-Specific Applications for SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant:

For Glaziers:

  • Glazing curtain wall modules, ensuring weather-tight seals.
  • Sealing laminated and insulating glass units.
  • Primer-less adhesion to acrylic and polycarbonate substrates.

For Builders:

  • Sealing expansion joints in concrete and masonry.
  • Weatherproofing building facades and joints.
  • Adhering various construction materials, including metals and plastics.

For Sheet Metal Workers:

  • Sealing sheet metal joints in architectural applications.
  • Weatherproofing metal cladding and panels.
  • Providing flexible seals that accommodate thermal movement.

For Signage Installers:

  • Adhering signage panels to various substrates, including metals and plastics.
  • Providing long lasting weather proof seals.

Technical Overview

SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant is a low modulus, alkoxy silicone sealant designed for high-performance weatherproofing and glazing applications. Its exceptional joint movement capability and primer-less adhesion make it a reliable choice for various construction materials. The sealant’s formulation ensures long-term durability and flexibility in diverse Australian climates.

Shore A Hardness: 25, indicating very high flexibility and suitability for dynamic joints.

Joint Movement Capability: ±50%, accommodating significant building and material movement.

Performance Range: -48°C to 149°C, ensuring long-term performance in extreme temperatures.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Standard caulking gun, tooling spatula, masking tape, and mineral turpentine for cleanup.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: For curtain wall glazing, ensure proper joint design and substrate preparation. For concrete applications, priming may be necessary.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: If adhesion is poor on certain substrates, use a compatible primer. Clean uncured sealant with mineral turpentine.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place at temperatures not exceeding 25°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in direct sunlight or extreme temperatures to maintain product quality.

Certifications and Compliance

  • 5 Star VOC Compliant: Meets stringent VOC emission standards, promoting a safer working environment.
  • Complies with relevant Australian building codes and standards for weatherproofing and glazing applications.
  • Tested according to Underwriters Laboratories, Inc, U.L. 723 Test for surface Burning Characteristics and ASTM E814 Vertical Fire Endurance Test.

  6. Use approved backing material for joints over 10mm deep.

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About SA Sealproof Silicone Sealant

Q: What makes SA Sealproof suitable for curtain wall glazing?

A: Its high joint movement capability (±50%) and low modulus minimize stress on glass and metal, ensuring long-term performance in dynamic building facades.

Q: Can SA Sealproof be used on all types of plastics?

A: It offers primer-less adhesion to many plastics, including acrylic and polycarbonate. However, always test on a small area first to ensure compatibility.

Q: How long does it take for SA Sealproof to fully cure?

A: It takes 10-14 days for a 9mm deep bead to fully cure at 21°C and 50% relative humidity. Cure time can vary based on environmental conditions.

Q: What materials might require a primer before applying SA Sealproof?

A: Materials like concrete, mill finish aluminium, and galvanized steel may require priming due to variable surface characteristics. Always perform a trial application to check adhesion.

Q: Can SA Sealproof be used in submerged applications?

A: No, SA Sealproof is not recommended for locations subject to continuous water immersion.

Q: How do I clean uncured SA Sealproof?

A: Use mineral turpentine on a clean cloth to remove uncured sealant. Ensure proper ventilation during cleanup.

column2: SA Silicone N60 - Architectural Grade Silicone Sealant
column3:
Use Silicone N60 for: Structural glazing, weather sealing, and general glazing applications. Ideal for curtain walls, building facades, and laminated glass.

Silicone N60 is a one-component, non-flowing, high modulus silicone sealant that cures by absorbing atmospheric moisture. Its thixotropic nature ensures it will not slump in typical construction joints, providing a clean and professional finish. This sealant is designed for demanding architectural applications, offering excellent natural aging stability and maintaining its elastomeric properties even under harsh conditions and temperature extremes.

Key Features of Silicone N60 Architectural Grade Silicone

  • Superior adhesion to painted and anodized aluminum and glass.
  • Excellent UV stability and long-life reliability.
  • Thixotropic nature prevents slumping.
  • Neutral cure formulation.
  • High modulus and flexible elastomeric sealant.
  • Suitable for structural glazing and weather sealing.
  • Drinking water approved (Trans & Grey only).

Technical Overview

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge gun, clean cloths, IPA or white spirits, polyethylene scraper, masking tape.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use the two-wipe process for impervious substrates. Cut the nozzle to the desired width. Tool before skinning. Use closed-cell backing rod.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid three-sided adhesion. Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Conduct compatibility tests with adjacent materials.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place below 25°C (77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of manufacture when stored below 23°C (73.4°F) and below 50% relative humidity.
  • Temperature Considerations: Prolonged storage at high temperatures may affect shelf life.

Certifications

  • AS-1288:2006
  • ASTM C1184, Type S, Use G and O.
  • C920: Type S Grade NS, Class 35, Use NT, A, G, O.
  • GB-16776
  • Meets Low VOC Rating – 47g/L (SCAQMD)
  • AS/NZS4020-2005 – Drink water approved AWQC (Trans & Grey Only)
  • ASTM C792
column7: aluminium,anodised aluminium,auto body-i,box buy,bulk-discount,caravan and truck-i,cartridge,caulking-i,curtain walls,external,facades,fast cure,flexible,glass,glazing,glazing-i,internal,joinery & cabinets-i,laminating,low voc,marine-i,masonry-i,metal,neutral-cure,one part,plastic,primerless,sealant,sheet metal-i,silicone,stone-i,uv stable,water tank,weatherseal
column33: Silicone N60: Premium neutral cure silicone for glazing and weatherproofing. Superior adhesion, UV stability, and long-life reliability.
column52:
How to apply Silicone N60 Architectural Grade Silicone:

  1. Prepare the surfaces: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free of contaminants.
  2. Apply the sealant: Cut the nozzle to the desired width and apply firmly.
  3. Tool the sealant: Tool before skinning for a good finish.
  4. Clean up: Wipe off excess sealant with a clean cloth or scraper.
  5. Use backing rod: Use a closed-cell polyethylene backing rod for proper joint depth.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Silicone N60 Architectural Grade Silicone

Q: What materials can Silicone N60 bond?

A: Silicone N60 bonds to painted and anodized aluminum, glass, laminated and reflective glass, mirrors (not vinyl backed), toughened glass, and composite metal panels.

Q: Is Silicone N60 suitable for drinking water applications?

A: Yes, the translucent and grey colors of Silicone N60 are drinking water approved (AS/NZS4020-2005).

Q: How long does Silicone N60 take to cure?

A: Silicone N60 cures 2-3mm in the first 24 hours and to a depth of 7mm in 7 days. Full cure may take 14-21 days, depending on temperature and humidity.

Q: Can Silicone N60 be used in underwater applications?

A: No, Silicone N60 is not suitable for underwater applications on concrete or some plastic materials, including swimming pools.

Q: What is the dynamic movement capability of Silicone N60?

A: The dynamic movement capability of Silicone N60 is ±35%.
column54:
Silicone N60 Architectural Grade Silicone limitations:

  • Not suitable for totally confined spaces.
  • Not suitable for aquariums or underwater applications.
  • Not suitable for some stones or below-grade applications.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Not paintable.
  • Not compatible with polycarbonate sheeting.
  • Not for medical or pharmaceutical use.
  • Not for use where building materials may bleed oils or solvents.
  • Not for surfaces subject to corrosion or oxidisation.

Safety precautions when using Silicone N60 Architectural Grade Silicone:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use. Consult the SDS for detailed safety information.
  • First Aid: If swallowed or in eyes, contact a doctor or Poisons Information Centre.

Frequently Asked Questions About SA Silicone N-10 Silicone Sealant

Q: Can SA Silicone N-10 be used on all types of plastics?

A: While it adheres to many plastics, it's not recommended for polycarbonate. Always test on a small area first or contact Sealants Australasia for specific plastic compatibility.

Q: What is the best way to clean uncured sealant?

A: Use mineral turpentine on a clean cloth to remove uncured sealant. Ensure proper ventilation during cleanup.

A: It takes 5-7 days for a 10mm bead to fully cure at 25°C and 50% relative humidity. Cure time can vary based on temperature and humidity.

Q: Can this sealant be used in submerged applications?

A: No, SA Silicone N-10 is not recommended for submerged joints where porous substrates permit water to the bond interface.

A: Store in a cool, dry place at temperatures not exceeding 25°C to maintain its shelf life of 12 months.

A: Surfaces must be clean, dry, and free of dirt, grease, oil, rust, and water. Use white spirits or mechanical cleaning with a lint-free cloth. Do not use soap or detergent.

column3:
Use N-80 Architectural Grade Silicone Sealant for: Demanding sealing applications requiring high flexibility, UV stability, and structural integrity, including structural glazing and joints in various building materials.

N-80 Architectural Grade Silicone Sealant is a 100% pure, neutral curing silicone designed for high-performance applications. This premium sealant offers exceptional flexibility, accommodating movement up to 30% of the original joint width. It is UV stable, colourfast, and resistant to mould and mildew, making it suitable for both internal and external use. N-80 adheres to a wide range of substrates, including glass, tiles, metals, and laminates, providing a durable and weatherproof seal for demanding projects.

Key Features

  • 100% pure neutral curing silicone
  • Architectural grade for demanding applications
  • High flexibility (±30% movement capability)
  • UV stable and colourfast
  • Low odour
  • Excellent adhesion to various substrates
  • Suitable for structural glazing
  • Resistant to mould and mildew

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polysiloxanes
  • Density: 1.03
  • Shore A Hardness: 20
  • Elongation at Break: 300%
  • Application Temperature: +5°C to +35°C

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sealant gun, masking tape, utility knife, smoothing tool, cleaning cloths, backing rod (for deeper joints).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Use a backing rod for deeper joints. Mask joint edges for a neat finish. Tool off the sealant before skinning for a smooth appearance. Use primer where necessary (50A for non-porous, 2001 for porous substrates). Maintain 2:1 sealant width to depth ratio.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid use on natural stone without prior stain testing. For aquariums, use Adheseal Contractors Silicone Sealant. If discolouration occurs on copper or brass, choose an alternative sealant. For composite panels, test adhesion with Adheseal Hi-Flex Construction first.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original unopened packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing temperatures.

Certifications

  • Meets “Green Star” environmental criteria
  • Conforms to Californian Bureau of Air Quality Management Rule 1168

Application Guide

  1. Prepare the substrate by ensuring it is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Mask the joint edges with masking tape for a neat finish.
  3. Apply primer if necessary.
  4. Apply N-80 sealant using a sealant gun, ensuring good contact with both sides of the joint.
  5. Tool off the sealant with a moistened spatula before skinning.
  6. Remove masking tape while the sealant is still wet.
  7. If sealant dries on the surface, clean with IPA Cleaner and scrape off with a blade.
