column3:
Use Adheseal S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone Sealant for: Sealing joints in tiles, sanitary ware, and movement joints in various construction and manufacturing applications.

Adheseal S100 is a high-quality, neutral curing, anti-fungal sanitary silicone sealant designed for superior bonding and long-lasting performance. Its oxime curing system ensures compatibility with a wide range of substrates, including glazed tiles, enamel, and aluminium. The added fungicide inhibits mould and mildew growth, making it ideal for use in kitchens, bathrooms, and other humid environments. With its high elasticity, S100 accommodates movement up to ±25% of the original joint width, ensuring a durable and waterproof seal. This UV-stable and low VOC sealant is perfect for both internal and external applications, providing a flexible and reliable solution for various sealing needs. 

Key Features of Adheseal S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone Sealant

  • Neutral (Oxime) Curing: Compatible with a wide range of substrates, including sensitive materials, without corrosion.
  • Anti-Fungal Properties: Inhibits mould and mildew growth, ideal for sanitary applications.
  • High Elasticity: Accommodates movement up to ±25% (30% as listed in physical properties), ensuring a durable and flexible seal.
  • UV Stable and Colour Fast: Suitable for outdoor applications, maintaining its appearance over time.
  • Low VOC Content: Meets "Green Star" environmental criteria and Californian standards, promoting environmental friendliness.
  • Wide Substrate Compatibility: Bonds effectively to glazed tiles, enamel, aluminium, and other common building materials.
  • Extensive Colour Range: Available in various colours to match grouts and tiles.

Technical Overview

Adheseal S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone Sealant is formulated to provide a permanently elastic and dustproof joint seal. Its neutral curing system ensures compatibility with various substrates, while its anti-fungal properties prevent mould growth. The high elasticity and UV stability make it suitable for both internal and external applications.

Chemical Properties: Polysiloxane-based sealant with an oxime curing system. Provides excellent resistance to mould and mildew.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C (41°F to 95°F). Ensure surfaces are clean and dry for optimal adhesion. Cure time is approximately 2mm per day at 25°C (77°F) and 50% humidity.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, and appropriate cleaners/solvents (e.g., white spirits).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a backing rod for joints deeper than 10mm to control depth and ensure proper adhesion. Apply sealant in a continuous bead and tool off with a moistened spatula before skin formation. Mask joint edges for a neater finish and remove tape while the sealant is still wet.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Incomplete curing can occur in totally confined spaces; ensure adequate atmospheric humidity. Poor adhesion results from inadequate surface preparation; clean surfaces thoroughly using the two-wipe process. Discolouration can occur on copper and brass; avoid contact or test beforehand.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to prevent product degradation.

Certifications

  • Conforms to Californian Bureau of Air Quality Management Rule 1168 (VOC compliance).
  • Meets “Green Star” environmental criteria.

column32: S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone | Neutral Curing Sanitary | Adheseal
column33: High-performance S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone. Anti-fungal, flexible, and ideal for tiling, bathrooms, and kitchens. Shop now at Adheseal!
column52:
How to apply S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Priming (if necessary): Apply primer 50A for non-porous or 2001 for porous substrates.
  3. Backing Rod (if needed): Use a closed-cell polyethylene backing rod for joints deeper than 10mm.
  4. Application: Cut the nozzle, insert the cartridge into a caulking gun, and apply sealant in a continuous bead.
  5. Tooling: Tool off with a moistened spatula before skin formation.
  6. Cleaning: Clean excess sealant with white spirits while wet. Remove masking tape while the sealant is still wet.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone

Q: Can Adheseal S100 be used in bathrooms and showers?

A: Yes, Adheseal S100 is ideal for bathrooms and showers due to its anti-fungal properties and excellent adhesion to glazed tiles and sanitary ware.

Q: What is the best way to prepare surfaces for Adheseal S100?

A: Surfaces should be clean, dry, and free from dust, grease, and other contaminants. Use the two-wipe process with a suitable cleaner like white spirits for impervious substrates.

Q: Can Adheseal S100 be used on natural stone?

A: Adheseal recommends completing a stain testing program before using any sealant on natural stone. S100 is recommended for marble and granite after a successful stain test.

Q: What is the cure time for Adheseal S100?

A: The cure time is approximately 2mm per day at 25°C (77°F) and 50% humidity. Cure times vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.

Q: Is Adheseal S100 suitable for outdoor use?

A: Yes, Adheseal S100 is UV stable and colour fast, making it suitable for both internal and external applications.
column54:
S100 Kitchen & Bathroom Silicone limitations:

  • Not suitable for totally confined spaces.
  • Not recommended for aquariums or adhering mirrors (test first).
  • Not suitable for structural glazing.
  • Not recommended for composite panels (test Hi Flex Construction first).
  • Not suitable for underwater applications (including swimming pools).
  • Requires stain testing on natural stone.
  • Not suitable for horizontal walkways and trafficable areas.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Not paintable.

Safety precautions when using Adheseal S100:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid prolonged skin contact. Wash hands thoroughly after use.
  • First Aid: Refer to the safety data sheet for detailed first aid measures.

column2: N40 GP Silicone Sealant - Standard Colours
column3:
Use N40 GP Silicone Sealant for: Sealing joints in sanitary areas, construction, marine applications, and preventing mould growth.

Adheseal N40 GP Silicone Sealant is a high-quality, neutral cure, anti-fungal silicone designed for a wide range of applications. This versatile sealant provides excellent adhesion to various substrates, including tiles, metals, and plastics. Its UV stable and permanently flexible formula ensures long-lasting performance in both interior and exterior environments. Ideal for sanitary applications, construction, and marine environments, N40 offers reliable protection against mould and mildew, making it a must-have for any trade professional.

Key Features of N40 GP Silicone Sealant

  • Inhibits mould and biological growth, ideal for sanitary applications.
  • Maintains a waterproof, flexible joint with ±30% movement capability.
  • Excellent adhesion to a wide range of substrates, including metals, tiles, and plastics.
  • UV stable and permanently flexible, ensuring long-lasting performance.
  • Suitable for both internal and external applications in diverse environments.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polysiloxanes, Oxime curing system
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Temperature Resistance: -50°C to 150°C (-58°F to 302°F)
  • VOC Content: 43 g/L
  • Movement Capability: ±30%
  • Elastic Recovery: >90%

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, white spirits.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Use a backing rod for deeper joints. Tool the sealant smoothly before skin formation for a professional finish.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor adhesion can be prevented by proper surface preparation and priming. Mould growth is inhibited by the sealant's anti-fungal properties.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures during storage to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Conforms to Californian Bureau of Air Quality Management Rule 1168.

column32: N40 GP Silicone Sealant | Anti-Fungal | Adheseal
column33: Adheseal N40: Neutral cure, anti-fungal silicone sealant. High bond, UV stable, flexible. Ideal for construction, marine, and sanitary applications.
column52:
How to apply N40 GP Silicone Sealant:

  1. Prepare the surface: Ensure it is clean, dry, and free from contaminants.
  2. Cut the nozzle: At a 45-degree angle to the desired bead size.
  3. Apply the sealant: Hold the gun at a 45-degree angle and apply a continuous bead.
  4. Tool the sealant: Smooth the sealant with a moistened spatula before skin formation.
  5. Clean up: Remove excess sealant with white spirits while wet.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About N40 GP Silicone Sealant

Q: How do I prepare the surface for N40 sealant application?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust, grease, and loose particles. Use white spirits for cleaning impervious surfaces. Priming may be necessary for porous materials. Conduct an adhesion test before full application.

Q: What is the temperature resistance of N40 sealant?

A: N40 sealant can withstand temperatures from -50°C to 150°C (-58°F to 302°F), making it suitable for a wide range of environmental conditions.

Q: Can N40 sealant be used in wet environments?

A: Yes, N40 is ideal for wet environments such as bathrooms and kitchens due to its anti-fungal properties and waterproof seal. However, it is not suitable for continuous underwater applications like swimming pools.

Q: How do I remove excess or cured N40 sealant?

A: Clean uncured sealant with white spirits. Cured sealant can be mechanically removed by cutting or scraping. Soften it with white spirits before scraping for easier removal.

Q: Is N40 sealant safe for food preparation areas?

A: Yes, N40 is safe for use in food preparation areas. It is non-toxic and has low VOC content, meeting "green star" environmental criteria.

Q: What substrates does N40 adhere to?

A: N40 adheres to glazed and unglazed ceramic tiles, enamel, laminated kitchen benches, aluminum, timber, glass, porcelain, fibreglass, colourbond, zincalume and galvanised metal.

Q: What is the cure time for N40?

A: Allow approximately 10 minutes skin time, 2mm per 24 hours cure time @25dg & 50% humidity. Please note all cure times vary depending on atmospheric conditions and porosity of the substrate.
column54:
N40 GP Silicone Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for aquariums or continuous underwater applications.
  • Not recommended for structural glazing or adhering mirrors (use High Power 609 for mirrors).
  • Not suitable for composite panels without prior testing (PU50FC recommended).
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Not paintable.
  • Not for use on polycarbonate sheeting.
  • Not for use on all natural stone, testing is recommended.
  • Not for use on horizontal walkways and trafficable areas.
  • Requires atmospheric moisture to cure, not suitable for totally confined spaces.

Safety precautions when using N40 GP Silicone Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use.
  • First Aid: If ingested, do not induce vomiting and seek medical advice. For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water.

column2: Hi Power - Instant Grab MS Adhesive
column3:
Use High Power 609 for: Instant bonding of various materials in construction, marine, automotive, and industrial applications, including on damp surfaces.

High Power 609 is a revolutionary MS adhesive/sealant that delivers an immediate grab, reducing the need for initial support. Its high shear strength and elastic properties make it suitable for applications subject to vibrations and deformations. This product adheres to a wide range of substrates, including ceramic, plaster, glass, wood, metals, and plastics, even in slightly moist conditions. With excellent weather and UV resistance, it’s perfect for both interior and exterior use. Its low VOC content and non-toxic formulation meet "green star" environmental criteria, ensuring a safe and sustainable application.

Key Features of High Power 609 Instant Grab Adhesive

  • Instant grab, eliminating the need for temporary support.
  • High shear strength and elasticity, ensuring a durable bond.
  • Excellent adhesion to a wide range of substrates, including damp surfaces.
  • Exceptional weather and UV resistance for long-lasting performance.
  • Low VOC and non-toxic, meeting environmental standards.
  • Paintable with water-based products for a seamless finish.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Hybrid Polymer, Moisture cured
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Temperature Resistance: -40°C to 100°C (-40°F to 212°F)
  • Density (Specific Gravity): 1.57 ± 0.05
  • Elongation at Break: 200%
  • VOC Content: 38 g/L
  • Shore A Hardness: 50 (after 14 days)

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, triangular nozzle, cleaning cloths, white spirits.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use a triangular nozzle for optimal bead formation. Ensure surfaces are clean and free from contaminants. For heavier elements, mechanical holding may be required until cured. Apply in beads 5-10cm apart based on weight of the item.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Poor adhesion can be avoided with proper surface preparation and priming. Avoid contact with uncured polyurethanes. Ensure proper ventilation during application.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store between 5°C and 30°C (41°F and 86°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 9 months from date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • Meets "green star" environmental criteria.

column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About High Power 609 Instant Grab Adhesive

Q: Can High Power 609 be used on damp surfaces?

A: Yes, High Power 609 has good adhesion even on slightly moist substrates, making it versatile for various applications.

Q: Do I need to prime surfaces before using High Power 609?

A: High Power 609 has exceptional adhesion to most materials without priming. However, for optimal adhesion on porous or critical surfaces, priming with 50A or Everflex Supaprime is recommended.

Q: What is the cure time for High Power 609?

A: Allow approximately 10-30 minutes skin time, and 2mm per 24 hours cure time at 23°C and 50% humidity. Cure times may vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.

Q: Can High Power 609 be painted?

A: Yes, High Power 609 can be painted with water-based products after it has cured.

Q: Is High Power 609 suitable for exterior applications?

A: Yes, High Power 609 has exceptional weather and UV resistance, making it suitable for both interior and exterior applications.

Q: How do I clean up High Power 609?

A: While the product is still wet, tools and spills can be cleaned with white spirits. Cured product can be removed by mechanical means.

Q: What is the optimal bond thickness for High Power 609?

A: The optimal bond thickness for High Power 609 is at least 2 mm for the elastic properties to come to full justice.

column2: Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant
column3:
Use Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant for: Seam sealing, bonding dissimilar materials, and achieving waterproof, UV-stable joints in construction, marine, and automotive applications.

Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant is a high-performance, high-modulus adhesive and sealant designed for demanding Australian conditions. Offering exceptional UV resistance and weather durability, Hi-Flex 60 cures rapidly into a flexible, dust-proof joint, maintaining long-term elasticity. With outstanding primeless adhesion on most construction substrates, this low VOC, non-isocyanate sealant is suitable for internal and external applications across construction, marine, automotive, and industrial sectors. It’s user-friendly, non-corrosive, and delivers resilient performance on cementitious materials, metals, plastics, and more.

Key Features of Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant

  • Outstanding primer-less adhesion on non-porous substrates like glass and metals
  • Movement capability of ±25% ensures durability in dynamic joints
  • Excellent UV and weather resistance for long-term outdoor applications
  • Paintable with acrylic, oil, and rubber-based paints for a seamless finish
  • Non-corrosive and non-staining for sensitive surfaces
  • High Modulus Shore A 55 suitable for anti-pick applications in public areas

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: MS Polymer, Neutral Cure
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 100°C (-40°F to 212°F)
  • Skin Time: 10 minutes at 23°C and 50% RH
  • Cure Rate: 3mm per 24 hours at 23°C and 50% RH
  • VOC Content: 1.5 g/L

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sausage gun, spatula for tooling, masking tape
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use Adhefoam backer rod for joints >10mm deep to control sealant depth
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Prevent bubbling by avoiding air entrapment; clean surfaces with Xylene for optimal adhesion

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry areas at 5°C to 25°C (41°F to 77°F)
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from date of manufacture
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing; do not store above 25°C (77°F)

Certifications

  • Green Star compliant – low VOC
  • ASTM C719 Movement Capability Certified
  • Conforms to Australian safety regulations

column32: Hi-Flex 60 MS Hybrid Adhesive Sealant for Construction | Adheseal
column33: Hi-Flex 60 is a high-performance MS polymer adhesive sealant with UV resistance and exceptional adhesion. Ideal for construction and marine use.
column52:
How to apply Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant:

  1. Prepare surfaces – dry, clean, and free of contaminants
  2. Mask joint edges for neat finish
  3. Cut nozzle at appropriate angle (45° for sealant, 90° for adhesive)
  4. Apply with sausage gun, ensuring steady bead and no air entrapment
  5. Tool off with spatula before skin forms (approx. 10 minutes)
  6. Clean tools with Xylene while sealant is wet; remove tape immediately after tooling
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant

Q: How should I apply Hi-Flex 60 for sealing joints?

A: Clean the substrate thoroughly, apply masking tape, and use a sausage gun to apply the sealant at a 45° angle. Tool off with a moistened spatula before skin formation.

Q: How does Hi-Flex 60 perform in extreme weather?

A: With excellent UV and weather resistance, Hi-Flex 60 maintains flexibility and adhesion in temperatures from -40°C to 100°C, making it ideal for Australian outdoor applications.

Q: What materials is Hi-Flex 60 compatible with?

A: It bonds to cementitious substrates, metals (excluding copper/lead), glass, timber, plastics, powder coat, and more. Preliminary adhesion testing is recommended for optimal results.

Q: How can I avoid air bubbles in the sealant?

A: Ensure surfaces are dry and clean. Avoid entrapping air during application, and tool the sealant promptly before skin formation. Use backer rods or bond breaker tape as needed.

Q: How do I safely dispose of Hi-Flex 60 waste?

A: Dispose of cured product as general waste. For uncured material, follow local hazardous waste regulations. Always wear gloves and wash hands after use.
column54:
Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for long-term water immersion or swimming pool interiors
  • Do not use in totally confined spaces – requires air humidity to cure
  • Not for use with copper, lead, or on bituminous/EPDM surfaces
  • Avoid exposure to cleaning agents, solvents, or alcohol during curing

Safety precautions when using Hi-Flex 60 MS Polymer Hybrid Adhesive Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, safety glasses
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas to avoid inhalation
  • Handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; wash hands after use
  • Follow first aid instructions in case of ingestion or exposure; seek medical advice
column55: Hi-Flex 60 is a high modulus MS polymer adhesive sealant, ideal for durable, flexible bonding across construction, automotive, and marine applications. It provides primer-less adhesion and excellent UV resistance, ensuring long-lasting seals on various substrates.

  • Metals (excluding copper and lead) – roughen and clean for best adhesion
  • Timber including plasterboard – remove dust and moisture prior to application
  • Plastics – preliminary adhesion test recommended
  • Powder-coated surfaces – confirm with surface preparation and adhesion test
  • Glass, porcelain, fibreglass, rubber, and painted surfaces – clean and test

  • Seam sealing bolted lap joints and display signs
  • Aluminium fabrication and sealing dissimilar materials

column2: Hi-Flex Construction MS Polymer Based Hybrid Sealant
column3:
Use Hi-Flex Construction for: Sealing expansion joints, perimeter window sealing, external wall cladding, and marine bonding

Hi-Flex Construction is a high-performance, single-component hybrid sealant based on advanced MS Polymer technology. Designed for durability in harsh Australian climates, it delivers exceptional elasticity, non-staining performance, and primer-less adhesion to most common building materials. Ideal for both interior and exterior applications, it’s a go-to for sealing expansion joints, windows, curtain walls, and vehicle or marine manufacturing.

Key Features of Hi-Flex Construction

  • ±50% movement capability accommodates dynamic joint shifts
  • UV and weather-resistant for long-term external durability
  • Paintable and non-staining, ensuring aesthetic finish on facades
  • Primer-less adhesion to most substrates including powder coat
  • Low VOC and mould-resistant, ideal for green star projects

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: MS Polymer, neutral curing
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 100°C (-40°F to 212°F)
  • Elongation at Break: Approx. 1100%
  • Hardness: Shore A 25
  • VOC Content: 1.10%

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sausage gun, spatula, masking tape, Xylene cleaner
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use open cell backer rods and avoid three-sided adhesion for best results
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid moisture-vapour transmission; ensure surfaces are clean and dry to prevent bubbling or delamination

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in cool, dry place away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from production date
  • Temperature Considerations: Store between 5°C and 25°C (41°F to 77°F)

Certifications

  • ASTM C920 CLASS 50 Compliance
  • ASTM C1248 Non-staining certification
  • VOC compliant for “green star” environmental criteria

How to apply Hi-Flex Construction:

  1. Clean and prepare surface; remove contaminants using Xylene
  2. Mask joint edges if required; apply primer for critical joints
  3. Apply sealant using sausage gun at 45° angle; fill joint fully
  4. Tool within 10 minutes before skin formation; remove tape promptly
  5. Allow 3mm per 24 hours cure rate; clean tools with Xylene while wet
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Hi-Flex Construction

Q: What is the best method for applying Hi-Flex Construction?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry, use a sausage gun to apply in a continuous bead, and tool off within 10 minutes before skin formation.

Q: How does it perform in harsh weather conditions?

A: It maintains flexibility and adhesion under extreme UV exposure, rain, and temperature changes from -40°C to 100°C.

Q: Is it compatible with powder-coated aluminium?

A: Yes, Hi-Flex Construction adheres well to powder coat but preliminary adhesion testing is recommended for optimal results.

Q: What if the sealant bubbles during curing?

A: Bubbling is often due to moisture or air entrapment; ensure proper surface prep and avoid applying over damp substrates.

Q: What are the safety precautions when using this product?

A: Use gloves and eye protection, ensure good ventilation, and clean skin contact with soap and water. Avoid inhalation and ingestion.

column2: Sikaflex®-11 FC Polyurethane Sealant and Adhesive
column3:
Please note, this product is BOX BUY only.

Use Sikaflex®-11 FC for: Sealing joints in concrete, wood, and metal, and bonding floor moldings, skirting boards, and acoustic ceiling tiles.

Sikaflex®-11 FC is a versatile, one-component polyurethane sealant and adhesive designed for professional use. Its advanced formulation delivers a fast cure rate and exceptional adhesion to a wide range of substrates, including concrete, brick, metal, and wood. This product is perfect for Australian tradespeople needing a reliable solution for both sealing and bonding applications, offering long-lasting elasticity and resistance to weathering and water.

Key Features of Sikaflex®-11 FC

  • Dual Functionality: Acts as both a sealant and adhesive, reducing the need for multiple products on site.
  • Fast Cure Rate: Speeds up project completion, allowing for quicker over-painting and use.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to various materials, ensuring long-lasting performance.
  • Weather and Water Resistance: Provides durable protection against harsh Australian weather conditions.
  • High Elasticity: Accommodates joint movement, preventing cracks and failures.

Technical Overview

Sikaflex®-11 FC is formulated with a moisture-cured polyurethane that delivers a Shore A hardness of 40-45, providing a balance of flexibility and durability. Its tensile strength of approximately 1.55 N/mm² and elongation at break of 600% ensure robust performance in demanding applications.

Chemical Properties: One-component polyurethane that cures with atmospheric moisture, providing a flexible and durable seal.

Application Temperature Range: +5 °C to +35 °C (41 °F to 95 °F), ensuring reliable application in typical Australian climate conditions. Service temperature is -20 °C to +70 °C.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Standard sealant gun, masking tape, backing rods, Sika® Tooling Agent N.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are thoroughly clean and primed as needed. Use backing rods to control sealant depth and prevent three-sided adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Bubbling can occur if moisture is trapped; ensure proper substrate preparation and avoid applying in high humidity.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, between +5 °C and +25 °C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production in original, sealed packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications

  • ASTM C920: Meets requirements for elastic joint sealants.

  2. Insert backing rod: To control sealant depth.
  3. Apply sealant: Extrude into the joint, ensuring full contact.
  4. Finish: Tool the sealant with Sika® Tooling Agent N.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Sikaflex®-11 FC

Q: Can Sikaflex®-11 FC be used for underwater applications?

A: For total water immersion applications, allow a 5-day cure at standard conditions. Avoid long term exposure to high levels of chlorine. Do not use in swimming pools.

Q: How long does Sikaflex®-11 FC take to cure?

A: It takes 1 to 2 hours to become tack-free, depending on climate conditions, and 3 to 5 days for a final cure.

Q: What materials does Sikaflex®-11 FC adhere to?

A: It adheres to most common construction materials, including concrete, brick, ceramics, glass, metals, and wood. Primers may be needed for some substrates.

Q: Can Sikaflex®-11 FC be painted?

A: Yes, it can be overpainted with most conventional paints. However, preliminary tests are recommended to ensure compatibility. Best results are achieved after a full cure.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Sikaflex®-11 FC?

A: Wear appropriate PPE, such as gloves and eye protection. Ensure adequate ventilation. Clean tools with Sika® Remover-208 immediately after use.
column54:
Sikaflex®-11 FC limitations:

  • Not for use in expansion joints.
  • Do not use on bituminous substrates, natural rubber, or EPDM rubber.
  • Avoid exposure to high levels of chlorine.
  • White colour can discolour when exposed to UV light.

Safety precautions when using Sikaflex®-11 FC:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, eye protection, and appropriate respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application and curing.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Clean tools and skin with Sika® Remover-208.
  • Disposal: Dispose of cured material according to local regulations.

Ideal for both sealing and bonding applications, it provides a fast cure rate and excellent resistance to weathering and water.

  • Wood: Ensure the wood is clean and dry.
  • Ceramics: Clean and slightly roughen the surface for best results.

  • Sealing metal fabrications and bolted lap joints.

  • General construction sealing and bonding.

Why Use Sikaflex®-11 FC:

  • Provides a durable and flexible seal, preventing water ingress and air leakage.
  • Offers excellent adhesion to a wide range of building materials, reducing the need for multiple products.
  • Cures quickly, allowing for faster project completion and reduced downtime.
  • Resists weathering and water, ensuring long-term performance in various environmental conditions.
  • Can be overpainted, allowing for seamless integration with existing finishes.

column2: Sikaflex® Pro: Sealant for Concrete and Masonry Facades
column3:
Use Sikaflex® PRO for: sealing movement and connection joints on porous substrates like concrete and masonry, both indoors and outdoors.

Sikaflex® PRO is a high-performance, 1-component polyurethane sealant designed for professional use on concrete and masonry facades. Its elastic nature accommodates movement, preventing cracks and leaks. With excellent adhesion to porous materials, it's ideal for both new construction and renovation projects. This sealant provides a durable, weather-resistant seal, ensuring long-lasting protection against environmental elements. Its versatility makes it a go-to solution for various sealing applications.

Key Features of Sikaflex® PRO

  • ±25% movement capability, accommodating structural movement and preventing cracks.
  • Good workability, ensuring easy application and smooth finishing.
  • Excellent adhesion to porous substrates like concrete, brick, and masonry.
  • Durable and weather-resistant, providing long-lasting protection against the elements.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +40°C (41°F to 104°F)
  • Service Temperature Range: -40°C to +70°C (-40°F to 158°F)
  • Curing Rate: 3 mm/24 hours at 23°C and 50% RH

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Sealant gun, backing rod, masking tape, tooling agent (e.g., Sika® Tooling Agent N).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper joint design with a 2:1 width-to-depth ratio for optimal performance. Use a compatible primer for enhanced adhesion on specific substrates.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying in wet conditions; ensure substrates are clean and dry. For uneven joints, use backing rods to maintain consistent sealant depth.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, at +5°C to +25°C (41°F to 77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production in undamaged, original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing outside the recommended temperature range to maintain product quality.

Certifications

  • AS/NZS 4020:2018 - Water Potable Approved
  • ISO 11600 F 25 LM
  • ASTM C 920 Class 25

column32: Sikaflex® PRO | Elastic Sealant for Concrete & Masonry | Adheseal
column33: Sikaflex® PRO: Elastic sealant for concrete & masonry. ±25% movement, excellent adhesion. Ideal for indoor & outdoor joints.
column52:
How to apply Sikaflex® PRO:

  1. Prepare the substrate: Clean and prime as necessary.
  2. Insert backing rod: Place a suitable backing rod at the required depth.
  3. Apply sealant: Extrude Sikaflex® PRO into the joint, ensuring full contact with the sides.
  4. Tool the joint: Firmly tool the sealant against the joint sides for proper adhesion.
  5. Remove masking tape: If used, remove tape before skin formation.
  6. Smooth the surface: Use a compatible tooling agent for a smooth finish.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Sikaflex® PRO

Q: How do I prepare the surface before applying Sikaflex® PRO?

A: The surface must be clean, dry, and free from dust, grease, and loose particles. For porous substrates, use Sika® Primer-3 N. For non-porous substrates, use Sika® Aktivator-205 and/or Sika® Primer-215 as needed.

Q: What is the movement capability of Sikaflex® PRO?

A: Sikaflex® PRO has a movement capability of ±25%, allowing it to accommodate structural movements without cracking or losing adhesion. This ensures long-term performance and durability.

Q: Can Sikaflex® PRO be used on different types of substrates?

A: Yes, Sikaflex® PRO is versatile and can be used on various substrates, including concrete, masonry, brick, and some metals with appropriate priming. Always refer to the product data sheet for specific substrate preparation.

Q: How do I clean up uncured Sikaflex® PRO?

A: Use Sika® Remover-208 or Sika® TopClean T to clean uncured sealant from tools and surfaces. Once cured, the material can only be removed mechanically.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Sikaflex® PRO?

A: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), such as gloves and eye protection. Ensure adequate ventilation during application. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information.

Q: Can Sikaflex® PRO be painted over?

A: Yes, Sikaflex® PRO can be over-painted with most conventional facade coating paint systems. However, paints must first be tested to ensure compatibility. Flexible paints are recommended. Allow sealant to fully cure first.

Q: What is the ideal joint design for Sikaflex® PRO?

A: The joint width should be designed to suit the required movement, with a width-to-depth ratio of 2:1. Joint widths should be between 10 mm and 40 mm. Use backing rods to maintain correct depth.
column54:
Sikaflex® PRO limitations:

  • Do not use on natural stone, bituminous substrates, or EPDM rubber.
  • Not suitable for joints in or around swimming pools or for permanent water immersion.
  • Avoid exposing uncured sealant to alcohol-containing products.
  • Colour variations may occur due to UV exposure or chemical contact.

Use Sikaflex® Construction AP for: Sealing movement and connection joints in porous substrates, general indoor and outdoor sealing.

Sikaflex® Construction AP is a versatile, 1-component polyurethane sealant designed for a wide range of construction applications. Its elastic nature accommodates movement in joints, preventing cracks and leaks. This sealant is ideal for porous substrates like concrete, brick, and masonry, offering strong adhesion and long-lasting durability. It's ready to use, requiring no mixing, and can be painted over, making it a practical choice for both professional and DIY projects.

Key Features of Sikaflex® Construction AP

  • High Movement Capability: Accommodates joint movement up to ±25%, preventing cracks and maintaining a secure seal in dynamic structures.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to porous substrates like concrete and masonry, ensuring a durable and reliable seal.
  • Easy Application: 1-component formulation eliminates mixing, allowing for direct application and efficient work.
  • Paintable: Can be painted over with most conventional facade coatings, allowing for seamless integration with the surrounding finish.
  • Weather Resistant: Provides excellent durability against weathering, ensuring long-term performance in outdoor applications.

Technical Overview

Sikaflex® Construction AP is formulated for elasticity and durability, making it suitable for demanding construction environments. Its non-sag properties allow for easy application on vertical and overhead surfaces, ensuring a clean and professional finish. The sealant's elastic recovery and tear resistance contribute to its long-term performance in dynamically stressed joints.

Chemical Properties: 1-component polyurethane, moisture-curing, providing a flexible and durable seal.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +40°C (41°F to 104°F), ensuring usability in various climate conditions. It is recommended to apply the product at least 3°C above the dew point temperature to prevent condensation affecting the cure.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Sealant gun, backing rod, masking tape (optional), tooling agent (e.g., Sika® Tooling Agent N).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure proper joint design and dimensioning according to relevant standards. Use a backing rod to control sealant depth and prevent three-sided adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For optimal adhesion, clean and prime substrates as recommended. Avoid applying in wet conditions or on frozen surfaces.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in dry conditions, protected from direct sunlight, at temperatures between +5°C and +25°C (41°F and 77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months from the date of production in undamaged, original, sealed packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing outside the specified temperature range to maintain product quality.

Certifications

  • ISO 11600 F 25 LM (Movement capability and sealant properties).
  • ASTM C 920 Class 25 (Elastomeric joint sealants).
  • VOC SCAQMD Method 304-91 (Volatile organic compound compliance).

Use Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390 for: Sealing expansion joints in precast panels, brickwork, fibre cement, aluminium windows, and more

Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390 is a high-performance, Class-A, low modulus polyurethane sealant designed for professional trade use. This one-component, moisture-curing sealant offers outstanding flexibility with ±50% joint movement capability, making it ideal for a wide range of internal and external construction applications. With acoustic rating, excellent durability, and compatibility with common substrates, it’s a reliable choice for demanding Australian conditions. Its paintability and no-mix application ensure efficient use on site, while compliance with AS4020 and ASTM standards guarantees peace of mind for trade professionals.

Key Features of Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390

  • ±50% joint movement for superior flexibility in dynamic joints
  • One-component, moisture-curing formula with no mixing required
  • Acoustic rated for sound-sensitive applications
  • Paintable after full cure, ensuring seamless finishes
  • Non-sag, smooth thixotropic paste for clean application
  • Made in Australia and compliant with AS4020 for potable water

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Service Temperature: -40°C to 75°C (-40°F to 167°F)
  • Tack Free Time: 6–12 hours
  • Full Cure: 7 days (allow 14 days for joints over 20mm)
  • Shore A Hardness: 30
  • Elongation at Break: >900%
  • VOC Content: 74 g/L

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge or sausage caulking gun, spatula/trowel for tooling
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Use backing rod for correct sealant geometry; ensure surfaces are dry and clean for optimal adhesion
  • Common Issues and Solutions: For porous surfaces or extreme conditions, use Bostik N49 Primer; use N40 Primer on non-porous substrates

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Cool, dry area (5°C to 30°C), away from direct sunlight
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in unopened container
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storage in extremes; dispose of in accordance with local regulations

Certifications

  • AS4020 Potable Water Compliant
  • ASTM C920-87 & 98 Type S, Grade NS, Class 50
  • AS 2253 / 1276 Acoustic Rated

column52:
How to apply Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390:

  1. Clean and dry surfaces thoroughly, removing dust, oil, and contaminants
  2. Insert backing rod for proper joint geometry and sealant adhesion
  3. Apply primer if required – N49 for porous, N40 for non-porous substrates
  4. Apply sealant using cartridge or sausage gun; tool off to smooth finish
  5. Allow to cure for 7-14 days depending on joint size and conditions
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390

Q: How should I apply Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390 for best results?

A: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Use a caulking gun for application and tool the bead for smoothness. For porous substrates, consider priming with Bostik N49.

Q: How long does Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390 take to fully cure?

A: It cures at 2mm per 24 hours on porous substrates. Full cure typically takes 7 days, or 14 days for joints over 20mm wide.

Q: Is this sealant compatible with aluminium windows and panels?

A: Yes, but conduct a P.A.T.S. test before application. Bare aluminium typically requires no primer; coated panels may require Bostik N40 Primer.

Q: What should I do if the sealant fails to adhere properly?

A: Check for surface contamination. Use appropriate primer (N49 or N40) based on substrate. Reapply with proper surface prep and joint dimensions.

Q: Are there any safety considerations during use?

A: Yes. Wear PPE including gloves, eye protection, and a respirator in poorly ventilated areas. Avoid skin contact and inhalation of vapours.
column54:
Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390 limitations:

  • Not for use in chlorinated or salt water immersion (e.g., pools)
  • Do not apply below 5°C or above 35°C ambient temperature
  • Not suitable for glazing or joints under traffic loads
  • White variant may yellow under prolonged UV exposure
  • Do not use on bitumen-containing materials

Safety precautions when using Bostik Seal 'N' Flex One P390:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Gloves, eye/face protection, protective clothing
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas; wear respirator if necessary
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact; wash thoroughly after use
  • Dispose of waste according to local environmental regulations

column2: Megaprene 40gg - Gun Grade Polyurethane Joint Sealant
column3:
Use Megaprene 40gg for: Vertical and horizontal joints in bridges, roadways, car parks, driveways, factory and warehouse floors, and service station driveways.

Megaprene 40gg is a premium polyurethane joint sealant formulated to provide a durable and flexible seal in various construction applications. Its single-component, moisture-curing formulation ensures easy application and fast curing, while its high flexibility and non-sag properties make it suitable for both vertical and horizontal joints. Megaprene 40gg's excellent adhesion to most common building materials, combined with its resistance to chemicals and intermittent fuel spills, makes it a reliable choice for demanding environments.

Key Features of Megaprene 40gg Gun Grade Polyurethane Joint Sealant

  • Highly Flexible: Accommodates joint movement, ensuring a durable and long-lasting seal.
  • Non-Sag: Suitable for vertical applications without sagging or slumping.
  • Fast Curing: Cures quickly, reducing downtime and allowing for faster project completion.
  • Paintable: Can be painted over, allowing for seamless integration with surrounding surfaces.
  • Tear Resistant: Provides excellent resistance to tearing and abrasion.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to most common building materials, ensuring a reliable seal.
  • Potable Water Safe: Tested to AS/NZS 4020:2005, making it suitable for use with potable water.

Technical Overview

Megaprene 40gg is a moisture-curing polyurethane sealant that forms a tough, durable, and flexible seal. Its single-component formulation ensures easy application, while its fast curing properties allow for efficient project completion. Megaprene 40gg is designed to withstand harsh environmental conditions and chemical exposure, making it suitable for a wide range of construction applications.

Chemical Properties: Polyurethane, moisture-curing.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +40°C (41°F to 104°F). Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants before application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula or putty knife, industrial solvent (Xylene or mineral turps) for clean-up.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Prime concrete floor joints with Primer 2001. Use backer rod or bond breaker tape to prevent three-sided adhesion. Tool the sealant immediately after application for a smooth finish.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Bubbling can occur from entrapped air or damaged closed-cell backer rod. Ensure proper joint preparation and tooling. Avoid painting until fully cured to prevent retarding the curing process.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures and moisture exposure.

Certifications

  • Tested to AS/NZS 4020:2005 for use with potable water.
  • Meets ASTM C-920 and SNJF Class 1 Elastomeric specifications.
  • Complies with WorkSafe Australia standards (non-hazardous classification).

column52:
How to apply Megaprene 40gg Gun Grade Polyurethane Joint Sealant:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure substrates are sound, clean, and free from contamination. Prime if necessary, especially concrete floor joints with Primer 2001.
  2. Backer Rod/Bond Breaker: Use Adheseal Backing Rod (open or closed cell) or bond breaker tape to prevent three-sided adhesion.
  3. Application: Fill the prepared joint completely, avoiding air entrapment.
  4. Tooling: Dry tool the sealant immediately before it skins, within 10 minutes depending on temperature and humidity.
  5. Joint Dimensions: Joint depth should be half the width, with a minimum depth of 10mm. Maximum width of 50mm for vertical joints.
  6. Painting (Optional): Allow the sealant to fully cure before painting.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Megaprene 40gg Gun Grade Polyurethane Joint Sealant

Q: What types of joints is Megaprene 40gg suitable for?

A: Megaprene 40gg is suitable for vertical and horizontal joints in bridges, roadways, car parks, driveways, factory and warehouse floors, and service station driveways.

Q: Can Megaprene 40gg be used with potable water?

A: Yes, Megaprene 40gg is tested to AS/NZS 4020:2005, making it suitable for use with potable water.

Q: How long does Megaprene 40gg take to cure?

A: Megaprene 40gg cures at a rate of 3mm per 24 hours. Tack-free time is approximately 2 hours at 23°C (73°F) and 60% relative humidity.

Q: Can I paint over Megaprene 40gg?

A: Yes, Megaprene 40gg is paintable with most commonly available paints. Ensure the sealant is fully cured before painting to avoid retarding the curing process.

Q: How do I clean up uncured Megaprene 40gg?

A: Uncured material can be removed using industrial strength solvents such as Xylene or mineral turps.

Q: What is the movement capability of Megaprene 40gg?

A: Megaprene 40gg has a movement capability of +/-25%.

Q: Is Megaprene 40gg suitable for swimming pool applications?

A: Megaprene 40gg is not suitable for internal swimming pool applications.

Megaprene 40gg Gun Grade Polyurethane Joint Sealant limitations:

  • Avoid air entrapment during application to prevent bubbling.

Safety precautions when using Megaprene 40gg Gun Grade Polyurethane Joint Sealant:

Use Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant for: Sealing expansion joints, perimeter sealing, and general construction adhesive applications.

Adheseal PU 25 FC is a single-component, moisture-curing polyurethane sealant, designed for diverse construction and industrial applications. With exceptional elongation at break (600%) and a Shore A hardness of 25, it provides superior flexibility and durability. Its potable water compliance (AS/NZS 4020) and low VOC content (<1.5g/l) make it safe and versatile for various projects. This product is ideal for builders sealing precast panels, automotive trades bonding metal components, and marine trades sealing hulls.

Cure Time: Cures at 3mm per 24 hours, allowing for efficient project timelines. For example, sealing external cladding seams will reach a stable cure within 24 hours.

Coverage Rate: Coverage varies based on joint size, refer to the provided chart. A 10x10mm joint uses 6 linear meters per 600ml sausage.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 40°C, suitable for most Australian climates. It is important to apply within this range to ensure correct product curing and adhesion.

Chemical Properties: Excellent resistance to water, detergent solutions, dilute acids, alkalis, petrol, and oil. Provides a durable seal in challenging environments.

Key Features of Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant

  • High Elongation (600%): Accommodates significant structural movement, preventing cracks and leaks.
  • Potable Water Compliant (AS/NZS 4020): Safe for use in applications involving drinking water.
  • Low VOC (<1.5g/l): Meets strict environmental standards, ensuring safe application.
  • Wide Temperature Range (-30°C to +90°C): Suitable for all Australian climates.
  • Fast Curing: 3mm cure per 24 hours.

Why Choose Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant:

  • Durability: Withstands harsh Australian conditions, reducing maintenance.
  • Flexibility: Accommodates building movement, preventing structural damage.
  • Versatility: Suitable for diverse applications, simplifying inventory.
  • Compliance: Meets Australian standards, ensuring safety and quality.

When to Choose Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant over silicone sealants when: You need high elongation and potable water compliance.
  • Consider other options when: You require a faster cure time, or are working with aquariums or structural glazing.

Trade-Specific Applications for Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant:

For Builders and Carpenters:

  • Sealing expansion joints in precast and tilt-up panels.
  • Adhering floor mouldings and skirting boards.
  • Perimeter sealing of windows and curtain walls.

For Automotive Trades:

  • Seam sealing and bonding metal cladding.
  • Providing vibration-resistant seals in vehicle bodies.
  • Adhering display signs and components.

For Marine Trades:

  • Sealing hull joints and components.
  • Providing durable seals for below waterline applications.
  • Adhering fibreglass and other marine materials.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, Xylene.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and primed. Use backing rod for deep joints.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application in confined spaces. Clean uncured sealant with Xylene.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

Certifications and Compliance

  • AS/NZS 4020: Potable water compliance.
  • AS/NZS 1530.3: Low ignitability.
  • ISO 11600: Joint sealing performance.

column32: PU 25 FC: Fast-Cure Polyurethane Sealant | Adheseal
column33: PU 25 FC is a versatile, fast-curing polyurethane sealant for construction and industrial applications. Excellent adhesion and durability. Shop now!
column52:
How to apply PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are sound, clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Prime if necessary, especially for porous substrates or critical applications.
  2. Priming: Apply appropriate primer (Adheseal 50A for non-porous, Everflex Supaprime for porous) and allow to dry for 30 minutes to 2 hours.
  3. Joint Design: Aim for a 2:1 width-to-depth ratio. Use backer rod for joints over 10mm deep and bond breaker tape to prevent three-sided adhesion.
  4. Application: Cut nozzle at 45° for sealant or 90° for adhesive. Apply in a continuous bead, ensuring good contact with both sides of the joint.
  5. Tooling: Tool off with a moistened spatula within 5 minutes. Remove masking tape while sealant is still wet.
  6. Clean-Up: Clean tools and spills with Xylene while sealant is wet. Cured sealant can be removed mechanically.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant

Q: Can this sealant be used in potable water applications?

A: Yes, Adheseal PU 25 FC is compliant with AS/NZS 4020, making it suitable for applications involving drinking water.

Q: What is the best way to clean uncured sealant?

A: Uncured sealant can be cleaned with Xylene. Use proper safety precautions when working with solvents.

Q: How do I prepare metal surfaces for optimal adhesion?

A: Slightly roughen the metal surface with an abrasive pad, then clean with Adheseal 50A surface prep. Allow 30 minutes to 2 hours before applying the sealant.

Q: Can this sealant be used in high-temperature environments?

A: Yes, it is suitable for service temperatures ranging from -30°C to +90°C, making it versatile for various industrial and construction applications across Australia.

Q: What is the significance of the low VOC content?

A: A low VOC content (<1.5g/l) means the product releases fewer volatile organic compounds, making it safer for indoor use and environmentally friendly.

Q: How do I ensure proper curing in different weather conditions?

A: Ensure application within the 5°C to 40°C range. Humidity also affects cure time, so allow for longer curing times in high humidity.
column54:
PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for totally confined spaces due to moisture-curing requirements.
  • Avoid use in aquariums or internal swimming pool applications with high chlorine levels.
  • Not recommended for adhering mirrors or structural glazing without testing.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Avoid contact with materials containing cleaning agents, solvents, or alcohol during curing.
  • Not for use on bituminous, natural rubber, or EPDM rubber surfaces.

Safety precautions when using PU 25 FC Polyurethane Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas. Avoid inhaling fumes.
  • Handling: Wash hands thoroughly after handling. Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures.

column52:
How to apply PU-50FC Polyurethane Sealant:

  1. Prepare the surface: Clean and dry the substrate, mask joint edges if needed.

Frequently Asked Questions About PU-50FC Polyurethane Sealant

Q: Can PU-50FC be used in underwater applications?

A: Yes, once cured, PU-50FC is suitable for below waterline applications. However, avoid internal swimming pool applications and exposure to high chlorine levels.

Q: Is priming required before applying PU-50FC?

A: Priming is often not required due to its high bond strength. However, for porous substrates or critical applications, use Everflex Supaprime. For non-porous substrates, use Adheseal 50A.

Q: What is the cure time for PU-50FC?

A: PU-50FC cures at a rate of 4mm per 24 hours at 25°C and 50% humidity. Cure times may vary depending on atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.

Q: Can PU-50FC be painted?

A: Yes, PU-50FC is paintable with acrylic, oil, and rubber-based paints. Confirm adhesion and note that non-flexible paints may crack.

Q: How do I clean up PU-50FC?

A: While wet, clean tools and spills with Xylene. Cured product can be removed mechanically. Use Adheseal Hand Wipes for skin cleaning.

Q: What is the movement capability of PU-50FC?

A: PU-50FC has a movement capability of 25%, making it suitable for joints subject to movement and vibration.

Q: Is PU-50FC suitable for anti-pick applications?

A: Yes, its high Shore A hardness makes it suitable for anti-pick applications in public buildings, schools, and prisons.
column54:
PU-50FC Polyurethane Sealant limitations:

  • Not suitable for aquariums or internal swimming pool applications with high chlorine levels.
  • Not recommended for adhering mirrors or structural glazing.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Not suitable for bituminous, natural rubber, or EPDM rubber surfaces.
  • White colour may yellow slightly when exposed to UV.
  • Requires atmospheric humidity to cure, not suitable for totally confined spaces.

Safety precautions when using PU-50FC Polyurethane Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respirator.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use.
  • First Aid: For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water. If ingested, seek medical advice.
column55: PU-50FC is a high-strength polyurethane adhesive sealant with excellent mechanical and abrasion resistance, perfect for demanding construction and industrial applications.

  • Rubber and fibreglass (clean and prepare surfaces).

column3:
Use Everflex PU-240 for: Durable, flexible sealing and bonding in construction, marine, and industrial applications.

Everflex PU-240 is a high-modulus, high-strength polyurethane sealant designed for professional trade use. Its robust formulation provides a tough, durable, and pick-resistant seal with excellent mechanical and abrasion resistance. Ideal for structural bonding of various construction materials, this versatile sealant accommodates constant movement and vibration, ensuring a long-lasting, waterproof seal. Suitable for both internal and external applications, Everflex PU-240 offers exceptional adhesion to common building materials, including masonry, metals, and timber.

Key Features of Everflex PU-240

  • High Strength and Durability: Provides a robust, long-lasting seal for demanding applications, ensuring structural integrity.
  • Flexible Structural Bond: Accommodates movement and vibration, preventing cracks and failures in dynamic environments, such as pavement joints and vehicular manufacturing.
  • Excellent Adhesion: Bonds strongly to most common building materials, including powder-coated surfaces, ensuring a reliable seal in diverse applications.
  • Paintable and Sandable: Allows for seamless integration with surrounding finishes, providing aesthetic flexibility for various projects.
  • Weather and Chemical Resistance: Maintains performance in harsh conditions, including exposure to UV, water, and diluted chemicals, ideal for external and industrial use.
  • Fast Curing: Increases efficiency on job sites, allowing for quicker project completion and reduced downtime.

Technical Overview

Everflex PU-240 is a single-component, moisture-curing polyurethane sealant that provides a high Shore A hardness of 35, indicating its toughness and durability. This sealant offers excellent green strength and tear resistance, ensuring a reliable bond from the initial application. Its ability to cure at a rate of 4mm per 24 hours at 23°C and 65% RH allows for efficient project timelines.

Chemical Properties: Polyurethane-based sealant with excellent resistance to water, detergent solutions, diluted acids, and alkalis, making it suitable for a wide range of applications.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F), allowing for use in various climatic conditions. Avoid application in temperatures exceeding these limits to ensure proper curing and adhesion.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, Xylene (for cleaning).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Use a backing rod for deep joints. Apply sealant in a continuous bead for optimal adhesion.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Bubbling can occur if the substrate is damp or if air is trapped during application. Ensure proper surface preparation and apply sealant firmly.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid storing in extreme temperatures to prevent premature curing or degradation.

Certifications

  • Meets "green star" environmental criteria due to low VOC content.

column32: Everflex PU-240 Polyurethane Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Everflex PU-240: High-strength polyurethane sealant for durable, flexible bonds on various construction materials.
column52:
How to apply Everflex PU-240:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants. Use appropriate cleaners and primers as needed.
  2. Joint Preparation: Use a backing rod for deep joints and masking tape for neat lines.
  3. Application: Cut the nozzle at a 45° angle for sealant application or 90° for adhesive application. Apply a continuous bead of Everflex PU-240.
  4. Finishing: Tool off with a moistened spatula before skin formation. Remove masking tape while sealant is still wet.
  5. Cleanup: Clean tools and spills with Xylene while the sealant is wet. Cured sealant can be removed mechanically.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Everflex PU-240

Q: Can Everflex PU-240 be used in marine applications?

A: Yes, Everflex PU-240 is suitable for marine applications, including re-caulking teak floors and seam sealing. Its ability to cure underwater and resist chemical exposure makes it ideal for marine environments.

Q: What surfaces can Everflex PU-240 adhere to?

A: This sealant adheres to a wide range of surfaces, including masonry, metals (except lead and copper), timber, plastics, painted surfaces, rubber, fibreglass, porcelain, aluminium, and powder-coated surfaces.

Q: How long does Everflex PU-240 take to cure?

A: The sealant cures at a rate of approximately 4mm per 24 hours at 23°C and 65% RH. Cure times may vary depending on temperature and humidity.

Q: Can Everflex PU-240 be painted?

A: Yes, once cured, Everflex PU-240 can be painted with acrylic, oil, and rubber-based paints. Always test adhesion and ensure the paint is flexible to prevent cracking.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using Everflex PU-240?

A: Ensure proper ventilation, wear appropriate PPE (gloves, safety glasses), and avoid skin and eye contact. If contact occurs, wash thoroughly. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for detailed safety information.
column54:
Everflex PU-240 limitations:

  • Not suitable for totally confined spaces due to moisture-curing requirements.
  • Avoid use in aquariums or internal swimming pool applications with high chlorine levels.
  • Not recommended for adhering mirrors or structural glazing without testing.
  • May discolour copper and brass.
  • Avoid contact with materials containing cleaning agents, solvents, or alcohol during curing.
  • Not for use on bituminous, natural rubber, or EPDM rubber surfaces.
  • White colour may discolour slightly when exposed to UV rays.

Safety precautions when using Everflex PU-240:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves, safety glasses, and respiratory protection in poorly ventilated areas.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas. Avoid inhaling fumes.
  • Handling: Wash hands thoroughly after handling. Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures.

Why Use Everflex PU-240:

Use Hot Melt Glue Sticks 11mm x 300mm for: DIY projects, crafts, repairs, and bonding various materials like wood, paper, fabric, and more.

Adheseal's Hot Melt Glue Sticks are a versatile and essential tool for any home or workshop. These 11mm x 300mm glue sticks are compatible with most standard hot melt glue guns, providing a convenient and efficient way to bond a wide range of materials. They offer a strong and reliable hold on surfaces like wood, paper, fabric, cardboard, and more. With their fast drying time, projects can be completed quickly and easily. Whether you're a DIY enthusiast, a craft lover, or simply need a quick fix for repairs, Adheseal's Hot Melt Glue Sticks are the perfect solution.

Key Features of Hot Melt Glue Sticks 11mm x 300mm

  • General purpose for DIY projects, crafts, and repairs.
  • Strong adhesion to various materials.
  • Fast drying for efficient project completion.
  • Compatible with most standard hot melt glue guns.
  • Easy to use and apply.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Thermoplastic polymer (typically EVA or polyamide)
  • Diameter: 11mm
  • Length: 300mm
  • Working Temperature: Approximately 170-190°C (338-374°F)
  • Drying Time: Typically 30-60 seconds

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Hot melt glue gun
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry. Apply even pressure for optimal bonding. Use a heat-resistant surface for glue gun stand.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Stringing can be reduced by adjusting glue gun temperature. Weak bonds may be due to incompatible materials or insufficient drying time.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
  • Shelf Life Information: Typically several years if stored properly
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid excessive heat or moisture exposure.

How to apply Hot Melt Glue Sticks 11mm x 300mm:

  1. Prepare the surfaces: Ensure they are clean, dry, and free from dust or debris.
  2. Insert the glue stick: Load the glue stick into the hot melt glue gun.
  3. Heat the glue gun: Allow the glue gun to reach its working temperature.
  4. Apply the glue: Squeeze the trigger to dispense the melted glue onto one of the surfaces.
  5. Bond the materials: Press the two surfaces together firmly, applying even pressure.
  6. Hold until set: Maintain pressure for a few seconds until the glue starts to set.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Hot Melt Glue Sticks 11mm x 300mm

Q: What materials can be bonded with these glue sticks?

A: These glue sticks work well on a variety of materials, including wood, paper, fabric, cardboard, plastic, ceramics, and more. Always test on a small area first to ensure compatibility.

Q: How long does it take for the glue to dry?

A: The drying time is typically 30-60 seconds, but it can vary depending on the materials being bonded, the amount of glue used, and the ambient temperature.

Q: What is the working temperature of the glue gun?

A: The working temperature is approximately 170-190°C (338-374°F). Refer to your glue gun's instructions for specific temperature settings.

Q: How do I prevent stringing when using the glue gun?

A: Stringing can often be reduced by adjusting the temperature of the glue gun. Lowering the temperature slightly can help minimize stringing.

Q: Can I use these glue sticks for outdoor applications?

A: While hot melt glue provides a strong bond, it's not generally recommended for outdoor applications or areas exposed to high moisture or extreme temperatures.

  • Handling: Hot melt glue can cause burns. Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Use caution when handling the hot glue gun.

column3:
Use Unobond for: Structural bonding of diverse materials, including wood, metals, plastics, and masonry. Ideal for water-resistant and marine applications.

Unobond is a versatile, one-component polyurethane adhesive that delivers a strong, durable bond across various substrates. Its moisture-curing formula ensures a fast set and excellent water resistance, meeting D4 classification standards. This adhesive is perfect for demanding applications, including exterior woodwork and marine environments, where a reliable and long-lasting bond is essential. Unobond's slight expansion fills gaps and irregularities, enhancing its bonding capabilities.

Key Features of Unobond Polyurethane Adhesive

  • Superior bond strength across diverse materials.
  • Solvent-free and quick-setting formulation.
  • High water resistance (D4 classification).
  • Suitable for marine environments.
  • No mixing required for easy application.
  • Resistant to low temperatures.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Polyurethane Adhesive, Moisture curing
  • Specific Gravity: 1.03
  • Colour: Uncured: Translucent / Cured: Cream/brown
  • Skinning Time: 10 minutes at 23°C and 50% RH
  • Initial Set: 30 minutes
  • Full Strength: 24 hours
  • Pressing Time: 1 hour at 0.6 N/mm²
  • Use Temperature: +5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Temperature Resistance: -30°C to 100°C (-22°F to 212°F)
  • Tensile Strength (Beech): 5 N/mm²

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge gun, clamps, nails, or screws.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and slightly moist. Apply even pressure during curing. For flooring, follow manufacturer's specifications.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Reduced strength when used as a gap filler; apply pressure during curing. Ensure surfaces are clean to prevent poor adhesion.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in unopened containers between 15°C and 25°C (59°F and 77°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: Minimum 12 months.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from extreme temperatures and humidity.

Certifications

  • D4 water-resistant bond classification.

  5. Clean up: Remove excess adhesive before it cures.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Unobond Polyurethane Adhesive

Q: What materials can Unobond bond?

A: Unobond bonds to wood, plasterboard, particleboard, aluminium, iron, steel, sheet metal, polystyrene foam, insulation foam, concrete, FC sheeting, brick, masonry, veneer, melamine, and many plastics (testing recommended).

Q: Is Unobond suitable for outdoor use?

A: Yes, Unobond is suitable for exterior woodwork and marine environments due to its high water resistance (D4 classification).

Q: How long does Unobond take to cure?

A: Unobond has a skinning time of 10 minutes, an initial set of 30 minutes, and achieves full strength in 24 hours.

Q: Do I need to mix Unobond before application?

A: No, Unobond is a one-component adhesive that requires no mixing.

Q: How do I apply pressure during curing?

A: Apply pressure using clamps, nails, or screws for about 30 minutes to achieve maximum strength.

  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use. Consult the SDS for detailed safety information.
  • First Aid: For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water. If ingested, seek medical advice.

column2: HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant
column3:
Use HV Duct for: Sealing high-velocity air ducts, seams, and metal sheets in HVAC systems, dust extraction, and general construction.

HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant is a premium, single-component acrylic sealant designed for professional use in HVAC and construction applications. Its fire-rated properties, confirmed by AS1530.3 certification, make it ideal for environments where safety is paramount. The sealant provides a durable, flexible seal, accommodating minor movements and ensuring long-term performance. With excellent adhesion to a variety of substrates, including metal, aluminium, and polystyrene foam, HV Duct offers a versatile solution for sealing and bonding in various industrial and commercial settings. Its low VOC formulation aligns with "Green Star" environmental criteria, making it a responsible choice for modern construction projects.

Key Features of HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant

  • Fire-rated to AS1530.3, ensuring safety in critical applications.
  • Excellent adhesion to metal, aluminium, and polystyrene foam.
  • Paintable and flexible, maintaining a durable seal over time.
  • Low VOC, meeting "Green Star" environmental standards.
  • Inhibits mould and biological growth, ideal for humid environments.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Acrylic Polymer
  • Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Service Temperature Range: -5°C to 80°C (23°F to 176°F)
  • Movement Capability: ±5%
  • Cure Speed: 4-48 Hours
  • VOC Content: 22 g/L

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula, masking tape, cleaning cloths, solvent (e.g., 100% White Spirits).
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. Use a two-wipe process for impervious substrates. For optimal adhesion, test and use appropriate primers (50A for non-porous, 2001 for porous).
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid application in wet or damp conditions. For confined spaces, ensure adequate ventilation. Clean uncured sealant with water.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 32°C (41°F and 89.6°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 24 months from the date of manufacture.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product quality.

Certifications

  • AS/NZ 1530.3 - 1999 (Smoke Developed Index 3)

column33: HV Duct: Fire-rated, high-strength acrylic sealant for HVAC & ductwork. Paintable, flexible, & excellent adhesion. AS1530.3 certified.
column52:
How to apply HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant:

  1. Prepare the surface: Clean and ensure it is dry and free from contaminants.
  2. Apply primer: If required, use Adheseal Primer 50A for non-porous or 2001 for porous.
  3. Cut nozzle: Cut at a 45° angle to the desired thickness.
  4. Apply sealant: Hold the gun at a 45° angle, ensuring good contact with both sides of the joint.
  5. Tool the joint: Smooth with a moistened spatula before skin forms.
  6. Clean up: Remove excess sealant while wet.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant

Q: Can HV Duct be used in humid environments?

A: Yes, HV Duct is formulated to resist mould and mildew, making it suitable for hot and humid conditions. Ensure proper ventilation during curing for best results.

Q: What surfaces can HV Duct adhere to?

A: HV Duct adheres well to aluminium, metal, and polystyrene foam. For porous substrates, use Adheseal Primer 2001. For non-porous, use Adheseal primer 50A. Testing is always recommended.

Q: How do I clean up excess HV Duct sealant?

A: While still wet, HV Duct can be cleaned with water. Once cured, it must be removed mechanically. Use a blade or scraper for dried sealant.

Q: Is HV Duct suitable for outdoor applications?

A: Yes, HV Duct is suitable for both internal and external applications. However, protect external applications from rain for up to three days after application.

Q: What safety precautions should I take when using HV Duct?

A: Wear gloves and safety glasses. Ensure adequate ventilation. If poisoning occurs, contact a doctor or Poisons Information Centre. Refer to the SDS for detailed safety information.

Q: Can HV Duct be painted?

A: Yes, HV Duct is paintable. Allow the sealant to fully cure before painting for best results.

Q: What is the curing time for HV Duct?

A: HV Duct has a skin time of 15-20 minutes and a cure time of 2mm per day at 25°C and 50% humidity. Cure times vary with atmospheric conditions and substrate porosity.
column54:
HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant limitations:

  • Do not apply below 5°C or in wet conditions.
  • Not suitable for continuous water flow or aquariums.
  • Not recommended for structural glazing or composite panels without prior testing.
  • Not suitable for underwater applications or below-grade applications.
  • Requires atmospheric humidity to cure; avoid totally confined spaces.

Safety precautions when using HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and safety glasses.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Wash hands thoroughly after use. If poisoning occurs, seek medical assistance.
  • First Aid: Refer to the SDS for detailed first aid measures.

HV Duct High Velocity Duct Sealant can be used on the following substrates:
