column3:
Use Adheseal Builders Nails for: Strong, reliable bonding in various construction applications, from wall mouldings to flooring.

Adheseal Builders Nails is a high-strength, solvent-based synthetic rubber construction adhesive formulated to provide a durable and lasting bond across numerous building substrates. Its non-slump properties make it ideal for vertical applications, while its fast-drying nature speeds up project timelines. Whether you're working on interior or exterior projects, this adhesive delivers exceptional performance.

Key Features of Adheseal Builders Nails

  • Non-Slump Formula: Ideal for vertical applications, ensuring clean and efficient bonding.
  • Fast Drying: Reduces project downtime, allowing for quicker completion.
  • High Strength: Provides a robust and durable bond for long-lasting results.
  • Wide Substrate Compatibility: Bonds to masonry, timber, metal, and more, simplifying material selection.
  • Low Odour: Enhances working conditions, especially in enclosed spaces.

Why Choose Adheseal Builders Nails:

  • Versatile Application: Suitable for a broad range of building projects, reducing the need for multiple adhesives.
  • Durable and Reliable: Ensures long-term performance in various environmental conditions.
  • Easy to Use: Ready-to-use formula simplifies application.
  • Australian Conditions: Great for the varied Australian climate.

When to Choose Adheseal Builders Nails versus Alternatives:

  • Choose Adheseal Builders Nails over standard construction adhesives when: You require a high-strength, non-slump adhesive for vertical applications and diverse substrates.
  • Consider other options when: Working with materials like styrene foam or requiring permanent water immersion.
  • Cost-benefit comparison: Adheseal Builders Nails reduces labor costs due to its fast-drying and versatile nature.

Trade-Specific Applications for Adheseal Builders Nails:

For Builders and Carpenters:

  • Bonding wall mouldings, architraves, and skirting boards with precision.
  • Adhering scyon and particle board flooring for a stable and secure finish.
  • Excellent adhesion to wet and dry timber, simplifying construction processes.

For General Construction:

  • Securing display signs and other fixtures with a reliable bond.
  • Bonding to a range of materials including concrete, brick, and metal.
  • Suitable for both interior and exterior applications, providing versatility.

Technical Overview

Adheseal Builders Nails is a solvent-based synthetic rubber adhesive that offers a thixotropic consistency, ensuring easy application and strong bonding. Its fast-drying properties and wide substrate compatibility make it a reliable choice for various construction needs.

Type: Solvent-based Synthetic Rubber adhesive for strong and durable bonds.

Application Temperature Range: 5°C to 35°C, suitable for a range of Australian climates.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge gun, spatula, mineral turpentine for cleanup.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Ensure surfaces are clean and dry before application. For best results on non-porous surfaces, slightly roughen and clean with Adheseal 50A.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Avoid applying outside the recommended temperature range. For stubborn residue, use mineral turpentine while wet or mechanical removal when cured.

    • Storage and Shelf Life

    • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C.
    • Shelf Life Information: 12 months in original packaging.
    • Temperature Considerations: Avoid extreme temperatures to maintain product integrity.

    Certifications and Compliance

    • VOC compliant with California South Coast Air Quality Management Rule 1168 (300 g/L).
    • Adheseal B.A.T. Program (Bond Adhesion Testing) available for critical applications.

column32: Builders Nails Construction Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Builders Nails is a high-strength, solvent-based synthetic rubber construction adhesive ideal for various building applications.
column52:
Application Guide

  1. **One-way Method:** Apply a 4-6mm bead using a cartridge gun. Immediately join the substrates and clamp, nail, or screw for at least 24 hours. Refer to flooring manufacturer's specifications for flooring applications.
  2. **Two-way Method:** Apply adhesive as in the one-way method. Firmly press surfaces together to transfer adhesive and then pull apart. Allow to tack off for 3-5 minutes. Reposition and press firmly, tapping with a hammer and padded block for maximum contact. Full bond strength is achieved in 12-72 hours.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Adheseal Builders Nails

Q: Can I use Builders Nails on wet timber?

A: Yes, Builders Nails is formulated to bond to both wet and dry timber, providing a strong and reliable connection. Ensure surfaces are as clean as possible for optimal adhesion.

Q: What is the best way to clean up excess adhesive?

A: While the adhesive is still wet, use mineral turpentine to clean tools and spills. Once cured, mechanical removal (scraping) is necessary. Adheseal Hand Wipes are also useful for cleaning skin.

Q: Can Builders Nails be used for exterior applications in Australian climates?

A: Yes, Builders Nails has good weathering and water resistance, making it suitable for exterior applications. However, ensure the application temperature is within the recommended range (5°C to 35°C).

Q: Is priming required before using Builders Nails?

A: Generally, priming is not required due to the high bond strength. However, for critical high-performance applications, consider using Adheseal 50A on non-porous surfaces and Everflex Supaprime on porous surfaces.

Q: Can I paint over Builders Nails?

A: Yes, Builders Nails is paintable with acrylic, oil, and rubber-based paints. However, preliminary tests are recommended to ensure compatibility and desired finish.

Q: What are the limitations of using Builders Nails?

A: Do not use for permanent water immersion, on styrene foam, or as the sole bonding agent for structural applications. Avoid use in tightly clamped joints and on metals exposed to direct sunlight.
column54:
Builders Nails limitations:

  • Not suitable for permanent water immersion
  • Not for structural bonding
  • Not for styrene foam
  • Not for metals heated by direct sunlight
  • Not for tightly clamped joints
  • Not for adhering mirrors (test first)
  • Not for structural glazing
  • Not for composite panels (test first)
  • Not for all stone (stain test required)
  • Wear appropriate PPE, including gloves and eye protection.
  • Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Avoid skin and eye contact.
  • Keep away from flames or sparks.

  • Ceramics, tiles, and glass, offering versatile bonding solutions.

Use Adheseal Builders Nails for:

  • Bonding wall mouldings, architraves, and skirting boards for a professional finish.
  • Adhering scyon and particle board flooring, providing stability and durability.
  • Securing display signs and fixtures in both interior and exterior settings.
  • Bonding various construction materials like masonry, timber, and metal.

Why Use Adheseal Builders Nails for:

  • High-strength bonding ensures long-lasting and reliable connections.
  • Fast-drying formula speeds up project timelines and increases efficiency.
  • Versatile application across multiple substrates reduces the need for various adhesives.
  • Non-slump properties allow for easy application on vertical surfaces, minimising waste.

column3:
Use Multi-Tack for: Flooring, wall sheeting, mouldings, and general construction bonding. Strong, flexible, and water-based.

Adheseal Multi-Tack is a versatile, water-based acrylic adhesive formulated for a wide range of construction applications. Its strong, resilient bond accommodates movement, making it ideal for flooring and wall systems. This adhesive is perfect for bonding timber to studs and joists, eliminating floor squeaks, and installing wall sheeting and mouldings. Multi-Tack's non-sag formula ensures easy application, and its water-based composition allows for simple cleanup.

Key Features of Multi-Tack Water Based Adhesive

  • Highly resilient and shock-resistant bond.
  • Non-sag formula for overhead applications.
  • Paintable and permanently flexible.
  • Water clean-up for easy maintenance.
  • Adheres to most common construction surfaces.
  • Ideal for particle board flooring and cornice applications.
  • Adheres to damp surfaces.

Technical Overview

  • Chemical Properties: Acrylic, Moisture Loss Curing
  • Density (Specific Gravity): 1.45 Approx
  • Consistency: Paste
  • Solids Content: >80%
  • Application Temperature: 5°C to 35°C (41°F to 95°F)
  • Skin Time: 30 Minutes at 25°C and 50% RH
  • VOC (Californian Rule 1168): <49 g/L
  • Elongation at Break (7 Days): 434%
  • Tensile Strength (7 Days): 0.471 N/mm²
  • Shore A Hardness: 33

Trade Professional Information

  • Required Tools: Cartridge gun, trowel, sanding block, cleaning cloths, water.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Sand warped timber for flush surfaces. Apply a 6-10mm bead to joists or studs. For T&G flooring, apply adhesive to the groove. Clean excess adhesive before it cures.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Not suitable for water immersion; avoid use in continuously wet areas. Ensure surfaces are clean to prevent poor adhesion.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 5°C and 35°C (41°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 2 years.
  • Temperature Considerations: Protect from extreme temperatures and moisture.

Certifications

  • Complies with AS: 2753 (Fixing Plasterboard wallboards) and 2329 (Fixing wallboards other than plasterboard).

column32: Multi-Tack | Water Based Flooring & Construction Adhesive | Adheseal
column33: Multi-Tack: Water-based acrylic adhesive for flooring and construction. Strong, flexible bond for timber, particle board, and more.
column52:
How to apply Multi-Tack Water Based Adhesive:

  1. Prepare the surfaces: Ensure they are clean, dry, and free from dirt. Sand warped timber for flush surfaces.
  2. Apply the adhesive: Apply a 6-10mm bead to joists or studs. For T&G flooring, apply adhesive to the groove.
  3. Position the sheets: Lay the sheets into position with minimal movement over the wet adhesive.
  4. Fasten the panel: Follow the flooring manufacturer's fixing instructions.
  5. Clean up: Wipe off excess adhesive and clean tools with water before the adhesive cures.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Multi-Tack Water Based Adhesive

Q: What materials can Multi-Tack bond?

A: Multi-Tack bonds timber, particle board, plasterboard, metal, concrete, FC sheeting, and most common construction materials.

Q: Is Multi-Tack suitable for outdoor use?

A: Yes, Multi-Tack can be used for internal and external applications, but it is not suitable for water immersion.

Q: How do I clean up Multi-Tack?

A: Uncured material can be cleaned up with water.

Q: Can Multi-Tack be used on damp surfaces?

A: Yes, Multi-Tack will adhere to damp surfaces, but do not use where surfaces are saturated with water.

Q: What is the skin time for Multi-Tack?

A: The skin time is 30 minutes at 25°C and 50% relative humidity.
column54:
Multi-Tack Water Based Adhesive limitations:

  • Not suitable for water immersion.
  • Surfaces should not be saturated with water.

Safety precautions when using Multi-Tack Water Based Adhesive:

  • Personal Protective Equipment: Wear gloves and eye protection.
  • Ventilation: Ensure adequate ventilation during application.
  • Handling: Avoid skin and eye contact. Wash hands after use. Consult the SDS for detailed safety information.
  • First Aid: For skin contact, wash with soap and water. For eye contact, flush with water. If ingested, seek medical advice.

column3:
Use Gap Filla for: Sealing gaps in window and door frames, cornices, plasterboard, sidings, vents, tiles, and general construction joints.

Gap Filla is a high-quality acrylic gap sealant specifically formulated to provide a flexible and durable seal in various construction and renovation projects. Its unique formulation allows it to accommodate minor movements without cracking, making it ideal for joints where flexibility is required. Gap Filla's excellent adhesion to a wide array of substrates, combined with its paintable surface and easy water clean-up, makes it a preferred choice for both professional and DIY users.

Key Features of Gap Filla Acrylic Gap Sealant

  • Flexible: Accommodates minor movements without cracking, ensuring a long-lasting seal.
  • Paintable: Can be painted over, allowing for seamless integration with existing finishes.
  • Water Clean-Up: Easy to clean with water, simplifying the application process.
  • Good Adhesion: Adheres to a wide range of surfaces, including glass, ceramic, wood, brick, metal, and concrete.
  • Versatile Application: Suitable for both interior and exterior applications, providing a reliable seal in diverse environments.
  • Low VOC: Complies with Californian South Coast Air Quality Management Rule 1168, ensuring low volatile organic compound emissions.

Technical Overview

Gap Filla is formulated to provide a smooth, consistent paste that is easy to apply and tool. Its acrylic polymer base ensures flexibility and durability, while its water-based formulation allows for easy clean-up. Gap Filla is designed to cure through water evaporation, forming a flexible seal that can withstand minor movements.

Chemical Properties: Acrylic Polymer, water-based.

Application Temperature Range: +5°C to +35°C (41°F to 95°F). Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from contaminants before application.

Application Information

  • Required Tools: Caulking gun, spatula or putty knife, damp cloth for clean-up.
  • Trade-Specific Tips: Apply a smooth, even bead. Tool the sealant within 15-20 minutes for a professional finish. Use a damp cloth to remove excess sealant before it cures.
  • Common Issues and Solutions: Cracking can occur if the sealant is applied too thinly or if movement exceeds 5%. Ensure proper surface preparation for optimal adhesion.

Storage and Shelf Life

  • Storage Requirements: Store in a cool, dry place between 10°C and 35°C (50°F and 95°F).
  • Shelf Life Information: 24 months in original packaging.
  • Temperature Considerations: Avoid freezing and exposure to extreme heat.

Certifications

  • Complies with WorkSafe Australia standards (non-hazardous classification).
  • Low VOC: 22 gm/Lt (Californian South Coast Air Quality Management Rule 1168).
column7: Foam,acrylic,aluminium,anodised aluminium,architraves,block work,brick,caravan and truck-i,cartridge,caulking-i,ceramics,concrete-s,construction,durable,epoxy-s,external,fibre cement sheet,fibreglass,flexible,flooring-i,gap filler,general purpose,general sealing,glass,glass and aluminium-i,glazed surfaces,glazing-i,industrial,internal,joinery & cabinets-i,laminates,large format tiles,low voc,manufacturing,marine plywood,marine-i,masonry,mdf,melamine,metal,non-porous,one part,paintable,painted surfaces,particle board,plasterboard,polystyrene-s,polyurethane-s,porcelain,porous,powder coat,primerless,pvc,render,rubber,sealant,sheet metal-i,signage-i,solvent free,stainless steel-s,steel,stone,structural plywood,tile-s,tiling-i,timber joinery,timber sheeting-s,uv stable,water based,wood-i
column32: Gap Filla | Acrylic Gap Sealant | Adheseal
column33: Gap Filla: Flexible acrylic sealant for filling gaps in windows, doors, cornices, and more. Paintable and water clean-up. Adheres to most surfaces.
column52:
How to apply Gap Filla Acrylic Gap Sealant:

  1. Surface Preparation: Ensure surfaces are clean, dry, and free from dust, grease, and loose materials.
  2. Application: Cut the tip of the cartridge at a 45-degree angle. Apply a smooth, even bead of Gap Filla using a caulking gun.
  3. Tooling: Tool the sealant within 15-20 minutes using a spatula or putty knife for a smooth finish.
  4. Clean-Up: Remove excess sealant with a damp cloth before it cures.
  5. Curing: Allow the sealant to cure for 24-48 hours before painting.
column53:
Frequently Asked Questions About Gap Filla Acrylic Gap Sealant

Q: What surfaces can I use Gap Filla on?

A: Gap Filla has good adhesion to glass, ceramic, wood, brick, metal, concrete, and many other substrates.

Q: Can I paint over Gap Filla?

A: Yes, Gap Filla is paintable. Allow the sealant to cure for 24-48 hours before painting.

Q: How long does Gap Filla take to cure?

A: Gap Filla cures in 24-48 hours at 25°C (77°F).

Q: Is Gap Filla suitable for outdoor use?

A: Yes, Gap Filla is suitable for both interior and exterior applications.

Q: How do I clean up Gap Filla?

A: Clean up with water before the sealant cures.

Q: What is the dynamic movement capability of Gap Filla?

A: Gap Filla has a dynamic movement capability of 5% +/-.

Q: Can Gap Filla be used in areas with constant water immersion?

A: No, Gap Filla is not recommended for water immersion or chemical environments.
column54:
Gap Filla Acrylic Gap Sealant limitations:

  • Not recommended for water immersion or chemical environments.
  • Not suitable for food contact or high-temperature applications (stoves, fireplaces, etc.).
  • Dynamic movement capability is 5% +/-.

Safety precautions when using Gap Filla Acrylic Gap Sealant:

  • Eye Protection: Wear eye protection. Flush with water for 15 minutes if contact occurs.
  • Skin Contact: Skin irritation may occur in sensitive individuals. Wash hands after use.
  • Children: Keep out of reach of children.
  • Ventilation: Use in well-ventilated areas.
column55: Gap Filla is a versatile acrylic sealant designed for filling gaps and joints where traditional, rigid fillers may crack or fail. Its flexible formulation makes it ideal for applications around window and door frames, cornices, plasterboard, sidings, vents, and tiles. Gap Filla offers excellent adhesion to a wide range of surfaces, including glass, ceramic, wood, brick, metal, and concrete. Easy to apply and clean up with water, it provides a durable, paintable finish for both interior and exterior applications.
